reviews.review: One of my favorite spots in Amsterdam. Either you are just going to read a book or to workout Vondelpark is a beautiful place, that is so lively and shows a lot of the Dutch culture and its diversity. Great for seeing beautiful birds around and handsome Dutch men jogging haha!

Great place for a run. I love running in new cities, find it a great way to see some early morning sites and get my bearings.Vondelpark was a couple of km's from my hotel, so was an obvious choice for my run. Nice walk / run there over the canals and along the deserted streets, and then find this wonderful park to play in.Wide open roads if you want to run on tar. Plenty of grass if you want to run on the soft stuff. And sandy paths if you want something in between.Plenty of trees to provide shelter from the sun if it was hot.The scenery was beautiful. Rolling green lawns, large trees, ponds & fountains.Loads of other people walking / running / roller-blading / cycling / dog-walking.
Lovely Park. We ran through it and also visited during a bike tour and found it to be lovely :-) If we would have had more time I think we would have picnicked there

Huge bike with lot of cycles. Located few minutes walk from central station, big park, beautiful, good place for a picnic with family. Entry is free.lot of cycles so you have to be careful.. We saw couple of accidents...Overall worth a visit
Sit enjoy and relax. Are u up for running a couple of miles or are looking to sit down and relax for a bit then the vondelpark is the place u are missing in Amsterdam

grab a blanket and lie down all day. visit all the coffee shops you want, get some take aways and spend time walking around, lying down, watching the skies, the clouds, the people, the kids, the tourists, the cyclists..

A large park in Amsterdam city center. It is a green area in the heart of Amsterdam, and 3 minutes walking distance from home. It s convenient for a walk, fresh air, a ride, some pick nick with friends, or to change ideas. However, the grass lacks maintenance, like one has in Paris or London, while some areas can be looud due to gatherings for barbecue or for concerts. There are a lot of dogs and ... poop!

Very nice and large park in the heart of Amsterdam. Very large and well kept park, good for walking or jogging. We spent about 1h walking around and sitting in idleness after a long walking day in Amsterdam .

A good place to go for a cycle if afraid of the roads. When we rented bikes, naturally enough we were a bit weary on the roads since we weren't used to cycling so much and we were staying near the Vondelpark so we thought it would be a good idea to try cycling here and it was lovely! There's a restaurant and bar in the middle which was nice for some refreshments and it was a lovely, well kept park overall whether you want to go for a walk or a cycle.

A lovely place to stroll. We happened across this park a little by accident, after seeing the I AMSTERDAM sign we simply kept wandering and found this. combined with a lovely day it is a very nice place to lose yourself for an hour or two.
Lovely park to stroll around. . Lovely park, beautiful autumn colours and plenty of places to get away from the crowds, lots of herons flying around.

Beautiful. Simply beautiful. I spent a lot of time here whilst staying at the Hotel City Garden which is just outside the park. This is such a clean and well kept park. I would recommend a visit during your stay to Amsterdam!

waoooo. Ah this is such a nice park :-))) We ride the bikes all over the park and had such an amazing time. Some people were practicing squats, some were running around or practicing yoga, some were drinking coffe or playing football...you can do so many different things over here:-)

Beautiful park with great cafes. We visited this park many times, both on foot and by bike. There's a lovely cafe overlooking a lake and another at the edge of the park which is a bit trendier. A perfect place to while away the hours on a sunny day.

Great place for a Sunday walk. Located near the Museumplein, this park is the Sunday destination for many locals and tourists. Spring, Summer and Fall are wonderful and you'll be able to make a long, peaceful walk through this park. At almost any exit from the park, you'll find cafés, bars and restaurants or there is also a café directly inside.

Great Park. This is the first time we have been here after 4 previous visits and its a great place to chill out from the centre. We went to the t'Blauwe Theehuis, which is a bit of institution for locals. More of a summer spot though. You can get drinks and sandwiches there, its not expensive but more self service. Lovely walk through the park, seeing characters and even Herons on path lights. Worth a walk through.

Picnic in the park . It is so picturesque, went to a local supermarket and got food for a picnic and sat on the grass and ate our lunch it was lovely, however the pigeons are a nuisance when trying to eat. There is an information box where my friends and I asked where you could hire bikes, which was just out of the park and round the corner. It was reasonably cheap, with 2 hours with insurance costing €10. The park is beautiful and there is unique parts of it which can be explored on foot or on bike. There is also places to eat, such as wee coffee vans or a restaurant/ cafe at the entrance of the park.Plenty to see and do
Beautiful relaxing park. Lovely place to go and relax and soak up the chilled atmosphere! We went there for a hours just to lie down by the lake, with the sun shining.
Beautiful serenity in city centre. You have to go and walk here if it's not raining. Even if it is raining give it a go. Unusual to find such a serene park inside a city. Watch out for herons!!
Scenic. Bike through on a bike tour. Was amazingly beautiful. Rose garden. Ponds. Recommend for picnics. Very romantic for walks too

Nice park but beware of cyclists!. This is a lovely park to walk through and we enjoyed a beautiful autumn afternoon strolling through it looking for somewhere to eat. The park is really nice but there are a LOT of cyclists (as you would expect!). Obviously it's great seeing so many people out getting some exercise and ditching the cars but it did feel a bit intense avoiding all the bikes and trying to work out where the best part of the path to walk without getting in someone's way would be! Great place for a picnic.

The Central Park of Amsterdam. Named after the famous Dutch Poet Joost van den Vondel. This is the Park where you can find everything to your liking. NIce places to drink or eat; meadows to relax, walking area for your dog or just for a nice stroll with friends or family

Simply stunning .. Was lucky enough to visit and cycle around Vondelpark in a beautiful sunny day . Some wonderful photo spots in amongst tree lined ponds and plenty of stop offs to just sit , relax and watch the world go by . Decent cafe situated on the park and good seating area. Busy with dog walkers , cyclists and people just out enjoying the beautiful surroundings .
Cycle or have a run here. A beautiful, clean and quiet place. Highly recommend going for a run through it or better hiring a bike and cycling.

Beautiful. Gorgeous park, no motorised vehicles inside the park. Lovely wide paths for cycling, easy to hire bikes nearby. Several playgrounds, suitable for a variety of ages. One of the highlights of our trip!

Rent a bike & go for a cycle. The park itself is beautiful. The day we visited there was a marathon on. There was music blaring and loads of people there. We rented two bicycles and had a cycle around the park. It was a fun afternoon activity. I cannot remember the name of the place we rented the bikes but the two woman there were really helpful and friendly it's literally just around the corner.
Beautiful.. My husband and I bought some snacks and had a little picnic while people watching. The park is very pretty, you can buy tea and sit around and enjoy.
Perfect for a sunny afternoon. We cycled around the park in the sunchine. It was beautiful. Unfortunately we visite during the Amster marathon which meant it was busy and routes were limited.
Lots going including parrots in the trees. Beautiful park, lists to see and a very pleasant walk. The park is will kept work multiple features.
Beautiful. Lovely park to people watch, enjoy the culture and wander,The tree lined paths were outstanding.Lots to see and enjoy.
Great place for a run!. Nice oasis in the middle of the city - and much better than running on the hotel treadmill! Great people watching as well.

Peaceful!. Its a beautiful park.. Best to take a nice book, grab a beer at the cafe and chill out. Its a beautiful park in the middle of the city and its very peaceful! Highly recommended. Cafe also have free wifii.. be sure to ask
Bike tour. Great fun riding around and quite safe compared to Amsterdam streets of you are new to navigating the city by bike. Very green, clean and lots of picturesque spots.
My place in A'dam. Lovely place to chill out, meet friends, cycling and get some sun. always when i'm in Amsterdam a save some time to go there

Time Flowin' By!. Took my Honey Bee here for a picnic on a sunny day; the Vertigo cafe has changed its name and expanded into the whole ground floor below where the Film Museum used to be. We scored a couple of fresh mint teas and they gave us a free picnic ground cover. It was so fine, we chilled and ate our sandwiches among several artists sketching and painting the small lake in the park. Quite romantic! My Honey Bee gave me kisses for dessert; stop by and enjoy. I'll buy you a Munt Thee!

GREEN RELAXATION ?. We cycled through the park on a chilly & somewhat wet October day. There were few people there other than runners and a few tourists.Apparently on warm, sunny days the park becomes a mecca for locals who all sunbathe on the grass. I can imagine it becoming a crowded friendly space - but when we cycled through it we were left with an empty feeling and it certainly didn't measure up to our much bigger London parks.
nice walks. Even here you risk to be overrun by ciclisti if you are not careful. If you survive, it is a very pleasant park to walk around.
Sunday brunch. It's a lively, beautiful park in the heart of Amsterdam. Sunday was a great day to go people watching, have a brunch or just wandering around.

Beautiful. Vondelpark was a street away from our hotel where we were staying. Lucky enough to have lovely warm weather on our visit. Very well maintained park and popular! Always activities going on so keep your eyes peeled, worth a visit.
Beautiful park!. This park is beautiful! We decided to hire bikes to ride through the park for a couple of hours. Loved the tree lined paths!
Beautiful park. Really lovely park, lovely open space. The Amsterdam marathon went through it and it was so lovely to run through.

Great Park. We walked to this park from our hotel in the Jordaan and it was beautiful. Even though it was raining a bit, there were so many people running, walking, walking dogs and biking. It was a nice quiet place to enjoy a walk, to bike or enjoy a quiet picnic.

Gorgeous . Absolutely lovely Park near the centre of Amsterdam. Beautiful greenery and water features. Locals out for a jog and people sitting around with their friends. I was told to avoid it at night but the same would go for most dark, wooded areas. Watch out for bikes when you're walking!

Best on a sunny day. Very beautiful. Will go back on a sunny day. Close to, and a nice diversion from, the busy museum area. You can eat here at the restaurant and sit around relaxing or reading. Lots of wildlife, water and bridges.
Much needed park in heart of Amsterdam. Always an absolute pleasure to cycle through the Vondel park, day or night there is something to see. Theres always something going on.
peace. This park has everything. People watching nirvana. Kids space, benches, bikes, food, photo ops galore.

Good day with the nature. This park is very big and lovely place to be to spend a nice sunny day doing some outdoors activity.. picnic, biking or jogging.. as a tourist you re usually not into these things in a new countrey, specially if ur stay is short.. the park is itself very lovely with flowing water canals but to be honest it doesnt reflect the spirit of the netherlands or amsterdam.. so if u just moved there or staying for long please go.. choose a sunny day though and bring ur bike.
Beautiful park . Beautiful park in the middle of a city! If you want to hire bikes and cycle round it or go for a wander or sit and have a drink this is the perfect place to come!
Lovely place. We hired 4 bycikles and we made a tour around the park. We stopped at some play yards. We had some coffee and hot chocolate

Nature oasis in the city. Amsterdam is a place where you’ll clock up many kilometres a day walking, but spare a couple for a relaxing stroll through Vondelpark — an extremely popular spot among locals. You can do a lot in this 47-hectare green space, including smoking a joint, but don’t get caught with your pants down as nude sunbathing is forbidden here even though it’s allowed in many European parks. For a city with very few rules I found this funny, but fortunately it was autumn when I visited so I had no desire to bare all. It’s a pretty park and worth your attention and it is close to the Museum Quarter so you can pop in here on the way.

Don't miss. Amsterdam's most beautiful park.
Give yourself at least 2 hours to be there.
Consider renting bikes to travel around the park.
Enjoy :)

Nice Park. Great park in Amsterdam for a stroll. I rode bicycles through with my brothers while in Amsterdam and we noticed many families and people of all ages enjoying the outdoors. Well maintained Park, with plenty of walking trails. Looks reasonably handicap friendly and I noticed there were a decent amount of toilet facilities available.

A beautiful park. Vondelpark was recommended to us by everyone we met in Amsterdam. It's a beautiful expanse of greenery and relaxation.
We definitely recommend going there to see and experience it!
A nice park in the city!. Nice park for walks, relax, enjoy the environment and the people in it. Check out the statues and several beautiful trees and plants.

Lovely at all times of the year. Don't miss this peaceful, breath of fresh air when in Amsterdam!
In summer, join the good vibes by getting a disposable BBQ and enjoying the summer sun. At other times, wrap up and enjoy a walk through the park after enjoying a nice brunch somewhere.
Lovely park. A delightful place for a stroll or snack. It is a pleasure to see how many people were enjoying the lovel area. A nice cafe on a pond in the middle of the park.
Beautiful!!!. Cycled here with a picnic. Great to cycle round, then lie back and people watch. Highly recommend this escape when visiting Amsterdam.
Big city park. A lot to do for children, local people and tourist! The green Park has playgrounds for children and places to bbq with your friends. Some nice historical statues as well.

Beautiful park. Found our way into Vondelpark by accident but we were so glad we did! It's an absolutely gorgeous park and its massive. You really don't appreciate how big it is until your feet ache from walking around it! Lots of things to see but nothing to really 'do'. Often larger parks have activities for younger children spaced out to keep them entertained but there was none of that here - just what seemed like thousands of cyclists!
Great hangout. Whether you are living in Amsterdam or visiting, this park is the place to be on sunny days. Also good for pokemon go!
Good for a walk. Enjoyable place to walk round in the bustle of a large city. The main restaurant is expensive but there are smaller ones locateed in the park.

Good park, but just a park. A big and luxurious park, good for a walk and complete with a lovely tea house at the center. Not, however, much of a sightseeing spot. Come here if you wish to relax, but not if you wish to see something new and different.
Great Friends average park. We stayed at the Park Hotel which is 100m away it's an okay park but nothing to write home about from what I could see. Where were the floral displays?
Beautiful. Beatiful park in the center of the city , perfect to be in a sunny day with food drinks and friends , the cheapest way to expend your time in Amsterdam

Great for picnic. Rent a bike or just walk around this rather huge park. Great for picnic. The public urinal is disgusting so if you cannot stand the smell you better grab a bite at any restaurants in the park and use their toilet
Lovely for a stroll. Visited Vondel Park on our trip to Amsterdam, lovely park and was great to walk around. Plenty of places to eat and drink, bikes available.
A vast green in the heart of the city. The park itself is a very ordinary place except that it is a large green in the heart of the city. Thus good for a change.

Nice place to spend a sunny afternoon. If you just want to relax at a park in Amsterdam on a sunny afternoon, and watch the world go by, this place is it. Very well maintained and a large expanse of green.

Beautiful. Vondelpark is big and beautiful, containing many points of interest such as statues, fountains, bridges and lock bridges, cafes and lakes. Filled with wildlife, and a great breath of fresh air in the busy city.
beautiful views. best place in the city to have a picnic with the family of couples. beautiful calm place. very green and lots of beautiful flowers and fauna.

Beuatiful city park!. Very nice park to relax in or just make a walk through. In summer many activities are hosted in the park.
Frequently used for sports as well, running is very populair.

Big&nice. Very big space where you can do whatever you want. From riding a bike, sitting on grass enjoying a beer near lake, getting tanned or excercising, or eating muffins in the midnigt - the choice is yours.
Backpackers . My boyfriend and I loved riding our bikes this park and enjoying picnics while people watching. It's fairy big and there's tons to see!

Good running experience. Good running.
Quite and peaceful.
We dod joggign and loved it.
Amaterdam marathon passes here.
Really greay

Perfect for a bike ride!. Cycling in Amsterdam is something you've just got to do, but it's a very daunting prospect - they take no prisoners! This was an ideal place to take our rented bikes and stop for a well earned cuppa. Gorgeous green scenery, playgrounds, lakes...lovely!

Absolutely beautiful . Had such a wonderful time in Vondelpark in August, the weather was lovely which made it even better. The park is such a beautiful place with fountains, statues, flowers so much to see but yet so peaceful. We spent a number of hours in the park relaxing having a drink and enjoying the scenery. We rented bikes from a bike rental around the corner and it was such a lovely way to spend the day. Highly recommend this to everyone visiting Amsterdam
Beautiful Park. I loved riding my bike through this park. It's huge and a great place to get outdoors and people watch.

Nice and Green. This is very good park in the vicinity of Museums and happening area with some of the best houses around . YHAI StayOkay is next to it and you can relax, read, run and walk at yours pace for hours. Very near to Tram station and convenient place to have family activities

I live near the Vondelpark!. I live near the park. It's a nice and big park in the city centre,especially nice if you don't have a garden or nice balcony. It is really crowded on beautiful summer days till late but it is still fun. They also have nice concerts and plays in the summer weekend. You always see people going for runs,walking and cycling in the park. And you have many nice places to eat and drink in the park but also nice for picnics and you can even BBQ in a few areas of the park.

Fantastic park by the heart of Amsterdam. After you get tired of walking and looking for some green (outside of the coffeeshop :-) ) this park is huge and has so many nice corners to sit or lay down for some time. Very nice break.

A bit of everything . Nice park to ride your bike through, go for a walk or go running. Little lake, a nice restaurant and bar, places to BBQ. People playing around. The day we went he weather was great and everybody was outside so that had a lot to do with it. Very clean.
Nice park. Nice for bike rides, running, picnics especially when it is sunny. has a nice atmosphere, great for kids

THE park!. A bit crowded, actually a lot crowded, but the park for you to know in A'dam! I visited once and now live close by. It is the place you will meet tourists and locals (barbecuing!) and biking, jogging, having fun!
simply to enjoy . The park is beautifull. As everywhere in Amsterdam you can take a bike and have a tour around the park. It is worth to take a break here and have a picnic.
Great time and a lot to do. Great place to go with friends, there are some nice bars and restaurants there. Amazing if you hunt pokemons.
Vondelpark. Amsterdam's equivalent to NYC's Central Park. Wonderful, wide open spaces, bike paths, lush green lawns. Very enjoyable and very close to all the Museums.

Quiet and calm park in the middle of the fity. Rode bikes and walked around the park. Picasso outdoor sculpture. Various restaurants on the borders... Good for families, couples, singles, runners, cyclists, walkers, etc.
Dogs are allowed to be off leash all over the park. They were very well behaved. Did not see any W/Cs. Nice place to exercise, safe and lots going on...

A bike ride in the park. Me and my fiance hired bikes round the corner from the main park entrance and had a lovely time cycling round in a sunny September morning. We then stopped for coffee at one of vondelparks many cafes. Truly worth a visit to take some time away from the bustle of busy Amsterdam.
Beautiful Park. Had a cycle around the park. very scenic, clean and plenty of space for a picnic. Weather was great so park was full of locals socialising

Huge park with lots of kids. The park itself is pretty scenic although it can get quite crowded at times. Came here during King's Day and it was full of kids selling their stuff, which was a very lively scene compare to the normal days.
Enchanted park!. This was an enchanted park. at the end of the promenade, we found ourselves in another dimension. wow! amazing for the kids. wonderful, for your dogs. Must visit this place!

Take the time to visit the park. Vondelpark is a huge park with lots of special spots to have a picnic.
Plan your route to walk through the park from one location to the next location, its worth the time, especially in the late afternoon.
Alternatively you can have lunch at one of the various park coffee shops/restaurants.

ideal for a Sunday morning stroll. On ou way to Rijksmuseum we decided to take a walk in this park which is very close to the museums and enjoyed every minute from the atmosphere - some were jogging, young families with their babies... very pleasant if you are lucky to have a good weather as we had
Ate a lunchtime picnic here after a visit to The Van Gough museum. Very nice park. Quiet apart from the ducks. We had a relaxing sushi and a couple of beers here. Very enjoyable.

Peaceful walk. We walked through the park on a beautiful sunny day with sounds of street musicians playing. The park was beautifully laid out. The path meanders, around ponds peaking in and out of the sun and shade.
grab a bike and have a look. if you have some extra time and it's sunny grab a bike and enjoy the ride, it's a big park so make sure you don't need to walk
The largest and most beautiful park . This is the largest and most beautiful park at Amsterdam. Hire a bike for 9€ for 3 hours and enjoy a tour in the park .
Nice park. A good place to take a walk. Shady, lots of paths. Plenty of people enjoying the afternoon. Not scary.
Lovely park!. Lovely park, lovely time there, you should have a wonder there, do not stop at the beginning... are some nice spots around!!!
pretty!. it is a nice , fairly long walk in the park or u can rent a bike and ride it. it is a very busy park!
Beautiful place. Good place for a walk, cycling or picnic. They also have some coffee houses/restaurants. Nice difference after walking at the city centre.
Peace. It is peaceful, colorful just a simple beauty of nature. Especially if you are living in a crowded city you just miss this place a lot! Even just to walk or lay down it is worth to go..
Pleasent space for a picnic. Nothing special but good to get away from the hustle bustle. Definitely worth relaxing there on a hot day.

Lovely walk but watch out for bikes . This park is really lovely but like much of Amsterdam you have to lookout for bikes when crossing as there is a road and cycle paths all round
But it's really peaceful
Great spot for a picnic. My partner and I had a picnic in this beautiful park on a sunny afternoon. Worth a visit before/ after spending time at the neighbouring museums.
nice small chilled place. beautiful park near town where you can chill out after museumstour or go running or do some yoga. nice tree and lakesystem

Must see. Ahhh! Pack a picnic and enjoy this beautiful place. We loved it - such a relaxing lunch and so beautiful to ride through.
If you're in Amsterdam, you must see this place

Amazing vibe. Lovely park very close to the owl hotel where we were staying.Lots of activity, people running, skating, cycling, training etc. there was also a restaurant and cafe and some fountains. Very nice place to spend an early evening or morning, just to chill out, probably work out a sweat if you feel like , after stuffing yourself on a holiday.
Nice park. This is a nice park, good for a stroll or cycle. There's some pretty little lakes and fountains. We didn't notice much in the way of amenities in the park such as food stalls or toilets.
Nice big park. We went there to use the bikes because we wanted to ride the bikes after we rented them but wanted a safe place. It's massive and marvellous
Peaceful . Just a perfect way to start your weekend. A brief walk from the tram stop gets you to the fountain surrounded by benches and greenery.
Time out from the city. Beautiful, peaceful, quiet, well worth a walk from one end to the other. Have a picnic here. A great hour away from the hustle and bustle.
Beautiful summers day walk!. Gorgeous views, very green and just lovely! Highly recommend it for a bike ride or just a lovely stroll !

I'm sure that you will like here!. Vondelpark is too large to look around all of the park, but visiting here is meaningful for anyone who want to enjoy nature and own time during busy itinerary.
I also went on a picnic at here eating waffle and ice cream. It was unforgettable experience for me and my friend.😎

Beautiful Park. Took the tram about 2/3rds the way level with the park and then walked back to the Rijksmuseum via the park.
Beautiful park with lovely water features and plenty of people walking, relaxing and cycling.
Several coffee shops inside
Worth a visit
Running trail. I like to run in the park, atmosphere is great and the time pass by without notice you already did 7 km.

A morning stroll 05OCT. This is a beautiful park to have a stroll or sit and watch the world go by. There is a few "quirky" statues dotted around the park, plenty of small lakes with foundtains and waterfalls. There is a couple of cafe's, one of which is by a small stream and a kids playground.
Disappointing. Was disappointed to find this a "run of the mill" park. One or two decent views but generally frequented by groups of men and cyclists rushing about. Not a place to sit and relax
Leisurely Bike ride.. Great place to go for a bike ride. Plenty to see and also safer than cycling on the roads! Hired a bike for 1 hour just around the corner at A1 Bike hire (I think)
Nice Park!. Nice and busy Park, I loved seating on the bench watching the people and the dogs go by. We were lucky to visit it on a sunny day and we really enjoyed it.

LOVED this park!. We spent our last day taking a long stroll through here and people watching. The park is GORGEOUS and filled with huge trees, ponds full of ducks and loons, and big open spaces for lying in the grass or playing with dogs. I really loved spending time here. I will say, however, that it would have been nice if the people there were a bit more respectful of the space- we saw lots of beer caps strewn about on the monument to Vondel and cigarette butts everywhere. Despite that, though, it is so worth a stop here. Just absolutely beautiful.
Beautifully laid out park. Near the museum area it is a good place to walk through. Well laid out and aesthetically maintained .

Beautiful . I walked the park on my way to my Hostel and then we cycled through it twice. Its a beautiful park! Offers alot of sights and things to do. Saw alot of joggers and pet owners and the occasional sport enthusiasts. Fortunately the day was nice that i enjoyed my stroll through the park.

So Peaceful!. This huge park is an amazing green place to relax and enjoy the locals. There are lakes, long trails for bikes and walkers, dogs running around and many places to sit and have a lovely picnick. Loved it :)

Beautiful space away from the bustle of the city. This park is easily accessible by either tram, water bus or we walked from Dam square in about 30 mins. Great for picnics, it's a massive area, we didn't cover all of it as we wanted to do the nearby museums. Nice cafe , hidden away , and worth a visit. Seemed popular with the locals which I think is a good recommendat ion. Best of all though it's totally free!

Off Season Bliss. I visited the park on a warm sunny morning in September. The Vondelpark is not far from the museum complex and reminded me somewhat of Look Park in Florence, Massachusetts. There are lots of open spaces, green grass, water fowl, ponds and places to escape the bustle of the city center. There is even an open air theater.

the place to be in good weather. Always busy, great place to take children, well laid out. Free concerts of all kinds of music, theatre and (dance) lessons in the summer. A 'wild' area where you can have a guided tour - must be booked.Three cool cafes. Lots of places to sit - and gaze at water or people watch

Delightful Place. We didn't begin to explore all of the park, but what we saw and enjoyed was wonderful. There are walking and biking trails, places for families to picnic and play, and a wonderful restaurant for a coffee, beer, small meal or full dinner.

Big and spacious park, but not beautiful enough. Visited on a sunny evening. While the park is big, it is not exactly very clean and green. It was made a little more difficult with tons of cyclists weaving through the main road running through the park. Other than that, it's a nice place to visit and chill.
Beautiful!. Beautiful park used by lots and lots of locals, tourists, etc. Excellent place to get away from this very busy city

Beautiful park . We visited here on a warm sunny day. It was a lovely place to take a few hours out of our day to just sit and relax with each other. The park is enjoyed by locals and very much looked after.

Beware of the joggers. A very sweet park, looks really nice, especially in the sunset. However, as a tourist you have to be very careful, the joggers are nearly as fast as the bikes. Just take the narrow paths. And of course, as one might expect, there is a smell of weed in many places.

Near the Neighbor's Magnolia Hotel.. Beautiful to walk, bike, skate, jog. Or just relax with a book or people watch. Free admission.
Also nice cafe for brunch, lunch and dinner.

A nice lunch spot. It’s really just a big park in the city but we did enjoy a pleasant lunch on the terrace enjoying the sunshine and warmth. The staff were helpful, pointing out the English menu posted on the window. The lentil soup, ham and cheese broodje and bitterballen were delicious. I wouldn’t go out of my way to visit but, if you’re in the area, it makes for a nice rest/lunch spot.
Lovely park. Lovely for a post-lunch walk. The park is very well maintained and dotted with interesting focal points.
Great picnic spot. It is a busy place but perfect for a picnic with loads of open space. A very clean area with lovely views across the water.
Lovely. We were staying close by to the place so we thought we will take a peek before we head out to other touristy places. But we ended up relaxing more time.

Great Urban Park. Great park for any city to call their own. Nice for a stroll, many nice lakes and an overall great place to mingle with fellow travelers and many locals as you commune with nature.Try the apple pie at the Blue Tea House!Make sure to stay alert for bicycles!

Nice park. Nice park, perfect to go for a walk, enjoy the nature and relax. This is the place where the locals go to exercise or have a picnic with friends. Very calm and peaceful if you want just to sit and enjoy the view.

Lovely lovely park. If in Amsterdam, Vondelpark is a must go after visiting the Rijksmuseum. It is the perfect place to relax in on a sunny day. So, grab your beers at the nearest supermarket or whatever you need from the coffee shop and head over. There is an area where you can set up barbecue and have a good time with family and friends too!

Calm Oasis from Busy Amsterdam. Where do all the locals go to get away from us tourists & all the hustle and bustle we create? Yes you've guessed it, their own little place of peace & tranquility which is Vondelpark. With a combination of small lakes, open grass areas & shady trees, this not insignificant oasis of calm is worth the visit if only to re-balance your body-rhythms ready for another hectic dose of Amsterdam-the-City. This beautiful park is equipped with all necessary amenities to enhance your visit (ie. food & toilets) but best of all it comes quite often with its very own entertainment (created by locals going about their every day leisure activities eg. Frisbi flying, hoola-hooping exercises and impromptu music gatherings. Oh & most important of all this park is great for 'people-watching'!Kick off your shoes, take the weight off your feet & chillax for a few hours, it's worth it.
Vondelpark is vondelpark. A great park in the city must see my opinion to rent a bike and take a tour in the park it is big and nice you can have a small picnic
Beautiful park!. The park is located in the center so it is really easy to get there. Beautiful park to have a picnic and take a bike. Don't miss out!

What a wonderful place, peaceful and charming. A great place to spend a late summer (early Autumn) afternoon, very tranquil- even though there were lots of people milling around. fabulous 'contained' places throughout making it seem like a lot of smaller spaces - very enjoyable.

Gorgeous inner city green space. This is my personal favourite park in Amsterdam. There are plenty of wide spaces suitable for Frisbee or some other activity, but then interesting gardens, trees you can climb right over the water, and lots of cycle paths. On a beautiful day it will be busy, but even on the best summer day possible you will still have plenty of space to yourself.

Nice for fresh air but beware cyclists . Took the tram a bit further and walked home via the park. Great place for cycling around or walking through. Children and grown ups playing or sitting by the pools. Parakeets heard but not seen very bold moorhens. There are places for drinks but not tried.

Free Live Music & Great Chill Spots in the Summer. Whenever I go to Amsterdam I just have to go in this lovely parc. There's all kind of people, many places to sit and enjoy a break and even free events in summer with Heineken stands.
So lovely!. What a lovely place to walk around. With little places you can stop for a bite to eat or drink it's so pretty. Definitely a must see!
Pleasant park in central Amsterdam. Visited on a very busy sunny Saturday afternoon. Good fun to see the locals enjoying themselves (in many ways - you can use your own imagination!)
Nice to chill. Nice, big, chilled and very green park in heart of busy Amsterdam. Great place for a lonely walk, for a chilled picnic with friends, or just cycling around.
Park. Beautiful!! More than Beautiful!! Big!! Even in a cold day is necessary to go there and take a walk, ride bikes or even sit on the grass and feel the sun!

Good place to take a breather. Came here on a weekday afternoon in September 2016. Really relaxing to roam about or just sit under a tree and read a book. There were also some music performances by street musicians.

Relaxing on a sunday. This is a great place for a strol. Even ended up taking a nap on the grass while kids were playing. People all ages come here, playing music, roller blading, walking the dog. Great place for people watching.
busy walking trails. Really nice walk-about near the city. On the weekend, you'll see families, pets, tourists, and even fitness classes. The Melkhuis is a good stop for a coffee and wifi.
amazing views and trees. very nice, romantic, relaxing park, it contains lots of trees around a lakes and green grass everywhere, a lot of nice views to soak in. great for picnics spend 2-3 hours.

Lovely open space and a break from the busy city. We walked through part of the park after dinner. It was enjoyable and somewhat entertaining. We saw everything from exercise classes, barbecuing and a small light show. Felt safe.
Lovely Park. We caught the tram here from Centraal and had a lovely sit by the fountain. Great for familys, couples or friends!

Stopped for drinks . Visited this wonderful park and spent the afternoon at the bar towards the middle - Vondelpark3.
Very good drinks and fairly priced - unfortunately there was no table service. The queue for drinks could also get long.
Nice park. It was a sunny day in Amsterdam. Lovely place to walk. Great place to run. We went there after going to the closeby market

Beautiful Park! . My husband and I spent an afternoon in Vondelpark. It is a huge open park with ponds, playgrounds, flowers, open spaces, trails etc. Many locals use this park every day but it is very nice for tourists as well. It gave us a little peak into the lives of the locals. If you love dogs you will see lots here! If you like birds there are lots to watch here as well. Feed the ducks, take a walk, relax in the grass. There are a few cafes and restaurants located around the park that are nice to enjoy. Especially if you can sit outside.
Must visit. A beautiful park that is nicely kept and visited by many locals as well as tourists. We went on a Sunday morning when it was bustling.
Vondelpark walk. a beautiful big park, can visit it more than one time during your stay, best place to set in, is vendel café, for its nice view and nice service

Amazing. Nothing better than a green area in the middle of a big city. Rent a bike and cycle in Vondelpark, you will find some area to have a drink, or if the weather is good just lay down on the grass !
Lazy sunny day . Great for chilling and watching the world go by , usually whizzing by by by cycle , always look left and right and left again !
Summer concerts . The park is fantastic in the summer but check out the free concerts June to August or just have a nice stroll.

Amazing scenery. We visited Vondelpark whilst in Amsterdam on our honeymoon, what can I say but clean & tidy, very chilled and relaxed area. Many locals sleeping in the sun on the beautiful lawns whilst cyclists ride by. Definitely worth a visit if in the area

HUGE. An ideal place for doing shrooms. During our trip it was damn windy even then we walked throught the whole park. its beautiful and relaxing. Great place to see birds. Lots of them. Ducks as well. Have heard the guy who wrote 'The Ugly Duckling' (written by a Dutch author), wrote it in this park.

Lovely well kept park . Great on a sunny day, huge park with loads to explore, well maintained and tidy always busy on sunny days with a great atmosphere. Places to eat within the park and a lovely lake plus lots of ducks

Natural beauty . What a stunning and diverse park. In the centre of the city action, it offers calm and relaxation!! Brilliant cafes and loads of different elements to enjoy!!
Recommend visiting when in the dam
Beautiful!. Loved the park. We rented a bike and biked though out the park, it was so much fun. Later found a quite place and rested, it was very relaxing and calming.
Beautiful park. Lots to do and see but if you are on foot beware the cycles. Watch out for the wild parrots too! Some lovely cafes that are inexpensive too.

Perfect for a sunny day. We were fortunate to attend Vondelpark the day before the weather turned. The whole grounds were spectacular and well looked after.
I recommend going for a stroll through and just getting lost, or bring a blanket and some snacks and just relax.

City park. Nice park to take a stroll through or a bike ride. Lovely green spot with large old trees. There is a water fountain at the front gate and you don't have to worry about drinking from it, Holland has some of the best drinking water in the world

Rent a bike and explore the park. My family and I rented bikes for a couple of hours and rode all around the park.It's not huge, you can do a slow loop in about 15-20 minutes, but it is beautiful with a number of spots to just stop and soak in the sun (hopefully).There's also a coffee shop in the middle of the park and restaurants encircle it as well. Nice place to take a break from the city.
Very nice place to chill. If you want to escape the busy city centre it is a very quiet place to go to. It is huge so you will find a quiet spot for sure.

This park is big! & Beautiful !. Plenty of things to do t this park, many beautiful ponds, huge trees, very serene and peaceful.Away from the crowd of Amsterdam. lots of friendly ducks all over the park.Must do for everyone to enjoy a different part of this city.

beauitful. I to experience a range of things on a trip .-and I was so happy to have gone through this amazing park [ on bike] in the center of this amazing city.You experience this and it helps one understand why the guality of life -here- is one of the highest in the world.

BEAUTIFUL PLACE. The Vondelpark is amazing. Beautiful trees, birds singing, and a good vibe. For summer days are the best option for having a picnic by the lake. I took a ride on a bike to get to know it better, and it was so much fun. I reccomend to spend some time reading, talking, whatever at the park. Its a very good place to be with friends.

a place to chill out. Near to the Museumplein, it's a great spot to chill out for a while after sightseeing. This place is concerned as favourite park of locals and you won't wonder about that - it's really big, full of small lakes, fountains, trees, greenery, places to sit and enjoy your time in there.
Enjoyed there. It is just a place to be. Calm clean quite but very near to the city. Would recommend to have a quick lunch break after long city cruising
Picturesque and relaxing. A place where you can go enjoy a bit of nature with a picnic or a scenic run. Very versatile cool park

A Very Pretty Place. Beautiful little park ! A great place to pass through or enjoy a few minutes of contemplation. Magnificent landscape and trees and the surrounding area is rich in restaurants and pubs.
Naturally relaxing. Simply what the title says, Naturally relaxing! Enjoyable for walks, bike rides and best of all, making love!

Variety at Vondelpark!. Visiting Amsterdam, you must explore Vondelpark and as you meander around this vast expanse, experience the bird-life, the variety of plants and, most importantly, the locals as many whip around on cycles, some walking and others just watching the world go by. After a good breakfast at your hotel, should you be staying nearby, a walk around Vondelpark will set you up for the day!

A relaxing stroll. The park was beautiful, and we spent a good hour exploring the area. Would recommend heading towards food hallen after visiting the park, as the route passes by a gorgeous neighborhood with some interesting buildings and churches.
Beautiful and calm park. Nice park, beautiful and calm. You can walk there, ride a bike or just relax. There are some bars there if you feel hungry.

Take a picnic lunch and good walking shoes. This is a great and popular park for locals and visitors. Take a picnic lunch and blanket and go to the park and hang out and walk the many paths , enjoy the many ponds, ,soak in some rays, enjoy the landscaping and many indigenous plants. There are several restaurants in the park with mixed reviews online. Wear good walking shoes! This park is big!

Could have spent my whole time here. Amazing park. Full of hustle and bustle. Also had a lovely pond with lots of ducks and geese. If the weather is good then I strongly advise making the trip to Vondelpark

Amazing . We hired bikes from a small rental place near dam square and rode in to the park from the city centre, which was quite an experience in itself!! The park was absolutely beautiful, stunning lakes and water features for you to enjoy. Riding around the park was one of the highlights of our trip.

Beautiful park. Gorgeous park, well worth seeing. We were there on a sunny day in August and it was busy, but not too packed. Lots of nice lawns for sunbathing, lovely water features, and a few cafes for drinks etc. Lovely place.

Breathtaking beauty . Lovely place to walk with your beloved .
Never felt so Peaceful & blissful walking around . Pet friendly park.
Lots of fountains, ponds & bridges.
Nice but crowded. Went there on Wednesday afternoon. The park itself was nice, but it was a little over crowded by tourists and people.

Lovely city park. Very good use of space.. City park, which means a fair number of people, but the space is very well used. A BBQ area, several small eating places, a concert area (which is almost always used) and some very nice planting. I especially like the rose hexagons.As a resident of Amsterdam it is a nice place to escape to, but many of our visitors have also enjoyed it.There are also a very large number of good bars and eating places in the roads that fringe it, which can make for a nice combined day out.

An oasis in the middle of a bustling city. . We stumbled across this park by chance while wandering around the museum district. It's beautiful, with ponds, sculptures and flowerbeds all over the place. There are a lot of cyclists, so this is a great place to go if you have hired a bike and want to stay away from Amsterdam's busy roads for a while.there are cafes to get a drink in too.

A walk in the park. During a short and busy trip to Amsterdam we need to have a moment of peace and calm, Vondelpark seemed to fit the bill, near the Museum district and close to the canals and old buildings of the city. There are meandering paths and areas to sit and relax. Cafes and bars are dotted about along with nature points. Worth it when the hustle gets too much.

Great place to chill, relax and soak in the city vibe!. If you want to see what the people of Amsterdam like to do, this is the place to be. You will find people picnicking, skating, cycling, barbecuing, reading, sleeping and everything else! Especially a great place to relax between your walks around the city. Also, if you are in Amsterdam over the weekend, definitely get around here to see some local artists/groups and families having a great time!
Great, nice and comfortable. A must of Amsterdam's attraction.Enjoy it specially on sunny days.Nice running, relax, bbq time, or walking.
Beautiful and restful. Walked around the park, easy to do and very peaceful part to escape to in Amsterdam. Gets you away from the bikes, congestion and general busyness that is Amsterdam
Fabulous oasis in a beautiful city. Had great weather, which helped - this is a great place to spend some time and there is always plenty going on here.

Very Nice Park just outside central Amsterdam!. Very large park with rivers and green space as well as bars and restaurants!Busy with families, people having picnics and cyclists and people having a stroll. It's a place recommend for all and a relaxing afternoon.
Amazing park!!. I had seen this park when I was looking for places to go in Amsterdam. So glad we went, was an amazing park!

Lovely park on a sunny day. We ventured out to the park and enjoyed seeing all the people relaxing and having picnics. Lots of ducks and birds around however knew not to get too close. You may catch the small group of young people smoking something else, but otherwise family friendly. Few washroom, may have to pay and lots of bike and people taking their dogs for a walk.

If you have the time. The park is really beautiful, but not something that I would put as a must-see. It's not quite in the center, so we put it on our list the last day there. We had only 30 minutes so we didn't have the chance to see all of it, but a small part. It's great for picnics, but only if you can bare the sense of weed everywhere.
Great place to chill. Great place to chill, went for a stroll on a sunny afternoon, quite a few street entertainers about the park loved it.
Lazy Sunday afternoon. Spent the day here on Sunday and had breakfast in the first cafe you come to - delicious eggs and bacon, then walked it off round the lakes. Really beautiful park for relaxing

Beautiful, beautiful park. Wish I would have discovered this park sooner when in Amsterdam. It is a beautiful park, relaxin walk with so many places to sit, enjoy, relax. Great place to seek refuge from the bikes, scooters, cars, trams, and buses. A must when in Amsterdam.
Just love it!. Vondelpark is a great place for a picnic or to practice sports. It is also dog friendly and you will see a lot of dogs there. You can also ride bikes inside the park. Don't miss it!

Beautiful. This park was a long walk from central station but it was well worth it! The park is really big with great places to walk and explore, its very dog friendly aswel. Theres large ponds and a beautiful restaurant. If i go again i will definitely be using the tram to get there but i guarantee it is definitely worth visiting if your in the city :-)

Relaxing in Amsterdam . What a place to go and relax on a beautiful sunny day. The park was full of people just lying on the lush green grass and lazying around. Despite so many people playing, running, eating and doing many other activities, the park is amazingly clean and well maintained. A great escape from the hustle bustle of Amsterdam. A nice way to give some rest to your legs (not for car people). Go and enjoy this place if you are a nature lover.

Nice place to kick back on a fine day.. We stopped by Vondelpark after a long day of sightseeing. It was late afternoon on a warm weekday, and the park was filled with people hanging out. Some were cooking meals, and walking dogs; a few were smoking joints, but most were just enjoying the day. There was a constant stream of bicycles on the paths, as this seemed to be part of Amsterdamers' commuter route. There are streams and waterfowl to watch, along with all the people.

Lovely on a sunny day. We hired bikes and rode around Vondelpark on a warm September day and it was one of my favourite things we did on our trip to Amsterdam - the park itself was lovely with loads of different paths and areas which we spend hours exploring. Great for a cheap day out in Amsterdam, we spent £10 on the bike hire and a couple of euros on an ice cream and had a fab day :)
Nice, restful. This is a nice park to walk through and is a good respite from the hot, bustling, cobbled stoned streets of Amsterdam. As far as parks go, it's not spectacular - just pleasant.

Ok but too busy to be relaxing . Nice enough park, but not the place to go for a gentle, relaxing stroll. Very busy with cyclists and runners whizzing past - so good to sit back and watch the hustle and bustle (or join in!)

Lovely City Park. A beautiful park, and we understand the place where all Amsterdamers visit regularly, so a great opportunity to just feel part of a fabulous city. Joggers, mothers with prams, cyclists (too early in the day for picnickers), No time to see it all but advise making time. There are places to eat and a great idea ..... Plastic picnic rugs available free ...how good is that?? (Not convinced by several what appeared to be permanent toilet facilities we saw which consisted of a portaloo with a urinal adjacent. There may have been more conventional facilities elsewhere, so ready to stand corrected).
Big Park. Unexpected to visit such a large park in the middle of Amsterdam. Nothing fantastic, but very pleasant to walk round.

Rent a bike a cruise through this park!. What an amazing park. It's as beautiful and as large central park in New York. Didn't get to spend much time here, but did rent a bike and rode all the way around. What a great place to chill!

peaceful park. even thou it was a lil bit crowded when i went , we really dint expect to be there for long but the weather so good , we dint know time passing ! i suggest getting a bottle of wine and some snacks and sheet and just chilling there !

Prepare to enter Paradise. In spring, walking through the Vondelpark is like stepping into a dream: You meander past lakes and 19th century buildings while green parakeets fly overhead. Well-dressed Amsterdammers with immaculately-ironed blonde headed children, hippies, dignified men with canes, cyclists - All among the most wonderfully contrived beauty
Beautiful park. An immaculate Park and very pretty. Really relaxing to have a walk around but watch out for all the cyclists!!

Great park. It was 31c in Amsterdam and so we went to the park next to our hostel. When we arrived there was around 1000+ people with the same idea everyone having a great time with BBQ's and music dancing/ drinking. Was such a great atmosphere. We went back the next day and it was much quieter it was great to chill out here,
Quiet pleasant park. This is a very pleasant quiet but busy with people traffic park where lots of people walk and sit on the grass in the sun. Nice.
Huge and peaceful. Loved Vondelpark it was amazing walking around in the sunset. This park is really big and quite popular, sit by the waters and enjoy a nice lunch on a break.

I "vondel" why. Over crowded and boring . I went on a beautiful sunny Saturday and there was a lot of people there. That's all good. But the park itself is not really that appealing. Its barren, dusty un-nuanced and the layout is not cozy at all. And nowhere could you get a coffee.
Great park !. One of the best parks I've ever been. You can walk, listen to music, smoke, meet new people, try mushrooms or you can enjoy the view. Must see!
Fun little park with eateries along the way. Fun to walk or bike around. Lots of people lounging on the lawn. We didn't, but it might be fun to bring a blanket and some snacks and picnic out there.

Sheer volume of bicycle traffic is impressive. Nice enough park and offers good respite from a busy city environment. Incredible as to how many people ride through (which I think is a great thing) and I wish Australia had similar transport infrastructure.
Pretty and magical. This park is beautiful and when busy in the sunshine of the afternoon has a festival like atmosphere. Everyone must take a stroll through this park when visiting Amsterdam.

City Park - quiet at time of visit . We walked around the park early on a Saturday morning. It was lovely. Ponds and canals throughout. People walking, running, biking, a few exercise classes and lots of dig walks. Great houses in adjoining areas. People we had breakfast with said they went on Friday afternoon and that it was very busy - probably not a good time to go.
So colorful ;) . One of the best parks i've ever seen! Is big, clean and with a lot of people that are relaxing or just doing something and respecting the place! Maravilloso :)

Lovely Park. Growing up across the street from Central Park spoiled me with park qualities but I was not disappointed with Vondelpark. We took our kids to the Kinderkookkafe so they could make their own pizzas, which they loved.
Really nice walk.. Great place to get out and walk your hangover off. Sit down on the grass and just enjoy the world passing by.
Chilling, different city atmosphere. take half a day off for this amazing park. we just walked around its plains and gardens. you can bring a space cookie if you like it. TOTAL FUN!
Beautiful . This park is absolutely beautiful and of on Amsterdam it's worth the visit to! It's a massive park but great to get lost and have a wonder in!
Summer day . Summer days at vondelpark is a must, a break of the city, chill, relax, BBQ, with friends or just to walk around it's an amazing place

Peaceful and calm park. Very beautiful place with some places in which you can have a great breakfast.
It´s recommended going by bike rather than walking.

Beautiful park with many bikers. Vondelpark is a beautiful park in an area near the major art galleries. They have a children's play area, a pond, tennis courts, restaurants and roads packed with bike riders.

Beautiful park, great for bike riding. We hired the bikes to ride through the park, stopping where there were interesting sculptures, trees or flowers. Big park, lots of green trees, lakes, sculptures and flowers ... and very crowded on a Saturday afternoon. There were many poké stops and quite a few rare pokémons ;)

Beautiful inner-city park. Although we didn't wander that far in to this park we still thoroughly enjoyed the peace and quiet that it provided in the capital city. It's a huge park and it would be great to enjoy it all in our own time on another occasion. Very popular with cyclists and joggers alike. Very, very picturesque place; gorgeous on a sunny day.

Nice park. This is a nice park in the middle of the city. Wish I had more time to spend here but that's for next time. Some really beautiful buildings inside the park. Great place to chill with a nice picnic.
lovely lovely park. been to amsterdam 5 times and spent a lot of time in this park each time, lovely smoke spots and scenery!

Nice and big park. The park is close to the Rijksmuseum and it's very big. There are a few playgrounds, but they are not that great. It's nice walking or biking in the park, looking at the small lakes and all the people that are gathered there. Take an hour and relax from the museums and canals.

A lovely place to spend the afternoon and unwind. If you go to Amsterdam, then I recommend you hire yourself a bike from your hotel and take a ride around this pretty park. The paths are wide and cater for everyone on push bikes to walkers and prams. Nice flat surface so no exertion required. Plenty of park benches to take a rest and people watch. Also there is lots of grassy area to picnic and loads of beautiful trees to shade you when walking or riding. We rode around and the stopped for a glass of wine and some lunch at the bar/restaurant located at the entrance to the park at the VondelCS. You can sit outside at the restaurant under umbrella's and enjoy the scenery. The food and wine were lovely.

Very Relaxing Place. During my sightseeing tour in Amsterdam, I visited Vondelpark with my guide "Jan". It's so amazing and relaxing! Nature is great and greenery is really relaxing. You can spend some quality with friends there and just forget about life stress!

Beautiful Break. We spent an hour in the park strolling around. It was a welcome addition to soak in the local culture on our trip. As always bikes rule in this city so use the walking paths if you are on foot!

Always a pleasure. Every time I head to Amsterdam, I make Vondel park part of the experience. It is great for people watching, picnics, strolls, bike riding, etc. Located near the major museums, it is a good place to rest when your feet are tired.
Great place to relax. We visited here on our last day, it is very popular with people of all ages and a lovely place to sit and people watch

Chill time . We loved Vondelpark. We only had 3 days in Amsterdam and after rushing around the city for the first 2 days making sure we saw everything we were shattered. It was so lovely just to stroll into the park and sit on the grass and take in the beautiful foreign surroundings, being able to relax at the same time. It was one of the highlights of our little trip. Watching bikes and people go past you could sit there for hours.

Morning Walk. Second time here, walked through the morning of a long layover. This park is very clean and full of joggers, bicyclists, and workout groups. There are a couple ponds and cafes to enjoy coffee and get a quick bite. It's pretty large park with beautiful buildings along the edges. The north/northeast puts you out just a few blocks from the the Rijksmuseum.

Great way to experience Amsterdam like a local. We stayed at an airbnb on the south end of Vondelpark and rented bikes for our 3 day visit. Every day we would start and end our day by riding through the park en route to exploring the city. If you want to get away from the stunning architecture of the old city (despite how hard that may be) to enjoy some "green space", this is the place to go.
Beautiful park!. It was really nice to have a bike trip here and then a wine+snacks lunch. Beautiful park with a lot of water and bridges.

Tranquil green haven in the city centre. We found the park on recommendation; after a few minutes you would not know you were in the centre of Amsterdam. Had delicious burgers (if slightly pricey with the current exchange rate) in the sun at the Groot Melkhuis, and the kids were entertained for ages after in the playground. The park is pleasant and well kept, a lovely escape from the hustle and bustle especially on a sunny day.

Amsterdam visit. Park is crowded with people biking, walking, exercising, eating...just enjoying life. It is a great place to ride a bike and not worry about the traffic. Lots of little pathways that lead to small ponds, rose garden, cafes and theatre. A must do when visiting Amsterdam.

Sunny walk and Dutch vibe!. An amazing place to enjoy good take-away coffee with a waffle. People are playing some music, walking their dogs, cycling and just living the life away in front of your eyes. Feels like a sip of freshness in the middle of the city! Must visit for sure!
Beautiful!. Beautiful park surrounded by the Van Gogh museum & iconic iamsterdam letters. Lovely at night, great for kids.
nice park. green landscape with lot of places to relax. in a great area and people tanning cycling sitting and enjoying. the biggest park in holland
Tranquil setting. A great place to relax in the quiet on a summers afternoon! The lakes are gorgeous, dogs swimming after sticks whilst I was there and some parrots flying and squarking overhead.
If your up for Running?. This is a nice all around park to relax or run like I did. If you look around you will find many statues and nice ponds.
Good place to ride a rental bike!. We rode our bikes around Amsterdam and this park was a nice place to go to get away from the traffic and roadways.

Great Park to Walk in. We stayed at a hotel only a block away and walked the park every morning of our stay. The park is unusual in that it is long and narrow, but the border sides are concealed with vegetation. The paths were well maintained and wide with WCs at appropriate distances. Would love to have a similar park near our house in the states.

Love it here. Vondelpark is an Amsterdam highlight.Get a picnic and some beers, and go and chill in the park with your friends like 100s of others from all walks of life are doing.You can take BBQs down which I love.Someone will no doubt be playing music (if you forget to take your own) just lie back and enjoy being in such a beautiful place!My favourite place to eat in the city!

Peaceful place in the city centre. This is a nice place to relax and to escape from the busy city of Amsterdam. Just walk through this park (very clean place), there are also some spots of have a drink and just watch the people walking by.

Beautiful park with so many interesting people!. I went to the park to meet with friends, I did not end up finding them but I still had a great time meeting people and hanging out! Go there, it is well worth it!

Beautiful . A lovely park for everyone to enjoy... there are things for everyone here. And as with everything in the Netherlands... it is lovingly cared for, I spent all afternoon relaxing by the water with my other half, we both loved it.

Get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Huge green space in the heart of the city. Full of walkers, cyclists, joggers, dog walkers, children playing, people sitting, eating, relaxing! Fantastic place to go to unwind. Lots of space for everyone! We saw a dog agility contest and there is a free open air theatre where we sat and watched a Latin American/ salsa master class where the audience joined in and some professional dancers on stage giving a performance. Great cafe for snacks and an area for more substantial food. Loved it!
Biked it and loved it!. Lovely park to bike around and picnic. Lots of green and lakes and ducks, excellent to spend a summer day.

Stunning Park. A must see when visiting Amsterdam especially if the weather is good. Lots of open space to walk, jog or run and just the most amazing scenery. Felt very safe during the day and police do patrol on foot, bikes and cars, would be cautious at dark but just use common sense.

A SLICE OF TRANQUILLITY IN A BUZZING CITY. Lazy Sunday afternoon. Great spot to escape the city buzz, or to unwind after a busy weekend- even though not far off the main road.. Bikes and rollerblades allowed. Barbeques allowed. Take a picnic and sit on the grass or buy food in a café - you can even buy alcohol if you haven't already had enough!! Definitely recommend to end an otherwise busy weekend
Very nice Park to Chil ... !. So we was walking .... in the Park ... it was so nice ... just relax and chill n this park very very nice ....
Great getaway from noisy streets. A place where you could enjoy lake, nice walk and people watching. You could also see on the terras outside a cafe, where serves drinks and alcohol.

Interesting spot.. A pretty park to escape the chaos of the Amsterdam streets. Plenty to look at along your walk through the park. Couples sitting in the grass relaxing in the sun or shade. We enjoyed our walk here. Clean park.

Beautiful park. One if the most beautiful parks in amsterdam. Located next to a busy road, and on the edge of the citycenter, vondelpark is a place of relaxation and peace compared to the buzz of the city.
A lot of joggers, bikers and people on the grass near the water when the sun is shining.
It is good place for picnic and relaxing. It is in the middle of the city. Surprisingly clean and safe this nice green space where you can walk, run or bike.
A nice fairly safe place from bikes.. Large park to walk and not get hit by a bike. Great for a stroll of sit on a bench. Ice cream can be found plus a cafe.
Nice place for chilling. Excellent place in Amsterdam to chill , just lay on the grass and enjoy when is a beautiful day. People are also friendly and nice.
Not one of europe's best . It wasn't the best park I've ever been to but wasn't the worst. Mind out for cyclists flying around - they're a law to their own.

Beautiful park for walks, bike rides, people watching. We had a great time after visiting the museums. We came for a walk, and saw lots of dogs running around freely, children playing, and just families and couples having a great, relaxing time, very clean and pretty. It's free too!

Nice. It was peak summer when I went there. Crowded. The park as such was very nice to sit around and relax. After some time the place filled with weed smell which I found very irritating so had to leave the park soon.

Lovely and huge park ❤️. What a lovely park to go in a sunny day, chill on the grass and enjoy the views of the lakes!
You can have some drinks, snacks and food in there, there are cafes and little vans for it too.
We rent a tandem in town and it took us 12 min from there. Very good!
Lovely. Very beautiful park in the heart of Amsterdam. Lots of green parrots everywhere. Best way to relax and spend a lazy afternoon/evening.

Such a nice place!. Such a nice park! We cycled the whole park taking cool pictures, climbing trees... People having barbecue, listening to musics, sleeping...
We went for a picnic and then for a nap! It was amazing!

Lovely walk to forget the night before!. I have been to Amsterdam a few times and nothing beats curing my hangover/stone over with a stroll around this park. It's massive!
Excellent to just sit and watch the world go by.
Would be ideal to take a partner or children.

Nice way to walk into the city. A great alternative way of getting to the city if your staying in that part. It is a very nice walk with cafes and restaurants to take a rest and people watch. Like Rome, Amsterdam isn't that big so lots of it can be covered by walking. I would definitely add this to your list of things to do
Beautiful park for a bike ride. Beautiful park in Amsterdam! Go rent a bike and bike through it, you will not regret it! There are bike rentals nearby just talk to the information kiosk in the park.
Nature in the city. An amazing concept of a park in the bustling city. One can see families, youngsters, kids...almost everyone enjoying the nature in Amsterdam here.
Relaxing. The moment you walk into this park, you feel the relaxing and sincere quietness you look for in a vacation.
Beautiful Park. Really nice park. With nice playgrounds and really beautiful lawns to relax and have a nap. Good for kids or for a run

Awesome park. The place to chill in Amsterdam while also buzzing with life and activity. Amazing picnic place and perfect for a nice long stroll. Had an amazing time here and the cheese platter we bought from the local market made it even better!

Amsterdam's most peacful place. Other reasons to love this city, Really just go for some peacful time
We we t there and even had some snacks, we rented some bikes, it's amazing especially because we went in september wirh great wheather
Its just a perfect park

Lovely vibrant meeting place. The park is pretty, but not spectacular in terms of plants etc.
What really makes it is the relaxed atmosphere and everyone picnicking, BBQing, socialising and enjoying the outdoors.
This was a highlight of our trip to Amsterdam.
They also hold free outdoor concerts throughout August and September which we really enjoyed.

beautiful place!. This place is really nice, there's a fishing pier, local souvenir shops and a relaxed atmosphere. Town itself comprises picturesque houses and nice atmosphere as ferrite and quiet. You should take out a boat and sail to marken

Great spot to wander and enjoy. We stayed near the park so it was like a back yard for us. It was lovely to walk around and enjoy the people watching as well as the lovely park. There are ponds, statues and a cafe to enjoy. We had a lovely sunny day so it was picture perfect. Well worth even a short visit if you are visiting Amsterdam.

Great for a BBQ or Run. Voldelpark was our first stop after dropping our bags at the hotel. We started a leisurely walk through the park before it's serenity grabbed us for hours. We ended up walking the entire park up and back and then around the edges before we decided to eat - which we came back to the park to do. There are plenty of running and bike lanes - and both groups are respective of the boundaries/paths for each. If we lived in Amsterdam this is a place we would definitely spend a lot of time.

A fun park to visit on a summer day. We came by this park twice to enjoy the scenery, visit the playgrounds and to have a snack at one of the waterside cafes. Pretty views with some wildlife near the waters. Decent side kids playground and splash areas too was useful on a hot summers day. We were able to walk thru most of the park in a decent amount of time. Not quite as overwhelming as Central Park in NYC. On a monday night we even witnessed a huge gathering of people BBQ'ing and doing other activities that generated a ton of smoke, it was a bit surreal.

Relaxing sunny afternoon. We happened to be there on a nice summer day and after a long day of walking and site seeing we strolled through the park and relaxed on a bench amongst other people all doing their own stuff

Beautiful Park. Vondelpark is really beautiful, very green, and something to not miss on a visit to Amsterdam. We rode bikes to it and through it. There are beautiful fountains, gardens, sculptures, and many trees and lovely features. It started to rain while we were there, so we ducked into a nearby cafe in the park for drinks & shelter. Be careful riding bikes, especially when crossing over intersecting paths. If you stay alert, stay to the right & warn peds & other bikers when necessary, you'll be fine. We loved riding bikes through the park, and its so much easier to cover a lot of ground and see it all!

Green island in the center of the city. It is popular park in Amsterdam, green, clean. But it was very crowded on weekend: lots of cyclist, rollers, tourists and pedestrians. But it is quite quiet place otherwise. Locals say they're often go for barbeque there.

Vonderfall Park!. Beautiful park on the outer edge of the last canal ring, where everyone escapes to. Go here to relax, ride a bike, have lunch, play games, or to watch all the people from around the world. It is very close to the Museumplein (Van Gogh, Rijks, etc.).
Amsterdam's Relaxation Point. It was nice taking a walk through this green-lawn paradise on a warm and sunny afternoon. Off the rat-race, with a funky retro tea house cafe building to boot.
Runners friendly park. Had a nice slow run around the park, It was almost 3 km. Nice views of water, flowers and trees along the way - wish it was a bit bigger
Best scenery ever. It was a very nice day in this park. We rent a bike it was very important to rent one and to do it all on bike.
Excellent stroll. We went here as a family, beautiful park and lot's of people everywhere. So much fun!! We will definitely come back here

Nice large park. If you are courageous enough to ride a bike here in Amsterdam, the park is a good place to ride a bike or just walk through the park. Bring a picnic and enjoy. Lots of places to spread out a blanket. Benches in some areas. Lots of shade. There are a few restaurants in the park as well.
THE park of Amsterdam. So alive, so many different people from all over the world. relaxing picknick or 'rave parties' it's all happening in the Vondelpark.

Loved this beautiful park! . A nice, refreshing green space in the middle of the city. We spent an afternoon here walking around and drinking wine at the cafe in the middle of the park. It's beautiful and not to be missed when in Amsterdam!
Get on a bike and ride. What a great experience, unusually hot day. Blue skies and green grass. Locals, tourists all out enjoying this wonderful park in central Amsterdam

Nice and relaxing, great for a walk in nature. We had spent a couple of days in Amsterdam and decided to walk through the park. It was beautiful with lots of greenery and smell of trees and flowers.
There were a lot of people there but it was just nice to be away from the town and be with nature.
wonderful experince. one of the best park i've ever seen in my entire life. necessary step if you come in amsterdam. wonderful
Only nature. Beautiful nature, lake and people. I feel like a heaven in. İf I been still there, absolutly spend time every moment.
Lovely walk in the park. Right near the museums thus is a lovely park where one can walk, sit or bike. Beautiful oasis in the city.

nature made park. apparently, all(?) trees are from nature,, i mean, not brought from somewhere els.
long huge park in the city! excellent for cycling if you are scared of cycle on the street...
hidden pockemon caractor is living there,,,(apparently..)

very relaxing. try to fit visiting this park anytime in your schedule.
give it proper 3 hours at least. it's fantastic peace of mind place.
go with a bike and go around it for an hour. then pick a spot to relax for more lovely time. Enjoy

A hot mid week day and it was very busy. A delightful way to while away a few hours in a green space.
Many locals were enjoying lying on the grass fields, or riding their push bikes along the many paths.

Best park in dam by a little. This is a lovely place to come relax whilst in dam. Grab some snacks from an Albert hein supermarket and spread out on the grass round the lovely lakes and watch the world go by. In the summer and evenings especially, literally thousands will flock to set up small bbqs and music and relax away. This is great to see esp as all the locals clean well up after themselves so the council allows this to continue year on year. There is plenty of music in the live open theatre which you can get a ticket for but just sitting near on the grass will get you the background music for a great day. My fave park is Oosterpark just cause of how pretty it is but Vondlepark is awesome.

Relax with a beer.. After a long day cycling in the Dam, there was nothing better to park the bikes, sit by the water and drink beer. It can be busy but plenty of space to allow peace and quiet. Highly recommend a visit.

Fond'le Park. To be away from the city, in the city itself. Lots of loiterers, when the weather is grand. Fondling is one of the main pass-times of passer-by's... The grand terrasse of the former Film Museum is a view in itself.

One of the coolest parks in the world!. My wife and I loved it! Everyone was so chill and friendly. We rode our bikes in, brought some snacks and sat by the pond. Vondelpark is a must go in amsterdam.
Busy, interesting park. We enjoyed both walking and biking through the park. Stopped for drinks on one occasion. Great place for people watching. Very busy at times.
Lovely spot in the middle of town. Such a beautiful park with well-kept lawns. Lots of little food stalls in the mark as well. It was really nice to sit in the shade and get out of the summer sun

Wished we had planned to spend more time here. The park is close to the museum area and we were sorry that we didn't spend more than a few minutes walking through the park. Nice respite from the hustle and bustle of traffic and bikes right outside park. Looked like locals and tourists alike were there.

Nice place to chill. The Vondelpark is the largest park of Amsterdam. It is where the locals go to chill out with friends on a warm day or to just walk around a bit. There are several nice places to have a drin or eat. The park is generally well maintained and kept clean. It is normally a quite safe place, also at night.

A beautiful sunny day spot in Amsterdam.. If you have a little extra time to enjoy the Vodelpark it is definitely worth a visit. We stopped there for about an hour in between visiting the Anne Frank House and the Van Gogh Museum, and it was a highlight of our day. Granted, it was a beautiful sunny day, so that helped a lot! The park seemed to be populated mostly by local types enjoying picnic lunches or catching a few rays. It was a beautiful way to observe some of the local life in Amsterdam and a pleasant break from some of the more tourist-oriented destinations.

A good spot for a stroll. Pedestrians, beware! Walking through the park not only means enjoying the green spaces but also watching out very carefully not to wander into a bike lane.
