Of course, that is true for the whole of Amsterdam. Vondelpark is a large area located within a very busy city and a tranquil spot to sit and watch the world go by. Popular with people of all ages. Located near to the museum area, restaurants, shopping and tram service.
Like Central Park in Manhattan but with more weed. One of the best city parks I've been too. Supremely chill and full of happy people enjoying exercise, a sports, a book, the sun, or a joint.
Lovely city part to relax in. You can cycle of walk around the Vondel Park. It's a nice quiet space in the city. There are restaurants if you want a snack.
Street musicians & bike hire. Lots of things to do going on in the park, from street musicians to bike hire. Would definitely recommend this during the summer months.

Stroll in the park!. Rent bikes and bike through vondel park. Stop and watch the amazing variety of people, young, old, artsy, crazy, classy, mothers with children. A good mix for today's world. And safe and wonderful.
And now for something different. A lovely change from the crowds downtown and a good place for a leisurely bike ride or just relax by the ponds
Weekend Break. Fantastic park a short walk from the city centre. At the weekends it is really popular and has live entertainment in the band stand area. Perfect for taking a picnic and relaxing.
Decompress. A perfect place to relax after a long day of travelling. Just sit at the cafe or along the water and watch all the bikers cruise by.

A great place to be in the heart of Amsterdam. Was bit tired in the busy city of Amsterdam. So me and my grandma decided to go there. it was beautiful day. we took walk. and have coffee at a very nice cafeteria Vondel Park CS . across the lake. very friendly staff.If you are in Amsterdam, Vondel Park is a must see place.
Nice park. I had the luck of having my hostel next to this park and I really enjoyed strolling every morning and every night in it.

Beautiful park in a beautiful city . Me and my boyfriend took a walk to vondel park (about 30 minutes from the centre) and were blown away by how peaceful and beautiful the area is. The park is kept clean and the gardens are well maintained and beautiful. Lots of people relaxing or taking part in social recreation. A wonderful place to relax and reflect... and a romantic setting for couples too!
Amazing park. Loved this park. Had late afternoon picnic. Lots of people of all ages, constant buzz of chat. Well worth a visit and if weather permits would definitely recommend taking a picnic.

Rent a bike !. This is a great place to get your feet wet on a bike in Amsterdam without the pros to throw you off ! I rented a bike for 2 hours and realized quite soon into the rental that I could have spent many more hours on a bike !I bought some food at local supermarket and ate in the park. Very relaxing, especially after a morning at the Riksmuseum.

An oasis in the city. Wow, what a treat it was to spend an afternoon wandering through Vondelpark. We were there on a sunny cool day, and it couldn't have been more perfect. We started out on foot, but then got directions to a bike rental shop which made traversing this enormous park much faster, and really fun. Paths for bikers and walkers wind their way through different sections where you can appreciate grassy knolls, hidden gardens, tranquil ponds, and even some great cafes. Many good cafes and restaurants in the surrounding area as well. It's accessible by tram, or an easy walk from the museum quarter.

How could you not love this place!. Unbelievably beautiful park as picturesque as ever with lots of hidden little place. You can enjoy a cycle, walk, picnic, whatever! Suitable for everyone and a must see if you're visiting Amsterdam!

Happy, lovely, fun place . Rent a bicycle and head over to Vondel Park and enjoy a few hours of outdoor fun, like the Dutch. This park is full of people riding bikes, walking dogs, strolling, having picnics and occasionally enjoying free concerts. I love this park and visit whenever I come to Amsterdam.

Wonderful open space. A fantastic area with lots of hidden spots eg a woods that you could build shelters in, a number of play areas, beautiful ponds etc great for keeping a five year old entertained for a coupe, of hours. Would be lovely in summer for a picnic.
THE "COUNTRY" in the CITY.. What a wonderful open space full of atmosphere and life! Lovely Cafes, walks, rides and trees. So quiet you can hear yourself think.
a pleasant but busy 'open space'. A calm open space where you can walk, run or ride your bike. Very good cafe and lots of small food/drink outlets around.

A gem in the crown of a beautiful city.. The park is large enough to take an extensive stroll or bicycle ride and connects with two very affluent areas. So there are large houses along the park to admire. Not terribly safe or family oriented at night.

Great for a stroll or a picnic. Vondelpark is beautiful! We loved it so much that we went there twice, the first time was just to walk around and the second time we went out of our way to have a picnic there. It’s a nice break from the hustle that is Amsterdam.The nature is mesmerizing, the green grass is endless, there are ducklings, beautiful water fountains, neat bridges and enchanting ponds with plenty of benches overlooking it all.Basically the park is awesome! Don’t miss it!

My favorite park in Amsterdam. I would like to strongly advice you to visit this park. It is a wonderful place for people that admire nature, There is sometimes live music (mostly on Saturday). Few cafes are in many corners of the park make it more enjoyable. The park can be reached easily from the central station of Amsterdam since it is close to the Leidseplein and Holland casino.

A must seen park in Amsterdam!!. It is a wonderful place to have relaxing staying and enjoy walking inside. We cycle from the city center during the mid day with food and drinks and stayed till evening. We enjoy the park during the sunny time, green area, the fountain and we cycle inside the park. it is of peace full and lots of activities and animals.
Amazing !! . A wonderful part of Amsterdam where you can have a wonderful ride by bike or by walk ! An amazing moment and really surprising in the middle of this wonderful city.

Beautiful park for jogging or bike riding. Beautiful park, filled with joggers, bike riders, and strollers. Nice way to spend a little time decompressing from the hectic pace of the city. Worthwhile taking a stroll in the park between seeing the sights of the city
Beautiful spot. Amsterdam is very relaxed but the bikes and trams are always cruising the scene in the center, so if you really want to chill, this it the place for you
Great Place for Summer. The place is huge, but it is very nice and beautiful. Best place to spend your summer with your friends and family.

Beautiful, relaxing, dreamy. Just lie down in the park and bask in the sunlight. This place is what amsterdams all about. It is so beautiful and lively and yet so peaceful. Listen to guys playing the guitar or the dog taking a jump into the lake to catch the ball or the group playing frisby. You can never be lonely in this park. This park has restaurats too where one can enjoy a meal or drink but the waiting line was too long so we skipped it.

Great On A Sunny Day with a Beer & A Smoke. I spent 2 weeks out in Amsterdam in Aug-Sept 2016. Vodelpark is great to walk round or just to sit by the lake with a beer or a smoke and watch the world go by.

A lovely park to sit in and walk through - but watch out for bikes!. Close to the Rijksmuseum, this long park is a beautiful way to spend some down-time if you want to relax in what is otherwise a vibrant and busy city. Quite a few water features and lots of places to sit on the grass, It's a through-route for cyclists though, so take care when crossing the cycle track that rings it. They move at some speed.

Pretty and relaxing . We spent a couple hours wandering around the park. It was very pretty and we enjoyed it. There was live music going on at an outdoor concert area, and lots of people there even mid-afternoon. Long winding bike paths to explore too.
Great place for a cycle and picnic. Great place to hire a bike and cycle whilst you explore the park and lakes. Chill in the cafes and enjoy the easy routes for cycling.

Good park, just incredibly busy!. I would like to start by saying that we went to this park on a beautiful sunny Saturday morning so we were already expecting it to be busy! However, I felt that much of the park was so crowded it spoilt the experience. The park itself is beautiful, relatively well maintained and clean so is a good spot to go and unwind if touristy areas of Amsterdam become too much for you, it is very close to several tram stops and easily accessible for all.

very nice park. i recently stayed near this park. it been always so refreshing to walk especially after dinner. i recommend anyone to stay near around to get chance to walk inside the park plus all the main museums located nearby.

Hire a bike and play at being a Dutch cyclist. We hired bikes and had a pleasant couple of hours cycling around the Vondelpark, without the chaos of cycling in central Amsterdam. Plenty of places to stop for coffee and packs or waffles.

Best place to escape the city heat. Join in millions who do the same. Find a spot, and relaxClean up your stuff when you leave. A good place to grill some meat on a small BBQ, read a book or sit with friends and have a beer.

Beautiful and peaceful. The park is very beautiful, especially sitting in the shade by the water - a great place to relax, if you can find a clean spot:The ground, I'm afraid, is not very clean - cigarette butts everywhere. We would have been glad to have some kind of blanket to sit on - to keep off the dampness from the ground and litter.

Less enjoyable.. Overcrowded.. Overrated.. We chose to discover Amsterdam green side 1st by visiting Vondelpark. Like everyone, we have heard a lot of buzz about this park and how it's the biggest park in Amsterdam and one of the highest rated.. We went there around 6 PM to find the place very crowded with lots of bikes going through, it didn't feel as cozy or like a place you can have a romantic picnic/walk in. It wasn't even a weekend, though it was overcrowded with mostly families with kids and people going through the park with their bikes on their way home. I don't recommend the place for any romantic gatherings, maybe for a bike ride though riding in crowded places are not really my favorite thing to do.

Nice, but even here there's bike paths!. There's lots of nice parks in the world and this one is nice but not outstanding. If you have a lot on your list of places to see, put this nearer the bottom. I felt Amsterdam was stressful since I'm not used to bikes zooming past everywhere and crossing the street requires a whole new skill set to learn. Our hotel was across from the park so we walked all around it, but those pesky bikes still plagued me. I know they're good for the environment, but Amsterdam needs to accommodate pedestrians too!

Good place to lie on blanket. We used our bikes to get there and then we lied on the grass and relaxed like everybody was doing.
The park is peefect for spending the afternoon doing nothing but also for riding the bike, running or rolling.
Very green, but not a very big park.

Perfect for a sunny day. went for a walk on a sunny day. large park with lots of different areas. it was sunny on the day we went so busy with people lying in the sun with picnics. There are also paths to walk in the shade which was pleasant. There are a couple of places to stop for a drink and do a little people watching. I would recommend if you want to have a gentle walk away from city streets.

Lovely visit!!. Took a stroll to Vondelpark with two of my friends, whilst staying in Amsterdam for a long weekend, and I'm really glad we did! Although we originally intended to rent bikes and cycle around, walking to and around paid off as we came across a free open area for performances, with plenty of seating and platformed seating too. There were bar areas to get drinks from, and the bottle of wine we had here was our cheapest of the whole trip! Whilst we were there they had 2/3 different bands playing - which were very good to watch.Walking around the park was also very pretty, there are plenty of lovely little paths to take.

Reboot. We decided to go to the park because it had been predicted to be one of the hottest days of the year. Pretty park with lots of lakes and ponds. Wildlife very used to people. Feed the ducks have an ice-cream . Park volunteers monitored joggers and the elderly to make sure they were not exhausted !

Great place to stroll or bike. We enjoyed walking the length of the park on a warm day and much of the walk was in the shade of the large trees. It was fun to see the baby geese, herons, and other water fowl in the lakes. It is mostly peaceful except at one end of the park a road travels over the park and can be a bit noisy.
Nice park. Nice park and the place you can found how the dutches are spending their free time. If you have a time you can have a great picknick there.

Nice Environment. When I go to Vondelpark it is usually to chill with my friends or cycle around (both are more common during nice weather conditions ofcourse ).The park is just a regular city park in the centre. During sunny days it will be packed to the brim with people cycling, drinking a whine in the grass, enjoying the sun etc. Due to the fact that it is in the middle of the centre you will find a few street sleepers in the mornings and against the evening and they are not dangerous! Actually some are very filosophical If you want to have your own space during summer periods in parks I would recommend Haarlemmermeersebos. But thats a drive away. To a tourist Vondelpark may seem like a complete mess with all the people either normal or under influence of something; but the park truely represents the lifestyle of the Amsterdammers.
Amazing park!. Super friendly, wonderful play areas for kids, just a generally wonderful park to walk and bike around!

Wander through the trees lines paths or laze on the acres of grass with the locals, relax.... We strolled through the park on a bright warm and sunny afternoon and it was idyllic. A fair chunk of Amsterdams population were there, riding bikes, strolling the paths or stretched out on the grass chatting in groups or sleeping in the open air. Mainly they were just THERE not inside but out soaking up the sun the air and the other people who were with them.There are places to eat and watch the wildlife in the many lakes or just watch other people passing or watching you...

Oasis in the city. All great cities have great parks. The green lungs of a metropolis that provides a respite from the hustle and bustle of life. In this park you will find families with children teenagers skating, joggers and people wanting to relax and unwind. There's open areas as well as secluded spots. I discovered an amazing children's activities area. It had elevated walkways that passed through overhead trees. There's also large lakes and water features, with bird life in abundance. Well worth a visit.

Second hand high. It is a beautiful park to walk and people watch. With all the bikes trolling around you need to watch your back.
The smell of pot is everywhere. You can smell it on people as they pass u by.

Lovely. We went in march and it was so hot ! We did walk around Vondelpark and it is lovely although are a young couple and although my mum would stand here all day loving it, we went into the centre and visited the shops

Relaxing!. Visited this park to have a picnic. Beautiful park, very relaxing feel to it, beautiful rose garden Amenities available too, would recommend a day in to park yo just relax and watch entertainers

Go there on a beautiful day. And you won't regret it, a nice peacefull park where you can have a picnic, or just relax
Make sure you walk along the lanes to see everything

Lovely park in summer but a lot of dodgey characters . We only stayed on the edge of the park and enjoyed the sunshine.. Took pictures on the bridge with love lockets. There were people there drinking and playing music and although non threatening, after speaking with a local there are better parks in Amsterdam.
Get a bike if you go here. Vondelpark is a very pleasant place to visit. However, make sure that you get a cycle as it gets much easier to explore the park.
Very nice park. This is a calm area but still within a 10-minute ride from the city centre. I would recommend this for families.
Really great park . Had a picnic in this park whilst staying in Amsterdam. Its great & clean. Seemed to be popular with locals too.
Peaceful, family centered. Loved this park! One of the most beautiful in Europe. Love that Amsterdam is SO FAMILY FRIENDLY! Beautiful gardens, great play parks!

Love the experience . Just visited Vondelpark and I really liked it , sadly could not see Tulip Island but the park itself is wonderful. It's a great place for a jog , walk or cycling with rest spots and park benches when you get tired .Also a fabulous place to bring your dog to with plenty of space to run and ponds to swim in Had my afternoon coffee while enjoying the sun and the view

Beautiful park with lots to do!. This park has to be on your to-do list. It's absolutely beautiful. I rented a bike and rode around until I found a nice spot to have a picnic with some friends. then we just chilled out a couple of hours before continuing the day. Really relaxing. There are lots of people there but everyone is doing their own that it doesn't feel over crowed.

Beautiful Park With Fantastic Scenery.. While staying in Amsterdam, I visited this park around four times. It is an incredible place to relax with your friends and admire the views while people go on about their daily lives, riding past on bicycles and having barbecues on the grass.

Large and beautiful. This is the largest city park in Amsterdam and very popular with tourists and locals. Easy to get around on foot or bicycle. Food vendors and restaurants are scattered throughout the park. There are no signboards with a map of the park. You may purchase a map for 2 Euros at the entrance.
Go there. Wonderful place wonderful park woderful location at the center of the cşty Amsterdam You can go with bicycle.

Nice park nothing really special. Good to spend a couple of hours and relax on the grass. The coffe shop and restaurant from the park are overpticed and the food, coffee or sweets..well we had better. It is very clise to Van Gogh museum and national museum so good to relax after spending a full day at the museum.
Peace of senses. This park is so peaceful and laid back. We were just laying in the sun and listening to music and there were happy people everywhere, you just couldn't stop smiling and feeling happy
Nice stroll. Lovely park, well kept and very large. Nice for a stroll after dealing with the museum crowd. Lots of benches and grass to sit and relax on.

Great big park with lots of good chilling spots. We went to this park 4 or 5 times and it was always a different experience. The park is quite huge. My favorite spot was a place with almost horizontal trees just abive the water where you can just sit and enjoy life. It is also good spot to have a few drinks with skme friends.
Bubbles in the Park. Great Park. Nice walking path. Had dinner at a restaurant in the Park. Children enjoyed playing with Bubbles.

Beautiful park in the center of Amsterdam.. This is a very nice park. There were many hundreds of young people in the park having a great time. They all were very orderly and well behave. I did not notice any police or security officers in the park.

Beautiful park. This was just a stones through from where we stayed and we walked through it a couple of ti,Es. It is not a acutely park, or another when we wheat through it, as it large and used by the full,cross,section of society. It was lovely to walk through this but like all places in Amsterdam, you still have to look out for the cyclists :-)

Touch of green in a bustling city.. Had a good hour or so wandering around Vondelpark, very nice area for chilling and enjoying a snack in the café.Good walkways, with sloped access for wheelchairs (and Amsterdam cyclists!!), tram stops to several districts of Amsterdam right outside.Could possibly do with a few more seating areas away form the cafes, and one or two sheltered areas as refuge from the showers.All in all a worth a gentle wander round.
One of the main attractions. The Vondelpark is one of the main spots in Amsterdam.It's a well maintained park and you can stroll a bit and relax.Try it.
Lovely park. Vondelpark is a great spot to grab some food and drinks and have a lazy lunch. Very scenic with winding bike paths.

A little disappointing. We took a picnic lunch to Vondelpark but were disappointed by the facilities that we found. The play park we visited was sparse and badly maintained, and the sand that covered the ground was dirty and messy. The toilet facilities are mainly portaloos and they were just awful. Urinals are OK for adult men, but taking children into the portaloos isn't an option, they were so dirty and stinking with no paper. I was really surprised. The event area at the centre of the park is a real plus though and i could imagine that it's a great place for summer concerts.

Beautiful!!. Vondelpark is an amazing place to explore, the grounds are huge with lovely views. Unfortunately my Husband and I wasn't in Amsterdam very long so didn't get to see it all but we will definitely be visiting again and seeing the rest :)
Nice large park to enjoy a nice day in. This is a wonderful park, with lots of activities going on all the time. Be aware the cyclists have the right of way in Amsterdam and take advantage of it
Nice but very crowded. Park is spacious with several partly hidden areas giving it some character. Walkways are plentiful but again watch out for bikes anywhere that have no regard for pedestrians.

What a great place to chill and have a picnic. This calming park has vast grassy areas to relax and have a nice afternoon. The geese and ducks in the lake is a fun thing to watch and you have many choices of food around the park, wether if you want to drink coffee or have a Turkish meal from a grocery nearby. You might stumble upon singers and young performers while strolling the park.
Summer strolling. The park is a very pretty place for a summer stroll or picnic. It is very popular and well utilised but as it is large there is plenty of space.

One with nature - relaxing!. We rented bikes and roamed around Vondelpark which is much safer to ride here than on the streets of Amsterdam. There are several paths to explore here at Vondelpark. On a sunny day it wouldnbe nice to have an ice cream (from the ice-cream/hotdog vendor by the lake) and just lay on the grass!

So many people working out. Beautiful park.
Free opera on show whilst we walked through.
So many people working out - either running, cycling or boot camping it up - made me feel bad!
Worth a meander.

Amazing !!!! . Well this park was amazing with a awesome bike and walking path water features lots of wildlife and trees for both shady and sunny areas. The atmosphere here is very relaxed with everyone having a good time. From couples on a picnic to joggers to people exercising to people having a BBQ... Like honestly a park that allows people to hang out and have fun and even have BBQ a meal with friends.. Wish we had these type of parks at home! And free to public.. They really cater to the public with lots of benches , public outdoor washrooms and garbage bins for BBQ coals..

Beautiful park in Amsterdam!. Great place for a picnic, walk, run or ride your bike. We were there at night too and there was a lot of people walking, listening to music, a nice atmosphere! We felt very safe although it was about 10 pm.
nice green space within the city. Relaxing place for a stroll , bike ride, picnic etc, we enjoyed the quiet green space away from the busy city, just look out for bikes, nice lake, birdlife etc

Disappointing. There is nothing very interesting about this park at all. Amsterdam is a tough place to take kids because there is very little green space. If there was a playground we couldn't find it.

Nice park. This is a nice park to walk through, but it's not stunning I think I have just been spoiled by the parks in London, I did go on a very hot and it was packed so maybe better on a different day, it was also the only Time I got annoyed with all the cycles, it would have been nice to just go for a walk with having to keep dodging them.

A beautiful walk. The park is serene and the morning walk in September was cool. It's a very big park with loads of open field. There were many joggers, people with the pet dogs and also serves as a short cut for people to go to work. There are a few lakes or ponds. Sighted a few ducks but does not look like a habitat for birds. Nice for kids to run about. Very clean.

beautiful and lively park. This beautiful and lively park has lots of lakes and small forest paths to explore. Take a picnic, ride a bike, simply people watch or even have a nap on the greenery. This park really is huge and is a great way to break a busy day up.

A little dirty, run down & disappointing!. I had hoped to enjoy a nice scenic stroll after the transatlantic flight, but only found a very dirty park. Hoping to find prettier parks here. I can recommend.
Lovely park to walk around. Lovely, peacful park to walk around and chill out in. There was also a great stage/venue with acts on that took us by surprise but was great.

Beautiful. Absolutely lovely park. Nice to either walk around or take a picnic blanket and sit on the grass near the canals. Lots of dogs walking around and people jogging. Just a lovely air to the place. Would absolutely recommend a trip here.

Worth a visit to bike it. Beautiful park and easy biking trails. An oasis in the city that is well used by the locals as well as the tourists. Large park so would recommend using a bike to see it all.
Pretty park. A lovely park to have a walk around it for a picnic or a drink by the rivers on a nice sunny day. Very close to the centre near Leidseplein.

Lovely Park. We had hired bikes and visited this park during our city tour. It was a Saturday and busy with lots of bikers, runners and families. However, there is plenty of room for everyone and we enjoyed a leisurely ride around.

Cycle ride in the park. The wife and I spent a couple of hours cycling in and around the park. We hired the bikes for 2 hours costing around 20 euro in total. You can't hire them in the park but it was near the entrance and tram stop. We found the park fun ad a safe environment for a cycle ride.
Chill. That's great park with nice relaxing atmoshere. It's nice to chill here or picnic but also good for cycling

Lovely park. Recommended for walking, jogging, and biking if you want a break from the streets. Nice trails, good amount of sun and shade, and many birds to see. The fountains and ponds make a peaceful setting.
Best spot to catch some sun. What a beautiful and relaxed park, Its really great to go there with the bike, catch a spot in the sun and bring some food with you for a picnic!

Busy and Beautiful. Vondelpark is beautiful. The grounds are massive and worth a stroll or bicycle ride around. There were parties going on, an outdoor theatre/stage. A stunning place with a pleasant atmosphere. My wife and I cycled around the park as part of our 3 hour afternoon bicycle ride. Recommend a visit. This was very busy when we went and I got the impression this is where the youngsters and the tourists go. If you want a quieter time go to Rembrandt Park instead.

Beautiful. But keep a working smartphone on you!. If you like the idea of getting yourself lost in an unusual but beautiful park, this is definitely the place. There aren't maps on site, however, so if you're heading a particular way, make sure you have some means of navigating!

Magic. This is the most beautiful and relaxing park I have ever had the pleasure to go to. I loved every minute of my day in the park. It glowed in the sunshine and was full of happy, smiling people. There is ample seating provided and many cafes to stop in at for a cup of tea or a reviving drink. The wildlife is plentiful and there are many tranquil spots to have a picnic or just while away the time. I would recommend that everyone who goes to Amsterdam spends a day at Vondelpark.
Great infra and beautifully maintained. The park is huge and full of great spots for photography, a picnic or just to relax. Top tip is to rent a bike to ride it all.

Great for chill-out. If there is a mist, this place is just mysterious. In a rainy day (especially in case of a common light Amsterdam-ish rain) - it is very calm and peaceful. In a Sunny period - full of joyful people! And if you accidentaly appear in a central "garden" - you'll see the magic - particularly during the sunset!This is onr of the best places in whole city.
large park with interesting spots. nice park to relax, with many pokemon go stops, so going with children is easy, a lot of young people
Nice park. Nice park , quite large to relax.Lots of people on weekend though. Children will love this place and there is a nice lake too

Sun, Ice Cream and Bicycles - very relaxing!. We hired bikes and cycled to (and through) Vondelpark.It was a very warm day with lots of people in the park, but there was such a chilled atmosphere!There was an ice cream vendor who sold the most amazing ice creams in waffle cones - perfect for chilling in the sun.
Just the place to chill and relax. Visited late afternoon after a hectic days sightseeing, a lovely place to stroll and relax, lots of locals use it to meet up for chat. Really nice atmosphere.

Walk in the Park. Arrived on a sunny day and spent most of it walking through the park. We have seen most of the sites in Amsterdam and planned to do the museums on a rainy day. Park is lovely. Great place to chill a little during a jam packed vacation. Lots of people around, kids, soccer, kids swimming, beer in an eatery, rose garden, water, dogs, runners, and more.

Lovely park. Vondel park is a very nice park near central Amsterdam. It is a great place to go to get a drink with cafes with outdoor seating overlooking the water. It is very busy though on a warm day so there is not much room to kick a ball around.

Nice park to relax on a sunny day. Even though our day was on and off sun vs. rain, this was still a nice place to sit and relax our feet after walking so much. Mostly surrounded by residences and office buildings but still a nice quite place.
Welcome relief from a very busy city. Spent several hours here during a hot sunny week in the city. After the busy streets this park is so welcome.

Perfect place for a packed lunch. Its the perfect place to carry your own packed lunch (though u can buy from inside too) and a bottle of wine or some beer. Its mostly full with locals and tourists but does not give u the feeling of being crowded. Its only a 10 min walk from the Van Gogh Museum.

Lovely park for a break. I love a walk/cycle through Vondelpark when in the dam.
Not a necessary tourist spot but a nice detour away from the hustling streets of centrum.
Always busy on sunny days but never had a problem finding a nice spot to relax.

Sun, bikes and relax. Vondelpark is "the park" in Amsterdam, as Hyde park in London or La Ciutadella in Barcelona. If the weather is good, do not doubt for a walk.This park is perfect for either a relaxing day with your partner or a picnic with your friends. As many other things in Amsterdam, it's tolerate to smoke, topless and enjoy a glass of wine or beer. Not only biking around is really nice and you can rent a bike there, but also the walking is really enjoyable.
Lovely Park. Lovely park just outside the city centre worth a visit for a nice stroll or to sit and watch the world go by. Easily walkable and not far from the main museums.

Green Oasis in the centre of this Great City.. Great place in Amsterdam to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life. We were on our bikes and was a pleasant change from the biz of the city traffic.We visited on a sunny Sunday and lots going on.......bands etc.Although plenty locals and tourists in the park it didn't feel crowded.Well worth a visit to escape the crowds.

Amsterdam's answer to the central park. If visiting with friends, carry a sheet to lie down, some food(although there are plenty places to buy food inside the park), some beer/wine(depending on what you like) and you have the best day planned!
Beautiful. Lovely place to walk through and chill out even moreso with your goods purchased from the coffee shops. Beautiful park seems to be well kept.
Hidden treasure. Lovely park to stroll around but beware the bikes! Hidden in the centre is the Picasso statue of the fish. You would miss it if you,didn't know as not sign posted in any way

Cool park with many locals! . The park is usually full of young Dutch people that chill or take the sun. Really worth a visit!
There are also chemical toilets in the park if you don't want to go to a toilet's bar and save money :-)
Beautiful!. A very unique park. It's huge and has different areas of people picnicking, smoking, biking. Definitely a must do if you have a few days in Amstedam.

Wine, Cheese, Meat, Sunshine = Vondelpark. An absolute must to visit to see where the locals hang out on the weekends, to sit and enjoy themselves with a nice bottle of wine, some food and some friends. We spent a couple hours in the park just sitting and enjoying the vast amounts of green space the place has to offer, and listened in the background to some live music that was happening in the amphitheater. We loved our visit to the Vondelpark.

lovely park. a lovely park in the middle of the hussles and bussles of city. a great place for the kids to explore. hiring a bike for a couple of hours going around it stopping for a picnic and or coffee is great fun. beautiful.

A Green Oasis. Lovely, green, open space in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the busy city. A great place to just walk in the sunshine and read by the water. Always worth a visit on the way to the Museum Quarter.

A piece of greenery in a busy city. Nice and relaxing, great for a picnic, bicycle ride or walk. Can get too crowded in afternoon hours. We took our bikes and some cheese and wine and had a nice lunch beside the lake.

See the locals. Spent a morning walking the length of the park. Enjoy a cup of coffe and watch the locals taking their exercise. The only people walking seemed to be tourists! There were cyclists of all ages, joggers and roller bladers. Fascinating to see the many adaptations to cycles enabling the whole family to travel.
Lunch inthe park. had a sunny day in the park. we walked around the park for a bit before we decided to have lunch at a café in the park.

Was not the quiet, tranquil park during our visit this time.. Unfortunately for us we came during a huge running event. Big crowds, loud music, and parts of the park sectioned off. There was definately a oar try atmosphere. It was still a lovely park to walk around. There are walking paths, water features, wild life, and lots of trees. Wheel chair accessable and a nice park.

Amazing park. The park was massive, loads of cafe and play area. We rented bikes so we had a fantastic time!! We enjoyed cycling around a few times, and went around the city as its close to all the shops and main attractions.
Lovely. A great walk with friends. Local musicians playing. A relaxing and fun place to go. It's always good to see another countries parks. So many ideas to adapt for your own backyard.
Huge!. A large park with loads of beautiful sights to stroll around in all day. Also a perfect place to ride bikes.
simply stunning. love a stroll through this place, a little time away from the hustle n bustle, ive been in the winter and the summer, it looks amazing any time of the year
WONDERLAND. best place to hang out with friends and get high 🦄🦄 If you want to try magic truffles in amsterdam, vondelpark is the best place to do that ♥️
Great park!. We enjoyed a good walk in Vondelpark on a Sunday morning in February. Nice walks, not too crowded, and an overall very nice and relaxing break from the city. Couldn't recommend it more!

Not enough time!. The park in full summer swing on a sunny day looked fantastic. Full of vibrant people enjoying life and soaking up the park's feel good vibe. Great walks great views and even a few places to eat and drink. Just didn't have enough time on our trip to see it all.

A lovely family place to spend time. We had a fantastic time and the kids enjoyed the nature. The birds and ducks are so friendly. I seriously recommend that anyone visiting the park should carry lots of bread to feed the birds and ducks.

Great place to kill time. We were too early for the next adventure, so we hopped into this park and walked around to kill time. The park was quite big, with trees, ponds, flowers etc. We looked for a nice bench right in front of a big pond, sat down and duck watching. Many families and individuals were utilizing the park for recreational purposes and to exercise. Many people cycled too. Clean park and near to city.
Great afternoon . What a fantastic place to go and just relax for a few hours. People watching is never ending and yet the park does not seem overcrowded.

Amazing scenery. This park is absolutely unreal! It tends get busy fairly early onwards but other then that its a beautiful park to visit. Its rather huge as well so we didn't get to see it all so we just picked a spot on the grass to relax

Beautiful massive park . Beautiful and massive - think Central Park in NYC. My husband and I stumbled across this and were so glad we did. I wish we had brought a picnic lunch. It was a sunny day and there were people everywhere soaking in the beautiful weather and surroundings.

Picnic in the park. Great to see locals using their open space so on a sunny day the park is busy but still plenty of space to enjoy some peace. Great place to people watch and enjoy either a BBQ, picnic or coffee in the park cafe or of course exercise of your choice.

Relaxing In the City. Vondelpark Park always amazed me how big is and is in the middle of urban city. Not many cities have park like that which is really used by people. Been there first in 1982 and this year again. The best is to go with bike and then you can easier explore around.Many people playing music,singing, sport ,yoga or whatever they like to do. Me like to stop and listening to musicians sit down with them and have good time. Love the place.Will definitely recommended to anyone.

A beautiful green space, away from the hustle and bustle. Spent many an hour wandering through this beautifully kept park. Wonderful to see locals and tourists alike enjoying it, walking, jogging, cycling and chilling. Vendors are expensive so take a bottle of water!

A perfect location to enjoy the sun. First day in Amsterdam and we found ourselves in the park while out for a walk. It is always nice to relax in the sun and in a nice park like this in the middle of a city. The park is obviously quite popular with lots of people there.

Beautiful and green. My family and I cycled through Vondelpark and it just such a lovely place to visit. There is a lake, a Picasso sculpture, a children's play area, an outdoor gym and lots of benches and places to sit. It can get quite crowded however. Overall though, it is one of my favourite parks I have visited.
Day trip. Just when I thought I couldn't love Amsterdam more we went to Vondel park. What an amazing area of beauty.

Lovely . My boyfriend and I took a stroll through the park and it was extremely beautiful and lively, with lots of lakes to walk around and small forrest paths to walk through and even a children's outdoor pool which we paddled in as well as plenty of bars selling drinks and snacks.There is so much of the park to explore and would also be lovely by bike.
Great for strolling. Excellent for strolling or riding a bike. Or just chilling out on the grass. Very busy and lots going on. An afternoon here on a nice day is bliss.

A lovely view to sit and relax. We went to this park when we first arrived in Amsterdam as it was right next to our hotel! It was a bright sunny day, and after a wonder around all the lovely views we sat down next to a pond/lake which had a fountain in the middle and relaxed there for about 30 minutes! It was so beautiful to watch the scenery and the different people go by. If we had more time there I would have visited again and done a more thorough walk through the park!
Beautiful . Beautiful place to just relax and enjoy the view. Good location, and also a good place to play pokemon go.

Has to be done. Had a lovely picnic and saw just a small bit of this fast park. It has loads to offer and all amenities can be found on one of the information boards which are around the park. Great place to chill and do nothing.

Gorgeous. My friend and I cycled around here for an hour or so in the afternoon and were really impressed by it.
It's a beautiful park, absolutely massive, with plenty to see and do.
There was even a bar/nightclub tucked away between the trees!
I was really quite disappointed not to have more time to explore.
Lovely place.

Walking through Vondelpark on a guide book walk of the city. A pleasant gated city park, with children's play area, a lake, paths, seats and bridges. Pretty setting. Not many flowers, but plenty of varieties of trees and shrubs. Ducks and heron on pond. Nice areas to sit and relax, chat, picnic etc. No public toilets as far as we could see. (In fact in the whole of Amsterdam there appeared to be no public facilities sign posted. Even Starbucks didn't have a restroom available.)
A wonder through Amsterdam . Large green area.Lovely walk in the sunshine with a picnic. Not much more to say other than enjoy :)

Gorgeous city park. We enjoyed perfect weather while we were in Amsterdam, so naturally we spent a lot of time at this beautiful city park among the locals and tourists alike. Perfect for biking, walking, relaxing with a book. Lots of greenery and wide open spaces to explore.

Peaceful and beautiful. Explore this park on a bike and get lost in one of its many lawns next to a lake. Vondelpark has jogging and bike tracks, spaces where you can have BBQs and amazing landscapes.

Very busy. It was a nice walk, but the park is really busy! You can find a spot to sit on the grass if you look for a little while unless you don't mind staying around people playing Pokemon Go! It's worth the visit though!
Charming & peacful place for those who love greenery. You'll find lots of ponds & live landscapes to cherish! Great place to spend half a day or a full day there! Mind the cyclists!
Day out in the park. Lovely great relaxed scenery where you can ride and cycle through the park looking at the Great surroundings

Beautiful, relaxing and free!. If you have half a day and need to charge up, why not in vondelpark? My fiancé and I went there after visiting the zoo (maybe 10-15 minutes ride from Artis zoo). We had a great time! Beautiful fountains and huge patches of green. A lot of locals come here, especially when it's sunny outside. You can find locals in bikinis and bathing suites whenever there is sun!Don't forget to bring a picnic blanket, but don't worry about food. You can either buy food from carts / restaurants in the park or alternatively, we saw locals order pizza to the park using an app with gps location ( can't remember what it's called but definitely check it out - ask any local). PS Mind that in vondelpark locals are allowed to free their dogs (for people whom it may concern).

Lovely and much loved park. Close by the museum area to the south west of the 'old can ringed city', this park is a splendid urban lung with wide paved walkways. mature trees, secluded seating areas etc. Its also a thoroughfare for the dreaded Amsterdam high speed push bikes, which can sudenly zoom upon the unwary pedestrian, so you need to keep an eye open. Thoroughly worth a stroll after a visit to the museum area

As parks go, it's nice, but not a must see unless you've got plenty of time to spare.. Vondelpark is nice...for a park. The obvious appeal is the somewhat placid atmosphere compared to the streets and canals of the city. That being said, it's a park. If you've got nothing better to do or need to wind down from a hectic itinerary, this is certainly a great place to do it. Otherwise, I wouldn't suggest cramming it into an already overbooked schedule. Expect a sizable crowd, so if you are into people watching, this is right up your alley. If you are a little introverted, there is still enough space so that you don't feel claustrophobic. Many locals (and I'd guess tourists) enjoy the liberty of smoking marijuana on the grounds, as the smell is ubiquitous (as it is in many areas of Amsterdam).As with any city, this is still a nice escape from the hustle and bustle if you want to get away from (some) of it all.
Stop By The Market, Picnic. Beautiful, rolling, plenty of space for hanging out, running, biking. Great for a lazy afternoon with family and friends or solo.

Beautiful garden and well preserved . A beautiful park area with lots of greenery including lakes, foundations, bridges and vegetation! There are lots of cafes in the park and it's lovely to sit within the park enjoying the surroundings or cycling around the park itself, highly recommend!

Beautiful park!. It's a lovely, very popular park at all times of the day and even into the night. Safe, with toilets (well, port-a-potties) and with lots of paths to explore. We visited this park several times in our week in Amsterdam and loved it!
Lovely Park!. Lovely big park, plenty for adults and children. Nice spot to sit with a picnic and watch all the bikes etc go by.

Loved this park. This park on a hot day gets really busy with people sunbathing, cycling, skating and just enjoying the environment. It has several lakes to sit around, a place to eat and benches to sit and watch the world go by. A lovely change from the city centre.

Great Place For A Walk. I came to Vondelpark after the recommendation by several friends who had visited Amsterdam before. It was a great experience. I have to say, I find the very few negative reviews to be quite amusing. When I visit somewhere I like, I have a habit of looking up the poor reviews to check for any down sides. It seems the only people who disliked this park, are people who either don't like other people, or consider the public consumption of alcohol and cannabis to be for homeless and druggies. That is more a reflection of their own narrowmindedness getting the better of their experiences. One reviewer said "Its boring, its just a bunch of people relaxing". That sounds good to me! Unfortunately, I had no other option than to go to Amsterdam in the middle of the summer peak time, at the beginning of August. The city was extremely busy, but once you step into the open expanse of the park, although it had lots of people still, it was like a breath of fresh air away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city, despite still being in the heart of it. We walked through the main gates and immediately spotted some buskers playing unusual music, and some other performers walking on tight ropes and such. It was all very interesting. We walked further and the park continued to open up. People lay on the grass relaxing, and it had a serene and peaceful atmosphere. I loved how liberal and laid back the area was - people were very civilised and at peace as they enjoyed glasses of wine, cold beers, or the famous Amsterdam smoke in the sunlight. Small walkways and paths weaved in and out of various coves, streams and lakes, alongside wider main thoroughfares were cyclists, joggers and skateboarders cruised by. Dotted along the way there are monuments, flower displays and places of interest such as bars, and food dispensaries. One of the first open areas we came along had an outdoor stage with a live band setting up. Who hung around for a while and enjoyed a beer and some free live music at a wonderful concert we had not expected to attend! A beautiful oasis in the middle of the busy city. A great getaway to enjoy some scenery and relaxation. Great for a casual stroll .
Nice park. This is a very nice park to have a picnic or to go for a bike ride (you can rent it near Hard Rock Cafe) and visit it the Dutch way ;)

A break from all the walking. Sometimes on holiday you just want to sit down and relax. On the way to Vondelpark we bought some pastries to enjoy. At the park you see all sorts of people, we saw musicians going up to hens picnics and spontaneously performing! The park is a great way to break up your day.

Good place to run and walk!. Went to the park a few times during my visit to Amsterdam, to sit and enjoy the sun with a sandwich, to walk and relax with friends and also one morning to run. It is very good for all of these things - lots of cyclists and runners around, with people enjoying the good weather. There are also some cafes to enjoy food and drink.

Crazy at night. We took a walk on a weekend night through the park. It was very crowded with people on the lawns bbqing and partying. Most people were polite and some were playing music. The downside was that there was garbage everywhere and empty beer cans and nitrous chargers were left by the party's. There was a police presence but they just made sure nobody got out of line. We felt safe even as it got later but the garbage did spoil the view.
Beautiful park!. This park is the perfect place for a picnic and it seems a lot of other people have the same idea! Great for a run to if you're inclined that way!
Very peaceful. Traveled through the park on a bike ride. Very beautiful and peaceful. Hard to believe there is such a peaceful place in the middle of the city.
Lovely open space.. Fab park, to walk, cycle or skate round. We hired bikes and cycled all round. Weather was great too, which was an added bonus. Great part of Amsterdam, not to be missed.

A lovely way to spend an hour or two . Had a couple of hours before the flight home and decided this would be a nice way to spend it. It is rather massive with a few places to grab a bite or a drink, looks beautiful in the sunshine! Highly recommend a visit!

Great place on a sunny day . Went round park and couple of times on hire bikes. Very busy but great to see cyclers, joggers & walkers enjoying the park. Couple of good places to get food & drink & watch world go by.
runners paradise. a beautiful park with a jogging trail around the lake. very peaceful place in the middle of a very busy city. you will enjoy!
Lovely place to have a jaunt . At present full of people pokemoning! Very large park. Lots of seating, fountain and open air space for theatre/music. Fun to people watch.
A lovely park. See the locals at play! A beautiful, well laid out park - you just have to watch out for the bicycles.

Amazing space to relax. This park is beautiful in the summer, with ponds, cafes, restaurants, tennis courts and more. It is a great place to relax and you can also hire bikes and roller blades to travel around the park. Definitely worth a visit!

good place for a BBQ!. the park is centrally located and has designated spots where you can BBQ and have your beer. Just buy some supplies at the local supermarket around the corner near the Museumplein and you can set up for a nice afternoon/evening in the Park!

Nice views, pleasant walks or runs.. Nice break to the tourist's packed routine. In summer, enjoy the warm, friendly environment... Also great for short running, and relatively close to many attractions.

Nice and green . Went there for a stroll with my baby. The place was fresh and green and accessible with my stroller. The park is huge and has cafes and ice cream stalls starting from € 1.50 which I saw no where else on my trip to Europe ! There people in large groups and also few single , having a good time on their and soaking up the sun, smoking up, listening to music, drinking beers.... Basically chilling but in a very civilised way as compared to where I come from. I did not notice any rowdy behaviour. Lots of bike traffic there and no designated places for crossing the tracks for pedestrians ( well at least no where near the gate that I entered from )Nice place to unwind, read a book and be close to nature.
Beautiful and fun. It's very beautiful and green, with water, flowers, trees and all. A perfect spot to unwind after a long day :)
Good relaxing walk. This is a very relaxing park. After a day of sightseeing it is just what you need. We got there using trams 1, 2, or 5 from the Central Station.

Blue tea house trip. Lots of people enjoying the park on a Wednesday evening. Went to the tea house for a refreshing beer on a hot day. Enjoyed some Dutch cheese and jelly with my brew. Nice complimentary lemon water and mint water

Good place to relax with friends or children. We liked the fact of existing a big park with large trees in the center of the city. You can sit in shadows under the trees or lay on the grass under the sun
Vondlepark . Very pretty place and a nice atmosphere I enjoyed it as it was somewhere to chill out really nice if it's sunny!!!

just a park. I took the time to go to Vondelpark after seeing such rave reviews, but isn't it just a park? It's nice enough and big enough but there's really nothing that special to it. There's grass, ponds, and benches to sit on, but nothing that's really worth making a trip there unless you have extra time in Amsterdam and just really want to go to a park since it's kind of out of the way. The city itself is probably much more interesting to explore.

Lovely. Walled through Vondel park a few days ago in 30º weather and it was such a stunning park. Its huge! In England you see families with children on the grass in parks but here there was mainly young adults. All relaxing and playing music or having bbq's and bikes are everywhere! Definately not used to having to watch out for bikes in a park. We walked through but it would be lovely to cycle through. A nice way to relax or pass some time in Amsterdam. Not far from the museums either

Beautiful!. Vondelpark is gorgeous - from the wire gates to the pretty green grass - it's really lovely on a sunny day. Very clean and quite busy. There were many, many people bikes around the park but it's also an excellent spot to run, relax or have a picnic.

Rent a bike and enjoy . The park is big.. So to truly appreciate it rent a bike. a1 rentals just next to the park / Marriott were amazing. Bikes for all ages and back seats for those too small to pedal.Loads to see and do for kids. Water park splash areas, climbing and play parks. Just great. A must visit for any family wanting a bit of calm in Amsterdam.
Beautiful park for riding bikes!. We rented bikes from the hotel in the late afternoon and rode through the park. It is definitely the hip place to be, lots of young people sunning and hanging out.
Vondelpark summer music. Great place on a Saturday afternoon to sit with a beer and listen to liv, free music. Can get quite busy so arrive early!

Lovely park. The Vondlepark is beautiful with so.ething for everyone lots of nice scenery and little stalls to get refreshments. The only down side is the cyclists don't stick to the cycle lanes and tend to get annoyed if your in their way. Still definitely worth a vist

Beautiful park & gardens. Lovely cafe in centre to relax & watch world go by. We walked to Vondelpark & were so pleased we did. It helped that it was a beautiful spring day. There park is family friendly but watch out for bikes as the bike path runs through it. There are bridges, ponds & play areas. Lots of ducks. It would be good for a family picnic. Lovely cafe in middle to relax with a drink & watch the world go by.

Lose yourself. Always go here when I am in City. Beautiful place to walk or run around. Close to the good shopping a quick team rude from centre. Always people running riding hanging out make it safe.
Beautiful. Wonderful place for a walk and a picnic. Completely lose yourself in the tranquility and yet is only 4 minute walk from plenty of bars restaurants and shops

Too late for tulips, but the roses are fabulous.. We were delighted with our visits to this park, the greenery and the sense of space is in direct contrast to the structured radial construction of Amsterdam city, where the crowds can be tiring. Vondel park offers a breathing space; a place to sit , or play Frisbee on the grass and the ultimate destination for avid people watchers. The bikes share the pathways of course, but after a couple of days in the city, watching out becomes second nature. If you hire bikes this is a family friendly place to enjoy cycling. Amsterdamers love their dogs, and all kinds of breeds (and owners) can be spotted.The water features are lovely, and for those interested in water management they show creative and practical ways to work with drainage. The wild birds ( herons,coots and ducks when we were there ) and butterflies thrive there. Have your camera ready for the statue of Vondel himself, the rose gardens and the fountains. The paths can be muddy after rain, so take care with little ones. The wilderness area in the park is just what its name suggests, and is kept as an oasis for birds, newts etc.

Wonderful place for a walk and people watching!. Take the time to find this park. It's a nice change from the busy and crowded streets of the city. Here you can sit on the grass, ride bikes on the wide street and really relax!

Nice place to people watch. We spent a couple or hours relaxing in the park on a beautiful summers day. The park is very large and has several small lakes in it as well as at least three cafes. There are toilets dotted around at various points. Even though the park is very large it was very crowded and I would have preferred it to be less busy. It was nice to visit but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there next time.

Sprawling park - chilled and relaxed!. This was a great park to visit on a very hot day! It was really popular - lots of groups of friends and couples just 'hanging out'; Amsterdam has a low children rate per capita so not even lots of demanding young ones! A chap's dog was swimming in the lake to cool down and both were friendly and sociable. Had a drink in the café - not the most atmospheric but the barman happily changes my glass when I complained of lipstick on the rim. A really nice place to chill out.
Nice park. This park in the heart of Amsterdam is quite huge and good for relaxing, looking the sights of nature or for a good jog around the park
Was a dander . Massive hotdog stands r a must when taking a stroll through this park the ducks also have no fear lol
Great park for a walk. During our stay in Amsterdam we stayed at a hotel right on Vondelpark. We walked in the park every day. It's large park and there are several cafes at which to enjoy a coffee.

Something for everyone. Admittedly we got lucky with the weather as it was 26 degrees so the park was just teaming with life, cyclists, runners, dog walkers and sunbathers. Lovely cafes and facilities near the middle, beautiful ponds and walkways. A definite must if you are visiting Amsterdam. We loved it.

Great place to rent a bike and have fun with your kids!. We rented a bike in a bike rental store nearby (we had to call several as we visited in August, and it was hard to find bike for kids), and we really enjoy our two hour visit to the park. There are lots of place to have lunch and snacks (although we did not try them).
Great, large park!. Great park for so many activities. In my view, the most beautiful spot is in the western end of the park. Also quiet and often private as many people do not find the entry point

A good walk and relaxing park . We walked through Vondelpark on the hottest day of the year in 2016. The cooling shade of the trees was most welcome. It's a lovely park and worth a visit to walk or just relax.

Very relaxing. I strolled here for almost 2 hours just going around. THe part is very green and the people are laid-back. If it would be hot at that time maybe i could see people having barbecue and grilled foods.

Great place to bisit. We went to Vondelpark 2 days in a row, once when it was raining on & off & the second time was during the bike tour we did which was a lovely sunny day. What a difference in the 2 days quite one day busy the next but both time very relaxing & quite, well worth visit.
Must Go. . I would recommend this park, it's nice to chill out away from the centre, visited the park with my partner on a sunny day and it was lovely! One of the must do things to do in Amsterdam.

Huge. On a sunny day is this park great, plenty of space. But too crowded, bikes are everywhere. There is a seperate area where you can bbq on selected tiles on the grassfield. Tip for the ladies: if you need to go to the toilet, just spend 0,50€ at a restaurant instead of the free toilet (blue/white box) at the park, it was disgusting!!!

Nice place for kids . I liked it for kids they enjoyed alot we went on a last sunday of july This place have some really nasty toilets which stinks so badly that u cant even walk by them Other then that nice play areas for kids walking tracks few lakes beautiful green areas

Amazing inner city park. Have walked and biked in Vondelpark. Amazing large park within the city that is used by all walks of life, great to see so many people out enjoying the park. As anywhere in Amsterdam the walking person should pay heed to the cyclists!
Great open space. lovely park, lots of different routes to take, good for bikes and walkers. Very flat. great on a sunny day

A nice place to chill for a couple of hours. . Maybe take a picnic blanket as there were a huge number of cigarette butts on the grass! We found a bench though by moving away from the main entrance and enjoyed a relaxed afternoon people watching, reading a book and eating ice cream.

Amazing experience . I have visited Vondelpark during my summer holidays in Amsterdam in August with friends. Omg what an experience. This is a breathtaking beautiful landscape where friends and colleagues meet after work when for get together picnic and/or barbecue and drinks. Strongly recommended!

An absolute delight. On bikes, foot, skateboards, rollerblades it is all happening here. When the weather is nice or really sunny the families, friends and singles are abound. What a wonderful please to hang out, walk through or just enjoy a coffee or your fancy. A true delight in the city with easy access

Park is nice. It was a huge park with lots of greenery but was not looking safe. Family crowd was not there when we visited. It is just a general park and nothing great. You can save your time by not going there.
Great place to kiss your bf/gf :). When I was there, its February. It's cold and mist, but park is so magical and and great spot to walk, run or just chill.
Amazing park. Loved cycling in the park with all of the locals coming and going on bikes. Bike hire was just €9 and we'll worth it. Great restaurants too if you fancy a snack or a glass of wine.

Busy Busy Busy. This is a beautiful park but in the 45 years i have been visiting it every time i return it is less and less.It is unsafe,even after the city kicked out it of dealers and junkies.People biking through the park go way to fast and pay no attention to dogs and children running around the park.The Blue Teahouse in the middle of the Vondelpark is a good place to relax,but in all the years i have been visiting it the service is still very slowwwwww.Don't go there if you are in a hurry or hungry.

Very relaxing. We walked through the park on our very first day and it was just beautiful and serene. Very idyllic: flowers, dogs running free (and very calm), kids playing, water fountains...just very relaxing.My daughter found the assault course fun and interesting

Great park esp on a sunny day. Had a lovely couple of hours in the park. Went to one of the playgrounds with a cafe attached so the kids could have fun on the slides. Gorgeous day which helps a lot. Best explored on a bike as it's pretty big to walk around. Great hangout in the middle of the city.

Great to cycle around......not as big as you'd think. Visited the park on a nice sunny day, so as you can imagine, very busy, but full of life! lots of little tracks to cycle down and small ornamental gardens to sit in. There's a nice little bar / food place in the centre that is a good beer stop on a warm day. Good place to spend three / four hours whilst in Amsterdam

Beautiful place to spend a sunny day. We hired bikes from our hotel and headed down to Vondelpark to explore. Stunning park, great bike paths and so many beautiful spots to enjoy the sun. Highly recommended, plenty of places to stop for a cold beer or an ice-cream
Nice Park. Nice park. Green with a creek and walking paths. Children's playgrounds are a bit dated, but are in good shape.
Gorgeous. Nice relaxing area to chill out and bake. Good crepes near by are a must when developing hunger. Enjoyed very much!

A Walk in the Park. The Vondelpark is so dreamy; from the minute you cross that gate until you exit, you re thinking "I want to stay here". The weather was pleasant the day I went, so a lot of people were riding the bicycles while others just relaxed on the grass under the sun by the pond. Some people read while others chatted or dosed off. There was a cafe where you could get some food or drinks (beer, sodas etc...) and there is a toilet as well. You could play music at the park and do several things. I think it is a perfect place for a picnic, you could easily spend 4 hours there.
Beautiful . Beautiful and peaceful place to stroll around when the sun is out. The amount of bikes is slightly annoying but then again, that's everywhere in Amsterdam. Would come back.

TRANQUIL, clean and safe. Always make time to walk in this park, just lie around, take in the beauty of a well kept park, seeing million of people who, like me, just want to load their batteries by enjoy the site of nature. How they keep it so beautiful for us all to enjoy, I do not know but every time I am stunned at the calm and the beauty.

Beautiful . This park was absolutely beautiful and extremely well maintained.When we came here last year we hired out bikes and cycled around this year the bike rental places were very busy each time we visited so we settled for walking around and having a picnic.

Beautiful, a bit crowded. Visited Vondelpark with our dog and had a lovely time. It was a very very hot and sunny day so understandably there were a lot of people out but it was very crowded. Seemed beautiful like a Dutch Central Park really but would have been nice to see with less people about as you are always worrying about being run over by a bike! Did witness a dog fight as so many dogs off lead in one place but other than that they all seemed well behaved and friendly.

Peaceful Oasis. My friends and I cycled through this park on a sunny morning. Theres a great atmosphere here, with locals exercising and gorgeous cafes located within the park. I would recommend anyone visiting to grab some bikes on take a tour around this fantastic park
Great park to take the kids. Lots of different activities to keep kids distracted for hours. In good weather take swimsuit to take advantage of the paddling pool.

The central park of Amsterdam!. Vondelpark is located in a culturallly rich neighborhood. Is provides the perfect background for a morning jog or afternoon picnic. You can also rent bikes and ride around the park. Every morning there are several fitness classes which are free of charge. There is also several nice restaurants around the park.
Nice place to have a walk and enjoy nature. Nice park in the centre of Amsterdam. Have a walk and enjoy the nature, have a picknick on the grass. Or even smoke some :-)

A break from city life. Voldenlpark is not just a regular park in Amsterdam. this park changes it's atmosphere every hour. in the morning you got the birds singing and the light wind in the trees. at noon you have lots of people on lunch break, taking a nap on the grassland at evening-music from everywhere, people laughing and sometime - live shows. don't miss a walk in that park!

Realy worth to rest in THIS park. In my opinion it is a granpa of New York Central Park :)Really big, with plenty of places to just lay on the grass and rest. IT is a good oportunity to spend there even a hole day - between days of Amsterdam sightseeing. You can see how people of Ams spend their free timeIn park there are also 2 or 3 caffeteria, but you can't eat smthg big.Also there are kinder place (with water and so on)

A lovely relaxing centre in the heart of the city. Our second visit - brief walk through before hunting a venue for tea. The place is just so relaxing despite being busy with tourists and residents - walk, sit, admire, walk, relax

Beautiful park stunning ! . Unfortunately due to the weather I didn't get the fully experience Vondelparks beauty I got to briefly walk-through and have a quick look around and it is beautiful would be lovely to go really hot summers day sit and have a picnic take pictures and just absorb the sites and relax I would definitely come back to experience that again and rent a bike!

A bit of nature in the midst of Amsterdam. The is a vibrant and relaxed park with many cyclists, runners and walkers using it to do their exercise or as a more picturesque way to work. I certainly used it as my preferred way to the course I was attending there. In the afternoon/evening groups gather and do their thing, some were dancing, others playing games....all just socialising and generally having a good time. There were also groups al various times practicing Yoga and Tai Chi. A beautiful space where humans and nature are in harmony.

Whenever I am in Amsterdam, this is the place I go to relax and to enjoy nature.. This park is very special because it is like an oasis in the center of one of the most, business-like, modern, busy city in Europe and although not the biggest in the world, it is one of the few, that offer green, relaxing spaces like this, that will please anyone, no matter the background of the visitor! Here, not only foreigners but the locals enjoy the beautiful gardens, nature and eachother's company.

A must visit park in Amsterdam. Unwind in this park with your love one or friends. It is also ok to be alone. The more the merrier they said. In this park you are allowed to have barbecues and drinks. Jogging, biking, roller skating, or any other sport activities are done in this park. Take your dog leased of course.
Peaceful place. A wonderful place in the heart of Amsterdam. 1.5km long and 300m large allows you to make a nice walk and sit on the grass watching birds and fountains.
Good place for a picnic. If you're visiting the museums this park is just a couple of minutes away. It is a good place to sit down and relax and perhaps have a picnic when it is good weather.

So relaxing. Could easily spend the afternoon here with a picnic just enjoying the lush environment and watching the clouds drift over. Lots of people here on the regular but enough space for everyone. Plenty of room to cycle around if you're on bike as well. Public restrooms available and a cafe in the centre also.
awesome to explore on your own!. such a great park - so beautiful. definitely a special piece of amsterdam to wander around on your own.

English park, Amsterdam style. This is a very large picturesque park with plenty of fountains lake and open spaces, in the summer months it's has plenty of activities to suit most ages and expectations...go visit!
Great park!. Go there with friends and bring some food with you. Great experience you should all have! I had a fantastic time there. Morning or afternoon.
Must visit . Perfect surroundings, ideal for cycling and long walks. Has cafes and other facilities. Beautiful lakes around and swans.

Picnic perfect park. If you're in Amsterdam and the sun is shining, be good to yourself and spend some time in Vondelpark. Better still, take a rug, some nibbles, iced lemonade, even a cheeky bottle of Prosecco and make camp for the afternoon. All just a short walk from the museums if you're looking to combine. Can't think of a more lovely green space in a major European city. We even sat and watched as a Heron casually waded past in the shallows of one of the many picturesque lakes. Highly recommended.

Nice park. It's a nice park but not really anything special as far as parks go. It's located close to the Rijksmuseum though so if you are going there or to the Van Gogh museum you could take a picnic to eat in the park.

The other way to relax in Amsterdam. Visited Amsterdam by car for a few days with the family so stayed a bit further away from the centre. Didn't quite appreciate Vondelpark was behind the hotel so was glad we ambled down a residential side street to check it out.This place is great - wide tree lined walkways where people jogged, cycled or walked. Large open areas, and plenty of space to just sit and watch the world go by - which is exactly what we did for several hours. Highly recommended as a place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the crowded touristy city centre.
Lovely Park. This is a beautiful park to rest or ride your bike. It is large and has lovely lakes and a nice restaurant. Well worth the visit

Gorgeous city park!. We stumbled upon Vondel Park on our first evening in Amsterdam. It was just around the corner from our hotel. I could see why the people of Amsterdam love this green space because there is a lot of open space and a lot of beautiful trees, flowers, lakes, walking trails (and bike trails). Because it was so warm when we went, the park was packed with locals having picnic dinners and cookouts. There were people playing frisbee, and people just catching some evening sunshine (it didn't get dark until around 10pm). We tried the restaurant in the park on our second night. The food looked better than it tasted, but we were in such a beautiful atmosphere it almost didn't matter. I would have liked to have more time to just hang out and take nature photos in the park.

we took a wrong turn and discovered a wonderful park.. what a great day for a wrong turn, we ended up walking the wrong way around the park, after an hour we realized our mistake but it was well worth it, really lovley place to go and enjoy the sunshine i believe there is some bands on and theatre at certain times. a really well kept park. not what i expected at all !!! we will definitely return next time we go to amsterdam.
Just beautiful! . Just beautiful park. It must be seen. That was the 11th times for me in Amsterdam and it the first I've really seen it. Will do it next time

Central Park in Amsterdam. Our hotel was a five minute walk from Vondelpark (Hotel Roemer). Loved the calm and the atmosphere -many young, old and many kinds of families walking, sitting by the pond, barbecuing, feeding ducks and riding bikes. A MUST in Amsterdam. If you get hungry you got the Hard Rock Cafe right across the street.

Beautiful multi-use park. We were here on a Sunday morning/early afternoon and the park was teeming with all kinds of activities. Running, soccer, and of course, bikes everywhere. The Dutch , to me, are very cool and seem to love just being out having fun! Great park in a great city!

Nice park. As a traveler I enjoy walking around the city and not spending all my time visiting landmarks. I spent couple of hours in this park and I really recommend other travelers to make a lunch break in this park (especially if the weather helps).

Beautiful park! . It was raining when we visited but this is still a beautiful park to take a stroll! Beautifully planted trees and water features. Situated about 15 mins walk from rijks museum. If it's sunny, this is a must see attraction. Take a book and a sandwich and just enjoy nature.

Relaxing . Lovely park & very big
Very relaxing place to get away from hustle & bustle of Amsterdam City
Great for picnic & they have BBQ areas where there is a grill you can use - a bit like what they have in public places in Australia

Peaceful getaway . A get away from all the noise from the inner city lifestyle. Vondelpark has much to offer including waterfalls, wildlife, somewhere to sit and get a bite to eat or something to drink, somewhere to go on a bike ride/ or a run. Just a place to relax.
A large park that suites all tastes. This park is suitable for both enjoying family activities,biking,music,festivals and relaxing. It is a huge park with beautiful vegetation.

Nice. Was a nice park but compared to some other parks. It isn't very clean. Obviously lots of traffic coming through the park but there probably needs to be a bit more cleaning staff etc. was nice though walking through, just beware of the bikes. Walk on the walking paths otherwise you may get hit.
Peaceful. Lovely park with a lot of greens. Nice for relaxing, walking, cycling and picnic. Very peaceful atmosphere
Oasis in the city. You can take a walk or bike through the park or run through it. You will be suprised by how big this park is in this compact city.

Lovely park to walk to cycle through, for all ages. We cycled and walked through the park to and from our hotel for 6 nights and we loved it. It is pretty big and you can tell that everyone cares about the park, as it is kept clean, tidy and looked after. Check out the open air theatre, there is a programme online, we managed to catch a film. There are portaloos (eww) and also toilets in the main cafe and the theatre area. Also, lots of pokestops! Definitely don't miss this park on your trip

Great park in the center of Amsterdam . What a lovely park to just go and people watch, relax and enjoy the setting. I spent hours just walking around and sit by the pond and forget about the world :) Highly recommend!!

Just biked through but would love to spend more time!. We just rode through with Joy Ride Tours, but got a great dose of history and loved the setting. We were very time limited and couldn't go back, but if you have more time than we did take a half day and picnic in Vondelpark! It is an incredibly scenic area in Amsterdam, rich with a cultural activity that values equality and access to open space for every day citizens. You can rent boats and row the lake - just a gorgeous setting.
lovely park. peaceful, serene and yet buzzing with dutch life. a lovely place to sit and relax, or even take a bike ride through.
Lovely . Absolutely lovely place to talk a walk. We were lucky that it was sunny and weather was fantastic. Nice place to relax after a long day of touring Amsterdam.
amazing park. a very large and green park where you can sit and relax or ride a bike in a very organized biking trails. also have some lakes with ducks. very peaceful and romantic.

Great Park. This was a great place for riding bikes and stopping to let the grandson play in different areas. You'll see folks smoking weed, but they're quiet and mellow. You'll see young couples kissing, people enjoying a picnic and the sun. This was my first time at the park and riding around on a bike was the way to go and get around.
