City oasis. Made a pleasant break from the very busy cars & trams, however it was a beautiful warm day and still busy with cyclists everywhere. The Cafe Vondelpark3 was good value and very comfortable

Happy people everywhere . A wonderful, large, clean park, filled with Amsterdamers, tourists, dogs... On the weekend, there are music performances in the small band shells. Cafes/restaurants are available, with outdoor terraces. We rented bikes and rode through, stopping by a lake to rest and admire the mansions just on the edge of the park. A diplomatic neighborhood is just bordering the park (where those mansions are), and made for a nice, low-traffic additional bike ride.

Peaceful. We stayed in a hotel only five minutes walk from Vondelpark. It was lovely and a serene little sanctuary from the city. Everyone seemed to be there to relax and be happy. Some rubbish near the pond but that's people for you, didn't let it take away from the beauty of the park itself.

Lovely Park with lots to see. We throughly enjoyed walking through this park, seeing the grey herons, and watching people enjoying the park. Nice to get away from the traffic, although bikes are still everywhere. It was within walking distance of our hotel, so walked around it for another day,as we enjoyed the first time so much.

Beautiful park in Amsterdam. This is a famous park very close (walking distance) to the center of Amsterdam. It's great to sit and look around. The park could be a little more cleaner but I'm sure is difficult to keep up with it. Be careful with the bikes, there are lots and don't stop for "walkers".

Chill out zone . Good place to chill out with nature at its best... Not too crowded which makes it perfect it's free and away from the center of the city perfect for a good evening stroll .. Have visited vondelpark everyday of my stay in Amsterdam .... Just so nice to be sitting there doing nothing ...
Beautiful . Fantastic park to bike around and relax in. One of our favorite things to do here for the whole family!
Great Park for biking, walking or having lunch.. Easy access. Beautiful, relaxing, nice good food, too. Great place to bike. Summer concert series, too
Girly holiday . Beautiful well maintained park, very clean would recommend a visit, beware of the bikes though as the road and paths seemed full of cyclists. Beautiful park

Beautiful spacious park . Massive park which is easy to get to. Contained lots of different statues & landmarks, along with winding paths across multiple lakes & streams.
For the best experience rent a bike and cycle from the west to the east along the wide, easy going pathways. On the other side of the park is the Van Gogh and Rijks museums.

Beautiful place for a summer walk. We often visit Amsterdam and stay close to the Vondelpark. We have stayed both Summer and Winter time and it is always beautiful. There are restaurants where you can sit, have a drink and just watch the day go by. It's lovely.
Beautiful and relaxing. Vondelpark is a great place for a walk or a bike ride with friends or by yourself. It's very relaxing and there's a lot of landscape to admire.
Place to relax. This large park situated next to many museums offers time to rest near many nice ponds and fountains.

nice park to relax. this is a nice park in the busy centre of Amsterdam where you can unwind after a tiring walk around the city. there are lovely cafe's around and bike's can be hired to roam around the park. there are toilets which are free (donations appreciated, it says). we went there on a warm sunny day so it looked beautiful, but i wonder if it would be nice on a cold day, though

The Vondelpark is THE park to go to in Amsterdam, it is really big and beautiful. This park has it all. It is the lungs of the city. Shrubs, trees, benches, bike and pedestrian lanes run playfully through it. Lots of water and surrounding lawns. Strolling, people watching, picknicking, making music, ... this park offers something to everyone. It is the most beautiful and big park of Amsterdam. You cannot go to Amsterdam and NOT have gone and enjoyed this wonderful park. There is an open air theatre in the Vondelpark that has performing artists on certain days. You have to google that:-)

Good place to practice cycling!. We had rented bikes and wanted somewhere to get used to riding them. The result was a pleasant time spent taking in the green space and riding on the wide, open paths. There seemed to be plenty of amenities, but also a lot of quiet areas for relaxing. Very central location means it is worth a visit for a chance to slow down and relax.

Great park. It is an excellent place where to take your kids. It is full of places for them to play. There are also places for parents to relax with coffee and/or beer. But you must be careful with cyclists. The local cyclists take Vondelpark as a highspeed highway to downtown. They won't brake or stop at any rate.
Pretty. A very picturesque park this is a lovely place to cycle your bike around and just enjoy some chill out time, especially given its close proximity to the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum

Lovely park next to Rijksmuseum. I went because of reviews. It's a nice little park with lots of people enjoying the sunshine. It seems to be popular with locals and tourists. There was music playing and bbq's and picnics everywhere.
Excellent park to relax and enjoy an open space. An beautiful park park to walk around, people watch and enjoy the gardens and trees, in addition to the bird life around the lakes.

Great Park with Fun Playgrounds. We went here today with our son and grandaughter. What a great park! We walked to the far end of the park (based on our grandaughter's recommendation) where they had a huge climbing area with a slide. We played there and had lunch at the adjoining restaurant. The food and staff were very nice.Then we were off to the next playground which had an extensive above ground network of rope paths that kids could walk across. This area was really nice. We ended up at a third area that had a large wading pool for kids. Our granddaughter had a great time and so did we.This is a great place to walk around even if you don't have the company of a child.

Gorgeous . We walked around binder park and has a fabulous lunch. The weather was beautiful. It was relaxed and friendly. There is so much to choose to do. For any age. Playgrounds paddling pools cycling eating and drinking. Lying in plenty of shade or plenty of sun. Wonderful experience
Large space. Big and clean park. Great if you wanna see the locals chill or just chill yourself. There are a few small diners but they are expensive as hell, so you better bring your own food.
Very Nice. This is a very nice place to enjoy your time with your friends a nd family. It is in the heart of Amsterdam and easy to reach by public transportation. Don't miss it

Bike ride around the park. The park is a great oasis in a busy city. The collection of fountains, lakes, paddling pool and abundant grass land has something for everybody. On a sunny day, it is just so lovely to soak in the sun and enjoy the occasional ice cream. Cycle around the park is exhilarating and relaxing. The paths are designed for bicycles and you can pretty ride un-interrupted for hours. It was a great day out for the whole family or group of friends, even just someone who's looking for a shaded bench to catch up on book.

Gorgeous walk or cycle on a sunny day. Vondelpark is huge and has a lot to offer. You can walk or cycle through...you can hire cycles from all over including the hotel Vossius Vondelpark just by the side of the main entrance to the park (Leidseplein side)

Beautiful setting outside of main tourist traps. A must visit for some calm. Although not the most tranquil place due to so many bikes and people, the park offers differing green views and space to stretch your legs and rest. Downside are the cafes - rather expensive and the treetop cafe was particularly disorganised!

Awesome. We were on a citytrip and we loved this parc!It's big, nice, living.... So charming and peaceful!!We loved our lunch at the Vondelpark/3 restaurant too!You just don't have to be afraid of bycicles.... But you're in the Netherlands remember ;-)

Great place to chill out and enjoy the outdoors. This is a lovely place to enjoy lunch drinks and people watch. Busy but people are enjoying the lovely gardens and various seating areas. Plenty of places to sit quietly.
A very nice public park - a good break from the canals and houses.. This park fits in well with the Amsterdam character - understated and cozy. Easy to get to and safe feeling.
Great on a sunny day. A great escape from the city and it's only about 10 minutes out on the tram. Great place to have a beer in the sun.
Brilliant park. Always something going on and expect a good walk round.there are places to drink and eat. Great for children
Peacefull park. Went to a festival (Loveland). Nice setting, clean and surrounded by water. Easy to reach, by bike or by car.

Huge Park - Probably the Biggest in Amsterdam. The park is really huge with a Big Status of Vondel surrounded by some beautiful flowers. The park also has a open Concert Stage. The Par has two big areas for childrens (Play Area)
Lots going on!. This is a very busy park with tourist groups to locals relaxing to teams working out together. It is definitely worth a walk through, if not a picnic.
Cozy. Had lunch here. Was nice, cozy and sunny. Watched all the people cycling through it. Romantic and large park. There was not a lot of benches.

Enjoy a Break Here. Vondelpark is a huge family oriented park that supports a variety of activities from the typical bike ride to casual relaxation in a beautiful, relaxing setting. There is also a large beer garden with large shaded patios with chairs and tables. You will feel like a local because they are here enjoying their free time with their friends and families too.

Strange. Yes it is a strange park, Besides the usual suspects that it makes it very attractive line nice ponds, beautiful bridges and landscapes, and all the usual suspects in a great park you can see also out of the ordinary things, like a huge group of naked cyclists.It is a strange but nice place (This was seen during my previous visit here in 2015).

Crowd Scene. After being blown away by the English Garden in Munich and Tiergarten in Berlin, we had high hopes.Maybe it was the time of day (late afternoon), but every inch of grass had a butt on it (and haze over it), and you couldn't cross a sidewalk with the Dutch reenactment of the Tour de France underway.I don't begrudge the locals for enjoying their park, but hardly recommended for a walk with the family.
Most beautiful park i've ever been to. Completely gorgeous and interesting with little bridges to be found. Busy but that added to the character and friendliness: everyone was having such a nice time

Great green oasis.... This park is a great place to walk or bicycle. It reminds us a bit of Central Park, N.Y. It is very accessible from all sides and is a nice spot to relax away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Amsterdam.

Lovely Park. We took in this park as part of our cycling adventure. So glad we found it. It's an oasis of calm and greenery from the hustle and bustle of the city. It's easy to reach by bike or by tram in the Museum district. It's teeming with cafes, people, greenery, grass, lakes and even a small outdoor concert where bands were performing. We enjoyed drinks and apple pie in one of the cafe's and locked our bikes up. A really lovely place. Well worth a visit even if just for an hour
Cycled through. Great on a sunny day and for people watching. Cafe, area where bands play. Picnic and relax. Very atmospheric and chilled. Near Museum quarter.

A Great Place. While the park attracts plenty of people on a sunny day, this park really is for everyone. It has a very chill atmosphere and is good for whatever you're interests are. It's a must for relaxing in Amsterdam.
Beautiful park. Great place to people watch. Was easy to access from our hotel. Lots of outdoor activities. Bike riding, running or just to stroll.

Lovely inner city sanctuary. As far as city parks go, this is lovely. An idyllic spot with lots of space. Nice places to eat and drink and lovely for a stroll away from the hustle and bustle. Well worth a visit.
Nice place :). If you want to spend a different afternoon in Amsterdam you can rent a bike and enjoy this beautiful park :)

Nice place. This is a nice quiet place. The air here is so clean so it is a oasis of peace and relaxation in the middle of the city. Take a ride by bike here to see how the Dutch people spend their spare time!

Sunday afternoon and the Dutch are at play.. A huge park, a beautiful afternoon in August, and it was very, very busy. Bikes everywhere, parked and in motion. Just so nice to see so many people relaxing, picnicking, playing games, having bbq's or having parties. There are several places to eat and drink and watch the world go by. There is a an open air music venue with seating, bars etc and a very good band were playing Afro Cuban rhythms. Really good to see all litter being picked up and disposed of, got the feeling, and rightly so, that people were proud of this place and treated it with respect.

If you need to relax in Amsterdam... :-). A very large park, with great views and places to sit and enjoy your coffee or ice-cream. It offers bicycles for rent, so you can enjoy a ride in the park. If weather is good - don't miss this park !

Bike ride through the Vondelpark. My friends and I decided to rent some bikes for the day and peddle down to this park from the city centre - and it sure was a great day! We went and grabbed some lunch things at the Albert Heijn down the road and ventured to this park, cycled around a bit, and ate some lunch. Come here for a relaxing day away from the city - highly recommended!

Great cafe. Most visitors to Amsterdam never this of this park, which can be reached easily by tram.The park and its many flowers, plants, wild life, and cafes are great.Sit and Have coffee and cake or light meal at one of the cafe / Resturant in this park and watch the world go past.Great for family or friends.Cheers Trevor

Gotta visit and gotta catch. Couple of less mentioned facts for any Pokemon go players, the park has two magic triangles that are often charged and you're able to catch plenty of water Pokemon. As a park I found toilet facilities were in rather poor condition, however the space and cleanliness of the whole place easily makes up for it, if you looking to spend a chilled out afternoon catching Pokemon and relaxing, place for you.

Beautiful inner city park with interesting history. Beautiful inner city park with interesting history. Full of tourists and locals alike having a sit down and avoiding the ubiquitous cafes.Full of people staring at their phones and walking into ponds like the living dead playing pokemon go

Great park. I visited the park during Holland Festival in June 2016. Amazing !! It was packed with activities and loved the live music. The scenery is fab in the park. If you are a keen runner , remember to visit the park!

Bike ride. Lovely little day visit, we hired bikes from a shop 2 minutes round the corner and rode round the park for an hour or so - very calm atmosphere with people having there own bbqs etc, sitting by the lakes and fountains and cycling down the tree avenues was very romantic.

Take a walk. A lovely park - the water, trees and greenery are superb. What a great refreshment after museum viewing. There is an art gallery in the park which was closed when we walked there at 8 pm. Lots of people around at that time so tourists can feel safe walking in the evening. Many photo worthy sights.

great to just chill and enjoy watching the people do dam. Lots of grassy areas you can just sit and chill while enjoying some of Amsterdam treats while watching the rest of the city walk by. Recommended for everyone but be aware that you may come across some interesting and weird people on all sorts of goodies ;-)
Perfect place for a picnic. Wonderful park for enjoying a spliff and having a picnic. Would highly recommend a stroll to all visiting amsterdam
beautiful. a beautiful and relaxed escape from the city for anyone. walking, riding or chilling with friends or solo, this is the perfect place.
Excellent Place for kids n family. We enjoyed a lot here and our kids enjoyed a lot. This place was pretty close to our Apartment and we visited here frequently in the days of our stay.

Great park. This beautiful park is a must see in Amsterdam. We walked a few laps of this park most days. No cars go through the park, so it's great for walking, running or riding a bike. Lots of places to stop and sit in the park on the grass. The lap around the outside of the park is around 4kms and there are many little paths to go off on the sides.
Pretty park, not overrun with Tourists. This beautiful park close to the city center is a great place for a relaxing break while visiting Amsterdam.

Fantastic. Do yourself a favour and walk or hire a bike as we did it's amazing in heart of Amsterdam ... Lovely gardens and also the different housing surrounding these gardens. Bird life and ponds everywhere very picturesque.

Large attractive park, just outside the centre. We were staying in an hotel right on the Park, so I took the opportunity to take a walk - mainly to work up the thirst for a beer.The park is fairly dense in places, packed with cyclists and joggers - more a flat Richmond than Regents Park. At the time I visited, it was alive with young people sitting around having a good time, smoking cannabis. Not a good idea to breath too deeply!Worth a visit if you feel in need of some exercise on your Amsterdam trip.
Stunning. Returning for all seasons again to truly appreciate its magnificence. Care to not collide with a jogger or psycho-list

A Great, Beautiful Park!. This park is great. I sat on a bench for 2 hours reading a book, watching the water across the path (w/ a water spout in it), people and dogs walking by, folks on bikes. It was very peaceful. The rose garden is nice, and the several pools with fountains in them are cool. There's one shallow pool with stone pads little kids were playing on - cute for kids. Definitely worth a visit - a very nice park.

Beautiful park in convenient location . We were in the museum square and the park was very close and has easy access. It's a very large park with paved bicycle paths and gravel walkways. There are large grassy areas and water features and it was packed when we were there. We did not walk through the entire park area, but we did not see public facilities or refreshments available, which would have been very nice. The park is dog friendly and great to relax, or take a jog.

Relaxing and nice.. The best tip I have here is about the toilet.The public free toilets here are horrible. You can find a paid toilet in the restarant in the heart of the park.Besides that its a great place to walk and ride a bike. Beautiful and calm.

Beautiful. I cycled to this park in the summer with a few of my friends. We had a great time here. Although it's a bit out of the city centre, it's worth the journey. We found a nice spot next to a few trees. There was a great summer atmosphere in the park.

Grab a bike and cruise in the sunshine. A great place to cruise around on your hired bike, taking in the sights, stopping at a cafe and wondering how come all Dutch people are so friendly?! A must in Amsterdam.

Beautiful park!. It's a huge park in the middle of Amsterdam! It's not too far from all of the museums. I saw a lot of other people picnicking which looked like a lot of fun. The park is massive, so you could spend a lot of time there. We just passed through briefly. It would be ideal to go there on a sunny day. I also saw a lot of people running there.

Ok. If you jogg or exercise alot, or just walk around or bike or chase Pokemons or just like to smoke ..... then it's a nice place..We just walked through the park from.hour hotel.I guess that if there are concerts or other gatherings it might be quite nice.On a good weather it could be a good place to have a picnic (if you find a nice spot).

Pleasant Walk. I went through Vondel Park on a sunday morning and was delighted by a flautist who gave me a tune when I asked her. I also stopped to watch three folk playing a game that I have never seen before but which highly intrigued me. It was very relaxing.

Great Chill Out Place. We only walked round a bit of this park, but then sat and enjoyed watching the world go by which was very entertaining - hundreds of cyclists, dog walkers and Pokemon searchers.Lots of space in a pretty busy city.
Beautiful park. Gorgeous city park. Really loved the atmosphere. Somewhere you could happily sit and people watch for hours.
Nice park. I was staying nearby and decided to take a walk in park. It's like a mini Central Park and was cool to see a part of the locals' daily lives.
Relaxing . We had a picnic on a break from the museums and loved it - surrounded by family's playing sports and kids having "relaxing" with friends. Absolutely lovely!
Beautiful . Great park that seems to go on forever. All sorts goin on from roller blading to portrait paintings. Will be returning for sure

A nice escape from the world yet close to everything. Much nicer than Museumplein. This is a great place to escape to while doing the museums. There are lots of trees, bicycle paths, and a wide variety of places to relax and watch the world go by
Green space. That's nice for cycling, but sometimes I come here with friends for walking, picnic and enjoing greens. Recommend

Fab day out. Awesome day out. Live music in the sunshine. Would recommend using public transport to get here. Not too much of a walk from Museums. Teenagers were happy in park too as they could go explore on own

Oasis in the city. Everything a park should be. Relaxing, quiet, beautiful. Lots of water features, perfect trails for strolling. Grassy areas for subathing. Many little cozy out of the way places to hide from the city. A lovely little restaurant at one end. Spend a few hours here in between sightseeing. Even in the rain, it's a great place to chill with a beer or a toke, and listen to the birds chirping.
Beautiful park even in the rain . Well worth a visit. Lovely park. Lots going on. Playground for kids. Lots of joggers and cyclists. Beautiful neighbourhood. Felt very safe.

Wet day wash out!. The Vondelpark is beautiful, but the day we got there it had been raining for hours. It was damp underfoot and visibility wasn't great. Just wish I could go back on a hot, sunny day!
Put it on the Itinerary. Great green space to walk, jog, cycle, lie down on the grass with the locals! In the summer it is packed and full of atmosphere
Amazing park. This was close to our hotel and we walked through most days. Beautiful and with free concerts! Keep an eye out for bicycles though!
Miss. 100% recommend Vondelpark to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Escape the tourists and busy streets and hire bikes to cycle round this beautiful green park!

Clean, spacious and rich. Enjoy great walks in the park, sit down with your friends for a while, take a nap, or even grill something in this park. Green everywhere and very calm. Suitable for resting a while after walking a lot during the day.
Walking. Nice grounds with a couple of places to eat and drink . Lots of people use it so its not a peacefull place .
Wonderful. Lovely landscapes and restaurants. The whole family loved Vondelpark. Relaxing. beautiful landscapes and lovely restaurants where you can sit outside.
Lovely park. Passed through here several times from our tram stop to get to Leidsplein or Museumplein. Its chilled out and a lovely place for a walk.

City park that never sleeps!. Whatever you age and interests this city park should not be missed. If passive smoking if amsterdams special tobacco is your thing then breathe deeply in this special air! If you like to jog, walk, skate of simply sit and rest then this park is great. Watch out for tourist bikes and laugh at ten in the wrong gear! I love this park and pass through it daily!
Nice relaxing stroll (except for the bikes). Watch out for the bikes (as you need to do everywhere in Amsterdam) But the park is very pretty and a nice stroll while in Amsterdam!

Go for a stroll. We stayed in the museam quarter of Amsterdam and we made the park our route into town.It was great to see so many locals just chilling out and relaxing, typically dutch.Also check out the cafe, simple food and good beer.

The place to people watch!. Grab some food/drink for a picnic.Take a blanket/towel along and enjoy watching people pass by. There is a lot of space to set up and hangout. Just bring some activities (book, ball or notebook)
Good place to relax during a day of sightseeing. Huge park, pretty lake. Kind of dirty. There were people smoking and people juggling and people barbecuing. Nice to see.

Time for a nap. We were here on our first day after arriving from Canada. Jet lag had caught up with me so headed here and had a nap on one of the lawns. Well refreshed walked around d and enjoyed some of the live music. A bit of Central park right in Amsterdam.

Lovely park in the middle of the city. I was here on a cold and windy day and wish I could have spent more time wandering around. It's a delightful park but when it started hailing (!)...I decided to head back to my hotel room!

Chilling . Cool Park with lots of areas to chill and people watch. Seems very safe even at night. Sometimes there is a dj playing at the park cafe. It like a condensed version of New York's Central Park.

Fantastic Park, Just a Short Walk from the City Centre. Beautiful park, just a short walk from the City Centre. Great for taking a breather from the bustle of the more touristy City spots. Buy a picnic (and perhaps a couple of beers, as we did) from one of the nearby convenience stores and then go exploring! Even when it's very busy, you're sure to find a nice spot to sit and chill. Good for bird-watching near the ponds (lots of water fowl, herons and terns!) They also put on music and arts festivals - we visited on a sunny Sunday afternoon and there were bands and singers performing on a small amphitheatre near the centre of the park.
Huge park. So nice to see when its sunny and to ride because is very large. Cool to take a coffee in front of the lake

Hire bikes and visit the Vondelpark! . As tourists visiting Amsterdam for 3 days, the Vondelpark was definitely a highlight. We hired bikes from A-Bike (just one street away) and rode around. It was very busy but lovely in the sun. Tip - bring a blanket, visit Renzo's Delhi to pick up some Italian pasta salads and head to the park for an afternoon.

So pretty! . Was walking back from from The Rijksmuseum to the tram and passed this park by chance. It was extremely beautiful! I was there in the middle of autumn, and got some AMAZING shots on my camera of different hues of orange and red trees. Very tranquil, I could have sat there for hours, reading or even just watching passers by.
Nice Park. Awesome park to go biking in. Bring a lunch, some wine, some marijuana and some mushrooms. Youve got yourself a good long day of happy vibes ahead of you!
Beautiful park to take a stroll or have lunch. A beautiful park for a stroll or a sit down lunch. Worth a visit. Definitely a place to visit on a beautiful sunny day.

A nice park. Good people watching.. It is a lovely park in a bustling city. It would be nice for a picnic.
I wouldn't chose it over going somewhere or experiencing something else though.

Green iland in the heart of Amsterdam. Great for rest, biking,running or just picnic on the grass.
Every time we had an opportunity, we just went through the park and had some rest on one of the benches.

Visiting in the vondelpark. We were in August. Exelent weather, exelent nature. The trees, the variety of birds, lakes, all green and lovely. A lot of bysicles with fathers or mothers with there children byking in the park. People are goging, or walking for fun. Lovely caffe to have some coffee and cakes. Wonderful entertainment for sunday morning.

Great for biking with kids. Amsterdam is definitely overwhelming when thinking about biking with kids - Vondelpark is a great and safe option. There are also several really cool play structures in the park to take a pit stop at. Definitle bring a picnic lunch or a snack and spend a few hours here.

Lovely park . Such a lovely park. We visited on a sunny day, everyone was out and plenty of hot dog and ice cream vans. The park is located in a great area as its surrounded by many attractions. If youre in Amsterdam and the sun is shining I definitely recommend going for a stroll or a sun bathe
Was nice park. Nice park. You can stay and relax. And you can rent abike and take atour in vondel Park and there are cofe shop and car to buy sandwiches and water

Crazy place to be . Vondelpark was just next to my hostel stayok so it was like a everyday chilling spot for me its huge and worth a walk you can also buy stuff from market and enjoy your trip to space within the park 😂 a must recommend place
Gorgeous city park. Cycled around the park oh a hired cycle at the weekend. Very relaxing and plenty to see. Worth a visit. A nice way to escape the crowds of the city centre.

Unwind. The Vondelpark is a place to relax, have a pick nick or bbq, watch people, see a free concert/dance performance. There is art to be seen, a rosegarden, storks, ponds, playgrounds, even a small swimming pool for children. Juist take a scroll, sometimes through a weed cloud and see what happens. Or juist sit down in one of the restaurants, some self service, 2 with playgrounds, or take you children to the "kinderkookcafe" weer they can make their own food. Free toilets can be found in the green booths. Please mind the bikes. Can be crowded on sunny days.
What a hidden gem. Beautiful with so many hidden treasures. Very relaxed and much bigger than I anticipated. Water features, playparks etc.

peace in a tranquil location away from the hubbub. its a little way out from the center, but if you are visiting the museums drop in here for a nice walk, in beautiful surroundings, place to sit and let the world pass you by and other places to grab a drink or something to eat.

Nice on a sunmy day. Sat and had a picnic for lunch, full of people smoking pot, cyclists and music which is what you expect in Amsterdam. A lot bigger than you think, also I would definitely recommend renting a bicycle to travel round the park on.
Nice. Lovely to walk around bit the weather wasn't the best... on a nice day would be fab for a nice relaxing picnic

Escape the city. The park itself is deceivingly large with a relaxed atmosphere. We arrived to groups everywhere with BBQs, Beer and a few of Amsterdams well known brownies and smokes. If it is to relax, run, sleep, walk off the food the park is worth a visit.

Beautiful, large park for picnics, bicycling, playground & wading pool for children. It was the perfect place to hang out and not be overcome by our jet lag. The pride celebrations were in full swing the week we were there, so there were lots of people. We rented bikes from nearby Mac Bikes and rode all around the park. It was nice to not have to deal with traffic or stoplights. We rented one bike with a large basket in front for my 3-year old nephew to sit in. It had a seat with a buckle. It is a beautiful park with fountains, expansive lawns to spread a blanket on, a 1 ft. deep pool for children to splash about in, and a little playground. Fun for all ages!

Lovely Green Space in the Middle of Amsterdam. Vondelpark is a very large and active landscaped city park just outside of the central area and very close to the museum district and high-end shopping. The park features walking/jogging paths as well as bike paths. There are lovely ponds to feed the ducks and ample benches for seating. There are a couple of cafes at the entrance near the museum district. Many people bring a blanket and just have picnic. This is a great spot to get away from the crazy of central Amsterdam and just soak in the relaxed Dutch lifestyle.

Great to relax, for sports or just to forget about the noise in Amsterdam. Had a nice Sunday morning walk in the Vondelpark this morning, trying to locate the Joost v/d Vondel statue. Plenty to look or not to look at, people walking dogs, people exercising, birds just being themselves, people travelling quickly from one part of town to another part of town (it is a sort of bicycle highway). All in all a great place to hang out and enjoy the weather, or to just not have the trams and other noise in Amsterdam for a minute.

have a pause to Amsterdam life. vondelpark is great to stop by - even worth to walk all the way from the city to the park and just enjoy watching kids, people, relax local life of Amsterdam, it is big and large grass to lie on, you will also enjoy the cafe overlooking the park at the entrance, Filmmuseum.. it is hard to explain the feeling once you are there you will see it yourself. Vondelpark is art, go there and enjoy life in Amsterdam naturally.

great to relax. We cycled around vondelpark and had our lunch at the cafe there. There are burger vans scattered about the park and you can get wifi in the park which my 17 yr old daughter was happy about. It was very busy
Perfect for a stroll or run. Nice open space to stretch your legs after the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam city. Sculptures dotted around, places to rest.

Amsterdam's version of Paris' Buttes Chaumont..!!. Stayed across the street in Overtoom and visited the park a couple of times.Exceptionally spacious and beautiful, very picturesque...Must for romantic couple..!Did a lot of biking in Amsterdam but surprisingly nothing matched the vibes you get biking in this park..!!

Funny bicycle ride. This park is close to city center only open to pedestrians and bicycles. Sunny days are very pleasant to have a couple of ride or walking with fresh air in a silent and green environment.

A great escape of the busy city. A good way to make use of a sunny day. It is near the museums district so it can be nice to get some fresh air after a few hours inside the buildings. There is still light at 20:00 o'clock in the summer :)
Lovely family park. Great large family park, spent a few hours here and could have spent longer here. Would recommend it for families and to bring a picnic on nice days!

Great place to Chill and relax. Visit a "cafe" uptown and then tour through Vondell Park with a couple of beers from the store. if you like to sit, relax, read a book and best of all people watch, then this is the park for you. And it's free!!! All day everyday! Take a stroll through here if you are in the city for a few days.

No benches to sit on. The park is nothing out of the ordinary. If it is a sunny day, then you can just sit on the grass and relax. The park could use more benches to sit on, since there are a lot of people visiting it.

Wonderful park - just like how all parks should be!. This is a beautiful park we went to three times during our week long stay in Amsterdam. Twice on foot and once on a bike. It is definitely one to see with plenty of joggers about. There are few stands dotted around selling hot dogs and ice creams which are always appreciated. I would stil say Amstel park is the one to see most if you are on foot as there are so many more lovely secluded sitting areas.

Suitable for all.. Whether you are cycling, out for a stroll, or just looking for a place to relax in the sun, the Vondelpark is a pretty nice place to visit. There are plenty of open spaces and lakes, winding paths to explore, and a childrens adventure playground. We spent a sunny afternoon there with a picnic and a couple of joints, watching the world go by. A real beauty spot in the middle of a busy city.

Early morning run. I have been going to Amsterdam for business for the last two months and i always felt that there were no good places to run because of the bikes and the trams. I couldnt have been more wrong Vondelpark provides a loop of about 4K in a beautiful environment

Beautiful and entertaining!. We visited the parking on saturday in the afternoon, it was full of people relaxing or barbecuing! The atmosphere was really nice and surrounded with a beautiful green. You could walk there for hours or just sit and relax!

Never seen so many bikes. This park is a lovely wide open space and it felt safe to cycle or walk through. However, I don't think I have ever seen that many bikes/joggers in one space in my life before. The locals are 'on a mission' by trying to get places and then the tourists like me and my friend try to blend in but end up zig zagging around trying to remember to cycle on the correct side of path. Very fun and slightly dangerous. Nice spots on benches to catch your breath though too.

No park run but plenty of runners . Went for a run on Saturday morning @ 9.30am with the Dam runners (further details can be found on meetup). Really enjoyed the 8k run and post run coffee with this friendly bunch of runners. The park itself is lovely & well manicured. There are lots of joggers, cyclists & activities going on. I wish I had had the time to go back again.

Daily coffee . I get together with a bunch of friends, all dog owners or at least dog lenders, every midnight for coffee at The Blauwe Theehuis. The Vondelpark is, for lack of a real garden, my yard. It's a friendly place, very welcoming to dogs walking without a leash, bikers, children and tourists. Only problem: way too crowded on sunny days. Clean up, people. Let's not turn this wonderful place into a mess.

Amazing greenery within the city.... Named after an poet, this park at the heart of the city can really be called the lungs of the amsterdam...green pasteurs...small lakes...jogging tracks..a great place to spend your afternoons...
Great place to relax . We spent one morning and one afternoon in this park. Definitely a highlight in amsterdam. Fun for the whole family. Great place to meet friends, have a picnic or just relax!!

Simply Amazing!. We instantly fell in love with Vondelpark! It is a great place to sit back and relax or go cycling or jogging. We loved the lakes and went there to feed the cute birds (ducks in particular). We cycled through the park every morning and evening. We enjoyed every minute spent there. During daytime in the Summer there are a lot of people visiting the park, bith locals and tourists, solo, couples and families. Be sure to visit Vondelpark during your stay in Amsterdam!

Good location and environment. This place is good because it is in Amsterdam, and you can get a break from the roads and buildings. There is room to sit and relax and it's large enough to wander around, but not big enough to get lost.
Relaxing . We went there as a spur of the moment. It is highly recommended as a stop on your way around the city. The park is very clean, and very well maintained.

Relaxing and great views . Decided to spend one afternoon on holiday taking in the surroundings of the park, and wasn't disappointed. My friends and I found it a really good way to take in the atmosphere of Amsterdam and get a feel for the relaxed feel the city has, definitely a place to go and spend an afternoon and would happily visit again
Magic park. One of the most beautiful Parks in the Europe. So nice and relaxing time when you get in. I suggest to everyone one visit with foots or with a bike.

Beautiful Park. We spent the day just sitting around enjoying the weather. The park is absolutely beautiful and very relaxing. There area always dogs playing around the area (which I loved). It was definitely one of my Amsterdam highlights.

World-Class Park. This is one amazing park, stretching along a good chunk of the city, including the museum zone. You could spend half a day exploring it on a bike. If you're in Amsterdam for more than a day, this'd park is a must-see and will provide a wonderful respite from the downtown mobs.

Peace . A peaceful park, with lots going on. It reminded me of central park in new York,
A large park, where you seen people jogging, dog walking, skating, picnicking,I loved the fact that they had designated areas for you to bring your bbq,
There is a duck pond
A beautiful park. I spent a nice morning walking around this busy park and people watching. It's a great place to get away from the city without leaving the city and very beautiful.

Great green oasis in the middle of the city, but...... Went there everyday with my dog.It's a nice well kept park, a bit crowded but you would expect it from Amsterdam!The only downside is that I was never able to leave the dog off the lead as the park is a motorway for bicycles. You must be VERY careful while walking as they speed a lot and they are LOADS!Must admit it was a bit of a shock for us, used to our Scottish parks, so quiet and safe to walk!

Great for weekend outing. This is a huge park, with natural ponds, playground, restaurants. You can see many jogging, skating, playing soccer, biking or reading books and relaxing. There are many photo opportunities. Occasionally musicians perform in the park. This is lot smaller than the Central park in New york, but charming nonetheless.
Don't visit in winter. Visited this place in February - I can imagine this place being amazing in Spring, but in winter it was a bit depressing.
Lovely park. Had a great walk and was amused by all the Pokemon Go players. Watch out for the bikes! Highly recommend it to break up a day of museums or just to have a stroll.

Lovely park. We spent an afternoon in Vondelpark lying in the sun watching the exercise classes and canoeists. It reminded us a bit of Hyde Park in London- nice walks, plenty of greenery and a pleasant atmosphere. Drink/Ice-cream stalls are throughout, as are toilets. A great way to spend a sunny afternoon.
Rainbow Market in the park. A great meeting place for friends and families. Beautiful maintained space with excellent events. Very close to the museum quarter. Easy to reach from the city on bikes.
Beautiul!. Cycled through the park with my daughter on rented bikes. Playgrounds, ponds, a wading pool, tranquil vistas -- so relaxing!
Great Green Space. Get a bike and enjoy a ride round this lovely spot. Lots of photo opportunities and benches to people watch.

great. lovely well kept park. bigger than I expected. take walking shoes!
there is an open air cinema there at the moment.. unfortunately seems to only show films in Dutch
Sunday in a beautiful park!. My son and I rented bikes from MacBike and spent the afternoon exploring and riding in the park. So beautiful and relaxing.
Perfect ambiance. Such a great place to stay on a sunny day, to simply stroll or ride your bike.. it is so relaxing by the water and very clean!

Paddle pools,cafes and playgrounds.. Von del park has it all and is a great escape in the city. Often busy on a hot day, it pays to pick your spot near a lake and chill. Free concerts, climbing frames and paddling pools dot this huge park. Beware the cyclists and stick to the sandy pedestrian paths!
Not very impressed. Was expecting more landscaping and flowers, fine for a walk, but nothing to write home about. A lot of homeless people around.
Relax and unwind . We had a lovely day wandering museums and found vondelpark a great stop off to relax and unwind. Great range of music being played and a friendly atmosphere

Bikes, puppies, families and explorers.. A great open park on the outskirts of the Amsterdam city center. Weekends are lovely when the sun is out with lots of people exercising, walking the dog and cycling.

Beautiful park. My boyfriend and I spent a couple of hours walking around the park and seeing it's beautiful lakes, fountains and flowers. It was absolutely stunning. If you have a few hours to spare whilst in Amsterdam it's hugely worth the visit. We sat by the lake and had a lovely ice cream in the sun too. Overall, absolutely worth the visit.

beautiful. This is a large beautiful park which includes trees, floral plantings, lakes, large green areas and tracks which make it suitable for cycling, running ànd picnicking. A great place to relax and enjoy.
Beautiful. Lovely place to come and relax. Everyone there seemed happy and i felt so comfortable i actually fell asleep on the grass. The famous Amsterdam letters are also located here

Truly Magical. This is perhaps my favorite public park in the world. I've had some truly magical times sitting in this park, picnicking with friends, and just wandering as a component of a long day walking through Amsterdam.It's a wonderful place and rivals any public space in the world.

A must. The park is clean, and has very broad cycle pathways. It is an absolute joy to take hire a bike and enjoy the park. Having a picnic in the summer sun is also great fun. There is a cafe in the park too. And a open air theater where some promising artists may be playing!

Beautiful. Gorgeous Park with the most amazing views. Having just returned from my second visit to Amsterdam, the Vondelpark was definitely one of the best trips into the City. With gorgeous weather, the park is most definitely a perfect day out for both Couples and Families with Cafes and entertainment available throughout the Park.
Cycling in the park. Lovely park to go cycling or chill or so Highly recommended and Free ;)Eat a pancake from one corner in the park and you will spend a lovely afternoon

A beautiful place for riding your bike. Vondel Park is huge, you won't expect it to be that big, in addition you will find all what you need in Amsterdam laying around it, from coffee shops, restaurants, night life, hotels, bike rental etc... It is easily accessible, has 2 major lakes in it, alongside several different restaurants and cafes, and lots and lots of greenery.
Beautiful. Such as peaceful and beautiful park. You can walk around for hours and would still be surprise with its landscape. Lots of great spots to seat and relax.

Park looks tired and poorly maintained. The Vondelpark is supposed to be the pride of Amsterdam, but it looks more like an overgrown, abandoned piece of land with brandnetels growing everywhere. Shameful.

Funky Buch. So I didn't actually go around the park to walk or run, there was a Traveler's gathering being held at the bunker under the bridge which was really cool and I met some awesome people and the park in general is really nice!

Peace. A lovely park to visit and unwind, but beware of crossing through it at evening/night time. The "nasties" lurk in the bushes waiting to rob you and don't care if they have to use a gun or a knife. I speak of personal experience. Please be careful!

Sport, nature and relax. Walking, footing or biking in a beautiful landscape, between water, trees and animals like ducks and squirrels. This is the Vondelpark. And when you go out, you are in Leidseplein, in the heart of the nightlife of Amsterdam.

You will enjoy it at any time of the day. Vondel park is a place for any occasion. We took picnic baskets with us and enjoy some nice afternoon hours with the family. There are beautiful corners, away form the noise of the city, and after visiting a few museums, a break in Vondelpark is the best you can do! It is easy to reach with trams and you can buy food in plenty of shops nearby or in the cafe in the park. You can also rent a bike and discover the park by bike.

Shabby. Had fond memories of an idyllic afternoon spent in the Vondelpark many years ago so was looking forward to revisiting. What a disappointment. Dirty rubbish strewn, noisy, crowded. Not relaxing.

A beautiful spot for a bike ride!. We zipped through Vondelpark as part of an organized bicycle tour. There didn't seem to be any hippies living there anymore, which is probably a good thing! It's a lovely park, and a beautiful spot for a bike ride!

Beautiful park........ A very nice place to take a stroll and admire all the green around you and the lakes. A place to calm down and relax. The only thing wrong is the too many bicycles going around.

city pak for a nice quite day in amsterdam. city pak for a nice quite day in amsterdam. Watch out for the bikes. see the squawking parrots in the tress. a nice park for a rest from all the walking most tourists do in the city.

Lovely park but beware of the bikes!. This was a lovely park to visit with broad walkways and well maintained gardens.We hired bikes to get around (which was lovely) - there is a bike rental shop minutes from the main gate that offer bikes at a very reasonable rate. If you visit the park information desk they also offer you a card to get a small discount!As with everywhere in Amsterdam there are hundreds of cyclists of different levels of ability. I found that the "expectations"/"etiquette" was unclear... I didn't know where I should be walking / cycling or who had right of way at any point so just be aware of this especially if you have small children.

Beautiful garden, well connected. The garden is quite popular with the locals and hence filled with people. There is an iamsterdam sign in the middle of the park. Nice place to pack a picnic and spend an afternoon.
Lovely. Large, green park filled with people enjoying themselves. Perfect for a run, picnic, barbecue (designated spots), a day out with children.

Beautiful . The park was terrific an equivalent to central park for Americans. We loved it and great place to rent bikes and ride around as riding in the street can be a bit overwhelming and feeling dangerous for those unbeknownst to it. I'd recommend avoiding it at late night as there tends to be a large number of drunk and high teenagers messing around but other than that the park is safe and a scenic beauty.

Gorgeous place for a picnic. We took the tram out here and just loved it. A really big park, easy to get lots. Lots to see and do within the park and great if you wanted to find a quiet spot. We took a picnic and enjoyed the scenery. Lovely spot in the middle of a big city.

Not much to see or do. Frankly I wasn't impressed. It is a green space, and it was fun to see the bicycles, but otherwise not much to say. The "big" playground by the milk house was quite small. Our neighborhood playground is larger and more well maintained. Altogether I wouldn't make a special trip to go and see it.

That's not manicured!. Rubbish filled water way on Saturday am noise from music exercise untidy gardens €2.30 small bottle water but wine cheaper not ideal for 11 am If you think that's tranquill you've been to a smokey MJ coffee shopDon't bother
Wonderful. As busy as this park could get, you could always find a peaceful spot and relax. Everyone's just having fun here. Picnics, barbecues, beers ! Essential after a museum stroll just nearby.

Nice place to hang out. Go there morning for a jogging, for brakfast, lunch, playing balls, listening to outdoor music, watching storks and flowers, enjoying the energy, barbecue at night. You can do everything in this vital green lung of Amsterdam. We went there several times during our visit.
walk at the park. vondelpark is a good places to walk and "hang around" with lot of nature and animals [birds] a place to be in summer for picknick and to walk in winter
Beautifull!. Very beautiful and peacefully park! We've rented bikes with our kids and stumbled on this really nice park. It is a great place to relax a bit.

Lovely park. We visited the park on our rental bikes and it was a lovely place to visit after being in the city for a few days. It was very busy and there were bikes everywhere but the cycle around the park was great. We found a small lake and parked the bikes up and lay on the grass. It's not an essential place to visit but if you have a spare few hours and a bike it's a nice place to see.

Average park with mix of locals and tourist hangout. Nothing really impressive when compared to other European parks. A decent place to just relax and watch the locals enjoy their summer afternoon outdoors.

A must visit during ams trip. Rent a bike, go to vondel park and just enjoy the beautiful ride among the greenery, lakes and cafes. A very relaxing and rewarding day...you can easily spend 3 hours here

Oh, those bikes !!!!!. Average big city park, but those *** bikes really take a lot of fun and relaxation out of your leisurely stroll. You can spend a half day here or just zip to the Picasso stature and take a picture. Nothing out of the ordinary, but worth a visit.

Beautiful open space. If you're looking to get away from the city dip into the park which offers lots of space and greenery.Large park offering space for games, family, picnics or just a quiet sit down.

Waste of time . Not much to say about this place. I personally didnt like this park at all. Nothing special about it. People sitting, relaxing, cycling, cooking weed. That's it. Visit only if you have extra time in Amsterdam.

A nice break for busy museum goers. It is hard to believe that this natural beauty sits right in the heart of Amsterdam! Made for leisurely strolls and picnics! Easy access from a number of different entry points in the museum and casino areas. Plan on spending at least an hour strolling the beautiful park.
Beautifull park. Huge and beautifull park, with lakes and ducks included, very good place to chill and picknick. Worth the visit, and really close to several museums and points of interest.
Charming oasis in the center of Amsterdam. We lived next to the Vandelpark and were happy to enjoy walking and riding bikes and admiring great landscape.

Beautiful. A very beautiful park with some great lakes and birds. Was a nice warm day so we just relaxed watching the world go by. It's a nice place to visit providing that it isn't too cold, they do have places to eat and drink which we didn't try but they seemed reasonable in price.

Flower Power!. What a lovely green area this is.There were folk having a picnic or walking the dog or riding their bicycles.There was an open air theatre,rose garden,a play park for kids,a sports field etc.This is an oasis in the city which does not have many such parks.
Nice park. Rent a bike. Go to all Amsterdam and during the day be sure to visit this park. Hidden treasure in the middle of the city. Beautiful. Can picnic there or just enjoy the view and fresh air.

gorgeous oasis. A beautiful oasis only a short walk from the Museumplein. Enjoy it for itself (for a run or a wander), or use it as a corridor between the Museumplein and the Willemspark shops and cafes.
A beautiful city park. This is a wonderful place to jog, bike, walk, picnic or throw a frisbee. There's even a swimming pool for children. Reminds me of parks you'd see in London..

One of my favorite things in the city. We rented bikes and rode through the city. We ended up spending about 3 hours in the park, and would have stayed longer if we had time. Truly a beautiful park. Plan a picnic there if it's not a rainy day.

Tranquillity . Walk, run, wander... however you do it you will find peace within the park. There are both formal and informal spots, open grassy places, kids' play areas and running tracks. 10 min away from the hussle and bussle or a lazy picnic it's a place to go.
Great place to crash on the grass. We had been walking all day and stumbled on this quiet gem on the way to museum. We laid on the grass in the sun, napped and watched the people go by.

Peaceful & beautiful distraction from city life!. One of the entrances to Vondelpark was located at the end of the street I was staying on in Amsterdam. The day we arrived was beautiful and I took the opportunity to explore the park and go for a short run. It was stunning! Although busy, full of runners, dog walkers, cyclists (watch out if you go for a run, I nearly ended up under wheels more than once!), strollers and people just generally enjoying the atmosphere, this scenic open space provides more than enough room for everyone and is very peaceful, even with so many in the vicinity. Try and take some time to visit when in the area if you are able. Even if you stay for 10 minutes, you will definitely feel better for it!

Lovely respite!. I'm very glad I wandered in and kept walking! This park was a nice surprise. You can see its there on the map, but much of it is hidden behind neighborhoods. This park is full of locals gathering, relaxing and riding their bikes. Right in the city! I need to find out where all the parrots came from and how they survive the climate.

Lovely park - it's huge. The perfect spot to enjoy some summer time in Amsterdam. With people lounging on the grass, jogging, cycling, walking, barbequeing, playing with their dogs and just generally having a nice public time. Lovely little waterways and a festival in June.

Nice walk with lots to see. Took a walk as I thought the tulip island exhibition was on, only to find out I was 2 years too late, oops. Was still nice to walk here with the rose garden, pond/lake, area for dogs.

A welcome break from the city streets. If you want to explore the Vondelpark for more than a brief stroll it could be best to get hold of a readily available map. It's within walking distance of the Museum District and is a green retreat from the sometimes crowded streets of Amsterdam. Popular with locals, there are lots of people strolling, walking their dogs and cycling (of course) but there is space for everyone. If it's been raining there are well kept paths and lots of places to stop for a drink or, on fine days, grassy areas for sitting with some picnic seats. If you have children there are play areas and a large playground. Storks nest on the island in the area designated as a nature reserve. If you walk as far as the far end of the park from the Museum District there are some good places to eat on Amstelveenseweg, just turn left as you leave the park gates and you'll see them opposite and all along the road. Finally, if you have walked from the city centre all the way out to the park entrance on Amstelveenseweg and don’t want to walk back, turn left, walk past the restaurants and down to the crossroads (3 -4 minute walk) where you'll find frequent trams to Museumplein, the shopping area and Central Station.

Lovely park but as the dusk sets it gets quite hippy. Great park to go for a run in the morning and to ride a bike around. As the day gets later you'll notice a lot of groups of people smoking coffee and doing other things there too. There are places to eat and chill in this park it is very nice.

Nice place to walk about or lay on a blanket on sunny day.. Our mid week visit was not actually planned but worked out well. Has a nice time viewing the gardens, ponds and walks. Many couples and small groups of people were taking advantage of the day and were having wine, fruit and other foods while laying back on blankets. Wish we had one along with us. We will attempt to visit again before we leave the area.

Strolling through the park!. Though this park is not something on my must do list, on a pretty day, or warm day, it's lovely to walk through, see the fountains, rose garden and all the local Dutch and tourists enjoying the park on blankets, playing music, and eating food. If I had the time I would have planned an outing, just some down time from the hustle and bustle of sightseeing. The park is clean, well manicured and no doggy mess. The visitors are all very polite, no loud music just people getting together and enjoying nature.
Amsterdam 2016. Enormous park with many things to do. Playgrounds, bike trails, picnic areas etc. There is a cafe located near the middle. Nice place to enjoy a sunny day.

Bike around Vondelpark. This was an excellent part of our experience. We hired bikes from Mikes Bikes and rode around the park.It is a a large park so would take a while to walk around, however it's beautiful. There are lakes, fountains, paddling pool and children's areas so it really is appealing to all ages.There is a pub which serves hot and cold beverages and seats a lot of people inside and out.This is an ideal day out for couples, families and solo explorers.

Amazing space. This park is really larger than you might think and has at least five eating/drinking places. Reasonably priced in the couple we frequented! Lots of bikes and at the weekend lots of fitness activities happening. Even has a specific area allocated to BBQ.
Nice place to have a picknick!. Perfect place to go by bike and have a nice picknick with friends or whoever! :-) a lot of pokémons there and good located :)

Beautiful must see park. Sprawling beautiful park, close to the museums. Bring a blanket and enjoy a few hours, plenty of room for everyone. Quiet oasis in the center of the city. Absolutely loved it. Make sure you sit by the lake, really beautiful.

A sanctuary in the heart of Amsterdam. I've been to many parks in my life but Vondelpark always has a special place in my heart . Its a huge park in size , you can really get a good workout by just doing one round. Because the seasons in Holland are quite define. The trees change its colour through every season . If you are there in the winter you can really feel the quiteness enclosing onto you . A good time to just enjoy and contemplate. Also in winter there ain't as many tourist , you can really enjoy the long walks and freshness of the trees. In the Summer its another story . Young and old people are having fun in the park, jogging , biking , playing music or picnicing ... you will hear music or seeing someone doing Tai Qi, Yoga or just taking a nap . Its really a safe park for children as well . Why not find a quite spot , sit down , observe and enjoy .
Nice enough . Although we went on a rainy afternoon it's is a nice park, a nice way to escape the busy roads and just have a quiet walk (less risk of being hit by a cyclist).

very cool . vondelpark is very good parkthis is the park with all facilities we enjoyed to much herethis is a very big park  we view only few part of park .we also purchase many new item from road side in park

Beautiful park, lots of open space, water, places to sit. Use a hire bike to get around. Hire bikes from Bikes in Town for €13.50 each on Spuistraat as you can pedal Amsterdam easily in a day and it gives you a great overview. Vondelpark is a stunning space, even better if you have a bike as you can see all of it quickly and stop off wherever suits. Amsterdam has very few open green spaces and visiting here is a welcome respite. Highly recommended.

Such a beautiful space. We visited Vondelpark last weekend. It is such an open, lovely, green space. Well used, but very clean and very pretty, with lovely waterfalls, and lots of space to chill out, lay down, sit and relax and watch the world go buy. The park was popular with runners and exercise classes, and a fantastic space for children to run around safely. The IAmsterdam letters were in the park on our visit, which was a much quieter place to get a photo than at the other venue. There are places to eat and drink in the park also. Highly recommend a visit if you are near by.

Nice to escape the busy city streets . Nice place to wander around on a summers day to escape the craziness of the city streets which are crowded with tourists. Take a picnic blanket if you want to sit on the grass as there are cigarette butts everywhere. There are also several eating/drinking places.

Great place for a stroll. We were staying just around the corner so it was an ideal place for a stroll. Lots of open space, green grass, trees and lakes. Busy place with walkers, bike riders and lots of people sitting around very casually enjoying the space over a few beers and clearly by the smell, a lot of dope.
Nice Park. Went for a chill out in the park while on a 4 day break. Park is lovely with lakes and a nice cafe. It was very busy on the day we went.

Lovely park!. I use the park several days a week for morning runs, and find it beautiful and quiet as the sun rises and the city wakes up! Green, lots of open spaces, birds and small animals. I always feel safe when going there, even early in the morning. During the day, the park is filled with people walking, having picnics and doing workout. Can be some garbage laying around in the morning, but normally quite clean. Lot's of toilets placed around the park.

Full of trees, ponds and birds, ride your bike lots of space to picnic.. A Huge park with incredible trees and plants. The ponds are beautiful and the park is full of different birds. Bike paths everywhere. A lot of space so a great place for kids to run and for you to enjoy a picnic. Gorgeous on a sunny day.
Change of pace. Excellent downtime from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam while still retaining a lively vibe. This time was the start of EuroPride 2016, do it was even cooler than usual.
Heaven at the heart of the city. Wonderful spot to chill out at evening time esp. Take your book and drink and lay down on grass...Gets busy evening yet very lively.
Amazing park. If you are in Amsterdam you must come to this park on a nice day. Huge park with plenty of places to just lay down and relax away from the busy city center.

Wonderful green lung in a beautiful city. Right in the middle of a great and beautiful city, a respite for the weary traveler having spent a tiring time hoofing through the sights of Amsterdam. A great spot to relax amongst the trees on the lush lawns for a quick lunch especially on a rare sunny day and mingle with the locals.

Gorgeous. We decided to visit here on our last morning, unfortunately we didn't have much time there in the end. We wish we had more time because it's a stunning place with plenty to explore. We also were fortunate as we had lovely weather so was able to have a relax by the lake as we listened to the violinists play.

enjoy day. we love the park so much. we spand 4day in amsterdam and we are going there everyday. we take a picnic at there, take another breakfast at there, and we even spending tea time at there. the park is so huge and so many activities. and it fits for us who doesnt have a plan, just watching a dog and enjoying the sunny day. love this park so much
Sunny day in the park. spent a lazy hour sitting in the park eating ice cream after walking miles around the city. Lovely open green space with fountains
A really green park. A nice park for a sunday walk, close to many museums. Its easy to see that someone is taking care of this park!

Beautiful Park. If you have any extra time in Amsterdam and just want to relax this is the place to be, I see everyone from all ages hanging out there, whether your looking to run, ride bicycles, or walk this is an area where you can do this without having to deal with traffic. If your not into any of that then pack a lunch and bring a blanket as it is great to have a picnic there. Also Picasso has a few sculptures there for you to look at for free

Caleidoscopic outside experience in Amsterdam!. As a local, the Vondelpark is simply THE number 1 park that I map my city around. Similar to landmarks like the Rijksmuseum, the center with its canals, the Central Station, The Artis Zoo, and so many more of those one of a kind things that make up the city in someone's experience, the Vondelpark is one of the core elements of what makes Amsterdam the beautiful city that is and has always been. So, what makes the Vondelpark so special? Critics could arguably say that any park is just a park and not a landmark in itself. Well, there are parks and parks. This park is indeed a landmark by itself just by it's location. One could say it's the Central Park of Amsterdam (though there are many differences of course). The park brings together pretty much all layers of society, all cultural backgrounds and all leisure seekers that walk around in Amsterdam at any given time. Both the park's location as a central hub connecting the south of the center with the actual center (Leidseplein), and the easy going vibe in the park itself make it a continuously attractive place to go to and spend time in. And with sunshine and any decent temperature, you will feast your eyes on the many people that are walking, rollerskating and biking by, or are having a picknick in the green fields available everywhere in the park. You will see ad hoc gatherings of friends or a regular Friday evening kick off drink taking place in the park. The open air theater is also a local sought after favorite. And definitely worth mentioning here is the former Film Museum building, which still hosts an outside bar and terrace that is an absolutely perfect location for a pitstop in any walk, run, or bike ride through the park. All and all, if the weather is good to great, it's a must do when in Amsterdam. A perfect place to meet new people, just bring your food & drinks and mingle. And even with rainy weather, it's very peaceful to just walk around and relax. Additional tips: the bars on the adjacent Overtoom (main street bordering the west side of the park) are very popular places for students and yups. There are several excellent student and regular bars, as well as many restaurants with all kinds of specialties. Furthermore, if you got primed by my Film Museum remark, they moved that museum into a fantastic futuristic building on the other side of the Central Station (on the Amsterdam Noord side) and it's called EYE. As a nice contract to the historical sites, EYE is definitely worth a visit as well. If you like movies and would like to see it in hands down the most beautiful and historic movie theater in Amsterdam, go to the main hall in Tuschinski, located just off the Rembrandt square (Rembrandtplein).

Love it!. If you are visiting Amsterdam for weed and chill, then you definetely should go to this Park instead of Red Light District. Area is so green, there are so many trees, animals and people. Everyone is happy and friendly.
Nice surprise in the middle of amsterdam. The park is beautiful and relaxing!In my opinion, the best way to see the park is on a bicycle cause it is very big and you don't want to miss Hidden places.

huge place!. Vondelpark is absolutely huge so even when it's busy (we went on a very nice, sunny day and so did the rest of Amsterdam!) it doesn't feel cramped as there is so much room to spread out. There are food stands and ice cream vans as well as lakes to sit by. If you want to be a classic tourist and rent bikes in Amsterdam, but are scared of riding on the roads, I recommend renting them and riding around vondelpark (there's a place to rent bikes round the corner from the park). That way you get to see more of the park and have a classic Amsterdam experience without the threat of death from crazy dutch drivers! A very pretty park, was a lovely stop off on our travels!
Chill. Great park to chill and smoke my weed I bought at Boerejongens. Met some nice smokers too. Was a sunny day in beautiful Amsterdam.

Great place. Great place for bike riding and pikniks. We sat on the lawn and had lunch. We rode our bikes and enjoyed the beautiful park. The kids enjoyed the playground there. A must go park . Don' t forget to hire bikes!

Beautiful. We decided to go for a picnic in the park, it is a great place for relaxing. We walked the majority of the way around. A lot of people ride their bikes around. It is very busy on the daytime and by night. It was extremely busy when we went on Saturday due to europride but yet still a beautiful place to go.

Beautiful park with a great atmosphere. We loved our visit to Vondelpark on a beautiful sunny July day. The park was full of people and the atmosphere was great! Someone next to us got caught with a BBQ in a non-BBQ area and the park rangers very kindly put their lit BBQ on the back of their van and moved it to the right area instead of confiscating it or throwing it away. Excellent park with excellent staff! Was really surprised to see gorgeous green parakeets flying around there too.

The summer hub of 'Dam. Vast improvement on my first visit - 1989 - when the underfoot crunching of used syringes wasn't that welcoming; nowadays it's very clean and has a range of attractions from basic walking/lounging to an open-air theatre and Groot Melkhuis cafe that has a playground for kids where parents can take a breather whilst cradling a small beer for 2.5 Euros at a nearby table and keeping an eye on the young ones.
Beautiful park. Very beauty park in the centre of Amsterdam with bike and happy walking. Soft atmosphere in all location

Stunning versatile park offer a lovely walk, views and a picnic space.. When we went they were hosting europride so it was packed with loads to see and vendors for food. There is a viewing tower cafe, a concert platform, cycle/roller blading/ jogging paths.
It was stunning with great views, a padlock bridge for lovers to lock their engraved padlocks to the bridge.
Lots of wildlife to photograph too.

Romantic, Beautiful Walk. Visited this public attraction in central Amsterdam with my wife as we toured the city on foot. Conveniently located near the Van Gogh Museum and several other landmarks, this beautiful park offers a nice respite from the busy streets of Amsterdam. Definitely put it on your sightseeing itinerary.

Green, open space in Amsterdam. We walked through Vondelpark on a sunny 23 July without knowing it was the first day of Europride - what a treat! Mingling with happy, relaxed locals and tourists alike in a beautiful open park, was a respite to the hustle and bustle on the city streets. Lots of people watching - a free event at the theatre with a wedding and great music. Take a walk through this beautiful space!
Large park. Nice large park. Many people jogging, and there's plenty of room. Full with people on King's Day....

A place not to miss. Lots happening around in this huge park. Go there in the morning and you can enjoy some real peaceful moments and a nice walk. Afternoons, if the weather is good, are vibrant. I was lucky to be there when a live concert was going on. Awesome!

Vondelpark. Quite a large park with ponds and roadways with bikes whizzing around. It's walkable from the Rijks Museum - about 10 minutes or so - check your map.There's a cafe or two in the park, and one overlooking the ponds which was a great relaxing spot to rest and enjoy.
Very clean and warm. We had a great time there. Everything was really clean but perhaps there were too many people in there.
Beautiful. This is one of the best parks in Amsterdam, which deserves seeing. Make sure you see it in the spring and summer.

Beautiful park to visit.. I visited the park with a friend while staying in Amsterdam for a few days. It's a beautiful, huge park & a perfect place to relax. We visited while the Euro Pride festival was taking place & the atmosphere at the park was fantastic. I would definately recommend visiting the park especially on a sunny day.

The must see of Amsterdam. Whenever you are in Amsterdam with slighty good weather. Head for the Vondelpark. Take a drink, snack and a ball. You'll be there till sunset. After which you'll cruise onto the Leidseplein with almost no effort at all.
Bike riding around amsterdam. Lovely green space much like Central Park. Cafes & buskers add character to this outdoor living room for adjacent apts.
overcrowded. too many people on mushrooms in this park. i recommend amsterdamse bos over this for a nice walk through nature. all in all this place is aight

A free super cool place to be. My partner and I ride through Vondel on hire bikes, it is a fantastic place anytime, any weather. Ride, run, cycle or just walk and people watch. Wondering through leafy boulevards or relaxing by lakes is a great way to spend a few hours, and it's free!

Incredible place to get lost in or enjoy a peaceful afternoon walk. After savouring some of this city's local delicacies, a stroll around this beautiful central park is wonderful. So much life and culture here, I couldn't stop taking photos.

A small park smack in the middle of Amsterdam.. The park was made in the nineteenth century by the merchant van Eeghen so many people could enjoy some greenery. There are a few interesting sculptures, one of Vondel the seventeenth century poet and name giver of the park, and one late work by Picasso.On sunny days you will find the grassy meadows crowded with people enjoying the sun and having picknicks.In spring tome you might see a stork flying overhead, it sometimes has its nest high up in one of the more secluded areas, owls, woodpeckers and Nile geese and ducks also have their nests in the abundant trees.

Great place to people watch. Definitely worth taking a visit or two to vondel park as the is always so much going on. Great spot to just sit and relax as well to rest your feet from walking/riding the city.
Leasure. A large well used park with lovely surrounding. No traffic to disturb the peace and quiet. The only problem is that of litter. Can be a bit messy.
Beautiful. Lovely to stroll through on a sunny day. There were a TON of bicycle riders and runners throughout the park, and an all around safe feeling.

Beautiful Walk . We experienced beautiful weather in Amsterdam and so we walked through the park. It was so lovely and is a popular activity of the locals. The most daunting part was avoiding getting run over by people riding bicycles. But once you get the hang of staying in the walking lane ... all is good.

A very bucolic and beatiful park. A lot of places to sit and admire. Frequented by a lot of young people who sit on the grass, eating and drinking wine in the afternoon. They said that sex is permitted after 18:00. :)
walk, run, and have fun. Natural park with a cafe and plenty of space for jogging, cycling and walking. There is also a pond/small lake in the middle.

a great city park. Relaxing and interesting. We were there in the fairly early morning and it was quiet so I don't know what it would be like if it got really busy. However, we loved it. Saw the storks in their nest, watched some very interesting characters doing their thing and generally relaxed. All in all this is the perfect city park.

Relax or picnic here. Vondel Park was very close to our hotel, so since it was marketed as a place to go, we checked it out. It was a typical park, a few fountains, ponds and lots of green space. Very few flowering shrubs or flowers, which we tend to like. Many people were cycling around or lounging about, a good place to chill out.
WOW. Don't even think about it! Go to the park! Bring some food, bring friends, hell go by yourself, chill out relax and soak it up.

Family Birthday Trio. Visited the park as part of. An A-Bikes cycle tour. A very cosmopolitan, busy park. Beautiful morning which made for a very pleasant visit. Loved seeing all the fitness groups, families on bikes and walking. Lots of play areas for children; beautiful lakes and even a Stork Conservation area. Well worth a visit if your time allows and a bike makes it much easier.

Vondelpark. Well laid out park. Although I would not put it in my top 5 parks I have ever been too, it is worth visiting. One thing that was odd..... The lack of garbage receptacles available. Not just in Vondelpark, but all of Amsterdam. It could be a cleaner park and city. The members only tennis courts were beautiful. It was very crowded, with great diversity.

Nice, clean park . This is a big park with a huge restaurant cafe and toilets. There are many entrances and exits. The park was clean. I didn't see any dog mess. I attended the Park for the start of EuroPride 2016.
