Well laid medium sized park. Extremely pleasant walk, the daffodils were still out when we visited so gave it that extra dutch feel. It has a pleasant cafe in the center that serves coffee and sandwiches all of which were consumed with by your authors one lunch time

Expansive park with lots and lots of cyclists. Beautiful scenery.. There is a lot to see in this park, although it is fairly similar from one end to the other. On summer days, there are people playing music and having barbecues together which creates a nice atmosphere.
lovely restuarant. Very busy but lovely meal in outside restaurant which was a little expensive but great for the hot day
nice relaxing park but nothing spectacular. A lot of people there, from Amsterdam, having good time in different ways. Good for them, but nothing special to see for tourists

Nice park to relax and refresh in.. Came to the park twice during my visit to Amsterdam. Its close enough to the main part of the city and since the weather was so nice, we went bike riding two days in a row. The paths are mostly paved and much of it is tree lined. The park itself gets a bit crowded on sunny days with people having picnics, sleeping on the grass, feeding the ducks in the ponds, etc. There are many bike rental places nearby and recommend going through the whole place to find a nice spot to relax in.
Lovely park for a sunny day. I loved the parkIts massive and you can have a nice walk through itThere is a lake and its just beautifulNot for a rainy day though

Admittedly it was 32C. Breathtakingly beautiful park. We circled the place on foot but it would have been worth renting some bikes because it's quite a walk. It's definitely worth stopping to feed the ducks and look at the amazing estates along the water. There were a few carts dotted about for food and drinks inside but they were all pretty pricey. The nicest terrace seemed to be at Groot Melkhuis cafe, but the bartender couldn't pour a pint to save her life so we left after one. Would prepare a picnic for next time.

A wonderful place to enjoy nature. We spent a lovely couple of hours, walking around and taking in the ambience.If you are mindful of the numerous bikers and stay out of their way, it will make for a really pleasant stay.We thoroughly enjoyed the concert at the Open Theatre, absolutely superb. Would love to go back and explore more, if parks are your thing, you can't go wrong with Vondelpark.
Enjoy the Dance on a Summer Night. Fabulous evening watching dance in the park. Wonderful atmosphere filled with lots of people enjoying the warm weather!

Overcrowded on sunny day. We visited the Vondelpark on a beautifully warm and sunny day at around 6pm. Unfortunately, so did the entire population of Amsterdam - gardens are very few and far between in the city so everyone heads here when the sun is out! It was seriously overcrowded with people coming after work. As pedestrians we were squashed towards the side of the paths to make room for the bikes. So much for a relaxing stroll...! I think it would be particularly stressful as a tourist to cycle under such conditions. It was difficult to appreciate the open space and peacefulness offered by this city park.We walked around the entire park, which took just over an hour. We saw water fountains at the main entrance and also opposite the Vondelpark 3 restaurant. We also saw a couple of hot-dog / ice-cream kiosks. There are public toilets (Dixi portaloo style urinal and cubicle) here and there.Bike hire is available nearby (A-Bike Vondelpark) but not within the park itself.We will visit the park again but not at 6pm on a sunny day!
lungs of the city. entry to this lovely park must be a relief to Amsterdammers and tourists alike after the crowds, heat and grime of the city during high summer.

Nice place to relax and hangout . Vondelpark is a nice place to relax and hangout. The first part (near the entrance at the Max Eeuweplein side) is rather touristy. A lot people on red/green/blue/hotel bikes who cannot ride a bike or never have done so in their lives. Watch for the fear in their eyes when they try not to cycle in one of the ponds. The second part of the park (at the Amstelveenseweg side) is more laid back and host more locals. Strangely, most of the tourists don't venture here. I think there is an invisible barrier of some sort. Or no mention of it in Lonely Planet ;-)The Vondelpark Open Air Theatre does great shows in the summer season. Check out their calendar. And last but not least: free parking on Sunday's. Not in the park of course, but on the roads adjacent to it.

Beautiful. Have visited Vondel several times throughout the Spring and Summer months and it's beautiful whenever. The park is very extensive and you can easily spend hours wandering around or sit and have a picnic. Great place to go for a more relaxed look at Amsterdam.
Really beautiful. Really beautiful, green, cafe, bars . Good friendly family atmosphere, fun. People picnicking and partying, jamming...
Lovely park. Make sure to stroll through this park. Lots of water and several fountains . Was a really nice rose garden area.

A truly beautiful park. I rode my bike through the park and found it absolutely lovely. There are open fields, streams, marshes, and little trails through wooded areas. It's absolutely beautiful, and was filled with people exercising, relaxing, and just walking around. Vondelpark is worth a visit in every season.

Lovely place. Really pleasant park to walk through any time of year or have a picnic in the summer. There's a tea house if you want a snack. Sometimes there are art exhibitions at the park and the rose garden is always a nice place to walk to. Really relaxing place to come to away from the busy city, but right next to many central sights.

Lovely picnic in the sun!. A lovely park to have a walk in or a picnic. It was very busy the day we were there but it was most likely due to the amazing weather. The park only loses a point for the toilets. They were pretty disgusting porta potties. At least there was still some toilet paper. Also the park wasn't that clean...at least in the grass. There were bottle tops, used coals and cigarette butts everywhere.
Great Park . Great park to walk/cycle and good play area for children. .. Had a very good time walking, accessible and near town. Relax and enjoy the walk!

Stunning. Went for a little stroll on a hot summers day. Like the rest of the city, you must be aware of the bikes flying past you in every direction, but other wise it was a lovely way to take a break from a busy holiday!

Fun in the sun. We went for an exercise walk and did two loops around the park so we saw it all. What an wonderful green vibrant fun and exciting thing to have in the middle of the city. All of the green fields and ponds and play areas are full of life and fun. There were at least three different cafes to relax at and have a drink while watching all the fun.

Huge beautiful park, lovely walk. Lovely park for a walk on a sunny day. People having barbecues and walking their dogs, people playing music, sunbathing, doing yoga, boxing, reading, cycling, bathing in the water. Was just the true meaning of a community area. Lovely place to be.

Always nice to relax here and let he day pass you bye. One place to visit when you just want to sit and relax and let time pass you bye. Beautiful grounds. Nice for a picnic or to just lay in the sun.
Across the road from amenities including tram stops and Hard Rock Cafe etc
Peaceful . Lovely park as long as you steer clear of the cyclist who are crazy😂 peaceful lovely park ideal for a picnic , chilling out or just a nice walk a little bit of heaven in Amsterdam
Beautiful . Vondelpark is one of the most beautiful parks I ever been. Worth every moment you have and can spend there. If is a sunny day may you can do a picnic there. Very nice!!

Vonderful. We were staying at Roemer Hotel, which is near this park, and enjoyed either walking here of an evening to the restaurant or hiring a bike and cycling around it. It was lovely to see so many families out enjoying the facilities this park has to offer in the middle of a bustling city.
Amsterdam's lungs. The Vondelpark is a great spot for a summers barbecue, picknick, or your morning run. Very versatile and loved park.

a busy place on a sunny day. A nice park to visit which is busy on sunny days.
Other cities have far larger parks with more things to do.
Beautiful park. Lovely park in Amsterdam. Well kept and clean, We took a picnic and head breakfast on the grass watching the world go by in the sunshine,.
Lovely open Park. Great place to visit and relax, lovely open spaces and in the heart of the city, good for walks and bike rides

Huge green park for relaxation. A great place for walks, bike rides and relaxation. There are a lot of people jogging, riding bikes, making barbecue, having picnic or simply lying on the grass.
The park is huge and I would recommend you cycle through it when you go, for example, to Museumplein.
AMAZING. This is an absolutely beautiful park filled with wildlife and nature. Ponds, canals, bridges, ducks, herons, and a rose garden. You have to see this park!

Sunniest Day of the Year!. Upon arriving in Amsterdam we headed straight for Vondelpark! It was the hottest day of the year so far and this place was the perfect place to enjoy it. After a walk around we treated ourselves to deliciously creamy icecream from a vendor and found ourselves a shaded spot where we relaxed in the surroundings. First we were seranaded by a violinist and then an acoustic duo on guitar. The park has a great relaxed atmosphere and perfect for picknicking. We are actually heading back there this afternoon!

Beautiful Park. We were lucky that the day we came here the sun was shining! It was beautiful and we enjoyed our stroll around the park on the way into Amsterdam Central. I would recommend a visit here!

A european paradise.. Honestly one the most chilled places I have been to in Europe. It's great for a walk or cycle around if you fancy getting away from the busy Amsterdam city. I will say that it is best enjoyed during the summer, it's not nice to walk around if you're getting wet in the rain (naturally). But if you do catch yourself out in bad weather like I did one day, go and rest at one of the cafes in the park, I personally recommend 't Blauwe Theehuis, great coffee and relaxing setting!Don't forget your camera by the way, as it's the most picturesque place in dam!

Wasn't quite as expected. We were fortunate / unfortunate to be visiting during a rather unexpected heat wave, so the park was packed with people out smoking and drinking and having a good sun filled day, but this did then make it impossible to enjoy the beauty and peacefulness you would expect from such a park.On a different day, I'm sure it's wonderful, just sadly not the day we visited.
Huge!. Massive park with lots of places to sit and relax! Would recommend cycling around it as it's very big
Excellent park. Excellent park, a lot of greens. beware of the cyclists though, watch out you are not on their path.
Amazing green spot. It's a great place to relax. Nice enviroment with a lot of services.Easy to reach, clean, quiet and really beautiful.
Fantastic venue. Slightly far away from where we were staying in Amsterdam however this place was well worth visiting and we were only sorry that we hadn't arrived sooner!
Beautiful . What a glorious public space. Music in an open performance area. Bbq areas. Bikes everywhere. Lovely gardens and relaxing.

Hire a bike and ride around here. I had already googled this park before coming to Amsterdam so I knew it would be pretty but seeing it for myself was awesome. We hired a bike and rode to the park. Once there we had a fantastic time. Its such a pretty spot. Take a picnic.

charming but watch out for those bicycles!. Spend a delightful morning wondering about in a delightful park, looking at people and their dogs and just generally relaxing. Well worth a visit but the bicycles are a genuine danger to unsuspecting tourists.

Definitely worth a visit (weather permitting). Visited today during a sunny spell in Amsterdam and was really impressed with the scenery and upkeep of the park. Plan on visiting again and hiring a bike before the end of my stay.
Great. A perfect place to relax and dine. We went there every day and loved it. Friendly service at the restaurants.

Beware the Stoners... not that they are dangerous or anything, its just with so many coffee shops nearby, its the logical place to go in the centre to get away for a bit. Can be a bit busy on a bike, and with Tourists and people of varios states of awareness, it can be less than tranqil. still a lovely spot, esp. on a hot day
Great City Park. Rented a bike, had a picnic and people watched, a great park. A very relaxing place in busy in Amsterdam.
Lovely Park. What a lovely park situated close to the Museum District. It is well maintained and more importantly clean and tidy. A surprising find to say the least!
February 2016. Lovely winters walk in one of my favourite parks There is always a nice atmosphere in Amsterdam Vondelpark , people are friendly

Stunning. Beautiful place! Our hotel was 2 minutes away and when it's sunny, it's such a great place to go and chill / cycle around. Great atmosphere however, it can become crowded with bikes but just stick to the paths whilst walking! (You will get shouted at haha)
The best place to chill in summer. Had a great time relaxing in Vondelpark ... the surrounding areas make this place quite lively . Really good during summer

Delightful surprise. A surprising park in the heart of the museum district. Delightful greenery and well laid out. Very popular as we saw people there at all times of the day despite the cloudy weather.
Nice. Its a nice place to see and very interesting. Its definitely a must visit if your in Amsterdam. Good for people watching and just relaxing.
Afternoon chill out. Huge park,family friendly,bikes,picnics etc. Lots of people reading,walking playing guitars great quiet place to chill our

an attractive and lovely park. It was one of the best parks I've ever visited. Bring some snacks and drinks and take your time as long as you want to. It is summer now and I saw a lot of local people doing gym together or having some event there. An attractive and lovely park to visit.
Lungs of the city. Great green garden in the middle of the city ,go there in the evening when there are so many people around cycling ,playing or just sitting and enjoying the greenery
Nice calm park. We were at a hotel near this park, we took some hours to have a rest and a brief pic-nic we really liked it, it's enjoyable and relaxing.

Amazing place. Vondelpark is such a lovely place, you could spend all day there! We hire bikes and rode round the park for a few hours which was lovely, we also had an ice cream and a drink and one of the many cafes/restaurants within the park. I wold recommended Vondelpark to anyone who is visiting Amsterdam, especially on a lovely sunny day.
Amazing park on a hot day. Rent a bicycle and visit this park on a hot day. There are restaurants and stands to buy food and its a nice place to spend an afternoon.
nice park. went for a nice walk here after the museums. tons of people on bikes, wish we did that, lots of kids and a fun place to hang.

Lovely!. Such a lovely place. Would recommend! You can walk all the way around enjoy the view and stop of for drinks ect at a few places. The area is just stunning. It is really nice at night too! The amsterdam sign is a tram stop away!

Bring your bike & some snacks / drinks!. The best way to see the park is via bike - allows you to see the entire park in a short timeframe, pulling off to stops as you would like. There are lovely cafes in the park, though better to bring your own picnic to really enjoy the experience. Even on a Monday the park was full of Dutch people trying to soak up the sun! A great family activity for a relaxing and green stroll outside the busy central streets.
Huge park, great vibes!. One of the best parks I've visited; a great place for a cycle or a picnic! Lovely spots to sit and chill!

Lovely park. We visited this park on a lovely sunny day. There was lots going on, but you can also just sit back, read a book and people watch. It a HUGE park so would definitely recommend going for a walk around if the weather is nice.
Lovely atmospheric park. Brilliant lots of food stalls big grassey area to sit out on, big paddling out pool to keep cool in museums surrounding the park a lovely area of Amsterdam x

A place to daydream.. Take a day and enjoy everything Vondelpark has to offer. Ride a bike or just take a stroll in this beautiful park, have a bite to eat and head back in. It feels like playing hide-and-seek with Amsterdam!
A very lovely park!. This is a huge public park in the city and a great place to stroll,relax and seek shade on a warm day! When you visit Amsterdam,this is a place that you really should visit!

Lovely large park. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this lovely large park near the Museum district in Amsterdam. This park has well kept paths for walking and cycling and is popular with locals. There are nice grassy areas for sitting and there are some picnic seats. There is a lake and a fountain. We were intrigued by the small bridge with the padlocks attached to the fencing. Lovers have put their initials on padlocks and attached them to this bridge. We had lunch at the cafe in the park, which is beside the lake. This was a lovely location from which to watch the walkers and cyclists. It was very relaxing. This is a good place to unwind and destress.

Nice Park, if You're Looking for a Park. Besides for picnics or concerts, I've never really understood the purpose of parks, so my review is pretty darn biased. We were taken here by a friend and, yes, it is a very nice park. Green grass and all that, but it is just a park. Plus there is a surprising amount of trash in the ponds which negates some of the park's beauty.
Beautiful park!. Just a great park very well designed and with great ambience!!Lakes, grass, sauvage areas, birds...and also beautiful houses around// It is very practical to ride on bike!Recommend!
lovely park - saw passenger. A lovely park which we strolled around on our first day and saw passenger performing - a real highlight for the family. Wen back another day on our bikes.

Chillin down the parj. Love this placeSo much spaceSo chilled outIt's a must see every time we go AmsterdamThe open air theatre is fantastic it has two barsA veranda/upstairs terrace with seats to drink onRaked seating availableTwo different places to eat next to the open air theatre and a summer season full of gigs comedy and such like Top place

Beautiful! . Vondelpark is a lovely place to go to for a nice picnic and some drinks. My husband and I also rented a couple of bikes and we were able to explore the majority of the park on our bikes. Love it there!

Well worth a visit. Nice park near the centre of Amsterdam that is tranquil enough to get away of the city's hustle and bustle. Enter from the south and enjoy a walk to(wards) Leidseplein and you pass nice places for lunch and drinks. Check out a concert at the Vondelpark theatre when you can.

Beautiful. The park can be used as a way to relax while admiring it's beautiful nature, bike among the many trees and flowers, hang out with friends or grab a bite. Everyone should visit, no matter their age or interests. It's a place that can please everyone. Would definitely recommend it!

Beautiful park; loose the noise of the city. Great way to enjoy nature and rest your feet with lunch or just tea/coffee... and people watch!
We walked this park the first day of arrival and found it very pleasant; we also toured on bicycle a few days later. There are restaurants/coffee houses that you can enjoy the scenery while have lunch or a beverage.

lovely way to spend an afternoon. this is one of my favorite places in the city on a nice summer day. There are plenty of places to grab a drink or just sit down under a tree to read a book. a very lovely park.
on a sunny day of summer is beutifull. good maontanance of the park loveley caffey and... carefull of the thousends of bikes that wiss in between the small paths

Great for a relaxing time in the sub. It was a lovely day when we sat in Vondelpark for a picnic and most of the afternoon, and although it was busy, it was not crowded. A very nice park with a pond and toilets nearby, although the only issue was there was not a place for up to fill up our water bottles, which would have been very helpful.
Nice walk but ruined by all the bikes . If on a bike then it would be great but if walking it is stressful as bikes are everywhere. There is a nice Cafe there which serves food and drink.

Jogging in the Park. If you like to jog (or stroll), this is an incredibly beautiful park, surrounded by a beautiful neighborhood. Also, when I ran through the park, I noticed hundreds of young people gathered in an old and beautiful building for happy hour. Wish I could have joined them. Looked like so much fun in such a beautiful place, with so many beautiful people.
Taking the kids out on a Sunday afternoon. It is always great to visit this park. Enough space to sit quietly while watching other people enjoying themselves.
Really nice park. A really pretty park. Plenty of grass to sit on in a very scenic setting. Clearly people are proud of the park as there is very little litter and it is well maintained.

Chill out. Great place to chill and hang around. Lots to do. We were on a Sunday afternoon. Lot of great people, free concerts... All you need for a funky Sunday.
Though the weather was not great we had a swell time
Where everyone seems to be on a warm summer evening. Heaps of people out walking, cycing, families friends. Seems like a lovely place to hang out. Good options for photography
Nice but crowded.. The largest park in Amsterdam is small and not very interesting compared to the parks in London, NY, or Paris.
Green space to enjoy a picnic. This was a great place for a breather. We enjoyed being able to relax and munch on our picnic food away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam.

Lovely park. Hired bikes for a couple of hours to go round the park as we weren't brave enough to go on the streets with them! Very glad we did decide to go round the park as it's a lovely oasis of greenery and calm in the city. Full of all types, from folk obviously commuting back from work, to families and teenagers playing catch. Nice atmoshere and a few places to stop and have food/drink/coffee along the way. Big play park for kids also.

A Very Pleasant Activity on a Sunny Day!. The Tram System is very easy to figure out in Amsterdam. We took the Tram to Vondelpark for a stroll on a sunny day. There were a lot of people picnicking, walking their dogs, sitting on the many benches and talking, lying on the lawns or just out for a stroll. It was a nice break from the hustle bustle of travel where a lot of our time was spent going to attractions. We walked through a residential area adjacent to the park. Older brick homes and buildings, narrow streets, very pleasant. Many restaurants and shops on the main street only about two blocks from the park.

Good to explore. A great place to go visit and explore. Renting bikes and cycling is the best way to see everything and enjoy yourself at the same time. However, in the height of summer the park felt overcrowded with other tourists, making cycling difficult and strolling around less peaceful. There are other parks available not much further away which offer thinner crowds and are just as good.
Hire a bike and cycle through this beautiful park!. So green and very easy to cycle through. We hired bikes near the park and just rode them around and it was so much fun.

the best place to do a work out!. Almost every day, I do walk here for my summer exercise and it is just the best place to be. Despite all the bicycle riders (be careful!) everyone seem to like these nice paths
Pretty nice stop whilst walking around the city!. Passed by the park for a quick snack and a cold beer on a sunny day walk through the city. Quite relaxing and beautiful on a nice day like that!

Famous park of Amsterdam. Huge park, I recomand to take a bike if you want to see it all. Sometimes there are nice events there. There is an area for bbq. Everyone sits on the grass and enjoys the sun. (Pss you can have a drink there, even if is public space. Even so, I'm not sure it is ok, but everyone does it)
Just a larger road with a small park in the middle. I do not know what this fuss is about. The place has nothing special. If you want to see a great park, then better go to Cingendael in The Hague.

Biking Through Vondelpark.. Took a 3 hour bike tour through Amsterdam with Viator. The ride included a 20-30 minute ride through Vondelpark with a short stop for liquid refreshments.Fun to go through on the bike tour and lots of locals out with their children to enjoy the Saturday afternoon in the park.Not much to see there unless you plan to go and maybe do a picnic.
Vondelpark in the summer. Hot , the restaurants are not welcoming, seem unclean, the park is very dry. There are a lot of people but over all it's overrated.

Pleasant open space.. If you want to get away from the city then this park is the space to do it in. Lovely lakeside resting places . Even though it gets fairly busy in the good weather it's possible yo find quiet areas off the beaten tracks.

A great hidden park amidst a jungle of buildings.. My wife and I were spending a week visiting Amsterdam and the bar person recommended this park. It is close to several museums which we were visiting so decided to look into it.It was absolutely fantastic and a great oasis of peace. It is laid out in many different ways and as we were walking around we eagerly waited to see what was around the corner. We can see why this has a huge number of visitors and reminded me of Hyde Park in London.When researching what to visit in Amsterdam this park does not feature much. It should do with its multiple lakes, multiple eating places, acres of grass to lie on and so much more.Residents are very lucky to have this park.

VPark. The park is great for a nice walk under the sun. Unfortunately, there were no flowers when I went to Amsterdam. The park was not over crowded. There is nothing spectacular as it is just like any other park. For a relaxing day, go here.
Our home away from home!. We walked this lovely, leafy park everyday on the way to and from museums and sights. Highly recommend walking through and enjoying the nature and people watching.

Escape the hustle and bustle!. This is the most wonderful place to go and sit and watch the world go by! After a few days walking around busy canals, streets etc, it was great to find a place to relax. Still have to watch out for bikes though!!
Beautiful Park. My friend and I walked through this beautiful park. It was reminiscent of Central Park in New York although not as large. It was very clean, peaceful, and serene. We enjoyed it.

Lots of green!. Enjoyed a Sunday walk in this huge park. There was a half marathon going on but that did not have an overall impact on the visit.There are a few water features in the park, but it is mostly trees, grass and a few restaurants.It is located near the biggest two museums in Amsterdam so you can easily combine them in one trip.

Beautiful. We are staying in the Park Plaza Vondelpark hotel right in front of Vondelpark. Just a short walk aways and we love the park! So much green everywhere and so many things to do. A great place to hang out, have a picnic, or go on a bike ride.
Amazing chillout. The best green of amsterdam.Id spend the entire sunday over a beer and a good talk with friends there.Must go in summer

Green oasis . Our visit at the Vondelpark could have been much more enjoyable, whithout the constat fear of the bycicles . As the park is open to bycicles , it is difficult to walk round fearless and calm.
A Great Park to Have Lunch At. Following our overseas flight we had a super lunch here along with people watching. Food and beer was great as was the service

Wonderful safe, clean park in the heart of Amsterdam. Vondelpark is a great park in the heart of Amsterdam. My teenage granddaughter and I walked there for about 3 hours. Many sculptures, flowers, monuments and playgrounds for the little ones. The bicycles like in all of Amsterdam are truly amazing. There are many clean outhouses if you need facilities. Many places to see. Since it is around 25 acres with many paths I suggest you buy a map for 1 euro at the information building. We felt very safe walking and taking pictures there, just like we felt in all of Amsterdam.
a nice place to rest and read your book and stroll around.... If you are planning to visit Amsterdam; include Vondelpark to your city tour ,you'll love it , really !!!!

beautiful park -- great for a picnic, bike, or stroll. big park, well-maintained, with lots of trails and cut-offs. Easy to get lost in if not paying attention. Bring a picnic and a book and spend the afternoon chillin' out.
Perfect place for picnic :). nice break out from the city, super chill out place. quit many people, but very positive atmosphere :) highly recommend

Lovely park to wander about in. Vondelpark is a lovely, green oasis in the middle of Amsterdam where you can just sit back and listen to the birds sing, watch the bird life and people and just relax. From the middle of the park it's hard to believe you are in busy Amsterdam!

Weather nice, green place enought for everyone!. I went throught whole Vondelpark, it was amazing! Wish in Czech would be some park like this one! Good for chill with friends or just you and your favourite book. Or you can take a ride with bike.
Best park ever!. I lived on vondel for six weeks and I loved it every day! So many different areas and new things to find around every corner. Great place for every age!

gorgeous park!. Once you are in Amsterdam, people give you a list to see.When I first came here Vondelpark was on the list.I was wondering what is so special about it to be on my to do list in Amsterdam. It is a total joy to picnic and walk in the park.Of course when the weather is good. It is very busy when it is sunny but it's not disturbing, the park is big enough to put your own terratory
Very dirty . We went in the evenning time and there was alot of smoking and the park was very dirty with alot of rubbish. If it was cleaner it would have been a much better experience.
Rent a bike and ride along the park. Great park for a stroll on your bike around the park. It reminds me of Central park, not that big but large enough to get a feel of the greenery and people watch.
Lay and smoke the dank kush. Lay here with a few friends for a while before heading home , they blazed the Dams finest kush in it while I played some dirty dutch house beats by Oliver Heldens!
Must Bike Through. Beautiful park that is best suited by riding your bike through. Places to pull over and see get a drink or lay out and get some sun.

Relaxing space in the heart of the city. This is a really nice park with attractive lakes, lots of room to walk around among the trees and decent places to have a drink or snack inside the park or just on the edge.We were fortunate enough to see a heron at very close range as it sat on a branch overhanging a lake. At first I thought it was an artwork until it moved.

A large park where a lot of local spend their leisure time. The park is very nice with lakes and lawn. A lot of local use this park to relax, jog or cycle. However, it is really distributing that smoking is not banned in the park, it is not pleasant when you have lots of second hand smoking coming from all directions. There are some toilets located in the park for the convenience of visitors but they are smelly and there are no tap water to wash hand after using toilet.

Amsterdams' Central Park. This large park in the centre of Amsterdam provides you with some relaxation after visiting the busy sights at the Museum Square or at Leidse Square. When the weather is good you'll get to see how locals enjoy the sun, by organising picknicks, BBQs, and having drinks with friends around the little lakes in the park.

Beautiful park, very busy, not the best. Vondelpark, in my opinion, is second to Rembrandt Park. The reason why is that it's almost always very busy, especially on weekends. But, if this is something you like, then my review is mostly irrelevant! Rembrandt is more serene, more lush, and more beautiful, I feel. It is fun to go for a ride through Vondelpark, though, and it is iconic Amsterdam, so no matter what I say, you're gonna go! I just wanted to get my two cents in about Rembrandt Park in comparison to the famous Vondel.

Beautiful park, nice break from the city.. We stayed in a houseboat on the canal near Vondelpark, and spent a wonderful rainy day riding thru the park. Great playgrounds, beautiful gardens and water features.

Beautiful Park, Must See. While in Amsterdam you must rent a bike and ride through Vondelpark. It's so beautiful and you'll feel as Dutch as ever. There are many beautiful green spaces to spend time people watching or just enjoying the outdoors. Yes, you may find some people smoking pot here and there but it doesn't take anything away from the beauty of the park. Take the time to see the park the next time you're in Amsterdam.

Great park to run,cycle or walk round.. I went for an early run a few times in this park. On week days there are lots of cyclists and runners by 7.30am and it's a lovely park to be in with lakes and trees and grass areas. The cafes in the park seemed very popular during the day.
Beautiful . A great place for a relaxing walk. Beautiful, green, often people playing music. A restaurant in the middle of the park. In April, the tulips are blooming.

Amsterdam's playground for all ages. Great place to go for people of all ages: from quiet stroll (in the morning or on a cooler day), easy and safe running circuit, giving young ones plenty of space to play (there are a few good play areas), or people watching on a summers day! There are a few cafe/ bars to keep you fed and watered and open air concerts during the summer months. The park gets quieter (has fewer people) the further away from the city center.
Very nice to chill. A nice place to sit and chill for a bit - people seem friendly and there are rivers to sit by too. Came when it was busy and was still space to sit down

Morning Jog. The Vondelpark is a very busy park on fine days, but is really nice to go to for a jog. One round of the park is nearly 3.5km so I would recommend going at 9-10am and you will escape the crowds.

A nice oasis in the middle of Amsterdam. I found myself with a free Sunday morning in Amsterdam and decided to walk through the Vondel Park. The well maintained and. Lean park offers everything from jogging trails to little streams and lakes with lots of space to picnic or just shoot the breeze with friends. A leaflet with that day's activities was available, including free musical performances. There are several restaurants you can stop at for a snack or just a cup of coffee. I enjoyed the walk and the people watching opportunity.

Still looking for Pablo. Lovely park, relaxing and enjoyed our delicious Dutch rye bread sandwiches. I can see why this park is a hit with people, both locals and tourists. It is well appointed, open and interesting with features that draw people like bugs to a candle.

A nice place to hang out.. We went here last summer, and I liked how people were free to do as they pleased. The kids played soccer, flew a toy drone, and walked in the water without anybody minding. Everybody just kept to themselves, and it was just an overall chill environment.

Oasis and fine houses . Vondelpark is a lovely park in South Amsterdam. The area abounds with fine mansions - this is a very well to do part of Amsterdam and a very nice place to have a stroll in the tree lined paths and streets.

Beautiful park. We spent an afternoon in Vondelpark with friends on a sunny day. Its a beautiful park with lakes, pedestrian and bike roads and lawns. Perfect for a picnic or just a stroll. Hard Rock Cafe is across the street from its entrance.

Awesome place. This is a really cool place. The park is quite big and there are ponds, a cafe a restaurant (which was closed when I was there) and trails to walk/cycle through. I'll definitely go again when I'm back in Amsterdam!

Nice but nothing special. It's a nice park. Nothing against it as we enjoyed our time there. A beer and a some fries on a warm day is a great time for me. But nothing all that special, really. You can smell some pot in the air every now and then or smell it on people walking by, but nothing to be worried a out.

Beautiful place. This was a beautiful park to go hangout and just relax. It's a place where you wanna go to get away and be with relaxed and chill people. Sit in the grass and let your mind drift away
Beautiful park. Calm and beautiful park. Great place to ride a bike, running or just sit there in the grass enjoying the views.
Beautiful!. What a beautiful place to spend the day. We spent hours just wandering down little paths throughout the park.

Central park. Wonderful place to stroll when needing peace in the city. They used to have an outstanding beer garden an it was wonderful at that time. Now u can find fitness groups in between groups smoking weed
Park to relax in the city. Take a moment to relax on a sunny day in Amsterdam. Enjoy one of the best city parks in Europe, stroll around, sit near the lakes, have a beer at the blauwe theehuis...
Peace and quiet!. Just loved this little park in the city. Beautifully kept. We used to stroll through from one side to the other.

Nice walk. This is a huge park very close to the museum area. It is full of people, bikes and life. We walked there with children; there is a huge bridge for children, open space to run and ice cream.

Beautiful . A stunning place well worth a look pop down Their on the bikes and have a ride round Try your best to take it all in their is a lot to see and lovely to just relax in the sun Their is a small cafe in the centre of the park the food is well priced and has seating outside and in

A must visit when in Amsterdam!. Vondelpark is really something you must not miss when you visit Amsterdam. It's a great park enjoyed by locals as well as by tourists. It's big enough to let you bike around but small enough to genuinely feel cosy. There are a number of cafes and places to check out but biking around and having a pic nic when the weather is nice would be my strongest recommendations!

Beautiful Stroll or Jog through this Park. This park is great for a pre/post dinner walk. Especially during the months where the sun goes down at 10pm - you can spend a nice length of time at this park. Lots of locals were jogging, riding bikes and having picnics. If I had some extra time during vacation I would have loved to enjoy a beautiful picnic and a book in this park.
Great park.. Great park on sunny days. Worth riding through. Like Amsterdam in general full of "mysterious" smells.....

Charming paradise inside the city . I liked this park so much and I believe that my baby girl enjoyed also here the most between all places we have visited.The lake and birds was so beautiful and it is safe.
Perfect. Vondelpark is the perfect place to go if you want to relax. There are places for everyone if you want to be alone or if you want to be social.

Great when the sun shines. A great open green space in Amsterdam. As you wander through you catch whiffs of smoke for which Amsterdam is famous. Very relaxed atmosphere and lots of cafes with terraces. Can't be in a better place when the sun shines. Something for everyone who wants to just relax. Watch out for the bicycles though!!
Visit. Nice place to visit with a good vibe. When special events are taking place is good time to go but watch out for the cyclists!

Good place for a bike ride. Lovely greenspace, packed with locals on warm summer days. Lots of paths to walk or bike, take the dogs out for a romp, get a meal at one of the restaurants within the park.
Good for tripping. Me and my friends ate a bunch of mushrooms and tripped here for a solid 5 hours. This day will hold a special place in my heart forever

Nice park to stroll, picnic and people watch. Spent the afternoon here and grabbed some food from a local shop and a couple of coffees. Plenty of wildlife and opportunity to simply relax and people watch. Plenty going on to wander round.
Very Artificial . Nice area but most of the place looks man made and not natural. It also smells in places and the littering is bad.

Amazing way to ground yourself. Start your trip to Amsterdam here, if you can. Take a walk, enjoy the people, gardens and activity. The weekends are packed with all types just hanging out. We enjoyed a beer at the cafe at the top of the park(?). My daughter and I walked through in the late evening (10ish) and felt safe. It was a highlight of our trip.

Great park. A very beautiful park, a lot of green and water (with ducks). Many people practice sports there, riding bikes running, kick-boxing, yoga... Some special places for children (e.g. ladders and rope bridges), including a swimming pool for little children (water depth around 30 centimeters it seems). Dogs playing around. Very very nice and relaxing.

A fantastic place on a sunny day. I absolutely love this place. Everytime I go to Amsterdam I love strolling through the park. It's got plenty of space for everyone and it's a lovely place to take things easy.

Relaxing day in the park . A great way to spend the afternoon. Bring a picnic and crashed out for hours or just run or ride a bike (a little easier than having to negotiate bikes and cars in the road - although it is a lot of fun). Vondelpak is a must.

Beautiful !!!. It was a lovely atmosphere with a lovely view. Me and my partner walked round and sat happily for hours, watching the world go by. You don't feel like you are in the city centre, its tranquil and beautiful. It is looked after well, with very friendly people happily sat around enjoying the weather. I would spend all day in the park on a nice day, lovely!!

Nice green space. We stayed in the nearby area and enjoyed evening strolls in the park which is well used by cyclists, joggers, fitness groups and picnickers. Like all city parks some areas seem more salubrious than others but the atmosphere throughout was relaxed.
City Break. Spent a lovely afternoon wandering round the park. Stopped off for a pleasant drink at the teahouse, whilst watching the world go by.
Relax. This park is like Central Park in NY city, but it was more relaxing. Many bikes everywhere. Employees were friendly and the park was clean.

An oasis of green ina busy city. Sunday afternoon was a busy time in the park. Joggers and cyclists enjoying the fresh air. Lots of people relaxing on the grass. Free concerts are on offer throughout the summer.
We visited the cafe and enjoyed a coffee while sheltering form a downpour. The staff were lovely.
Absolutely beautiful. We rode bikes through the park everyday we were in Amsterdam. A great place to walk, run or ride bikes.
Beautiful . It's a lovely little patch of greenery in a busy city. We went on a really sunny day so had a picnic on the grass. Beautifully kept!

Once in a life time.. Once in a life time.
Very high class calculated decorate.
One of the romantic place you must see by your own eyes before you die.
A MUST !

lovely!. we hired mac bikes behind the art square and road through the park twice during our trip. A great activity for a sunny afternoon as everybody is out and its a lovely atmosphere. There are a few restaurants/cafes in the park, numerous play parks and a small pool so if its a hot day bring something to paddle in! was a nice break from the busier city side of ams.
Beautiful park 👫🌳. A lovely green space in the centre of Amsterdam that is absolutely perfect for a stroll by the lake(s) when the sun is out.
Lovely especially when the sun is out. Have been in the park several times during our trip. Always lovely and clean, plenty of benches and great place for a picnic.
Good to go if you like parks. Its a beautiful park to go during the weekend is the weather is good. It is easy to get there and there is some good spots to stand in the sun.
Beautiful !. Very pretty and even though we didn't have great weather was still worth going! Would recommend going there by bike but by foot is fine too!

Fantastic Amsterdammers City Park. Used by Amsterdammers, this is their park. BUT, it is way too crowded and far too many bikes, so go early morning to cycle especially weekends. Very beautiful very big. As i lived in Amsterdam, we used to go there each day but early morning and away from Tourists peak time 11am til dusk.

A King's Day Visit.. The weather was not great, but the park was packed with people enjoying patches of sun and the King's Day activities. The park is lovely and we particularly enjoyed the flowers. This is another must-visit in Amsterdam - very close to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum.

The must have seen Park in Amsterdam!. The vondelpark is located in Amsterdam city centre. Not only can you walk around and experience the busy bicycle traffic to goes trough the park everyday but there are some bars and restaurants located where you can have a proper drink and snacks. Try the Vondel3 bar/restaurant for a good beer or lunch.
Beautiful Sunny Afternoon. Such a nice day to be outside in the park. People and dogs all about. Enjoyed our visit and stroll through the park.
Relax, exercicie, friend's time.... It's a big park to go to walk, sit, talk, run, bike... A lot of activities to do with or without friends, family, partner...

Vondelpark not the best. Walked through the Vondelpark when going to and from our hotel. Yes it is a big park but it doesn't have any distinguishing attractions. Not many flowers or foliage but is very busy with cyclists, make sure you stick to the walking paths. Also there are no pop up eateries, which I expected not even an ice cream van.
Fantastic park. One of the best features of Amsterdam is this park. It's huge, has great bike lanes, a beautiful lake and is perfect for a relaxing outing. I recommend it to everyone.
Wonder oasis. We walked he length of the park one afternoon. A great respite from the so busy city. A place to see real Amsterdamers at leisure.
Nice park. A great location for biking. We went to a near by supermarket to buy cheese, bread and fruits and we had a picnic at the park. Lots of shade and nice location for the kids to run
Great morning exploration. Beautiful park. We explored it in day to tack a break from hustle of the city. Very picturesque, well maintained and clean

Vibes, Vibes, Vibes. Being there on a sunny day, the park is stunning and plenty of space and so many people all hanging out and 'breathing in' the Amsterdam atmosphere! Definitely set yourself up for an afternoon here whilst in Amsterdam!

Very nice.. The obvious thing to say is that it's no Central Park. Nowhere is of course, but this really means that Central Park is a destination in and off itself where Vondel Park is a really nice place to relax if you're nearby and it's sunny. It is really nice though, and I particularly liked the part with the type of modern amphitheater. A nice stop off on a sunny day.

Beautiful and Green. Beautiful wide expanse of Green and very pretty to look at. Go there to walk or simply unwind during a busy day. It is a great idea to cycle though this as it is a very big park and walking through the entire expanse may get tiring.
It feels good. I love to walk in this park at any time of the year, relaxes me, and it feels good, the park is very beautiful, the perfect place to escape the crowds in the streets.
Great place to bike/chill!. Perfect place for a lay in the grass to rest your feet. Super chill vibe where people just sit and read, listen to music or chat. Really beautiful park!
Watching the world go by. Relaxing place to spend a Sunday afternoon recharging the batteries. Great for families. Entertainment in the open air theatre

Nice for a stroll. The park was great for a stroll, but with so many other beautiful walks, the park was overshadowed by the canals and some of the lovely streets. However the park would be good for picnicking and birdwatching

A place for everyone. Here everybody meets, so not only locals, but a lot of tourists. It's nothing special about this park, but you can go there and hang out with all the others, if you like that. The Blue Tea House in the center is a nice spot for a drink or a snack (or just a toilet stop for 50 cent).

Lovely . We just popped in for a quick stroll and it was lovely. My favourite time of the year so many people enjoying the place even tho it was a little cold. There is something to see around every corner. Will go again when it's a bit warmer and enjoy an afternoon relaxing rather than a quick stroll.
Between Showers. Great open space with trees,lakes & fountains to take a break from the city hustle just watch out for the cyclists who use the paths as a race track.
on sunny day!. Nice place to walk, run, bike or just having a picnic on a sunny day. nice little lakes and plenty of different places to just hang around and relax.

Yellow Bike Tour Surprise. Ok, this was a GREAT surprise. I took the "yellow bike tour" that found our way to Vondelpark. It was so "out of time" watching the people of Amsterdam enjoy their park by lounging in the grass, laughing and talking. It was a beautiful experience.

Lovely park in the centre of Amsterdam. Can spend many hours here just walking around. It is a lovely park. I found it quite interesting that a large number of green parakeets live here permanantly. They are fun to watch and can be very noisy haha.

Amstedam's equivalent to Hyde Park. Nice charming park close to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. Nice place to unwind and have picnics. As with everywhere in Amsterdam you do have to keep an eye out for cyclists
this park is beautiful. shame i only experienced it during the Amsterdam marathon in pain and in the rain, otherwise it looked "charming"

A must!. I have in amsterdam for 7-8 times now and every time i pay a visit at vondelpark. For a morning run, for a walk, for coffee or just relaxing time. It's close to leidseplain and the casino. In sunny days it's one of the most beutifull sites in the city. Big like!!
Beautiful. We hired a couple of bikes from Mac Bikes and cycled round Vondelpark for the day. A wonderful day out.
Great Family experience. Lots of nice walking area. Saw the wild parrots and other birds. Just a nice, relaxing place to spend an afternoon.

The nicest park in Holland. Always a good vibe..nice people and lot of nice grass to lay back.
you'll find some restaurants and terraces spread around the park.
saddly bbq-ing is forbidden in the park.
In the middle you'll find a public toilet.(€)
Otherwise you can use the several free Eco toilets or urinoirs.

amazing. out of nowhere, and withing 10min walking from the city, located this amazing park, where one can walk, run, enjoy the view or have something to drink. a place to run from the croded city center :)
Vondel park. Great Park , lots of attractions for the whole family, picnics, leisure and family/social events like birthdays etc.

Bike death trap. Got in and struggled to 1) walk around, 2) relax and 3) even leave the park without almost getting taken down by a cyclist. It's more like a high way for high speed bikes. Maybe don't go during rush hour.

Relax and enjoyment in the heart of Amsterdam. It is the biggest park in the city center, always full of people, with numerous art and music performances taking place all year long. It has a few lovely lakes and hundreds of trees which make you feel like being in a real forrest. You can walk there, ride a bike, practice jogging or even yoga, alone or in a groups of people. It is also a perfect place for a picnic with your friends and family, on a grass, with a beer and delicious Dutch cheese. Just go there!
nice city park. Fresh and clean and free music. No homeless or trash like there is in the u s nice to see some happy dogs too
relaxing place. It was a beautiful place, but I expected flowers garden, it was more like garden with small lakes and big trees.

Stunning park!. I remember cycling through vondelpark, and seeing a guy playing a piano (free concert at night - lit by candle light), I remember seeing the parakeets of which there are plenty. If you go to Amsterdam it would be your loss not to have a nice walk/cycle/run etc around Vondel and soak up 'real chilled Amsterdam'!
Stunningly beautiful!!. This park is a little piece of paradise in Amsterdam and perfect for a stroll on a sunny day. It is truly a beautiful park!

Mix with the locals. We walked through this park on a number of occasions between our hotel and the city centre and even in the rain it was a pleasant walk. Lots of different areas, some unexpected surprises (nesting storks and fountains) and a good cross section of users, from school trips to keep fit classes. Cafes and play parks too. A good way to mix with the locals !

In the heart of Dam. Outstanding place to be with your loved one, great afternoon or evening area.
Seat back and watch the world go by....
Must visit if your every in dam.

Nice big park. Grass and flowers need a bit of tlc. This is quite a big park in the south side of the city. It's a very busy park with cyclists and roler bladers. It has a play park and outdooor paddling pool for the little ones. It was busy. Itvs got a few places whete you can have a bite to eat. Sit outside and eat too. Plenty toilets availablebso this is what makes this last bit a bit out of place. We saw a few down and out alcoholics or homeless guys pissing in bottles and behind bushes. One guy pissed in a bottle took it over to a large bin. Emptied the piss into the bin and then yes then had a rake around it for food! Yuck.

Great day out.. Rented out bikes for 15 euro for 24 hours and spent the day at this beautiful park. Loads of benches and small gardens when a break from cycling is needed. Plus a lovely river side cafe/bar for beer and food.

Just passing through . Stumbled across the park whilst out for my morning run. Honestly I've never seen a park so busy. Didn't have much time to take in the scenery as I was just watching the thousands of cyclists that ride through during the rush hour.

Lovely atmosphere. Walked from Dam Square to Vondelpark and found an amazing, green space with loads of different groups, runners, cyclists, dog walkers etc enjoying the warm and relaxing.There was a band playing in the centre which many had stretched blankets out for and were picnicking - in all a very pleasant park well worth a wonder.

It's a park. This is a perfectly fine park...but it's not all that special. The rose garden is nice but there is no signage that tells you how to find it. There are many more beautifully laid out urban parks than this one.

A nice place to visit if you need to fill in time. We walked to the park which was pleasant from Amsterdam central, the hop on hop off tour gets you close to the park. Personally I would not make a special effort just to see the park. It is pleasant and worth a visit if you have time to fill in. It is just a park we found, nice coffee shop there and nice food.
Beautiful park. Definitely worth wandering through even on foot. It's popular with locals having picnics and barbecues on the lawns. Do keep an eye out though as its popular with cyclists too.
BEAUTIFUL PARK. We visited Amsterdam on a very warm day with lots of people everywhere. Vondelpark is a beautiful, shaded and cool place to take a break. Lots of water, trees and flowers.

beautiful. I spent a week in Amsterdam and i think i spent most of my time in Vondel Park, so relaxing and beautiful, no matter how many people were their we always managed to find a little space to chill out an watch the world go by, i really miss it now i'm home :(

Pleasant lively park in the city. Amsterdam has many canals but very few green spaces so on a nice day this park is great for laying about on the grass - Has a couple of ponds, lots of space and a smooth road running through it clearly liked by skateboarders and skater types.Nice place for a stroll in the evening, beautiful when the sun is out.
Open green space in the middle of Amsterdam. Escape from the crazy city in the park. Not far from the Van Gogh and Rijks. Run, cycle, or stroll ... just an oasis away from the bustle of the city.

Great place. Amazing green spot in the city, a lot of wildlife, dogs can run free, really full of people on sunny days. Relaxing atmosphere, possibility to have bbq, really a nice place for a walk, but not only!

Amazing park. We were told to take a stroll through Vondelpark.Very different to the parks that we are used to! There are people everywhere, having picnics and bbq's and just catching up on some sleep in the sun.The park itself is across a very large area and really lovely and peaceful to take some time out of your holiday.
Green oasis. Good place for a stroll after time in the museums - cafe near the entrance serving drinks & snacks too.

Especially good with kids. We were staying really close to Vondel Park and managed to spend a sunny afternoon there. Our 4-year-old was happy to see the ducks in the park and go and play in the children's area while we ate and drank at he restaurant right there.
Very Pretty in the Summer!. We drove bikes through on a tour. It is large and lively on the weekend. A nice place for as picnic! There were many things going on there too.

The "Central Park" of Amsterdam. This beautiful park is great for a relaxing afternoon away from the crowded streets. The park is huge so rent a bike and tour like a local, otherwise you'll be walking for days!Lots of outdoor restaurants along the path and free outdoor music as well. Playgrounds and wading pool for the kids.

A great place to bike ride and relax. Rented bikes at A bikes right near entrance to park (a great place to rent!)Rode around the park to get used to bikes and then again at end of rental because it's such a pretty park. There's a cafe in the center but we did not try it. A nice city park for getting away from the crowds.

Amazing, lively park. So much going on here in summer! 3 restaurants/bars spread out across the park, people walking, running, cycling, yoga classes, other exercise activities. Really impressive compared to the underutilised parks we have at home (Adelaide)

A lovely place to spend your day!. Vondelpark was great! We didn't get to spend as much time here as we would've liked because it rained on most of our trip, but the time we did spend here was lovely. The park was clean, large, with beautiful green spaces and water. We had a very romantic picnic and walk through the park, and still didn't even cover all of it! It's quite large. Would've loved to spend more time reading and drawing in the park. Watch out for bikes!

Sanderson' s walking tour of Amsterdam. What a great introduction to Amsterdam. We booked the free walking tour online and our tickets and instructions were emailed to us. We met our guide Michael and the rest of the group. There were probably 20 of us from all over the world.Michael was a fountain of knowledge, and kept us all entertained with his stories, information and jokes. The tour went for 3 hours with a 15 minute break at a local cafe where you could purchase drinks but certainly weren't pressured to. We went to lots of little places that we probably wouldn't have otherwise seen. This included a quick detour into the red light district. I had my 15 year old daughter with me so certainly wouldn't have ventured there otherwise but it was really interesting to have a quick look, and there wasn't anything too risque for her to see. He also covered the marijuana cafes and how they came about which was also really interesting.Take an umbrella or rain jacket with you as the tour will still go ahead.These tours are run by freelance guides so whilst they are technically free, the guides rely on your donations for their living. You are asked to donate whatever you feel the tour is worth. It really was a fantastic experience and well worth a generous donation. My 15 year old daughter also really enjoyed it, but if you are concerned about your kids hearing reference to drugs, the sex industry and a bit of starting then this might not be suitable for you.Thanks Michael for a great tour!
Spacious. The traverse of the park will take up to half an hour. One can observe a lot of animals here. And good chill in the sun. Dogs are allowed. For sports lovers here offer good opportunities.
Good as nature. This is a beautiful park. It is so big so it takes around an hour to see around and walk. Also good for jogging.

Beautiful park but very busy. The park is extremely beautiful and well-maintained with ponds and fountains. There are many, many people in it though, even on a weekday during work hours, so if you want to be alone I would not come here. There is also a lot of bicycle traffic, which I was fine with but if you aren't used to it, you may find it annoying.

Great place for cycling and walking. Great place for cycling and walking. Rent a cycle somewhere outside vondelpark. Vondelpark3 is a good restaurant to eat within the park. A picnic lunch in the park is also very nice

What a place. What a place.. Located in a walkable distance from museumplein, it's definately worth visiting and spending some hours in this wonderful park! A green oasis in the middle of the busy city of Amsterdam. It' s so big, that it never looks overcrowded, even in Sundays. Don't miss Vondel's statue! Absolutely loved this park

Beautiful. Me and my sister hired some bikes for the day and rode around this park for a good few hours, it was absolutely beautiful! I already wish that I could visit there again. The atmosphere and the people there were so nice.

Amaterdam's most famous park. It's big and beautiful but just like with parks everything depends on the weather. The park has good spots to chill, train, have fun with kids or have a picnic. A lovely place in the heart of the city.
Average park. This park is average. There are a few benches dotted around if you wanted to stop for a rest or maybe a picnic. There were work men, working on the park whilst I was there.

Sit and relax for while if you have some time. This is a very nice park, I enjoyed looking at hundreds of people biking through it, running or just people spending some time there and relaxing, its not a must see but a nice park though
Vondel park. What a beautiful park it is. Rent a bike and take a Trip into the beautiful vondel park. Plenty of toilets and food great things to do go and enjoy!!

Great place on a nice day. Just a few blocks from all the museums, this gem of a user-friendly park, which reminded me of both Central Park (NYC) and St. Stephen's Park (Dublin), is crowded with runners, bikers, walkers and families. Has what looks like 19th C mansion converted into a restaurant with toilet facilities, a small lake and numerous water fountains. A few police on bikes (incredibly friendly) patrol intermittently and there are many places to sit, picnic or just have a smoke. The park is like the city - lovely, laid back and cool. If you are InAmsterdam on a nice day, don't miss it.
Gorgeous park and area around it. Beautiful and really nice area to walk around. The park is so cute! The area offers many things to see and do and it is close to Rijksmuseum.
Beautiful . Lovely Park with lots of flowers and water features. We saw a gorgeous heron. And in the trees there are awesome wooden climbing frames, quite high and fun!

Nice place for spare time. A perfect place to relax after a hard day walking all along the city. There, you will enjoy lakes, grass, trees, wild birds and locals doing jogging, riding bikes and working out in so different ways you would like to join them!

A brilliant Park, loads to see and do (Exercise if that is your want).. Did the Shopping side of Amsterdam, during the week, at a loss for something to do on a Sunday nothing better than a quiet stroll through Vondel park. Bird/people watching nowhere better. We saw loads of Herons, Egyptian Geese, Moorhens, Coots, Jays, Magpies and loads of Green Parakeets. There are cafe's and gelato carts, plus bandstands where groups just set up and play a few numbers.

AWESOME!. This park is to me one of the most interesting parks i`ve ever been to. enormous it`s hardly impossible not to get lost in it. there are amazing wooden attractions to climb and see the park from a higher sight from between trees. dogs allowed, bikes skates rollers... breathtaking. to have a picnic or just a walk. very recomended
Good to visit any time of year. Ideal place in summer to hang out, watch some performances, eat an ice cream, or bike or skate around. In winter a great place for a work-out run or leisurely stroll.

Loved it. . The park is simply lovely. Cafes, water fountains, play areas. Everything you'd need in a park. But also this park is surrounded by wonderful architecture from neighbouring buildings.We hired bikes, €11 for 3 hours. Had a cycle around the park and then made the 2 minute trip up the road to the museum area. I recommend it to you all.

A beautiful walk. This park is different in each corner and easy to find a spot by yourself or follow the many paths that weave around the gardens. There's a lovely coffee shop & a couple of pop up shops along the way
Great Park. perfect for running or just a stroll to be away from the noise but still within the center of the city.

Green oasis in the middle of town.. When you´re tired of all the musea, other attractions and shops, Vondelpark is a nice place to relax. Green trees, lawns all around. Take a nice sandwich from the nearby shops and enjoy a lovely picnic on the lawns.

Always busy but still lovely. This park is really nice. When the Dutch weather permits a visit to the park it is always very busy. Nonetheless this park is lovely. You can always manage to find a tranquil spot. Go for a walk r run. It also lovely to skate here or to go through the park on your bike.
Beautiful!. We lucked out and had wonderful weather! It was so lovely to walk around. Understandably crowded! But really lovely. Would be great for runners and families alike.

people love the sun here:). if you read my other reviews about Amsterdam you will understand that i adore this city…being from LA i had enough of sun in my life, and during my visit Amsterdam was sunny, and my first impression from the park was that locals come here to get as much sun as possible, and this was the only place may be that i did not see the tourists…hmmmm…i love Amsterdam , every corner is special, even this regular park from the first sight is special:) magical city…

Rent a bike and go there. Park is quite big, I suggest going there by bike! There are restrooms in the park (convenient), one can buy food from street vendors and just sit somewhere on the grass and enjoy nature.

Vondel Park. Lovely large green space. Big paths for runnibg, cycling. On Saturday mornings, we saw lots of fitness instructors doing classes. Well worth a visit. This is close to museum quarter also.

Nice leisurely stroll early in the morning. On our last day in Amsterdam we took a nice leisurely stroll early in the morning through the park. Water fountains in the ponds were lovely and we saw a stork's nest with 3 young ones. We enjoyed a coffee outdoors at the Paviljoen Vondelpark inside the park.
Winter wander. Walked through the park on a January morning with bright sunlight but chilly temperature, very enjoyable and easy to find.

Greenery in central museum area. Vast park wtih pools of water and the ubiquitous bicycles - with wafts of smell of marijuana occasionally in corners of park where it is legal. There was a circus-style event going on, and I noted that such things are normal. Definitely a place to wander into ...

Nice place for runners. My hotel was just around the corner from this park. It's approximately 2.5 miles per lap from the entrance on Stadhouderskade. There's no cars so it very peaceful. It can get busy later in the day on weekends as cyclists seem to like this park too. So I did my runs early in the morning at about 6:30am.
Ibeautiful!. We went on a Sunday, and it was lovely, with so many families riding and picnicking. We rented bikes and rode through. So lovely!
Nice park. Nice park which seems to be well kept . Good selection of eating places within . Very popular with the locals
Great to relax and walk beside small lakes. It is very lively when it is sunny. It is great to walk around or picnic or just seat and watch people passing by on their bikes.
So beautiful!. My friends and I had a great time exploring Vondelpark. It was absolutely beautiful and the perfect place to relax and enjoy an afternoon picture.
So crowded!. It's a lovely park...well maintained. But I went there on a Sunday and it was so crowded that it was not possible to find a place to sit down.

Nice park for walks, biking or picnics. We went there before summer and the trees were already green and the birds were already flying about. It's a lovely place for some quiet walks or family picnics.

Picnic and dining. What a great place to grab lunch and go,relax or a picnic and if you would rather be waited on there's lots of food choices available - sometimes a concert or some music to just chill and relax

Beautiful and well located. A must visit, but gets really packed on sunny days during tourist season. Especially after work when all of the city seems to descend on the park for after work picnic of big groups.
Nice dog area on the big field on the western side.

Favourite place. I like Vondel Park really much.
By bike, on foot, it is always relaxing. Sometimes it gets realy-really busy, but never too crowded.
It is just an excellent place to be.
Lush Green. A lovely, lush green area right near the city center. Easily accessible via tram. Great for walking/running/biking or laying in the sun reading a book.
A nice and relaxing walk. I liked the park, nice nature and beautiful lake. Many people are there most of the time, walking, running and biking.

Sunny day at the Vondelpark. It is really difficult to catch a good weather in Amsterdam, but if you're lucky and you have a day off, or at least an evening before the sunset on a sunny day- Vondelpark is the best place to spend your time. All parks in Amsterdam are amazing but Vondelpark is the largest of all. In June you will enjoy the most delicious Linden scent and see the stork nest. Swan- families, ducks with ducklings and lots of other birds are so close that you can take a selfie with them. There is a place for every taste: BBQ -lovers, romantics and joggers.

Good for a Run, Drink, Smoke, BBQ. The main park of Amsterdam, just below the Leidsesquare. It has three cafes; Filmuseum at the top, Blauwe Theehuis in the middel, and the Vondeltuin at the bottom. The Vondeltuin also has a very nice play yard for kids with a big slide. There are three other attractions for kids in the Park; Melkhuisje (Play yard); Tree houses and the Pierenbad (for sunny days). Check your kids for Ticks if your are done.
Beatifull laid back park. This is one of the favorite parks to visit in Amsterdam. You can walk, eat, drink, jog or play with the kids.

A lovely walk with the locals. We had a lovely stroll along this very long park and took the tram back. There are many water features and lots of happy, well-behaved dogs. We ran into an outdoor craft and clothing market which was interesting.

Beautiful park. One of the best parks in the world for sure. A must see attraction on every travel to Amsterdam. See all the activities going arround the park. Enjoy cycling through the park and laying on the grass - if the weather allows that - with a beer or even something to smoke.

Nice Park - Great Place to Explore. Vondelaprk is a lovely park to walk around, jog around, cycle around, sit on the grass, smoke some grass or just chill out. The cafe is a nice place to stop and have a drink or two too

Perfect place to ride a bike and have a picnic . It's really a wonderful park, with playgrounds area for the kids. It's also a good location for picnic and impromptu parties. Rent a bike if you haven't and ride it through the park you'll love it.
Vondelpark open air theater. Every year from June till September various shows (music, theater, dance) in the Vondepark. We visited the ITS dance night. Great atmosphere and good beers.
Lovely park. Beautifu park. You could spend a full day here. Clean and unspoilt. Just watch out for the bikesa s there are no designated bike lanes!

Stoner's Paradise. Vondelpark is a big park in the city of Amsterdam. Since marijuana is legal, the place is one of the most preferred places for smoking pot.
Its very green and well maintained
RELAXING. We bought some bagels and a drink and sat in here for lunch. It is lovely and peaceful - a great place to re-charge your batteries and rest your feet
Great park!. Beautiful with lots of different spaces and uses. This park is very well cared for, but not so much that you felt you couldn't use it. There were kids, runners, walkers and amblers.

A peaceful sanctuary in a bustling Amsterdam. Grab yourself a bike and enjoy the ride out to the gardens. Rest assured the ride around the Vondelpark is more relaxing than the ride to get there. Beautiful and peaceful and delightfully green.

An afternoon in the green. This park is right next to the museum, ideal for a break during the visit. It is the biggest park of the city with a lot of place in the shade of trees. A lot of people meet there that's why there is a lot of animation.
Good on a sunny day. Great way to spend a couple lazy hours on a sunny day. Take a lunch and lay on the ground to take a rest from the busy world.

Lovely park. Loved this huge park. Plenty of lovely scenery & architecture. Restaurants & cafe, toilet facilities, Lakes. Enjoyed the stroll round on a lovely sunny day. Wish I had more time to explore

A Great Place for a Walk. We spent an entire morning wandering through Vondelpark. It was a nice morning, mostly sunny, and we walked from the north end all the way to the south end and back again -- enjoying the wildlife, the scenery and the serenity (even though the park was full of people, some running/exercising, some biking (many), some walking their dogs, others getting from here to there. We commented that if we lived somewhere near a park like this we would go often, to relax, enjoy the view, take in the sights and generally step out the hectic rest of the world outside of the park. This is a must-see when you are in Amsterdam. I can't believe we waited until our third trip to spend some time in the park.
Amazing . My favorite part of Amsterdam. You definitely need to go here if you want to have a good trip (if you catch my drift) haha

the best way to visit Amsterdam local nature!. I am lucky to live a few steps away from this beautiful and lively park. It is my gateway to the centre of Amsterdam, and the best way for my little dog Fiene to walk freely in the City. That is the best, in the park you can learn your kid to bike, walk your dog, jog and boothcamp, do some bbq, and enjoy the city!
Lovely park- pice of heaven in the city. Great for sport, bick riding, stroling, and just breathing in.... Recommended to take the time and the pleasure to visit the park!!
Beautiful. This is a lovely park in the middle of a bustling high density city. We enjoyed lunch in a cafe within the grounds watching dogs and their owners play. A pleasant way to spend a few hours

That's one of the loveliest parks I ever been to. Ok, reaching the park is pretty easy by public transport, the park itself is just wonderful to walk in, sit in, take pictures, if you are a nature lover, or just there for bicycling, you are up for a treat.Well, the day i visited it it was rainy, so wasn't that great, but I bet you'd love it on a sunny day, take a walk over the bridges, and enjoy the small rivers and the trees on the sides.
A nice break . The park was a lovely break from the hustle and bustle of the city with a nice 3k circuit around the outside to walk around and plenty of scenery to take in it was really quite lovely!

Vondelpark. Vondelpark has the largest amount of unique and interesting individuals. If you are ever free to walk around on a sunny Friday afternoon you must check it out. Every demographic is present was during my visits to the park, making it such a wonderful destination. The park itself is beautiful with lots of trees, patches of grass, and there is always enough room but that's because it is huge. Remember your steps as there are a lot of twists and turns.

Lovely!. This park is HUGE and lovely. You will forget you are in the middle of Amsterdam and think you walk throught the woods. Great place to walk, run, ride a bike or just chill and enjoy the sun, flowers and ponds.

Peace in the city. A wonderful park to stroll thru for a break from the noise of the city. Park is popular with bikers, runners and picnickers. Has nice fountain in park and has lots of summer evening concerts.

Fabulous park.. A fabulous park in the the center. So big, green and well kept. I advise you to rent a bicycle and explore this fantastic park. You can stop everywhere for a picnic or a smoke with your love one. Must.

5 days in Holland . Vondelpark was a great Park to visit it was sunny the best day we had. great place to eat and drink in the park. also an open air stage with live music and free of charge. even had an area for barbecue concrete slabs set in the grass great area for picnics. if in Amsterdam must visit the park.
Nice walk thru the park. Great people watching and bird watching. It had just rained a lot so huge puddles everywhere. Had to pay to use the toilets - never have understood that in Europe.

The Central Park of Amsterdam. On lovely days in the summer in Amsterdam everyone heads to Vondelpark. It is breathtakingly lovely and bucolic. Be prepared to ride your bike or walk for a while. It is quite large. There are idyllic streams flowing everywhere, many paths to wander, open fields to run in and play frisbee, and scattered all over are small play and discovery stations for kids to climb and ramble about on. Take your time and enjoy. This is what the natives do.There are cafe's, bathrooms and water parks all over as well. The food is pretty standard, but completely palatable and not too expensive. All of Amsterdam is a bit expensive so it is not really out of line. We loved the city of Amsterdam and its people so much we are returning again this summer and will be spending days roaming Voldelpark!

a break from the gig city. very lovely and pleasant park .a break from the city with a music stage and verity of musicians.at the entrance there is a table of the showsa big and nice park with lake, rivers and fountain.
Have a cycle through . Fabulous park with lots of activities! A must see if you hire a bike in Amsterdam it's so beautiful! The fountains are lovely and it's so clean
Don't Skip Vondelpark!. If you visit during summer, rent a bike, go to Vondelpark, and spend a relaxing afternoon there. Wonderful place if you love nature.
