Beautiful park. Beautiful park especially on a sunny day. I would recommend visiting it before or after going to the Van Gogh museum as they are in the same area of the city. We cycled in the park which allowed us to see it in about 20 min, it would take longer if walking. There are a couple of cafes/restaurants in the park and it is suitable for picnics.
Great morning stroll.... Such an enjoyable stroll through the park in the mornings. Quiet, serene and relaxing. A staple if you are visiting Amsterdam.

A Pleasant Green Break in the midst of Amsterdam. Having finished our river cruise and having time before getting into the hotel room, we decided to wander through the park. It was very nice, lots of green space and water and as luck would have it there were free (voluntary contribution after the fact) concerts of opera and string music that were well received.

It is like Central Park NewYork, transplanted to Europe. Wonderful walking park, far enough 'outside' the downtown belt to be extra quiet. Very close and an easy walk to Hard Rock cafe, and the Van Gogh museum. I highly recommend a quick stop at VP3 for an outside coffee.

What a beautiful hidden garden!. Right in the middle of the city and where you least expect it, you find this wonderful part. Filled with nature, animals, bike paths, running paths, concerts, food, and on and on. So many things to do and very peaceful for a morning stroll.
people watching. lots going on. good place to get a coffee/ sandwich and watch the world go by on bycicles. pathway to the van gough museum.

Similar to many large public parks with very quirky local folks.. It was a lovely day and we strolled all over the park. There were many people on bikes, picnic blankets covered with many young semi-naked men drinking from open bottles of beer and walking barefoot on broken glass in the grass near them. Very strange.. it was a working day but no one seemed to be at work. We stopped at a 'beer garden' insidethe park but it didn't compare to the beer gardens in the Bavarian public parks.
Amazing place to relax. I loved the park's simple beauty and peaceful atmosphere. It was a very good place to relax after a long day of walking in the city.

Beautiful. This is an enormous park that is used by the locals on their time off. From joggers, bike riders, school groups, yoga classes on the grass, to lakes and gardens, this is the place to experience a wonderful part of the real Amsterdam.

so relazing!. My favorite park of my weekend in Amsterdam was sitting and observing people in Vondelpark. My friend and I walked all the way in and stumbled upon a reggae concert in the park that was so cool because it looked like an event that really brought the community together.
When it's sunny, it's busy. City end gets really busy when the weather is good. Try going to the other side (West end). It's a good 15 minute walk but worth it.

Lush park. We initially traveled through Vondelpark on a cycling tour so managed to explore most of it in a short time, there was an amphitheater built in relatively recent times, however no shows performed while we were there. Paid a second Vondelpark one afternoon when the rain had subsided for a few hours, sat by the lake, the ducks were surprisingly confident & came right up to us, I imagine many tourists feed them & they were after a quick meal!The park appeared well kept. There were water fountains scattered about, handy for the runners, & also a porta-loo for when nature calls!
Great spot for a bike ride!. Go ahead - be brave and rent a bike when you're in Amsterdam. We did and enjoyed a really nice spin through Vondelpark on a beautiful June afternoon.

Honestly, an overrated park.. There's nothing special about this park at all - not many things to see, not many animals, just a couple of cafes nearby.It's not even a good place to walk or jog, as so many cyclists constantly pass through the park.

A Piece of Paradise . We came across this Park by accident on the first afternoon we arrived in Amsterdam and visited it every day as it really was a beautiful place to be in. A lot of locals and families obviously loved their Park and spend a lot of time in there. Monuments, fountains, wildlife, cafes and so much more to experience and appreciate. A must visit when in Amsterdam!

A beautiful city park near The 9 Streets. On a beautiful sunny day (80+ and blindingly sunny when we were there), it is a lovely walk after gorging on retail nearby on the 9 Streets. Similar to the Tuilleries in Paris. Lots of green grass and strolling couples or people hanging out casually on the grass.

Amazing place. Yes! There is a quiet place in Amsterdam and it's called Voldelpark. Site is spectacular and and the natural beauty is stunning. A great place to contemplate nature, practice sport, read and philosophize about life.

What a GORGEOUS park. A real treat on a sunny day in Amsterdam.. The park itself is huge and beautiful with many ponds, gazebos, wild birds and meadows. There were also several entertainment venues and beer gardens. We even got to stop by at the open-air stage and see the local ballet practicing for a performance, which was call. The park was full (but not too full) of people sunbathing, playing paddle ball and relaxing with friends. Such a great atmosphere and also very centrally located. Don"t miss this park if you have some time to waste on a sunny day in Amsterdam.
Lovely!. We went walking in this park early on Sunday morning. Great pathways and a variety of ponds, fountains, wooded areas. Nice to see a larger green area in Amsterdam.

Beautiful! . Very scenic and a lovely place for having time to relax within the city but away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam, but you've still got to watch out for the bikes! My friend and I went in with the intention of just having a look around and ended up staying there for more than three hours.
Lovely stroll in the sun. Vondelpark is a beautiful place to take a stroll or walk around. Truly a garden in a busy city like Amsterdam.

Friendly Park to hang out . Went here at the end of a long day walking around the city. Weather was nice and we sat and chilled for an hour with a couple of brews. Just a nice place for chillin and people watching.
Beautiful Park. Excellent place to "people watch" The tulips were out and it was a lovely sunny day - had a lovely walk in this park and walked up an appetite going for pancakes!

Beautiful park to relax. We visited this park in the hot afternoon. Were surprised to see so many people relaxing even under hot sun. There were various activities going around in the park. Small concert, free walking tours, etc. We just walked around the park, there was this huge water body in the park surrounding which many people were relaxing with there loved ones. We grabbed a place beneath huge tree and spent a good time with music in the background (concert).
an oasis in the city. had drinks and canapés here after a busy work day. ideal setting to relax, enjoy the scenery and recharge the batteries

Walk in the Park. Nice sunny day for an amble in a lovely park with ponds and lots of green spaces.
Areas set a side for barb-e-ques, picnics and dogs. A fun spot.

Lovey. Great place to take a walk (or bike ride if you are brave enough). The scenery is beautiful with plenty of places to stop for a picnic or cafe's if you are not so organised. It's peaceful and relaxing and you could forget you are in the middle of a big, busy, bustling city.

lovely park. Lovely park with winding paths, lakes, fountains, ducks. Lots of people were there relaxing on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Easy to get to on a couple of tram lines (I took 2). I was attracted by the idea of a rose garden but in fact there wasn't much to it. Much more interesting was the open air theater where a band was playing. It was free to the public.

A break from crowded streets. It can be crowded in the centre of Amsterdam, and a walk in Vondelpark is therefore a nice break away from the streets. You can walk and talk, you can sit or you can ride a bike on the wide bicycle paths. I am sure children will find it nice too, as there are interesting birds to see like storks and parrots.And it is of course free.

Beautiful Sunday morning in the park!. We spent a beautiful, sunny Sunday morning strolling through this vast and beautiful park. It is well worth a visit and is an ideal place to leave the city behind for a few hours and enjoy the quietness of the lakes, pathways, bird life, fountains and feel part of the outdoor life of Amsterdam. There are several lovely places to have a drink or light meal, and at lunchtime there was a musical concert at the open air theatre. Don't miss the beautiful rose garden!

Great place for all. Vondelpark is a great park for all different groups; families, friends, couples. It has places for people to bring their own bbq's, as well as a cafe that serves food and drink. We rode our bikes through the park which was also wonderful.
Beautiful. Beautiful park to wander around on a sunny Sunday morning. Full of people doing the same, running, cycling. Loads of cafes for lunch. A really enjoyable walk

Most beautiful park we´ve ever been to!. Vondelpark is a vast park and it´s just stunning! Lot´s of very old and therefore big trees, beautiful lakes everywhere, festivals and other free Entertainment. A very good atmosphere, a lovely place to relax on a sunny day or evening!
Beautiful park. Vondelpark is a beautiful park in central Amsterdam, it's a great place for a walk, or bike ride to escape the city. Lots of photo opportunities too. Well worth a visit.
Worth it!. Must see while in Amsterdam! We traveled thousand miles just to see the wonderful art works of Van Gogh and it was all worth it! Highly recommended to all!
Nature in the middle of busy life!. What a delightful bike ride through the park. It was a wonderful break from the hectic traffic of Amsterdam. Live music was very nice.
An oas. Lovely walk in the park. We found a restaurant with ok prices inside. You can walk on the grass or just sit under a tree and relax.
Great park. During a recent visit to Amsterdam we stopped by the park and had a very relaxing time listening to live music and then enjoying wine on one of the decks there.

european adventure 2016. Vondelpark is the Central Park (NY) of Amsterdam. It is SO COOL!!! Walked through this beautiful park on several occasions throughout my stay in Amsterdam. Early morning - very peaceful and serene. Late afternoon - people barbecuing, having a birthday party on the green, simply relaxing. Caught the end of wonderful jazz concert on the outdoor stage in the center of the park...got to enjoy a Heinken from the kiosk while listening! There are different "feels" while walking through this park...there are restaurants right in the middle of the park which gives one a distinctly European feel and then there are "row homes" (from the surrounding neighborhoods) that look out onto the park that gives one a New England/Boston feel. Take a walk and enjoy a special place in Amsterdam - Vondelpark

Sooo nice. Beautiful park, lots of people sitting and drinking on the grass. Also having some sort of disposable barbecue (I guess it can be bought in the supermarket) so check it out if you want to have lunch in the park!During summer there is an open theater.
A tranquil park in the middle of the city. We enjoyed walking through the park. Next time we would hire bicycles to further explore. A gem right in the city.

Lovely spacious park with lots to look at. Had the good fortune to stay in a hotel beside the park. It was a lovely place to relax after sightseeing, and some great birdlife. Lots of paths to explore, cafes, plenty of seats to rest on along the way and trees to shelter under when the showers come!
Great place for a walk or bike ride. We rented bikes at a place just around the corner and biked the park...it's pretty and lovely. A good way to get a nature fix.

Must visit to Relax, eat, run and play. Great park for residents and tourists alike in the middle of Museum Square. Walking distance from Museums. Great Bistro and play areas, public pools inside the park. Great jogging tracks.
Nice. A nice park in the Middle of hectic Amsterdam with different restaurants and cafees. Could easily spend half a day here.

Nice park with beautiful ambience . It is really a nice park with beautiful environment. You will feel like enjoying every moment here. You will see lots of beautiful birds and their chirping will make you feel awesome. If you have a bike, the visit would be more special. You can cover whole park on bike. Must visit place if you have plenty of time in Amsterdam.

Beautiful park. This park is lovely to walk around even on a slightly rainy or cloudy day. It has lots of nice paths that lead off to slightly quieter areas of the park as well as loads of pretty bridges. One of the bridges in the park has lots of padlocks on it for couples. Nice for a quick visit and would definitely recommend.
Best Park in Amsterdam . Simply rent a bike and travel around in this wonderful park. You can definitely spend a few good hours there and have a nice picnic.

A Terrific Place to Run. Whenever visiting Amsterdam I make it a point to get in at least one run at Vondelpark on every trip. With all of the recent rains throughout the region many of the gravel paths in Voldelpark were too wet to run on but the hard surfaces were just fine. As others have pointed out - be very mindful of the omnipresent bicycles. They are EVERYWHERE! And, they all seem to think they have an eternal right of way. Despite this minor aggravation, this is a great place to run in the midst of a great big city. Highly recommended.
A beautiful haven in the middle of chaos :). Lovely,well kept park in the middle of Amsterdam.Lots of cyclists and dog walkers but plenty of space for everyone.Perfect for a picnic :)

Lovely. Me and my partner walked here from the Banksy/Warhol exhibition, lovely park. I was stunned how nice it is, especially with the number of people passing through. Lovely place, may have to bring a BBQ next time after noticing the locals enjoying themselves in the BBQ area. Great place to relax and take a break from the busy town atmosphere.
Travelingsenior70s. A wonderful part is the city to relax, take a stroll or bike ride, or have a picnic. Beautifully designed; ponds; water fowl; statues; waterfalls, etc. "must see".

Green area in Amsterdam. This park is located close to the Museum Quarter. It has a lovely green area to use as a focal point when exploring the area and is also a great place for a bit of a respite from a busy city.
Vondelpark hire bikes. we saved vondelpark for our last day in Amsterdam we hired bikes the weather was beautiful lovely place to relax and unwind and people watch beautiful park

great day. Vondelpark is a great location to spend some nice hour outdoors. We spent lunch in the park during a very nice day, people are very clean and quite. There are some little animals plus it is very close to some attractions. Worth a walk!
Nice place to run. Near our hotel, a foud tihos park excelent! Even in the early morning, with winnter cold was nice to run. Very quiet and clean.

Amazing park . Amazing, beautiful Park with so many areas to sit and relax, have a picnick or just ride around on your bike. We hired bikes this day and it was perfect. Not stressful at all to ride bikes in the park as there's plenty of places to pull over and plenty of room on the road for other riders to overtake you. There's lots of beautiful areas to explore and you can easily spend half a day or more here as we did :)

Lovely place to have a pick nik. Just a beautiful green eye in the middle of the busy city and canals. Well kept and with a lot of vegetation, kids playgrounds and an info point to ask what to do and where.

Nice park. We strolled through this park while staying in Amsterdam... Not far from our the American Hampshire Hotel. Very clean and happy park. Everyone can enjoy this park...seems like the citizens do enjoy it most...all ages!

Beautiful - watch out for the bikes!. A tranquil park, beautiful scenery, but watch out for the bikes!! Treat bikes like crossing a road with cars!! it was nice to sit and relax, but a lot goes on, with groups of people chilling out to music and smoking. It felt safe though, and police patrol.

Beautiful park in the middle of Amsterdam. This is a perfect place to grab a croissant or baguette and some gouda cheese and fruit and go and have a picnic. Lovely serene place in the middle of quite a busy and noisy city.

What a wonderful way to spend an afternoon. Bikes, walker, dog walkers, runners, skateboards, joggers and more....felt very relaxed and at ease walking through the park, it was nice having clean water points to drink from or to fill our bottles. Worth a visit for definite. :-)
So relaxing. My boyfriend and I loved hanging out in Vondelpark, it was so relaxing and everyone just seemed to be having a good time. Good for picnics or hangin out and having a joint.

Vondelpark! Again!. Last year I visited Vondelpark for the very first time! And I have visited the park a couple of times the last year! Love to walk there! Just as a lot of other people! Love to come here! Gives me peace of mind walking around here! Most beautiful place!

Love those Vondelpark days. The park of the 1960s is still visible though the place may be full of people with very different things going on in their heads now. But it's still my park of chocie for relaxing on a summer afternoon when there is nothing to do and nowhere to go. Amsterdam has bigger parks, but this one has history and atmosphere in spades.

Chance . By sudden we found ourselves in this park it was not planned as we were lost but it was a nice relaxing area to have rest and to take photo it is big I liked the lakes inside and birds it is nice place to read and write poetry

Beautiful and practical. We rented bicycles and rode around there, there is restaurants, hot dog, ice cream stands and food trucks. The roads are big enough for people walking, riding bikes, skate boards or rollerblades. Nicest park in Amsterdam
Love this place. A moment of rest, just sitting at a bench and watching people strolling by, skating, snacking... Lovely place
Nice. Great place to chill in Amsterdam. Play football, make a picnic or walk... But nothing special, just a big green area with thousand of bikes (as always)
Walking in wonderland. Great area for relaxing and having a romantic meeting. At weekends there are sometimes live music as were when we were there on saturday.

Peaceful haven in the city. Beautifully kept park, lots of places to sit and relax after a busy day sightseeing or for a morning or late evening stroll. Busy at times, with everyone going about their daily business or getting together in groups in the evening. Immaculately clean and well kept, with regular police patrol cars driving through to make sure everything is in order.
Like Central Park in nyc, an oasis in the city. Beautiful peaceful park to walk through, like being in the countryside in the middle of the city. Very relaxing.
Nice for a stop. Nice place for a stroll, picknick, bbq, watch people, cycle around and jogging. In the centre so easy to come and go. There are toilets too!

Don't mis this park. Beautiful park in the middle of Amsterdam. Very crowdy but even that is beautiful. Many different people relaxing, sporting, biking, taking a terras, barbeque, smokig weed etc. Wonderful to see and a big walk in green environment.

Diversity all over. People on bikes, dogs, roller skaters, runners, people having a picnic, great places for lunch (Blauwe theehuis, Vondelpark 3), children playing and on and on and on. Everything you expect in a big city park. When the sun is in the air, this is a place to be to escape from the city streets. Be prepared, it can be as crowded as the streets itself or even more busy. Enjoy!

Nice park away from the city centre. Vondel Park, is a very nice place for a gentle walk round, nice and level, lots of little water lakes around which some have little cafes, not too expensive. There is a path you can walk on but like the rest of Amsterdam keep an eye out for cyclists. There is a strange statue you must see and make up your mind.A great place to go to take time out from the city centre, and about a 10 min walk you can be at Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum.
Green, green everywhere. Cool green and huge park for perfect evening picnic with family or friends. Nice jogging and cycling tracks. Natural wonder having lots of birds and many small ponds.

Beautiful. I journeyed into Vondelpark on my last day in Amsterdam, and the entire area is just stunning.The park, much like the rest of Amsterdam, is full of people walking and riding on bikes. But for the average tourist like myself, I enjoyed the nature, the buildings and little bridges over water throughout the park.My only advise is to just be aware of your surroundings as the cyclists can sometimes be incredibly vicious if you're in the way.
Walk in the rain. Lovely set up in central Amsterdam. Plenty of mature trees, would love to know some species. Lots to look at and appreciate even in the rain.
Nice place to chill with your partner or friends. The park is a nice walk and place where people hang out and chill. It's a spot where you'll meet friendly locals and visitors happy to speak to you.

Lovely natural park. Lovely park in the city center. Great for sitting and watching the world go by. Very popular with locals. Contains a few restaurants, great for catching a bit to eat or for having a refreshing beverage.

Beautiful park. This park is in the south of Amsterdam away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Here you will find dog walkers, joggers and cyclists and the park is big enough to take them all. Try the cafe in the middle of the park - they do a fantastic mint tea!
Beautiful. A lovely park to wander around on a sunny day. Everyone is so relaxed and it really is beautiful. I would recommend visiting.

Chillax!. This is a beautiful place to relax during a city trip. grab yourself some snacks at one of the many Amsterdam markets, take the Tram or bike or walk to the Vondelpark and just get some rest by the water or in the shade of a tree...
Come here rain or shine.. I came here on the way to the van gogh museum, and could not just walk through as I came to the concert place and Philharmonia orchestra was on the stage.

Best picnic spot ever. Great way to spend the afternoon, picked up a picnic and a doobie on the way and enjoyed the summer sun for a good few hours. People everywhere but everyone was doing their own thing so it was very peaceful.

Beautiful but not huge. A perfect outing when you are tired of all the museums, going around. Just sit and enjoy the nature. We had perfect two hours here, doesn't need long. Small water bodies, parks. You can also use it to perfect your biking skills. There are few eating places and karts to quench the hunger and thirst. No need to go there separately just to see it but go when you are just too tired to go anywhere else. Perfect rejuvenation park.

Beautiful park close to museum district. Our hotel was right beside this park. We went for a walk in the park and sat and watched the locals enjoying the park. They were riding bikes, pushing baby strollers, walking dogs, jogging etc. There is a lovely pond with water fountain that had ducks, blue heron and other water fowl swimming in it. It is a very lovely spot.
A beautiful place. A place for a relaxed walk away from the city car traffic. Still too many cyclists taking away some of the tranquility.
Wonderful afternoon. This park is an oasis in this busy city. We were lucky to have some wonderful weather when we visited this important part of Amsterdam just like Central park is to New-York
Wow. What a treasure.. NL is so lucky to have such a beautiful national treasure like Vondelpark. Take the bikes and kids on a nice day, pack a picnic and spend the whole day in the park.

Must visit in Amsterdam. A walk through the Vondelpark on a nice day is a fantastic experience. Locals are using the park for all kinds of leisure. They may even celebrate whatever with the whole family. There is plenty to see, eat and drink. Best thing is just have your own food and drinks and sit on the grass and enjoy passing people. In summary a must do when spending a couple of days in Amsterdam

Nice and relaxing green park . Nice and relaxing green park. Many people come for visit, excercise and picnic etc.. many entrances connect to local neighborhood which can see more local living and life style..

A lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon. A very well kept and clean park very close to the main attractions of Amsterdam.Plenty of walking paths and cycle ways with plenty of space to enjoy yourself without the fear of getting run over.We were lucky enough to be there over the last weekend in May so there was a Sissy Boy market with plenty of market stands and people with a great atmosphere.

Great jogging park in central city. Very busy park with many cyclists using main roads through as a thoroughfare, so do need to watch for them. However nice place to jog around and some secluded paths off the main roads. I used it for running about 3.5 km for a lap.

Beautiful park in Amsterdam!. What an amazing park this was. My husband and I explored Amsterdam on our first full day there with bicycles, and glad we decided to come here to ride all over the park. It was so beautiful and peaceful, and quite large. Great place for exercise and just hang out for a while. Definitely recommend visiting this park. Riding bikes through Vondelpark was definitely a wonderful memory from our trip that we will cherish forever.
Beautiful. We walked around and ate in the park area. The weather was warm and everyone was out enjoying the great weather. Nice place to just hang out.
Clean and tidy . Grass was cut there was no litter. Nice quiet place to enjoy a spacecake and just watch nature. If you have not much money go relax maybe jog?

Beautiful Park. We were lucky enough to have the sun shining on our trip, would have loved to spent the day here but had other things to do... only got seeing the start of the park and had a quick wander around, would loved to have spent more time there, very relaxed.
Nice visit, but not very special. Pleasant well laid out park. Enjoyed watching all the bike riders and people enjoying themselves. The grounds were not outstanding in any way.

Picturesque, beautiful, amazing, peaceful.. Vondel park is beautiful. Great for taking photos, walking your dog, cycling or going for a stroll. There were people lying down relaxing, walking their dog and having parties in the park. The park is huge. Right at the start of the park there's a bar which had a great atmosphere, drinks are expensive though.

Lovely park. We walked and cycled this park it's 3.3km all the way round. Lovely lake, canal, fountains, outdoor theatre area, childrens play area and picnic and open spaves. Plenty of room for pedestrians, runners and cyclist.

Beautiful atmosphere. Vondelpark is the number one place to hang out on a sunny day. The park is quite big; I have been there two times and I still haven't strolled around the whole park. There are beautiful water and plant elements and you can even forget being inside a large city.
Nice views. You can get to most places from there.But it has it's unsafe areas like anywhere else.I enjoyed my walk.

Refreshing. Vondelpark was a great surprise. It's bigger than it seems and offers plenty of space and, at the same time, privacy on the several spots where we can sit and observe all the life it concentrates.

Check out the Hollandsche Manage Equestrian Center. Hidden Equestrian Center - Hollandsche Manege is right outside the park. Beware of rogue by bicyclists! Have a lovely lunch in the park - good food and nice ambiance.

Peaceful retreat from the busy city of Amsterdam. A pleasant and very pretty green space with lots of paths for walking ( or cycling, running and roller blading). Plenty of lakes to sit and relax by, with a good number of eating places open early. Good place to get away from the busy streets of Amsterdam

Lovely . We hired a bike and went cycling around vondel park and outside area, it was such a good day and I would recommend it to anyone traveling to Amsterdam. The cafe was also not badly priced. Great place to take children as had a lovely playground!

Must do. Have kids? Well get yourself some bikes and get to vondelpark. Excellent playgrounds especially the treetop playground and it's all free!
Visit the kinderkokcafe where the kids can make their own food!
Lovely park. Enjoy a stroll around Vondelpark at anytime of the year. There is a play area for children and a cafe to sit back a take it all in.

Great amenity. This park is clearly used by many Amsterdam residents. It is well maintained and full of cyclists, runners, walkers, sun-bathers, dog walkers etc. It was lovely to sit on one of the many park benches and just watch the people passing by. There are different lakes within the park and I noticed public conveniences at different locations. I noticed a band playing music at one location there.
Great for a walk. The weather was lovely when we visited and we spent a very pleasant afternoon walking round the park and having a spot of lunch

Beautiful, safe and clean!. This was our second visit to Amsterdam and Vondelpark. My husband and I were so impressed with how beautiful, safe and clean this park is, even later at night. I would highly recommend a stroll through Vondelpark during an Amsterdam visit!
Amazing Park. This has to be one of the best parks in the world. Very relaxing, it is perfect for a stroll after walking around some of the many museums Amsterdam has to offer.

Lovely park. large cafe in the centre , gorgeous place to sit and people watch , an open air theatre in the middle, lots of events going on in the summer , lovely place to sit and relax after a day of walking and sightseeing .

Lovely break. Lovely park to take a break from the busy city. My girlfriend and I went here on our last day in Amsterdam just for the fresh air and getting away from the traffics. There is also a market nearby to grab a quick lunch.

Great vibe. The park is beautiful and is a great way to see the locals having fun. They have family parties and kids parties where they decorate an area with gazebos or a tree. There was also a little splash pool for the kids to paddle in. Worth a visit.
Beautiful Park . This is a pretty amazing park in Amsterdam, it is stunning in the sunshine, great for just lounging around with a book and friends. Just beware of all the cyclists.

Cycling highlight. This is a beautiful park to cycle around on a lazy Sunday morning, there are not too many runners and cyclists and the scenery is beautiful. You can take a walk or run around it to, but its large, so if you dont have much time cycling is best.

Great park. The park is a great escape from the metropolis surrounding it. It is very similar to Central Park in New York City, Hyde Park in London and Champ de Mars in Paris. I would relate this closer to Central Park than the other two, but the same idea. A place for residents to get away from the city and enjoy nature. This is a great place to take your dog or hop on a bike and ride around.This is a nice place for children, and something nice to see for free while in Amsterdam. Although the park is not central to the city, it is in very close proximity to the Rejksmuseum.
Beautiful park . Beautiful park specially in the summer I highly recommend a visit. If you have the opportunity rent a bike and go cycling in there.
Nice. So nice to chill out and sunbath and close to everything you need like Starbucks and you can catch the hop on off bus just outside the casino in the lay by ( no sign they are not allowed)
THE Best Park. Don't miss this place, take day off from the museum's and shopping. Counsel located near the museum's is so serene and beautiful that you're going to love it!
Family friendly park. Great place to chill out for all, young or old, couples, groups of young people, families, keep fit, cycle, eat and drink, stroll, play games ....
Beautiful . Beautiful scenery and lovely wildlife. Great place to chill for an afternoon, especially the weather is nice.

Essential visit for those with young children.. It was a hot day so we went to the park for a picnic. There are water fountains to drink from near the gates. Vondelpark is near the museum quarter so a lovely change from being inside galleries. We found a children's playground with sand and climbing frames with a cafe. Very handy for parents to sit with a drink and let the kids play - the playground is great. There are other parts with playgrounds in the park but we had a lovely walk and had no time to visit the other areas. Very highly recommend if you have kids in Amsterdam. This particular area had toilets which cost 1 Euro which I was surprised at as we were customers.

A place good for chilling. Been there each time when I visited Amsterdam. The park is quiet and throughout the whole weekend you can find a lot of people hanging out, saving energy for the evening, or enjoying a barbeque. Once I stayed on a bench (not so many) close to a group of hobos, very friendly and funny, they played music on request for few eurocents - one of the best memory with Amsterdam.

Wonderful place to walk, eat, watch people. Wonderful stork platform-saw babies. Couple cafes. We sat outside and watched dogs jump in water. People napping in grass. Tons of loose dogs (with owners). Ducks, flowers, trees, rose garden. Great vibe. New information stand helpful. A highlight for me.

Lovely garden to walk through, or just sit down and relax. This is the main garden in Amsterdam that is very well taken care of and a great place to relax and unwind after a day walking around Amsterdam

a good place to visit on a sunny day. On a sunny day its a good place to visit, supposed to be the biggest park in Amsterdam and when its sunny people sit there under sun and enjoy themselves. The walking paths are also good and cycling tracks are also there.
Beautiful park. Very beautiful and big park close to the city center. Nice to bike around or have a picnic though at least on weekend was very crowded.

Lovely city park. We went on an early morning stroll and found ourselves walking walked through the park, I had read about the cafe on Tripadvisor so we stopped and had a delightful brunch outdoors watching the world go by
Jog here in the morning. Beautiful park in the heart of Amsterdam. Colorful, happy and busy with the bicycles. Anyway you can jog here in the good fresh air before starting the day.
Beautiful park. Great place near the center for a quite rest or raiding the bike. Very romantic. There's a lot to do at the park with young children.

Beautiful Park. A great park for relaxing or bike riding! Would be great with children too as we saw lots of families in the open spaces. A great central location and could easily accessed by various trams.

Rent a bike and go around!. It is a great idea to rent a bike and ride around the park. Just take it slow and enjoy a sunny day there. You can stop for a little near the Picasso and just see local people getting tan, reading or just walking their dogs. Cool place to rest after a long day walking.

Perfect place to unwind in the city. I loved Vondelpark. It is large, green and beautiful! You can stroll through manicured gardens, walk by the water, bike, run, or just sit, relax, and take it all in. I spent a perfect spring evening here reading in the sunshine with a picnic.

Pleasant way for a pleasant day. It was a Sunday morning and we decided to take a walk through this park. There was a bike roadway and along the edges were dirt trails for people to walk along without fear of being run over by a bicyclist. The flowers were in bloom and their fragrances added to the sensual pleasures of this park. When we got to the large pond, we joined the many other people who were sitting there and soaking up the warmth of the sun. There were so many people and such a peaceful and restful atmosphere. If you need to take a few moments from a hectic schedule of visiting the many sights around the museum area, drop into this park and allow its calmness to ease you through the rest of your day.

Beautiful. Very pretty park! Highly recommend to hire a bike and cycle the whole thing! Very big! Lovely scenes and a few food places! Not much to do apart from relax and enjoy the views but I'm not complaining!

Out for a nice walk, nice ride, or lunch.. A long rectangular park with trails and plenty of open space. Located near the downtown area close to the museums. It appeared to be visited by all age groups.It seemed like a place you would want to check out on your travels to this city. It was free and would be a nice place to hang it seemed. A concert would be good here I think. Looking forward to wandering around through there again on my next visit.
Very relaxing! (rent a bike). Nice peaceful place. Lots of greenery, large/small ponds and lot of people enjoying this park. Rent a bicycle and enjoy the ride!
Beautiful park. A calm & gorgeous park near Museumplein. Lovely place to go for a walk or enjoy some takeaway after a visit to a coffeeshop.
Vondelpark. My husband and I hired bikes and rode around the park, it's beautiful with lots of different cafes to stop off at. You could easily spend a whole day here.

Beautiful Park . I went to Vondelpark on my way back to the hotel from the Rijksmuseum. We were only there for a short time but there were lots of people there on bikes, rollerblades, scooters, you name it. Although there isn't much to do other than relax or workout it's a great place to stop by. The park is filled with vegetation which makes is a beautiful place to be.
Beautiful park 20 min walking from the centre. A great place to take a walk or lay in the sun. Filled with people on every square inch of grass on a sunny day.
A must see. Busy park on a wonderful Saturday. Lots of space to ride bikes, picnic or just walk. Near musuem square. Lots of families as well as tourists.
Nice place to walk. Great place to spend an afternoon after a visit at the Museum District. Rent a bicycle or spend some time running around the nice park or sit down and enjoy the local people

Beautiful. If you spend some time in Amsterdam you must visit vondelpark. Beautiful well kept park which has a couple of bars spread across it. The park also has a stage and hosts small gigs in the park. Good for going for a stroll or having a beer in one of the many beer gardens.

A welcome respite. When you're all museum-ed out and need a break, there is no better place than this. In the middle of the city but once you're in you can hear none of the city noise. Wandering paths and many ponds and new (to us) types of birds. A wonderful place to rest and re-charge.

Nature, Relax, Peace ............ A quiet, sunbathing, playing sports, or maybe a BBQ, you can take lunch or buy something delicious, is the ideal place to spend the full day with family, friends or alone place, transmits a lot of peace, tranquility for contact nature, the park perform various events during the week.

Beautiful Urban Park. We visited Vondelpark during our stay in Amsterdam. It was a beautiful day and we were able to sit by one of the ponds. We had hired bikes and you can easily cycle around the park due to the smooth and even surfaces! Just beware of pedestrians and segways!

A beautiful park in the middle of the city. A must visit, especially if the sun is shining. Vondelpark has plenty to offer, walks, a circuit for joggers and plenty of open space to have a picnic or barbeque.
It you hire a bike, it is easily accessed. Get away from the crowds and hang out with the locals and relax!
Nice Place for a Run. I did a nice, jet-lagged jog here in between rain showers on my first evening in Amsterdam. It's a lovely park with plenty of trees, fountains, flowers, and seating areas.

Great park to go to with kids. Vondelpark is in the middle of Amsterdam and a unique park. It links east, west and south to eachother and i love jogging, or chilling there in the summertime. A must go for tourists for sure.
Good workout place. Impressed with the maintenance and diversity of flora. One should also see how active Dutch people are in the park working out, riding bikes and taking fitness classes.

Beautiful park on a sunny day. We visited vondelpark on a scorching sunny day, watch out for the bikes they are everywhere! We had a hot dog and ice cream as we wandered around past the
Lake and watched the ducks. There were various buskers singing and playing instruments.

Hectic. Came here for some peace away from the madness of Amsterdam...how wrong we was,absolutely rammed and hassled every 5 minutes by pigeons trying to empty their bowels on you or lads trying to sell you beer...not for me
Lovely park. Lots going on! We visited on a lovely warm day. Our friends cycled and we walked. Children having parties. People playing guitars. Vibrant atmosphere. Very busy on a Saturday.
Beautiful park . Bikes and more bikes! A must .. We went biking and had a great time. Go for a picnic or just ride your bike. It's a huge park. Lots of green, water and people on a Sunday. Fun.
Beautiful. Such a beautiful park even in winter time. Such a busy park for commuters, families, people exercising and dog walkers.

Pleasant Park. Very strange this park. For some reason it felt so English, and could have been anywhere in the Uk. Nicely laid out and very relaxing with plenty of seats to watch the world go by. Or just stretch out by the many lakes and water features. You may also catch a concert going on.

Amazing place for picnic or for cycling. We cycled inside this huge park for 45 mins. Its a huge park for small family/ friends picnics and people can walk, jog or cycle without any vehicles. Its brilliant to spend some good time just doing nothing or just cycling. We really enjoyed it.

Good breathing space. Right in the heart of the eating /shopping zone of Amsterdam ,a walk in this park is rejevunating and gets your quota of fresh air.
It's a collective effort of citizens of yesteryears and today to create such a park for amsterdamites
Good family place to visit

A walk in the park. We had wanted to visit this park on a previous visit but didn't have time so as it was a hot day we had a walk to the park.A lot of people were taking n the nice weather siting on the grass and seats, there are ice cream huts to get drinks and in the middle there is a cafe with indoor and outdoor seating.One thing I wouldn't go there in the dark.
Tranquile place.. Nice place to have rest from hustle and bustle of Amsterdam city center. Also nice for jogging of a bicycle trip.
Wonderful Park in Central Amsterdam. This is a terrific park in the middle of Amsterdam that's easy to get to via public transportation, especially the trams.

Beautiful!. We were blessed with great weather when we visited. Lovely to stroll/jog/bike around the park. There are a couple of places to stop for a drink and some food as well.
Very clean for a municipal park. The city of Amsterdam should be proud of that.
Stroll your day away. Beautiful park for a walk or picnic lunch. Close to the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum. Find time to explore its paths.

Love this park!. Our apartment was right next to the park and, as we have two children, we went to it everyday of our five day stay. The Melkhuis cafe has a great little playground and further down there's another great playground, much bigger. Loads of green parrots (!) flying around and herons all over the place too! Lovely little lakes and bridges. Bet it's even nicer when all the tulips are out - we had just missed them.
Beautiful. The Vondelpark is a beautiful park, it's always busy in the summer, but still a great place to sit for some time away from the hustle & bustle.
always nice and clean. just a great stroll. love this park. it's very clean and well maintained. most people are friendly, respectful and give each other space.

The nicest park in the world. Vondelpark, what a magical place! I had the opportunity to walk through Vondelpark in every season, and it is wonderful in the snow, raining when the color changes... Great to have a pick nick smoke a joint and let your imagination fly away. one of the reasons I stay where I stay when I go to Amsterdam is because I walk thought it everyday.It is a most do no matter how cold or rainy it is

You could be in Central Park!. Glorious weather meant that our visit to the park was perfect! It took about 3 hours to just wonder through the lanes. A great way to spend a morning! Should have a brought a picnic but found a lovely restaurant for some lunch.

Great Scenery. Relax hang out, and enjoy the weather, people watching, or some beer or wine. This is a fun location to see what Amsterdam folks do when they relax in a park. It can be crowded in nice weather, and is only a few blocks from the major museums..

Lovely walk. We walked through this park most days enjoying people watching. Be aware of the cyclists they don't take any prisoners they have right of way. It is clean there are outside toilets if you get caught short. There are several cafes. It is very popular also clean.
Lovely park. Nice place to chill away from the noise of the city. You can take a barbecue along and chill with friends or its just a nice place for a stroll

Beautiful park: the further you go the better. ... perhaps because the hoards tourists don't get so far in... it seemed the stoners only just got past the entrance whereas the far end of the park was for fitness buffs. Really pretty with cool trees to climb. Some free toilets but no paper or hand sanitiser. Take your own food and drinks as nearby stalls are stupidly expensive.

big linear park, much used by bikes. Analogies to New York's Central Park are misplaced. Yes, there are ponds and greenery but it is bisected by a big bike route that feels like traffic to a pedestrian. Good for picnics or people-watching.
Calming. Lovely place for a good walk... but be very careful - cyclists are super speedy and don't stop for anyone.

Wonderful open space. We went to the park after our trip to the Van Gogh museum on a sunny Saturday morning. There were walkers, joggers, riders, children and dog walkers all enjoying the park, water and nature reserves. Well worth a trip.
Tour by bike!. Great green space in the heart of the city. Was able to tour by bike which made it even more enjoyable.

Beautiful . Spent the whole afternoon in this amazing Park. Busy pretty much all day but tranquil enough to lay back and watch the world go by. Absolutely massive and immaculately kept. Beautiful bandstand and lake after lake. Definitely a must to visit

Sunny Day at Vondelpark!. lovely park to get away from the hustle and bustle...
ponds and green areas... 3k running track, ball game areas... nice relaxing atmosphere... lovely on a sunny day for a nap and an ice cream!
A mini Central Park. Beautiful, vibrant park, with a wide variety of spaces to do sport, bbq or just relax. A gem in Amsterdam

Love this park!. A beautiful large park in the centre of the city..ideal place to spend a sunny day. Walk, picnic, sit by the little water bodies, cycle, play, sleep, eat, watch the dogs...its got something for everyone.

afternnon walk. we visited the park after spending time in Museum Square. Lovely park. we spent more than 1 hour and could see people enjoying walk/jogging and cycling. We could see lush green area all around. Right place to spend an evening for picnic or otherwise.

Wonderful and exceptional park. You have Tiergarten in Berlin, Hydes park in London and this is Vondelpark Amsterdam. Super relaxed park where you can have a picnic or a drink(cops don't mind the drinking) on a sunny day!
Beautiful Park. We were lucky it was a sunny day and strolling the park was lovely. It was spring time so the flowers were in bloom.

Natural beauty at center of Amsterdam. Nice to spend the time with my friends and girl friends. Very calm and beautiful place. You feel the relax once u spend the time.
Amazing maintenance by Management team. If you have bicylce you can see the entire park, By walk, Its take more time, because it Biggggggggg size.
Pretty. Safe pretty and well worth a visit during the day. Easily accessible from the edge of the canal ring, cycling allowed

Restful and Beautiful . Vondelpark was in walking distance from our hotel. After a day of sightseeing, it is an excellent place to go to rest and be with nature. It is a good place for people watching, or to bring a light snack and relax. Highly recommended to add to your list to visit.
Relaxing and well maintained. A relaxing park with a lake, cafes and an open air theatre. Well maintained and pleasant to stroll around after a big breakfast.
Nice park in Central Amsterdam.. Nice to walk through a good stretch of green park away from the hustle & bustle of Central Amsterdam.

Good place to get away from the busy centre. A beautiful and peaceful park perfect for getting a break of the busy streets. Just a few minutes walk from leidseplein square and easy to find on many maps

Gorgeous Park. We strolled through most of the park and truly enjoyed it. We most loved seeing all of the dogs that were playing in the park. The water features are lovely and well done. The park is beautiful and well maintained. It is a definite must when you are in Amsterdam.

Beautiful quiet spot. This is a lovely place to chill and unwind in if you want a break from the crowds. On a sunny day grab a picnic and head for the lake, lie back and relax. It is popular, but I've never failed to find a spot to read, doze or have a drink in.

Gorgeous. I cycled through vondelpark and thoroughly enjoyed it. I would highly recommend this for people that have hired a bike and want to go out of the city slightly. Had the weather been a little warmer I would have loved to have a picnic.

Nice green area south of the city. Still a wonderful area to walk, run, bike, skate, picnic, see a music performance for free, see an old film, or have a nice lunch (among other good things.
We entered at the main entrance near the Leidseplein and walked in from there.
Didn't see the parrots this trip, though...
Beautiful park. Really lovely park on the outskirts of the city - it's very busy and full of some very interesting characters.

Great park. I wondered through this park by chance, to cut through to another area. Ended up staying here for two hours. There are well-priced cafes and ice cream vendors etc. as well as facilities for bikes. It is good for families, couples and just for chilling out to enjoy a picnic in the summer the weather and scenery. Would recommend visiting when in Amsterdam.
Great park. Nice big park. Bike around and stop at one of the restaurants for a beer. Well kept and great landscape. Great for a sunny day
nice chill for nice day. If you love parks, love dogs around, like to just chill, go there.. it is really nice place in center of Amsterdam..

The garden of Eden!!. One of the pieces of resistance of this great city!! If you wake up feeling nauseous or with an overwhelming hangover my advice is to cut back on partying and take a great breakfast followed by this majestic park. The Vondelpark is amazingly beautiful, and it gives you a notion of the quality of life people experience while living in Amsterdam. You can take the opportunity to enjoy nature while exercising and take some beautiful photos.

A TREASURED OPEN SPACE. It is a long walk from Amsterdam's busy streets, like spokes from the wheel hub of Dam Square, to find quiet countryside. City parks are few. The Vondelpark is close to the Van Gogh and Riks museums. It is a place to seek a place to contemplate on what one has gleaned from looking at so many paintings that one can be overwhelmed.Behind its finely wrought iron gates the park is narrow in its width. Fine brick-built houses dating back to the early 1800's can still be seen through summer trees. High roomed windows give a clear view of graceful young women, wired for sound, gliding along black asphalted paths on roller-skates. Traffic noise attenuated is replaced by shouting, screaming children letting off steam, whilst young city-mums seek to get their skins sun-kissed from spread-out blankets and watch there children of so many different ethnic hues play on the green and russet skins of grass. Whilst other children are content to be told about the different breeds of water birds bobbing up and down on the small central lake.It is a park where on the Kings birthday hundreds of children sit alongside the walking paths to sell all the unwanted bric-a-brac, and with there national ability know how to strike a bargain and make a good profit.It is also the park on this same KINGS DAY when the Dutch Royal House goes walk-about that the air of the park is filled with cannabis smoke and to become lit-up with taking in this mixture along with the aromatic ingredient of Happy Cake. I thought I would try to inhale to seek a path to perception. It was all part of the experience. In winter time the windows of the overlooking houses are closed. Curtains drawn, but in this park the warmer coated skaters arrive and if it has snowed then with all the twinkling lights one can enjoy moments of magic.

Wonderful walk in green surroundings!. We caught the tram which made getting to the park really easy. We had a perfectly sunny day and we so enjoyed watching the locals riding their bikes, meeting up with friends and children enjoying being outside. We enjoyed a lovely light beer while sitting outside a little tea-room that served other drinks and light meals, as well. This is a wonderful spot, full of greenery and fountains not far from the city centre.There are clean public toilets for which we had to pay a small fee. However, there was no entrance fee - so well worth the trip. Lovely escape from the busy city.

Almost missed it!. It was supposed to rain almost everyday of my trip in amsterdam..luckily it didnt happend and we too a tandem bike to go to vondelpark, a beautiful and huge park!You can buy cheese and beers and just go chill in the park
Beautiful park for walks and recreational sports.. Beautiful park for walks and recreational sports. It's very clean and well kept and close to town. Great neighbourhood
Nice park to relax. This is a big park in Amsterdam that is very nice and relaxing. There are special areas where you can grill, small cafes and fountains.

So nice. Go biking to voldenpark. Take with you some juice and sandwich in a sunny day. So nice! Go to the very end of it, there is much less people. Walking tourists only cover the first half. There is a very nice hexagonal park at the end as well, you can see it in google earth.

Sunny day to soak up the atmosphere. We'd pretty much walked the city the previous two days so when we had some sun we spent a couple of hours wandering around, having a cold beer and people watching. Well worth a trip to kick back in amidst the city bustle.

Walk in the park . Nice massive park for a stroll. Didn't do all of the park, but what we saw was nice. There's cafes to stop at and toilet facilities too. Even allowed bbqs in designated areas of the park.
Perfect place for a cycle. I spent a lovely hour cycling around the park on a spring Sunday morning - lovely trees, birds and great to watch Amsterdam folk taking time out to relax

Beautiful place to walk around. This is a big, beautiful park near the museums to walk around. It is a nice stroll on a nice day. You can pack a picnic and sit and people watch if you just need a relaxing afternoon away from the tourist crowds.
Beautiful!. Scenic and dream like.Old meets new world.Lovely people! Picturesque location for amazing photo-ops! Not too many culinary opportunities would be the only drawback!

Pleasant afternoon in the sun. Nice park for walking or cycling. Lots of tourists & locals enjoying the weather. Groups of men drinking did get a little loud and intimidating but generally families out enjoying the sun.
Gorgeous park. Everyone just hangs out here. So cool. Its really big and hey watch out for those bikes. I just sat by a tree and then a fountain. So peaceful. Other people gather and play music.
Lovely Walk. Just walked through the park but it was very pleasant the ca fed looked good but didn't tr y them yet maybe another day I'm sure we'll be walking this way often during ou stay

Chill at the park. Great park. Lots of space to hang out.
Broad streets for a bikeride.
There are public toilets.
It's close to the city center of Amsterdam

A place to chill. The park is a great place to get away from it all and relax in lovely surroundings
Not any quick places to get a drink or ice cream though
June. Nice green space close to the museums and ideal for a walk. An escape from the hectic pace along the canals. Good spot for a picnic
A retreat from the bust city. Pack a lunch, get a bike and lounge next to the fountains and have a picnic. Make sure to circle the entire park.

Nice park for some leisure time. It was near our hotel, but as we had only a few days in Amsterdam, we just took a short walk through it. If you're staying for longer, keep it in mind as a great place to relax, maybe have a picnic, and escape the hustle and the bustle of central Amsterdam.
Trashy park. There was a lot of trash on the ground in the grass. Maybe because it was very sunny and bussy in this park, but we would recommend to clean more often on busy days
Beautiful park. Enjoyed cycling around this beautiful park on a lovely sunny Sunday afternoon. An oasis of of calm amongst the vibrant Amsterdam atmosphere,
Brilliant park. Always a highlight of visiting Amsterdam - great park to relax in and always something going on, with excellent shopping on neighbouring streets
It was a beautiful day. Great park to ride a bike around or hang out in the grass. Everyone was out enjoying the beautiful day.
Bbq. Nice people of Ámsterdam you can bbq every day ir the weather is good also take a walk and do some sports

Nice. This has very high ratings and is often compared to Central Park in NYC but I didn't think it came close. It was very relaxing and beautiful with several paths but nothing out of the ordinary aside from the special bird stand and the small fountain show.

Beautiful day for a walk. A beautiful park on a nice sunny day. Lots of bike riders and people just chilling out in the grass. An easy park to walk around and enjoy. Went in and out of some of the entrances and looked at some of the beautiful architecture nearby. A lovely break from a hectic morning

Worth a visit. Arrived in Amsterdam on Friday night and woke up early Saturday morning staying in the Park Hotel next to the Vondelpark and decided to talk a walk through the park as the weather was good.It is lovely place to get out of the crowded city centre and a bit of open space, although because of the weather there was plenty of runners and the obligatory cyclists.Worth a visit if you have enough time.

Good walk and relax . Whatever you want to do in the park whether it's cooking, chilling out, walking, playing you can find people doing all sorts of things and there is enough space for everyone. Must do in Amsterdam
Nice Park. The park was situated behind our hotel. It was a nice walk through but will be even nicer once the weather gets warmer.

Relaxing time. We enjoyed a perfect sunny afternoon in this beautiful park, lying on the grass. Although loads of people around you still feel the calmness of the surroundings. A must visit especially after a hectic day :-)

A beautiful park. A beautiful park near the city centre, just next to the Museumplein. The park is fairly big with a lot of space, interesting little corners and some cafés. Great place for a picnic or just a walk away from the noise of the city.

Vondel park. A nice stroll through the park . Ideal bike ride for whole family. The gardens were poor. Disappointed at the level of tidiness. The gardens are not maintained professionally like many other parks we have visited on our travels through Europe.

Lovely peaceful space. The park is just outside the centre of Amsterdam. Approx half an hour to walk from end to end.
There are several cafes inside and lots of trees and lawn areas.
Amsterdam is not a noisy and boisterous city but it's still nice to get away from the hubbub.
Very highly recommended.
Lovely. Lovely big beautiful park! After a long day is it a lovely place to come have a pic nic or people watch lol. It's very lively, vibrant great place to take the family or just solo or a couple

Perfect way to spend some time. Vondelpark is a massive area of green space in Amsterdam, and is the perfect place to stroll and contemplate after a visit to the Van Gogh museum! There are lots of hidden gems in Vondelpark and it's well worth a visit.

Lovely!. Vondelpark was a beautiful pllace to stroll through and enjoy some quiet time after being in the city. We stopped and sat on a bench by the fountain and just relaxed after a busy day. Recommended for a scenic view of Amsterdam!

Suns out guns out. We were lucky to have the sun shine on the Saturday we were in Amsterdam and the locals were all about it in the park. It is a beautiful Park filled with dogs and groups of people and beautiful scenery!
Lovely park!. Came here on a sunny Friday afternoon and despite it being quite busy, it was lovely, peaceful, and beautiful. Lots of places to sit and chill

Great place to cycle around!. Lovely park with music, water features and plenty of paths to cycle/walk around. Lots of restaurants in the park. Good place to cycle around if you are nervous cycling in the traffic!

Great walk . Such a pretty park that has been well kept and maintained. The main walk way is quite busy with walkers and of course cyclists, but there is so much room and other walk ways that this doesn't matter.
If you loose something there, it could week end up on the lost and found sculpture. Pic attached.

Green place. A large green area in the middle of Amsterdam. It is close to the museums area, you can walk, run, ride your bike, skate, practice gym on grass etc. You can picnic and even barbecue provided you leave the place clean. And on top it is one of the seldom places where pedestrians will not run on by those aggressive cyclists! Definitely a must to share friendlyness with easy living Amsterdamers.

Enjoy a good walking!. Good choice to stroll alone or with your family. Good space, many trees to take your time relaxing under shadows or just stop by the ponds. Beware if you need toilets... You don't have many options.

A beautiful, very extensive park.. Just west of the Museumplein, this gorgeous park is a perfect place to relax after the intensive experiences of the nearby museums. The Amsterdam citizenry love it too. While there are bike paths, the cyclists were not nearly as abundant in numbers as on the nearby streets. The birds are varied, as are the people. The landscape architecture is very inviting.

Beautiful!. This park strolls from the Hard Rock Cafe area of Amsterdam through to the far side of Amsterdam, away from dam square. Our hotel was situated just off one of the entrances/exits to the park, so we strolled through here from our hotel to the centre.It is such a beautiful park and is very well kept despite being so busy. As the weather was beautiful, there was lots of BBQs, cyclists, runners, dog walkers, smokers, even people doing yoga! It's lovely to stroll through and even make have a spliff here (when in the dam!) or a beer and just chill out for a bit if you have the time!Highly recommend.
Nice green space. We had a quick wander through after the Reiks museum and found it a nice place to relax and walk. There is a nice lake where you can feed the ducks.

Amazing park. A must visit in Amsterdam! Was the best part of our trip. The park is huge and so much beautiful! We could stay there forever. There were dogs playing, and lots of places to relax yet have privacy. Would love to come back to this place.
A walk in the park. Impressed with the quality of the park. We were lucky with the weather which brought out all the locals which added to the atmosphere. The market was crowded.
Perfect for a sunny day! . Grab your bikes and take a stroll around this beautiful park! We went on a Saturday and there was a flea market with live music. Enjoy a Heineken and chill out!

Amazing place in the city . Of course this place is very popular as it is a lovely setting in the heart of the city. When the sun comes out everyone is here. Groups of friends, families, people out for jogs or cycling. It's clean and absolutely huge so room for everyone when they want to enjoy the sunshine !

Beautiful and interesting park. So many features to explore here! We were there for hours with our 1 year old who loved it! Ducks, birds, ponds, fountains, a shallow water pool with stepping stones, many playgrounds, gazebos, gardens including a hexagonal rose garden - you can come back over and over!
Beautiful park. It is the perfect place for a break, a drink or even a barbecue. The barbecue area is really nice but make sure to go early in a sunny day because it becomes crowded.

Nice place to rest. If you have luck as I had, you're going to rest by laying down in the grass, feeling the sun in the skin together with the fresh air of the city. Ah, there is a good hot dog nearby rs...
Happening place in the evenings. So much going on in park. If you like to run, walk, cycle or just enjoy the beautiful surroundings and have a picnic and watch the activities, this is a nice park.

Missable. The guidebooks made this sound like a must-see, but I disagree. If you can't do for a few days without seeing some trees, maybe make the trek over here, but it's really not that much to see. It's small, for one - it's much much smaller than Central Park in NYC. And there is not much to see or do there. We had planned to rent bikes, but there are no bike rentals in the park and the ones nearby closed at 5pm (in April), so that was a no go. But it's just as well that did not work out, because in a short time, we had walked through more than half the park on foot and were nonplussed and ready to go. It's a pleasant park, but it's not a destination.
Nice place to get away. Handy park to head to get away from the hustle and bustle. Markets and concerts on the weekend are great too. As with anywhere in Amsterdam beware of bikes.
great park for all. Vondelpark is amazing. Full of joy, nature, nice bars and this in the mere center of Amsterdam! Definitely a must visit when you are in Amsterdam

Great place to enjoy the nature. Beautiful park. When we were there, it had been a bit cloudy and cold but still, the atmosphere was very pleasant. Stunning nature and plants. Don't miss the cafes scattered throughout the park and enjoy a cup of hot drink.

Beautiful park.. This park was so beautiful to walk into. They have a little tulip island but unfortunately it was closed when i went. It is practically a gazebo where you can go into and its surrounded by tulips. Other than that really pretty park with lots of greenery. I only went because it was right next to the hotel i was staying in. Otherwise, it is not a must see in Amsterdam unless you have lots of time to do so.

Worth a visit. Very pretty park that is good for a stroll and replacing on a sunny day. If you want to see all of it a bike hire might be a good plan. There are a couple of cafés in the park. We only went to one but it was good.
Beautiful park - lots of dogs running around. Really nice during the week. Gets a little crowded on weekends. You'll see lots of wild parakeets all around the park.
Great place for a walk, run, or just to hang out.. A lot of young people hanging out - drinking, grilling, and relaxing. A wonderful place for a stroll after the visiting the Rijks museum.

Beautiful park, nice place to eat and drink on a sunny day. I cut through Vondelpark riding to town. If the weather is good it a nice place to catch some sun.The Duchies will hang out there, some doing exercises, some just hanging out and chatting. There's a few places to grab some food, with a little beer garden at the western end (there's also a pretty cool looking playground there if you've got kids) and cafes closer to the middle too.

Special place in Amsterdam. Great place to walk or ride bikes. Beautiful park with loads of space, a real haven in a busy city. Definitely worth visiting, riding bikes through the park was one of the highlights of my visit to Amsterdam.

If nothing else go and watch the morning commute. Twice I took early morning walks here while my daughters caught up on sleep some. It is a pretty park with many nice trails but go around 8 a.m. and watch all the people going to work and taking their kids to school on bikes. I saw kids STANDING on book rakes while a parent pedaled, kids in cool looking wagons in the front of bikes, bikes loaded with 3 kids, etc. Very entertaining and there is a beautiful movement and synchronicity to it all.

Busy little park, better the further you go from the centre.. We went twice - once on a sunny weekend when it was absolutely heaving with people, mostly young and well-behaved. The second time was better in mid-week, with fewer people. On both occasions the better end of the park is at the south-west (the end further away from the centre of Amsterdam), where you can find some tranquil spots. But the park is rather narrow, so it's hard to think yourself far away from the city bustle. Bicycles are ubiquitous in the park, so it is not a refuge from them either. Not one of the world's great parks, but not a bad place for a stroll either.

Nice. If you are in amsterdam and the weather is nice I would recommend to take a walk through Vondelpark, you cannot do much here except from wandering around but it was one of the nicest wandering arounds I made in amsterdam.

Peaceful stroll . Very pleasant area to walk around during good weather. It took ages to find the park however, especially from Anne Frank's house! But it was worth finding as it is a nice, peaceful place to walk around and kill some time

How do you fade this!. Not sure how to rate this.. Amsterdam is a very open minded place. This is a very busy area with plenty pubs and cafes. There seem to be a very mixed crowd just mingling. Of course the girls in the windows are intriguing! Each to their own I guess.
Huge park. You can definitely go for a jog, walk, picnic, whatever outdoor easy going activity you can think of. It's a huge Park with nice greenery around.
park. nice park, good for walking and cycling. But there are a lot of cyclists like everywhere in Amsterdam. It is thought to be the best park in the city. Good for a walk if the weather is good.

Great place to jog or walk. This is a lovely park for an early morning jog or a walk at any time - lots of ponds and features, and a few resident herons! This is a quiet spot to take time away from the busy city, popular with locals and tourists alike.
Great well used park. We spent about 3 hours wandering around the park and could easily have spent the full day, great relaxing place. Unfortunately we were too early for their renowned rose display.

MUST VISIT WHEN IN AMSTERDAM. This park is outstanding to take a nice peaceful walk...its huge and has many entrances....it has a lake ,public toilets,small eating stalls.Its nice to rent a bike and cycle here.

Best park. Awesome park placed in center. A place to relax after a visit to a smartshop or cofeeshop :-D
Per Erik

I am Amsterdam was there. Nice atmosphere, lots of people and green everywhere. It was nice to walk around and relax. I also wanted to take the picture at I am Amsterdam sign and it was there at that time. But I would still go there :)
Relaxing. Amsterdam can be quite noisy and crowded. This place is a great place to relax for a while. A must see
Gorgeous place to relax. This park is a gem. We loved strolling along, taking in the sights and people watching. Great hideout from the city to unwind.

Purpose-built building with a great collection. The building is modern and exciting and the Van Gogh paintings very well displayed and explained. There are enlarged extracts from his letters to his brother and a few paintings by his contemporaries. The opening line-ups are very confusing : first in are all those with tickets. When they are all in , the box office opens to change vouchers and passes into tickets and when they are all done, the ticket buyers are allowed to step forward > Do NOT confuse a voucher or pass with a ticket !

Great place to escape the madeness of the city. We went here to get in some nature, relax and destress. It is a nice place to walk around, sit on a bench, people watch and get away (mostly) from the crazy bicyclists!!!!

A great park!. I wish we had parks like this in England!A huge park that is really well kept and something for everyone. It’s a nice contrast to have such a large tranquille park in the middle of the hustle and busstle of Amsterdam. There are numerous lakes with fountains and birds aplenty, with a number of bars that serve snacks as you wak around the park plus swings and slides for children.We travelled on a Dutch bank holiday so there were additional attractions with a concert taking place on Saturday and Sunday with more entertainment on stage on the Monday. A great place to spend a couple of hours to relax.

Peaceful, green oasis within the hustle and bustle of the city. Be careful of the bikes! But seriously, enjoy a stroll through Amsterdam's green oasis. There are plenty of benches to kick up your foot and plenty of spots to enjoy an impromptu picnic in the grass. It is a great diversion when you would just like to get away from all of the bustle and traffic in the city center.

The place to chill. In the summer, most of the Amsterdamers gather there. There's often free concerts and events organised there.
Please don't walk in the middle of the bike lane....

A Family Place in the City. This was a nice place to visit to see the families of Amsterdam at play and leisure. We took a nice stroll then stopped on a convenient bench to watch the people jog, play soccer, picnic and sunbathe. We left when a chilly wind came through. But it was great to see informal gardens and ducks and geese throughout the park.
Lovely park. Lovely park for walking, biking, or playing. We also stopped at the Melk Haus for a wonderful apple pancake.

Place to relax in a big city. Park is very close to Museumplein and the Marriott Amsterdam hotel. Visited on a Sunday afternoon. Great place to walk or to just sit and enjoy the garden. Several places to eat but were full.

A much to crowded park when sunny. One of the few parks in Amsterdam centre, which makes it incredibly overrated. When the sun shines, entire 020 will end up here. If you want to have some privacy, be here before 11 in the morning, or just stay away... This doesn't mean it's not a fun park to hang out, but it's not that great either. A lot of bikers and skaters on the road which make it difficult to leave your toddler strolling by themselves. You really need to be careful with small children and/or animals..In my opinion; way too many locals and much more tourists.
Quiet Beautiful Park for afternoon stroll. Vondelpark was right across the street from our hotel..the Piet Hein. Felt safe walking in park day and night. Beautiful even in February.

A part in the bustling city. This park is good if you want to get away from the traffic and endless streams of people walking all over the city. There are some areas to sit and relax and reflect of course. You will forget that you are in a big city while in the park. Me I prefer to just walk all over the city and stay in the thick of it though.
Stunn8ng . Gets a full Mark for clean safe and great atmospheric walk. Roller blade or hire a bike east to not get lost here.

Spend a Lazzzzzzzzzzyyyy Afternoon here. Lovely little park with so much to see. Perfectly silent and relaxing and a great place to spend an afternoon here. Try and visit when they have the Tulips display.. it's absolutely a treat!

So much fun!. I actually hate beer but this experience was excellent and enjoyable. My friend and I learnt about how it's brewed, how it came about and other interesting facts. Even if you don't like beer, it's a cool place to spend an hour or two
Very pretty. Lovely and we'll kept park in the city if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
great park!. this park is awesome!! some real interesting things in the park, like the Picasso, yes he left it there and donated it to the city of Amsterdam. Great spot for a picnic also

My backyard!. Loving it. Recently renovated. When the weather is nice the park is full with runners, skaters, walkers...anyone. When the weather is great, the whole park is great with parties, barbeques, drinking, laughter. I love my backyard!

Lovely park with everything in it. I took a walk around the park on a sunny weekday with my wife. It is a really pretty park, and is very lively with activity but not crowded (at least not mid-week). I was on a weekend get a way with my wife but this is the one time we really missed our kids as they would have lot's of fun. As it was only us grown ups we still enjoyed our stroll, looking at all the green ponds, fountains and flowers and soaking up the atmosphere, a must for a sunny day in Amsterdam.
Nice big park. Really nice and clean park with a ot of things going on. Nice to stroll around or just have picknick and enjoy watching people and the nature.

Good place for picnic. Park is located in central area and size is big. At time we visited it was not so well taken care I mean bushes were looking wild not well cared. But there is plenty of green area to spend day with your friends with food and drinks. Also services are available. As well as open theater in Summer time. Also great place for jogging.

When visiting Amsterdam, don't miss Vondelpark!. I have visited Amsterdam several times for both business and leisure. I never miss visiting Vondelpark. It is a perfect slice of Amsterdam. Very beautiful and always filled with folks enjoying the outdoors in all ways

Great break from the city in the city. Another oasis in the city if you are in for some air and space. The park is large. Great on a nice day. Few places for drinks and food but you might as well bring your own and have a picnic on the grass!
Beautiful in spring time. Visited it couple of times during the autumn, in spring it is even more beautiful.Recomьend for everybody!

Picnic in the park. Lovely park and a great way to spend an afternoon in the sunshine away from the bustle of the city that surrounds it. Take lunch in with you to feel that you can totally kick back and relax without out a care of what to do next taking the time to enjoy the relaxed environment. Lots of winding paths to follow and plenty of grassy areas to sit and watch the world go by. Get a bike out an cycle around the routes within the park or stop at one of the cafés for a refresh or grab an ice cream. Only down side are the toilets (make sure you have some tissue and hand gel, although there is one toilet (opposite the band stand) that is a pay as you go which is clean and accessible.
