Spring tree and tulips especially wonderful but the park should be lovely year-round.. If you need a break from museums, traffic, and press of people, head for this delightful park. Water features, beautiful plantings, wide paths for walking, running, and biking.
Or just sit and people watch!

Beautiful and very popular. Very popular and lengthy park! Popular with both visitors and the locals for dog walking, running, biking etc. Sadly it was wet when we visited, but the potential is there to see for a lovely picnic! There are a variety of winding routes good for children and pushchairs and numerous ponds with wildfowl and lots of variety of shrubs and bushes all very fragrant.

A bit too busy and full of looney cyclists. The park is an attractive open space with lakes and tulips but it is very crowded. Pedestrians need to watch out because the cyclists come from all directions.
Pleasant. We took a walk through half the park in the rain. Very pleasant with lots of different birds and people with their dogs. Nice diversion before/after visiting a museum.
A great getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city!. Lovely park to walk in ,well kept ,clean and with wonderful pathways.Quite large and only a short 15/20 minute tram ride from Central Station

Great park to walk in. What a great park to wander about when you need a break . Lots of people using this park it feels very safe and is really clean for as many people use it. There are several different places to eat here as well.

Natural beauty as far as the eye can see. This park is the most beautiful inner city park I've ever visited. If you're going to go you have to rent a bicycle and go through the full park. Lots of great cafes and parks. Beautiful ponds and a lake, don't miss it whilst you're there
The central park of Amsterdam. A relaxing walk through this park is definitely worth it if you've got some time in Amsterdam. Bring some food and drinks, and go lay out on the grass and enjoy!

bike through park. we had planned before to hike bike even though it seems dangerous but no matter we just did it. One of the memorable trip abroad. Plenty of lakes also some children playground. Food and cafes are available
Beautiful green area. This is where tourists and locals come to experience the lush and picturesque park with joggers and cyclists taking advantage of the paved path around the park.

Beautiful active park. Walked from our hotel through the park multiple times. So many people having picnics after work, riding or walking around the park. Well kept. Didn't stop at any restaurants in the park, but they looked good.
Time to recover after visiting the nearby museums. A good place to escape the city or recover after visiting museums.....we had a short walk and enjoyed watching locals relaxing in the park.

A must seeing in Amsterdam!. Went for a walk in the park a sunny Saturday. Wonderful park with a lot of people relaxing on the grass. Kids running around. People having coffee. A must-see when visiting Amsterdam!

Great park. Definitely worth a visit top this park especially in summer. Lots of buzz and a nice place to relax and hang out with friends or family. There are random cafes inside which are fun as you stroll around.

lovely park!!. We visited vondelpark in November last year.as our hotel was only around the corner we decided to go for a walk and came across this park. Lovely place to go for a walk. Very peaceful and clean... Deffintley go for a walk here :)

nice but crowded. We needed a breather from the museums so went here. Lovely spring day and, I think, it might have been a weekend so it was crowded. Tons of people. Groups cooking on BBQ. Overall, nice but not if you are looking for some quiet.

Good city park. Vondelpark is placed in the heart of Amsterdam. Some might say it is quite narrow but that does not take away from its charm. The place seems to be well mainrained. People enjoy their walk and cycling there, so you should be carefully of some idiot bikers in there as you should in other places of Amsterdam too.

Relaxing oasis in the city. I like visiting parks just to change scenario for a while during city trips. This park is quite lively and beautiful for a relaxing walk or even get some tan if the weather is right.

Central Park of Amsterdam!. A huge, beautiful, fascinating park in the middle of the city. If you are visiting Amsterdam, this park is the perfect spot to have a 30-60 minutes break and just chill and relax. Just bring something to eat and drink, find a place by the water to sit and just enjoy the park. There are always lots of people in the park, but it is never too crowded. If you are lucky you can even see some musicians practicing or some street artists performing. When it is time to leave the park, don't forget to check the nearby streets. There are lots of luxurious houses and beautiful buildings.
great place when events. the park is always in for activites and fun, lots of festivals, settled in a nice beautiful neighbourhood

Great park. We walked through during a layover and were not disappointed. It was nice leisurely walk amongst the green grass and birds chirping.
Nice break of pace from the busy week.
Width I had more time there.
Beautiful Park. Beautiful park and surroundings- great to experience by bike= bring a snack or a lunch and sit and enjoy the sights- sometimes musicians will be along the park- truly a sight to see.

Have a picnic in the park . This park is great!
You can have a picnic on the grass or rent a bike and ride around the park
You can feed the ducks, sit with a book or lay down with your favorite playlist and enjoy the atmosphere

Lovely spot amidst the hustle and bustle!. Walked through the park several different times. The most memorable was on King's Day when the children set up their secondhand sales spaces, games, and food. It was fun to wander with the crowds dressed in orange. The park is lovely with a couple of restaurants, beautiful greenery and flowers. A great respite when you're tired of the crowds or the museums are too overwhelming.
Beautiful Walks. Great place to walk and ride a bike. The park has several lakes to walk round with wild life. Live music was playing when we were there.
Lovely park. We took a lovely stroll through the park for fun and we loved it! There are plenty of places to lay out so make sure to bring a blanket to lay on and enjoy the weather!
Countryside in the City. A lovely stroll for Half a day stopping for refreshments en route.Trees, lakes, fountains and play areas--- a haven of country side in busy city.
a very hip and trendy park. for park lovers and people who love to people watch. it's teeming with crowds of people doing different things. relax, bike or run at this park.

Best part of Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a city known to most (in my circle at least) for its pot shops and drinking scene. Vondelpark is a nice escape from that and the chaos of the city center. I spent the afternoon here watching locals enjoy the sun. It was beautiful and authentic!

Relax out door . The park is huge . Filled by lots of relaxant corners. Best out door choice is you are fan of out door activity. Get some drink ,snacks and make your own picnic day with family .very advisable for those seeking who live last in city like me. You will enjoy the natural and will give you post

One of Amsterdams best amenities! . One of my favourite places to visit while in Amsterdam, been here every time iv travelled to dam.
BBQ, music, drinks everything you'd want on a summer's day.
Quiet and Fun Spot. Lovely park to go with friends to relax for a couple of hours during the sun. The park is quite large and there is a lot of space to relax. You could also ride the bike.

Love this park!. I live in Boston and this park reminds me of Boston gardens on steroids. It's a lovely park for a run/ walk or a meditation by the pond. Lots of people running and walking dogs.. It's very peaceful yet in the heart of the city.
Beautiful park. A nice place to take a stroll and relax. We also sat down in front of the lake and enjoyed the nice weather.
Lovely park on a sunny day. Lovely large park for walking, throwing a frisbee, and of course having a picnic. Worth a visit even if just for an hour.

Greenland at the very heart of the city. It is a wonderful option for a day out in Vondelpark to walk , run or ride a bike with family and/or friends / kids.. You can stop by to watch a roving ballet performance by young ballerinas on any corner , or another young artist making his music may surprise you fır a moment. Besides all various kind of snacks available inside the area such as hot dogs or haring, ice cream...up to your taste . Enjoy ! if you can find a shiny weather or not!

This is an excellent walk as it is 2.5 km. This is a lovely family park and a nice walk, you can go here to relax and have your lunch as there seems to be a shortage of benches all along the canal so unless you actually sit in a café outside you have to dangle your legs over the canal
Very Lovely Spot. Very nice area to take a rest from all that walking and cycling! Picnic, hike or bike it's just hard to find a spot that isn't a visual feast!

Nice Park to walk around and see the city nature. Lots of tourists and local people having fun. It was special for me since I visit there with an old friend for the first time we met. The park is full of life and bikes, just like the rest of the city.

A beautiful walk. As this was very near our hotel we took a relaxing stroll there. Would have been a nice place for a morning jog. The couple that was with us had kids and was disappointed there wasn't a play area for the kids, as far as we walked in anyway
A walk in the park. We had glorious weather, so enjoyed a relaxing walk in a very pretty park. Seemed very popular with residents and tourists alike. Not very impressed with the café though.

Huge diversity when crowded. We got a beautiful sunny Saturday afternoon to visit the park and it was all crowded, but I could see in that crowd the real spirit of Amsterdam, a diversity like that one it's hard to find. The nature is beautiful (I bet it's more beautiful when it's more quiet), but on a beautiful weekend, you must pay attention to the nice, different, interesting people around to see the real beauty.

One of the best out there. We walked through this park every day while we were in Amsterdam - and it really is the quintessential European park. Extremely clean with bikes zooming around, it's a lively yet calming park with lots of beautiful trees and ponds. Definitely visit, if only to walk through!

Even when busy you can still find peace and tranquility. We visited with children on a sunny evening. This is a huge park very close to central Amsterdam. There were thousands in the park when we visited. In particular there were many types of fitness groups training. In spite of this, we found many peaceful areas, where our children climbed trees, ran around and admired both baby ducklings and a nesting stork. So a fun place to escape the busy city streets.
Great for families and bicycle tours. Take your bicycle and lunch packet and spend a time there with family. A lot of space for various activities.
Relaxing. Step outside of the busy tourist and busy life of Amsterdam. Find a bench (open field in the middle, it's the dog park area) and grab some wine and cheese. So relaxing.

Great park to cycle through. Lovely park. Well worth a visit. Lakes bridges trees. Well used by walkers joggers cyclists etc. We cycled through. Plenty of places to stop and have a picnic if you chose to.

Beautiful park to Walk or cycle through. This park is a must .... You can cycle and walk through it but NO motorized vehicles. Huge fine if caught .... We entered the park on our scooter and fortunately came upon the restaurant so sat down and had a wonderful breakfast of eggs and bacon and coffee ... Somebody then told us we not allowed in the park with the scooter .....

Busy and calm all at once. This was an unexpected gem in our stay in Amsterdam. With beautiful spring days and temperatures in the mid 20's C Vondelpark was buzzing with activity, but also blissfully quiet and peaceful depending on where you were. Great place for family time or just lazing on the grass by the lake - just keep your ears open for the bikes on the paths! Great public space - safe, clean and relaxing.

Beautiful cute park centrally located. Beautiful park to check out if you want a quick getaway from PC Hooftstraat shopping! A quick walkthrough will take 20 minutes, you could pack a picnic and spend as long as you'd like (if its not a rainy day).

Two times as good. This is an amazing park right in the centre of Amsterdam. Very bear the all famous Museumplein, this is a must visit to enjoy sights of locals cycling and taking a walk. A nice break from the action filled Amsterdam that it usually is. Great if you have rented a bike. Take a camera for some amazing clicks.

Beautiful Park!. Went to the Van Gogh Museum in the morning and the Rijks in the afternoon. In between we had lunch at the museum restaurant next to the Van Gogh (there was lots of outdoor seating). Food was very good. We went to the park for a walk and it was just lovely. This is a great area to spend the day - museums, restaurants and the park. There is also a bakery on the way to the park that many were getting to go lunches and sweets to take to the park. I believe it was Bakery Simone.
Had a great picnic here!. Big beautiful park where you can do picnics and have a blast. Lots of people but there is always place to chill.

A park were you enjoy the amsterdamers way of life. We went there on King´s Day and it was really fun. Families bring things to sell, old clothes, toys. They play old and simple games, groups perform music, everybody enjoying to stay outdoors.
My favourite Amsterdam park!. Whether you want to run a loop (just over 3km), take a shortcut through the park, take kids to the playground or enjoy warm summer days Vondelpark is the place to be.

Stunningly beautiful green-space, relaxing and hospitable to all. We stayed at a B&B near the park, and it was our main thoroughfare when walking to and from museums, etc. Vondelpark has several restaurant/pubs, ice cream and hot dogs vendors, as well as designated places to do your own BBQ. Benches abound, as do bicycles (!) which can be rented within the park (or nearby). Everyone from infants to seniors (to dog lovers with their dogs) enjoy this beautiful park, which provides an oasis of quiet (or space for energetic pursuits). If you discover that you have visited too many museums and historic places, Vondelpark will restore your equilibrium. You can chill out with a picnic, stretch out on the grass for a bit of a rest, and soon you will be ready to hop on a tram and continue exploring Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside.

Could spent the whole day there!. The park is a really lovely place to wonder around, chill out or have a picnic. We went on a lovely sunny day and it was so beautiful, wish i had a park like that at home. Might have to move there just to enjoy it!

Walking and cycling. Vondel park is huge and you can walk or cycle for well over an hour, past the tulips and stop for a nice rum hot chocolate in the park cafe. It is a nice way to see Amsterdam folk at the weekend, full of locals cycling, running, skating and walking. I'd give the park three stars, if I was asked to compare it to Hyde Park or St James' park closer to home...
Must have seen. The Vondelpark is easy to reach with the tram number 1 and 2. It's such a great place to chill and everything looks so beautiful :)
Beautiful Place. Visited on a glorious day! The place is stunning and wonderful for a wonder. If your not on a bike be careful not to get run over they're everywhere.

quiet place ish to visit but heavily used, rubbish everywhere and worn.. Most definitely needs some loving attention and upgrade to make more of this. Watch out for the kamakaize cyclists and most definitekly not a quiet stroll

The most beautiful park in the city. Vondelpark is the perfect place to spend a slow and calm day in the open. This is the biggest and most beautiful park in Amsterdam. Here you can have a walk, ride bike, or simply have a picnic on the grass!

Very Beautiful. Vondelpark is gorgeous and also very conveniently located - it's close to the canal cruises. We walked through on multiple days including King's Day. Crowded or not, it's a beautiful park - very attractive with tonnes of greenery, and we also saw a few lush tulip patches.

Highlight of my trip!. Vondelpark was one of the best parts of Amsterdam! It was so beautiful and there was an abundance of culture found in one small area. It was relaxing and easily one of my fondest memories from my time in Amsterdam.

stoned again. very nice park in the heart of Amsterdam place perfect for relax
i suggest to visit it and enjoy your trip

Beautiful park to walk through, or in which to take a nice break. This is a beautiful urban park. We happened to get an apartment near it, so walked through it on a daily basis while in Amsterdam. There is a protected heron retreat in the center, where a heron sat on his nest each time we walked by. Many people use the park for exercise (running, cycling route, in line skating), and there are many areas to lied down and relax alongside a stream or pond, or a couple of places where you can set up a BBQ.
It was beautiful. Great walking around. Saw early glimpse of tulips and other flowers. Nice variety of flowers and bulbs. Really nice break from the city.
Beautiful park. The Vondelpark is a quiet gem - well worth taking a walk through. It's a really good and beautiful place to get some quiet and get your pulse down in an otherwise busy city.
Vibrant park. Great place for a walk or a picnic. We visited on Liberation Day when there were activities a plenty especially for children . The lakes and the flowers were beautiful.

Oasis of peace. The Vondelpark is a must for any visitor. After the bustle of the main tourist areas, a stroll round the park followed by a relaxing drink or meal in Vondelpark3 restaurant will unwind you.
A park with parrots. Nice to walk and see parrots in trees. Quiet and relax in the morning. A good coffee at the restaurant.

Everything that's cool about Amsterdam is here. I'm used to the great parks of London dut Vondel park has everything from every park I know, I jogged round in the morning surrounded by the fittest young women and some guys, taking breakfast later at the cafe near the city centre end, loved it
Nice park. Visited on a slightly rainy day,the park was well payed out with walking trails and areas to relax. There was a live music festival going on, excellent free music.
Vondelpark. It was a very lovely day when we visited the Park. Lots and lots op people relaxing on th grass and even more cycling or walking. Beautifull Park

Big and beautiful . I recommend renting a bike and ride it through Vondelpark! There are many places to sit around the many lakes -both park and "wilderness" aplenty. We had a picnic in the sun and it was my best Amsterdam daytime experience!
Cool place to chill. Perfect for a sunny day! The park is massive make sure you have a map to not lost yourself in there :p
Very beautiful. The Vondelpark was lovely, so much to see and do. When we were there, the had an open air theatre on with musical performers

Nice park to relax during sunny day. We liked Vondelpark! We rented bikes (there is a rental on the second street from the main entrance) cause it is quite big. We had great time in park and also had fun with bikes :)
Beatiful urban park. I mostly quiet park and a good place to wander around. Mostly clean and easy to navigate. I recommend good weather, though.

Fine park but may get crowded. I used to stay on the next street to the park during my assignment in Amsterdam. It is absolutely beautiful in the mornings. It however gets very-very crowded on a fine warm day, with lawns full of picnicking locals and tourists. The restaurants in the park are quite poor in food quality and struggle to service in the pick hour.

Nice park. Very big park with walking paths and water. A lot of people and crowded I. Weekends. Some cafeterias or restaurants. A lot of people wound just let their dogs free having no control, very rude. Watch out for all the bicycles . People are going very fast, texting on the phones and don't look up.Strange if nobody gets hurt. Easy to find the park close to museumsplein.
Chill and enjoy. If you visit Amsterdam, take in the green sites of Vondelpark. Sit in one of the caffees, away from the hussle and bussle and watch the world go by.

Revisited after 60 years.. Well maintained roadway and paths, although the grass could do with a mow. I was disappointed with the graffiti on the gates and signs in the park which looked like they had been there for a very long time and no attempt had been made to clean it off.

Great Place to Relax after a day of sight-seeing. Vondelpark is one of our favourite places in the Museum quarter. It has pleasant vistas, the lake, fountains, flowers, good walking paths and you fell as if you are miles from the surrounding city. The beer café is great and there are several places to eat. This is a good reason for staying in the Vondel-Overtoom area.

Very Peaceful Walk through the middle of city. quiet and peaceful walk. Many benches to sit and enjoy the quiet and lunch. Hard to believe it is in the middle of the city. As always - be watchful of bikes.
Great place to relax. Close to the center, this park attracts all walks of life! Pick a place to call your own and have a nice picnic when the weather is nice.
Love this park. Well kept park used by many people. Lawns and flowerbeds with modern sculpture. Relaxed atmosphere, yoga and fitness groups using the space for peaceful exercise.

Beautiful park. Easy to access - in the heart of the city. 10 minute walk from Museumplein. Perfect for a sunny day. Beautiful, well looked after park. Great for an afternoon stroll or perhaps just to sit on the grass and watch the world go by. I would recommend renting bikes for this park. - It is a great way to get around and see it all. For first time travelers to Amsterdam, cycling in and around the city can be daunting and this is an excellent way to feel part of the community, as well as it being lots of fun! Would definitely recommend a visit here.

Beautiful urban greenspace for a gental stroll or a half hour pedal.. Clean and well kept. Great place for a family picnic but be aware there are ducks and some geese who might require discouragement where lunch is concerned. Tables and benches throughout the park.

beautiful park for a picnic. why not see the park after a museum trip and have a picnic in the sunshine. beautifully laid out. cafes and places to eat and drink are in the park as well as a helpful map.

Stunning Park in the City. A beautiful spot to stroll through or sit and relax. Popular with locals on a beautiful summers day. The lush greenery in weather which is hot for Amsterdam was refreshing (our summers aren't as green in Canberra, Australia). Great for a breather between attractions.

Watch you don't get knocked over by a bike!. This is a stunning park, on par with any other park on Earth. As with the rest of Amsterdam, just be careful you don't get hit by a bike. Every time i come to Amsterdam i make sure to visit this park, all of the surrounding areas are absolutely beautiful. What a city.

Accessible green lung right in the heart of the city . The park is easily accessible and immediately the atmosphere calms down a couple of notches. It can get quite full during sunny days and especially at the weekend. There is a pavilion, and visitor centre in the lush grounds.
Perfect Place to Laze in the Sun. Head down here with a pack of cold drinks and some smokes for a wonderful afternoon. We were very content laid on the grass watching the world go by.

Happy Birthday King Wilhem Alexandre !. Rather than braving the crowds of drunk and noisy in the Dam, at the suggestion of local Amsterdamers, I spent a good deal of time during Konigsdad (April 27) at Vondelpark. The park was in close proximity to my hotel. What a wonderful day: families, music, all sorts of sales, eating tons of homemade Dutch snacks and sun ! The park is really well laid out for strollers and one place in the city where I didnt need to constantly check my sides for those damn bicyclists !! I was most pleased to spend time in this park on a National holiday (but yes, I did end up in Dam Square later !)

Clean and very very green. Its a beautiful park with many open places where you can unwind and relax. There are small lakes inside as well around which you can have a small picnic. There are a couple of pricey restaurants and food stalls inside - I would recommend to pack and bring your own food.
Watch the cyclists. A very nice park that is well used. Just need to watch the cyclists as they are everywhere. Cafe looks over park but was closed when we walked through.
Beautiful. Had the luck of weather at 80 degrees and enjoyed a lovely walk through the park. Great to enjoy after time inside one of the near by museums.

Huge and amazing. This park is really awesome. It is huge and full of lakes ,small rivers and areas with grass. It has a couple of cafeterias and an area where you are allowed to have barbeque. Tip: in this park public sex is allowed ;)

Relax on a sunny day. If you have a few hours to spare after visiting one of Amsterdam's museums that cluster nearby, then take the walk to Vondelpark. It is peaceful yet invigorating at the same time.Peaceful because of the trees, small lakes, paths and the numerous park-benches for the rest of the weary. On sunny days the closely cropped grass is inviting and many people bring rugs and settle down with a book to read or just for a snooze in the sun.Invigorating because of the flow of cyclists, joggers and roller skaters along the paved, motor-free, routes through and around the park. Each person either intent on the daily dose of fitness exercise or simply taking advantage of the traffic-free route from one part of the city to another.If, like me, you are frugal and have your own packed-lunch to munch, then I found the stay long enough to see almost every type and size of bicycle that there is. A second bonus is that the riders are aged from under 8 to over 80.
Peaceful. It was a beautiful and peaceful setting despite the inclement weather. Since it was only a few blocks from my hotel I went and had a nice walk there.

Lovely park. OMG. Such a lovely park for a picknik. To take sunbath. Enjoy sunny days. Excellent place for jogging and there are some tracks for jogging. It goes absolutely with family and kids also for teenagers.

Park yourself here. This long, linear park offers peace and quiet in the middle of all of the chaos. It`s narrowest part is accessed from the Centrum of Amsterdam.A statue of the one who the park is named after is near this entrance and there are numerous ponds and trees as well as places to throw down a blanket or sit on a bench and watch the world go by, read a book of have a picnic.

Lovely, Sprawling Park. Great to walk through for exercise and scenery. At one end of it was a great sandpit for children to play in. Our daughter's treat for getting dragged around Amsterdam during the day was to play there at the end of the day.Like everywhere else in Amsterdam, watch out for the bicyclists!
Very nice park to stroll through on a sunny afternoon. This park was near to my hotel and when I visited it was full of flowers. It was very nice to walk through or relax on a bench.

A super park. We walked to the park avoiding the cyclist. We had a coffe then walked around park . Had lunch at a very nice cafe. A group were rehearsing songs from Hair we all clapped along Great fun

Pretty park and good for cyclists. Pretty park. We rented a bike and cycled around it. Stopped at Bagels and beans for lunch. Good to cycle around to get to grips with the bicycle before attempting the city!

Beautiful and Peaceful. As a current New Yorker, Vondelpark reminds me of Central Park in NYC, but with different plants and vegetation, which obviously make it unique and stunning in its own right. I loved walking through the park and also walking around the neighborhoods surrounding the park and experiencing a different park of Amsterdam apart from the more touristy and crowded areas.
Great park. Great park in the middle of Amsterdam! Lots of green and if you want to go out from the city and have a quite walk than this is the place.

nice park in the middle of Amsterdam. It was a fine sunny May day. We saw a lot of locals out sunbathing and generally enjoying the lovely weather. The atmosphere appeared to be tranquil. It is so close to the main attractions in Amsterdam that we walked inside without even realising that's the place we planned on going later on in the day!

must go!!. Don't you dare miss Vondelpark! It's unbelievably beautiful and also clean. People hang out there, sit on the grass... The atmosphere is great!! Rent a bike and go there! Or by foot as well :)
Nice when it's sunny. Nice park, very green, quite big, to rest and have a picnic when it's sunny. Very close to the museums
nature/garden. if you are interested in garden, forests, and taking pictures, its well worth it. lots of different flora, and good place to chill out.
Time out in the park. If you want to experience the beauty of the gardens, take some time out or exercise this is the perfect place.

Beautiful Area. We had a very unique experience for we "strolled" through the Park on Kings Day! Although it was quite crowded because of Kings Day- we were still able to appreciate the beauty of the setting. How fun to see many locals dressed in orange and the children with their special activities including the flea markets, games, music, etc.

A Relaxing Activity. This is a pretty park. We rented bikes (outside of the park) and spent some relaxing time riding around the park. We saw a lot of birds and the park in general was beautiful. You do need to be careful of all the people on bikes.

A charming local park. We went out of our way to experience this park as we had read good things about it. It is a little oasis in the middle of a residential neighbourhood and seemed well used by locals. A nice place to sit and enjoy the greenery.

Fantastic park. Once again, an Amsterdam must, rent a bike for this one. The park is well laid out and what is impressive is that it used to be a private park later donated for use by all. I think there is something for anyone here, you can cycle, sunbathe, have a few drinks, get some food, the possibilities are endless. It is well maintained with quite a few birds around. Definitely visit on a sunny day, but I've been here a few times on a rainy day and I still enjoyed it.

Great place to ride a bike. We rented a couple of bikes and went exploring in the park. Best way to enjoy the park as long as your good with the bike traffic! Fabulous weather contributed to the overall experience.
Love it. Beautiful park for walks and chill sessions in the summer! There is a pool for children thats great when its hot!
Vondelpark. Our hotel was directly on this park, so we enjoyed both the view of the park, as well as walks within it. A very large space to have some quiet, reflective time when in a very busy city.
lovely. a really lovely park with lots to do and see,childrens playgrounds,childrens paddling pool,you can ride bikes all arround the park,has lovely fountains

A must see. A trip to Amsterdam is in no way complete without visiting Vondelpark. With what seems like miles of beautiful land to relax on you won't be disappointed. It attracts all sorts of people and activities and if it's a bite to eat or a good people watch you'd prefer to do, do so, after all its one of the rare free things to do in Dam

Holiday bike ride. We always rent bikes for our visits to Amsterdam. Usually staying within the canals we chose to head to the park and what a treat. In full bloom the park was absolutely fantastic and flourishing. It has a great layout with plenty of room for all to enjoy it's manicured beauty. I highly recommend riding a bike through or coming through with a lunch basket. Stay awhile

Large park . Not the nicest park I've visited but large and lots of people. Don't get me wrong worth the walk. Just one negative beware of your step. Dutch don't pick up there dogs sit and bikes seem to priority .

Beautiful Walk. This is a beautiful park to walk or exercise, it is one of the main parks in Amsterdam and it is a short walk from the Museum quarters. It is great to wander through it, soak in the landscape surrounding it grab a coffee or drink afterwards.

Plenty of green open space. A very large well used public space that was very tidy. People were walking, cycling, exercising, gardening, playing as well as eating and drinking. There was plenty of green open space and water both of which help me relax. There were ducks, parrots and other birds I did not recognise. We only walked around a fraction of the park but enjoyed the ambiance .

Wonderful . Vondelpark in my humble opinion is one of the most wonderful place in this planet, beautiful trees, tulips and lakes! Young people make their barbecues open air, many tourists, must visit!

Beautiful park. It's a must to stroll through Vondelpark while in Amsterdam. Whether it's warm and sunny, or freezing cold, there is good people watching and it is just a relaxing and beautiful park to meander through.

Great place to hang out for an afternoon. Rode our rental bikes through the park, enjoyed an afternoon on the lawn people watching. Easy to get to, crowded because it was a beautiful day and everyone was enjoying the sunshine.
the most hyped park in amsterdam. its a great park actually, lots of free space but it still gets overly crowded from spring onwards and the whole part smells like bbq.

Nice park to relax. Nice & quiet park near Leidseplein. Good place to relax and eat.
Visit when you are visiting other museums nearby.

Perfect on a nice warm day. I visited Vondelpark on a nice sunny day; the birds were chirping, people sitting in the grass and dogs swimming in the little ponds. As I walked through, I spotted a wading pool for kids, free of charge. While I do not have children, I imagine this to be class for kids in the summer. The Vondelpark has cafes/restuarants (in the middle and one at the exit, as far as I know), which looked busy. The park was clean and is so close to the city centre that it's ideal for anyone visiting Amsterdam, and wanting to escape the busy shopping/restaurant streets around the Grachten. Also, ideal for runners.
Beautiful and Large. We stayed in a hotel close to the park and enjoyed evening walks. The park is huge - next time we will rent bikes to enjoy it even more!
Nice and relaxed. A great park for a stroll on a sunny day very lively and busy but you can just sit down and watch the world go by.plenty of events held through the year.

Perfect for a sunday walk. Sunday walk in this park is a relief for troubled minds and hangovers! The paths are full of pedestrians and dogs. The funny thing I observed was that all of the dogs were nice to each other and very socialized. (Just a comment from a Norwegian dog-owner.) Nice places to rest your legs both in restaurants and on benches elswhere. The blooming had just begun.

Beautiful. Beautiful park in the city centre. It is a nice way to get out of the city feeling and walk around the park as it doesn't feel like your in such a large city. I would recommend renting a bicycle and travel to the park.
A beautiful and peaceful hideout in the busy city. A nice park with lots of greeery, bicycles and people enjoying a walk in the very large park full of flowers and small lakes.
Idyllic and full of local life. Great park with a historic tea house best enjoyed at lunchtime or the evening, 5 mins walk from the museums and boat tours
Huge park. Lavish green park probably better to see with a bicycle. When we went, it was overcrowded. One can also enjoy a drink or cafe at Vondelpark 3 cafe.
Beautiful park. We did a long walk in this beautiful park. Its a wonderful area to relax and have a pick nick! We were there during the King's day and it was very lively!
Lovely park for an amble. Great spot to escape the hustle and bustle of the city for a while. Perfect for children to play and adults to relax.

Great..... On Mornings. Staying closed to the Park, we went there several times on our ways to the other Amsterdam attractions and on our ways back.The Vondelpark is gorgeous as well as really big. But, if you want to really enjoy it, go there before 11AM and you'll have it almost only for you. On the sunny afternoons, it's like looking for a place to stay in Central Park

Beautiful place . We spent an hour sitting in this park in between visiting the Van Gogh and rijksmusuem and it really was lovely. We were on foot so couldn't explore as much of the park as we wanted to but decided we would go back with bikes next time we visit Amsterdam. From midday through the park there are food and ice cream vans scattered around but if you wanted to take a packed lunch there is a supermarket by the Stedelijk museum that is cheap and sells everything you need for a picnic.
Plain area for a nice walk on the sun . Good place to lay down on the sun and have a picnic. It's a simple flat area of grass with a great view of the Rikjsmuseum.

Beautiful Vondelpark. Our hotel was situated right behind the park, we had a lovely walk through one morning, it was great to see the different breeds of birds especially the parakeets, I know they are noisy but we get them in our garden back home in the UK so we are used to it. We could see from the scorch marks that locals probably light a barbecue or have picnics in the park and it was great to see the local yoga classes being held there. We were lucky with our visit as Amsterdam was experiencing a heatwave. Go to Vondelpark, you will have a lovely time.

Lovely sanctuary. Lush greens and waterways, even a real Picasso! Look for the 'Figure Decoupee l'Oiseau', which was donated to the city by Picasso after it was committed for the Vondelpark's 100th anniversary celebration in 1965. A beautiful park - a must see! Hire a bike or jog around, or bring a picnic!

Peaceful and beautiful. What a nice way to spend a few hours to reflect and take in the beautiful park surroundings. Big and peaceful, it's a perfect place to take a light lunch and blanket and enjoy a picnic while nature and people watching.
Beautiful space of green. This is definitely a locals weekend retreat. Everyone was exercising and getting some much needed sun! Great place to walk, hangout etc.
Fabulous park, escape the tourists. Beautiful park, good areas to wander and most importantly to take the dog for a walk in central Amsterdam.
A must if the weather is good. This is a must do if the weather is good. Amazing atmosphere, bbqs, music and people just chilling out having a good time.

A Nice Place To Relax. We walked through Vondelpark a couple of times and found it to be a nice place for a leisurely stroll. There can be a lot of people there, but it doesn't feel as crowded as trying to walk around the City Centre. Plus, there is more room on the trails, so your odds of being killed by a bicycle are reduced significantly!

Beautiful on a good day!. We had a couple of hours to spare and the weather was incredible. We brought a picnic with us and enjoyed the afternoon sun. Would recommend anyone to do the same! Can be very busy and crowded though!
Sit back and relax. Sit back and relax. Park is near to Rijksmuseum and walkable. Quite spacious and good to spend couple of hours to walk around and relax.

Beautiful Park!. Absolutely beautiful park. This park is great for a walk, a run, a walk with Mans best Friend, and many other things! Well manicured and easy to get too makes this a great break from the busy city life!
Amsterdam trip . A lovely place to relax and just walk away from the crowds. Beware of the bicycles and make sure you stay to the pathways.

Beautiful sunny day . Wow what a beautiful park , we had great weather 25 degrees , tulips out even ducklings , a great thing to do to relax bring a bottle of wine and just sit and take in the atmosphere loved it
Great park. Vondelpark is very beautiful to walk and enjoy the scenery. Because my trip was in springtime, it was not too hot and flowers were still at its best.
Lovely park to walk or ride (a bike) through!. Loved seeing the park (Amsterdam's "Central Park -- as in New York City). The sun was shining and families were out. The tulips were in bloom. Gorgeous.

Art, flowers, wildlife and people watching . Cycling around the wide paths or zig zagging through the pedestrian areas it's always entertaining going through Vondelpark. Sun will bring hoards and free puffs of grass will float by adding to the relaxed atmosphere. Early or grey days bring out the colours of seasonal planting and the variety of bulbs were delightful. Parakeets are common as are herons which have protected nest areas. We spent a good 10 minutes discussing the what one of the sculptures was meant to be and decided moose/fish/bird face was most likely. Look out for the brandmaster cafe off of one of the side entrances as the coffee is sublime.
sit and relax. very nice and clean park, we enjoyed a sunny day and walking, there are wonderful places to sit and relax.
Relaxing park in the city. Spring time is the best time to spend the day at the park. Have a picnic or just reading a book on the grass. Rent a bicycle to ride through the park too.

A wonderful relaxing day duck watching. As our hotel was quite close and the weather beautiful we walked through the park at least once a day. It always felt safe and enjoyable both day and night with a number of cafe's and bars en route. The best bit was just sitting on the bench watching ducks and people walk and waddle past. joy.
Great park. Wish I had rented a bike...it was a beautiful day and the park was in full bloom. A nice place to relax and have a picnic.

Well Kept Park for a walk. Super spot for a walk or run while in amsterdam as the park is kept well and clean . Very nice areas for sitting and having a picnic or just strolling around for awhile if the weather permits . There are also a few cafes for grabbing food or coffee a nice spot if you have the time as its very big

Vondelpark... wonderful!. Vondelpark is a wonderful park, just two steps from the city center.Always full of people, you can ride a bike, have fun with your family and friends, or just stay relaxed in the grass or near one of the many beautiful fountains.

A must in Amsterdam. Specially with good weather this park is a must, but also in Winter. A walking from one side to the other of the park offers something really special and different of Amsterdam stereotype.There are different areas. Around Leidseplein you will find all the tourists and people who want to "enjoy" music, noise and trends.On the opposite side of Leidpseplein, in Direction to Amstelveenseweg you will find small lakes, ducks, coffee places, a lot of grass and the sound of lovely birds.Locals use it on a daily use to run, go to walk with babies, make birthdays parties, even in same areas you could see people doing barbecues.

long park. nice park , felt better for me i suppose having just eaten a handful of truffles , trip advising my mind . 4 hours of loving nature and smoking , nice big restaurant , great place to kick back on a sunny day , advised ,trip there . thanks for reading .
Great place. Lovely park were you can roam around walking, cycling, skateboarding. There is lots of place to have a picknick or bbq or just to relaxs on the grass. Very busy when the weather is good!

Overwhelming. I was there in December and it was a typical winters day in Amsterdam. It was twilight and I was riding on my bike around the park and a sense of beauty,culture and elegance was rushing through me. There is no descriptive word nor a picture to show my experience. Nature in its finest form.

A lovely park for walk or stroll in evening!. Visited this park in second week of April 2016 in evening. Its a beautiful park filled with lush trees, a water front and walking / cycling area. In April do remember to carry your umbrella as it tends to drizzle on and off. Its a great place to walk / stroll and chat with your friends / family and have a good time.
Amazing Place. This is a nice place to relax and just let your kids play. If you are a photographer, you can get some amazing pictures of birds. I would recommend this place to families.
Nice park.. A lovely walk, we didn't have the best weather but enjoyed it. A nice coffee and the main restaurant look lovely, will try next time.

Gorgeous gardens . Absolutely gorgeous park. The scenery is picture perfect. Well worth a visit. If you love a stroll then this is the place to do it or bring some lunch and sit under one of the beautiful trees and relax.
Nice to cycle. We crossed this park to get to the City. This is like the central plaza in New York. You can do a lot of things here not only cycling.

Stunning park. Hired to bikes and spent the day cycling around this beautiful park.With many different laid out areas and two cafes inside there is more than just the park.Only tip watch out for the pigeons

Beautiful Park. This park is beautiful and big. There are many paths to walk our just sit in the big field on a blanket and visit. You can get away from the hustle and bustle and still be in the city.

Pretty haven in the busy city of Amsterdam. We enjoyed a pleasant stroll around this pretty park after a heavy lunch. The Voldenpark was busy with tourists and locals enjoying the fresh air as the day was warm and sunny. Cyclists mingled with skateboarders and families without any collisions , but care needs to be taken. A nice classy cafe is available for coffee and snacks , lovely traditional architecture can be observed all around the periphery of the park .We exited the park adjacent to the Museum quarter and had a pleasant 30 stroll among tulip beds in bloom .

Amazing day out!. We rented an apartment in july 2015 what a gorgeous part of Amsterdam honest 10 min tram no 1 or 17 takes you to central station or dam rak but we spent most of the week in vondal the park it out this world such lovely people so friendly and the police we so nice & helpful you can picnic or bbq whatever you like its massive so takes days to find new spots to sit & take in the scenery there's lakes & ponds infact theres something for everyone live bands it really is money well spent we will definitely be back!.

Incredible nature in the middle of busy Amsterdam.. Take a break from the hussle and get fresh air and a walk, great people watching. We had a beer at the tennis club and watched good tennis for free, drinks and snacks are cheap.

Beautiful Park for strolling. This park is best when it isn't cold and rainy (summer months). I was there in April and it was a bit chilly. Still, it's a picturesque park where you will dodge fewer bicycles than on the streets. It begs leisurely stroll to admire nature.

Great park for a walk. Just a great place to walk through and it has some historic statue of Poet Joost van Den Vondel
beautiful tulip gardens in mid to late April.

A lovely Park, and a MUST GO experience. Beautiful park. If your in Amsterdam do not miss this.
Variety of walking paths, green views and the special atmosphere of Amsterdam in its best.
Nice park. Nice little park in Amsterdam. Great for walks etc with family and kids. Not much else to do here but that.

An oasis from the tourist crush. A great place to relax in the sun, only a short walk from the ever busy Rijks Museum, but also only one short street away from tram connections. In the sun there were loads of birds singing, joggers and people just chilling.

Great park to Bicycle, run or walk in. We took and evening Bicycle ride around the park
it was very clean a nd nice with plenty of paved space for cyclists and runners
the park was rather busy even after dark because it is well Lighted
we enjoyed spending time inside this park

Kingsday, kingsland.. We were so grateful to visit The Netherlands during Kingsland. The event we went to was at Rai, Amsterdam but it was amazing. If you are into Edm festivals or any type of festivals this is the place to go. There is always an event going on. Ask a local. Everyone was so nice and helpful.I am definitely going to return!

Incrediblepark!. Amazing park! You can see people with bike, during the run, take the sun, and relax themselves! Flower are beautiful and if you can, rent a bike and turn around every corner of This park to see how much it's fantastic! Todo el resto es una sorpresa
Lovely city park. The birds are singing and the flowers are resplendent. Take a walk or ride a bike through this lovely park and then enjoy the neighborhoods that it penetrates.
wonderful running, walking, and gathering park. we walked here in a light rain and enjoyed all the people watching. Also used the nice crushed gravel path for running on another rainy day.

Lovely place to walk and people watch. Great city park! I went twice during my stay, and loved walking through on my way to other sights in the city. Make sure you keep an eye out of the Picasso sculpture which the artist gave as a gift to the city.
Picturesque. A nice slice of natural beauty and calmness in a central area of Amsterdam. If the weather is nice I highly recommend a visit

large park- good for biking. Located near the museumplein with Rijksmuseum is, this is a good sized park (long and thin) for taking a stroll or a bike ride. Having said that once you've been to see the tulips at Kerkenof, this really pales in comparison. We didn't think there was much to do or see here. Hardly any flowers, but a nice small reservoir in the middle.
beautiful park!. a great place to relax on a sunday ! you really get a feel for the city and daily life. Its also good for a short (2 mile) jog and is very accessible to most hotels in town.

Beautiful Park. Perfect for Koningsdag!. We enjoyed the park on King's Day 2016 with many local families and others. The children were selling there wares, performing and otherwise to earn a few euros. Nice ark for a srtroll anytime, or a bike ride.
Shrooms park!. This is the best place to trip in, all the good magic mushrooms are around this park and it's beautiful.
Day out . We went the most popular park in Amsterdam and I didn't want to leave.... There is so much space for families and friends to relax I will go there again for sure

Great playground and open space. We were very glad to find this green haven in Amsterdam as we had found few playgrounds with safe swings for small children. It was good to walk in a quiet place with good coffee and space for the children after fighting the numbers in the Rijksmuseum nearby.

Cute little park. This is a cute little park to stroll through if you have time. I really enjoyed seeing the tulips there. This is close to the museum complex so come by if you have some time but I wouldn't go out of my way.

A sweet island of calm. This large, well manicured and well arranged park is seated right in the middle of bustling Amsterdam, just a little south west of the center. It's a surprising island of calm and quiet in the middle of what can be a loud and overwhelming city. On sunny days its full of leisurely bikers, walkers, dogs and families, but even when busy it's charming and relaxing. Definitely worth a look if you're in the area.

Amazing. Amazing park for photo shooting and games. We enjoyed it during the kings day and there were a lot of activities to do there. Its a must see and accessible by public transportation and free entrance

Best Park in the world . The Vondel Park is amazing for all kinds of people watching as it boasts cafes all the way around from fine dining to snacks and you can even bbq
AMAZING!

Great green space. A great green space that I'm sure would be even nicer in late spring / summer.
Cafes in the park are great for a coffee . Nice to see some wildlife in the middle of a city.
Cyclists , walkers runners and even roller skaters about so eyes up!

A locus amoenus. If you are lucky to find a warm and sunny day in Amsterdam you can't miss the chance to spend an afternoon in this park just close to the museum's square. Trees, birds and tulips surround you letting you feel relax and thoughtless riding a bike or lieyng on the grass.
Good park for a nice stroll. The park was near our hotel and we visited it on occasions. The park tends to be full during weekends but still makes for a nice walk.

Great running location . This was a beautiful park around which to do an early morning run and enjoy the beautiful scenery - from manicured gardens through to wild grasslands. Felt very safe - with lots of other runners and dog walkers (and of course - cyclists)

Vondelpark. Very serene and beautiful place to hang out with kids! The kids just love hanging out by the pond and eating hotdog! Simple treasure moments with a great view! A good resting place from all the museum visits!

Beautiful park in the city center. This is a very big park that crosses the city. It is an amazing walk to chill, and enjoy the view. Of course, you're in Amsterdam, so beware of the bikes! Definitely worth it!
Simply beautiful. Its a very nice place to visit. It's the last place that we visited in Amsterdam. Its really a tranquil place.

didn't see a whole lot?. while we had originally planned to bike through the park, the biking seemed a little too serious for us, as we were only in Amsterdam for 3 days and the bikes looked as dangerous as the cars. we walked for a bit but didn't see too much that was interesting. I think it would be nicer to visit in the spring or summer.
Very pretty and serene. Definitely hire a bike and take a cycle around Vondelpark for an hour or so. There are cafes, food vendors, children's playgrounds and plenty of little lakes to sit beside.

Rent a bike!. When we went (April 2016) the trees were flowering, the air was crisp and fresh and the park was pure magic.Great place to walk around or, as we did, bike around. Everyone is happy, light footed and relaxed. Huge mix of cultures, races, colors, odors, musics.This park gives a good idea of what vide the Dutch enjoy on their everyday weekend.

Beautiful place!. What a beautiful park. Myself and my husband visited here today. There was so much going on there and totally family friendly. We took a walk around the park and enjoyed watching everyone going about their business. There was a lovely relaxed atmosphere and beautiful sights to take in.
Great place to chill. Lovely park in the middle of the centre of Amsterdam. Great for a BBQ and to relax with friends. Near the fountain are a lot of trees where you can chill in the shade.
Very pretty. Very pretty in a very nice section of the town. A little farther out than I thought but if you want a quiet place to sit for awhile and you're close by it would be nice.

Beautiful park. Vondelpark is a beautiful park. I visited it on Kingsday when the flee market was set up. I loved the flee market as it was unique. Otherwise too it's beautiful to walk in the park..several benches to sit down and relax and soak in the serenity

Oasis of calm close to museums and city. A short stroll from the Van Gogh museum this park is a breath if fresh air. Well kept lawns punctuated by ponds and gentle streams. The perfect place for a relaxed stroll or take a seat (plenty available) and just let the world stroll past.

Vondelpark visit. Went to visit with my friends and its quite nice. We had a calm and serene walk and I suggest you smoke , if you're into that . The park is quite big and there are various nice locations for you to have a group or family picture .
Good place for sport and relax. Nice place full of greenery is good for running, cycling, romantic walking, relax on the grass with your favourite book or in cafe.

A walk or a bike ride after the museum. As it is close to Van Gogh and the Rijks museums you can pass by to have a walk, a run or a bike tour. I biked all through it and sit people watching for a while. nothing special about it just a good park.
Beautiful park. This is a beautiful park, where you can rent a bike. There are restaurants and cafes in the park if you want To spend more time.

Beautiful park even in the rain. We came here on our last day in Amsterdam and even though it was freezing and lashing, we enjoyed walking around this huge park and feeding the ducks and other wildlife here. The neighborhood outside the park is very quiet and quaint to walk through also

Cute park. This is a cute park, close to the center. It's perfect for a stroll or just passing through it on a bike. During the summer this must be heaven for the citizens of Amsterdam.
Worth a visit if you are staying multiple days.
Lovely park. A delightful park. Perfect for enjoying the good weather and a beer at the café located in the middle of the park. A must to visit when you are in Amsterdam!

A nice place for a walk. Many of us were enjoying the park at the same time, both bikers and pedestrians. Some waterfowl were around as well as some tulips. The houses visible from the park are quite impressive. We made use of the benches. The park is close to museums and restaurants. Not as charming as Central Park, NYC.
Perfect place to rest. After a long walk through the beautiful streets of Amsterdam I enjoyed the silence and the sun in the beautiful Vondelpark! <3

Beautiful park to relax. We spent an afternoon relaxing in the park watching the world (and hundreds of cyclists) go by. There are plenty of grassy areas to sit, both is and out of the sun, and it would also be a great place to take your children cycling away from the busy streets.
Oasis in middle of amsterdam. Nice peaceful relaxing park enjoyed by locals and tourists alike. Lovely old buildings to see in the the area. A nice change not to keep dodging cyclists
Lovely walk in the sun. A very busy park when the sun is shining. Frequented by families, cyclist, joggers and people like us who got lost.

Beautiful Pet Friendly Park. This is a great place to walk and smell the tulip and plants and... I went there everyday & even though my travels to Amsterdam required me to have rain gear, there were areas that were had surfaced so I could walk without getting too dirty. Plenty of birds and flowers and duck and dogs and people to enjoy.
Beautiful. Vondelpark is beautiful and huge. We only covered a small piece of it so we didn't get to see everything. It's definitely worth a visit to just walk through and hang out on a nice day.
Cruise around the park with a bicycle. The park is huge and crowded on a sunny day. The best way to see the whole park is by bike. The park is great for picnic, biking and jogging.
garden. amazing garden to take a walk with a family or friends! Enjoy this great park after a great night or just after smoking something :)

Beautiful park in busy Amsterdam.. A lovely place to stroll around, especially in the sunshine. The Tulips were in full bloom when we visited in April, and the colours and effect were beautiful. Very popular with the locals and tourists alike, for walking, running or cycling, it was quite a surprise to find something so large within the city of Amsterdam and so lovely. Definitely worth a wander around, even just to re-charge your batteries!!!

Delightful even in awful weather. Through rain and snow we wandered through the park for an hour, and saw only a fraction of it. The tulips were, of course, the highlight. In better weather we would happily have spent the day there, and would return.

Beautiful, right on a major canal!. You can get anywhere in Amsterdam very easily from here, by water taxi! Plan to go into a deli or supermarket, buy a bottle of nice wine, a couple of sandwiches, and picnic in the park!
Beware the bikes!. This is a lovely park that was full of tulips on our visit. There is a large and popular cafe. On a sunny day take a picnic!

A lively, lovely oasis in busy Amsterdam. Whether walking or cycling, this park is a great place to visit. This time we accompanied friends to an open-air cafe in the middle of the park where we enjoyed some delicious Belgian beers in the warm spring sunshine.
Nice, Clean, Lovely Park in the Heart of Amsterdam!. Great park for walking or biking. Stroll around and have a coffee. Very nice respite from the hustle of the area around it.
great. great place to walk around or have a picnic if its not cold. Try not to get lost & wonder around!! We did but it was still enjoyable :)

Great on a sunny afternoon . Me and my friends cycled out here on our bikes.It was a lovely warm day,so the park was busy with locals and tourists.we stopped and chilled out in a nice spot,we had a couple of cold beers and a couple of spliffs and chilled for the afternoon. Great time.

Serene beautiful. I write this review because my friend lives in this park and we visit regularly. This is how life should be in a city but rarely can be of course. Take a picnic and watch the beautiful world and its people go by in Vondelpark. Go for a stroll in Amsterdams little oasis.

Beautiful Vondelpark. We enjoyed an incredible afternoon walking in the park. The depth of wildlife in such a small area was quite astonishing. The park is very well kept and maintained.
What a great find in Amsterdam
Lovely park in the city. cycled through here on a bike tour and it was quiet close to the hotel we stayed in. Really lovely park in the city
A wonderful park to visit. You almost forget that you are in a city with this wonderful park. It is a great place for a wander and a sit.

A breath of fresh air next to a busy center. Walking around in Amsterdam makes you longing for a taste of nature, trees, grass lawns (also for picknicks) and a bit more open skies. Big enough for some nice running as well.

Beautiful Park in museum district . Spectacular Park!
Visit museums and walk through this beautiful park. Long, wide walking path and bike path. Benches by the water to sit and people watch.

A major urban park in a beautiful and important European city.. Vondelpark is a verdant, green expanse of beautifully planted and maintained parkland and gardens that is a lively part of daily life in Amsterdam. We happened to be here during the incredible tulip season and there were many colorful blooms planted in the park. There are lagoons and foot paths as well as bikeways that extend a warm hand of welcome to anyone who wants to take advantage of a lovely green space in the city. The surrounding neighborhoods are gorgeous and elegant boutique shopping is readily available. Take some time to stroll through this lovely urban park that ranks among the best in the world.
Lovely parl. Beautiful park near museums and the IAMsterdam sign. Families and dogs in abundance. Great place to relax

In the heart of the city. We walked across the park every morning to visit family - it is definitely the heart beat of activity in a family oriented city bikes runners kids playground and beautifully landscaped. Enjoy
Beautiful and well located. Well worth a walk around here on a sunny day, can be a bit cold if it's wet and windy. Make sure you visit the pancake house opposite!

A lovely green space with lots of birdlife. This is where Amsterdam citizens relax at the weekend. The park has lots of lakes, fountains and greenspaces and cafes as well. You can see the tamest herons in Europe as well as Egyptian geese and a stork. This is a great place to people watch - and for safe cycling.

The Central Park of Amsterdam. No matter which entrance you use and how long you visit, you will not see it all. You will see it from the Tram, the street, your bike or on foot....you simply can't be in Amsterdam for more than an hour and miss it....Like Central Park in NYC - it is there and lovely. Just enjoy!

Much green. So wow!. I did not expect a park in the heart of a busy city like Amsterdam. And I DEFINITELY did not expect it to be so big and lush green! I was amazed at the beauty and organization of this park. It is perfect for a relaxing day or a morning jog. You can see people doing BBQ. There are also small stalls or bigger eateries within the park. It is like a parallel universe away from the hustle bustle of Amsterdam!
An oasis in the heart of the city. Great park for a stroll or to go jogging. In the summer the park is full of people and their bbQ's but You can still find some quiet spots
Beauty spot. What a lovely place to walk around and have a picnic or sit in a cafe and have a bite to eat. Would be lovely for a bike ride too.

Big park, full of people, really nice for picnic in summer. I live in Amsterdam and often go to this park to get some fresh air. Keep in mind in sunny days is really packed so get down from your bike in the main road or take the lateral ones.Is and old park with huge trees and big grass extension and lakes, is keeps really clean and tidy so feel free to sit in the grass and have some fun.
Amazing. Gorgeous park with amazing views. Lots of lovely places to sit and watch Amsterdam go by. I would highly recommend visiting x

A beautiful day out.. An absolutely gorgeous and large park suitable for walking or cycling around.. me and my partner hired bikes for the day and had a lovely cycle around.. I can imagine it to look lovely no matter what time of the year.

Besutiful . What a beautiful space Vondepark is. Strolling down the pathways, enjoying the views and watching the parrots roosting in the trees, it seems a million miles from a busy city centre.A lovely relaxing day spent in this wonderful park.
What a gem. Beautiful.. We spent an hour with a bottle if wine sat on the balcony watching the world go by beneath us. Really , really nice.
A park day. If you want to relax then you like this! We rended bikes and drive all the way! Nice relaxing view! Recomended!

Nice park for a run . Vondelpark is a great place for a run. I did an early morning run and the park was bustling but not too busy. There were just enough people on the trails to keep you motivated. The park is also close proximity to a couple museums and a really beautiful garden. It was a great spot for a spring visit.

One of the loveliest parks for bicycling in Europe. Unsurprising, given that Amsterdam is the City of Bikes, but it has fantastic and well used bike paths throughout and is an unparalleled place to take a bike with loved ones and enjoy a tranquil Spring afternoon.
Nice park. Lovely park to walk through on a sunny day. Lots of amenities. Kids play areas and places selling refreshments.
Wonderful . Very well laid out and maintained, worth a walk in the nature after visiting the packed museums, which are just very close.

A spot of green in the city. Very nice and fairly big park, close to the museum area. After a day in one of the musea, it's nice to come here to catch some fresh air. Just mind the cyclists, as they share a path with the pedestrians

Beautiful and Busy. A trip to Vondelpark is a great choice for a few hours. We experienced a perfect spring day with many flowers in bloom. We sat at an outdoor restaurant and enjoyed some libations. We strolled the paths, marveled at the flowers, enjoyed the sights, smells, and sounds.
Beautiful. Great in spring and summer, just pack up a picnic and sit and people watch and listen to the bands playing

Very busy! . We visited on a beautifully sunny day in April and had a fantastic afternoon watching the world go by. The park was very busy (watch out for bikes and don't stray into the cycle lane!) with all kinds of people enjoying the sunshine. We bought some cold cans of beer from the street sellers and ice cream from the stall near the entrance. Further into the park there are large cafes with outdoor seating and these were packed with people. Vondlepark is a lovely little place for an afternoon stroll.
Picturesque. We kept returning to this beautifful park on our trip. We had bikes and we were able to cycle around at our leisure.

Lovely to Cycle Through. We cycled through the park on one of our big DIY cycle tours of Amsterdam and walked the same route through another day. It's a wonderful space to cycle or walk through and is clearly loved by the locals. I love huge, lush green parks and there are plenty of flowerbeds, water features and benches to make the most of. When we were there, there were groups of school children using the park for races and what looked like a dance off (possibly as part of their Koning Day Celebrations), but it was lovely to see the area was so well looked after and used. I could easily spend hours here with a good book on a sunny day, but with so much to see and do, it was just a brief pit stop and calm moment for us!

The evergreen park I ever seen. When temperatures rise in Amsterdam, the Vondelpark is the place to be. Located in the centre of the city, the entrance directly behind Leidseplein, the greens of the Vondelpark have turned into an paradise for travellers and local students. Dragging along fridges loaded with alcoholic beverages, stereo speakers and barbecues, the crowd have a genuine feast.Actually, on warm days, the Vondelpark looks more like a festival than a park.

Lovely park!. We stayed near here & well worth a visit. Makes a nice change from all the hustle & bustle of the city centre. Places to eat there & a beautiful display of tulips around a statue in every colour imaginable! Loved it.

Lovely park for a stroll. We walked here while walking to the main centre of Amsterdam. Lovely park with lots of people out walking an biking. It was a nice sunny day the day we were here so very relaxing and close by the museums.
Very windy at times- but great to relax in the day.. It's a great place to see the city as something other than the RLD, and a bunch of tourists. Close to the Museumplein, so worth a visit.

One of three. I think that if you are in Amsterdam for a short stay / weekend break there are probably 4 or 5 things you ought to do. A walk through Vondelpark is one of them, small lakes, dog walkers, play areas, "The Blue Teahouse" and more, all set in a pleasant mix of the 'unkempt bucolic' and the 'manicured formal' styles of parkland. Glorious on a Sunny day.
Sit on a bench in the middle. The park is always full of great people. It was pleasure seeing cyclists and doing their stunts and the mommy's carrying toddlers behind their bike.

Green break.. With all that water everywhere in the Dutch city of greed, it is a happy break from the usual scenery. In other words a Dutch version of the central park I guess, but with the annoying bikes being all around the place. There is a cute café/bar for a bitterballe and beer break.

A perfect choice to run from the crowd in Amsterdam!. If you are looking for the perfect place to read a book or just chill and relax in Amsterdam? this might be a good choice. There are a lot of people riding a bike or just jogging around here. Sometimes there are even people playing football or playing some music in the park. Another hidden gem in Amsterdam!

Beautiful! . We stumbled across this park and we stayed for over an hour. There is a cafe and a lovely water feature.
It's well cared for and looks fantastic - well worth a visit!
Hide from crowds of tourists. Nice place to hide from crowds of tourists and urban atmosphere. Hovewer there is not much to do for tourists. Casual park
Beautiful/Peaceful. Loved walking through this park on a crisp, sunny day. Loved the green spaces. It was great to see so many people of all ages enjoying this park. An oasis in a busy city.

Perfect pause. There's so much charm in this park, lolling on the banks of a canal of a sunny spring day....it's always busy and buzzing ...and great with a bunch of friends .... It reveals so much of the charm of the city and it's people.

Great city park wonderful to stroll around. t. Make sure you go to one of the cafes and just sit and relax. Note that you have to pay 0.50euros to use the restrooms even if you have consumed at the cafe. Lovely spot.
Great place to stroll with locals. Lovely walk in the park, lots to see, very tranquil and great place to have a picnic. It's free and we accessed via the canal hop on off.

Awesome for dog walking. The green heart of the city, very enjoyable to walk the many paths with our dog as we don't have to negotiate the traffic. It is a very peaceful place with the ducks and water fountains, plenty of places to sit, taking a moment from the hustle and bustle outside the grounds.
Colourful park in the spring with cherry blosoms. A great park for a gentle stroll after museums visits. Beautiful trees in the spring with flowers from cherry blosom in full bloom.

beautiful. Vondelpark has everything what you expect from park. Grass is very green and fresh. The stream goes inside the park. you can seat and just think, or play something with friends or family. The place itself is very nice.
A Nice Park . Vondelpark is worth a visit if in Amsterdam . Just for s walk around the gardens if the weather is good . Metro may be the best option from centre of Amsterdam

Great walk away from the city . If you are looking for a time in the nature and a good walk
This is the perfect place for walking and relaxing
It's highly recommend
A pretty nice park in central amsterdam. Lovely park for walks and bikes. See the green parakeets that breed there and fly all over the city.There are lovely cafes and a play area for children.

Pretty Park, Great Place for a Stroll or Leisurely Bike Ride. This is a very nice park with features for everyone. There is a bike path as well as a walking path and plenty of places to stop to sit (benches) and picnic (grass). Glad we went!
On the countryside in the center. Go for a stroll here, when you are tired of city life . A wonderful spot...the local people are using the park...a good place just to "watch people".
Great park Amsterdam. It was nice sunny summer day beautiful park,worth the visit. Do not miss this place take the hop on hop off , there is a station across the street
Nice but not particularly exciting. This is a nice park with lots of herons but I wouldn't go out of my way to see it again. Not particularly exciting.
A beautiful park. A beautiful park to stroll around and get away from the hustle and bustle, but it's only a park at the end of the day, it's lovely and very scenic
great place for a walk in the sun. just go you will love it, near the museums so a nice change being outdoors, refreshments are available
Beautiful park close to the city centre. Great place for a stroll, but watch for the cyclists. Beautiful gardens, plenty of paths and very spacious
Sun and bicycle. Rent a bike, pick up a burger at Lombardo then take advantage of the sun to walk you in Vondelpark ... a real pleasure
Interesting. this park you all have too go with nice weather. this park is the best park in Amsterdam. It is a big park where you can chill,walk or do whatever you feel like.

nice park, often not so quite.... nice park, often not so quite...during the summer full of tourists and inhabitants eating from the bbq, bike or walk through the park, eat and drink and throw waste in the baskets

Beautiful, green haven. Perfect for a little respite from the busy city. Lovely lakes and waterways, walking trails meandering through the trees, little cafes dotted here and there. I spent a few hours here and enjoyed it greatly. A bit of peace and quiet and beauty.

Enjoyable place. Vondelpark is a green big place with beautiful gardens, lakes, monuments where people love to ride bike, run, walk, to have a pic nic , rest and enjoy the nature in the middle of the city,Amsterdam

Much needed leisure and green park in Amsterdam. Vondelpark is a 47 hectare city park in Amsterdam situated a few minutes walk northwest of Museumplein, providing much needed leisure, recreation and green space for residents and visitors of Amsterdam. This park was opened in 1865 and is named after playwright Joost van den Vondel for whom there is a monument placed at the northeast end of the park. You'll find plenty of grassy areas for picnics, walking and bike paths, crisscrossing Vondelpark as well as a lakes with pavilion (and possible birdlife). Other interesting things to see at Vondelpark include an abstract sculpture of a fish by Picasso as well as a bronze of a Caribbean lady by local sculptor, Nelson Carillho. We visited during March when the trees remain bare of leaves. Luckily we were able to see some early daffodils which were nice. Like most large city parks in Europe, Vondelpark will make for a more pleasant visit during warmer months of the year when the trees are full, flowers in bloom and weather more enjoyable. In the end, Vondelpark is a nice rural retreat in city and offers accessible park space to escape from busy streets of Amsterdam.
Great place to relax. A fantastic Greenland park in the middle of a bustling city. Well worth a visit to understand the tranquility of living somewhere so busy .

Beautiful antidote to the city centre. Relaxing, green, beautiful, idilic... a lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon, culture all around and a superb antidote to adult shops, drugs and overprice art exhibitions
Amsterdam Green Heaven. On a sunny afternoon just give it a go for a few hours.. ride a bike, lay down on the grass, see locals around and chill out.

Amsterdam's own Central Park. The most famous park of the city. The Vondelpark is Amsterdam's own Central Park and is without a doubt the most famous park of the city. Beautiful in all seasons, you can come here to picknick, stroll around, make pictures, work out or just to enjoy nature. One of my favourite places of Amsterdam, without a doubt!

Nothing special. This place is a nice place, similar to other park, with green grass, colourful flowers and a lake. Well, in my opinion, nothing special about this place. If you need a place for relax, enjoy the sunshines, this is the place for you. It is clean park, with bicycle and pedestrian path....
Busy park. See the Picasso. Great park for walking, sitting in and watching the world go by. Weekend mornings are busy with lots of runners
peaceful. such a peaceful place.. most of the cafes are closed at 18.00, therefore it would be wise to consider that

Great place to ride a bike!. Beautiful park, big area, close to the Museumplein, nice restaurant in the entrance, large area to rest, great for any age, you can either ride a bike, go for a run, have a pick nick, or just walk through.
Beautiful . A beautiful place. Highly recommended to rent a bike and to come with a picnic kit. Very romantic. It is a very clean park.
Great escape. This was a beautiful city park near our apartment. It's a great place to take a run or a long walk. Watch out for the killer bicycles!

Weekend away for my husband birthday. This park is so amazing, if you come to Amsterdam you must visit Vondelpark, places to have a drink and rest, it is like St James park in London, different kinds of trees and birds like parrots flying above your heads
Great for running. I went running twice in the park. Very nice surroundings, watch out though for the cyclists. Some of them are very fast!
Huge nice park. Super huge nice park. Nothing special but if you have time and like nature it would be good place to walk
