Beautiful Park. This is one very large park! Great place to go to let the kid run and enjoy the day and have a picnic. Such a beautiful green oasis within the city. You will also find people with lots of dogs. They are very well socialized and are not a problem. We will definitely visit again when in Ansterdam.

stunning. what a beautiful, beautiful place. The whole of Amsterdam is truly beautiful but this place was tranquil and gave you a sense of calm about, such a busy city. This brings the peace into a city!
Natasha (leeds)

Beautiful park. What a lovely place to come and while away the day. When we visited the tulips were in full bloom. It is a large park which always seems busy used by tourists and locals alike. If you have children they have play areas for them to give you a little bit of peace.If the weather is good I would definitely recommend a visit to the park.
Walked on the perfect day. Greenery, endless lush greenery. Smiling happy people buzzing along enjoying this wonderful park. It was right in the middle of the bustling city.

Lovely place for a stroll. We spent a pleasant Sunday afternoon in April strolling in the park. It's a place to people-watch with lots of bicyclers, dog-walkers, pram-pushers--the people of the city enjoying the spring weather. The trees, flowers, and landscaping with ponds and lakes are pretty. There's also a couple of cafés to sit and rest. One of the places that would make Amsterdam a nice place to live.

For children there are many playgrounds, a great high in the trees walkway, wading pools, and just on the edge of the park are the Kinderkook Cafe (where the little ones can cook mommy and daddy lunch and play in the garden) and the Holland Manege (a elegant 18th century riding school).

Lovely park for a walk. Lovely park for a walk on a Sunny day. Close to attractions such as the Van Goch museum, Bols and Rijksmuseum. I had hoped to see swathes of tulips planted to save a 5hr day trip to the tulip fields but sadly there weren't any.

Quick Stroll in the Park. Our experience was a quick one. We were pretty hungry after visiting the museums and were eager to get to dinner, but we wanted to walk through the park, so we compromised by making it only a quick visit. We walked around the park for about 30 minutes. It is very pretty in the spring/summer time. I would recommend taking bikes around the park if possible, as it is pretty big. A walk around Vondelpark would be a great break between museums if you are doing multiple museums in one day.

A good Park, with loads of ponds, built on an English Theme!. It's a fine Park with mature trees and plenty of wet areas, harbouring a variety of birds.It is nice for a stroll and a meal at the restaurant. People ride bicycles, jog and run or relax all along it's paved paths and road, with wide enough pavements to walk on not to be run over by cyclists. It is fairly extensive and one can have a pleasurable walk in it.
Lovely park in centre of the city. Very pretty park to sit and people watch. Nice oasis. There is a lake and different wild life to see.
Beautiful park. Had a lovely stroll through vondel park, although it was February so was very cold and we didn't spend much time in the park

Beautiful Park . A Lovely park to take a walk around right in the centre of Amsterdam. Great to taking in some culture and people watching. There are plenty of places of sit and a number of bars and cafes in the park too. The park is full of nice plants and ponds. Recommended to take an hour or two out of the bustle of city and chill out in.
bof. not extraordinary like the tourists books says about this garden. it is sobbing but not so nice we prefer westerpark.
A place to visit in Amsterdam. In a sunny day you have to visit this quartier: people enjoyng the green of the park everywhere, Museums, cafès. The channels in the nearby are marvellous

Gigantic, peaceful, beautiful. I had a little walk here a fine April morning, and it was really great. There were bicycles, runners, dogs, kids, flowers and nature. You can lie in the grass, you can listen to music, you can be childish in one of the wooden installments. Enjoy the birds too, for you'll see parrots, storks, and many others!

Beautiful park. The Vondelpark is a great place to visit with your friends, family or colleagues. Almost everyday after lunchtime I take a walk in the Vondelpark with my colleagues. It's a good place to chill en enjoy a afternoon walk.
Picturesque. Beautiful place to sit, have a coffee and people watch. Or even just wander through (or cycle like we did)

Good place to stroll. Very pretty park, nice to get some fresh air in the middle of the city. There is a cafe where you can sit outside and watch the world go by. The flowers are beautiful in April. Lots of locals walking dogs, cycling etc
Lovely park . This park is lovely for a wander and / or a cycle around. Great for people watching too. A lady was busking when we were there with the most amazing voice...put a smile on my face! 😀

Beautiful park, nice for a break. Nice to walk around, have picnic in the grass or drink tea at the Blue Tea House. It's surrounded by a beautiful neighbourhood. Very close is the Zevenlandenhuizen (houses of seven countries).

Lovely park. Had a wonder through the park one morning and found it thoroughly enjoyable. It is pretty big, and you could spend a while going all the way across if you wished. There were families and older couples and it had a lovely peaceful feel.
Peace in a busy capital city. This is a haven for peace and relaxation in an otherwise busy capital city. In the centre of the park you can't hear traffic and it's a lovely place to have a picnic.

Lovely place to stroll and take in the atmosphere. Went on our last day in Amsterdam. So many joggers & families - a lovely park. If I had wanted to try biking in the city I would probably have done it here; much safer than the city centre.

Lovely for a bike ride. A beautiful park in the middle of the city of Amsterdam. Well worth a stroll through with a hot chocolate or even better grab a bike and go for an afternoon cycle. Stunning in Autumn.
Nice park . Perfect for a nice stroll with your loved ones. Nice water surrounded by trees and a nice gateway from the city buzz. Love this place.

A beautiful park... missing some details.... We walked into Vondelpark on a rainy day after visiting some of the museums in close proximity. It's a very pretty park with a lot of attention to scenic beauty and wild life. We encountered a ton of joggers and bicyclists enjoying the park. Surrounded by residential neighborhood, the periphery of the park are edged by homes and the occasional cafe & restaurant. What my Wife and I noticed is that this park has absolutely no water fountains and no restrooms. I guess this is to discourage vagrants from living in the park or something, but when you've gotta go, you've really gotta go and there is nowhere to go inside the park itself. We had to hike back out of the park in order to find a restroom and that pretty much ended our experience.

Dodgy Characters. We took our young daughter to the park to stretch her legs and play on the swings. Walking through the park is very pretty, but is like a bicycle highway, not much fun when walking with a toddler. The play area is ok, but there were drunks in the kids area. There were a lot of very off people wondering around drunk, not the best place for a family walk.

Lovely Park . Amazing green park with lots of lovely greenery to enjoy and loads of local and exotic birds. There's a nice restaurant/café in an amazing building aswell. I visited in the middle of April in a bit of a cold spell so not that much had bloomed yet. But I can imagine how beautiful it'd be when everything is blooming.
great way to relax in Amsterdam. Park near to our hotel. great space to get out and stretch your legs if need fresh air away from crowds and traffic.
Just a park. Vondel park is a nice park where you can cycle or take a walk around the park. Scenery was average (as compared to other parks in Europe).
If you like museums. Must see but but your tickets online unless you wait alot and do not forget to buy audio ticket, too, the tour takes approx. 1./1.5 hour

A great place to walk amongst other things. This is a beautiful place, you find all sorts of people here from walkers to cyclists to skaters, there is a few nice cafes round, well worth a walk if in Amsterdam
A city oasis. A lovely park in the centre of the city where you can chill out. Plenty of water and wildlife to distract you. Keep your eyes open for the flock of Green Paraketes.

The Central Park of Amsterdam. My boyfriend and I visited the park late in the evening and loved the surroundings! Such a relaxing place in a busy city. We had a drink at the bar in the centre although we did notice that as soon as the sun set it was freezing! I would highly recommend visiting the park during the day. Overall it was a beautiful place!

Amsterdam's version of NYC Central Park! - great place. My wife and I rented bicycles at the hotel and went pedalling about in Vondelpark. It was our first time there and didn't know the area. Nevertheless it was easy to move around just following the bike paths... plenty of room and beautiful trees. Great place for jogging cycling or relaxing paved and dirt tracks - beautiful place!
Lovely park . Great place to cycle round especially when sunny! Definitely recommend a cycle around to see it all. The little cafes here are great too
nice to take a book and or bike around. Great to get away and just enjoy nature. You can easily rent bikes and enjoy coffee on the multitude of benches available.

Big park in the on the edge of the city centre - ok but not great. We went here to escape the bustle of the city and get the kids to burn off some energy. We were hoping for a good play ground and something a bit different and whilst the park is ok it isn't that different to a number of parks in London or other large cities we've visited. In fact in terms of playgrounds and space it is worse. The playgrounds we discovered weren't really up to much and the multitude of paths were busy with bikes - great if you're on them, less good for a pedestrian with children. Finding a public toilet that is open after 1700 is also a real challenge - not great when you're managing kids desperate for a wee!

A slightly surprising park.... We visited the Vondelpark one morning in early April, and ambled through it to see what they guidebooks were on about. It's right in the middle of the city, so you can see buildings all around, but it's still somewhat quieter than the streets (inverse square law and that...). The layout allows quite a bit of wandering around, assuming that you can stay out of the way of the pushbikes. The feral pushbike is a peculiarity of Amsterdam and you simply need eyes in the back of your head if you're planning to change your position on the path/grass. We did see quite a few groups using the park as a gym. Shuttle-running, skipping-ropes, 2-person yoga, shadow boxing and suchlike, and mostly done following itinerant trainers who arrive on pushbikes with their kit in a small trailer behind the bike. On a cold April morning, this was a surprise and I suspect that in the summer this is far more widespread. An interesting glimpse into local lives. We did't try any of the various hostelries/teashops around the park but it's a city park and well-maintained. Probably much better in the warm sunshine later in the year.

Unsafe. Wanted to take a walk after breakfast at a nearby hotel. Two minutes after walking through the gates noticed many rough sleepers with some (not all) drinking alcohol and using other substances so left as I felt unsafe.
Park time with the little one. Nice park and good to get away from the city for a little bit even if just for a few hours.It's no Central Park but worth a visit especially with kids.
Nice park. We went through the park on a Yellow Bike guided tour. A great way to explore the inner city of Amsterdam.
Beautiful Park. Spacious has facilities and great for cycling, jogging, relaxing and close to public transport for Central Amsterdam.
GreenFreedom. Vondelpark is a beuty inside Amsterdam, run, walk or just sit down and take a look around, and breathe fresh air
nice park for bicycling. perfect park for sunny spring days. peaceful atmosphere which makes it great for cycling, running or a picnic
A lovely park . A great park to take a walk, rollerblade or cycle. A place to enjoy a peaceful atmosphere, nature's beauty and fresh air.
Wonderful open air space. This was the closest park to our hotel and we were very impressed. A lovely park to walk, cycle or jog around and a very pleasant way to approach the museum quarter.

BLISS!. Vondelpark is absolute bliss on a warm summers day. Sometimes can be a little crowded but that just adds to the charm! Lovely scenery and just amazing to sit and relax while watching the kids play.
Perfect price for chillout. Nice place for running , walking or riding a bike. A lot of green space and very huge area. Perfect place for weekend visit with family or boyfriend

A walk in the park. We were staying close by, so decided to have a look, we had a lovely wander round on the Sunday morning before we were due to leave. There is lots going on and people/families having fun. I liked all the cafes round the park, we stopped off at one of them for a drink before heading back.

Interesting. 5 minutes up the road from our hotel, so very handy. Some tulip beds, saw three cafes, plenty of paths, 3/4 lakes/large ponds, a family of green parakeets, 2 laid back herons and plenty of local activity walkers runner and cyclists, including a fire crew having a workout.
Nice Park. Nice park to go to on a sunny day and relax! Has a beer garden as well as other attractions there! Would definitely recommend, although it is a bit of a walk from central Amsterdam

De CENTRALPARK van Amsterdam. Here you have a feeling that you are in a "jungle-heaven" at a busy city as Amsterdam.
It is a must!!!!

Cool place to chill on a warm day. Cool place to chill on a warm day. Very relaxing place! I really enjoyed it.
The only bad thing I could find about it is that sometimes I found it too crowded (in my opinion).

Perfect terrace het Blauwe Theehuis. Every time I pass through the Vondelpark with my bike, it feels like a small holiday. People walking, exercising, enjoying the park. And a perfect meeting place for a free afternoon. First a walk in the park, chatting with my friends and then to het Blauwe Theehuis for some drinks and bites. In the summer a great place because there will be summer concerts near this place.

Beautiful park with amazing scenery! . This park is ridiculously charming and gives you the feeling of being in a novel. It's beautiful and has plenty of benches to just sit and relax in front of a scenic place. I miss it!
Beautiful central park. The Vondelpark is a true oasis in the heart of Amsterdam. At sunset, the park is full of picnickers on the lawns, joggers, and lovers strolling around the lake. Beautiful!

Beautifull place to visit. Hired some bikes, cycled through the canal streets to the park, had a little picnic and then cycled around the park and back to the hotel. The park is huge, plenty of space to find somewhere quiet to sit and lovely scenery.
Nice park, a bit dirty.. The park was well maintained and had a lot to see, but it seemed a bit dirty as there was litter etc in the bushes and hedges.
Well worth a visit. A great outdoor space with paths wide enough to cater for cyclists, runners and those taking a more leisurely pace.

Cycle. We cycled through the park on a lovely sunny day in Amsterdam, this park is also popular with the locals. It is a lovely place to go for a walk, cycle, run or relax with a book or picnic on the grass or benches. Worth visiting if it is sunny.
Beautiful. Really nice park to relax in or just walk through especially when the sun is out. Plenty of places to get food and drink, definitely worth a visit.
nice break from city bustling city. In April park does not look impressive, but still has nice atmosphere. We rent bikes just outside and took round through. In summer park has to look amazing.
Great when on a bike!. We rented bikes and cycled through. A great view and an excellent experience :) it was winter so not much colour but still worth a visit :)
Nice for multi day journey . If you want a nice walk with nature then for sure go here but if you walk enough in the city, then no need to really do the park.
Great oasis of green. Great for running or cycling ir just spending some time in a green park. Great location. Well kept...good on you amsterdam for taking such good care of the park
Amsterdam park. Watch out for the bikes!! lovely, huge park with lots of stuff going on in it. Popular cut through for the locals going into town.

Beautiful spot on a sunny day!. A relaxing and beautiful place to chill out on a sunny day, peaceful and relaxing. Filled with a range of ages and people doing lots of different things, so always something to look at!

Pleasant afternoon stroll. Our hotel was located just round the corner from Vondel park which made it a continent place to have a wonder round. It is a very large park and there is lots of space so it isn't very crowded, you do have to be aware of the bikes because there was quite a few people speeding around. The only let down was the amount of dog poo that hadn't been picked up so just make sure you watch where you walk. Other than that it's a lovely place for a walk and when the weathers nicer I can imagine it being a great place for a picnic.

Family fun in the sun . If you enjoy doing activities together, running, biking, playing football, and climbing the jungle gym, then thus humongous park has it all, and more.When museums and history and architecture are overwhelming, then going to a park is a great way to recharge. Just ask all the locals who are all at Vondelpark already!
Love the ducks!. amazing day... feed the ducks and they will never let you go. They would come and pick the bread from your hand then share it with their friends... lol

Amazing scenery. We came here whilst on our trip to Amsterdam, we made a picnic and ate it in the sun. Stunning park with lots to do. There are a few reataurants/bars which looked very nice indeed. The park was booming with loads of wonderful flowers. Definitely worth a visit of you appreciate those kind of things. We sat and watched a number of people playing football, yoga, running, roller blading, cycling, dog walking, strolling. Was so nice just to sit and watch the world go by

Nice park. Nice park with green and water, and some restaurants.
Perfect for jogging and bicycling.
It's located in the middle of the city and easy to access.
Rent a bike and enjoy the park like a local.
Great park. Great park to bring a toddler that needs to stretch her legs from riding the stroller. Lovely little bridges and ducks everywhere.

Extremely Peaceful. We decided to check out Vondelpark on the final day of our visit, it's great for a nice walk and a nice relax under the sun on a peaceful day.
We didn't explore the entire park as it was a brief trip; again, great on a sunny day.

So pretty. Beautiful scenery and a perfect day out. I found the park not to busy witch made the experience a lot more pleasant, a couple got engaged and everyone started clapping, cute day out would certainly recommend.

Nice Park. This park is located in the museum complex area, so it is good for a "relax" after a museum. There is a great playground with a really nice climbing area, soccer games, a "drinks" area, kiosks with delicious waffles, water ponds and a hint of "pot" smell every so often

Escape from city. My first hotel in Amsterdam was located adjacent to one of the lakes in this expansive park. I visited April 2016, in the height of spring, so I was blessed with stellar weather. Perfect for people-watching! At some point, I felt like a spectator watching a play depicting how Amsterdamers live and play. Skateboarders, walkers, cyclists, families having quality time. I sat on a bench, stared at the glistening lake, napped for a bit, read the "Diary of Anne Frank", and just simply lived doing nothing. A fruitful 2 hours of my Amsterdam trip and a brilliant way to provide respite to one's frazzled feet. A veritable highlight.

Overrated in my opinion. Maybe it was due to the fact that everything looks dead and the cold, there weren't much people around, and it wasn't exactly pretty. There were muddy paths and little flowers on half dead trees. However I reserve my judgement on this as it might actually be really pretty in another weather...

Beautiful Park. What a beautiful place for a walk and a coffee. The only complaint I had was that people did not pic up after their dogs so you have to watch your step. Many different walks of life here. Watch for bikes as per usual.
M. We took a Segway tour all over Amsterdam we came across vondelpark! And obviously I had to take a picture with my letter too!
Beautiful . Beautiful park. Perfect for family days out, picnics, exercise... all outdoor stuff.Very pretty lake in the middle and plenty of places to sit and take it all in.
Beautifully relaxing. Lovely park, very clean. You can read a book, watch the world go by and ride a bike. It's big and it's lovely

Tranquility. A short stroll from museum district a very enjoyable wander tranquil and relaxing plenty of things to see a very good cafe in center and some interesting birds some very interesting properties surrounding park ideal for a few hours to fully relax well worth the stroll
A nice park. We hired a bike and enjoyed a ride around this park. There is a nice café at the entrance although we didn't have time to go there.
Lovely park. Nice to cycle round, have a picknic or just walk. There were lots of people so it's also great for people watching
Very nice park near museum area. A lovely park within a few minutes walk from the museum area. On a nice day, would be great for an outdoor picnic.
Excellent place to ride bikes. Rode bikes around the park late and night, felt safe. Is a beautiful park night or day. Well worth a visit.

Large, open city park with lots going on and a great cafe in the middle. If you fancy getting out of the hustle and bustle of the city, then head for this park. Surrounded by large impressive buildings, the park has wide paths and large open spaces to wander around. We had a coffee and cake at the pub/cafe which was very nice, sitting in the sun watching the world go by.
A day in the park. Stroll, adore. Sit, adore. Watch, adore. Stroll, adore. Sit, adore. Watch, adore. Ride, Adore. Spend the day and Love.

Great escape from the hustle of Amsterdam. -large, relaxing park -great escape from the hustle of Amsterdam
-can be busy with bikes and dogs but this doesn't detract from the serenity
-good place to unwind after museums

Very relaxing! . Beautiful park, lovely scenery and places to stroll. Very relaxed atmosphere with lots of locals here too. Watch out for bikes however. Lovely cafe at the far end which serves alcohol, perfect for a drink in the late afternoon.

Parrots!. We went for a stroll around the park which is really pleasant. My boyfriend thought I was going mad as I thought I saw a parrot flying! Sure enough I was proved correct when 3 came and sat on the same branch!There's a Picasso sculpture too.The water is really relaxing. We sat in a cafe and watched the world go by. Really liked it here.
Beautiful place to spend a sunny day. . I highly recommend walking through this park on a sunny day. I was surprised how big it is. The entire neighborhood around this park is also worth the visit.
Amazing!. What an amazing park. Now this is no ordinary park by any standard. It is huge! Lots of areas to explore by cycling, walking, running, rollerblading etc. Well worth it!

The meeting point.. Nice for long walks, bike rides or being with friends. Is is the place where people gather for drinks or even barbecue while listening to music. There are usually concerts and if you are lucky enough you may get to see a band playing.

Get Away From It All!. I visited here on a cold February morning so it was more of a trip to say I've seen it than anything else. It's a laid back, quiet, peaceful place with quite a few joggers, cyclists and people trying to get a bit of fresh air and exercise. It's not the prettiest park I've ever seen but I'd imagine it is more so on a warm summers day.There's a few small lakes, refreshments and plenty of entertainment as you make your way around the elliptical walkways, however, you never feel far from the city as you can see the built up residential areas that surround it from almost everywhere in the park.Good for a summers afternoon with the family.
What a wonderful space!. We enjoyed a beautiful afternoon wandering around the park. So many little places to explore. If you have a free afternoon and a lovely day, head to Vondelpark!

A lovely park!. My partner and I came here during a city break in Amsterdam. It was lovely to spend a few hours away from the busy city. We hired bikes during our stay and spent an hour or so cycling around the park which was beautiful, walking or running would also be great here. While we were there we saw part of a music concert by chance, which took place at the stage area, which had plenty of seats for the public - all for free!! So may be worth checking if there are any events here during your stay. Great for couples, families or solo.

Lovely haven in the middle of a city. So much going on here, people exercising, doing Tai chi under the sprawling trees, tea rooms, lots of walkways and interest and some respite from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam
Green gem!. Had a lovely stroll through the park. It's a lovely little escape from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. Well worth the little stroll!
nice place. good and beautiful place .historical place and lots of tourist enjoy alot with my friends . we got lot to see and know about amsterdam

Nice park. This is a great place to come down for rest and relaxation after rounds of the museums. Helps that's it's a bit of a distance from the more touristy places.
It's a nice place for walking, jogging or cycling. One could see many families with kids playing games in the park and enjoying themselves

Beautiful. The locals are out and about in the rain, jogging, biking, and going about their daily lives in the park. As a Californian, this was so foreign and fascinating to me.... This park is gorgeous. Take a break from the city and stroll about on the paths.

A little break from the city. Vondelpark holds a special place to me as it's where I got the chance to roam around and learn to ride a bike in Amsterdam! It's beautiful on a sunny day and gives you a break from the busy city life around
Nice walk and relax area. Spent an hour or so on Vondelpark on afternoon, was great to people-watch and check out the ducks and other birds. Would be fantastic for a bike ride or roller-skating too.
Beautiful park for walking to biking. We did both of the above! Trees to climb, tulips to see, playgrounds to swing on and lots of people watching to do. Lovely place.

Serene and scenic but too many dogs. Beautiful place highly recommended for a balmy day, with a good dining experience but it seems be a popular haven for families with pets. If only the pets were kept on leash, it will make it safer without having to get startled when a playful barking dog comes towards you
wonderful park. Amsterdam is pretty walkable so why not visit this amazing park watch out for bikes but that's an advice for anyone visiting amsterdam

wonderful park. wonderful park especially if the weather is sunny. you can go for a walk, to have a cup of coffee or brunch or lunch. it is huge, many people go there to run, to bicycle, to have a picnic etc to play with their dogs. you must visit this park and in my opinion by bicycle.
a great place for taking a walk. a great place for taking a walk, for those who love nature and peace, we enjoyed every moment here..

Freshness fills you up. This is a nice and quiet place for a stroll and bask in the freshness of nature.
Must visit place for nature lovers.
P.S. You can go around the park on a bicycle as well. That would be fun :)

I always come here. My wife is Dutch and we always come here with the kids. It's just a lovely park to wander through. We have young tackers and it is perfect park to run around and play games in. As we normally stay around the 9 streets area it is also convenient to get to.One big plus is it is a bit of a walk away from the red light area so not as many drunk English tourists.
Nice place to explore after museum quarter. Recommend hiring bikes at Mac's and cycling round my kids really enjoyed exploring the different playgrounds and great cafes too catering to all tastes.
Amazing park. Beautiful park, great for cycling and walking..With good weather it's a good place to spend some time and relax

Superb place to hangout on a nice sunny day. Its like the Amsterdam cool club come and hangout, and if its a sunny day oh nothing like it :) great walks along the tiny ponds, lots of flora,fauna and animals :)

Nice place to be. Visited with my lovely wife during March. The place is vey nice, quite and highly recommended while sunny day.There are few restaurant exit in the park where you can order a coffee, tea or any other drink with some cake. Very warm atmosphere to stop "busy" day and relax. Very cool paradise in the middle of Amsterdam.

Think Central Park for Amsterdam (small but well loved). Right across from the Leidseplein, Amsterdam's tourist centre, is one of the city's gems: the Vondelpark. It can be active but reasonably quiet, with lots of little corners to hang out and relax. In the summer people picnic, year round people jog and skate, and there's a cinema with an attached cafe (Vertigo) that is the social hub of the park. It's really where Amsterdam comes together to get away from it all...
Lovely. You must go when in Amsterdam. Its very peaceful here and good to chill. Really nice for cycling. I love it here

Nice place to pass a few hours . Very pretty park and it's very well laid out (cycle paths etc). Lovely place to cycle around for a few hours especially if you're not keen on cycling through the city due to traffic or trams. Lots of locals out walking dogs so great place to do some people watching or to just chill out, weather permitting.

Underwhelmed. Was a bit disappointed in this park. We visited at Easter. The weather was cold and the park just seemed grey and devoid of colour. Lacked atmosphere too. Found the playgrounds a bit bare. Kids not too impressed. Maybe in warmer weather this place would be better

Great park to breathe. Our hotel was nearby this park, and I highly enjoyed the setting with water, birds, walking, sitting, and plenty of green! No surprise this is a hot spot for all kinds of activity and relaxation!
Good to cycle around. We biked round Vondelpark on a cold windy afternoon. There are a couple of hot dog stands as well as two cafes to sit and eat at.
Wander here. Fresh lively and a beautiful respite from the busier city. Take a picnic if you can. Watch for bicycles. Sit in the sun. Walk around.
Amble thru nice vondle park. Lovely park in the centre of Amsterdam to totally chill and have a restful moment. On our way back from pancake house opposite in a smaller park. Yum yum.

A stroll in the park but watch out for the bikes.. Stayed in the Hotel Roemer which is adjacent to this park and a lovely place to take lunch when the sun shows its face,which it did just as we arrived.

Biking around. This place is nice. Many dogs. If the weather is bright, go have a walk or bike around this park. You could enjoy the sun from the bench. And listening to the bird tweets in the morning. Really peaceful.
Popular place to unwind. Whether you enjoy it by bike, foot or roller blades. It’s a popular place to hang out and relax in. We hired bikes and cycled around.
Great park to cycle around. We had wonderful weather and a great ride around this park. We enjoyed the hot dogs very much. Very peaceful and beautiful place to ride your bike around.

Beautiful place to cycle or walk. The park is absolutely beautiful, scenic and safe to walk or cycle. There is a restaurant and hotdog stand. The late afternoon is particularly serene. A wonderful place for a stroll at the end of the day. There was a police presence at one part of the park.
Very nice. The first weekend of april was marked by the flowering tulips in Amsterdam. Really beautiful all those beautiful colors.

So lovely! . Very busy park. Great to see locals and visits enjoying the park. Most people where cycling or jogging. Dogs welcome. We went on a Sunday morning. Good to walk through to see part of Amsterdam rather than walking the crazy busy streets.

Great Park!. Great park and its massive so loads to explore. There are loads of cyclist as there is all over Amsterdam! So if you cant beat them join em. We hired some bikes and rode round the park and it was lovely, we were only in Amsterdam for a long weekend so riding our bikes around the park meant we got to see much more of it with the limited time we had. Perfect for families, loads of space to sit and have a picnic or just to have a nice stroll! Highly recommend the visit its very pretty!

It's a park. This is a park, big one, pretty much same just like every other park on the planet. Great place to chill, relax and take some time off from the wild Amsterdam experience. Watch for the wild joggers, bikers, runners, dog walkers etc. If there's no rain (which is considered a miracle in the Netherlands) Vondel will be very crowded.

Lovely to explore. We came here on a cold and sunny day in March after visiting the nearby museums.It was a lovely place to stroll through with a very nice cafe.it was lovely to see herons walking around,seemingly not bothered by us humans milling about and I would imagine it's a lovely place to be in the summer.

Perfect park. Vondelpark hosts a brilliant area of space for couples, groups, and families. Myself and partner took a lovely stroll around the peaceful park, and it was very enjoyable. Like all of Amsterdam, there were cyclists everywhere, but it's fine sharing the footpath. There are many burger/hotdog stands and after all that walking I highly recommend checking them out; best hotdogs in Amsterdam. It's a great place to go if you just want to chill out away from the centre of Amsterdam. Its a huge park and in the summer I shall definitely be back with an array of picnic goods!

Wonderful park for families!. We rented bikes nearby and explored the park with our kids. We were blown away by the various playgrounds and surprising natural gems in the park. Don't miss the tree house rope bridges to climb and the super slides at the end of the park. The pub next to the slides was super family friendly and a perfect spot to end our awesome day.
Great Park. Everybody told me before may trip that the place was awesome... when I got there, i thought it was only good... anyway, it was worth going there
Vondelpark. Beautiful place to walk on a sunny day. It can get busy at the weekends but lots of lovely lakes and green areas to see. It would be nice to bike around as well.

Best park of Amsterdam!. For about 7 years I have lived 500m away from Vondelpark! Loved it! It's great for all sorts of occasions; a picknick, drinks or a bbq, a bit of fun cycling around, walking your dog and most of all great for running. One lap is about 3.2km, no need to worry about traffic and lights! During warm summer days, the park is packed! Everyone wants to be here, locals and tourists!

Lovely park for strolling in the sunshine. Loved this park as we visited on a nice sunny afternoon. Very tranquil space in the city. There is quite a bit of wild life to see with various types of birds. There are also some cafes with outdoor seating. Entrance to the park is free.

Perfect for a picnic or break from the city. Perfect for a nice couple of hours away from the crowds and buildings. On a nice day this is the ideal spot for a family picnic or bike ride. It's just a lovely area and worth a visit.

Beautiful park. Great park for cycling, walking, running, and just hanging out. The weather was amazing when we were there, which made it even better. There are nice places for grabbing drinks and a bite to eat.

Fab!. Beautiful park with lakes and huge paths to allow for all the bicycles and walkers. This park was one of best attractions to visit in the centre. Rent out a bicycle for the day and explore the grounds,you will not regret this! 😄 😄
Very pretty.. We were lucky, as our trip was blessed with a very sunny and warm, April day. Being a Sunday too the park was full of people doing all activities. A very pretty oasis in the busy city.

Great Park and Nice Break from the City. We rode our rented bikes (Star Bike Rental near Centraal) through the park for a nice long ride. It was wonderful, even in the off-season of March. The trails are generally not paved, but it wasn't too dusty on the bike. The park was crowded, so there was plenty of people watching. I would recommend taking a walk / ride through the park after you see the I Amsterdam sign and the Rijksmuseum close by.

Lovely day spent cycling around this lush park.. Well worth a visit to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. We hired bikes and had coffee in the park. Right opposite the park entrance is the Hard Rock Cafe. Lovely way to spend the day.

Good for a walk. It is a public park to visit if you are nearby. If the weather is good, you can go and spend an afternoon maybe. In march, it was sunny and clear but cold so we just walked. There are places to drink and eat in the park.
Small and nice. We went to the park for some fresh air near the centrum. I recommend renting a bike and going cycling around the park. It's not big, but its very nice.

Basic open area. Worth a quick visit not the best park I've experienced but a green open space in the city is always welcome. Maybe the cold wet day didn't help but seemed to lack children friendly play areas.

Amazing place. Vondelpark is an absolutely beautiful open space in Amsterdam... A huge green space ideal for walking, going for picnic, or just walking... It's a wonderful landscape for riding your bike!

Want to come back in the warmer weather.. The Vondelpark is a beauty, reminded me of NYC's Central Park or SF's Golden Gate Park. The walking trails, plantings, sculptures, green lawns, water features, and variety of trees are amazing.

Lovely park to spend your lazy summer day. I was in Amsterdam visiting a friend and we spent our lazy sunday summer afternoon enjoying cold beer. The park gets pretty crowded during weekends. one can also enjoy cycling around the park.
Relaxing time. Large park to explore. If you want to isolate yourself from the busy centre of Amsterdam, this is the perfect place. I recommend you to rent a bike and cycle around it. It was great.

Beautiful park. Hire a bike as its easy to see the whole park and get to grip with using a bike in Amsterdam. Tourists are not the favorite of local cyclists as the bike culture takes a bit of learning

Beautiful park. This is a lovely park to have a walk around of hire a bike to cycle through. The park was not particularly busy so if you wanted to do a bike ride away from the roads this place is ideal. We went just for a walk around and stopped for a coffee at the cafe, was lovely even though it was still quite cold the sun shining made it a pleasant afternoon.

Nice park. Not very children's friendly to me. Children rating 2.5/5. Maybe in summertime when they can run around the grass it is a good park for children but in the middle of Easter with the wind blowing on the back of your head it is not the most pleasant place to be. Having gone thru half the park and not having found one single playground for children to play in, we just left. Maybe they are all gathered in the other half we didn't see. Also the fact that the bikes cross the park at the speed of light using the same paths as people that are walking, makes it dangerous for children to be let loose so in the end, it is just not for them. Also be aware, bikes mostly, don't stop so you better look before you move around.
Beautiful Place. Even though it was still cold, it was still a great place to run and walk around. Enjoyed just walking around and looking at the sights.
Vondelpark. Great place to go for a walk with friends, couple, or just for taking your dog for a walk (There is a dog area for them to play)
Best Park. Nice place for a stroll or a run or a joint early in the morning & at anytime of day. Beautiful park & friendly people.

Vondelpark Is Hub of Activity. Visited this park in the southwest near the Museum Quarter on a Saturday morning. It seemed like the entire city was here jogging. The park is quite large and the adjoining neighborhoods are some of the wealthiest in the city. Great place to get a sense of the lifestyle of the locals.
It's a park?!. What more is there to say? Great restaurant (when you find it) :)About half way it's a a little hidden gemBlah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah (filling the 100 words)
Small paradise. The park is nice to relax in afternoon. A lot of students hang around and appreciate the advantages of Amsterdam.

A lovely oasis in the city. We only had about an hour before we were scheduled to visit the Van Gogh museum but enjoyed walking through the gardens on a warm sunny day in March. The birds, especially parrots, were very neat to see after a long Canadian winter.
If we had more time we would have stayed longer

Seasonal But Beautiful. I stayed in an apartment very close to the park and found myself walking through every morning to wake myself up for the day. I visited in March and found most of the trees and plants to be rather bare but all in all with the art, activity and sunlight the park really shone to be absolutely beautiful and made up for season discrepancies. I would like to come back and see the park in Summer when it is in full bloom and at the height of its beauty

Lovely ring necked parakeets!. Enjoyed a wee solo walk tonight in this park. It was lovely to see and hear so many wild parakeets as well as being able to spot the usual blue tits etc. Interesting to watch all the locals doing their exercise.
Lovely.. Beautiful and relaxing. Lovely park to walk through in the sunshine. As it was sunny there was quite a few people around. A few nice little ice cream carts around which added to the day.
An treed oasis in an otherwise brick and mortar city. I partly grew up in Amsterdam and have some fond memories of this park. Going back did not disappoint.
beautiful park!. Stopped in this park between a tour of the Rijikesmueum and the Van Gogh museum with Babylon tours and loved it!

Lovely place!. This is such a pretty place to visit! I wondered round the park for a long time and I still don't think that I saw all of it! Lots of benches, paths, lakes, trees and just a lovely quiet spot in the middle of a busy city! It is very easy to get to on the tram:)

Nice park. We had a brief wander around the park - only because the weather was terrible and had hoped to return if the weather improved. It was nice to see the parrots flying wild and people walking their dogs and cycling around, as well as the ponds.

The best Park!. On a sunny day it seems the whole of Amsterdam converges on this sprawling equivalent of New York’s Central Park. Couples kiss on the grass, friends cradle beers at the outdoor cafes, while others trade songs on beat-up guitars, the youth smoking a joint, the Street performers work the crowds, and kids rush the playgrounds. It’s all very democratic, just like Amsterdam. The English-style layout offers an abundance of ponds, lawns, thickets and winding footpaths that encourage visitors to get out and explore the scene. Vondelpark is home to a selection of restaurants and cafés, including the Blauwe Theehuis (my favourite one) , Café Vertigo, Vondelpark3, De Vondeltuin and the Groot Melkhuis. You’ll also find a skate rental shop, an open-air theatre and a rose garden with more than 70 types of roses in the park. The Main Entry is near the Leidsenplein. Honestly, you have to come to this spot!
Sunny walk. This was on the way from our hotel to town so we traversed this park a couple of times. Full of runners and cyclists. Excellent parks with a number of attractions and fooderies!
Great setting for a nice stroll. Lucky for us, we were just down the road from the park. It was great for strolling through, especially if you are looking for an escape from the city setting.

A pleasant park in the heart of the city. The shier lack of cars in the city of Amsterdam makes the air feel clean and the noise levels low. However if you need a little shelter from the motor vehicles and trams and need a little green therapy (not that kind of green, that's elsewhere) then head to Vondelpark. There's no shortage of bikes circulating the inner city park and we found it a great place to warm up the cycling skills before hitting the city.Lots of trees, ducks, grass and…um…bikes. Check it out.
Lovely!. Lovely park to cycle or walk through, especially on a nice day! The history of this park is very interesting, especially how it was founded.

A spacious and beautiful park. This is worth a visit but if you can arrange to go on a sunny day when the flowers are out it would be an added bonus. It is a very popular park we visited at the weekend but it was enjoyable wandering around the gardens.

The Vondelpark, a park where you can relax. VONDELPARK The Vondelpark is a large public urban park located in Amsterdam Oud-Zuid, also kwon as the Vondelpark buurt ( Vondelpark area), in Amsterdam. The park is named after Joost van Den Vondel, a Dutch poet and play writer. On sunny days the flows full of sun worshippers who are comfortable on the lawns where you can relax with a drink and a snack. The park is well furnished, there is a large playground for the little ones, and you can play football, cycling, walking and tennis. The park is a 5-minute walk from the museum square . In summer, mostly in weekends, there are on a stage in the park free concerts. You can find the agenda on internet.
Nice park. At the end of 3. months, just beginning to blossom, certainly in the spring a lot nicer. Although he now was very nice, a nice walk and not far away.

Enjoy the Park - Take care amidst the hords of bicycles. Before you go into the park, get some provisions and have a picnic on one of the many benches. There are some wonderful playgrounds for kids, dog run areas, and plenty of patch to wander around. On the main thoroughfare, watch out for all the cyclists.

Must Visit. I am fortunate enough to be able to visit Vondelpark everyday since I walk my dog there. The park is not too big to where you can walk the whole park and not feel lost like Central Park or Hyde Park, but big enough to where you feel like you can find your own little spot of tranquility.There are multiple restaurants/cafes in the park where you can stop and get food or a coffee. There are playgrounds for kids and also a rose garden. There are lots of people working out in groups and running. There are also a couple of dog fields where all of the dog owners head to and let their dogs off leash to run and play. There may be one dog or 20 dogs at one time.Many people ride their bikes through the park. If you are a tourist remember to look both ways before crossing in case a bike is coming your way. You can also rent bikes to cycle through the park which is fun. Just remember to follow the rules and stay on the right side when riding.Overall, a visit to Vondelpark is a must if you're visiting Amsterdam.
Nice park. Fantastic Area for adults and kidsWe spent some hours there and it is just a Nice cost placeCan absolutely recommend thisThomas

Nice sized popular park nice to visit in all seasons!!!. I really like Vondel Park!!! It is a nice park to visit at any timme of year. There are always people around. Can be a bit busy when it is really sunny - tourist & locals. People ride their bikes, walk, lots of joggers there. The park is dog-friendly ... spots where you can let your dog run unleashed.During Kingsday (April 27th) the park is designated for 'kids only rummage sale' - though I noticed adult kids last year!.People busk here, picnic here. The park is nicely kept and there are a couple of nice cafes. At the right timme of year you can see nesting storks!!!There are so mmany varied activities - including a one mminute eye contact/humman connection exercise. Lots of timmes there are filmm/tv scenes being shot. Police horses ride through. Swimm pools for the kiddies and swings, slides and of course, trees abound!!!

Fabulous stroll. We stayed on the edge of Vondelpark so walked through it when heading to the museums. It is so pretty even in the chill of the morning. Many dogs being walked and they are so well behaved they dont run at you at all and just go about their business, so if you are scared of dogs dont worry we walked through twice a day for 4 days and never had one come near us.Can only imagine how beautiful it would be in spring and summer!! Definitely stroll or bike through if you have the chance
Very pleasant and relaxing. A very pretty park, perfect for weekend relaxation and for tourists who want a bit of down time from the hustle and bustle of the city attractions.
Boring little park. It's not like I picture a park. Not nice at all. Boring park without anything cozy or nice. Doesn't worth your time!!!Go somewhere else

Nice way to observe the Amsterdam families and couples on the weekend. We found this carefully maintained park a nice place to stretch our feet after a long plane flight. The weekend stroll allowed us to see the young families biking, the runners taking classes and dog owners from the neighborhood. It's entrance was near to many other attractions. We missed visiting a local grocery /deli market. That would have been fun way to have a picnic.

Cycle around. Me and my girlfriend visited Amsterdam for a 4 day easter break. Cycling around Vondelpark was one of our favourite pass times. The park has a lovely communal atmosphere. It is a great place to get to know your rental bike without the threat of crashing into oncoming cars, trams, small children or heaven forbid one of amsterdams many canals.Vondelpark is approximately a fifteen mimute leisurely bike ride from Centraal Station.

Bicycle rentals! (No deposit required). You can do lots of amazing things in this craziest city! You can lose and find yourself, you can have a blowout, there are not much rules in this city, its fredooooom! After these foreword if you expecting an insane recommend sorry I let you down but my suggestion is; rent a bike, enjoy the Vondelpark and the city. You feel like a real Amsterdammer with just a bike:) there are several bike shops around the Vondelpark, we paid 40€ for 4 person for 2 hours. Really was a great experience, better try than sorry..
Lovely stroll. Good for all types of outing and surfaces for bikes, walking, wheelchairs etc. Toilet central in a cafe
Nice Park. Vondel Park is quite large and is very nice. It would be great for a run or cycle or just to lie around on a sunny day. I wouldn't go out of my way to visit if the weather is bad.

Visit this place any time of the year. This amazing park is full of places where you can you sit and relax. It is specially nice during the summer, but also good to go for a ride during the coldest times.

Beautiful and relaxing . What a way to spend a sunny afternoon.
Whether it's waking, cycling or lying on the grass.
There's a wonderful little cafe too.
A space to watch the world go buy.

Wished I Had a Dog With Me. Nice clean park to stroll around. It would have been nice to have a dog to walk around with. It's very near the Rijksmuseum and shops of Hobbemastraat which are nice areas as well.

A relaxing afternoon walk in the Vondelpark. This is a park filled with lush trees and calm lakes. There are many ducks and birds around and these animals share the same space in a non competitive manner with human beings. It does not have fancy stuff in it but it is very relaxing to walk in it or just sit or lie around leisurely to bask in the sunshine, nature and animals. Worth visiting, no need to queue and it is free.
Lovely park. Me and a friend made a picnic and went here, gorgeous.Kept getting lost each time as its so big but enjoyed getting lost.
Quaint little walk . This park is beautiful, well worth a visit if you're wanting to get away from the busy hustle & bustle of central Amsterdam. Good for bike riding or just a gentle evening stroll.
Nice Park!. Great place for a walk on a sunny day. Quiet open and not a lot of cover if the weather were to turn. Theres a nice cafe/eatery in the centre and a few ponds/streams running through.
Wonderful evening stroll. Relaxing place for a quick stroll during the evening and then enjoying the sun. Quirky performances happening all the time. It is a good place to cycle.

Beautiful break from the city. I was staying in Amsterdam with my friend in a hotel really close by, we walked through the park almost everyday. It was always beautiful and enjoyable even on a cold grey day. There were dogs everywhere and it was lovely to sees many different people doing things in the park (exercising, cycling, walking, playing). Best when sunny obviously.
An extremely nice place. If you're tired of the busy vibrant city and would like an hour or two of peace and quiet, then this should be the place to go
medium size park in Amsterdam. Park is used day and night. Especially during summer very crowded. All day people are jogging, skating and walking in park.

The main formal city park of Amsterdam. The place to go if you want to run, walk, sit on the grass with friends or simply see something green (Amsterdam streets don't have much trees, so you need to go to a park to see them).
It's located close to the main museums, so they together click into a good day trip.
And it's free!
Do not expect more compared to other cities. The park is nice, and full of people, perhaps too many cycles. But do not expect more compared to other cities.
Great park. Ideal for a wander - just watch out for bikes! There were lots of people out running and fitness sessions all over the park.
Nice stroll. Always look out for bikes and joggers! Well located near the museums and not far from Albert Cuyp market. Nice shops around too

Great for a stroll. Perfect place to stroll or ride bikes. If you enter near leidersplein and leave at first exit bearing left and then left again , there is a great shopping street leading down towards the museums.

Nice park. We stayed opposite Vondal park so went for a walk every day through it. Lots of cyclists - they seem to have right of way everywhere! Joggers, dog walkers and families all mingle and make this a very pleasurable park

Amsterdam's Central Park. For the Amsterdam's in the summer this is the place to meet up and picnic - read a book in the sun - play a game of football with your friends. A friendly buzzing atmosphere. Close to the Museums so after an intense visit a great place to chill out! Lovely gardens to wonder through.In the winter still a great place to go for a run in the chill weather.
Beautiful. A beautiful Park.. And the history.. To know that Anne Frank played in this park as add young girl..
Beautiful Park. Beautiful park located in the museum area. Great walk, lots of birds, and dogs. Popular bike paths, lovely stroll though a beautiful park.

Oasis in the city. Having walked for miles on narrow, winding streets trying not to be run over by bikes, scooters, motorbikes, trams, taxis, cars, buses and whatever else shot out from behind a lamp post... This park was a joy...The ability to stretch your legs, wiggle your arms, secure I. The knowledge that you weren't going to lose a limb in the process was fantastic.The only reason I'm not giving it an 'excellent' is nothing to do with the park itself, but more to do with the people with dogs who seem unable to clean up the 'mess' left by their dogs.Stick to the paths unless you want to stop every ten feet to clean your shoes.

Beautiful scenery!. Wonderful place to spend time with your family! We rode our bikes through the park, stopped at parks, passed beautiful ponds, and houses. Large beautiful paths excellent for walking and biking!

Beautiful greenery. It was a bit cold when we visited but that was a given since me and my friends visited in early February. It would be great to visit Vondelpark in the summer. Plenty of wildlife wandering around the park, especially at the lake. Landscape artists would love this place!

Most famous parc in Amsterdam. If you happen to be in the surrounding area, go there and walk through the parc. If you are in Amsterdam while the weather is beautifull: take something to drink and eat with you and a book and enjoy your stay at the parc together with the Amsterdam inhabitants!
Raining? Stay away(:
As good as a good London Park. Great place to relax after a long stint of museuming. Beautiful in good weather, less so in the rain (but that's a general truth). Take a picnic with you and enjoy.

Beautiful park!. A local friend had suggested we visited this park which he called the "Central Park" of Amsterdam. So on our last day we rented bikes and went to Vondelpark. We all had a wonderful time, the park is beautiful and is perfect for a bike ride.
Beautiful. I love the vondlepark. It is definitely a highlights of Amsterdam where you can go to just chill out or alternatively have a nice cycle or run through.

Peaceful walk. We had a nice peaceful walk around Vondelpark although we didn't think it was really that special. Our hotel was next to the park and I think I would have been disappointed if we had gone out of our way to visit this place. Good place for a run / stroll away from the noise of the trams and masses of bikes.I would imagine in the summer it would be a nice place for a picnic especially for families.

Nature At It's Best. If you Love spending time outside this is definitely for You. Walking, cycling, jogging or having a picnic with friends or family this is the Ideal place to visit. It's Huge and Beautifully maintained A Must Do for Winter or Summer

Beautiful Park. The a Central Park of Amsterdam. Stunning place with lots of activities taking place. Everything from bike riding to exercise classes and running groups. Even saw a man practicing walking on a tight rope suspended from two trees. Beautiful trees, pagodas, ponds. A must do on a beautiful sunny day.

Ok. Ben tenuto ma un parco come altri.I can't see that it is something extraordinary to see, in my opinion it is as beautiful as many other parks. It is ok if u want to go biking on a sunny day or of u want to have a walk, maybe with ur family or friends.
Peaceful. The park it's 4kms long. Good to ride on a bike and go read a book. Really nice place to relax or go for a run.
Stunning. Absolutely loved this park. Really is beautiful to go and see the sights. The ice cream is nice and you can sit in the nice cafe/bar on sight.

Beautiful. Wonderful park, had an amazing truffle trip there, convinced the bright green parrots were hallucinations but turns out they're real! Flying about everywhere - amazing!Lovely park even if you're not tripping, lots of places to chill, walk about, water features, pub in the middle with great food, picturesque bandstand etc. Nice spot to relax in the middle of bustling Amsterdam.
walk picnik. In the center of the city it is a beautiful park.Take a walk and relax , picnik or drink a coffee .There is a small open theater and restaurants around .
Great sunny morning. Excellent for a sunny morning, in a bike or on your foot, beautiful park for family, couples or friends.

Nature and peace close to the city center.. The visit happened in March, the trees were leafless and the weather a little cold. The park was full of life, vibrant, the architecture around was visible and this added to it's charm. Will visit it every time, can't wait to see it during summer as well.Walking distance from the city center: around 20 minutes.If you go with kids, a binocular would be a good thing to have, the park is full of small rivers and lakes where the birds are easy to admire.

Full of wonders. I went to Amsterdam last year and it was one of the most amazing experiences of my life. I got to walk around the city for a whole day and although I was very tired at the end of it I would not change a thing! The city is magical, the old buildings and the style of the city, the people was so warm and the canals are so beautiful. The one thing that caught my attention the most, was vondelpark. I got there and started walking and walking and it seems like it's never going to end, it's so big! What was so amusing about it was the fact that it is full of animals, little lakes, spaces for children and even a place for found objects! (If you find something, anything, that doesn't belong to you, you just leave it there for the owner to look for it) isn't it incredible? It's a beautiful place to go with friends, family or that special someone.

Beautiful haven in Amsterdam.. I was surprised when I first heard about vondelpark, I wondered how peaceful it could be being just on the edge of the city. I was happily proven wrong, the park is a wonderful place to spend time. We visited twice, once early afternoon and then again later in the evening. In the afternoon the park was filled with families and people on bikes, skates and dozing in the sun (we had beautiful weather when we visited in september) and in the evening it was much the same. Lots of exercise classes and people sitting on the grass.The park itself is beautiful, extremely clean and well kept and there are lots of birds and wildlife to see. We had heard some rumours not to go down at night but it's one of those things, I wouldn't go to Central Park at night either. Whether it becomes a sinister place or not we never saw even the hint of it being a "bad" place to go. It was peaceful, clean and quiet. Perfect when you want to take a break from the hustle and bustle for a little while.

Relaxing . Me and my boyfriend went for a walk around Vondelpark it is so big!!! It is beautiful especially in the spring! Would be great to go on a bike ride around the park. Otherwise just a nice walk
Have a walk in the park and see Amsterdam come a life.. Great park in the city center of Amsterdam. See people jog, walk their dogs and surprise acts on stage from well known performers.

Probably nice in summer.... Been to Hyde Park? St James' Park? Any park with trees and a lake/river/stream? Well you've seen it all then.
I was pretty underwhelmed but not because the park isn't lovely, but because I'd been told such amazing things about Vondelpark. It is literally JUST A PARK.
I bet it's lovely in summer...
Great Park in the heart of the city. The park is well kept and is nicely in the centre of the city! I would suggest hiring a bicycle to see the entire park.

A beautiful place to have a leisurely walk. Watch out for bikes, as in the rest of Amsterdam, bikes rule. But having said that, it is a beautiful place to spend some time, and the sight of parrots living free there was a pleasant shock.

Despite the weather... It was a beautiful park and the cafe in the middle was so welcoming! Definitely worth a scroll so many people to meet and get along with!
Also close to the higher end shops
Beautiful place for a lacy stroll. Great place to go to for a lacy stroll or a morning jog when you need som fresh air and want to relax. A little bit like Central Park in NY.

Beautiful Park. Vondelpark is a very beautiful park in the center of Amsterdam with in the middle the cafe het Theehuisje. If you in Amsterdam it's a must go for a little walk, but beware of the bikers etc.

Nice, clean & quiet place. We've been here in March and were lucky to have some sunny days in Amsterdam.
Although the trees were not green yet, the park is still pretty and perfect for a relaxing walk.

Oase of peace in the middle of Amsterdam. A visit to Amsterdam is not complete without a visit to Vondelpark. It's for free, but addictive, next time you visit Amsterdam you want to be there again. Cycling, jogging, playing chess or just relaxing in the sun, just do it!
Beautiful oasis on unexpectedly sunny day. Only intended to pass through the park en route to museums but worth a stroll and coffee on a sunny day.

central park Amsterdam. The place to be on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Colorfull people, music, food. It can be a bit crowdy but the atmosphere is so cozy and everyone seems in a good mood. There is only one place that does me thinking of: Central Park New York...
Stunning. Beautiful park with loads of nice spaces to spend time. The paths are good and the park itself is really lovely and we'll kept.

Peaceful space in the city for a short walk. Lovely park very close to the Rijksmuseum and The Park Hotel where I stayed. Great for walking, cycling and lots of locals dog walking. A clean and calming space in the city which was lovely to escape to during a busy working week.

Beautiful Park. My husband and I visited this park at the weekend and had a lovely time. It was very well maintained and it was lovely to walk round.
I did think however that they could do with a nice restaurant, the only one we found didn't look particularly nice!
Relaxing and fun!. Depending on the time of your visit you might find a live music performance in the middle of the park. Definitely a must see!

Morniing walk. As our visit was in early spring, very few spring flowers were out, and the trees were leafless, but the park was well laid out and patronised, by cyclists, joggers, dog walkers and mothers pushing prams.or cycling with children
A lovely Sunday morning walk. Vondelpark was a gorgeous place to walk on a sunny Sunday morning. A must-see, if only for the resident parakeets!

Nice park to walk or ride a bike. The view is very nice and there are some nice lakes to see.
Worth checking out if you want a nice place to chill.
Nothing special. It is just a park like any other. We read so many positive reviews, so we had high expectations but once we went there we were not thrilled. We've seen better parks.

Relaxing and soulful. A really great park, well worth a walk or cycle around whilst in Amsterdam. Its vast with plenty of places to sit, have lunch or just watch the world go by. Full of locals at the weekend
Gorgeous to ride around on bikes . We had a lovely ride around on our bikes, great for pics. We also had a nice walk around and stopped for a drink. Highly recommend especially when dry !
A Haven of Calm. Vondelpark Park is a great place to escape to from the hustle and bustle of the city. Large open spaces, surrounded by impressive architecture and a mixture of birdlife.

What a beautiful park. We have been this park before but never walked right through, what a beautiful park it is, it has some weirdly fascinating tree's and beautiful scenery, we would love to come back here in the summer to sit chill and watch the world go by

Great in all seasons. A beautiful park in the centre of Amsterdam. In summer packed with picnic visitors and outdoor concert goers. In other months visitors strolling, cycling, or jogging through. Well worth a visit in any season. Also a nice selection of cafes and restaurants in the park to choose from.

If You Are On A Budget, This Is A Great Place To Relax And Enjoy Your "Store Bought" Food!. Many people try to see too much in too little time. It can be utterly exhausting. Make time to relax in parks. Enjoy a store bought meal. You will save a lot to spend on something else. The local Albert Heijn sell super good quality salads and bread. This is a really big park, and so much to see. Use the time to go through your travel notes, or read the local newspaper! When planning a trip to another country or city I make much use of other peopl's reviews. It will be great if locals can give more clear directions on how to get to places they review, especially on local transport - advice on which tickets are better value for money. I find Netherlands different types of transport tickets quite intimidating. Love Amsterdam!! Hope to return soon!!
Lovely park. Lovely to stroll around - storks , herons and parrots!! Very busy with people walking cycling and running
Nice depending on the weather. Simple park, can be very pretty but it was a little cold for us. It's a nice place to bring some food and have a picnic
Cycling Heaven.. Great place for safe cycling, running or walking. Lots of open space, wildlife aplenty. Pleasant cafe with indoor and outdoor seating areas.
Park/scenery. Lovely place for a walk with nice wildlife seen a woodpecker for first time which was good the park is well kept and plenty of places to sit and relax

Great run... . I live in Dublin and run in Europe's largest park, so I'm therefore a total snob! Vondelpark is stunning, quiet and surrounded by beautiful homes. It just makes one want to move to Amsterdam. The overall feeling of a fresh city is enhanced by this beautiful little park...I ran there this morning and Thomas and I plan a walk & coffee in the cafe there this afternoon...

An oasis! . Stunning park, you forget you're in the middle of a city here. Wander amongst the lakes and trees and look out for the parakeets! Definitely worth a look and an ideal chance to get away from the crowds.

Great for cycling. We hired some bikes to bike around the park, it was great, the park is flat and brilliant for those who aren't very confident on bikes!! The park is beautiful and there are some great places to grab some coffee if you need a break or to warm up
Lovely park - probably wasn't the best time to see it. We had a lovely walk around this park. It was a bright day but it was very cold which, in some ways, spoilt the experience.
The Central Park of Amsterdam. The classic central park every city (should) have. Great to walk around in if you want a quick nature breeze in the city centre.

There are better less crowded parks in Amsterdam . Volndelpark is great for a stroll, bike ride or run. However anytime except for winter it is very crowded and mostly with tourists. For more authentic Amsterdam Park experience try westerpark on a sunny day.
Lovely. Lovely spot to escape the bustle of the city very clean and well maintained was lovely to cycle around as it wasn't too busy! Imagine it is gorgeous in the summer!
Great park. Lovely park to walk around in the fresh march air. Lots to see - a bit far if you are based city centre but easy trams. Great for a bike ride.

Great place. For those who love nature this park is a wonderful place where you can relax a have a great time. Sometime it is a little crowded but if you look around you can find easily a quiet place.

Beautiful park. Great park has everything a park should have. Open space, play area's. Lakes, coffee shop, open air stage. Used as a commuting route for cyclists and pedestrians. Lots of people exercise in the park.
Peace and tranquility. Just a stones throw from the Rijks Museum is this island of serenity, an immaculately kept garden with spectacular water features and winding walkways.

Nice arena for a stroll n the park. Another green lung in a Biking city! We just strolled along the park keeping sight of the very beautiful houses along the side of the park and found the caféterras for a teabrake just before it pourred down
Park . Park is lovely to walk round, just got to be careful not to be run over by the thousands of bikes going round, and not far from iamamsterdam sign

Great for a sunny day. We went there on a sunny Sunday, it was full of people running, riding their bikes, skating, going for a walk... the environment was great. The park it's very nice, with several lakes and classified areas for dogs, ball games, terraces...
Walk in the park. Lovely afternoon stroll around Vondelpark. There are a couple of places to eat and drink. Loads of benches to sit and watch people go by!
Beautiful :). Take a bike and for for a ride! totally worth it. Very clean and quite, gives you a sense of what's living for the locals is really like
Great to cycle round. Nice park, especially in the sun, and lovely to take an afternoon cycle around. Quite busy there but I imagine it would be nice for a picnic.

Best Park I've visited . Vondel is a picturesque huge space in the middle of Amsterdam's lively Leidsplein. There is a large stage for performances, many activities to join in with, and plenty of spaces to sit down and enjoy a smoke/beer/the view. If you fancy a quite lunch or a chilled evening in the middle of the touristy area of Dam then drop by vondel. Really recommend renting a bike and cycling through as it is a very very large park!
Beautiful Park. Lovely park, does not feel like you are in a capital city. Great for a stroll, cycle or picnic. Free!

Quiet oasis in the middle of the city. We went for a walk here on a Sunday morning around 8am. Here you see a different side to Amsterdam the runners and dog walkers are in the park but it remains really calm & peaceful.

A happy place to be. We cycled Vondlepark park. We loved the flowing tree lined paths. I am sure it will be even more beautiful innthecsummer months. A ver peaceful spot in the middle of Amsterdam. Wonderful for runners too.

Nice Park. Nice park to have a wander around and kill an hour or two. Good to hire a bicycle from one of the many rental companies around Amsterdam and have a leisurely ride around. Nice little cafe in the centre overlooking a pond where you can relax and people watch

Here it happens. Already ages ago it was the green lung of Amsterdam. A lot of unexpected things can happen here , like musique , swimming , drugrelated things , walking , biking , etc. Keep it clean. OK for children accompanied.

Ahhhh, Vondelpark. Fab for cycling, running, chilling and watching the storks go by...I mean...the world. It is a big park with art, water, places to sunbathe or sit in the shade under an ancient tree filled with funny parakeets. You can even BBQ in the park. Packed during holidays and sunny days. But do also give it a go on a foggy morning. Sheer bliss!
A beautiful spot on foot or by bike. On a good day its a beautiful walk or alternatively hire a bike to get around faster. A lovely spot for a summer picnic.

Wonderful park!. Wonderful park! Easily accessible from the city center and close to the Museumplein.The park is beautiful and quite big, it is nice to walk around or go by bike.Of course is better to go in sunny days.During Kingsday also offer a nice marketplace made by kids with second hand stuff and self-made games.

Relaxing. We rode our bikes around the park and it was so beautiful. It's nearby the Hard Rock Cafe, which is what we were originally searching for but ended up spending quite a bit of time riding around enjoying the views.
Beautiful!. Lots of people, youths, families.couples get here to rest, dance, play music or ride bikes! be careful with them!!The lake across the park is beautiful and generates nice atmosphere!

Perfect place in a sunny day. Vondelpark is the perfect place to go for a walk in a sunny day. It gives the feeling of being out of the city and it's right next to the centre of Amsterdam. Good restaurants to get a coffee or a snack.
Nice Park. Visited this park on both my visits to Amsterdam and I must say it is definitely worth a visit. It is easily accessible from the local tram system.

Best Park in Summertime. Truly the best park in summertime, but also nice to come during winter and enjoy the snow. It offers great variety of concerts and events so make sure to check out the internet before you visit.
Nice to relax. If you want too rest a little of the middle of the city, this park if perfect, you can seat and soak up the sun.
A must see beauty. A lovely visit to Vondelpark, so peaceful and tranquil to wander through. A great, clean park suitable for families, couples or simply for a moment to reflect on your thoughts.
Delightful. A treasure a few minutes walk from the museum area. Take a picnic and make the most of a lovely park in a gem of a city.

Beautiful wander. 10-15min walk after finishing the Rijksmuseum. Got a hot chocolate from the cafe and walked around the ponds and grassy areas. Beautiful trees. Really pleasant walk. Would come again.
Go for a walk. Relaxing walk watching bicycle riders, walkers, runners, and dogs. Peaceful time in middle of city. Find an entrance and just walk.

Brilliant and vibrant park. After getting lost numerous times trying to find the park we were pleased that it was so big. Even though it was quite busy with cyclists rushing around and runners there was plenty of space for everyone. It was great to just wonder around and feel like you weren't in the middle of a busy city.I would highly recommend a bike tour to take you to Vondelpark as all the people on tours looked like the were having great fun and probably didn't have sore feet like we did!!

Trippy if you've just had a box of mushrooms.. We bought a pack of 10g Atlantis mushrooms each, and walked to the park. After about 50 minutes, the first thing we noticed was blue became really intense and stood out from every other colour. Then the sky became the most amazing blue, and started changing between blues and violets.Then they kicked in harder and peoples faces started to change, so we found a bench to sit on in the sun away from people. We stayed on the bench for around 2-3 hours talking crap seeing the floor melt and not wanted to stand up, with giggles none stop, laughing till we were crying. The park was the perfect place to take these and it was an unreal experience! To top it all off, on the way out, parrots were flying around everywhere! WHAT?!We thought it was the mushrooms, but we took pictures of them and checked later, and there are actual parrots in the park! Everywhere!! Such a good park!
Decent Park. Big park you can walk or ride a bicycle or watch the ducks if you fed up with the crowd of the city. A decent big park next to city center and Holland Casino.

Nice but not perfectly maintained. for such a world known place I would like it to be a little more well kept. there where broken branches and in some places the path had sunk to make large puddles in the middle of the paths

Nice park. Great place to relax from the busy city centre. We walked all the way round, stopping often to watch dogs play or people run. It was busy and you have to keep an eye on all the bikes. I wouldn't like to have a small child with me on the loose! The park was clean and tidy.
Quiet, Beautiful.. We had a walk in this park after our trip to the VG museum. A good place for anyone looking to unwind after a long day.
Lovely, even in the cold. Cold wind blowing but enjoyed walking through this haven from the business of the city. Nice walks, peaceful, nice to just "be" in a hectic city center.

lovely! . beautiful park with some interesting sculptures! look put for the big wooden hand holding a tree branch.
lovely spot to stroll with your loved one or find a bench and relax in the tranquility.
Feel the nature🍃. The vondelpark is a great place in amsterdam to relax and enjoy the silence of nature.Great for bikes and walking in a sunny days 😍🌷
