Very pretty!. Stayed really close to this park and glad we had a stroll to see it. It's really huge and clearly a great 'cut-through' for cyclist's as it was very busy. Really relaxing to sit and people watch.
Awesome. A beautiful place to stay in a sunny day. Much people but safe place .. Very big with bathroom and something to eat and drink inside
Much of green and relax in the heart of the city. A beautiful park between the Museum pplein and Leidse plein, worth walking around when waiting on your boat trip

Walk In The Park. My first impression of this location was just how much is stood out in contrast to the rest of the city. It turned out to be this incredibly large piece of greenery surrounded by anything but. I first took a walk through the park, until later it dawned on me just how big it was. The next day I came back, but this time had rented a bike. Very well clean. Very tranquil. It was a wonderful public park.
Beautiful. Vondelpark is beautiful rain or shine! Unfortunately while we were in Amsterdam we had more rain/snow than sun, but it was still lovely to walk around Vondelpark in the fresh air
A place to chill. Really lovely park to relax in the sun . Lovely atmosphere and lovely scenery as well. Its a nice place to have a walk and to clear your mind aswell.
Great place to chill. Nice at any time of the year. Great in the summer with people from all walks chilling. Lots of dogs, bikes and a few good and drink stops through the park
nice walk. great place for a walk, and if the weather permits you'll have a good location to take photos as well.

Peaceful park on our hotel's doorstep. Great park to have your morning jog or stroll in. Relatively small (3.3km jogging route) but others a peaceful haven from the hustle and bustle of the city. Be warned: lots of bikes flying through the parks cycle routes. I'd recommend trying a hot dog with the free toppings that you can put for yourself with a coffee, sit back and take in the (occasional) sun.

Peaceful yet energetic. After seeing all the museums and canals, I longed to See a park.. A place where I could sit doing nothing much without noise and enjoying nature. This is exactly how it is here.Plus there are people jogging, kids playing, lovely dogs and good crowd. I wish the season was slightly better... Like if were blooming already,am sure this is where i would have spent max time.Yes, shoppers and party people maynot prefer this. Shopping is close by however! And there are waybetter places to party at Amsterdam! Enjoy.

Great park to walk and cycle. I have visited Amsterdam earlier on in 2011 but this time when I went in November 2015 it like writer messy and unkempt . its a 5-7 minute walk room Leidesplien square. Nice park to cycle.
Nice park. Been there during our Ams visit. Nice green area to get out for a peaceful break of the crowded Ams streets.

Not worth going. It's so busy it's not worth going. You can't take a photo without having at least 80 other people in it. Or have your own space to sit anywhere and just enjoy. The food around there isn't very good either but I can't say that for every food vendor there. I wouldn't recommend someone wasting their time going there, do something else instead. I was there early morning in winter (0 degrees) too so definitely wasn't peak hour.

Beautiful, in winter and in summer. Nature is always a plus in a city. Vondelpark is big and beautiful. It's even better in summer and spring, because you can run or to a bike tour. You can also chill and just sit on the grass with your friends and have a picnic. I have very good memories.The park is very big, so try to have a lot of time when you go. Take water, food and a camera and walking shoes if you're planning to walk a lot (do it if you're doing Amsterdam by foot).

A green lung for the city. This park is an extensive area of greenery for the city, right in the city centre. Very close to the Rijksmuseum it provides a good escape from the art for a while. Full of people cycling, walking dogs and feeding ducks. Various cafes around. Visited in February and there was lots of wildlife and spring shoots: in summer it would be terrific.

Beautiful park. We were only here for a short while, as it was rubbish weather, but it is clear that this park will be stunningly beautiful in the summer. The park is so huge with a few cafes and loads of places to sit and enjoy the views.
Beautiful Afternoon Spent Here!. Brought a picnic here and made a lovely afternoon of it over the past summer. Great for anyone and a nice way to spend some time while in Amsterdam!
Relaxing. Big area, nice place for a can of Heineken and a sit down in the cafe. Lots of space and area to walk in.
my favorite running garden. beautiful garden with lakes very close to the shopping street and the conservatoruim hotel where i was staying. the best for running or just a walk

Great hangout in the summer. Vondelpark is the largest park in Amsterdam. It's very central and easy to reach from Leidseplein and the different museums. Like many Amsterdam residents I love the park, especially in the summer. There are a few restaurants with large terraces where I love to meet with friends and watch all the people walk by. My favorites are Blauwe Theehuis and Vertigo. The best way to move around the park is by bike. In the summer the park is mostly packed with people lazing on the grass, enjoying a picnic or listening to music. The park is also great for jogging and rollerskating. In the summertime there are lots of free concerts at the open-air theatre.

Good Spot for a Picnic. We rented bikes for the day, picked up picnic fare at Albert Cuyp Market, and rode out to the park. Biking the park was great as it allowed us to cover most of the park in a short period of time. The park is busy with bikers, runners, walkers, etc...It was nice to be around some locals. The park is not as beautiful as some others in European but definitely worth a visit if you want some greenery and relaxation time. It can easily be combined with a visit to the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum.

Pretty even on winter. It's still nice to walk around even during winter time, as long as there is some sun, there are lots of birds and you can see tulips growing, it's nice for a picnic by the lake.
Beautiful park. This is a lovely big park. We hired bikes and cycled around it for a while. Great place to relax and spend time away from the hustle and bustle during a trip to Amsterdam.

Clean and fresh. We hired some bikes and off we went to this clean and pretty park.It was great to sit and just watch the people enjoy the sun or the skaters do their tricks a great way to enjoy a sunny afternoon

Pretty and accessible. A lovely park, not too big and in an area which, whilst busy, is a welcome retreat from the roads beyond.We were there in colder weather but would have been happy to take a picnic if warmer.Walking beyond, the Pijp district is a delight and different again from the centre or Jordaan.
Beautiful. Beautiful park, go there every time I'm in Amsterdam, lovely little cafe as well. Great for a little cycle as well if it is nice weather
ON any day. On any sunny or raining day it is nice to walk through and end up at BlauweThee huis. short walk from Museum square.
Nice park. Not the most stunning park, but more than good enough for a little walk or run on a Sunday morning, given that the weather is good!

Beautiful Park. If you like walks in parks or just to sit down and read a book, I would definitely recommend Vondelpark. It is nice and very big, they have a number of benches for people to sit and relax, breath some fresh air. You can also go for a run, I would definitely go back again.

Great park to walk around and see the real Amsterdam. This park is used by the local people for exercise and meet ups. Lovely place to walk around if the weather is nice. Be careful of all the people on bicycles.
Beautiful park!. We walked thru the park, during our visit to Amsterdam. It is such a beautiful park! It was fun to see the locals walking their dogs, exercising and riding bikes!
Lovely. Lovely place to cycle round or have a relax with a picnic. It was clean, and had a very friendly atmosphere.

OK for a walk not not much to see or do. This is a long finger of greenery close to the museum district of Amsterdam. It's a pleasant lunchtime walk with several different routes although it's limited width means that you are always almost within sight of the eastern or Western boundary. There are lakes and a few interesting buildings and sculptures but it's main attraction is as a fairly peaceful (but busy) walk. And you still need to be careful to avoid being run over by the city's mad cyclists
A walk around Vondel Park. Such a relaxing and beautiful place. Sun was shining too =) We went for something to eat at the cafe there.
excellent plaace to enjoy. big and fully green park,, very clean and natural... love to be there again in next visit,, specially in summer its good over there

lovely park in summer or winter. We stumbled on Vondelpark accidentally as it was quite near to our hotel. We had a wander around on a chilly day in February and still very much enjoyed the park and its beautiful scenery. Im sorry that we didnt get to explore the park in its entirety but the section that we discovered was a lovely place and would be even better in the summer. A great place to relax and take a walk

Beautiful . We cycled round the park and had a coffee break in the middle! It was beautiful, not too busy or empty, cold but sunny as well. It's so peaceful just like most things in Amsterdam and small enough to get round in an afternoon!

Chill in the city . We fortunately got a really warm sunny during our visit to Amsterdam, and decided a leisurely afternoon in the park would be well spent after a morning in the nearby museums. There are many options for different routes to take through the park, with water features and flowers dotted around. It is a good option wether you want to walk or cycle. There is also an array of cafés to have lunch or a drink. There is a mix of people in the park, so it was a nice people watching spot with a beer in the sun! A definite visit for some chill time while in the city.

Good option for a bike ride in a not so crazy place. Cycling in Amsterdam can be really challenging for non locals... But at Vondelpark, as there are no cars, buses, motorcycles or trams, the ride is safer and much nicer! If you prefer, it is also a great place just for walk, relax and take some nice pics!
Cycled around the park. . Beautiful park. We hired bikes to cycle around. The paths were nice and wide and there were plenty of cafes for a break.

Nice park - better if you cycle through it. We went to the park on a cold, clear day. It's a nice park to walk through right in town. However, I have seen nicer urban parks in Europe (can't compare to St. James Park or Hyde Park in London etc.). The second time we went through the park , we actually cycled (look at my post on yellow bike) - much more fun and very enjoyable. In short, I do recommend but don't expect too much.

Beautiful spot for biking. Especially if the streets of Amsterdam seem a little daunting to cycle. Making your way to Vondelpark is worth it. Lots of scenery and people taking in the beautiful space along with a few good spots for refreshments or lunch.
A peaceful place . I would recommend to rent bike, from mac bike which is near, and to have a nice morning at the park.dont forget to take some bread with you for the birds

Amazing . The best park in Amsterdam well worth a visit if you get a nice day Couldn't believe our eyes when we seen about 100 parakeets throughout the park but apparently they are native to the park.Can't wait to visit in summertime great spot 5 mins walk from the busy leidseplein area and Museumplein area.

Best place to relax. The vondelpark is one of my favourite places in Amsterdam. There is so much you can do there: relaxing, sports, go for a coffee, have a fun day with family and friends. It is the best thing to do on a summer day and have a great outdoor activity. Also fun: people from Amsterdam go there in the weekends when its good whether to have a BBQ with their friends.
Strolling delight. Nearby the museum complex, this park is worth a stroll, particularly on a fine day. We enjoyed going through it twice. It was refreshing and not too large to easily traverse.
Cycle around, stop and have a coffee.. We cycled around the park on a beautiful sunny day. Very clean and very pleasant. We stopped in a nice cafe by a pond and had a hot drink. Very pleasant.

Beautiful and quiet. We made a walk through this park on our way to the museumplein. It's really a green oasis in a busy city center, I would really recommend it when your travelling with children, want to have a picknick or bbq or generally need a break
Beautiful Amsterdam greens. A must walk in the park on a sunny afternoon. I love this park just to sit and relax. Watch people walk by.

it's a must when in Amsterdam, so know how to enjoy it. When visiting Amsterdam, at 95% you will spend so time at Vondelpark. So, more than the rating it's important to know how to get the best out of it. Best hours are at dawn or before 10am, so you can appreciate the northern light, absolutely special. Vondelpark is the epicenter for runners, bikers and for people playing every kid of outdoor sports (yoga included). Pay lot of attention to the bikes: locals are fast and they assume tourist know the rules, which is not always the case unfortunately. If you're biking stay on the right, use the bell, and pay extra attention to the others. If walking stay outside the paved roads: those are for bikers and runners. Green areas can be accessed without restrictions. It's a safe place also in the evening, while you may prefer to avoid late night hours. You never know.

Relaxing long-stretched park, close to shopping - and museums area. Starting close to the inner A'dam (near the Leidse Plein and Hotel Americain) this relaxing long-stretched park, with several places to have a drink at a terrace, is much loved by the locals as well as visitors. In the 70-ies it was a place where hippies slept overnight, but that is no longer allowed. It is well kept and enjoyable, just watch out for the cyclists that use it as a short-cut from the center to Old-West. And also for runners, who do their daily practice after office hours. It is a 5 minutes walk from the Museum-Square/Plein, don't miss it!

Wonderful for a stroll. We wandered through Vondelpark a few times during our trip to Amsterdam. Although there wasn't a huge amount to do (off season?) there were still a lot of people out enjoying the park and it's lovely to find such a large open space in a busy city.The paths are all well laid out, winding their way through the park and the wrought iron street lamps and hundreds of cyclists make it feel a million miles from the hustle and bustle of nearby streets. There's also an impressive number of birds here, so wildlife fans will really appreciate the conservation of woodland etc.

A beautiful walk. A majestic park pretty close to most of the museums of Amsterdam. I totally suggest a walk there maybe after visiting the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum or if you are keen on exercising have a morning run there.
Beautiful park, perfect on a warm day. This park is huge, and features stages for various performance acts throughout the year, lakes, ponds and huge trees to lay under. Beautiful!
Stunning park. Absolutely stunning park and beautiful any time of year. The lakes are really pretty and the scenery is beautiful. definitely a must if you're in Amsterdam.

Beautiful park.. Beautiful scene.. Beautiful park.. Beautiful scenery. A walking distance from Rijksmuseum n van gogh museum. Enjoy your morning or evening walk here is the best. Fresh air.. Fresh air..Bring your sketchbook if you like drawing.

chill in the park with the locals. this park is the most popular park in amsterdam. it's huge, green, clean, perfect for running, and great for chilling. here you can relax and refresh your mind and just enjoy your day. i would recommend to visit this park in the summer

Beautiful park. We walked around this park on a cold February morning.
It is a really beautiful park with amazing bird life
It was quite busy even quite early and lots of bikes, but that's to be expected, you are in Amsterdam after all.
Well worth an hour or two to wander about

Big park. Big park with beautiful lakes,ducks,birds,statues,bikers ,people...
even in winter a walk was just fine
in the city centre near by the museums(museumplein)

Lovely green spot ibn the heart of Amsterdam. Taking a walk in the green park surrounded by such elegant and classic old houses is very special.
There are lots of nice restaurants in the district, besides the famous museums, thus definitively workl worth a visit

One of my favorite places in Amsterdam!. Yes, it is touristy, especially in the summer, but it makes for great people watching! It's a perfect place to ride a bike around and also a great place to bring a bottle of wine and enjoy a nice picnic on the grass!

Peaceful Visit. We visited this park at about 10:00 in the morning, it was a beautiful crisp sunny morning and the park was so peaceful. It's nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city centre into the green area. There are plenty of pretty bridges and nature that means the park is great for photographers. We had breakfast in the park and we felt really relaxed. We chose to walk around the park but if you wanted to cycle this would be the ideal place as the cycle path is nice and wide and there aren't as many cyclists around.

Lovely and peacefull. Randomly bumped into this park on my first visit and had to return, Park is beautiful and full of energy, lots of runners, walkers and cyclists everywhere, Park itself has lovely ponds and wildlife

A refreshing walk. A very chilly Saturday walk, but nice to get away from the busyness of the city centre. Much quieter area to relax, walk, people watch and look at the amazing homes from across the park.

Nice walk. Before our visit we had been told to visit Vondelpark and have a bike ride. We walked all the way around the park and found no bikes. (Ones we could rent anyway). I guess we needed to go there with the bikes.. A nice walk even so! Would be lovely on a sunny day.

Fantastic place to stroll and bike!. A must see when coming to Amsterdam, Vondelpark is an excellent place to wander or bike and watch the world go by. Always things to see here and people watching at its best!

Lush greenery in the middle of Amsterdam. I love the fact that this huge park is smacked in the middle of Amsterdam, near the museums where it is easily accessible to everyone. Despite the winter weather, there were still lots of people who come visit and hang out at the park. So relaxing!

Bring your bike. This park is beautiful to bring your bike and get lost. It seems to be never ending with many lakes and green areas to enjoy. It gets very busy so be prepared to battle with traffic on your bike. Highly worth visiting when you visit Amsterdam
Such a lovely Parl. Can get quite busy but its really pretty, especially in the sun. Nice place to ride bikes/ had a lovely walk or picnic. Not many nearby places to eat however.
Lovely Park. Had a walk through here and it was lovely. Very nice park and worth visiting for a little walk. Not far from the museums!
Stroll along. Dogs, birds, kids and people. Runners, walkers, the old and young. A beautiful park even in the rain.
Loved it. A must do when in Amsterdam... Peaceful at times crazy fun at others just right in the heart of the city......loved it...
Really nice park. Nice park, great flora and fauna, and a chic, trendy cafe in the middle of it. A pleasure to walk in, and it's right in the center of the city, with great transport links!
Easy breezy biking. We rented adult/child tandem bikes from the MacBike nearby and had a nice spin around the park. A nice break from the hustle and bustle of the canal belt.
Nice Park. Excellent Park in Amsterdam. This park is very green with lots of activity in the heart of the city. It was cold but worth the walk.

Loved Vondelpark. Definitely worth visiting. Nice walk in the park, gorgeous greenery and lots of dogs!
Also found a cool jungle gym that adults can fit through. Lots of fun if you want to feel like a kid again!

Great to blow cobwebs away !. Visited Amsterdam many times and I love this park it's a free attraction that few tourists go to. In summer there is live music deckchairs and sunshine. In winter Dutch families are out jogging, cycling or just walking to keep fit. We landed on a cold winters day and our room wasn't ready so a 90 min walk round the pond was great for some fresh air. There are two cafes in the park so had an obligatory hot chocolate to finish.
Very nice. Beautiful park, probably much more fun in the summer. But still, it was very nice to walk around in the middle of the city surrounded by green nature.

Welcome to the Central Park of Amsterdam...but better.. This is a great place to visit just south of the heart of Amsterdam. Just south of the Canal Ring, and very close to Rijksmusuem and Van Gogh Museum. Saw many locals exercising and taking advantage of the park. There are many entrances which seem to make it quite convenient from a large area. There is not a lot to say other than this is a great expansive park that offers so much. It is free for the most part and really if you are close there is no reason not to at least drop in. Another one of the many no-brain-er places to visit in Amsterdam.

Pleasant enough. HIred some push bikes and cruised through this place. There were rabbits hopping around and great little ponds to sit and talk by. Did witness some weirdo going off at another dude for whatever reason. It was awkward, but resolved peacefully. Other than that, its a cool location to chill in and bbq in.

Freezing Cold. Sadly I was so cold that I had to limit my stay inside the park to only a few minutes. I had no time to explore the park and all the facilities that the park had to offer. What I did come across though is a beautify restaurant and bar located inside the park.

Nice park... February probably not best time to vist. A cold day in February' probably doesn't do this place justice, it's a nice park... We were. It wowed... Maybe in a bit summer day it would be different

Wonderful . This is great. It is the 60s all over. This is amsterdam in a microcosm. But do t go after dark. Really great place. So friendly so laid back. Love it. Great circular running loop. Joggers paradise.
Just divine!. Perfect for a picnic, is such a lovely place. You feel in a really nice natural place even though you're right inside Amsterdam

Lovely walk!. It is a peaceful park in the busy Amsterdam! Its green with small ponds. Its quite big and full of families and joggers. You can imagine yourself during summer time having a lovely picnic before heading to one of the local museums.

A nice break from the walk around Amsterdam. The park was incredibly busy at the time we were there which took a little bit of the magic away. After walking around Amsterdam, it was nice to find a place to relax and listen to some music while writing postcards. It's nice if you're in the area but if you aren't, you aren't missing much.

Stunning. Although we didn't walk through the entire park, what we did see was beautiful, just reminded us of Central Park in NY. Lakes, cafes, tennis courts. It was a beautiful winters day when we walked through, there were people jogging, riding bikes, playing with their children, such a lovely sociable place. Can't wait to return

Surprising. As parks go, this is a pretty nice one. It is so nice to find somewhere green and peaceful in the middle of the city. Lovely pond and cafe and a nice track round the edge, perfect for walking, cycling, roller blading or skateboarding. Nice to see lots of runners and dogs making use of this pretty area. Also lots of grassy areas away from the main tracks so it's possible to get so privacy. Perfect for a break from the bustle of the city.
Very beautiful.. Very beautiful park. Be careful though of the cyclists, as the main road is usually used for cycling.. was a bit lost when I just entered the park :)
Pretty and peaceful. It's a very nice park, not spectacular but a good place to have a relaxing walk, away from the city bustle.
Beautiful chilled park . Went for a lovely but chilly walk here just this past Wednesday a lovely park surrounded by lots of museums and things to see and do near by.

Beautiful park for a walk. Not a great deal going on. The park was on the way to our hotel so we walked through, nice to see but not much by way of activities other than the walking itself. Lovely sunny day for it though so I enjoyed.
Quite touristic, but still very good. Vondelpark is the biggest and best park of Amsterdam. When the sun is shining, it is crowded and the atmosphere is really good!

Decent park. Its nice if you rent a bike and cycle around the whole park, other than that it is just an average park. Definitely better in the summer as you may be able to have a picnic and enjoy the weather.

Great open space . We had a lovely walk around the park on Wednesday. A great place to escape the bustle of the streets and squares. There's lots of places to sit and plenty of grassed areas to enjoy a picnic during the warmer months. You can buy food in the cafe/restaurant but we didn't so I can't comment on what's on offer. My only word of caution as with the rest of Amsterdam is "mind the cyclists" Well worth a lazy wonder around or maybe a jog for the more energetic

Good park for a family walk. Easy to find just off the number 3,5,1 trams, great wildlife for the kids to spot, clean and flat open spaces. We only found one playground which was a bit old but it still kept them busy. I think could of found more but it was such a cold day we headed back. Definitely worth a visit.

Pleasant & vibrant park for all seasons. This park is a wonderful open space, ideal for relaxing & people watching. This park is also large enough to cycle around. on a spring or summer afternoon it is buzzing with Amsterdammers just relaxing & doing their own thing - especially vibrant on Sunday afternoons.There is an excellent cafe & terrace plus many lakes to sit around.

Pleasant and therapeutic. A must see. These gardens are located around a 20-30 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal station and if you have a nice sunny day, the walk up to them is a lovely, walk through the bustly streets and canals.The park itself is free entry and a lovely area to walk around at your own pace (whilst at times trying to avoid being knocked over by bikes!).There are lakes and delightful walks to wander around. The park itself is huge! If needs be there are little food stalls and cafés dotted around, to put your feet up and people watch!A must-see and do!
green and clean. for fresh air, running, walking dogs strolling the ecological conscious maintained park is a must do in Amsterdam..

Nice place to sit and relax. The park is just a few minutes away from Leidseplein and is a nice place to relax in the sunshine, we visited here on our last day to chill out before our flight home. In September it can get pretty warm and there's a slight breeze through the park so it cools you down before heading back into the warmth of the city.
Delightful. A fabulous park with cormorants, Storks and green parrots. Great for cycling with all of the family on wide flat cycle paths or walking through to the museum area.
A lovely gardens . What a beautiful gardens , lovely to walk around , got a few places to eat too . Beautiful area :) nice lakes and gorgeous walks

A bit of peace & quiet in the city. A nice large quiet place for getting away from the hustle & bustle in the city. Very pleasant to walk through with a nice lake to sit by if the weather is nice. Some nice architectural buildings on the perifery

Big park right next to museum square . I have lived in Amsterdam for 1,5 years now and the Vondelpark is a place I have visited often, passing through it on my way to work, enjoying summer events such as the free open concerts (!!) and studying with friends. It is a vibrant place, in the early morning scattered joggers and late clubbers can be found, while from the afternoon onwards all sorts of folk can be found. In the summer it can be crazy busy with tourists, barbecueers and the like, so beware. Also, check out the vondelbunker under the bridge, where all sorts if events, concerts and exhibitions can be organized. The only thing that bothers me has more to do with the people than the park in itself, namely, the mess that is left. I would pass through the park every Saturday around 7 Am and the place would be completely trashed, municipality workers cleaning up the stuff lousy tourists and lazy party-goers left behind. So please, if you visit the park take responsibility and throw away your trash or take it with you!

Lovely Park! . We went for a cycle and a coffee, it's a lovely Park in the centre of Amsterdam. It was freezing cold but blue skies with the sun shining when we visited. There were people jogging and roller blading and plenty of bicycles, obviously!
Beautiful vast park. Beautiful vast park, nice old trees and ponds. I was missing cosy places to sit during workday mornings.
The better green leaf in this city 😂. Lovely stroll through this enormous park, stumbled across a small children's playground, kids had a great time building dens and playing on the swings
Great place. Great open park with plenty of places to wander. Stunning on a crisp February afternoon, the city melts into the background.

Nice place for a break. There was so much to see in Amsterdam that we didn't have much time here to relax. It is still an oasis in an area where there isn't many traditional parks. Not Central Park or Hyde Park but still nice to escape the hustle and bustle.

Nice park in a hectic city, must do in summer. Close to Rijks- and Van Gogh museum. Good walk, with a few nice places to drink tea, coffe or a beer. Many joggers, skaters, runners and fitness people, but also young mothers with baies and elederly couples taking their daily walks.
Connecting a few nice neighborhoods, so quite central to many good places.
Fantastic place . Beautiful park, would highly recommend visiting here in the summer, we hired bikes and made a picnic,, perfect spot to people watch ! We saw some of Amsterdams finest here !!

Must look out for the green parrots colony. We really enjoyed our daily walk to and from the old town, from our hotel at the other side of the park. It is not a very big park but plenty of people take advantage of it, and also plenty of animals and birds can be seen (not only pets). Look out for the naturalised colony of green parrots, it is said to be one of the top attractions, and you can hardly miss them as they can get very vocal. They are beautiful.
Beautiful. Beautiful during summer months. Definitely my favourite park in Amsterdam, ideal for get togethers or even just for a casual day nap!

Run your heart out. As a keen runner I was not particularly enthused with the idea of running the streets and dodging the trams and random bikes. Fortunately we stayed at the back of the Vondelpark and it is the perfect place to exercise in Amsterdam. Around 3k for a full loop its big enough. Great for walking and cycling too. The lungs of the city.
Always a great outdoor experience. Returned to the park again, this time in the cold/wet. Love it anyway, as so many different paths to walk and run.
"Central Park". It's the perfect park to go jogging, walk or ride a bike! Perfect for those who want to exercise body and mind! Very crowded!

Nice enough but I've seen better further out. Lovely centralish park. Not as nice a Amsterdamse bos and surrounding area there... but nice all the same. Busy. Vibrant. Nature and birds everywhere and clean and looks lovely too. A must see to escape the busy centre atmosphere.

A beautiful walk. Discovering Amsterdam can sometimes send your brain into overdrive. Especially if it's your first time being subjected to this kind of culture. Vondelpark is the perfect place for a just a laid back walk while your brain tries to process everything it's seen.
Romance. The place where the hippies slept in the open in the seventies and many young Amsterdam people had their first intimate encounter and people my age share memories.
Chill out. Rent a bike and spend half a day riding inside. Take a book to read next to a tree. Take a coffee or an argentine mate. A really nice place to stop by.

A wonderful park with green parakeets in the trees. Admittedly it was absolutely freezing when we strolled around the park, but it was still a delightful experience. Lots of places to sit and soak up the atmosphere while enjoying the tranquil peacefulness. It really does shutout the bustle of the city.
It's not up there with the Hyde or Central Parks of the world, but definitely worth a stroll.

A beautiful escape from the busy city. A lovely park that isn't too big or too small. Some beautiful water features and a load of lovely spots to escape to for a picnic.We particularly liked the on-site cafe/restaurant for it's outdoor seating, and in particular, the large beanbags.We explored the park on some bikes - highly recommended. It felt like a great way to get around and was good-safe-fun because of how spacious the park is.

Beautiful park. A lovely park - great for people watching and exercising. Watch out for all the bikes though! Lots of locals exercise here and it gets very busy. A couple of good bars are available too.
Good park . Lovely park would go again enjoy I walked from central station to vondel park took me near an hour a bike would be quicker but I was on a budget.

Just a park.... It's strange for me how this park is ranked #4 attraction in Amsterdam.I couldn't see anything special there.It's just a regular park,like thousands in this world...lake,grass,trees,alleys...It's true,I visited it in a cloudy february day,maybe in a sunny summer day it looks different....What I liked were the many wild birds.
Worth a walk. When visiting Amsterdam, this park will be well worth a visit, take a walk and enjoy the green surroundings

Great relaxing place to get away from the city. We took a wander down to this park to get away from the city and all the hustle and bustle of trams, bikes and cars.I imagine this place would be stunning in summer. Even in winter was still nice to take a walk around and relax.
Classic park in the city. This is where you see real life in Amsterdam. Great atmosphere, but crowded. Walk, bike, picnic, sleep.

Bäst park ever all year around. I've ben hehe many Times in different time in the year its all was nice to take a Wall or in the summerjam have a picknick or for The one that like to runt this park is perfect for that its really big and beror u come to vindlar man entré there is a pannkaka house with the best pannkaka

Vondelpark was far away the best Amsterdam parks!. When me and my boyfriend visit Amsterdam on a weekend, we went to Vondelpark and it was quite to underestimated... there was too many people and the park does not inspired the natural quiet environment that it should be. Actually, Welterpark was really more interesting and it was almost the same distance from the center.
Beautiful. Brilliant place to people watch, walk or cycle! It was a cold wet day in January and still worth a visit, I can only imagine how great it would be in the sunshine!
A nice quiet place!. This is a nice park in the heart of Amsterdam. Especially on a sunny day the park is a real joy to visit. It has a friendly, relaxed atmosphere.

Lovely and huge park. You have to go here. It's like you are transported out of the city and into some natural environment. There are many benches that you can sit at (and the one from 'The Fault In Our Stars,' plus you can see the house that they rang the doorbell, then realized it was the wrong house. It was a little muddy while we were there because it had just rained a lot, but I'd imagine in the summer and fall, I would be spending lots of time here. There's a few ponds with some wildlife and I even saw little green parrot-looking birds flying around. It's quiet aside from the fact that jet airplanes fly low over the park every 10 minutes or so, which is a treat in itself if you like airplane spotting. With a standard pair of binoculars or decent camera zoom, you can see in the windows of the planes. I don't recommend looking in windows of houses, cause that's just rude, lol. But I definitely recommend this place to walk, run, bike, play or have a picnic.
Great bike ride. Lovely park with cute cafes to stop and watch the world go by. Great place to relax and get to grips with the dutch bikes.
Lovely. A huge and lovely park in the city, i only walked as far as my legs could carry me. A nice place for some self reflection or quiet time.
Good Value. Good value, very friendly and helpful also on the tram route however a little tired could do with a coat of paint in places.

An absolute must, in Amsterdam. Vondelpark is an attraction that you must not loose! It a great park in the hart of Amsterdam. You can visit it either using bike or just for a walk. It's one the best park that i have ever seen!
Fitness Haven!. Lovely park. It's packed with runners and cyclist's but you can enjoy a lovely walk and stop for a coffee and cake at the cafe.

The amazing Vondelpark. This park is as large if not larger than Central Park. You can ride your bike, jog, have a picnic, or have coffee and lunch at their restaurant. I visited everyday the 5 weeks I was there. Huge mansions overlook this park and there are actually places to stay in this park. A must see while in Amsterdam!

A very large park in the middle of Amsterdam. You will find a lot of joggers, bootcampers, dog walkers, bikers and other active people. But if you stay inactive most of the time (like me) it is still a very nice place to be. There are a lot of safe places for kids to play (even with water on hot days!), dogs are allowed without a leash and there are multiple spots to buy a drink or have lunch.
peacefull. I styed beside the park on a recent trip to Amsterdam and I have to say it was one very nice park to walk through
popular with locals & nice walk. We walked out of hotel and park was short walk away. Only walked a short way but would be lovely in spring.
Beautiful park. It's close to the Hard Rock Cafe so it's great place to have a walk in after a fat meal :) it's a very beautiful and quiet park, like piece of heaven

Very relaxing. Nice park , hired some bicycles with a couple of friends , was on holiday here! Very relaxing :) its a big park, if you are used to the city like me, this is somewhere to go to escape reality abit :)

Lovely Oasis in the City. Walking the Streets next to all the canals is great for a while, but on the busier streets you are constantly looking out for people, traffic and bicycles, and it can become a bit of a chore after a few hours. So head for the park and get some free space, and enjoy the canal/streets on the way.
Nice walk around. I really liked this park... especially the lakes inside, it is realy nice to walk around there. Do not miss it.
Daydreaming. it is a daydream background park. and it makes me feel like i am not a turist I am already a part of the amsterdam . You should find time to see and have the moment

Beautiful. We spent the whole morning walking through the park
So nice compared to London parks
Such a beautiful place
Highly recommend it
Chillout Park!. Great place to have a bike ride, read, or just set by the many water streams and enjoy the scenery, calmness and beauty of this place.
Lovely park. Nice clean park. We walked through this park. We visited in February but I'm sure it would be a lovely place to spend the day in the summer.

A Dream in the Middle of Amsterdam. This is one of the truly great city parks of the world. I can't believe how many times I had been to Amsterdam without coming to this park, now, I will never be able to visit again without at least a brief walk through this beautiful spot.

Nice on a sunny day . Beautiful place to have a walk. I do recommend to go on a sunny day since it can get quite chilly walking there in the rain (like we did). Want to feel like a local? Rent a bike to visit! Really, really worth it. :)

Love this park!!! . I love this park! When the sun is shining, it is really nice to sit with friends, couple or solo to enjoy the nature, the water or having a tea or a coffee in the few restaurant there!
Beautiful, great area. Vondelpark is a great park to walk, bike, and run. Huge park with playground, two cafes, ponds, and plenty of space, definitely recommend at least biking around it.

Nice place for an afternoon of people watching or BBQ with friends. If you don't have time, don't fret about missing out on the Vondelpark.
If you do have an afternoon, pack some food and sit down on a blanket to watch people, kids and dogs frolick around.
Or bring a bottle of wine and while away some time doing much of nothing :-)
Beautiful Park. Great green area for walking, jobbing, running or just sitting by the bench. Especially beautiful in autumn when leaves turn to different colours.
Relaxing Stroll. Safe area for a relaxing stroll or to sit on a bench with lunch. Vondelpark is edged by upscale walkable neighborhoods. It is also just a few steps from the tram line.
Beautiful expanse of green and water. Not much to see in January but it's a great space to visit. Lots of locals use it for cycling and jogging. Worth a visit especially if you go in spring/summer.

Gorgeous park just near the major museums / a break from the crazy city centre. Gorgeous park just near the major museums / a break from the crazy city centre. If you can't spend a couple of hours here, the worth a quick visit or walk through at least before or after Van Gogh museum or Rijks museum
Amazing. A great place to go to at anytime of the day. Very well maintained. Check the program and make sure you don't miss on the performance played at the stage area.

Nice and clean place to relax and enjoy the nature. The Vondelpark is a nice place to relax and enjoy the nature in the fast living city of Amsterdam. If you hotel is near the south-west of the park, you shouldn't use the tram or bus to get into the city. Take a nice walk through the park when you want to go to the city or from the city to your hotel.The Vodelpark is big with lots of ways to go. There are dogs that play on the green and most of the people are relaxed and nice.
Quaint . Relaxing and something to do to chill out. A lovely park to visit in the winter. It is a pleasant stroll.

Nice place to hang out. Very nice chill atmosphere here. Lake was frozen over when i went but was still a really nice atmosphere. I rode around a couple laps on a bike before heading out. Good place for picnic, just walk around and talk or chill out and take a few pictures etc. note the park is very big, if you want to cover all of it on foot give yourself a couple hours

Very nice in summer. Vondelpark is really nice in summer . Nice coffe from restuarant at top end and childrens wooden play area throughout the park. Locals stitting around the water features at lunchtime was good to see and very relaxing and quiet. Enjoyed sitting here for couple of hours with the kids
excellent venud for joghjng. one of the best places for a great run. A beautiful location in the centre of Amsterdam. Not to be missed

a great place for a vondel!. great place to take an afternoon stroll. I didn't go to the tea garden inside the park but heard that it is lovely as well. Nice place to spend an afternoon with some friends.

Huge park. A huge green park where one can stroll along the winding paths, sit by the ponds and watch the birds. We went there around 5pm expecting a lot more activity. There were people but we would not recommend specifically visiting unless you have kids and want some open space for them to run around. We felt there was nothing much for adults to try and specially fit it into your sightseeing activities.

The heart of Amsterdam. An obligated visit for a walk or with your bike. In summer it becomes the heart of Amsterdam. Great for a picnic.The park is really big and has space for everybody. There are BBQ places, stay away if you are not into smoke. There are nice spots on the north side where you can be pretty much alone most of the year. Good for running but avoid rush hour as there is a lot of bike traffic.

Beautiful and biggest parc of Amsterdam. You cannot not take the time to visit this beautiful parc. The best is to rent a bike to visit it. But you can walk or jog of course..in the winter as much as in the Summer. In the summer it is one of the busiest place to be...on the sunny days it is as busy as going to the beach!

Peaceful setting. When I saw this as a top thing to do in Amsterdam I was skeptical as I thought it's just another park. However, this park is huge and keeps on going, we walked through it mid morning and it's so peaceful. There are many people jogging and cycling through but it still felt nice. Would recommend
Beautiful scenary. Take your time and expereience the different lakes and hidden parts. Had a wonderful 'meeting' with a heron, saw many parakeet (beautiful green color)
Amsterdam's most famous park. It starts out narrow and then fans out. Bicyclists, skaters, strollers, sometime horseback riders use the park and give it vibrancy.
Beautiful. Its really hard to review a park. However, if your visiting amsterdam its certainly worth a walk/cycle through as its very open and just a generally lovely place to visit.
Beautiful walk. Me and my partner walked round it for nearly an hour it just kept going. Was good to see lots of activities going on in the park. Remember your running shoes though!
Great space for a walk. we walked through vondelpark with our kids. Nice cafe with playground. separate area with treetop "walk"

Beautiful park. I visited here in August several years ago. It was a beautiful Summer weekend. This time my visit was in February but I enjoyed this beautiful park as much as last time. The park is set in a very respectable district of Amsterdam with some really beautiful buildings and very near to the Rijkmuseum

Beautiful park!. Was quite a walk from our hotel as we stayed within the centre was well worth the walk and even hired a bike however you can't hire them from within the park you must get them from the nearby road or from the city!
Lovely park. Nice park, bit cold and wet when we went but in the summer I bet it's lovely! Well maintained and as ever lots of cyclists.

Calm in Central Amsterdam. A wonderful place for quick walk or cycle away from the traffic. The only thing to irritate is the parrots, but that's getting really picky. A walk round the edge will take about an hour at a reasonable walking pace. In the summer it makes a great picnic spot.

Lovely park. Living in Scotland means scenic routes are no stranger to me. I was surprised to find such a lovely park in a city as I had not visited the Amsterdam before so did not expect to find much in the way of nature and trees. We were fortunate to have a sunny day in November. I would recommend sensible walking shoes as some of the park can be quite muddy. There is a little cafe you can stop in, and there are benches you can sit and enjoy the weather. Lots of people walk their dogs there so you'll see so many well natured pets playing with other dogs and walking next to their owners happily without a leash. Lots of people ride their bikes so be mindful that even in the parks bikes are always around you. Very relaxed atmosphere, peaceful little place if you fancy wandering off from the city streets. You can probably circle the whole park in about an hour.

Nice Park. After roaming around the city on foot and enjoying what Amsterdam has to offer, it was pleasant to step out all the buildings & roads & rest & enjoy few minutes in here. It is your typical park with small ponds, lots of birds in it, greenery & overall a perfect setup for a lovely day on a sunny day. For us, it was not sunny but nevertheless enjoyable. We also enjoyed a drink in the restaurant in the park.Overall, a good park to relax & unwind.
Beautiful. Very pretty park, great for a city escape amd gentle walk around the park. Easy to get here on a tram and in the summer would be great for a pic nic.
Get lost in Vondelpark!. Organize a day out, get sandwiches and drinks, a good book and enter the gates of this beautiful park... That's all you need to have a relaxing day

It's a park!. Not a lot to say about it other than it's a long thin green space with cyclists zooming about! You've got to be on your toes when moving around the park in case you fall foul of a cyclist!

My Vondel .... I live around the corner of this beautiful park and enjoy it every day if possible. If you ever pay Amsterdam a visit: please go ahead and take a stroll through the park. Be sure NOT to stay at the side closest to the city center but take a walk down as it is much quieter down there and have a real chance to take in the atmosphere!Also perfect for a morning run! One round is exactly 3.33 km, so only three rounds for a perfect 10K!
Evening Stroll. Took a long walk through here one evening and it was beautiful, lots of cycle paths (as expected) and a beautiful lake. The calmer side of Amsterdam.

Great place to walkm relax and escape the city's huste. This is a great place to walk, relax and see the locals doing the same - riding their bicycles, playing with their kids.. Location is city center, about 5 min. walk from Rijksmuseum. Go there!!!

Pleasant for a stroll. The Vondelpark is a big space to wander through for a relaxing stroll. Lots of cyclists and joggers but there are pedestrian paths to the side so you don't need to worry about them like you do in the city centre. And no trams! Look out for the green parakeets who have made a community here - they do look interested if you whistle back at them!There's a couple of places to stop off for a coffee or maybe a beer if you'd like. People of all ages come to the park and smokers who don't want to sit in a coffee shop are polite enough to stick to the wooded areas or more tucked away paths.
Very nice place. Beautiful place for a walk, bike ride, recreation or just chill and watch the nature :) I was here in January and can only imagine how good it is during spring and summer.
Nice place for a break. It's a nice place to take a break with all the grass you can have a nice picknick here. Also nice to have a stroll or have a running excercise.

Glorious day. We had the park very near to our hotel which was a great bonus as the weather on the monday was cracking for january. We went down in the morning and took a long walk all the way round the park, stopping off for a latte in between. By the time we came back in the afternoon after the coffee shop the place was busy and full of a vibrant buzz with locals and tourists everywhere. we took a nice we seat next to the lake and became one with nature on a beautiful day, This place would be a must visit in the summer without a doubt, or any season for that matter. Try some pollen first just to really enlighten your senses to it all.
Beautiful. A lovely walk through the park is available to get away from all the noise and hustle and bustle of the city. Just watch out for the bikes!
Lovely park. Great park. Nice even though it was winter...imagine it would be even better in the Summer. Lots of runners and bikers. Great place for a bike ride.

Beautiful stroll in the park!. Vondelpark is absolutely beautiful! Even in the wintertime, it's a wonderful place for jogging, hanging out with friends, or just relaxing by yourself without feeling like you're in the city. It's a wonderful place to be if you need a break!
Vondelpark. Beautiful place to take a stroll through came winter or summer. The park is always full of people being active ore just relaxing!
Lovely park for lunch. Lovely little park where you can have a picnic if you're on a shoestring budget. Free of charge.Nice place to take a stroll.

Best relaxation in AMS!. I used to live in Amsterdam and of course Vodelpark was one of my favorite places! Its perfect to enjoy a sunny (good luck with that haha) day having picnic with friends in Vondelpark! Its soooo relaxing! Full of people and music and food and dancing! You can also go jogging there (you gonna see a lot of people jogging in the morning)! When visiting Amsterdam, dont miss this place!

Beautiful . Been here so many times over the years. In the winter when it's covered in snow there is a lovely little cafe in the middle of the park. They do really good hot chocolate and l could sit there for hours. In the summer there are concerts in the evening and always something going on in the day time. One of my favorite places in Amsterdam
Beautiful park. A great escape from the hustle and bustle of the centre, great place to go for a run or cycle, or simply walk from one end to the other to relax.

Great in Spring, Summer and Fall. Can Be great at snow days in the summer. Nice cafes and areas for jogging and roller.. Great space to relax, run, jogging, eat and just meditate.In the heart of Amsterdam. It has a roses garden area that attracts a lot of visitors during the spring. Great for sun bad.during summer.

Relaxing at Vondelpark.. One of the many free and pleasant things to do n the city.Quite a large park that is popular wth the Dutch and tourists alike. There is an open-air theatre,where performances are sometimes held, and a number of scenic areas.You can see a set of sculptures under the van Baerlestraat, and very close by is an interesting independent bar/events venue called "Vondelbunker".Also have fun looking for the "woodcutter" sculpture on a tree branch in the park.

Wonderful . I have been in Amsterdam twice and both times i visited Vondelpark. The last time it was really cold but it was wonderful. You can see people running out in Vondelpark at any time. They even have lights on them at the night. You can see dogs playing with each other. You have to visit. Don't finish your journey without Vondelpark

Escape the rush of the city.. Beautiful park in the middle of Amsterdam. You can walk, cycle, have a beer or barbecue there. Basically, escape the rush of the city. A great place for both local families and tourists alike.
Lush! . Lovely park to ride threw and to sit and have a coffee. It's easy to find and its very close to other attractions like the different museums.
Beautiful . Beautiful couple of hours spent walking around the park, I imagine it is stunning in spring with tulips etc but definetley worth your time

beautiful park. Lovely park to walk around. Clean and spacious. Can see how perfect it would be for running or cycling around and can imagine would be an idyllic picnic spot in fine weather. Although we didn't try any of the cafes I can see how pleasant it would be to escape the bustle of the city
Beautiful. Beautiful scenic area for a stroll through the park. Packed with plenty runners and bike riders however it is truly beautiful

It's a park.. We hired bikes for the day and decided to make our way to Vondelpark however it's a bit bare this time of year. I think it would be lovely in the late spring and summer but winter is not it's best season.
Excellent for morning jog. Beatiful park very popular with runners as it has a nice loop to jog. Good acces from various areas of town.
great place to escape the busy city.... Beautiful, spacious park. Great for walking, cycling or just people watching and while enjoying a picnic ☺
Gorgeous . In my humble opinion the most beautiful park in Europe, many bikes, beautiful trees and tulips, young people, great security, good restaurants, another must see at wonderful Amsterdam

Always good when the sun is out. If the weather is really good you want to get there early to get a good spot becauae it gets extremely busy. Good for outside dinner parties and small bbq get togethers. Accesible from many places.
Lovely Park. . Really nice park, my partner and I found this place by accident and it was a great find. I would recommend taking the time to visit this gem!

Picturesque . Picturesque view of nature. I visited in winter when the small lakes were beginning to freeze over and the scenery was still beautiful - worth a picture or two during sunset for those keen photographers.

very beautiful. very beautiful very wide full with nice and many hinds of trees and birds and very quiet and amazing with a wide aria full with green grass and a big beautiful lake and all the visitors are happy doing sports or walking with there bits it was a wonderful day

Superb park. Very nice park, certainly a place to go have a walk, or my recommendation would be an early or late breakfast at the kiosk, watching the joggers and dog owners go by... It's very relaxing and they always have different decorations as well as lots of flowers exploding with colors.
It's a park. Nice park, visited in January so was freezing but nice to walk around.. Lots of activity going on eg cycling running and people playing football. The lake was pretty

Nice, cold and big park. I go with my son and friend to this park to see around . there's a lot people run for jogging and walking with dog. The park is big and nice... but more nice if u came in summer not winter day like I do. But I still enjoy it
A quiet place to refresh the body and mind. Close to our hotel. After a hard day's walking it was a pleasure to walk quietly, to sit and relax and enjoy the environment

Amsterdam's Oasis. If weather permits, you must visit Vondelpark. It is among the most peaceful and relaxing spots in this peaceful and relaxing city. Time spent here soaking up nature and enjoying some people watching is tough to beat.

Nice place!. The Vondelpark is a wonderful and beautiful park that is especially nice when it is sunny. From early May to September there are interesting performances at the open air theatre which are free of charge. Vondelpark is large so a bike would be handy to have. There are also some really nice places to have a lunch or a coffee. The location is also central and close to museums.
Great for a bike ride!!. Excellent place to visit, family place. We rent bikes a block from there and ride together, had a great time!!!

Great park. We had a lovely wander through this park and sat people watching for a while. It was a lovely June evening and was busy with lots of people enjoying the evening sun whilst having a BBQ.A must see in Amsterdam.

Especially beautiful when it is sunny!. Beautiful location, highly recommend at all times. There are often events happening as well, but you can always just walk through and listen to music or hang out with friends in the park.
Favorite place in the city!. A fantastic place to spend the afternoon exploring and it has so much to offer! From a rich history to exciting modern day uses.

Must do in Amsterdam!. Any trip to Amsterdam has to involve a visit to Vondelpark, I would recommend hiring a bike and doing a few laps to take in the scenery. Lots of restaurants, cafes and other conveniences nearby.

Beautiful beyond words. Spellbound by the fall colours, we had a marvellous time cycling through Vondelpark.Such a beautiful place, with families taking their digs out for a walk and beautiful houses by the side of the park. It was a treat just cycling through.

The best park.. Is better to rent bicycle to see the park.
Is the best park ever..
If you go Amsterdam don't forget to see that park..

Honestly Underwhelming, but Likely Due to Winter. Our visit to Vondelpark was not as great as we had expected. We saw that it was the #4 rated attraction for Amsterdam on Tripadvisor, but we felt it did not live up to this rating. It was simply average or maybe even below average. But I feel the need to say that we went during November and this was likely why we only felt it was "average".The park itself was poorly maintained and their were large puddles of water blocking the paths from recent rain. This meant that we had to walk around the path and into muddy areas of grass. We did throughly enjoy people-watching from a park bench. There must be an elderly retirement facility nearby because their were many cute elderly people walking in the park with their walkers and getting pushed in wheelchairs. We fondly remember one lady in particular that had the cutest little dog happily follow her as she walked with her cane. Another thing we noticed was that none of the dogs of the locals were on leashes, but they were so well-behaved and loyally followed their owners and didn't bother any other people or dogs.
Nice walking park. We stayed near this park and enjoyed walking the loop, which is about 2.5 miles or so. A lot of people walk or bike it but it doesn't feel crowded.

Great!. You can ride bicycles or have a walk through the park. In the center there is a tea house where you can have a small bite to eat and drinks. In summer concerts are given and locals use the park for relaxation. During Queensday (27th of april) a large flea market across the park is held.
Beautiful on a summer / autumn day.... Great for walks, romantics and in fact everyone! Take a picnic if you can and a good book. People watching at it's best!
Loved this park.. After a few hours driving we had a very pleasant time walking around this park then enjoying sitting and watching the people and children enjoying the parkland
Busy, but well laid out for a run. Just keep your eyes (and ears) open for bicycles, strollers and other runners. There are plentiful maps around to navigate.
A walk in the park. A beautiful park with lots of great relaxing sights. It's just a few blocks away from the main museums and you wouldn't believe how far away from the city you feel there.

Good but not extraodinary. Nice park, huge with nice landscapeI have been there in winter. So this is not probably the best time to visit because most of the the trees are with out leavesAnyway it was nice to walk around but it is not a must see unless you have timeI believe it will be good for kids
It's big; no jokes. Although when we visited it was winter, but it still looked gorgeous the park seeing people picnicing, kids playing around and cycling. A lovely experience, recommended.
Completely Lovely!. Like Amsterdam as a whole, Vondelpark is a breath of fresh air! Light and open and beautiful, this is the ideal place for a walk or a picnic!

Nothing beats a great park. Vondelpark trails stretches until Stadhouderskade, but when you walk down the street and see those trails nothing prepares you for the large and beautiful park up ahead. The park is clearly a favorite green spot for the citizens of Amsterdam. It is wonderful walking along the park and seeing all the people jog, all the children and dogs play. This visit made me wish I had my son and dogs with us so they can enjoy this visit as well.Take a breather from the city sites, museums, shopping and cookies and come visit this park.
Nice. The Vondelpark is a really nice recreation area in the middle of Amsterdam. Beautiful surroundings and a nice Place to og for a run
Lose yourself. This giant garden in the middle of the city is a piece of heaven. I love riding my bike slowly through its paths. It has an unique charm each season of the year.

Great place for a picnic. We went here on a whim, it was a nice day. We had a picnic and a few biers. There are nice ponds and tons of lush greenery. Don't go at night? Seriously, that's common knowledge you don't see families flocking to central park at midnight.

Far from center. This was a long bus ride, then a long walk to get there.It is a quiet park that is also used by very well behaved school children. You have to go through a college town, and what may not be the best part of town.

Tranquillity in Amsterdam. I've been to Amsterdam on several occasions but it wasn't until my most recent visit that I went to the Vondelpark. The Vondelpark is absolutely stunning with a wide variety of plant and tree species and some outstandingly beautiful ponds. Its incredible to think this greenspace is in the bustling city of Amsterdam! I cannot encourage travellers enough to visit the Vondelpark if they are planning a trip to the city. Perfect place to relax.

Get Away From it All In This Fabulous Park. Not far from the Museumplein or Liedesplein and the general buzz of Amsterdam is The VondelPark. Just go there and stroll, have a coffee or a beer in the cafes located in the park, just do what the Dutch do and enjoy it. A must do when visiting this fabulous city.....UTG!!!
Walk and Cycle around. Nice place to chill and just cycle and walk around, talk to people, sip coffee at cafe, take it slow.
Calm Beautiful Park Inside City. Scenic and Very Calm Park Inside the City. Nice Small Restaurant As well for Quick refreshment.Excellent for Family With Kids
Nice little walk around . Enjoyed a nice walk in this park early January. Would recommend a stop by when you are in the museum/ lidsplein area, nice place for a between museum break.
Lovely park. We walked around this fantastic amenity on two occasions during our stay. It's reattach to find such a fine space so near the centre of the city.

Don't go at night. While during the day this park is pretty gorgeous, it has a tendency to turn a bit seedy at night. However, if you're with a group and are just cutting through the park, you should be fine. Go to one of the many bakeries in the city center, grab picnic provisions and make your way to the park to enjoy the sunshine. A great way to relax in the city.

Silence spot in the middle of a big city. You know what is so nice about the 'Vondelpark'? It's a oases of silence in the middle of the city of Amsterdam. If you visit Amsterdam you should definitely go and enjoy the park. You can picnic there. It's really a great spot.

Always amazing. No matter the season vondel park is one of the best things Amsterdam has to offer. Great vibe, plenty of joggers and people chilling in their own ways away from the hustle of the city. Has a nice cafe right on the middle called "blue theehouse"

Great Park to chill out and have a good walk around!. Beautiful park, for a lazy walk around. Reminds me a little of Hyde park in London or the botanical gardens in melbourne. Grab a bike and cycle round, great for families, couples or solo travellers. Good to stop for a light refreshment at the cafe half way round. :-)

Nice walk through he park. Great place to kill some time. Calming and serene escape from the city of Amsterdam. i've only been there during the winter so not much greenery, but still the lakes freeze over and there is ice skating and other activities. It is a popular escape for the locals and if you want a place for a leisurely stroll there is nothing better in Amsterdam.
Afteternoon in the park. My kid needed outdoor time in a park. Amsterdam has great playgrounds. We went to the cafe in the park and i got to read while she played on the playground. Great day!

Relaxed and beautiful park. We loved vondelpark, a huge open space with lakes, grass, benches and pavement for everyone to enjoy. You'll find runners, cyclists, families, dogs, all enjoying the fresh air together. Perfect for a morning run or a picnic in sunny weather.
Lovely park. Love this park . It's very large and has plenty to do and see, even just a long walk is worth it!It's very central and nice places for walkers alone. Couples and families!

A Lovely Fall Stroll. We happened on Vondelpark on a sunny fall day (a rarity) in Amsterdam. Walking through the park with its old trees and autumn colors was a lovely break from the urban bustle. Be aware, as with most areas of Amsterdam, there is plenty of bicycle traffic.
Goregous way to spend a day.. We took a stroll on New Years day and it couldnt hae been more perfect. Well it could have been a little warmer but anyway we love this park.

beautiful park near to the rijksmuseum. lovely park to wander through and enjoy the sights of local people. heron and parrots can be found in here. statues and beautiful trees. beware of dog mess though.
Lovely Park. Really nice park for a wonder round to get away form the hustle and bustle of city life. Clean and well kept with some lovely houses around the park.

Sit back and watch the world go by :). If you're on a budget, or not stuck to a time frame make sure to come here to just sit down, relax and watch the world go by. Great to take a bike through, but also to just lay down, look up at the clouds and take in your surrounds, which include very interesting people :)
A Beauty. We visited here on our last day whilst by the Van Gogh museum - Really beautiful park. Great place to ride a bike around if you don't want to be on the busy roads!
Very good . Green, there are lots of events. Loved walking across the park with friends. Many beautiful sights. Good for bysicles
Very natural. It was not bad but not in cold weather i suppose, for lovers to walk hand in hand, for a little jogging or being alone with oneself
Beautiful. A lovely place for a bit of tranquility in a busy city. We visited the little cafe in the middle of the park which was great.
Nice park but nothing special. Nothing special - nice park to walk or ride a bike but nothing special to see or do (compared for example with hyde park in London)
Biking in Vondelpark!. I love Vondelpark! A nice and relaxed park in Amsterdam. We rented bikes and saw the whole park in 35min! I would recommend this to enyone!

Yep. Ok. . So it was raining when we visited BUT it was a pretty park. Lovely walking around it. Would be nice to ride a bike around too.
There are cafes but check opening times and days! The only one we could find open on the day we went was a gay cafe 😂

Wonderful park. A huge green space in the city. Beautiful, peaceful and relaxing - the perfect antidote to busy streets. Lots of different spaces to sit and chill, or walk around. We visited in June and loved watching the musicians in the open-air theatre.
Wow. The wild life, the grounds it was a beautiful place. The only shame is we went when it was raining. This park is huge so you can truly make this a day out, picnic the lot.

Very peaceful. We chose to wander round the park on our last day, which thankfully was the best day, weather-wise - bright and sunny! Lots of people out enjoying the park - walking, cycling, jogging etc but there was plent of room and no-one got in anyones way. A beautiful urban oasis and very well worth taking some time out to enjoy
Breathtaking. Great escape from the city noise and a great way to relax and hang out with friends. You can bring your own food and have a bbq inside the park.
Lovely stroll. There was a great vibe I Vondelpark, everyone was very happy and non-judgmental, which was refreshing! Lovely bridges, ponds and cafes to visit.
Relaxing Space. There is plenty to see and do in this park, if you are heading to any of the museums then it is worth hiring a bike and taking a ride or grabbing some lunch and chilling out here.
Nice place for cycling. Very big and beautiful park. You need a bike to roam around or it can be a tiring walk. Lot of birds and ducks are there in the ponds.

Very nice park in the center of Amsterdam . The Voldenpark is a very nice park situated in the center of Amsterdam. It brings to the city a very fresh air and a nice open place to be with kids/family/friends. A bit challenging visitors closer to the Leidseplein part but good overall. Watch out the bikes on the rush hour! :-)

Great Break From City Life. Take a stroll here as a break from the maelstrom of the city. As with the rest of the city, watch out for bikes! Dog friendly -- a sign at the entrance advises that the city believes it is important that dogs have a place to run free. Nice for running and walking. I believe the ring around the perimeter is just under 2 miles.

Not really for me.. I only went because it is by the Rijksmuseum and en route to the Van Gogh museum . There are fast food stalls and various attractions but I didn't really hang about, no need to. It might be better in summer.

Vondelpark. While staying in amsterdam we went for a long sroll through vondelpark, its a lovely walk with beautiful scenery we sat on the benches watching all the bike riders going about there buissness an just love thete lost property bases were you clip lost gloves,keys babys shoes lost from prams we thought this was a great idea, so if your in amsterdam pay vondel park a visit.
nice and free. good park to walk around. we hit it on the way to another place. we went in winter so it was pretty cold.

Beautiful park. This park is very nice,in this park you walking around a park ,this park have a nice trees and flowers,you kan enjoy whit live musik in this park,you can drik coffe and food,you kan have picnic there,you can riding bike and esketbord. You can enjoy it very much in this park.

Great place to relax. Spent several hours exploring & people watching. Some great playareas if you have kids. Cafes/snack areas dotted around, but a picnic & a bottle of wine from the supermarket is definitely the best way to relax there.

Lovely urban oasis. If you are looking for an infusion of greenspace during your time in Amsterdam, Vondel Park fits the bill. While you still need to attend to bikes whizzing by, the miles of walking paths, well manicures lawns and whimsical play spaces will help to revive you. Even in the winter, it it provides a welcome break from the city.

A Favorite. Huge and amazing. If in Amsterdam, save some time to take a stroll along the park including a picnic by one of its beautiful lakes. Great place to relax, to practice exercises, to see locals practicing exercises and taking their dogs for a walk. And obviously to smoke dutch weed. Been there in the summer and fall, and I must admit that I have a thing for fall colors
Beautiful . Everytime we visit Amsterdam we walk through the park it's one of my favourite places on this earth. Beautiful when the flowers are on bloom aswell as when its a winters scene.
Great area. We stayed right on Overtoom. Easy access to the tram, close enough to multiple restaurants, eateries, stores and more. Walking distance (if you like to walk) to the Central station.
Family holiday. Hire a bike as it is huge. Younger visitors can walk, but it will take a long time to see everything

Beautiful park year round. I have visited Vondelpark in both the summer and winter months and have thoroughly enjoyed the park on all occasions. It's great to hire a bike and go for a ride around, check out the wildlife (herons, parakeets and other waterfowl) take a picnic and just relax. I would recommend visiting the park to anyone who enjoys parks, walking, cycling and nature, great to get away from the busy city for a few hours!
Beautiful. I love taking pictures of gardens and nature do to visit Vondelpark with different people of all cultures and walks of life was a great treat.
Great for starting the day in the morning. great for starting your day here to watch the sunrise and walking or running here. we took so many stunning picture here and enjoy the nature.
Lovely urban park!. It was great to cycle around this charming park and enjoy the slow pace. What a wonderful asset to the city of Amsterdam!

Grab a bike or a picnic rug and enjoy. A beautiful park surrounded by beautiful homes. Vondelpark is a quiet oasis in a lovely city.Stroll around the lakes and have a relaxing time, or hope on a bike and enjoy the park with the wind in your hair.

Nice and quiet place in the middle of the city. Nice park where you can find some quiet time after exploring the downtown of Amsterdam. A fun thing is the 'vindhek' or findfence. Here you can put something you found in the park, like a glove, or a card or sunglasses. The park is good for a nice walk or to sit down for a while and just relax.

Loved it!. We loved the Vondelpark. It is calm and peaceful. You can enjoy nature by walking or cycling through the park or just go and sit there and watch all the airplanes flying over every few minutes.

Lovely!. The park is truly beautiful to walk around. We visited in summer so it was a fantastic sight.It is very large, and great to walk around and enjoy, with a lot of areas to stop for a picnic or to relax.Due to the warm weather of August, the park was quite crowded, but not unpleasant as everyone seemed to be there for the same reason as us, to enjoy an afternoon of scenery and sunshine!The park is roughly about 30minute walk from the centre where the majority of attractions are, but definitely worth the walk

Good for some time out. We popped down to the park in between visiting museums. It is very handy for the main museum quarter. Very pleasant park and ideal for our young daughter to run around and blow off some steam!
Excellent Open Space. Excellent open space to take a walk with your friends in the afternoon. You can chill on the grass or ride a bike.
Nice park. Nice park with nice locals and also soothing environment. An evening walk in this park will leave you an unforgettable memories
Lovely park. Nice park. We visited on a rainy morning but even so it was popular with people jogging and walking their dogs. I can see it being a great picnic location in the summer.
Lovely park for a stroll. We headed here on a Sunday before we got our flight home. Great park with lots of people running and doing exercise.
Lovely park. Lovely park. We enjoyed a walk around and a little sit down to take in the place. Would recommend this place for a lovely walk and chill out.
Nice park.. Our hotel was near to Vondelpark so we had a walk through. It was a nice area to have a stroll through, very busy with lots of people, walking and cycling etc.
Lovely park. This was really near our hotel and was lovely to walk through to get to the Museumplein area and the city centre.
Great space in the city. Very atmospheric green space. Plenty of wildlife to watch and very popular with cyclists and runners too. Tea house looks good, but haven't had chance to eat there yet.

Euphoria. Amsterdam has the most beautiful parks. Vondelpark is one of them. Big and clean. You walk through the trees, natives doing their bike ride, its so relaxing and you surely feel like an Amsterdamer!
Lovely at night. It's well lit when night comes and lots of benches to sit on. Would love to come back during the day with a bike for an hour or so.
Lovely Park . Fantastic park....its like Londons Hyde Park...best part of Our mini break to Amsterdam..... would recommend a visit
Great to escape the city. Lovely park - fantastic just to sit and people watch! Most Saturday's in summer there's free entertainment.

Lovely park for a cycle. My wife and I took a leisurely cycle through the park one day to escape the madness in the city. It has many cycling and walking paths. The park also has large grass lawns, beautiful trees and ponds. Only downside was that being winter it was freezing, and all the trees were bare. I'm sure it must be stunning in summer.
Take a break from the city. Calm your mind, people watch, relax on the grass or benches or go for a run. Vondelpark is clean, easily accessible from the city center and can occupy you for hours.
