Lovely, large urban park. Amsterdam's central park. This is a great place to stroll, to jog, read, ride your bike explore. Quite a large inner-city park with charming canals and bridges. Nice on a sunny day.
Beautiful stroll. Nice park located very close to my hotel. Be mindful of the bike riders. Nice leisurely stroll to clear your mind.
Perfect. Perfect park to get a 3 mile jog in. Lots of activity, well lit and safe at night. Also ran it in the day, busy but not too busy to make at your own pace/no dodging people.
Pretty Park. A park is a park, there's food and fun near and around so worth a visit. They do check to make sure you're not smoking in the park though.
Great place to relax!. It was a great place to spend our last afternoon in Amsterdam. I stopped by a coffee shop to grab a final treat, and went to the park to relax and people watch.
Nice walk. Lovely big park suitable for everyone. Lots of families, cyclists couples of all ages enjoying the outdoors.
Great for walks and biking . If you are searching to have a nice walk with your dog or with your friends it's ideal! A large busy park but quite relaxing and has a lot of ponds
Vonldelpark. A great way to spend a few hours. We walked around the park and felt like we were miles from the city, it's a lovely way to reconnect with nature if you need some time to chill out.
Big, for free and gorgeous!. Just go and feel the Dutch atmosphere: bicycles, dogs, families, people working out and so on that is beautiful on Earth! It worths even in winter!

Nice oasis to escape the museum square madness.. It's amazing that right next to the madness of the tourist trap of the whole museum square area is this green park escape. Really peaceful way to relax from the crowds. Stroll thru the park. Stop by the Blue Tea House for a coffee and a snack to recharge before you rush back into the tourist crowds.

Great place for relaxation. On a sunny day, do spend at least an hour in the park, strolling around or sitting on a bench and watching people passing by. Oh yes, the best solution is to stroll to the nice and simple cafe, grab a drink and enjoy life!

Great place for a bbq with friends. The most popular park in the central area of Amsterdam is filled with people during all seasons. I'd recommend you grab a disposable bbq, some meat and head to the designated areas where you can experience the chill.
Lovely park. Lovely green park in midst of Amsterdam; many people out on a warm late October day enjoying themselves. Made a great walk in the middle of a busy trip.
Wonderful park. A nice place to relax and people watch.lots of wild birds,parrots and duck,geese.went there also at night,perfectly safe,always local people cycling and running.very peaceful

Nice place to chill in the summer. I enjoyed just walking around and sitting on the benches during hot august days, looking at people going by. I might've been under the influence of the local greenery while doing so but it is of course not needed to enjoy this nice piece of nature in the middle of a busy city.
The best relaxing part of our visit. The ideal opportunity for a short escape from the urban environment, taking "breath" of nature and getting relaxed by the buty of the park's winter view.

A lovely park. Enjoy the walk and see the little lakes and trees any time of year.
easy to get there.. walk or public transport
Take a Break. The park offers a respite from shopping and traffic, and you can even escape the onslaught of bikes and mopeds because there's plenty of room. Flat walking trails offer a great escape

Busy, but still relaxing. Right next to the touristic Leidscheplein you'll find this relaxing place. Whether you're a tourist or just live in Amsterdam, you have to visit it once in a while. This busy park both entertains and calms you. Don't forget some food and wine on a hot summer day!

Relaxing. Stayed near here in the West Cord Fashion Hotel. It reminded me of Central Park in New York. It's full of people walking, running and cycling. If like me you like to run it's ideal. There are two playgrounds, especially a really good one attached to a restaurant in the centre of the park. Loots of nice walks and if you like, you can feed the ducks. A great place to enjoy amd relax in.

Great to cycle. This is the second time we have come to Amsterdam the previous time was in the summer so it was nice to see how the park looks in different seasons. We rented bikes and cycled around which was a great way to relax for an hour or so before going to get a coffee!

Lovely on a summer's day. Its a favourite place for both locals and tourists. Musicians and artists congregate to entertain visitors and yet nature is still close by, you can see lots of birds and squirrels, often looking for scraps from visitors. There are amenities for food and drinks, ice cream etc but you can also bring a picnic! Not the safest place after dark though!
Nature at the heart of Amsterdam. A must walkthrough park, romantic and lovely.A great place to take a breath and get back to the city.
Tranquil. A lovely, tranquil park which serves the residents of Amsterdam. Fairly large and a great spot to chill and relax. Easily accessible by foot, tram or via the tourist sightseeing bus

Large Park so much to do. Great place to visit - central park of Amsterdam. Plenty of green space. Winding walkways. Children play areas. Great place to go for Konigsdag when the place is a massive flea market.
Relaxing . Nice views, lovely atmosphere and great for romantic walks through a beautiful park. Lots of bikes and joggers so look out.

Gets you away from the city. Delightful little park 20 minutes outside the centre, large in size however not too full. Bikers and walkers using it for relaxation and presumably a cut through. worth a look if you want some extra head space and chill time from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam.
Really nice park. We went there in the morning before the museum, because was a really nice day. I am argentinian so we've sit there to drink some mate. We enjoyed it so much.

A peaceful oasis in the heart of the city. This is a great spot for running in the city with a lap of the park around 1.5 miles. At weekends, particularly in the summer, expect to be joined by many other runners. Maybe best avoided at commuter times - staying out of the way of hundreds of bikes can be challenging!

The park of 3 sins!. In this park you can do the 3 illegal things that usually you're not allowed to do in most of the park around the world,
You can smoke weed while you're drinking alcohol and having sex with your partner, but that must be in hiding place or at night cz it's impolite if there was kids around!
Beautiful. Lovely park with many pools and offering such a relaxed chilled feel about it. Enjoyed a half hour stroll but would have stayed longer if had time.

Definitely Recommend. Great way to experience Vondelpark is to hire bicycles and cycle around, I'm sure it would be beautiful to cycle around in the summer too. There are some great juice shops near by that I definitely recommmend too.
Nice . It was really good to rent a bike and drive around the vondelpark! This park is really nice even during winter time, we had a great time over there
nice even with rain. take your time visiting the park and the aerea .the coffee place was nice.it must be great in summer.
Amstedam. Dutch hyde park. Perfect for a 3.5km bike ride or stroll. Lots of birds. Must be lovely in spring as lots of trees

I was positively surprised. I highly recommend a stroll in the park, maybe even on bicycle.
I very much enjoyed a glance of nature during our urban vacation.
Nice. Lovely park - there are lots of birds roaming around and people on bicycles. Would recommend for anyone looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Like a Rembrandt painting come to life . Even during winter, Vondelpark manages to impress, with beautifully landscaped lawns, bridges and open spaces to soak in all of Amsterdam nature.
Central Park of Amsterdam. Nice and big park for a nice stroll after lunch. Reminds me a lot of Central Park. It's big, a nice place to run or bike. Good place to have a smoke and relax...enjoy!

a stroll in the city , a kind of dutch central park. this is the park of my memories. enchanting walkways, bridges, nooks and crannies. in the spring and summer a fabulous place for canoodling and picnics. a ride through on your bike is always fun.
Beautiful and peaceful. What a great park! So peaceful! Wild and organised. The whole tour takes quite some time but I'd good to enjoy some more cooked time in Amsterdam.

A special, beautiful and must see retreat from the city.. I have been here many times now, and it always worthwhile, even in the dark winter months. In the summertime, it is a wonderful picturesque place, with cycling, running, walking opportunities, and the reverse, i.e. just sitting either on a park bench, on the grass, having a BBQ, or being in one of the four cafe's. (My favourite is The Blauwe Theehuis.) The Openluchttheater has performances every Saturday and Sunday in the summertime. The park is suitable for all, especially families, and even teenagers.
Majestic Park near Rijks Museum. Tranquil park that is widely used by pedestrians and bicylcists. I wish we would have had more time to explore.

one of my favourite places. quite big so did get lost my first time as I didn't know where abouts I was headed. Quickly got the hang of it, the stepping stones are my favorite place to sit & relax. Very close to a lot of things also which is handy

Wonderful Park in the heart of South Amsterdam!. This lovely park in the heart of South Amsterdam is perfectly located between beautiful residential buildings and the shopping on PC Hoofstraat. The blue and tea house was once a TB clinic with large balconies where the patients would be rolled out to get fresh air. There is also a lovely lake and extensive bike paths. It is serene even if the weather doesn't cooperate. It is definitely with a morning stroll before shopping.

Don't miss a walk through Vondelpark. I almost didn't visit Vondelpark, but I'm glad I changed my mind. The park is absolutely beautiful (even in the winter) and it's a really great place to stretch out, go for a walk or a run, ride a bike, etc. The birds are super friendly and sometimes heron will actually walk up to you.

Green space. We visited on a rainy day so probably didn't see this place in it's best light, however it is pretty and has some nice sculptures. Pass through if you're around the area but I wouldn't advise making a special effort to get there unless there's something special going on.

Paark life. Vondelpark is gorgeous, even in winter! It was so peaceful and a great place to enjoy a break from the busy city, but only a few minutes from trams, museums, etc.
Awesome for people-watching too :)

Huge park - great for a walk. Vondelpark is THE park of amsterdam, its next to the partystreet leidseplein. During summer on sunny days this park is full of life and people who enjoy a great day in amsterdam. A lot of people who bike or do jogging. You can also do a bbq in the park- just take your one way grill and enjoy your food in the vondpark. It really is huge.

Many walks through the parc. As a local I'm often walking through this parc (at times jogging) and it's a very calming and safe area to go to ease up your mind a bit. In summer it's one of the most natural parcs you've ever seen, and with all the people lying in the grass and bbq'ing.. it really gives you a sense of how the locals live.

Lovely park for relaxing or people-watching. This park is just a few minutes walk from the Van Gogh museum. There are lots of joggers, cyclists, walkers, and cute dogs. It's a great way to see the people of Amsterdam while getting a rest at the same time. When I was there, it was a little chilly with bits of rain, but it was still a great place to sit on a bench for a while.

Nice park but very crowded. The central park of Amsterdam is Vondelpark. Specially with warmer weather it's very crowded. If you want to have a picknick or barbecue outside there a specific places for it. There are more quiet parks in the city which are also nice. For example Wester park, Rembrand park

Great place for walk or coffee! must visit. We have been there at December but the park was still stunning. A great place for a walk, or for coffee. Full of lakes, trees, life! it is better to visit in spring , but in winter is also very beautiful
Beautiful Park. I was there at the end of winter, it was nice walking around the park and when it felt too cold I can enter one of the cafes there.
Run. If you are a runner this is the place to go in amsterdam, i just loved itIt almost a 4k run around the park

Cute park. It's no Central Park, but it's quite lovely. Enjoyed riding some bikes through here. I wouldn't really go out of one's way to visit, but if you're in the area, it's worth passing briefly through.
Great . Really great park with a lot of people exercising there and also a lot of people just hanging with some friends. Very good place

Super nice park, big! Great for many activities. Vondelpark is a super nice park. It is large, and appropriate for all audiences. You can go there on a nice summer day or evening with friends, family, for a walk, exercise, to meet up. There is also a nice bar inside.. Overall, a large, in the midst of the city, chill relax park. I recommend it to everyone who visits Amsterdam :) Definitely a must see/attend!

Beautiful park in the city centre. Great place to walk and relax.. Beautiful park in the city centre. Great place to walk and relax.Nice break from the bustling and touristy city centre. Find a nice bench and enjoy life!
Find a nice bench!. Located not too far from the museum cluster, this is a good place to give your feet a rest and take in some of the surrounding architecture.

great park in the city center. Beautiful park in amstedam.Quite large to go for a run or skating. With good weather you can in some spots bbq and there are many events especially in the summer. Also many parties held in the cafes there.like like :)

Breath taking park. This park is so wonderful and so relaxing.it has many places to sit and relax while you are enjoying amazing lakes and the nature itself.you can also take food with you for a picnic for example next on the grass.you can go bike there, or simply have a walk and smell the fresh air.if you ever visit Amsterdam, try not to leave before checking out that park.
Beautiful Park. If you go to Amsterdam this is a place you cannot miss...specially when is sunny, and the people are in the park.
Great park to relax. Nice park with lots of locals. Very nice to visit and very nice to get a better taste of the dutch culture.
Beautiful Day. Attended a free concert, walled the whole park, families were having birthday parties, dogs everywhere, be alert of bicycles, they are the mode of transportation all over Amsterdam.

A step away from the centre of town. We had some free time available on the way to Museumplein so decided to deviate our route through Vondelpark. A truly lovely break away from sightseeing and shopping, with the shopping area and Leidesplein literally up one street and Museumsplein along another. I enjoyed people-watching while relaxing on a bench.Very busy, even in winter.

Beautiful all year round. I been to Amsterdam twice now, in summer and in winter, both times walking through Vondelpark and it is simply stunning all year round. During summer you have all the animals out and about and the park is full of life. In winter it is a little bit of serenity with locals working out and little school kids being pulled along in wagons. It is amazing, definitely take time out of your trip to stroll through! Beware I have gotten lost both times haha
Nice break after museums . It's worth having a break here! Right next to the museum zone and ideal to sit down and just enjoy the sunset. That is, of course if it's not raining
Very nice . Nice park to stroll around and get some time to relax before reentering the buissy city life. Very clean.

Very pretty park, very big. Very large park with wide paths to walk or ride your bike. Went in fall so the leaves were very pretty. Took over an hour to walk the whole loop around. Plenty of places to sit and rest too. Good place to people watch

Amazing place even at winter. We rented bikes from near place,Found a beautiful spot on the lake and eat some food we brought.You must rent a bike, otherwise you wont have full experience of the park.Amazing!

Picnic in vondelpark. Enjoyable day at the park with lots of natural beauty to see and friendly people amidst. All welcome (including discreet smokers). Enjoy your time there but please respect the surroundings.

Best Backyard!. This park is for everybody in every season! Visit the park for it's nice terraces, just to walk around, sit on one of the nice benches and look at all the people passing by and my favourite running.

Beautiful and huge!. We went to this park many times during our 2 week stay in Amsterdam. My favorite part was the big restaurant that had an amazing park behind/next to it. My son loved it and there were so many expat moms & kids playing there that he enjoyed playing with as well.  There's tons of beautiful wildlife constantly around. We saw herons and so many unusual ducks and other birds.  Under one of the bridges, check out the super weird and creepy sculptures of kids. They're carved on the wall sides of the bridge.
Great atmosphere . Great atmosphere for a slow/brisk walk or run. I spent a few hours here one Sunday morning, the park was very busy but not crowded.

''#Real creative of nature and water views''. A Beautiful and Peaceful Amsterdam Vondelpark viewing gets you close to all your #liked dreams and hopes of forever grateful greatness, good good nice time in the Vondelpark gets you free like a bird flying from cage to cage to reload,refresh and free up your minds in 1 stop Beautiful Vondelpark of Amsterdam it is so Amazing in inspiring #Check out this creative and indebted for it being,. Amsterdam
beautiful. Incredible park. Beautiful views and an amazing place to just sit down a relax. Near the centre of the city so easy to find.

A lovely garden !. The garden is beautiful, even though I visited it in the wrong season . It would be lovely to see in springtime or maybe summer . I imagine it would be more colorful with flowers . Anyway we enjoyed walking through and had a lovely time there.

Crowded yet Clean. Our only experience with the park was during a guided bike ride. We stopped for a bit to learn about the history of the park and particularly it's "loose" reputation for public sex and squatters during the 70's. The park was well maintained and full of locals despite it being November.

Central Park heaven!. In the middle of Amsterdam, close to Leidseplein, a green oasis, vibrant, beautiful and a must see! If you just want to stroll around away from the traffic, enjoy a picknick on the grass or lunch in one of the numerous cafe's, play with dogs, meet other travellers and exchange tips, jogg of bike..... Vondelpark is the ideal place to be! There are cultural activities very often, mostly the summer months of course but also in the winter you can enjoy a wonderful scenery. Don't miss it!
Winter probably is not the best time. Now the trees are not beautiful, because the winter. When start snowing probably will be nice and beautiful.
Cozy Environment. Wonderful view at the park. Its clean, cozy & good environment can have a great exercise or jogging out there at anytime!
Beautiful park in the center of Amsterdam. I loved walking on the park. So quiet and calm. I did some nice pictures and found that it is a good place to rest for a bit whilst seeing the City.

Great!. Great atmosphere, perfect for chilling and relaxing. Best place in Amsterdam :) Do sports if you'd like to or feed the ducks. Watch people, close your eyes and listen to the nature. A place must be seen!
Nice for a walk. Nice park, wide open trails to get away from the stress around. It is not far from the tourist attractions, or the city itself.Have cafes for a break while walking. Liked it!
Amazing and beautiful park. Its one of the most prettiest parks i've ever been too, Its very big and on the hostels doorstep very central and peaceful

The Central Park Of Europe. A great park where you can just walk and have fun.
There are so many people running in the morning, the little lakes and nature is very good.
Beautiful park. I recommend to go there as part of a trip in Amsterdam on bicycle and eat there lunch. It is near the museums so can be also a nice break!

could do more with it. Sure its a nice green place which you can walk north to south in 15 minutes bit on a grim, drizzly day, it is not appealing. Especially as there is not a lot that is going on under cover ... well, next to nothing actually unless you count the café at the north end.

Lovely park in the center of Amsterdam. A lovely walk in the park with the birds in the ponds, even though it was rainy it was lovely.
The park is big and it is a long walk to the main park but it's worth it.
Weird. A bit of an eye opener not for the faint hearted,best not be a prood if you are ,not recommended great walks when the weather is good

beautiful city park. The vondel park is a large city park, with lot's of things to do: sports, lunch, drinkings, people watching, picknick, biking.
A must on a clear sunny day

You need to visit!. This park is so gorgeous! We went in the winter but it was still full of families, dogs, runners. A lovely, clean, scenic place to visit-something different from shopping! Have a look!

Cycled through the Vondelpark. Our family cyycled through the Vondelpark, to get the lay of the land, and then returned for the kids to play on the playground. On sunny days, you can see people carrying almost anything on their bikes through the park...and on WARM sunny days it seems as though everybody in Amsterdam is here. A diversity of ponds and plantings and secluded areas exist in the park; a lovely escape from the bustle of Amsterdam.
City Break . This park is one of my favourite parks. It's walking distance to city centre, hotels, luxurious shops, coffee shops... Etc.

Amazing to chill out. Spot the hidden art projects that lurk in the park. We spent a full day there having wine and picnic. Very busy. Bbq spots are dptted around. Take wet wipes for the toilets some are ok amd others not so nice :). Lovely water features and theres a nice wee cafe in the park looks like a treehouse - snacks are ok and they do a lovely cherry cider.
Passing via bike is great. We were pasaing via the park on our wedding bikes and the air was criatal clear after the rain. I worth to visit anytime during the year.

This is Amsterdam!!. Living in Amsterdam this is the first place where you go as soon as the sun comes out and you know that summer is comming. The park is really big and if you want to see the whole park it's best to go on a bike...for me...i just walk from Leidse square or Museum square and enjoy the most busy park we have. On a summer night you have to litteraly search for a place to sit. The whole park is full of people comming from work and eating there with friends, celebrating there birthday or drinking there before going out. It is the most fun park to be!! Just walking through the park already gives you a good idea of how people from Amsterdam live. Just sit there between the people and watch them for a while...youw will see then why we love this park so much...Go to the nearest supermarket, buy some bread and butter and some wine and enjoy Amsterdam the way we locals see it!!

The Central Park of Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is a great place to hang out especially during summer time. Large groups of Amsterdam citizens and tourists hang out here and have a relaxing time. Free concerts during the summer as well.

a great place to get the Amsterdam biking experience in. Beautiful park with many loops to get lost in. It's gorgeous and well maintained. If you want the Amsterdam biking experience, I recommend coming here because the paths are wide and it'd be very hard to run into someone.I come here for bike rides during the daytime because I moved here a couple of months ago and find this the most relaxed place to bike.

Nice place to wander. Although it was cold and a bit grey and windy when we visited, Vondelpark is a nice place to just wander along the winding paths. Lots of locals walking and biking through the park, too.

lovely. lovely place. I didn't know to bike but we rented double bike (or something ) and my husband and İ were biking at the same time with our 8 years old boy :) faNTASTİC. Try the cafe in the middle of the park; children will love it and you'll love the coffee and free wifi:)
Awesome all year round. Lovely park even in winter. Take a bike and cycle around just to feel the breeze and life in the park.

Peaceful and Quite Place to Rest. I love Vondelpark and visit each time when I go to Amsterdam. I have been in Central Park in New York as well and can say that Vondelpark is definitely better than Central Park. It is so peaceful and quite and good for being alone and think think think. It is the best green place I have ever been.
Walks and quiet moments . One can spend all day or just a half hour here wandering the paths. We found so many great photo opportunities. Birding was exceptional - better than botanical gardens.
It never ends! . It's a beautiful park to even just wonder through. Pack a picnic, make a lunch of it and enjoy the wonder =)
Tranquility In The Heart Of Amsterdam. Walk, Run Or Cycle Through Vondelpark With Its Many Lakes, Paths and Eating Areas - Peace And Quiet In The Heart Of A Bustling Cuty

Better places to go.. I thought the Blauwe Theehuis in the middle of Vondelpark was disappointing - looked rather crowded and depressing so we didn't go in. It's a long thin park with little to recommend it in December.

Cute little walk! . Great park that gives plenty of space for activities, saw a lot of outdoor group exercises, thought that was a brilliant idea. Being the time of year I feel it would have been more impressive to look at in the summer, but great park all the same :)
Great for families. What a fantastic spot! Lots of play areas for kids. Good cafes. Oasis of calm in a busy city.bring a picnic and enjoy people watching.
Lovely park to cycle around. If you're looking for a pleasant park to spend some relaxing time in, then Vondelpark is perfect. Located right next to the museums, it is lovely to cycle around.
Beautiful place to wonder. Me and my girlfriend spent a lovely day at the park, we had a little picnic and walked by the trees and flowers, a beautiful and romantic place,
Casual bike ride. A lot of people using the park. Runners, cyclists, walkers, dogs on leads but few children. Cycling around was easy enough. Lovely views and a fairly large park.
Absolutely Stunning. Two friends and I cycled around here on a Sunday on rented bikes. It was so beautiful we kept doing more laps, would love to do again.

Always good for a relaxing time.. In the middle of the noisy city you can find this large park, a great place to relax, to hear silence (almost). You can bike and skate here, walk your dog or your kids. In summer the roses are beautiful, in Autumn the colorful leaves. Enjoy nice evening performances in the open air theatre. Just watch all kinds of people doing the same like you.

Nothing to write home about.... An OK park not up to London standards and avoid saturday morning when the armies of Danish joggers, cyclists and keep fit fanatics often with personal trainers invade the park

Lovely. Nice outdoor space to chill in, cycle or walk round. Not as big as we expected, so we were able to see every bit of it in an hour or so. Small café and also a bigger restaurant, the latter of which closes at 14h00 on a Sunday. Nice rose garden, lake and a children's (or adults who want to act like children!) playground.
Great attraction. The park is perfect for jogging or cycling. Also here you can walk perfectly with the children, to breathe fresh air and admire the pond and ducks.

Good for a nice relaxing walk or bike ride. We planned to walk from one side of the park to the other but it was larger than some of our group was willing to walk so we were able to pop out of an exit and catch a tram easily to get to where we wanted to go. I thought it might have been nicer if we had bikes that day because we would have been able to see more of the park that way. We where there in late November, and while it rained on us most of the time we were there, we were able to catch some clear skies. There were a lot of photo opportunities and there were these beautiful little great birds all around.

It's a park..... As stated above. We hired bikes. Rode around. Grabbed a coffee and watched the runner and Rollerbladers whoosh by in the middle of December. A welcome addition and bit of peace during a very busy city trip.

You will fall in love. Quite simply, a must go for anyone in Amsterdam. This huge park is full of beautiful trees and plants. You will find super kind Dutch people having a day in the park and fun travelers enjoying a truffles trip. If you decide to do truffles in Amsterdam, this park is a MUST. There are even adult playgrounds with ropes hidden around the park.
Worth visiting. Here you can get away from the madding crowds and enjoy a stroll around this extensive park. Easily accessible on the excellent public transport in Amsterdam.

lovely walkthrough. i went here on a rainy november day, and even then I was not disappointed. large green areas, withered autumn trees, the sound of ducks and wind. very few people as it was raining. but the ambiance was surreal (and I love the rain, btw).

nothing special. A nice green place in the middle of Amsterdam. But that is it. Everywhere you have nice green parks. Why is the aded value of this park? No idea. If you want to walk in the green and cold, yes do it.

Great spot for a stroll. One of the places where you can casually stroll through a Dutch park without feeling dizzy from all the bicycles zooming by! It's a lovely pond and romantic spot for selfies for those that are so inclined.
favorite park in Amsterdam. I lived next to Vondelpark for two years, and still frequently return for a bike ride or a walk. It is lovely, and includes a few cafes. Highly recommended.

Well it's a park a Vonderful park.. What can you say about a park? No really, it's a park. There are trees and some water. People and cops (which might be even better than Finnish cops which are lovely) and dogs etc.It's a park.Be there during summer time and have a picnic. During winter (like this time) it is a rather windy place but still nice to walk around there.But as parks go in European cities (of course haven't seen them all) - it's the best.

Vondelpark a nice place in the midle of town walking distance from Leidseplein. A big park in the midle of town. Many joggers, rollerscaters or people hang around to party or BBQ. In summer we have the Vondelpark theatre with free music, dance or theatre. There are 4 places to sit, drink or eat. Some of them (like the Vondeltuin) are only open from april until oktober.A must if you visit Amsterdam

Nice park but too many people. Perhaps it was the time of the year. Was my first visit. But it was packed with people, some extremely noisy and rowdy. Not a very tranquil place to relax. Didn't feel like it was worth the effort. Maybe quieter during other seasons.

Just beautiful!! . I went there alone early in the morning.. Easy place to find, its just on the main road. You can get there with the number 2 tram. People running and walking early in the morning.. Birds flying and off course the beautiful ponds.. Its just amazing. Make sure you take a camera with you.

Best and second biggest in Amsterdam, beautifully maintained. After 24 years in Amsterdam I must have had a picknick there for at least 300 times. It's located in a central spot and if you find ten thousand people there on a sunny day we call it quiet. It has bars&lunch places, as well as a podiu for bands at night, free of charge. Go see it.

Love Vondelpark - Like Hyde Park in London but better :). Beautiful park, particularly in summer when you can sit outside and enjoy the scenery. We visited a great cafe too, and sat outside on the wonderful decking with views of the park. Perfect for touring on bicycle!
One of the Best park in amaterdam. One of the Best park in Amsterdam . You have to visit And get information about this park before your visit .
ONLY place in the world that i would use a bicycle at!. Cruising, chilling, snacking... my wife and i had some great hours at the park and the surrounding area.

Lovely even just to get away for an Hour. in the Heart of the city and often with things going on around the park Vondelpark is a great place to either walk through, have a spot of lite lunch or just hide away for an hour or two from the busy city, there is lots to do and see and plenty for families

Beautiful - even in the drizzle. A beautiful park even in the November drizzle. Lots of locals on bikes and out for a run give this park a really lovely atmosphere. would love to come back in the summer months.

Great place. Vonelpark is a beautiful place to go at. You can go there for a quick jog or just to relax. In the park is VondelCS, a castle where you can find a restaurant and a bar. The view from the balcony is amazing, you can see the park.

Beautiful Park. we went for a walk and was pleasantly surprised with this park in the middle of Amsterdam, busy park with people out jogging, biking,walking, running, loads of exercise classes in progress. we had a lovely stroll around it.

Fantastic. The park is huge, with a lot of vegetation and usually is very well frequented during the summer. People usually do barbecue, play soccer, play guitar and do a lot of sport activities there.

Very pretty, worth a visit even in Winter. Went here over the weekend, it was cold and bit grey but the park looked great. I bet it is beautiful in the Summer.There were cyclists everywhere and lots of dog walkers, just a really peaceful place.I loved the little bandstand on the lake and there is a place where you can hang up lost items for people to find which I thought was great.Really lovely place to stroll around with a nice hot chocolate in hand.
Must visit when in Amsterdan. This park is a must see when you're in Amsterdam. Many people relaxing in a typical atmosphere for Amsterdam.

Great for running.. A great location for running, plenty of good surfaces and routes to follow. Flat of course, like the city but probably the best place to escape the traffic - although not bicycles!
Great for jogging. Amazing jogging in nice green park with ponds and lots of birds. Good for spotting locals running and cycling and relaxing after work.
Lovely city park!. Huge is an understatement. It was enormous! Children were playing, adults strolling, birds chirping etc... A serene place to be after lunch or dinner.

Beautiful Park, Nice Place to Unwind. We strolled to this park a couple times and amazed this green area in the center of a bustling city. A lot of people come here to relax, bike, walk, picnic, and enjoy nature. Its a great place to unwind for sure. A stroll through the park makes you feel you are not in the heart of a bustling city.
Great Place to Walk. We found the park and really enjoyed the opportunity to take a walk so near out hotel. The walking paths were crowded on the weekend but be particularly careful of the bicycles!

Bones of November. It's hard to know if this rating is fair because very few outdoor spaces look good in November. I came into the park from a panhandle near the Rijksmuseum and was planning to do a large loop through the main part of the park and back. The weather forecast said thunderstorms were to arrive later in the day, unfortunately the storms arrived early. I made it to the structures in the center of the park, a little beyond the open air theatre. Then the clouds and heavy rumbling sounds blowing in from the other end of the park convinced me that I wouldn't have time.The trees were mostly leafless, of course, and the plantings in the panhandle looked forlorn with nettles being the predominant plant that I recognized. Deeper in, I saw sections of rhododendrons and hydrangeas that might be nice displays in season. The park is a major thruway for bicycle traffic but even with the threatening weather there were families with strollers and dog walkers, as well as a group of rowdy young bloods singing their love of the red light district and drugs. Harmless but loud and almost on key.The only places to wait out the storm were restaurants and I wasn't really hungry so I shortened my loop and let the wind push me back out of the park. I got a little wet but made it back to watch the worst of the lashing wind and rain out of my hotel room window.
Great for summer days. Crowded when the weather is good but a must-visit for a hot summer day barbecuing or sunbathing, or for jogging all through the year

A lovely urban park. Such a beautiful space in the midst of the busy city. Take a break from your day at nearby museums for a walk through this peaceful, but family friendly park. We were here during the summer, so we saw lots of locals walking, jogging & biking throughout the park, as well as mothers, nannies & children in the children's area.
Very big park in center of Amstedam. We go around the park by bike. Very big park with ot of activities going on around. Nice for barbeque and drinks.....

A stylish oasis in a hectic city. The Vondelpark is not particularly large, but it is a pearl in the crown, an elegant place for a walk amongst trees together with a multitude of people is the weather is favorable; it is -provided it does not rain- a very fine and relaxed space in town with some historic landmarks and monuments, the statue of Vondel being amongst the most important ones. Vondel is the most famous Dutch poet of the 17th century, the Dutch Golden Age, he is a contemporary of Rembrandt
suepr nice park. one of best city parks I have ever been to. so easy to access, clean and perfect for any outdoor activity

Sight for sore eyes. Enjoyed cutting through the park on the way to the museums. it may be a longer route from the Marriott Hotel but it's worth the extra steps to avoid the narrow city sidewalks overtaken by frantic cyclists. It's also a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the city.

An escape from city life. Beautiful all year round !Bongo players, solo guitar and jugglers practicing in a peaceful manner in an all year round haven within the hustle and bustle of one of the most diverse cities in Europe.

Beautiful park near the centre. Perfect for everyone looking for a quiet place close to the city centre. This is a huge and beautiful public park, perfect for a bike ride, having a picnic, running, reading or having a fun day with the family.
excellent place. We like Vondelpark so much.we have good memorries here.Natural green world, brige, so romantic place.

Nice atmosphere. I visted vondelpark in August after a day of travelling it was nice to spend some time sitting down and admiring the beauty of this park.One can find bike rides,restuarants and toilets.

My favorite park in Amsterdam. I couldn't get full of this park even though I was crossing it more than 4-8 times per day during my 2 weeks holiday in Amsterdam.It is big enough full of green happy people,bikers,runners,dogs,a few artists,tourists and locals but all these create a perfect puzzle.During the summer they told me that a lot of people love lying down on the grass,having snacks beers and playing to their music.So enjoy every corner of it
Nice and scenic even in winter. Had a walk round the park as it wasn't far from our hotel. Lovely and can imagine in summer it would be awesome. Was a nice crisp winters day and enjoyed it alot.
Full of fresh air. Amazing park in the middle of Amsterdam and near to the I AMSTERDAM sign. This place is great for walking and getting fresh air.

Beautiful and serene. We walked through this park without realizing what it was. The next day when we took a bicycle tour, our guide gave us a little history about the park. It is a great place to picnic, take a stroll or go for a bike ride!
Beautiful . Beautiful place for a quiet walk if you've had enough of all the tourist attractions, just watch out for all the bikes or you will get squashed!

3.5. This park is very relaxing and it has a totally different vibe than the city which is just a few steps out. There are a lot of small things you can view at the park from the bridges, walkways, the lake, buildings, nature, etc. there are small unique things to view around the park if you're looking! It was perfect to take a book there, grab a warm coffee and read there for hours. All in all I found this park to be cool to visit, but only because it was near my hotel . Otherwise I wouldn't have Made an extra trip there. **people watching is pretty cool here because you have anyone from runners, bikers, walkers, etc.

Great park for a walk, ride or just drink with friends. Amazing park in the middle of Amsterdam! This place is great for a weekend walk or ride or just to have a drink or two with friends when the sun is up and shining bright.
Beautiful park. Gorgeous park especially in the summer.Take a football with you and barbecue.Lovely way to spend the hours away with friends.

Great park!. I liked this park, it pretty big but there are roads to get around. Great for biking and walking. But be careful, the bikes don't pass by slowly. There are some restuarant and café there and some streetfood available.
Love that Park. It's the best place to relax, listen to music, look at the animals around, take a ride with the bicycle or have a romantic picnic.

vondel park. Very nice park with beautiful places to rest relax and enjoy the view or simply walk with your dog.I was on hollidays and my dog was back home and looking at the dogs walking with their owners reminded me how much I missed mine.Litle lakes,lots of green...Nice
If the weather is nice. This is a lovely park to visit , preferably on a bike. Nice central cafe , lakes , herons and parakeets in trees.

Relaxing! . A lovey spot to relax after a long day sight seeing! A beautiful park and lots of benches to rest your feet! Lots of dog walkers and children playing football! It's a must visit of you go to Amsterdam!
Great for walk or run. I love staying near Vondelpark. We generally choose a B&B close to the park and enjoy the surroundings by doing a morning run.
nice walk. wonderful park, we were there at the end of november on a rainy day but it was still a wonderful walk :)

Feels like Central Park. I stayed right on the edge on Vondelpark during my trip to Amsterdam. This gave me a chance to really get to know the park. This place is just lovely. You can walk around for hours and completely forget you are in the city until you hit the main roads. Or, you can walk straight through on your way in and out of the center. Regardless, make sure to look around. There are tons of places for some good landscape pictures or maybe you like to watch the locals live their daily life. Go, people watch, and get some great pictures of this beautiful park.
Great park. Good park to spend few hours walking in it or just for a lazy picnic day. Lots of museums nearby to check out.
Beautiful. We walked the whole area of the park. Very nicely kept. There are walkers and plenty of people on bikes but this not a problem. There is loads of space.
Beautiful Park in Amsterdam. This huge and beautiful park hosts thousands of visitors. It is perfect for a picnic, a run or people watching,

Pretty Park. This is a very pretty park, lots to see and do I'm sure, however being November it was all a bit damp and not many leaves left on the trees, but in springtime and in the summer it's would be a great place to spend some time in.

Got to love it.. Walking, cycling, just chilling on the grass, this wonderful park in the city centre is great for any of those. Even though I'm not an autumn lover, Vondelpark did look absolutely stunning during my visit in November.

Beautiful . The Park is a must visit when in Amsterdam. Lots of internal cycle lanes that worth a ride.
Also some places for a proper picnic
Nice park to get relaxed. Way more quiet than the rest of the city. Great to have a relax after walking through the main attactions.
Breath of fresh air in central Amsterdam. Lovely place to walk even if the cycles still try and run you down. Just worth wandering around the lake and taking in the air

Friday walk to relax. I visited Vondelpark with my friend and my brother. There are no words to describe how beautiful this park is. First thing of all - it's full of people who are relaxed; you just can't walk there and be stressed out. Park looks amazing, it's very very clean and quiet, altough there are so many people. I took so many pictures because I was so delighted with a feeling you have while walking. We decided to sit in the middle of some part where only roses grow. What a experience!After chilling, we took a walk around the park and we even saw adorable green parrots singing on the trees! Our overall opinion - if you visit Amsterdam - visiting Vondelpark is a must.

One of the best places in amsterdam. A huge park in the city centre. You can spend hours roaming around. Also good for a bike ride. If you are staying in amsterdam for for more than a few days, do visit the park. You will have a different experience of the city.

Vondel Park. I lived 6 years in Amsterdam and cycled through the Vondel Park to get to work all 4 seasons. For me this is the heart of the city by day. Good when frozen for skating but on a sunny day is buzzing. Great cafe/terraces, playgrounds, performance venue and mix of people.

Lovely place to walk. Downtown, lovely atmosphere, so green, bikers, runners everyone there! Get lost, walk, sit by the lake, read your book... It's full of people especially at the weekends when the weather is nice!
Great park for a walk or run, very close to city centre.. A very pleasant park for a walk or run, very close to the city centre. Ideal for travellers who have travelled a long way, to unwind/stretch.
good place to visit. good place to visit in amsterdam. Tram is available to the location. its near other attractions also.

Walk through the park. Nice, big park! It'll probably look much nicer in summertime, it looked a bit sad now in the fall. We went for tea and coffee in the tea-house. Cosy and great choice of tea, but looked a bit weary.

Great place for a run. Whilest staying at the marriott, i enjoyed running in the park after work. It is very busy with People running an d walking, so you don't feel lonely even though it is dark. The full trail is approx 4.5 km.

Amazin Parc for nature lovers. such an incredible place. Very peacefull and quite. you have to spend time there. ı really love to walk, sit on grass and hang our with friend. ıt would be better to go there in spring:)
Summer in Vondelpark. The park is large, great for runners, cyclists, walkers or just for a picnic and a spot of sunbathing. Plenty of room for everyone to relax and watch the world go by.

enjoyed greenish with water. like it . near by to alot of resturants and cafes .
good place for bikr ridding and doing sports.
it is good choice uf you want quit place.

Great place to have lazy afternoon and bbq. This park is not big but very charming. It's situated close to city center so there is a lot of people but that brings the unique vibe to the place. The most important fact is that there is a special area where you can have bbq. If you're not a fan of bbq you can find some restaurants there as well.

Very special park. Amsterdam's answer to central park in New York. This park was recently upgraded over ten years and the transformation has been amazing. It is the most popular park in the Netherlands, with over 10 million visitors per year, and it is worth it. A stroll through the park as peaceful and fascinating - but beware of cyclists!
leisurely stroll. A lovely park in the heart of the city. Many joggers and bike riders here, as well as those taking a walk through. A lovely area to see.

Great, peaceful and quiet. In certan parts of the park you can't even perceived you re in the city. Go there and you will experience the city like a real Amsterdammer: going for sports, to relax or to make a barbecue in the sunny days (even if they're not so much!)

Wonderful. It does get a crowded in Summer but the park is an oasis in the middle of the southern district.
Tip:
Do take something to sit on as you can get a wet behind in many areas of the park.
Great for a mornings walk to blow of the cobwebs. Lovely park, great for a walk away from the busy centre of Amsterdam. Lots of nice bars/coffee shops close by.

Close to nature. Great place to chill and relax
One can also bicycle at the park.. It's a huge park.. however try reaching the before sunset
A must visit

If the weather is good, get BBQing!. Whatever time of year it is the Dutch love to BBQ. Vondelpark is a refreshing green, open space in Centraal where you can make a cheap day of it and meet lots of people and enjoy the outdoor space. Grab a disposable BBQ, take some beers or something a bit more interesting and enjoy some time by the lake. This is a very typical Amsterdammer thing to do, enjoy!

A lovely park. The walk in this park on an autumn day with leaves of red yellow and amber reflections against ponds and the fresh air is so good. There are a few couple of cafes/restaurants that you can enjoy in the sun or alternatively take some lunch and just sit in the many benches provided. The only thing to watch out for are the cyclists cos' they are everywhere.
Long walk in the park. Beautiful, well maintained park with chairs one could seat on when tired of walking! Very family oriented
Nice walking!. If you are tired of museums, or just want a break between them, it is an ideal place to walk and relax.

Great place to ride your bike. The park was much bigger than it appeared to me on a map, would probably take 30 or 40 minutes minutes to make one lap around. There was a really cool food stand area with beer in the middle of the park that had live music.
Nice park.. Not like English parks, just a nice park. very magical at night i think. morning the colours look really good. coffeeshops are near here ( vondel coffee shop )

Great place to check out. Such wonderful surrounds. Was really nice to just take a minutes to chill out and see how many locals make use of the place with their dogs.We went during the day and night and both times we really enjoyed it.

Early morning stroll. . Great Park with plenty going on, we took a walk around one morning and really enjoyed it. A good place to get away from the busy city of Amsterdam and out of the central area. Make sure you walk in the right lane otherwise like many other places in Amsterdam you'll get hit by a cyclist. Very tidy and clean also. A few lakes and a cafe in the middle make this a very nice place to relax.
Beautiful autumn bike ride. Perfect for a leisurely bike ride, walk or run at any time of year but I would particularly recommend Autumn as the leaves are an incredible range of colours.

A joy. In the centre of Amsterdam this huge park is an absolute delight. There are rules but these are solely designed to make sure everyone has a great time. A real pleasure to walk around and on on site cafe restaurant which is surprisingly good. A wonderful place to relax after (or before) a day of sight seeing.

Nice city park but not enough quite/green spaces. Vondelpark was a nice oasis in Amsterdam, but there were so many people that we had difficulty finding a quite place to sit without throngs of people. In Vondelpark, we did sit on edge of "duck pond" for a deli lunch. Perhaps we did not walk far enough into the park. Admittedly, we are spoiled having a 400 acre (162ha) park in a city of ~200,000 people.

Lovely Park. We went just about an hour before sunset, and there were kids playing, people jogging, couples walking, families on bikes, and it was all so lovely.The park itself is very nice and clean.Be warned, it gets very cold as soon as the sun goes down, as we discovered.
Perfect getaway from the busy city centre. Perfect place to give your bike the best time. 10 mins ride from the city centre, this park gives the perfect place to relax and have a good relaxing day.
Wonderful park! . The scenery is very nice, and with the sun shining it can't get any better. A lovely park to stroll through. Definitely recommend it!

A Nice Place for a Stroll. On our first visit to Vondelpark some years ago we were told that its nickname was "needle park" and we were advised to be very careful of drug users. We never saw any nor had any problems. It's a beautiful place for a stroll and it's great for people watching. You might even see some ...unorthodox...behaviors. Watch out for the bicyclists, they're everywhere and you might get run down; my wife almost did and really it was her fault, she wasn't paying attention.The entrance to the park is near the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum, so check it out when you visit them.
Nice walk outside. Great place to stretch your legs, either for walking or running. Lots of children, dogs and families where there, some having picnic in november brrr. But seems they did not mind

Amsterdam life. We walked in the park one weekday morning and experienced a real slice of Amsterdam life: cyclists going to work, cyclist Mums taking their kids to school, fitness fanatics running and training everywhere. We even spotted some of the famous local parakeets! A great park for a stroll, especially in the autumn with the trees reflecting in the lakes.

peacfull . so nice and relaxing park. its also sooo nice for the morning sport. dont forget the secret places which you can enjoy the mini jungel setting on tree cuts and watching the flowers around you.

Gorgeous green space in the city. Vondelpark is a must for a leisurely stroll or bike ride. It's beautiful, peaceful and a nice little escape from the hustle of the city. It would also be a lovely spot for a picnic in the warmer months. If you would like to explore Amsterdam like a local then it's worth taking some time to relax in the park.
Great place to visit by bike. I visited this park in Autumn and it was very beautiful with gorgeous landscapes. The park is a little big, so I would recomend you to visit it by bike.
Beautiful Park!. This is a lovely park to walk through, have a picnic, sit a while or stop and have a drink overlooking the lake. Or why not hire a bike and join the cyclists that enjoy the pathways.
Oasis in the city. Such a gorgeous place to walk the dog,take a break from the city,maybe have a drink or two and people watch. O

An oasis of calm. We walked through the park from one end to the other. Nice wide walkways but you need to keep an eye out for the ever-present cyclists in Amsterdam. Lovely trees, flower gardens, lakes and fountains. There is a Bandstand too which I should imagine is lovely in the summer with some music playing. There are also cafes for refreshments. Being there in November it was lovely to see the autumnal colours. We also came across the 'FindFence' where lost items are pegged on a fence. What a great idea! This park is an oasis in the middle of a busy city - good for some quiet peaceful time.

Good way to past time. There were construction and some renovation going on at a few areas when I was there, it was also rather crowded. Nevertheless, walking in the park was a fun way to past time, it also doesn't cost you a penny. Just remember to keep an eye on the cyclists when you're walking.
Nice park for a relaxing day in Amsterdam. I dont think there was something very special about this park. But it is definitely a place where people could unwind from the busy life and enjoy nature.
An oasis in a busy city. A totally enjoyable experience in the heart of a busy city. Make it a picnic on a clear day or rent bikes and ride through the park.

Oasis within the madness. After lots of sightseeing around Amsterdam, Vondel park provides a wonderful oasis of peace and quiet for a rest between the madness.After a wander around and a chance to sit and just relax, you are ready to resume the experience of the hurly burly of wonderful Amsterdam

Stunning!. This wasn't on my list to visit when I got to Amsterdam but after using Trip Advisor and had some time spare we decided to give it a visit and I'm so glad I did.This park is just beautiful and could tell it was very popular with the locals and not just tourists.I felt like I was in a movie and seeing everyone relaxed and enjoying the scenery why wouldn't you be.I would say if you have some time in your visit on drop by and have a walk around. I'll promise you won't be disappointed. I will definitely be relaxing here again in the future.

Morning run. This is our second time in Amsterdam. Both times, we had a hotel near Leidseplein. As such, it was also very close to Vondelpark. It's about two miles around the park, so we usually combine that run along with other destinations. Many people on bikes as well through the park. Coffee available in the park, as well as around the park.
Mellow and clean. Perfect for a walk or a bike ride. It has a pond with some really cool looking birdies. Very green, very clean.

Attention Runners, Walkers & Bikers. If you're looking for a good spot to run, walk or bike in Amsterdam, this is it. There's a trail next to the road for runners and walkers. Bikers own the road, but no cars allowed. One loop around the park is about 3 miles.There's a lovely thatched-roof cafe/bar in the center which was closed for the season, but had dozens of outdoor tables which looked quite inviting for warmer (and less rainy) months.The park is is the Museum Square area, just down from Van Gogh, Rijks and other museums. A nice area with good shops and restaurants for post-workout.
Leisurely stroll and fresh air. Lovely park to spend time walking through on a crisp November morning.Did not realise how big so take some time strolling at leisure.Very relaxing

Quiet retreat. Amsterdam, like any major metropolitan city, is bustling, and Vondelpark is a quiet retreat in the midst of the chaos. It is paved with a looping series of paths, which are frequented by bicycles and runners and many families out for a stroll. It's out of the way enough to feel like a real oasis, but only about a ten minute bike ride from Amsterdam Centraal. Stop at the cafe for a snack or a beer, and go back into the city refreshed!

An unexpected oasis only a few minutes' from busy Leidseplein. Seeing the sights of Amsterdam can be a hectic experience and I imagine that relatively few tourists take the time to relax a while in this tranquil, well cared-for park within walking distance of the Rijksmuseum or busy Leidseplein. Relax here for a bit and you are ready to tackle the better-known sights you have not yet seen!

Lovely park. The park is gorgeous, lots of wools milling around doing various types of exercise, dog walkers, runners and cyclists too. It's steeped it history as well which a local guide can tell you all about it. Well worth a stroll around.

Peaceful. Apart from the bad weather we had, if you want some time out of the city, with some nature around and also a quite place, make sure you have sometime to pay visit here.Nice and peaceful. Plus it is free!

Park in the Centre of Amsterdam. A large green space in the middle of Amsterdam. A good place to let young children run around, however typical of Amsterdam it is very busy. It would have been more relaxing to sit on a patio at Dam Square.

A lovely city park. We were blessed with a beautiful sunny day. It is a massive park so we only saw a small part of it. It was filled with young people enjoying the day. I am sure that it is even better in the spring and summer months.

Lovely place to hang out. Went to the park after a day of sightseeing... It was a beautiful sunny day and it was just the perfect place to chill, read a book and have a nap. The park is huge and very popular but you still manage to find a little space for yourself. :-) At one end is also a great cafe/pub/bar to have a couple of drinks...

Lovely park. My friends & I hired bikes for the day, cliche I know. This park is huge and was lovely to cycle around, the park had a really nice vibe and was packed with locals all tourists. There are lots of little hotdog stalls too which is perfect when you've got the munchies.
Day of amsterdam. Lovely park to stroll around or enjoy the sun, and then go to 1 of the many squars to have a drink in amsterdam

Lovely park, good biking route. We came here for a walk after our meal at hard rock (just up the road) as we needed to kill a few hours before our flight home. We lugged our suitcases along and found a bench to sit on, although chilly it was nice to relax and enjoy the scenery for while, lots of pretty ponds and cyclists whizzing along, worth a visit, can get a tram from Centraal station, get on the one heading to Rijksmuesum
Beautiful Park. We spent 2 afternoons walking through the park, watching the joggers, exercise groups and bicyclists. A beautiful, quite place to enjoy.
Lovely park. Good place to get some fresh sir in the centre of Amsterdam. Lots of work going on while we were there so quite noisy.

Great for a bike ride. We hired bikes at Mac Bikes in Overtoom and took them to the park for a ride. It has been a long time since we have ridden bikes but in Vondelpark the paths are wide and flat. We did a couple of circuits and stopped off for a hot chocolate before taking the bikes back. I look forward to doing it again next time we visit Amsterdam
Beautiful at dusk. We visited at dusk, this was a beautiful and calm experience.Mind the numerous bikes at certain times though!
Loved it!!. Just happened to come across this beautiful place by accident! We spend most of a summery day wondering and exploring this beautiful and relaxed park! Love love love

rainy day brightened by this gem. even though it drizzled all day, we rode bikes through this lovely park and thoroughly enjoyed it! I would recommend to anyone touring Amsterdam. It is a fine way to relax and enjoy the beautiful gardens and pathways. A picnic is a must!
A diamond in the heart of the city. A wonderful park in the heart of Amsterdam. You can go there for running, walking or just for some sightseeing. Green, green everywhere.

Beautiful. We spent a few hours here relaxing as we ate a picnic.
Lovely sights and was nice to get away from the bikes...
Relaxation. If you are ever looking for a great place to wonder and watch the world go by this is a wonderful place. Find a bench on a nice sunny day and relax.
Nice surrounding. Nice place, well kept, relaxing. Can visit here evening so you could relax. few places to eat around here

Picturesque park. Couldn't have enjoyed a place more
Went cycling around here nearly every day we were in Amsterdam. Especially great during autumn. Even nice at nighttime, not dodgy at all

Beautiful but better in warm weather. It's a beautiful park and pretty to walk through. That being said, this is something that is only probably really worth it to do in warm weather. When it's nice out, it's clearly a place locals hang out in often and it would be fun to do that when they do, to get a real sense of the city and the locals. In cold weather, it's just another park to walk through.
beautifull. my friend and i spent a very enjoyable day in the sun... we spent are time rideing on are bikes.. fab , fab day

Nothing extremely special but probably more enjoyable in the summer.. I've been in parks all over the world. Het Vondelpark Is a nice park to walk around in. But not a must see when you come to Amsterdam. It will be fun though in the summer because you have some spots where you can grill and bbq.
Halloween Sunday walk. Lovely open space. Very active park with dog walkers, joggers and families. Very clean. Tennis club nearby and cafe/restaurant.
Beautiful place, spend a day at leisure. A beautiful park where you can spend a day at leisure. Hire a bike at the park. We rode the bike from Sloterdijk which in the end became too much for a day.

Beautiful Amsterdam.. We decided to visit Vondelpark on a warm sunny Sunday - and I think most of the population of the city were there too. People were out to enjoy the sun and the beautiful park - many locals were enjoying picnincs by the lake or under the canopy of shady trees and children were frolicking on the green grass with balls and games. It was lovely to see so many people enjoying this lovely park and the outdoors. Another time I would revisit on a week day when it would be a little less crowded.

Gorgeous, peaceful park. My boyfriend and I spent a lovely afternoon walking around the Vondelpark. It was busy but it never felt crowded and it's absolutely gorgeous. Very well maintained, tons of water, gardens and plenty of walking paths. This is a great spot for people and dog watching as well. If you're in Amsterdam, make sure you take the time to stroll through the Vondelpark!
Relaxing stroll. Sunday morning stroll through this lovely park was so relaxing.Super watching all the locals make use of this beautiful park. Walking, jogging cycling etc.

Central Park of Amsterdam. The park is really nice even when it was still wet. There are places to walk and bike. A lot of people bring their dogs and children so it was nice to people watch and dog watch. Definitely go when the weather is nicer.

Quite possibly my favourite place on earth!. The Vondelpark is absolutely beautiful, an oasis of calm and outdoorsy loveliness in the midst of the city. We always visit whenever we are in amsterdam and always feel so serene and peaceful after our visits. A must do!!!!

Family Cycle. I was disappointed. It is a lovely green space in the middle of the city but the children's play parks do not compare to the UK parks. If you just see it as a chance for the children to stretch their legs, then it will suffice. The cycle ways very crowded. The main restaurant was old and a bit grubby but you can use the toilet for 50 cents.

Perfect bike ride. Maybe it was the Amsterdam atmosphere that got to me but riding along in Vondelpark on my bike made me smile and enjoy Amsterdam. For a fun experience bring some bread with you to feed the birds, it's especially fun to feed the gulls as they are swooping down. Perfect spot to stop during a busy day, just make sure it's not raining!

Romantic for couples. This place is so beautiful and spacious it's great for kids to visit too, professional photographers would be in heaven just to capture the beauty of it, but be careful for cyclists as they have right of way, there is a bar in a hotel nearby, rivers going through the park and bridges to cross over, it is worth a visit through your own eyes
Loved this place...... We loved the freedom of the park. Was busy but didn't feel rushed or pushed by people. Lots of smiling faces which is always nice.

Nice walk around the park. A very nice and popular park in walking distance from the city centre. We walked around the entire park and afterwards ended up having a glass of wine on a terrace overlooking the park (perhaps this was the highlight).
Beautiful place. What a stunning place. I really would recommend walking around this park and stopping off at the little cafe to rest your feet.

Nice park. My friends and I decided to rent bikes and ride around the park - which was extremely lovely and a lot of fun. This park is bustling with visitors and i'm sure locals. It has plenty of restaurant options and is very close to public transportation. Okay so this park is nice but nothing special - I don't think it's a MUST SEE if you only have a short amount of time in Amsterdam.
Massive park. Lovely to ride round on bike,or just to sit on the grass. Busy and popular well worth a visit. Lovely lake
Nice barbecue picnic spot. Best time to enjoy Dutch summer with family and food. Have nice places to set up your barbecue and for trash. Clean toilets that help you stay longer.
Cool park inn the middle of the city. A very nice park to relax in, alchohol is not allowed but police sometimes doesn't care. A very nice park with history and a good view.

Beautiful Day at the Park. Rent bikes and make the trip to Vondelpark. We rode thru town on our rented bikes and toured Vondelpark. It is amazingly big. Kids playing, couples just hanging, joggers, and just strolling. We had a beautiful cool sunny day in October. There are a number of restaurants and self serve venues where you can grab a beverage and a quick bite. Don't miss it if the weather is right.

Perfect for cycling. Came here in October and weather was perfect . Family with 3 teenagers. Hired bikes from Green Budget Bikes (also recommended!)Great way to spend an afternoon as cycling around streets in Amsterdam can be a little daunting for less experienced . Very safe and clean
Peace away from all the tourists. We cycled around Vodelpark a couple of times, and although it was busy it was nice to be away from a lot of the tourists. The cafes were great as well.

Simply stunning!. Simply stunning and gorgeous park! Walked round here for hours! When back in Amsterdam again will certainly be visiting here again. Few cafes here too, so great to sit, get a drink and take it all in.

Do if you have time. Beautiful park and is in the museum and shopping district. We took a walk since we had extra time that day and definitely enjoyed it, There are some cafes with a view of the park which are nice. Not a must see but if you have the time definitely go. Also a great place to ride bikes if you rented one for the day.
Very nice park. Ideal park to ride your bike for a while, to hang out on the grass or just walk around after you ate your magic truffles!

Lovely way to spend a day!. A must-see when visiting Amsterdam! Vondelpark is very easily accessible and well worth hiring a bicycle to explore the gorgeous scenery. There is a little tea-garden that one can order fresh meals/sandwhiches/cakes and drinks from and if you are lucky bag a spot along the river and sit in the sunshine!We went here on our last day and it was very relaxing and peaceful, a stark contrast to the mayhem of the redlight district the evening before!
Silence and beauty . This is a very big Park. You can rent a Bike and look around by Bike. Good for relaxing. You can have a sit in a Cafe. you can walk or make jogging.

Ride in the park. Hired bikes for three hours and rode into the park. Beautiful colours of the autumn leaves an d very pleasant ride through the park. Wide path level so even the unfit can ride. Lovely grand building housing cafe with south facing terrace. Had a relaxing couple of hours.Recommended.
Peaceful. Nice peaceful garden away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Good to take a walk around and plenty of places to visit whilst in the park.

Fall color. Our favorite day in Amsterdam began with a morning trip to the Rijksmusem followed by lunch at Sama Sebo and then a stroll through this park, the entrance to which is just a few blocks down. Vondelpark is a pretty standard city park and shouldn't be at the top of your list of things to see, necessarily, but it makes for a wonderful retreat in nice weather. Though long, it is possible to walk the entire thing in an hour or so. When you get to the end, you can cut over a few blocks to the east and catch a tram back to Museumplein or the city center, but the neighborhoods surrounding the park are also lovely and blissfully quiet with a number of nice antique shops and cafes.

Wonderful!. I love green park so I loved vondelpark and it was very near from the hostel where I stayed so I went there as often as I could. The contact with nature and the big green threes will paralyze you.

A beautiful park. Vondelpark is a big park not far from downtown Amsterdam and right next to the museum's square. If you don't have to time to walk across the park, take 5 minutes to walk as much as you can because is worth it! Watch out fot the cyclists, though...
nice park. very pleasant place to walk through. All flat as the rest of Amsterdam but still full of mad cyclists. Lots of work being done when we were there to update the lakes and grass.

Stunning!. My sister and I red bikes to get away from busy Dam square for the day and had our favourite day in Amsterdam! It is so beautiful in the park, not too busy, verandas and cafes to use. Dog friendly, bike friendly, lots of monuments, lovely autumn walk. Well kept and clean. Recommended visit!

Good Park for a Joint. Excellent park to go to and smoke a J before you enter the Stedelijk, the Van Gogh or the Rijksmuseum. There is a lovely labrynth you can walk along inside the park while you do that I found really helps center the mind. As far as city parks go, it's not the best, but it's not bad.
lovely. a great place to bike, walk, picnic or just hang around. apparently there are sections where you could jump up and down and feel the earth move.
love Amsterdam. Since our last visit this park has just gotten better. Love the I LOVE AMSTERSDAM artwork outside. A must see!

place for a picnic. me and a couple of friends wanted to go to the museums nearby and decided to take a detour through the park. although we have only seen a small portion of it we spent around an hour walking through it.i suggest that people rent a bicycle, take a walk. have a picnic in the park, its a really nice and quiet place, a different part of amsterdam for you to see.
Good Place to chill away from the hustle and bustle. Plenty of fresh air, great to amble around and relax especially with kids. Beautiful. Not far from Albert Cuyp Market.

Lovely walk.. Great for a good walk, jog or cycle. Pretty views and lots of space. Benches to sit and rest on as it is rather a long walk all the way around or even if you want to just sit and enjoy the moment. Lovely and relaxing!
Great place to spend a fuzzy sunday. After hitting Amsterdam hard the night before this was a great place to recover and enjoy a coffee / walk through the woods.

Good place for a run. We were staying in a nearby hotel and for my morning run used the park as part of the route. Well kept and pretty park with lots of people using it, so well worth a visit to walk, run or cycle

only had 1 hour to see a small part of it. we were at Van Gogh Museum for most of the day and walked over to the park; had a cup of capacino and enjoyed the fall color at the eastern part of the park.Will spend more time in future.

Beautiful park. What a beautiful park for the people of Amsterdam, and boy do they love it. We walked all the way through it and at every turn there is a view to please the eye. Three cafes are spread throughout and people are running, walking, cycling and playing games. A joyous place to relax and wind down during the hectic tourist thing. Not to be missed.

Beautiful Park Minus the Construction!. Walked through Vondelpark whilst visiting Amsterdam and it is indeed a beautiful piece of greenery. It is peaceful and colourful, with artists scattered around painting the scenery; it is nice to see. The only downside to it was that half of the park is undergoing major construction so there are upturned turfs, construction tools and vehicles in a lot of the parks areas. I would like to visit again once the work has finished.
A must will small children . Made two trips to Vondelpark with our 2 year old. He loved running, playing, exploring and looking at all the animals. The playpark at Melkhuis is definitely recommended.

If Stepford Wife's had a park. Lovely autumn colours, people effortlessly gliding by on bikes, Tai Chi, people strolling, tiddly-peeps in their primary school carts, yoga, an art class etc. No cans of Tennant's Super...all a bit surreal and "Stepford Wife's" but just stunning.

Lovely park to chill out! . We stayed next to the park and had a lovely afternoon and evening stroll. Lots to do and in the summer will be amazing!Plenty places to grab food and drink if needed and lovely scenery.Lots to do for children as well
Gorgeous!. Lovely place to rest and walk around -- beautiful ponds and trees and not TOO big, but still huge enough to be blown away (not literally, it wasn't too windy)

Nice walk to clear the head. These beutifull gardens are a delight to rome around in with your partner to your side the water makes some where calming to get away from hustle and bustle of amsterdam and just clear your head. Maybe bring a bottle of wine and a basket with nibbles if the weather is good. It's a hotpot in the summer for allot of people so be warned. my favourite is the bridge it sets a romantic vibe that you will feel if you make it there especially around sunset ;-)

Tourism in Amsterdam. An outstanding Park, excellent for bikes particularly nice if the weather is good and shiny. It is strongly recommended for all ages. It is not a large park but has an outstanding structure. Perfect for relaxing.
Pretty park in the middle of Amsterdam. When you are from a rural area and spending time in Amsterdam this is a wonderful place to retreat to and recharge your "green".

Beautiful park, a decent way to walk by and relax. Highly recommended on Sunday. The park offers hugh green fields which are perfect for a quite relaxed walk, with some pools, pretty flowers and facilities for children along the way.Great way to spend few hours in Amsterdam and relax a little.It's probably the best to visit the park on Sunday, when it is full of people enjoying their weekend - running, playing football, practicing, play with their kids, walk with their dogs etc.It's found in a great location, you can reach it with a 5 minutes ride with a tram from the city centre.
I loved riding in this park on my bicycle. It was great to enter the park away from the bustle of the city all around, and see people of all ages enjoying themselves

Such a beautiful place. I visited Amsterdam with friends and we hired bikes and came to this park. What a brilliant idea! It was absolutely stunning and falling leaves made it so much better (visited in October). If you stay in Amsterdam city centre then visiting this park is a must as it is such a beautiful getaway from the city for a while!

Sit and relax. Rode my bike through the park and found a nice bench next to the water to just sit and take everything in. Lots of people working out and others just relaxing. Good place for picnic lunch.

Happening Park. Spent a very pleasurable 2 hours in the autumn sunshine chilling out. Watching the locals using various forms of transport, joggers, roller bladers, skateboarders, cyclists, and people on scooters. Felt rather mundane simply walking. The autumnal colours were splendid, reflected in their glory in the many lakes. It was definitely a highlight of the break, and good to clear the lungs after the Rijksmuseum.
Family walk. This park was right by our apartment and we walked through it on our way to the Room of Riddles. What a beautiful park. Well worth hiring bikes and exploring. Beautiful
Nice park. Especially in sunny days, I can strongly advice to make a bike trip. Ther are small and nice lakes. At the end of park, there is a place in which you can drink beer, have a snack and rest.
