Lovely park. Great place for a cycle or to just relax. Visited in autumn and was very picturesque for cycling around on a sunny day

Amazing Park !!!. From one end to another you just cant keep sitting and watching. There is beauty everywhere the eyes can reach and you need to think twice before you shift your attention to another side. The Fall season added more romance to the beauty.
Enjoyed the visit. Great for a stroll/sit down on a nice day. Busy with cyclist/joggers and pre-school children outings in multiple buggies. Interesting just to watch the world go by

Huge Park in Amsterdam. This is a great place to relax and enjoy a nice day. Many people are sunbathing, walking their dogs, riding bikes and just having fun. Good place for a picnic and to take a nice walk around the entire park. It's a must visit when in Amsterdam. I always ride my bike through. Watch our for the dogs when riding your bike.

Perfect park life!. A fantastic place to get lost in for an hour or two. Lovely coffee in the cafe in the park and some funky features, like the carving of a man holding up a tree. We were lucky with the weather and all the colours of autumn making the park look very fine. If you like wandering through parks, this is a lovely place to be.
Beautiful! . Amazing views and such a lovely walk around . Lots of cafes to have a drink . Takes up quite a bit of time as it's very big!

Walk for a perfect day. The park is in Amsterdam Centrum, which gives it a lot os options to go before or after a walk there. Another good thing to do is to cross it riding a bike or to grab a cup of coffee in one of many corners.

Nice by bike. Enjoyed biking through the park, it was a nice way to break up a day of museums. The paths are clean and well paves, and its a nice escape from the bricks and hustle of the city that surrounds the park.
Just a park. Nothing special to see as for tourists. It is more of the park where locals hang out on sunny day and have their daily run. Nothing else

What an amazing park in the centre of Amsterdam. Living fourty plus years in the Netherlands and never visited Vondelpark in Amsterdam. I am ashamed of myself. Today I walked throughout the park and I loved it. Such a beautiful place!! People running, walking, biking and walking their dogs. The weather was beautiful. Almost 20 degree Celsius in October. Amazing!!This is one of the places you need to visit when you come to Amsterdam. And I promise that I myself will visit this beautiful park more often!ENJOY!

nice bike ride. This is a beautiful park and excellent place to bike, jog, run or have a picnic. We enjoyed a very leisure bike ride and played with a few of the parks residence - ducks and geese. Very enjoyable.

Perfect place to spend sunny day. We were lucky to get sunny day in Amsterdam. This is a perfect open-air place, so nice to walk, so nice to have sun, so nice to ride a bike. Many visitors, but the park doesn’t seem to be overcrowded.We didn’t go to Groot Melkhuis, there’s a lot to do for children in the park besides this café. We found some simple but nice playgrounds for our daughter, where she was happy to dig in the sand.Rose garden was pleasant, too. Although it was too early for roses to bloom, we could easily imagine how wonderful it is here when flowers blossom.But what we loved most was Kinderbad – some kind of round shallow swimming pool or fountain bowl where kids could run, play, jump, splash (although water was quite chilly). Taking swimming suits and towels for our daughter was a good idea. The bowl is knee-deep so it fits for children at any age.

Peaceful haven to watch the world go by.. We visited Vondelpark yet again to enjoy a wonderful Sunday morning strolling around the calming oasis of this popular park. Watching the locals cycling, skateboarding, rollerblading, jogging etc etc was terrific.
go there by bicycle. we went there on a sunny fall morning and had a full tour by bike . worth going for a tour and some relaxation in a gorgeous green scenery .
Have seen better green spaces. whilst it was perfectly nice it doesn't compare to the likes of Hyde Park in London, El Retiro in Madrid or other similar open spaces
Surprising park in the center of Amsterdam. When you enter this parc you wille see all kind of things: There is enough space to sit on the grass and enjoy the weather and the food you can bring in.

Beautiful park well worth a look. Always love coming here fro a wander on a sunny day in Amsterdam, very picturesque and some great little places to eat and drink in the park and the surrounding area.

Like a heaven . U have to visit here if u r at Amsterdam. Just lay on grass and relax. U can see all the colors..
Just ride ur bike and enjoy
Nice park. A really nice park, Great fun to cycle round and felt very familiar, like being in an English town park (very similar to Cannon Hill Park in Birmingham) well worth the visit
Beautiful. Even in the cold, dreary weather, this park was beautiful and helpful in navigating our way through the city!
Lovely park, great for families. Great cafe and park in the centre of Amsterdam walk to and close to restaurants and museums. Great for families and gentle stroll

Lively park. Would love to have a park like this back home, with everybody just cycling along an so many families out on their bikes together loved it, walk through the park at night from the opening up near the main part an it was still very busy so felt very safe.
Perfect for bikig. Went there biking, very nice. Park itself is huge and you can easily get lost in it if dont have a map or sense of direction :)

Truly Amsterdam! for local and to avoid crowded tourists!. Had a fantastic time walking the park with my friend. Clean, peaceful with everything very well tended. This is a hidden gems where tourists will neglected but a truly Amsterdam experience!

What a place!. Vondelpark is one of the most beautiful,exciting and relaxing spaces in the city. Plenty of nature to be seen, including both rose ringed and alexandrine parakeets and white storks and Egyptian geese. This is also a dog lover's paradise. A wonderful way to spend a day.

Romantic stroll and drink in the park.. The vondelpark is a lovely romantic park in the centre of amsterdam perfect for a glass of wine or coffee (whatever takes your fancy) with a boyfriend or husband!
We didn't hire out bikes for the park but definitely wish we had as looks very fun and the best way to see the entire park!
Nice. Amsterdam is very beautiful and the people are great :) You can see this looking in the park on a Sunday morning.

Great Park. I visited the park for running and it was amazing. It has wide paths to run. The green grass and the water are beautiful. Its relatively big so you don't have to do many laps.
There are water fountains to drink from.
Its a very nice place to have picnics and relax.

Very peaceful. Would highly recommend this as a way to escape the busy streets! Very peaceful and pretty. So much to walk around and see - only saw a small amount myself but the park is huge! Certainly worth looking round.

large park, good atmosphere. Nice park to spend a few hours in Amsterdam whether by foot or cycling. It has a few coffee spots and a little stage where some festivals are held with nice street food stalls

Great Place to Get Away From the Crowds. Is this a busy place? Absolutely. Busy compared to downtown Amsterdam around the Central Train station? Not even close. We were there looking for a less busy place to enjoy Amsterdam. This is certainly such a place. We also took pictures of newlyweds.I llike nighttime pictures because I think the nighttime is a magical time. This place is no exception. It's easy to get here using public transport. It is also close to 2 must see museums - the Van Gogh and the National Museum.

An oasis of "chill-out" vibes. The Vondelpark is one of Amsterdams best known parks, and one of the most visited places by locals as well as tourists. The great thing is, that it doesn't really show. The park is huge and the people are awesome: picnicking, BBQ-ing, playing games or just lying around in the grass.. it truly is one of the best places to get your inner batteries charged.
What a wonderful park.. This park is so lovely. It really is worth spending a couple of hours walking through this beautiful green space -- take a lunch - it's a perfect place to watch people.
Beautiful park for walking or biking!. One of the most gorgeous parks in Amsterdam. Seems like a hidden gem. Nearby there is also an amazing Crossfit gym. Highly recommended!

absolutly amsterdam. awesome kids pool
awesome lakes
happy people
ideal for picnicks
green
birds
ideal for yoga
ideal for a nap under a tree

Coffee really good..... Stayed just next to park and it was great to go for a morning walk and drop in to the cafe for coffee. Locals were having breakfast so it must be good. Park is very peaceful with lots of people taking morning exercise. Just watch out for the bicycles. Within walking distance of the museums.

Beautiful . Its a beautiful park where u see all kinds of people having a run(when we went there was a marathon happening) walking the dogs... Under the bridge there were some people with some music, it was pretty fun!

Beautiful park great for biking. We bike through the park and it was nice place. It was a bit chilly day and not many people were there, but I'm sure a lot more peole like to hang out when the weather is nice.

Central Park of Amsterdam. This is by far the largest and most beautiful parks of Amsterdam. Located in the museum quarter and accessible only by foot of bike. Very well kept with many different plant and tree species, this park is an oasis of quietness, unless there is an event going on or on a sunny Sunday. It is very safe and there is also a restaurant for some drinks or snacks.Well worth to kick up your heels...
Like Central Park in New York. Largest Park in Amsterdam, where people come to bike, stroll, play, walk and enjoy the outdoors in a beautiful setting.
So nice we returned. Even during a short trip to Amsterdam we enjoyed wondering in the Vondelpark, taking pictures of herons, so much that we returned. Lovely, accessible, city centre park

Peaceful and lovely. Very peaceful and beautiful park near the Museum quarter. Its quite large and has some interesting buildings inside it. My favorite was Blauwe Theehuis, a saucer shaped cafe. The part is quite busy even in the winter.

Way too busy. Amsterdam has many parks, also similar in beauty. So why do we all cram ourselves in this park where all the green beauty is obscured by stoners and drunks? Unless you like that, there are many other parks to visit as well.

Beautiful Park. During my trip to Amsterdam for business this summer I stayed at a hotel across from Vondelpark. This is a very nice beautiful park and I enjoyed walking it from end to end daily as I walked to the central area. There are a lot of active people in the park riding bikes, jogging including excercise groups, it was really neat to see so many people being active and healthy. It was interesting too to see groups of young and old bbqing, and playing games and at night there were some mini raves going on. If you're in the area, take the time to walk Amsterdam and really see it.

A pleasant walk away from the busy city centre. A relaxing place to have a pleasant walk but you do need to be on your toes to avoid colliding with the numerous (and speedy) cyclists who frequent the park
Ran through this!. Ran through this as it was part of the Amsterdam Marathon course. Not exactly situated in city centre but lovely park to walk through.

Lovely place. Visited here with our children last week. Lovely place to take a break from the museums. Kids enjoyed the play park near the tennis courts. Would be a great place to have a picnic in better weather

So pretty. This park is absolutely beautiful - and HUGE! It's so big no matter how many people (and sometimes it is indeed a lot!) are in there there is always space. As soon as the sun is out there is a million bbq's going on - lovely! There are lakes, restaurants and little bars in there - keep your eyes open! Every time i bike into Vondelpark I am amazed at the light inside - it's something special about it!
A peaceful stroll. We took a two hour stroll through the park. Such a wonderful way to see the city. The trees turning colour, the locals and the serenity. A great way to end our mini vacation.

Relax. I don't really do chilling and reading a book on my holidays, but glad we did visit Vondelpark!We visited twice during our 3 days in Amsterdam, was nice to unwind in the afternoon with a bit of a picnic and a book. I would imagine your wouldn't find it as enjoyable if the weather is not with you, but if it is, give it a go!Within 1 minute of tram stops, there are toilets available for a small donation and a Cafe.
If you like a strolll. It was a cold and fresh sunny day an ideal place for a walk. Beware of cyclists, joggers and dog walkers but all very friendly.
Pretty. We went cycling in Vondel Park and hired bikes for $5 which is very cheap. There was ducks on the pond, people exercising, walking dogs it was a lovely experience.

Beautiful Urban Park. On our recent visit to Amsterdam, we walked through this beautiful, urban oasis every day. There were plenty of little spots to sit in private and enjoy the tranquility of nature from the sparkling ponds and lively ducks to the crisp fall air and brilliantly coloured leaves. This park must be inspiring because I'm not usually this poetic! We also walked to the Vondelpark Paviljoen and enjoyed beer, fresh mint tea, and a tasty Dutch appetizer platter in the beer garden while watching cyclists zip by. If you are tired of getting lost in the busy city, try getting lost here for a few hours!

Beautiful!. One of the most beautiful places in Amsterdam. Absolutely loved every second of it. Picnics, relaxing, or even bringing a speaker to hang out and listen to music with friends, it's such an amazing spot!
So lovely. Lovely place to walk always sporty people running and nice ducks around. I enjoyed my wlak in this park...in the summer should be even better
Lovely, a must for biking. Had so much fun unwinding at Vondelpark and it was such a nice calm atmosphere to get to know the neighborhood.
Beautiful. Me and my friend rented bikes and cycled around Vondelpark. Such amazing scenery and cafes. Just be careful to cycle on the correct side or you get shouted at!
A long promenade!!. Do you feel like walking? Then ,there you are!! Don't forget to pack sandwiches and drinks. You can sit to the banks next to small lakes and enjoy the silence!

Lovely peaceful park. Vondel Park is a nice place to spend some time away from the busy city. There are many small lakes and fountains in the park, with pleasant walking paths through and around it. Wildlife include lots of different water birds. We also saw some green parrots. The only thing I didn't like were trash containers that were painted red and white. A bandstand and light posts were light gray. The color of these things were too strong, taking away from the colors of nature.
The Central Park of Amsterdam. Vondelpark!. Great park, old trees, relaxed atmosphere, 185 years old, always sinking, well maintained. Tennis, Thee, walk and enjoy!

Great for a nice walk or reading a book with nice weather. My most favorite park in Amsterdam. Great for a nice stroll through the green. Take a book and a beer with you, sit somewhere in the grass and just chill a bit, while you watch all the people walk through the park.Also great for families.

The place to be in summer. Are you in Amsterdam on a nice warm day? Go check out Vondelpark. Everyone in and around Amsterdam will be relaxing in the park. There are several spots to barbeque, some cafes, playgrounds for kids and so on.

Relax in Amsterdam's green lung. Vondelpark is beaurtiful. We visited during a sunny August, cycled through the park, amid flowers, trees and lakes, relaxed on the grass with other sun-catchers, and went to the restaurant in the centre for incredible pancakes and coffee. Also - our hotel was on the other side of the Vondelpark, meaning we walked and cycled back through it after midnight. It was perfectly safe and pleasant even at this time. Amsterdam's centre is somewhat lacking in green spaces, so make the most of this beautiful park while you're there.
MUST. A PLACE U MUST VISIT.there's nothing like it.so unique and special..can't be described by word.just go for it

beautiful. Vondelpark is like a small Hyde Park or Central Park. A pretty stream runs through it, there are beautiful trees and green spaces, and a running and cycling path as well. A nice escape from the busy streets of Amsterdam.
Beautiful!!!. Beautiful! great chill out location. Easy to find. My hostel was right beside it. Beautiful for morning runs and romantic hang outs!

Big park and a nice place to relax. It's very big from one end to the other. You could rent a bicycle outside the park (there's one near Hard Rock Cafe) but you have to return the bicycle on time as it closes in the evening (around 5pm) so start earlier in the day if you plan to rent one. Greenery and landscape provided pleasant views during our weekend stroll.
Lovely park. It's a delightful place, lovely gardens and has facilities eg cafe, restaurant and so on. A great place to come with friends and lie on your backs on the grass.

An absolutely stunning gem. Get a bike and go for a ride through this beautiful park. Stop at one of the cute outdoor cafes and have a beverage while you watch people exercise, play with children, walk their dogs and just enjoy this very special park.
Nice area for walking and biking . Though the park tends to get busier after work hours still a relaxing and nice escape from the hustle of the streets of Amsterdam.

Lovely stroll. This park was a real delight to stroll through. The view is lovely across the lakes and the gardens are quite nice. It is a large patch of solitude away from the bustle of the city. It was nice just to relax at a café and just watch the walkers and cyclers go by

A peaceful walk. We walked the park mid morning and thoroughly enjoyed taking 'time out' from our full on day of sight seeing to relax and enjoy nature here. It's an easy flat walk and we stopped for a coffee and cake and people watched for a time. Runners, riders and walkers all flowing past. Families and fitness fanatics mixing together as they make their way around the grounds. We were lucky enough to catch a beautiful wedding in progress and the sun was warm and we left for the next sight seeing energised.

Lovely place for a walk or cycle. Took a walk through some of the park on a lovely crisp, autumn morning. Was busy, but had a sense of calm about it. Would be a wonderful place to go also in summer when the weather was hotter. Nice haven away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

A Delightful Stroll Through Nature in the Heart of the City. If you find yourself in need of a quiet, nature-filled moment while enjoying the beautiful hustle & bustle of Amsterdam, Vondelpark offers the perfect retreat, anytime of year.
Ride a bicycle here. It is a huge park.. It will save you some time if you bike.. Or jog! A great place to get away from the busy Amsterdam..

A great place to go for a run or take a walk. This is a great place to go for a run or relax. Running one lap around is about two miles, so you can get a great workout when you run two or three laps around.
If you're not a runner, this is still a great place to take a relaxing walk around town.

Peace and quiet when you want it.. If you are anywhere near you really should have a walk around this most interesting of parks. If you are in Amsterdam for more than a day it might be worth your while to take tram down here if your not within walking distance. I love the way the locals really make use of this place, which can be an oasis of peace in a hectic area.

A walk in the park on a nice bright sunday morning. I went for a walk in the park on the sunday when I visited and it was very pleasant, I stopped at the cafe in the middle and had a lemon tea and a morning wake and bake 420!! No one bothers if your smoking a reefer and the Dutch nation as a whole seemed to be working out on a sunday morning... There was a few lad's from the local population calling out to the ladies as they exercised but nothing bad... and there's a lost and found thing in the park which is both honest and a great idea...
Lovely for a walk round or sit down. Love walking round the park and try to each time I'm in the city. It can be very peaceful, after the busy streets it's an oasis!

Biked Through. My friend and I had the opportunity to bike through the park on our tour and it was a soothing ride. Great place to escape and there is some history to be learned from the outdoor Picasso artwork, to the history of the beautiful homes around the area. Very pretty and great place to relax.
Stunning park to relax or jog . Vondelpark is a great place for a jog or to sit on a bench and relax. The park is rather large and has some fabulous lakes throughout.

Awesome park.. Must see in warmer weather. My boyfriend and I had rented bikes and rode from the Metro at Waterlooplein all the way to Vondelpark. Unfortunately since it was so cold outside, it was a little difficult to really enjoy the park. I'm sure in the summer time it's nice to lay out and have a picnic, but we had a pretty good time just riding around. It's a really relaxing area to kind of get away from the busy city. There are great little spots all around to take nice photos, which we definitely took advantage of. It's right near the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum so definitely check it out after you go through the museums.

Close to all museums; great skaging in the winter!. With all of the lines and congestion in Amsterdam, this park offers a pleasant respite. Have a picnic, lay in the sun, play ball or do nothing!Easy to find and adjacent to Van Gogh museum. Plenty of souvenirs nearby and places to eat and have coffee.
Beautiful Park. I was there for about 3 different times and it is always a nice place to visit, very large, really very big and it is a god place do walk around, ride a bike or just run.

Highlight of trip!. In the brief window it wasn't overcast and rainy we hired biked and made our way to the park which was lovely to just cycle round and grab a coffee at one of the many little cafés in the park. Really close to the Van Gogh museum and it's very quick to make your way back into town on the bike paths

Wonder park. Vondelpark stands for Wonder park and it truly is. There is nothing more charming than to go there for a picnic during the warm months of spring and summer. You have lots of people exercising (bootcamps, running, biking) and having food (BBQ or hot dogs) and it is just fun. Only downside.. it's so crowded.

Beautiful parc in great surroundings in Amsterdam.. I love the Vondelpark because of it's alternate places; sometimes it feels like Central Parc, on other parts it's like a small rural village you're looking at. It's being used by so many diffrent people (as a large cityparc should) and for so many purposes: cycling, jogging, relaxing, eating, resting, sitting on the parc benches, etc. In spring and summertime you can storks and green parakeets.....

So lovely.... Vondelpark is a must for any visitor to Amsterdam. We walked the length on our way to Blauw restaurant the evening of our anniversary recently. A beautiful Autumn evening, hand in hand with ones loved one - Autumn leaves falling, perfect.

A nice park in middle of town. Lot of lush green and lakes, in the middle of town, lot people walking, sprinting, playing, or just sleeping. But you can find your own space. ProIt well keptthe "I amsterdam " logo is here too....
Too busy. It's a nice enough park but me being an Amsterdam resident I know there are better parks around. That said, for tourists it's must visit aspecially in the summer
Hemelrijk. Wonderful park in the heart of the city To jog, do some yoga,chill, picnic, play guitarread, kiss on a bench...
Lose your senses. Get a bike and have the ride of your life, or just wonder around. Great park to chill. Go there if you visit Amsterdam. During summer time it's gorgeous!

What a beautiful place to visit. Keep your eye open for the oldest indoor horse riding arena and training center still i. Had a fantastic time walking the park with my family. So clean and neat with everything very well tended. We discovered a hidden gem and my daughter had the chance to ride a horse in Amsterdam, a huge highlight for her.
only for summer and spring!. Although i was there at winter time, the park is still great to walk in, in the summer and spring its the best place to chill in amsterdam

Great park, but watch out for the bikes!. I went to the park one early morning for a jog. SP did loads and loads of locals, on their bikes on the way to work and schools. They clearly are used to biking around at very high speed, so watch out. Particularly if you have small children wandering about. The park in itself is wonderful!

Nice stroll to clear your mind. A pleasant park, very lively in the summer. There are two tea-houses you can have lunch at, or a drink.
Be sure to walk off the cycle path, there are many cyclists, as this is an important cycling route.

Great park for walks, runs, picknicks and BBQ. The park stretches from the city centre rounded by canals to the Amstelveenseweg at Amsterdam-Zuid. You can easily take an hours walk or run for 5 k round the park. There are specific spots where you are allowed to BBQ on stones, two large children play area's, one with an open toddler pool, the other one connected to a self service restaurant where you can eat lovely pancakes or "poffertjes". There are another two restaurants, one inside the Filmmuseum on the north-west side of the park. There is a lovely rose garden hidden in a maze as well. So plenty of possibilities to spend a lovely afternoon. No scooters are allowed in the park, but take care of all the bikers though, as they bike you of your feet if you dare to walk on the bike paths!

Chill and relax after a busy day sightseeing. After a hectic time sightseeing this is a great place to sit back relax and take time out, to just enjoy the rest and relaxation period you can have by just sitting on the ground and chilling.

I love this park. Amazing sprawling park in the centre of Amsterdam. Many events and vendors especially in the summer. Multiple ponds and wildlife make this a must visit location for friends looking for a chill or couples on a walk and everything in between!
Lazy Sunday. Perfect location for a Sunday stroll, enjoy the quant location of this hip and happening spot.. :) All walks of life can be found relaxing, picknicking on the grass..
Bikers paradies. Wonderfull place in town. When you have time to relaxe you have to visit this place!! Southwest from the parc there are some good restaurants, shops and so on.

Cyclists Rule Here?. Quiet green space in a big city, re-developed to be used by ALL?Where cyclists 'rule' or seem to,using it as a cyclist 'rat run'?'Temporary' public art work is displayed at various points, in the park such as the 'Findfence'?(See Photo Attached)Where people can leave, read, reply to notes on the fence, while watching their backs?
Think Central Park meets Amsterdam. Took a great walk there and let the kids play at the playground. Lots of people riding bikes, jogging, eating on terraces, and enjoying a beautiful afternoon

beautiful place!. we rented biked to bike round the park, was such a lovely, beautiful place, we took lots of pictures! lots of other people about which was nice to see and very clean park, we went to the restaurant in the centre for lunch, was lovely to be able to sit outside and watch other dog walkers, runners, tourist go by.

Beautiful. Definitely worth a visit. We biked through the beautiful park. Had a tasty cappuccino in the delightful restaurant and then walked around the children's themed areas. Really quite a lovely visit.
Worth visiting!. The park is such a lovely place, especially if the sun is out. You can relax at one of the cafés, but also you can admire the beauty of nature by taking a walk through this big park!

Cool place to chill out. I've been told to visit the park prior to my visit to Amsterdam, but I had no idea that it was so big! Lots of grass, lakes, very good to walk around, chill out with friends, especially if you consumed some of the goods only sold legally in the Netherlands - you know what I mean. Anyway, it's a very good place to visit, at any time of the day. If you're used to warmer places, like me, you may find the park a bit cool, but bring a coat and you'll be alright. And I'm not sure if it's possible to ride a bike in the park, but if it is, try to go around the whole park, it's quite calm compared to the streets of Amsterdam, crowded with bicycles. A must-see place!
Well worth a visit. An urban park in the middle of a busy city, well worth a visit just to sit and relax to recharge your batteries in between museums!

Oasis of calm, fewer bikes. Vondelpark is similar in ambiance to St James's Park in London with wide tarmac stretches and lakes, one with a lovely fountain. The difference is that the wide tarmac strtches are for bikes and joggers, pedestrians walk on a gravel path alongside. There is plenty to see in the park, the bird-life ranges from parakeets to herons and there are benches on which to rest. A lovely place to stroll and relax.
Beautiful park. Well worth a visit, especially in the sunshine! The water (ponds and water features) and greenery in this park are truly stunning.

Lovely park. We went for a walk in Vondelpark - great clean park with lots of space for our toddler daughter to run around. It is also centrally located so easy to get to. It is also a few minutes' walk from the Rijksmuseum.
Favours cyclists like everywhere in amsterdam. Great for jogging. Some good cafes but too many cyclists. Lots of water features, walking paths uneven cycle track smooth
A beautiful, local park. This is a park filled with locals, not tourists! It is lovely park with meandering paths and lovely ponds.

Centrally located green space.. Vondelpark is a nice park, but not my personal favorite. Personally, Westerpark is a much better place to relax, with more open space, a few nice places to enjoy lunch or a drink. The bike paths are more interesting, and the vibe is much more relaxed and family / kid friendly, compared to Vondelpark. If you are a tourist, and it's possible to make your way there, you can walk along Haarlemmerdijk (from direction Grand Central, area Jordaan), and see the many interesting shops along your way. I've seen some strange / creepy characters around Vondelpark .....

Lovley Afternnon. Rent a bike, collect a pic nic and slow down. This park is a great place to recoup after touring Amsterdam. It’s very central and easy to find, there are plenty of places to sit and relax. The park is well used by locals and very well kept.
Nice park. Nice park with a few drink and eat places, little ponds and mini rivers passing through. People jog, sit around and cycle.
lovely place. lovely place just the darn bike hurtling through like an express way. they really dont give a hoot if it is a park

Nice park if you have time, not a must to visit... Wonderful park and if you are walking around Amsterdam or want a place to slow down away from the canals this park is perfect. We knew about it and stumbled over it. Nice break, walked around, had a snack and decided to go shopping (close to shopping area). Would not go out of my way to visit but if you have time, want to take a break or just like a nice park.....it is worth it.
Great cycling park.. Such a well lit park so biking at night is fun. Beautiful park in the day too. There are restaurants, and beautiful small lakes to sit in the sun by.

Vondelpark - Green tranquility. I was in Amsterdam with my girlfriend, it was my birthday so she made a surprise, took me to Vondelpark for a pick-nick such tranquility , so much green, a must if you'd like to disconnect from the city center, very very recommended for you - the tourist. just go biking, take a walk or do like me, sit on the grass, east cheese and drink white whine.

Huge open space, fresh air…and the ever present cyclists!. We visited this huge, beautiful park twice during our four day stay in Amsterdam. During both of our visits, we spent time sitting on park benches, just taking a rest from our busy tourist activities, in a relatively tranquil and attractive environment.It was good to be away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city streets. However there was a continuous flow through the park of cyclists, who are so abundant and common in this city.There are several large lakes located within the park and they are homes to a large variety of bird life. The lakes are a positive addition to the ambience of the park.The weather was hot on each day of our visits to the park and there were plenty of large trees to provide shade from the heat of the sun. Near the main entrance at one end of the park, we found a water tap which provided the public with cold, refreshing drinking water.If you happen to be visiting Amsterdam and you feel the need to escape from the frenzied activities of the central city then you could, as we did, head to the Vondelpark for some time out, to rest and recharge your batteries.
Peaceful city centre park. Beautiful park right in the city centre. Well used by locals and tourists, and a nice escape from the hustle and bustle elsewhere.
Excellent in Autumn. We have strolled through the Park before so this time it was good to go in Autumn and experience the different colourings. A must visit park if you are in Amsterdam.
relaxing and peaceful. wonderful view of fall colours. walkable distance from the museums. good place to sit and relax. lots of birds in the water bodies

Nice romantic spot. We stayed a night in a hotel just next to the park. We took a walk right from our hotel room. It was a very pleasant way to slow down after a somewhat stressful travel day. Pack a lunch, ride your bike or just take a lazy stroll and get lost in this large, beautiful park.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park. We went in Autumn so there were so many shades of red and green to captivate the senses. Well worth a visit.
Green and Lovely. A beautiful park and a nice way to escape the crowds. Keep an eye out for the many birds, especially the flock of feral green Conyers(like smallish parrots).
Vondelpark Amsterdam. A lovely park that has a relaxing feel to it. Just watch out for the cyclists. Small lakes situated around the park. An idea place to escape the busy streets.

Relax. Nuve, quiet park. Several types of birds (not only usual ducks).Several "street" musicians playing on very strange..eh...devices? People strolling in bicycles and jogging, local people barbecueing. Nice place to relax.
Beautiful park!. Great walk or bike through a beautiful park so close to many restaurants as well. There is a beautiful restaurant in the park.
Average park. Very good for runners/cyclists or just going for a stroll, you have to pay to use the toilets and food is a bit expensive.
Very pleasant walk in the sunshine. Very pleasant walk in the park, the weather was lovely and warm, close to to museums and bars, very peaceful.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park to relax at and enjoy the day. Also great for a bike ride, not as busy as the city can be.

A Lovely Respite. In the middle of the afternoon after walking through many parts of Amsterdam, it was thoroughly relaxing and enjoyable to sit down and enjoy the beautiful Vondelpark! Although it was a Saturday and there were many people also enjoying the surroundings, we were able to have a nice, quiet visit and leisurely stroll after our rest.

A day in the park. We hopped off the bus to spend some time in this beautiful park. It was a crisp sunny day and many people were out enjoying the green spaces. There were ponds and paths going around the park and there was plenty of space for bikes and walkers. We ate lunch at the restaurant in the park and the food was good, but atmosphere was even better. We felt like natives. Loved it.
Pleasant park. This park is a pleasant green area in the heart of Amsterdam and really nice for walking. It's a beatiful place to have a rest for afternoon with enjoying the sunshine.

Great Park in the city. We had set aside only one hour to walk through this amazing park. We could have spent many hours wandering through the paths and gardens, buildings and restaurants but instead we had a beer and chips at one of the outdoor restaurants and did some serious people-watching.
beautiful park. this is a large green space in the heart of Amsterdam and lovely for walking. A great place to spend a pleasant afternoon enjoying the sunshine.

Good Park. We visited Vondel park on a lovely sunny Sunday afternoon and the place was full of people lazing around and enjoying the weather. Must admit we did not realise how large this park was complete with the open air theatre, café and tearoom. We spent much longer in the park than we anticipated and didn't manage to visit the other attractions we planned for that day. We enjoyed people watching - it's amazing how entertaining people are just going about their normal business! Worth a visit from the hustle-bustle of the city centre, follow the signs for the museum quarter to find Vondel park.
Good place to hang out and eat. Good place to enjoy a picnic. We bought some sandwiches and sat down at a restaurant in the middle of the park to have a beer and people watch. Be aware of bicyclists

Very pretty. Vondelpark is about a ten - fifteen minute walk from Museumsplein so it's definitely worth a wander if you've been visiting the museums and it's a nice day. It's clean and a nice way to spend some time to get away from the bustle of the city.

A bike ride through heaven. Most of us know Amsterdam for its thrills but Vondelpark shows you another side of Amsterdam which is not mentioned as much as i would like. It shows the innocent side of the city with kids playing, families enjoying picnics and fitness geeks running.I took a bike ride where we just rode through the huge park. I have seen my share of parks and Vondelpark is as good as any. What differentiated this park is the change it offered from the red light district and dam square. It was almost like we entered an different era and a different city. Must visit if you visit Amsterdam.
Great park. Great place to relax with kids! Liked seeing the parakeets all over the place! Flat paths nice and wide for cycling, or with kids scooter.

There's more to Amsterdam than canals!. Vondelpark is just wonderful. It has over 10 million visitors annually yet it still feels like it's just yours. 9 out of every 10 people who live in Amsterdam visit the park at least once every year. There are several really cool cafes inside (our favourite being the Blue Teahouse) It's a cycle mega highway - at the weekend, the vast range of people on bikes is just amazing. Walkers have their own paths to the side so are safe from the bike traffic. My guidebook said that open air sex was permitted provided it was hidden away in thye undergrowth. Didn't see any of that although not sure I'd want to! I have to confess, I'm more into bird spotting - and there are plenty of them!
Great place to go. Great place to go! Sit and watch the park, the people. Easy to get by train! Close to others atrations. ;)
Lovely park. Lovely sleepy afternoon - bring a waterproof blanket though - the water tableis high and slight spongy grass.
Very godo place. It is a Very good place to do a pic nic, or only to see people around. Everything is calm and quiet.
Best place on earth. Vondelpark completely exceeded our expectations, everyone coming to Amsterdam has to experience vondelpark!

Beautiful park . Just walking through here was lovely. Be very careful of the amount of bikes and joggers too!was not too sure of all the various entrances etc more information boards would be helpful
Lovely city park. This is a lovely city park near the museum district. We were there from 5:30 until 7:30. Got to see the local bicycle rush hour from a park bench. Fascinating to watch.

Lovely park. Never been to such a lovely big park.did not walk through the whole part but was lovely and clean. .not far from Amsterdam center.when hot the park is packed and full of families it's lovely

Pretty park.. We spent our last day in Amsterdam walking through this huge park. It is a good break from the busyness of the city. The lakes are good for bird watching. The tall gray herons will walk right up to you. I've never seen herons take food from humans but these will.

Peacefull. The vondel park is an amazing escape from the city.
Well amsterdam is a calm city anyway but still its a beautiful place to walk, relax, have a picnic, riding your bicycles.
Beautiful park. Excellent place to just walk or ride a bike. Beautiful views and pictures are on the way. Be sure to go there. By bike would be better for the park is really big.

Well, it's a park. It's green and spacious and you can sit on the grass or a bench or pretty much anywhere you like and relax. There are people walking and running and cycling and sitting, depending where you go there's singing, music played, smoking, places to eat etc. All that you would expect from a regular park. And it's free. I think it's safe, too but Dear Paul RenéI am writing to you regarding Louise Daly. I have known Louise personally for over 3 years, and have always known her to be an organized, responsible, and easy going individual. I believe that her skills and experience make her an excellent candidate for a councillor, which is what she would like to progress her career as. I trust that Louise would be very good at such role as she is very helpful, understanding and inspiring. She can always look at a problem from different angles and suggest what can be done about it or how to approach it. Louise is also absolutely trustworthy and as she is a good listener I never hesitate to confide in her as I know that she will be discreet about what I say.When I met Louise, she had just left a busy position of customer service consultant in a call centre, where she was responsible for answering phones and responding to customers complaints and also finding best solutions for them. Being a people person that she is it was a job that Louise was very successful at and always received excellent feedback from her customers. We later worked together when Louise became an Client Services Manager and she continued thriving in this role. She is very organised and as a great Client Services Manager she understands clients and shows empathy and always receives excellent happiness scores from them.During the time I have known her, Louise has been active in local community, being involved in RMDS. Her contributions included organizing and acting in multiple shows that I always enjoyed seeing. Louise has also performed for charity events. Louise is always very supportive to me and her other friends. She is very sociable and has lots of friends that she always finds time for. She supports everyone in their hobbies and passions and while doing that finds herself in different social situation where she always feels comfortable and is ready to make new acquaintances. It was a pleasure and fun to meet Louise’s family and friends on a few occasions; when she celebrated her birthday and also when she invited me to spend Christmas with her family. They are absolutely lovely and immediately made haven't had a chance or need to visit at night
Awesome Green Space. This is a cool green space in the heart of the city. We rented bikes and cruised through the park like locals. I recommend this to anyone visiting the city.

An amazing park!. I spent there Sunday morning and what a morning it was! Crowds of runners, cyclists, trainers and the teams having training on the grass, daddies running with strollers. I had just some rest reading with a beautiful lake view and had really great time there.

Local chill out. Vondelpark is definitely one of the hot spots among locals. Everyone takes their family or friends, picnic bag and cycles over if it happens to be a sunny afternoon. Love the spot near the small lake where you can find few fountains and a tree over the water.
Relaxing. Loved this park. Went in Fall season and the colours of the trees were beautiful. A great place to relax and take photos.

Beautiful . An amazing park and so busy. Have never been to central park in New York but this is how I imagine it to be. Busy with people do many things from yoga to playing the piano. Also lots of art work and wildlife to spot.Beware if you hear sirens jump out the way quick they don't slow down.

A great place to unwind relax and smoke a joint. I really love the Vondelpark to go and unwind and ride the bikes and get out when the sun's out you can smoke pot in the park and nobody cares just great places to eat all around it and you're near Bij, a great coffee shop.

Just another park. My wife and I visited Vondelpark on a recent trip to Amsterdam. It was nice, but nothing out of this world. Just seemed like another park in a large city. Central park in New York city is much more impressive.

Vondelpark. Actually visited Vondelpark in June 14,serviced by trams & buses alike, weather was very good & most people were having BBQs & picnics and either a glass or 2 wine/beer, all in all very civilised...

Great park for a run. Right near the museums, this is a huge park which is great for an early morning stroll or jog. Lots of people walking, biking, and strolling around. Very safe but just watch out for the many bikers.

Great park for all, but watch out for the bikes. Lovely park , great playground for the kids. Bikes are allowed here, so as anywhere in Amsterdam, watch out for the bikes. There were at least two cafes here, one near the entrance and one further in, the second one was better. We enjoyed a peaceful sunny day there.

Truffles, Bike Rides & Beautiful Scenary. The park contains so much natural beauty, there's so much to marvel at & lots of places to sit down to take it all in.We had our first magic truffles experience which was crazy but Vondel was the perfect location, we felt so in touch with our surroundings, it was a journey through our minds as we watched the water & listened to the chirping birds. The park was very neat with hardly any litter, but the porta-potties really let it down, they were DIRE. The smell was gut wrenching, we called it quits & used the on site restaurants toilet for a 50 cent charge which was totally worth it. We went back to the park the next day, this time on hired bikes & completely sober. It was breathtaking. Thank you for such a great experience Vondel, you're a gem x

Nice city park. I had some time to waste before my overnight train. Glad i came here. It was nice to get away from the city crowd and just people watch for a while. It is the city of bicycles, on full display here. Nice beer garden near the entrance to unwind, have a brew and something to eat.
A nice stroll. We walked through this large park twice. Since we are birders, the chance to see nature in the city was great. The colony of rose ringed parakeets were especially amazing.

Beautiful green oasis near the Rijksmuseum. Vondelpark is a beautiful park just a short distance away from the Museumplein area of Amsterdam. There are numerous walkways, bridges and fountains, as well as excellent cafe called the Blue Teahouse built in the Art Deco style. A great place to relax and reflect after enjoying the treasures and riches of the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum and the Stedelijk Modern Art Gallery,
fantastic park. beautiful park especially in the summer when we visited in august 2013! nice to have a picnic and relax. everyone was very welcoming

Best attraction in Amsterdam. For bike riders and hike lovers I think Vondelpark is the best place to be in. Peaceful and natural. You can go at anytime you want. With tram you can use Museumplein station and 5 mins by walk after that.

Nice place to take a walk.. This well kept, well laid out park on the outskirt of Amsterdam centre is about a 10 minute tram ride from the central station and is a great place to take a walk away from the hustle and bustle of the central areas. Just an all round nice place to spend an hour or so.

Sunday Market fun. A lovely little place to chill, get some food, and drinks, and then walk around and get lovely pics. We visited when the market was on so we got to try nice food. The museums are close by so you can take your pick. It did start raining lightly, but that didnt deter us.

A place to Unwind. This was a very relaxing and tranquil experience. We went on a Saturday and the park was filled with a very bright and lively energy. This was truly a sight to see as there are so many people out and about that is wonderful. Every so often you could catch random sports or other activities in the park. There are bicycle paths as well as walking paths. You will find many people sitting in the grass or on the benches in many of the wonderful attractions.

Active yet pastoral park close to most attractions. Vondelpark is the most vibrant park (per square park) I have ever been in. It is continually filled with people of all types doing all sorts of park-like things: meditation; cycling; running; kick-boxing; picnicking; canoodling; eating; sleeping; tai chi; playing soccer. And there is plenty of wildlife (birds mostly). But the most remarkable part is the neighboring houses that overlook, but never intrude, on this slice of heaven

Green, busy, too much to see. Buy some food nearby, there are too many good places around to recommend you one! Sit down in the grass and enjoy the people watching. Literally every type of person comes by. Stay away if you don't like crowds! It's always crowded and no traffic rules apply!
Nice visit. It was very nice, I was there in very good weather. Lot of people there, I was there on a bike. saw the birds and the trees.
The Central Park of Amsterdam. Beautiful serene setting, an oasis in Amsterdam! Ride your bike or walk around this stunning park. Worth a trip!

Lovely on a summer days. Had a lovely stroll here with some of the locals during the summer. The weather was beautiful so the park was very busy. Lots of cyclists, walkers and people jogging. Lots of people walkign their dogs too. The park itself is really quite beautiful. It felt a little small but then I didn't explore the whole park. There were a couple of decent looking places to eat (nothing fancy..just standard hot dogs / donut stands etc) within the park and plenty of places to sit. Like anywhere in Amsterdam, look out for cyclists or as one of the tour guides said on a walking tour "cycopaths" haha. The surrounding neighbourhood is quite lovely as well and it is situated quite locse to all the main museums.

Beautiful views. We had a walk around Vondelpark and found it very beautiful. Saw lots of interesting animals around the park and the vibe everywhere was just so friendly and chilled. Would have stayed longer if we had time! Only down side - some very small litter around and could do with a few pop-up coffee shops etc.

A favorite place to go, located off Stadhouderskade between Leidseplein and the Museums. Beautiful, park with paved and dirt trails. Lots of bicycle riders, skateboarders and joggers. Lovely place to stroll.
Great place inside the city. Impressive park inside the city. You can rent a bike and ride to Vondelpark. You can find relaxing heaven there. We loved it very much.

Not very relaxing. This may just be my experience, but I was expecting something like St James' Park or Hyde Park in London and it was nothing like that. The park really only contained cyclists that seemed to just be passing through. If you're looking for an escape from the city feel, I didn't find it here. I will say though there was a lot of wildlife such as ducks,herons, etc.

Great place to walk, bike or picnic. Vondelpark is a great place to bike, walk or picnic if the weather is good. Although you could walk and bike almost anytime of the year. The environment is quiet and relaxing with a wide variety of people using the facilities. Also the surrounding neighborhood is fun to explore.
Must See!. Very beautiful! It's a nice place to spend the day laying out after visiting the truffle shop. I would also recommend renting a bike to bike around the park.

vondel park. I visited the Park on a Sunday.There were plenty of people biking,walking,and enjoying the sunny day.Also visited the next day with a Yellow Bikes city tour and found not very many people which made it easier to get around and view the surroundings.The park well laid out, near the city centre for locals and tourists to enjoy..

interesting place to visit. came here one evening to take some rest after several hours of walking around in the city. It was full of crowds of young people enjoying themselves. Most of them were doing bbq's and it was a very pleasant surprise as in Uk you arent allowed to do it in public parks.Overall the place was beautiful and energetic quite a contrary to a typical park

Lovely urban park to take a morning stroll.... The majestic trees are filled with an array of birds and birdsongs. It's just the perfect place to spend a morning walking. The playgrounds are filled with moms and their children, locals biking and walking. The park is a safe place to rent a bike and explore the park. No cars! Stop and have hot chocolate at the Het Groot Melkhuis...great spot to people watch!
Go to Vondelpark when in Amsterdam. Beautiful park in Amsterdam... my husband and I rented bikes and rode around the park... It was a lovely afternoon activity on a day that wasn't rainy.

An oasis of peace and nature in beautiful Amsterdam!. I love going back to Amsterdam again and again. The people are beautiful and open-minded. The city has character and plenty of history. It is so elegant and clean. Best discovered by foot. Whenever I go, I make sure I visit Vondelpark every single day. I can walk or hop on the (so convivial) tramway. Once there, nature is everywhere and it's fun to watch and listen to all sorts of ducks, geese and the like…Those noisy green parrots are everywhere… A a stork family (the nesting area is protected but for all to see)… Another fun activity is watching Amsterdam residents walking their aristocratic-looking dogs. Also, I enjoy the flow of bicycles crossing the park in both directions: students going to or coming back from school, fathers and mothers taking their little ones to (or back from) daycare or kindergarden in elegant two-wheeled vehicles, older cyclists too, and some tourists paddling in groups…

Beautiful, los and never-ending. I visited twice durning my time in Amsterdam because I just couldn't stay away. I highly recommend hiring bikes (we hired then from a place near the Olde Kerk and rode up to the park (about twenty minutes) but I'm sure there are closer hire shops).
fairytale. A huge park with beautiful scenes of nature and people walking, jogging or biking (go biking if you can!). I fell in love with the greenery, lakes and silly little ducks

Amsterdam's grand park. Beautiful park that has lots of different spaces, a great amount of open space, streams and fountains, and lots of people relaxing, playing with their dogs, and enjoying the space. It was a beautiful sunny day, so that helped. I'd probably avoid at night. Great family spot!
Lovely park. Nice place to chill on a warm summer day. Just take a nice slow walk around the park or have a rest and people watch.
Perfect . A beautiful sunny day and a picnic from the Albert Cuyp market. Such a beautiful Park, perfect for people watching and meeting new people. We even made a friend in Local wild life.
Lovely for a daytime stroll. Our hotel was located near Vondelpark and it is a really lovely area. It seemed a little sketchy at night, but maybe i was just paranoid.

A sample of each and every type of human beings in the same place. Every time I go to Amsterdam I try to have a beautiful&peaceful day at Vondelpark. This place, I think, displays what this city is all about: democracy of styles, races, colors, genre and so on. You would notice that you can see a bit of everything there, embraced by some of the most beautiful trees that you can put your eyes on.This walk is mandatory for first timers, for sure.

Great chill-out place!. If there is any ray of sun, it suddenly fills up with people. Music, sports, dancing, sunbathing, barbecue, relaxing.... you can do anything! In the summer there are events practically every weekend. Not to miss!

Nice running routes and scenic routes. I stayed behind this park and loved walking through it everyday. Lovely running/walking routes. so nice seeing people walking and playing with their dogs and kids and just enjoying life
Stop and relax. Lovely park! Great place to take the kids. Watch out for the bikes, though.They speed through at times.

Amsterdam's version of Central Park. You will love the liveliness in the Vondelpark. Music, sports, leisure, food and terraces are all around you. The atmosphere is very relaxed and laid back. Locals treat the Vondelpark as their back yard. You will find them inviting friends for a BBQ on one of the grass fields.

Wonderful place to walk off your jet lag!. BIG park in middle of the city. About a 20 min walk from Amsterdam Centraal train station (without luggage), but you can get closer via another station. close to high-end shopping district, Casino and major restaurants and Museums.

Gigantic, beautiful open space. Me and my friends visited this park as a must as we heard so much good reviews so we went out of our way to find this place. It was amazing we loved the stroll in the park and we really enjoyed taking pictures there this park is a must go it is enormous and beautiful. A lovely day out. Theres lots of people riding bikes and skating we really wished that we had hired a bike and rode the bikes in the park it really would have been so much fun.

Beautiful Space. We stayed at a hostel nearby and walked through Vondelpark everyday. If the weather permits I recommend grabbing a croissant and a coffee for breakfast and sitting in the park. A perfect start to a day in Amsterdam. As always in Amsterdam, watch out for cyclists!
A Slice of Amsterdam. Lovely paths through a well laid out beautiful park...restaurants, dogs, joggers, bikers, walkers....lovely.
A park. Nice enough. Weather was rainy when we were there. Basically a park. Not much else to add. Easy enough to see because it is close to museums etc.
Check it out on a nice day.. A relatively big park that leaves space for sport and relaxation. Near the museum district and not far from downtown.
If its free why not. Beautiful place to walk or run/ride a bike. Nice pond areas and greenery. Just off some lovely main roads too!

Feels like you are somewhere else and not in the busy city. After couple of hours spending in the otherwise great museums it really feels good to go to this parc where it seems that you are at the country. Take a byke and just drive around. It is great!

Green and somewhat pleasant. We used the park as a short cut between our hotel and the museums. Pleasant green area, mainly grass with some interesting trees. In the central area the cycle track is great if you travel by bike. However the footpaths were muddy and wet when we visited in late September. No flowers in the area we saw. Watch out for dog mess.
Fun. The park has something for everyone and lots of people watching. I found the bikes to be a little intimidating though.

Stunning park. Went on a three hour bike tour of thiis City and went through this famous park. Very large space and very well maintained although they were doing a lot of work in some areas. Lots of ponds, wildlife and on a nice sunny day great to take a picnic and walk the dog, cycle or relax with a book
Awful pretty even on a cloudy day. Mostly took a break from museums by walking through the park. Wound up eating lunch in one of the cafes in the park, which was delicious. Just a nice break.
Getting off the busy streets of Amsterdam. We rented bikes and rode through Vondelpark. It is a much less congested bike ride. You can rent bikes close to the museums and ride to the park

A place to have a restful break. A nice restful area in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam.
There are pleasant cafes within the park.

A Perfect Park. We walked through this park on a beautiful sunny afternoon. people were out enjoying this glorious weather. The park is well maintained with lawns, path ways. People were riding bikes, running and just walking taking in the day. Seats were placed along the paths so one could just sit and watch the world go by.

Great for a walk. Park seem d quite massive, loads of water with bird life. Couple places to grab a drink or snack along the way.
Pros: Free, clean and location
Cons: 1000's of cyclist riding everywhere. No the paths, off the paths and on the grass.
Beautiful park. Beautiful and peaceful place. This park deserves at least a walk through to appreciate the beauty that is almost a hidden gem.

Garden In a Most Amazing city. For those of you who have been to Amsterdam know these Gardens. Its Iconic from the Jhon and Yoko legends and the Hippy times of past. For those who have not been here before, well do yourselves a favour after spending some days shopping in Amsterdam which is I must say Fantastic if not some what expensive for some items, there is a lot to choose from just search. This park offcourse is best at spring and now in Autum when there is a change in colours so cool and I mean Cool its quite cold now but bring a jacket and shawl and your fine, its worth the visit......
A must while in Amsterdam. A good stroll if you have the time. The overlooking cafe is a nice spot to relax after a walk in the park. Bring a book

Peaceful. I liked that there is so much room, people where laying down, other people were playing soccer, families were having picnics, people were having drinks. and no one got in anyones way. there could be a few more food and drink stands nearby though.
Peaceful park in the middle of Amsterdam. A huge, beautiful park - calm and peaceful island in all the business of a big city. I didn't have enough time to explore it this time.

Pleasant stroll. This park has many levels to it - you can see wildlife (many many birds), you can see bike riders, see dogs (or not), sit and eat, stroll, sit and read, watch the water, etc. This is a large park that offers a lot of space and many things to see throughout. Stunning piece of nature.

Spent a whole afternoon here, amazing!. We spent a whole afternoon here soaking up the sunshine. As we're from busy busy London we thought it was very different to Hyde Park, we loved that everyone was drinking or smoking or sunbathing all tight together by the pond, everyone was friendly and chatting away. Very european! If you're going to Amsterdam this is a must!

Lovely . Spent lots of time with my friends here in this absolutely wonderful park. Bring your own drinks and food and you are assured of a great time! There will be music, singing, dancing and mutual-minded friends to make! Because you're only there for 1 cause:
Pure relaxation.
Beautiful Park. If you want to enjoy a picnic this is the place. Nice park for biking,walking and people watching. Very vibrant area.

Chill in the park. Spent a Sunday afternoon with my wife strolling around this beautiful park. Lots of people out jogging, walking and spending time with their families. A beautiful way to spend a few hours and get away from the bustle of the city streets.

A large beautiful park.. We visited the park on a Sunday so there were lots of people cycling, walking and picnicing. It has great atmosphere and is large enough so that one never feels crowded. Lovely setting with lots of water features and birds and animals.

A lovely walk through nature. Vondelpark is a lovely natural park with lots of walking paths and room for cyclist as well as pedestrians. Do be careful though, as the Dutch cycle fast and it seems like it is up to the pedestrian to beware. Park is also widely used for jogging. There are beautiful old trees, waterways with ducks and other birdlife, plus squirrels . There are also several cafés and restaurants in the park.

Lovely park. This is a very nice size park. Made me think a little bit of Central Park in NY. Quite enjoyable. Only complaint was the signs at all the entrance's were messed up so you couldn't really look at a map to find things.

Love it!. I love this park. You will see people working out, running, trainning, biking at any given time. Great place to hangout with friends and chill. Perfect place for a picnic or a barbeque. There is a small restaurant/coffee shop in the middle of the park which is a nice place to relax.

Not Important. About 4km approx. South of Central Station & Nearby Museum Area so, if you want to go you can see it with expensive Museums & you can go by public transportation: MTR + Tramway + Bus or, walking = about 1hr during it you can see different or all another attractions.It is not attractive green area only + small lakes + i think, resturant + ...

Highlight of our trip!. Travelling with a toddler can sometimes be a pain... but Vondelpark was our saviour on most days. Situated 100 mtrs from our B&B , we visited the park everyday to enjoy nature and of course to let our toddler run free in the kids play areas. It doesn't end there, we adults enjoyed the scenic beauty all around too. Many a times we walked through the park instead of taking the tram to the museumplien. It definitely was the highlight of our Amsterdam trip.

Nice place for a stroll. We were walking back to our apartment after visiting the van Gogh Museum and saw the west entrance and decided to take a detour through the park. It is a really nice park and there is plenty of room for bikers, walkers and runners (not always the case in Amsterdam). We walked all the way to the west end of the park and took a tram home. There are tram routes running along both the north and south sides of the park. A really relaxing diversion that costs nothing. There are cafes and toilets available.

Amazing Park on the edge of the city. Our hotel was very close to this park. We decided to walk thru it on the way back from City center and ended up walking the entire park on a Sunny Friday evening. People all over the place with wine and snacks. Runners, bikers and walkers abound. Lots of people with their dogs.This is a great park for a nice morning or evening walk.
Cool place. . Nice chill park. Lot's of green space. People with dogs. We enjoyed it very much. Will definitely visit again before our time in Amsterdam is over.
A good place to stroll through. This is a terrific place to wander through, or have a picnic on the grass. There are plenty of grassy spots to rest and just enjoy the scenery.

Delightful green space in the city. Fantastic city park with lots to do for adults and children. In the heart of the city but huge and open. Go there for some play time or culture. The best of Amsterdam. Locals and visitors use the park all the time.

Peaceful for a stroll. Just down the street from my hotel this huge city park was great for a morning or post-dinner stroll. Watch out for cyclists powering to and from work. They are everywhere! The park has good walking paths and is leafy and green with ponds in the city. It's not a display garden with masses of flowers, but more like an arboretum. I was there In early autumn so it was lovely with early autumn colour. It seems quite safe because it's so busy.

Great place to relax in busy Amsterdam. We spent time in the park on a recent trip to Amsterdam. The park is used for exercise, group gatherings, barbecues and generally hanging out. It was clean with very well maintained paths. I ran a couple of times through the park and found it to be great for exercise. I would be worth a lazy afternoon if the weather is nice.
Nice park. Very nice. We had a lovely break here from doing the tourist stuff. Easy to reach if you are into walking or be brave and hire a bike but be warned the Dutch are not timid cyclists.
very beautiful park. it's a great, crean park, very big, perfect for chilling on the grass, reading etc, not very crowded, good for running, rollerblading
A stroll in the park. A pleasing area to stroll in; great for people watching with lots of seating. It has a calm atmosphere even when busy.

A Perfect City Park. Vondelpark reminded me of Central Park in NYC but much more relaxed. It was a beautiful day so we cut through the park on our way to the Rijksmuseum from our hotel. The citizens of Amsterdam really utilize the park for picnics, soaking up some sun and just relaxing with friends. I always enjoy people watching and this is a great place for a stroll and people watching.
A very nice walk. A reasonably big park, with lots of space to play and relax as well. A good place for jogging and biking as well.
beautiful park. We hired bikes for our weekend stay and cycled around the park, visiting the restaurant in the middle. Well worth a visit even just for wine & people watching.
Green in Amsterdam. This place is perfect to relax after 2 or 3 hours of museums or walk. With a bicycle I think it would be better.

Nice place to chill. Sat down for a few minutes to roll a cigarette and ended up sitting there for an hour or so people watching and having a drink in the sun, good for cycling and walking alike, this is where the locals seem to go also, which is always a good sign that it is a quality and large park

An oasis. We walked here through some interesting residential streets, after the Van Gogh and enjoyed walking on the many paths, around the lakes and flower gardens. Makes a welcome change from city streets, although you still have to be aware of bicycles.

Vondelpark - great for walking, bicycling, birding. This is an beautiful park to walk through. It was about 3 blocks from the rental apartment we had (Amsterdam City Apartments) - the Intermezzo Apartment.
Wonderful park. Couldn't quite believe the size of this park. Beautiful place for a stroll (watch out for cyclists and joggers though!) and was impressed with the cafe in the centre. Just lovely!

Don't miss this gem in Amsterdam. Vondel Park should be a must for any visitor to Amsterdam. It is similar in many ways to Central Park in New York but smaller. People out jogging, dog walking and generally going about their day.

Wonderful break from city doings.. After visiting the art works on the Museumplein, a stroll in this lovely park nearby is a wonderfully relaxing contrast. You can rent a bike and traverse the paths, but we preferred to just wander around for awhile, admiring its lushness.

Feel free to do whatever you want. Great park that lets you cycle, rollerblade, walk, run or just chill. Beautiful place with some cafes and places with food. You may see ducks in the different ponds and lots of people with dogs.
Great place to visit for only a little time or a couple of hours.

Lovely park. Excellent walk around the park...escape the madness of the city and find a quiet spot to chill out. hire a bike or stoll through the park. Very good for families, couples or even just yourself to clear your head from the night before. Highly recommended
Beautiful. Beautiful park about a 20 minute walk from Dam Square. Very scenic & peaceful..made even better by the guy selling cans of Amstel beer! Perfect for a hot sunny day in the park!

Nice atmosphere, beautiful city park. Lovely park for a walk, run or cycle. You can escape the city (not that you'd want to in Amsterdam) and enjoy the quiet, pretty open spaces there is also an open air theatre.

good to walk around. The park is nice to walk around as amsterdam has limited green space. There are lots of areas to sit on the grass, fountains, some cafes, playgrounds for the kids and plenty of walking tracks and roads for cyclists. There are some free toilets but they are the portable ones and by sunday afternoon they were filthy and nearly over flowing. Best to head to the paid toilets. Even though the park is nice there is still a lot of rubbish that has been thrown into the garden areas. I also find that amsterdam in general suffers from this even though they have cleanup crews on the streets most days. It would be a much better experience if people could dispose of their rubbish in the bins as there are plenty available.

Amazing bike ride!. Loved this place! We went there with our bikes, so peaceful and lovely! it has a lot of green spaces and little roads with people running and riding bikes. I really recommend visiting Vondelpark!
Quiet and peaceful place. Peaceful place to be, away from the hustle bustle. Best place to relax when you are tired from all the walking, all day long.
Best park in Amsterdam. Nice park, very busy but all the better for it. Cyclists, joggers, partying students, wildlife, it's all here !
Wonderful. One of the best places to relax when in Amsterdam.I always try to come here on sunny afternoons, just to absorb the calm and relaxed atmosphere :-)

Stop and have a break.. Nice breath of fresh air in the middle of the city. Must be wonderful to have a stroll (or a bike ride) during lunch hours. Might be tricky sometimes figuring out were you can walk without being run over by bicycles. There are a couple of lakes and flower gardens and also some food shacks.

Beautiful park with beautiful views and beautiful birds and people. in the City of Amsterdam, the Vondelpark is one of the many beautiful parks where everyone is welcome to come and relax. to take a walk. see the lakes and trees and grass and water fowl. many a place to take the weight off of your feet and have a bite or drink or both. nicer in spring and summer and fall but also in the winter especially if there is snow. for young and old. you can bike through it too. yes go there.

Nice place to escape busy Amsterdam. Vondelpark is a nice place to relax, and escape busy Amsterdam for a couple of hours. In summer you can have a nice bbq or picnick on the grass, as enjoyed by the locals

Niiiice!. If you want to chill with friends or have a romantic meal and just enjoy the weather (if you were lucky to see sun in Amsterdam) this is definitely your place! Lovely atmosphere, amazing views, nice restaurant... It's actually suitable for any kind of occasion, so just go and see yourself!

Great getaway without going anywhere.... The grounds are lush with trees and lakes and an active vibe in the summer and a beautiful snow covered wonderland in the colder months. I visit everytime I'm there. A place that centers you from the hustle and bustle of the city... A must

Beautiful. Just the best place for a saunter on a bright day. Walk, cycle, even swim to take in this beautiful park. But give it a full day and you'll leave chilled out. The beer garden at the south entrance is very good as well.
Do watch out for the bikes though.

Great to Walk Around. An expansive park with nice trails for bikes and pedestrians to wander and see a bit of nature as well as some nice architecture through the trees.
Also good if you want to see planes coming in for a landing at the airport.
best Park. Beuatiful park to make a pic nic or see people interesting. Have fun with the best garden, ludic arts inside the park. People with dogs, girls with boyfriends and good people.
nice park. good park to hang out on a sunny day. its very big so it will be good for a healthy morning run as well.

We had a great bike ride here!. You can walk or bike through this lovely park, which is nearly empty on a rainy day but crowded with people on a lovely day. Clearly the populace of Amsterdam enjoy being in the sun.
Good park to kill time. Good but not as good as english garden Munich or tiergaten Berlin. Good for cycling or walking. Can have a rest too.

A beautiful park in a beautiful city.. This is a great place to visit, especially on a nice day. The park is kept outstandingly clean with lots of wildlife, I even saw a pelican by a pond. There is a park here for children and also a few mobile vans and restaurants to buy food and drink.
Must see. A must-see place when in Amsterdam. There´s a very close and very comfortable hostel at one of its exits. Excellent location and easy of access.

It's huge!. We walked around this park in glorious sunshine on one day, and cycled in torrential rain on another day. Both days were fun, and allowed us to relax in the relative peace of the park. We were not anticipating the size. I loved all the little parks, and the fact the paths went in lots of different directions and you never really went the same way twice,
One of the Best Parks. A wonderful park for a walk, bike ride, or lunch, or even just to sit with a glass of wine and people watch.

relaxed place to be. arrived in Amsterdam, great weather for September, bottle of wine , 4 different types of cheese and crackers and grapes, enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere of the park where people just chill!

Park. Brilliant. A lovely beautiful large park. Easy too walk around with plenty of cafes and play areas for children of all ages. If on a bike wonderful tracks to follow. Beautifully kept with some surprising fountains dotted around. Worth a visit on a dry day.

Flowers and pleasant trails for walking and running. Beautiful park for families, leasure and exercise. This park small enough for a nice walk or run, but also big and interesting enough to return to for a visit or perhaps a picnic. It has ponds, fields of grass, lots of planted flowers (tulips!) and trees, trails for walking, running and biking.
Beautiful . Beautiful, relaxing and lively ! Next time, will ride a bike there. This reflects the relaxing atmosphere of Amsterdam
Green strip Amsterdam inner city. Great place for a relaxing stroll in nature, or just park on a bench and watch the locals. Lots of open space and water.
Lovely park. Lovely scenery thoroughly enjoyed the walk saw loads of birds and there is a lovely cafe in the middle - all well worth a visit

A great walk at the end of a long day. This park is close to the Marriott Hotel where we stayed. It is a great place to visit for a stroll at the end of a long day of sightseeing. There is a cafe at the Pavilion on the grounds so if you are looking for a place to eat on a fine summer's evening consider this as a place to go away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam traffic.

Beautiful Park. I was lucky enough to be staying in a hotel near this park during my last visit to Amsterdam, it is wonderful. the park itself is so big it would take the best part of a day to do a full loop of it. There are lots of little paths and twist and turns so make sure you know which way you are headings.The park itself was safe and when visiting in the day there was lots of police presence which was nice. if you are in the city and need a break from the fast pace go and check it out.
Great park for bicycles. Good cycling routes in the park, and free music at the open air theatre made this a wonderful experience!
