A bucolic oasis. What a beautiful park, it is huge, Amsterdam is a city rather silent, and the park is even more. Lie flat on the grass, reading a good book, are common activities in many parks, but here they taste different, better. If I lived in Amsterdam I would go there every day.

Gorgeous.. A must stop while in Amsterdam, absolutely beautiful park and a nice place to stop, sit and rest your feet, have a drink or a snack and take in the beautiful scenery around you. Very relaxed.
Deep Relaxation. One day in Amsterdam, I was alone and got lost without any GPS and map .After a few hours I reached this place and got a deep relax and then asked someone to find my way.
Didn't find much to do. Didn't find much to do. The park has just one map at the entrance. But other areas lack any sort of direction.

Great park!. We spent a day going around to three different parks in Amsterdam, and Vondel Park was by far my favourite. Very large, lots of area to walk around. Spots available to stop and have a coffee or a drink.

Where is the Entertainment. Our Amsterdam guide book told us that there would be entertainment in the park on a Sunday. We couldn't find it. But it was full of young people relaxing, and the occasional old man 'perving.

Be Dutch, rent a bike and ride through the park!. This is a lovely park. Rent a bicycle at any of the local establishments, typically three hours or 24. We rented for three hours (less than 10 euros each), rode aimlessly through the park and into the local neighborhoods for two hours, then Googled our way back. So much fun!

a Breath of Fresh Air in a Busy City. Vondelpark is a very large park located between Leidseplein and the Rijksmuseum. No matter what the day or time you can see people, walking, jogging, bike riding, playing ball, etc. but no Barbecuing...it's prohibited. Definitely worth a visit.

Picnic in the park. We went to the nearby food market and took a picnic with us to Vondelpark. The park is very large and one can cycle/walk through on the numerous crisscrossing pathways, or have a sedate picnic by the lake. We did both and it was an excellent afternoon
Nice serene park. It's a great place for a morning walk and bicycle ride.. Not much else.. It has a few statutes.. But overall it's a good not great park..
great to ride a bike through. rented a bike and after a fun ride through the city ended up in the park, good park lovely ride and good vibes all around

cycle through the park. Fantastic always love to cycle through Vondelpark whenever were in Amsterdam, sit around next to the water and watch the world go by, skaters dog walkers musicians in this park you will find it all
Peaceful place of heaven. Its your average park + add the love of people sitting on the grass and the cool bikers, skaters, rollerbladers, joggers add up to the nice view in front of an awesome lake.

Park Life. Visited this park as part of a bike tour of the city. Set in beautiful surroundings It is quite a large park. Although we visited on a damp day appears to be quite popular with tourists and locals and can imagine would be very busy on a sunny day. Definitely worth a visit if nearby.
Escape the city. A lovely way to spend an hour or more walking in the grounds. Sitting by the lake. Having a coffee in the cafe sitting in the terrace with lovely views.
Vondelpark. Very big park but hardly any flowers. Worth having a walk around it but if you are looking for lovely flowers you will be disappointed.
Take a rest after visiting Rijks. Nice promenade and good place to while away your time. But people from Paris would have definitely seen better gardens and promenades by the Seine

Vondelful . Lovely park and walks. Good cafes
Enjoyed the free jazz festival when we were there.
Easy to find. Difficult to leave.

Great place to get away- look out for events. This was a lovely surprise to find in the city. Walked from hotel, we were there the day all the colledges were having a barbaque so fiull of young people, great atmosphere, worth a visit.
Beautiful way to spend an afternoon. Really lovely way to spend an afternoon. Would highly recommend renting a bike and going for a ride around this beautiful park!

Fresh air and serenity. This place is always interesting to visit. The first time was in the Spring and it was awesome-people out and about, enjoying this marvellous spot. This time was in Autumn and although not as busy as before it was a delight to ride around. Make sure you hire a bike from rental places nearby as it is so much fun to explore. A couple of cafes within the park to enjoy and rest when needed.

Favorite park in Amsterdam!. Prettiest park Ive ever been to! Dogs off leashes, children playing, beautiful ponds with fun looking birds and a great area to ride bikes! Grab a sandwich and spend some time in the park. So fun!

MY favourite city, my favourite park. One of the best parks in Europe! Everything you want in summer, in the Dam, right here. My favourite park in my favourite city. While you are out of the city check out the local food/markets/coffeeshops. Remember there are Museums and plenty to see nearby so maybe book a night or two this side of town and save some cash. Amsterdam is great anytime of year!

Worth a visit in a sunny day! . We had a wonderful weather, so we spent a day at the park. It was really nice way to spend some time, felling like one of the local people. Take with you something nice to eat, something to drink and a nice book to read- and you have a great day!
One of the best in Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is big,peaceful and well maintained but incredibly popular so always packed with bikes,joggers and dog walkers.

Lively park in the middle of the city. A nice place to stroll among green fields and lakes in cloudy or rainy days and a lively picnic place in sunny days. No matter the weather, this park is an absolute highlight in Amsterdam.

Fantastic,fun, huge!. This is a great park, with lots to see and do - we arrived early to visit friends in Amsterdam, so with 3 children who had been in the car for 3 hours, we wanted somewhere for them to let off steam.We drove to the park and parked very near to one of the entrances - parking was pricey (unless I overpaid by mistake!) - about 15 Euro for the afternoon, but when you put that money up against the fact that it's such a great park, then it was good value!With our children (12,10, 5) , there were plenty of play areas, and things to see, and although it was a busy park there was plenty of room.There are a couple of cafes in the park, so it was nice to get a drink next to one of the play areas.Recommended way to spend a very pleasant few hours that feel like you are in the countryside, even though you are in the middle of a city!There was also a paddling area with some small water features - great way to ccol down, but make sure you bring a towel, and maybe a change of clothes for the kids!A lot of people on bikes on the main paths through the park so keep to the sides!All in all, highly recommended.
Good when the suns out. Need to go here if the weathers good. Get bikes and cycle around just taking it all in. It is really cool and loads is going on.

Amazing Park Right in the middle of the City. We visited Amsterdam in last week of May and loved the liveliness of this city. VondelPark is a beautifully designed park ,serene and quiet and still located right in the centre of the city. It was a place of solitude and peace.

Great escape within a city. Walking through Vondelpark you almost forget that you are in the middle of a rather large city. It is very peaceful and with the right weather is filled with people. Perfect place for a little picnic.
An oasis of silence in the middle of the city. Clean, quiet, well arranged - a good place to relax outside the city rush. Terraces are also good. The lakes is what I have enjoyed the most.
Nature in the middle of the city. Great quite place for a bike ride or a walk in nature in the middle of the city. Lots of green and trees.

Just OK. The park is convenient if you are in the area but it can be a bit scruffy and crowded. A nicer park not too far away (via bike or tram) is the Amstelpark just south of the Amsterdam RAI station (on s109 / Europaboulevard).
Beautiful park. Alot to see and experience, beautiful ponds everywhere, nice to go have picknics, bikerides and walks

Breath of fresh air (but look out for dog-poo)!. A great escape in the middle of a big city. Best experienced by hiring a bike, cycle through it and take an exit at random - you won't be disappointed.
Walking in Vondelpark. Wonderful walking park. Very relaxing. Lovely lakes. Places to eat. Locals walking their dogs. About 25 mins walk from central station.

A little bit creepy to be honest.. We went on a relatively gloomy, but not rainy, day to Vondelpark. It was around 4pm, and there were quite a few people around, which is to be expected in Amsterdam. For some reason the walking paths are made of packed dirt, so when it rains they turn to mud. In Amsterdam, it's constantly "sweating" so the trails were muddy in many places. There was trash in every nook and cranny, as well as teenagers and tourists in groups of 3 or 4 in the bushes smoking weed and/or drinking. I don't have a problem with either activity, but they also were blasting music and throwing beer cans on the ground. Very few flowers surprisingly. There were some herons, which were interesting. Overall, go if you want to see it, but I don't think it's essential viewing for an experience in Amsterdam.

freedom.`. the day before i left amsterdam to visit krugar park in south africa, this park was my friend and i refuge. it was raining yet we could careless. it was a true moment of au natural. of course, we were still in amsterdam. :)
Delightful stroll in the Vondelpark. Lovely park for my morning run. Great for walkers, joggers, strollers, doggies, etc. The park is well-maintained and - as always - the Dutch are the friendliest!

beautiful park a little tedious. I heard so many good things about the park and it was very lovely however once you've walked around a bit there isn't much more to do. We hired a bike and that was cool to zoom around finding the hidden places but the cafes were expensive and unless you take a picnic it can get rather repetitive
Beautiful park. This is a beautiful park with lots of people walking and bicycling through. It is near the museums and is a nice take to take a break. Would be a good place to jog, walk or bike.

A classic city park. I am an Amsterdammer and like many Amsterdammers I have a kind of love-hate relationship with the Vondelpark. In the last years the park has changed from an oasis of quietude and rest to a hyped-up place to be and dating ground for the young and supposedly beautiful. That is fine with me but it makes the park very, very busy on summer days. But the park has still a lot to offer to nature's friends and people looking for a bit of relaxation.There are beautiful old trees, long, winding lanes, a rose garden and classical statuary and buildings. Just visit it on a spring or autumn day to enjoy it to the full.

Gorgeous park in Amsterdam. This park is just beautiful, green and lush. The birds and wildlife will come right up to you. It wasn't crowded when I was there, but the park is huge so there is plenty of room to find a cozy spot for yourself to have some peace and privacy. It is a couple of blocks from the Rijksmuseum. Great place to grab lunch and have a picnic or ride your bike.
Beautiful park. AMAZING park, super big, but full of tourists all year around due to it is near the museumplein and leidesplein
Very beautiful place. Lots of green areas to walk, run, play, or simply lay down and enjoy a sunny day. Very pleasant experience.

Amazing park. This park is amazing. We were lucky in that the weather was particularly good during our stay in Amsterdam, but I think it'd be great to enjoy in all weathers. Peaceful but with enough people for a good atmosphere - great for picnicking and chilling out from the city. The open air theatre is brilliant - we saw an amazing concert, all for free! There's also a few restaurants and cafes that make spending a whole, relaxed day in the park completely possible.

Such a nice park. Vondelpark is very close to the Amsterdam Hilton where we stayed for six days. The park is great for lounging, walking, running, and biking, We loved strolling through this beautiful park and chatting with the locals. We planned on biking there our last couple of days, but the weather didn't cooperate. Vondelpark was the first place we visited in Amsterdam and also our last. We totally enjoyed our time there and could have hung out in this relaxing place every day.
Beautiful !. The park is a great for riding bikes and a spot of lunch by the water. Would definitely recommend on a sunny day.

A breath of fresh air. Vondelpark is a ginormous park where you can escape from the city life and enjoy some moments of peace surrounded by nature...If only I knew how to ride a bike the experience would have been much better as it is a bit hectic to explore it on foot, with a backpack! A must - see!
Enjoyable atmosphere . Went for the afternoon to find a coffee bar recommended to us but loved the whole area very bohemian. X

Nice day out. Lovely place to wonder around and relax. Easy to locate as it's sign posted right from the Station. Lots of little side routes to exit the park if you've had enough before you reach the end.

Cool park. Myself and a mate visited the park twice the first we were just passing through and the second visit we were actually checking out the scene at Vondel. Overall the park carried a very lively and friendly atmosphere, which as a tourist made me feel quite comfortable in the environment. The bikes were a plenty but still a cool park!
Fantastic park. Took my wife there it was beautiful perfect location for a romantic picnic with beautiful scenery around you. took alot of beautiful photos that we cherish so much.
nice park in amsterdam. My hotel was nearby so I got to visit it a couple of times. very nice park for walking running or whatever. it felt so alive with people doing group activities.

Nice park to chill out. This is an awesome park where you can just sit, lie, relax, walk, jog, whatever you feel like. Its green, clean, a bit crowded though - but it could have been cuz we visited during the peak season. There is a tiny lake inside where you can find some ducks also swimming. We also saw a restaurant inside, though we did not visit as we just lazed around nearby the lake. Just grab your kindle, beer, some snacks, and chill :-)
Beautiful park. Great opportunity to mix with the locals Beautiful park and very relaxing I enjoyed walking around there very much.

Central Park of Europe. This is a beautiful park which is clean and well kept. The flowers and wildlife are kept beautifully. This is a fantastic place to go for a jog, run or cycle while abroad. There are many locations to have breakfast, lunch or dinner while visiting the park. Great place to come and chill - I'll definitely be back!
BIKES !. Beautiful. Just watch out for the tall Dutch, weed smokers, and people on bikes ! Oh yeah, and every Saturday morning they have free Yoga in the park !

wonderful area to visit. our apartment was a rooftop terrace near to this park. Such a lovely area, peaceful, pleasant, clean and calm. Very relaxed. The park itself is beautiful, well worth a wander.

A place to watch the world go by. A beautiful park to walk, jog, cycle or star jump around! This is a very vibrant park with something happening all of the time. People come here to exercise, walk their dogs, play with the children or just sit and watch the world go by.There are lovely cafes to enjoy with wildlife in abundance.Free entry and good wide paths.
lovely...truly lovely.. I love Vondelpark. It's a great place for an al fresco breakfast or lunch, people-watching in the rose garden or for a cool summer evening walk.

A Nice place to relax. You can sit and watch the world pedal by. There are a few food places scattered thoughout and weather permitting, you can sit on the grass and take in the sun, watch the ducks or just simply relax.

Good place to chill for an hour or two. After riding our bikes through Amsterdam, we have decided to drink beer and have a snack, so what a better place than a park. Not the biggest or the prettiest park, but it's still nice.
Very pretty- even in the rain!. We had one day in Amsterdam, and traveling with our 5 year old son meant that the vondelpark was perfect as he could run! Very beautiful place!
Not a must-go, but if you need more nature in the city, here's the place.. A spacious and nature-oriented place to go for picnic or just to spend a chilling afternoon. I love those cute ducks!

Lovely wander in a morning.. We had a stroll through this park one morning, despite the rain! It's a hive of activity from the ever present cyclists to dog walkers, boxing training and runners galore! Lovely lakes and grassed areas and a few cafes which looked inviting, with places to sit to watch the world go by. On a summers day this place would be lovely; serenity in a bustling city.
Gorgeous. I loved this park with it's greenery, landscaping, solitude and quite. It is gorgeous. You can walk or bike through it and when done break out into the big city from any gate.

Most Popular Park in Amsterdam!. This beautiful English style city park of 120 acres is located in the southern part of Amsterdam but one of the entrances is actually right across the major going-out area in the center of town. It was developed in 1865 and is named after the most famous Dutch poet, writer and playwright. The Pavilion was built in 1878 while the Blue Tearoom opened in 1937. The rose garden in the center was created in 1936.Other facilities include a children's playground, an open-air theatre, a Film museum as well as four bar/restaurants.The place is very popular with 10 million visitors a year. It's also a favorite for kids on roller blades, joggers and cyclists which can be a nuisance at times. Having said this, it's still a great place to take a break, meet people and for having a picnic or BBQ.

Beautiful....but watch out for the bikes! . What a stunning park to get away from the hustle and bustle of city life. One moment I was in the heart of the city the next surrounded by tranquil greenery, wildlife, beautiful rose gardens and water features. Just watch out for the bikes!!! I felt quite nervous crossing the path to the other side of the park just for the sheer amount of bikes, but I guess that the beauty of Amsterdam.I cannot recommended a trip to Vondel park enough!

A great place to unwind and relax. Big enough to find some where quiet to unwind but not too big to feel isolated and easy to walk to from the museum quarter. My tip would be to buy some picnic food from the underground supermarket at the other end of the museum park and wander over to the park and watch the world go by for a few hours. There are a few cafes and restaurants in the park, the food is expensive for what it is but it's fine for a cold beer. There is a small children's paddling pool, playground and adventure tree course (its not go ape though.) We had a great relaxing afternoon, even managed a brief snooze!

Comfortable and friendly cafe.. This cafe is in a delightful setting at the east end of Vondelpark. It's great for watching people go by, on foot, jogging, skating, segwaying or most likely cycling. There is a big mixed menu and you can order almost anything at any time of the day. The fresh mint tea was a pleasant surprise, and the cheese with mustard sandwiches are good. A lovely place to relax or meet friends.

One of the best parks ever.... Visit Vondelpark just before sundown, take some food and drink and just soak up the atmosphere, it gets real busy on the weekends with people lighting small fires, it has a great vibe, in some ways reminiscent of the sixties.. Great park!!

Hive of activity. A lovely park with an endless amount of constant activity from yoga, bikes, joggers, blading, picnics, gatherings, music, students, business people at all times of the day and night. Definitely worth a wander through to sample a taste of life in Amsterdam.

Watch out for the bikes and joggers. Yes, keep your wits about you, but then that would be my overall tip for Amsterdam - keep a look out for bikes fomr all directions! This is a great place though. A way from the centre, but not far from the museum quarter, it is worth a visit because it is one of the few realtively calm places in what is generally a very hectic city

Beautiful Park that is a MUST SEE when in Amsterdam. We loved the area around Vondelpark. This is the area where nearby you'll find the AMSTERDAM sign to get photo in front of and the reflecting pond & the plethora of interesting and unique statues on display and it's also near the Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum and transit, shopping, restaurants so easy to spend a great deal of time here. It is also an area to get a break from the bicycles and traffic and marvelous chaos that is Amsterdam.

Peaceful, popular but busy park. This park is really big and spacious. There are many people walking, running and cycling through in both the day and night. It is well lit at night. Has cafes and restaurant but probably expensive, we didn't use them. Porta loos all over it which is handy. Benches all around or grass to sit. People doing all sorts, exercise, martial arts, partying, smoking weed. Lovely lakes and some cool birds. We weren't there then but Friday to Sunday apparently there is free live entertainment. Lovely park all round.

Beautiful park. Whilst I'm far from a park expert, I think this is my favourite of all those I've visited. The various different areas of the park cater for almost all tastes, whether you want a lake, a wide open space, or somewhere quiet and private.
Very nice park. Very nice park with pathways, lakes and cafe's, an oasis in the heart of the city. Good place to see locals relaxing on a sunny day, well worth a stroll through.

Beautiful Park. We rode around Vondelpark which was a great way to see it. Green grass, ponds,fountains, people relaxing. Great on a sunny day. We enjoyed it so much we visited twice and enjoyed it just as much as the first time.

Nice park. Many people were using the park, including two different exercise classes and runners. We also saw moorhens, Coors, a grey her on and, we think, lots of rose-ringed parakeets. Good place for a walk.
Average . It was a nice park and everyone was sitting outside and cycling through it but I definitely think that it's overrated. Probably wouldn't go again unless it was really nice weather
Be careful of the dogs. Too many dogs off leads and bikes which will knock you down. The cafes are very nice and drinks lovely. Nice park but could do with being pedestrians and no dogs only
Pretty and Relaxing. This park is a nice place to have a relax and have a picnic. Short walk from the amsterdam letters and a tram.
Beautiful park. This park is amazing in the heart of Amsterdam. It is beautiful and scenic. Also rode through it on a guided bike tour so learnt about some of its history as well.

Great park. Brilliant park to walk around or cycle, clearly most of the locals do their exercise in this park or walk the dogs, great to people watch and burn off the calories from a previous nights meal!

a place of recovery from hectic life. This park was founded when the city was in its second expansion wave, just before 1900. It serves for different purposes for different people (walking, bicycling, picknicking etc.) and is a favourite hangout for locals on a summer day, when it actually can get quite crowded. The more lively parts are closer to the Singelgracht and city center, whereas those more distant have also quieter areas. In the last couple of years, the park had a several breeding couples of storks.

Overly hyped, I think.... We visited this place while in Amsterdam, as my wife and daughter saw this in a movie. We arrived late in the afternoon and spent just a little time in the park. In fairness, there's a lot of green spaces where you can rest and pass time. However, while there, I could notice that in some areas of the park (at least in the area we visited), groups (gangs?) of men tend to congregate and police sometimes pass and talk to them. This gives a feeling of unease on my part, especially when it was close to dusk. On the lighter side, you can also find groups that are enjoying themselves, even a few cooking barbecue.

A great place for fun in the sun!. We cycled around this park in summer and it was overflowing with people and energy. There was lots to see and its best to see it on a bike as this park is huge. There are lots of cafes that serve wine and beer to refresh at in the summer heat.

Tip Toe through the Tulips. Went to this park on a delightfully warm and sunny amsterdam afternoon for a picnic.
I sat next to the lake, ate my waffles, people watched and inhaled the smell of weed that lingers in the air of most public spaces in Amsterdam. The park was lively, clean and botanically pleasing. Good for an afternoon stroll.
Beautiful!. Beautiful park with interesting history. We took a bike tour through the park and it was beautiful with lots going on!
Park Life!. Beautiful park to wander through to get out of the city just for a couple of hours!! Lakes and fountains very nice. Hard to believe this place is here! Watch out for the bicycles!!

Wow. What a relaxing place. It is a huge park and wow to relax.
Green clean grass and surrounded with beautiful trees.
The lakes inside are wonderful.
Kids can enjoy feeding the ducks.
Perfect place for workout and cycling.
Amsterdam's Central Park. Don't go when it is raining (like I had to) and have a nice picnic on a bench or on the grass, watch out for bikers!
Nice place to picnic and relax.. A large peaceful and relaxing park. Full of locals and tourist enjoying a picnic or a nap. Nice place if you want to chill out for a spell.

A delightful "walk in the park". We were fortunate to have booked a hotel right on Vondelstrasse, so we walked there twice; once on a sunny day, and another cool evening. The entire park is gated with well defined paths, very safe. Lots of walkers and joggers until the gates are locked. There were many fountains, lakes, and interesting sculptures all around the park. It is very large, like Central Park in NYC. We also had a light meal at the Teahouse, set in back over a picturesque wooden bridge. From there we could see a small concert pavilion that had colorful tulips planted all around (unusual for July - past their peak season of April-June) so that was a nice treat.

Nice but nothing special. I read a few recommendations to visit this place and my host in Amsterdam recommended it as well. Although it is a nice place to hang around, have a picnic or ride a bicycle I wasn't too impressed, it's very similar to park I live next close by in my home city. I would recommend this place but only if you are in the area.
Excellent park so much goin on. An amazing park lovely to spend time in when the weather is good lots going on an ideal spot for family fun and picnic

Oasis of rest in bustling city centre. An oasis of rest in the middle of this bustling city. Go to Vondelpark for a jogg, a stroll around the lake or to just lay on the grass for an afternoon nap. It also has a great restaurant (Vondelpark3), with superb terrace where you can really relax and watch the world go by (upstairs terrace is self-service, where downstairs is table service - and the place to be!).

Vondelpark is lovely. we wanted somewhere to chat and eat and feel relaxed and Vondepark offers all that and more. Such a haven of space and tranquility. Well worth the stroll from the Rijksmuseum/Van Gogh Museum.

The closest thing you'll get to outback in Amsterdam. Okay, it's not outback. But it's a really big park that feels more natural than the other more polished ones. It has tracks for jogging, cycling and horse, a nice lake to take a bath in and some cafes here and there. A nice place to go for a jog or get away from all the people.

A smaller Central Park. The Vondelpark in Amsterdam is one of the most beautiful and famous attractions in the city! People of all ages go there and have lots of fun because there are many things you can do.You can go there for a walk, for relaxing or for a picknick! But what I recommend is rent a bike and go there for a bicycle ride!
Nice park. exactly what you would expect. Plenty of space to enjoy, walk, bike, lounge. Good people watching and duck viewing.
What a vondefull place!. In the summer this place is amazing. Great place to ride a bicycle, sit down for a picnic and people watch, or take a mellow dose of truffles and enjoy life.
Beautiful park . Plenty of green space in the city. Well maintained. Its huge. We went in search of a playground and never found.It was a beautiful day and there were a lot of people there.
Great for a stroll. Spend some time in the park to unwind during our trip to Amsterdam.The park is clean and there are a lot of places you can stop to rest and just enjoy the view.
Lovely park. We came here on bikes. You can park it outside or ride inside. Few lakes, few stands with food and drinks. Nice vibe full of young people having picnic, skating, biking, chilling.
Nice timeout in Amsterdam in hot days. Was nice to have a break there with a picnic on the grass, many playground around, shadow, small Caffè, everybody can find something to do!

Beautiful and fun Greenness.. This place is amazing. Right in the middle of Amsterdam and close to all the best museums. Lots of grass to sit on and picnic. Restaurants also. Swans and ducks like I have never seen before. It's a must see place.

It's a park.. I'm not sure if it's just me but I didn't really see what was special about Vondel Park. My friends were raving about it in the run up to our trip and our visit there was alright, but it's just a park. I'm not sure how it is the 5th top thing to do in Amsterdam. It has grass and path ways and ponds, but with so much else to do in Amsterdam I wouldn't waste time going again if i were only going for a weekend. I'm sure it would be lovely if you were local, I'm just not sure it's worth wasting vacation time on. Also the bike problem that is everywhere in Amsterdam is tenfold inside the park, you are risking your life with every step.
Huge and Beautiful. The main city park is really worth visiting. If you like to walk and admire a beautiful view, the Vondelpark is a must go in Amsterdam! It's perfect for a bike ride also.
Pleasant diversion. Okay it's not Central Park, but Vondelpark is a pleasant green diversion from the hustle & bustle of the streetss & sandals of Amsterdam. Plenty of space to enjoy an ice cream.
Excellent . Amazing Park with lot of places to chill out and relax.. Very clean Park and in the middle have a nice bar to refresh.
Running, raving, rocking, relaxing. Whatever you feel like, you can do it here. Meet people, find relaxing spots to chill or go wild running your lungs out.
wonderful. a really nice park, you can have a rest or enjoy a picnic there. amsterdam is a smooth city, and vondelpark the most chilling place there
Beautiful park. Great place to spend a sunny afternoon. They have free porta-loos throughout the park for those who need it.

Clean, calm and pretty! . Happily we spent a day here chilled on a blanket with a picnic and a bottle of wine watching the world go by! The grass is kept short and clean, there are many portal ops descreatly placed around the park. It's a place to go walking, jogging, cycling , chilling and socializing all can be done at the very well presented park!
Lovely little wander. Lovely little park, even in the rain it was nice to walk around and soak up Amsterdam life. Not quite as big as I thought it would be though!

Relax here. coming from a cramped ciy like Mumbai it was a real pleasure to visit this open garden space in a city like Amsterdam. Vondelpark is full of energy with people walking, running, jogging, cycling etc. Its a green space which really bring peace in a city like Amsterdam.

Relaxing walk in the City. It is great to wander through the park and watch others exercise, relax and enjoy good weather. The park is full of people busy enjoying time out. There is a great cafe near the north east end, and plenty of water to watch the geese, moorhens and grebes!

Rent bikes and go here. On our final day in Amsterdam, my soon-to-be wife and I grabbed bikes and rode through the Vondelpark for quite some time. It's big and full of people, which is pretty great. On the day we visited there was live music, football games, picnics, cycling teams, performers, and about 5,000 people just enjoying a nice day. If you're visiting, you should be one of them for a stretch.
Nice place . Nice place to walk. Rent a bicycle. Take a nice photos. You can have a nap on the grass. Take a brake in the coffee shop.

Great fun. Great, great park. It is big though! There are meant to be 6 playgrounds, but we only found 1 (didn't look very far!) and thankfully it was brill. Climbing frame, swings, basket, dens, slide and then the best bit....a kind of fountain splash pool. My daughter aged 6 went a bit crazy, stripped down to her knickers and splashed around with around 5 or 6 other girls and had a whale of a time. I didn't know it was there and had no spare clothes or towel so thankfully it was a warm day. The water is very shallow so there were lots of toddlers in. It was just very special and you wouldn't see that for us at home.We also had gorgeous sandwiches and drink and apple cake at the cafe- highly recommended! And free toilets too (find the staffed ones, avoid the yellow cubicles if you can, they are revolting!). Great place, loooove it, even if virtually everyone is cycling very fast!
Very nice park. Walked through this park an a sunny Sunday afternoon, lots of pathways and ponds/lakes. All kinds of people of all ages using the park, very nice atmosphere, recommend.

Okay. My friend and I went here as it was recommended online. In honesty we were disappointed, it's a pretty park but nothing really impressed us. Possibly because we're very used to parks and greenery where we live so it left us a little underwhelmed. It's a pretty little park but we got round it pretty quick.
Beautiful . One of the most amazing parks I have ever been to. Rent bikes to enjoy the full experience. So pretty, ideal for doing fun stuff with friends!

Great cycling in a beautiful park. We hired some bikes from Mac Bikes near Vondelpark and cycled around here.The rain settled in fairly quickly so we stopped at the park's central cafe for coffee and a cake (which was very good and reasonably priced), before continuing with a few laps of the park once the rain held up.We had the bikes for 3 hours - a lap of the park will only take about 15-20 minutes at normal place. So, take your time and explore the lakes and gardens within, or do as we did and cycle on down to nearby Rembrandtpark, too.Well worth a visit, and a great place to cycle for those who are a bit timid on Amsterdam's roads.

Great place to chill.. Huge park with lakes and a couple of cafes to relax. It gets very crowded on summer time, or at every chance that the weather is good enough.. You can picnic, ride your bike or even have barbecue on designated areas. You'll see people chilling, sporting, making sorts of group activities, etc..

Beautiful Park in Central Amsterdam. We were looking for somewhere to just sit and relax, took a picnic, had read and seen Fault in our Stars so thought we would try here. Great park, lovely to watch a different way of life go by, with music coming from a local orchestra, and picnics with Snow White, and just such a relaxed buzz to the place, a definate stop and sit place after walking for miles round the City, Beautiful and it's free

Such a lovely memory. It rained like a monsoon and we were all in ponchos, we stumbled across a cafe bar in the middle of the park and we sat outside looking at the torrential rain on the lovely park, and we drank Irish coffees and red wine and melted into the park. My favourite memory of Amsterdam.

A Breeze with Ease. After waiting for Van Gogh this is a place to relax and smell the roses. The children can run around, feed the ducks, look at the flowers.The adults or couples can strole hand in hand and explore the different areas of the park. You can also catch one of the many concerts in the park as well.

Beautiful Park in Amsterdam!. If you are looking for a beautiful park in the middle of the city and want a place to picnic, walk, bike ride, let the kids run/play, sunbathe, or just hang out, this is it. The park is enormous in size, has lots to offer and can be a very low cost way to spend an afternoon.
Simply awesome. Spent a whole afternoon here and loved every moment of it. Just go in d afternoon and just relax under the sun
Amazing . The best park I have ever been. It is so calm and cozy there! The best choice to relax either alone or with your friends.

Greens all around. Green all around. Very refreshing away from the city central.
Low lying trees for good photo takings, with ducks in the ponds.
Good for joggers and cyclist too
Great park for a stroll . I love this park at all hours. A must see. It offers a nice respite from the crowds around the museums. There is also good shopping nearby.
Beautiful. Perfectly trimmed grass, water, foutains. And so clean. Best place to chill in amsterdam! Its really central but at the same time so peaceful
It's a park.... There's lots of greenery, lots of ponds and lots of people. A nice place to visit and I'm glad I did but wouldn't specifically go back.

A must go to park . You can bbq, buy pizza, snacks or grab anything on you ( from amsterdam ;) ) and just chill in this park..you can chill for hours without getting bored. Just make sure you grab something to place on the grass because it is usually mildly wet and some speakers to chill with music on you

Great to bike around the park! . Vondelpark was really beautiful, the perfect mix of man made and natural beauty. I had rented a bike before coming here, so I biked all around the park with two friends. I think it's really too big to enjoy the entire park on foot if you have limited time, rent a bike!! :) We stopped to get a cappuccino and when I came back later by myself, I got some delicious ice cream.

Beautiful park. We visited this park after a couple of days partying in Amsterdam so this was a welcome break . Not much to do except relax and enjoy the scenery . Very close to Leidseplein square where you find lots of restaurants .

Perfect picnic spot. Vondelpark is just 20 mins from Central. Most trams take you close enough or you can bike around. A great place for kids or if you want to just relax. Weekends are generally crowded. If you are adventurous enough, you can even barbecue

Lost in the woods . Went to dam as you do with your wife on your anniversary and didn't really plan on visiting a park while there but was glad I did, they really do pay attention to detail and it gives me more of a deeper insight into Amsterdam

Vondelpark. We visited Vondelpark in the late afternoon/early evening. It was a very pleasant walk especially as we had just had a large meal as it was our first day in Amsterdam. We had planned to go back and have a barbecue but never got round to do that. A walk around the lake was very relaxing combined with the smell of a BBQ
Awesome. Awesome place to soak up some sun, lay in the grass, and people watch, and bird watch. Great place to have a bbq too :)

Beautiful park. This is a lovely park especially on a sunny day. We hired bikes for 3 hours from nearby Mac's and cycled around the whole park and onto Rembrandt park. Vondelpark was beautiful. We passed pretty ponds musicians playing in bandstands, an orchestra playing freely to passerby. It was all so relaxing a real haven from the busy town. Lots of people shared our enjoyment there too. Cycling around was such fun too.

A nice park. It was OK and nice to walk through, couldn't find a public toilet (if they have them) I should have checked this before we visited but really we just used it as a cut through between trams.

Larde central park but be on your guard!!. This is a big, well maintained park in the centre of the city. It has various arty displays and is a good picnic area. It has cafes and has facilities for biking. It is inhabited by a lot of 'colourful' locals who will help you with your bags and money if your not careful SO BEWARE!

Beautiful walk to the city. Stayed right by Vondelpark and walked through it to get into the city. Beautiful place to wander but watch out for the bikes, they seem to have right of way where ever you are.

Peaceful park in the city. This is a beautiful green space to relax in...lots of people all ages cycling, walking through. We didn't go all the way in, but rested on benches after walking all afternoon.
Beautiful park. My husband and I walked through this park as we headed out for a day in Amsterdam. It's a beautiful, well-used park and a lovely oasis in the middle of Amsterdam. Take a walk around!

Lovely large park. Vondelpark is a very big park which is lovely to sit in and relax for an hour or so on a sunny day. Very big so you can spend a lot of time here relaxing. Very nice after walking around Amsterdam for a few hours!

relaxing park.... A beautiful park close to the center. Rent a bicycle and get yourself down here. Worth riding around admiring the greenery and the locals enjoying the sun & nature. It is pretty huge with lakes, fountains, trails & bistros. Occasional smell of weed in the air reminds you where you are. A nice relaxing experience not to be missed.

Beautiful. Such a beautiful park to spend the day! If it is sunny, well it is just perfection! There are coffees where you can go to eat or drink something
I totally loveeeed it!
A wonderful park close to city center.. What a wonderful park! It has miles of pedestrian/bike trails, lakes, fountains, bistros, and manicured lawns to picnic on.

Huge park!!. If you want to see this park you will need some extra hours (at least 2) because this park is just huge! It is beautiful and i recommend visiting. If you have animals they will love it because all dogs are free in here and if you are thinking riding you bike here, you should definitely do it!!
Tranquil and relaxing. A great place to wander through after a long day of sightseeing. Great concerts on Wednesday nights through the summer. Very safe.

Great chill out place. Calming place for chill out located in the south right next to the city center. Well know meting point for locals as well. I was there several times, each time were there many people, who have played games, had fun etc. Revommend for chill, when you want to go away from busy city center

Open air concert in Vondelpark.. We attended an open air concert in this park in August, for the Grachtenfestival. A performance by the five young winners of the annual Grachtenfestival competition (classical music). Great.
relaxing afternoon!. Rent a bike, eat ice-cream, have a drink, feed the ducks, people watch. We rented bikes and cycled round as it is pretty large!

Beautiful park with a great vibe.. Beautiful park with a great vibe. Great to ride around as its different at every turn. Also a great spot to sit and relax, take in the music that someone's playing, play some Frisbee or just people watch and watch the performers doing their thing that day. Great low key day.

Nice park. Nice park to take a stroll or sit down for a picnic. Very big. Close to the Van Gogh museum. Can't say it's a must-see but good to go if you're looking to kill some time. As with the rest of Amsterdam, there are bicyclists everywhere.

Great escape in the middle of the city. Great escape in the middle of the city , spent time with my son and my mom , had lunch at the outdoor cafe. Reminded me of a small Central Park. People relaxing having picnics by the lake
Relaxing. Nice, spacious park a little bit south of the center of Amsterdam. Too many cigarette butts on the ground but a nice place to relax.

Between locals and weirdo's. If you're in Amsterdam, you have to see Vondelpark. It is the best park. It actually is the backyard of al the locals. On hot summer nights all locals meet in the park, bbq and drinks included. If your lucky you will see a birthday party going on. If you're unlucky, you might see a weirdo do a number 2 between the plants. PS did you know a band called Vondelpark because they liked the place that much?
A place to chill on a sunny day!. A place to chill on a sunny day! Lots of families, dog lovers and artists all in one place! It's very close to the museums too!

Lively, Upbeat "Central Park" Vibe. A large park just outside the center of the city visited by locals and tourists alike, Vondelpark has a lively, upbeat "central park" vibe and is a great place to walk in the early hours of the morning or to unwind at the end of the day.

Great Park. We rented bikes from our hotel and cycled around this park. There is a cycle path which is separate to the pedestrian path which is convenient. It was a lovely summer's day so we were lucky in that respect. There are plenty of places to stop and have a coffee.

A paradise in the heart of the city. You can take the whole day out there and forget about the real life, work, responsibilities and all. But, like any other place in Amsterdam, beware of the cyclists.

Nice and quiet afternoon. We (me, my husband and 6 year old son) spent a shiny afternoon in the park.We loved the peace of the place. We strolled and my son played in the playground.It is a nice alternative to escape from the crowds and the noise of the center!

Sculpture of The Fish by Pablo Picasso. Biking towards the Vondelpark I thought I was hearing waterfalls but it was actually the rustling of the leaves of large trees. Good place to relax after burning my muscles from biking is right in front of The Fish. I've seen better, beautiful parks. It just makes a whole lot of difference when you have the work of a great artist right there.

Quite nice park, cafe unclean and expensive.. Nice park to stroll around for a short period of time. Seemed to be a place where some people went to recover from the night before. Used one of the cafes which was expensive, nearly 5 euros for a small cold coffee.

Beautiful park. I went through the park with friends, we walked and cycled around it. Although there were large crowds it was still peaceful enough to sit down and relax for a while even if the ground was a bit damp
Great afternoon in Vondelpark. Spent the afternoon in Vondelpark. The rose gardens was in bloom. There are several places to relax, biking trails, and children playgrounds.

Nice place to relax. Nice park in the south west area of the city. Walking distance from the IAMsterdam sign and Museumplein. tons of people biking through so watch out and stay off to the side of the paths. Little pond in the middle is a nice spot to put out a blanket and relax.
nice to get some peace and quiet. It's nice and I am sure Amsterdam benefits from having it I have just been to larger nicer parks our own grant, Lincoln, and Millineum parks are nicer

Great park in Amsterdam. Lovely park near to the centre of the city. On a sunny day it is very busy with locals. There are lakes, flowers, lawns, cafes etc. a nice contrast to indoor visits and near the museums.

If the sun is shining when you are in Amsterdam, stop here and laze the day away.. The Vondelpark is a huge park located near the museums and Leidseplein area of Amsterdam. If it's sunny when you are there you should definitely spend some time in this park with it's beautiful lakes, large grassy spaces and you can people watch all day.

Sunny day. For who likes nature, when you go to this city try to find vondelpark, a massive park where you can do exercise, take your bycicle, walk with your dog, make a nap in the grass, go for a cofee or even if you are lucky like I was, watch a breathtaking bride celebrating her marriage with all the friends and family.
Lovely Park. Great oasis of calm in hectic city, had a leisurely stroll on a lovely spring day. Great cafe overlooking the water.

Favourite park. What Central Park is for New York, the Vondelpark is for Amsterdam. Located just off the very centre of town, it is easily accessible from all directions. It is long and (not so) narrow, has many lovely places to sit, talk, eat (BBQ allowed in designated areas) and enjoy the surroundings. Special events include concerts and sometimes a tulip market. Also, storks are breeding in season, and there are many loud rose-ringed parakeets.My favourite park in Amsterdam!
Good for cycling. We hired bired and the park was a great place for getting used to the strange bike. Take a picnic and enjoy the piece and quiet or if you are lucky you may get an open air concert.
Walk in the park. Nice spot to stroll but, like most of Amsterdam, has too much litter. Great spot for kids and teenagers to unwind.

An unexpected piece of heaven amidst the chaos of Amsterdam. Anyone who has ever been to Amsterdam will agree that it can be a bit hectic. The city is in a constant state of motion with trains, trams, buses, cars, boats, pedestrians and the never-ending sea of bicycles. Vondelpark is a true reprieve from the city. It's oddly calming and quiet in the park even though there is a strong volume of people using the grounds to exercise, to walk their dogs, etc. The park is extremely well kept and there are several picture worthy spots along the main walkways. I just wish we had had more time to stop and have lunch. It's quite the magical spot.

Amsterdam's Treasure. We walked and rode bikes through this park. Thankfully, the walking paths and the bike paths are separated. There are some great playgrounds throughout the park where my kids could play for hours even though they have outgrown the typical American playground. Bring a picnic lunch, a soccer ball and enjoy a few hours next to one of the many water features (ponds).

Great spot for cycling, jogging and relaxing . Would highly recommend making a visit to this gorgeous park. Great spot for cycling, jogging and general relaxation. Plenty for kids to do and lovely cafes for breakfast, brunch and dinner.

Vondelful!. Recently spent a week in Amsterdam and would definitely recommend a visit to here on a nice day. We spent a couple of hours lying on the grass in the sun and watching dogs playing in the stream and the blue herons fishing. We also rented bikes and rode around the park. We even took the cycle route to Rembrandtpark, which is pretty close. There are free portaloo toilets in the park as well, which is a bonus, although no toilet paper! There are also a number of places to eat in the park.
an old favourite. Lots of food, lots of birdlife (some of it local, much foreign invasive species but still pleasant) and always something interesting to see

Perfect Bike ride!. Our bike tour guide said that "tourists avoid and locals cherish" this park and behind it, the Fun Forest. We had dinner at the Vondel Park Restaurant and was lovely. Get on a bike and explore this vast and beautiful part of Amersterdam

Hang and relax with the locals. This is a perfect way to spend a lazy afternoon among the locals. Ride your bike, bring a picnic, find a nice shady tree to lean against, and watch how the locals relax.
very pretty. the park is good to walk or cycle round. it has different things to see and has a relaxed atmosphere. There some nice places to eat and drink. worth a visit if you like parks
the great Escape. Its a beautiful park for a lovely weather, you can ride your bike or maybe go for a nice walk. Away from the busy streets and noise from the people its quite a blessing. Enjoy!
Beautiful place to chill out & workout. We spent around 1 hour there. If our itinerary wasn't packed, we might have a picnic and people watching. A perfect place to picnic, take a nap or jogging :p
Amazing park . Very cool landscaping and and especially the little lake is looking amazing. Alittle bit manmade and almost artificial but still best picknickspot in Amsterdam

Quick visit. Didn't get the hype of people who had previously been. Was nice but not amazing... Unless you want to sit around and inhale everyone else's smoke. Maybe I didn't go as far in as you need to.... ?!

Great park for a summers day. Brilliant park for a summers afternoon, recommend hiring a bike (typically 6 euros for a couple of hours) and cycling around. Lots to see and do and a great place to chill out and unwind.

Great Escape. Vondelpark is a place away from the crowded canals and squares in Amsterdam, away from the bars and coffeshops.
you can lay down, read a book, jog or just sit and look at people's faces passing by.

Nice opportunity to get away from the busy city life. Very clean park. Used by many people for doing sports, walking around or simply releaxing. As well, there is a small bar in the area of the main entrance and a small "mobile shop" was selling some coffee.

Beautiful park. Beautiful large park with fountains and lakes. Perfect place to enjoy the weather, take a walk, ride a bicycle go jogging or even have a picnic. Suitable for family, couples or friends. Near to city center. It's a park that never gets boring.

Very nice escape from the noisy city in the summer.. Very big and green park. We were in August in Amsterdam so even the park was overcrowded.We rented bikes in front of the park and biked for some hours in the park. The restaurant right in the entrance is a bit expensive. If you have little kids or like sitting and relaxing in the park you will like it.
Rest your feet or take a walk, lovely place. Perfect place to walk or ride a bike. Many area to sit and enjoy nature. Pack and lunch and blend in with the locals.

Beautiful large park. We managed to get stuck in the park! How does that happen? Well, Vondelpark is really big and several of the roads/trails are circular and turn back on themselves so getting out of the park took some time. We walked for miles and saw several pond, park setting, and many people lounging in the grass enjoying the sun. There are a ton of bikes riding in every direction and hundreds of people hanging out on any given day.

LOVE this park!! It's beautiful!. This is a terrific place to come if you just need a break from museum-ing. We found our way to a lake with a beautiful water fountain in it, sat down, laid back and grabbed some rays. We were surrounded by groups of people sitting together, having picnics, wine, cheese, chocolates, etc. Everybody was incredibly friendly and every twist and turn in this park is beautiful. I moved to a bench after a while and had a nice conversation with a lovely couple from London.Just remember.... as with the entire city of Amsterdam, there are bikers - fast bikers all over this park so watch yourself. They were even riding over the grass where we were laying and I thought for sure one was going to hit me. Several of them were giggling as they biked in and out of the people laying down on the grass knowing full well that they were scaring people.Other than that, there are people selling food and there are bathrooms and it's a great way to kill an hour just relaxing.
nice place. amazing place must to visit for some fresh air you can make cycling & take some food with you to enjoy a nice meal between the nature
Great place to go for a run. Nice peaceful park. I ran in the park several morning during my stay and found it to be a nice place to run. I felt very safe and enjoyed the solitude.

Vondelpark a little Haven. After museums, canals, trams etc it was lovely to breathe some air in an open space. Vondelpark is great to stroll around or hire a bike. We strolled for a while and then had lunch at the Restaurant. Lunch was delicious we shared a Ceasar Salad. To me Vondelpark is a must see while in Amsterdam.My only - negative, but this right through Amsterdam it needs to be cleaned better. Cigarette butts, bottle caps everywhere.

Fun, amusing, interesting. Nice stroll along the canal and a chance to see a Sunday afternoon in Amsterdam. Plenty of choices to step out of the park along the way to grab a bite or a drink, soft drinks available in the park along with a local circus of people in various activities ranging from family picnics to dead drunk.
Nature in the heart of city. We went there to see how the local people spend their Sundays, a great walking place with good coffee shop.
Beautiful uniquely Dutch park.. Pure Dutch landscape design. A great place to relax for an hour as a break during touring of the museums.

Away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Beautiful green area in the city. Nice to have a stroll. One hears musicians at various points. A good way to see the full park would be on a bicycle. Nice restaurant where we had lunch.
Fantastic !. If you go to Amsterdam in a good weather day don't miss a visit to this park you can see the real life of those that life in Amsterdam like if ot was your own.

Excellent Green Space. Vondel Park is sort of a "sleeper". Since it was nearby my hotel (Amsterdam Marriott), it was my "go to" place to do my morning walking regime. It is a sprawling, well laid out, well attended, green space in which to enjoy the outdoors

Lovely park. . The Vondelpark is lovely; well-kept and interesting. We spent an afternoon wandering the park - there are many routes you can take. There is a children's play area and paddling pool which is nice. Definitely worth a wander.
Very beautiful, worth going. one nice park to walk, bike or walk is beautiful and quiet , if the amsterdam worth going there! I recommend

Worth a visit if you are in the city.... Beautiful! Lots of places to stroll around, ride a bike, se some greenery/fowers. Also a few fountins etc. Very large, much like Central Park in NYC (not quite as lage). Well worht the stroll

Stunning . A stunning park!! Gorgeous lakes, bridges, flowers, fountains and walks to do. There's a really cool treehouse, a few old style food carts and a gorgeous lakeside cafe. A really nice day I would definitely go again x
Nice park. each season, you can find a beautiful nature and animals there. It is good to spend time with friends or alone.

Will definitely go again. It was raining when we went so we spent most of the time at the coffee shop inside the park but from what we saw it looked like a wonderful place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Definitely worth multiple visits.
Oasis of Calm. This is a wonderful oasis of calm in the heart of Amsterdam. Well-kept grounds, coffee shops and amenities makes it a pleasure to visit.

Gorgeous . Absolutely fabulous park, very green and the people are so friendly in Holland ! We went in a day where is wasn't to hot which was nice because we could appreciate it more. Its just outside the centre and walking distance from the Heineken experience which is a must, the tram is just outside and takes you straight to the centre

Vondel full. . This is such a pleasant place to go for a ride a walk a sit down or even to sit in a tree. The park is so full of activity and people. Many people simply come and go and many return again and again. Some of them are park fixtures, people who were there ten years ago. If you spend any number of days in Amsterdam without stopping here you miss so much of what makes this city a balanced one. Vondel park gives a slice of nature necessary for that complete spirit we often strive for.

A breath of fresh air. This is a wonderful park and a peaceful enclave from trams, bicycles (mostly) and the crush of a major city. I have visited when it has been virtually deserted and also on the Queen's (now the King's) birthday. If you have a chance..do both. The King's birthday transforms the park into a carnival atmosphere. A very interesting contrast to a quite day in low tourist season.

Somewhere to chill and watch the world go by. We visited 2 days in a row and each time was different. Band playing the first day and second got a drink and sat on the grass verge and actually recharged energy. Only thing I would advise is don't sit on your own if a female as partner went to get drinks and I had 2 men approach me who were quite intoxicated. Was a little scary but remained polite and got up and walked away from them. There are police patrolling so wasn't too worried.

Popular nice large urban park. Large park in the center of Amsterdam, surrounded by houses with beautiful trees and flowers, lake and grass lawns. Very popular in sunny day but worth a walk at any time
Beautiful park.. What an amazing park in one of the worlds most amazing cities. We just loved the one space, the locals embracing the outdoors and the central location.
Beautiful park. Good place for a walk in a sunny day. Very close to the main museums in Amsterdam, full of water and nice atmosphere!
Relax. Fantastic park in the center of the city. You can relax, run, doing some sports, sit and look at the rose or at the fountain!

An incredibly amazing park filled with vibrant and friendly people. An incredibly beautiful park, filled with locals, foreigners and just about every walk of life you can imagine. A great place to spend the afternoon with some friends relaxing - especially if you're indulging in some of Amsterdam's merchandise.

One of the top parks in Europe!. Vondelpark is a large park that is located in the middle of Amsterdam.It is so easy to go there on foot, by tram, however you like.You can either sit on the grass and chill or you can sit on the benches and watch the bikers, the walkers, skaters pass by you continuously.It is also a perfect spot for a little picnic. If you want so, get you sandwiches and wine and just relax by the little ponds in the park.Enjoy!

Walking into park heaven! . This was the first thing we did in Amsterdam and we loved it! Even though the weather wasn't it's best it was still lovely to walk around and take some nice photos! Plenty of photo opportunities and a great place to have a picnic if good weather!

My sun bath in Amsterdam. Since I arrived in Europe I learned how to enjoy the sun and the parks around the cities.
Vondelpark was already in my list of things to do in Amsterdam.
It's huge, full of bikes and peoples having a sun bath.
Go and enjoy,
Rent a bike and cycle around the park

Rustic and relaxed but regularly overcrowded. The experience depends very much the time you go there. A extensive park in the middle of Amsterdam, a good place to relax. On the other hand, if the wheather is good really everyone wants to go there and it get overcrowded - no rustic feelings anymore.

Nice place for a morning bike ride. The park itself is.... like any other park. However it is a clean, beautiful, large example of one. As a cyclist (in Amsterdam that's most people) it's a fantastic place to head for an early leisure ride before it gets too full. It's said that most cyclists are using the park as part of their route from A to B, but a lap around it and back home gives me 8km of exercise and for that purpose it is fantastic. The road around the park is wide, with footpaths either side. When it gets busy the tourists tend to walk all over the road which makes cycling interesting, but there's a lot more space here than in the canal district and centre so it's easier to avoid them without resorting to angry bell ringing.Otherwise the park has some water, a few narrow footpaths through bushes and trees, and some nice places for food and drink. There is an ope air theatre for fun in the summer. At weekends it is incredibly busy, which can ruin its purpose as a getaway from the noise of the city, but given its location by Leidseplein and associated tram routes it is easy to get to and enjoy the scenery.

Vondelpark Amsterdam. Made a nice change to our weekend break to have a walk around Vondelpark away from the crowds for a while. Saying that the park gets fairly busy but we managed to find a bench to rest our weary feet. There are plenty of tracks for a walk if you prefer. Several restaurants, cafes are in the park for refreshments. We saw a lot of birdlife in the park.

Relaxing in the city . Great place to relax in the heart of the city. You'd forget the hustle and bustle and that you're only 5min walk away from the masses. An obvious favorite with the locals and a great place for a picnic on a sunny day
Nice Park for a walk or a bike ride . This is one of the famous parks in Amsterdam. Good place for a walk, cycling or just relax in the grass
A place to laze the day away. A beautiful place to people watch and laze the day away, it was vibrant and a relaxing place to get out of the hustle and bustle of amsterdam.
Gorgeous. Lovely peaceful area. Playground for kids. Mind the bikes though! Stray off the main paths to find the real beauty.

Lovely Park. Great way to spend the afternoon after a day of sightseeing. There's a nice cafe and a restaurant on site. If you plan to rent bikes, make sure to go early since many of the bike shops close by 8.
Stunning park. Such a beautiful and relaxing park. Plenty of room to ride your bikes, have a picnic or stroll around. I rode through here every day on my visit :)
Ok city park.. Park full of stoners. People passed out in the bushes. Looks nice from a distance. Gets a little better the deeper you go into the park.

Buzzing yet peaceful. Good place to connect back with nature and small glimpse of wild life.
There is always something buzzing at this place but there are spots where you can just relax after having spent time in active Amsterdam.

Free concert series for over 60 years!. Enjoyed concert in the park. Wonderful combinations - everything from classical to upbeat. We saw use of an instrument we'd never seen. All in all a great afternoon. Be sure to get there early if you want a seat.

Wonderful day. It has been a wonderful experience wandering around vondel park. It was a very clear and sunny day which i guess we happened to be lucky. So we decided to rent a bike for a day and some of us decided to walk. Then we chilled by the lake next to the fountain. It is a nice place to meet new people and birds especially ducks :)

It's a park. It is a nice looking park, great to walk, but don't spend much time there. Not that I was not impressed, but it is a park like any other parks. Parks are made for local citizens to escape and relax, away from tourists.

Lovely break from the city. A great place to wander and people-watch! Nice variety of gardens, ponds, parkland, and plenty of wildlife including ducks, herons, cormorants, coots. A few ice-cream and burger vans dotted around. There are a couple of cafes/restaurants but they close at 6pm.
Bike or walk interlude. This is a green spot to duck in and get away from the bustle of the museum district. I enjoyed biking through, even in the rain.

Great place to take a walk and take a few photos.. I decided to walk over fro the Van Gogh museum and explore. There are plenty of open areas to sun and also private paths that are nice a quiet. Its a great place to explore, and relax.

Great for tourists, not so much for Amsterdam natives.... The Vondelpark is an exquisitely laid out city park and the largest in Amsterdam. It has several separate sections aimed at different activities. As an Amsterdam native I prefer the jogging trail around the perimeter of the park that is about 2.5 km long. To relax I prefer the other parks in the city. The reason being the overabundance of litter and dog droppings that make it impossible to sit in the grass anywhere. During the summer many people (natives and tourists) frequent the park for BBQ or other activities. Many leave their litter, which is removed by volunteers (who cannot manage the entire park) in the morning.To just get away from the city, the park is fine, but for true relaxation I would recommend some of the other parks that are less touristic and are cleaned more properly.
Nice Park. A place to take a break from de the city, but in the middle of the city. It has lakes and inside you got another "IAMSTERDAM" to take a photo.

Beautiful . Went for a few hours just to chill with friends. Was lovely.
Very scenic with some things to do, like cafes, if you're interested. Would love to give bikes and see it all again.

It is a must to go!. This is a very peaceful and refreshing park. It is kinda big that it would be a good idea if you go there by bus. You should also go there for picnic. There are different kinds of birds too!

Lovely summertime walk through the park. A lovely park. Many were having picnics, strolling children, walking dogs or jogging. We walked through several times and can only say it was AWESOME! I worry about parks but felt very safe here. Even at night when we walked back around 10pm. I felt safe.
Athletes haven. This is a fabulous park in the centre of Amsterdam. On weekends it is used by walkers, joggers, bootcamps etc. Nice to walk around or stop off for a coffee in the restaurant.
Beautiful park!. Fantastic little park! Great beautiful grounds, good cycling! Centrally located (as everything is!) and provides for a really nice walk through with your significant other.

Great park, great fun. Vondelpark is a huge park in the wider center of Amsterdam. Literally every kind of fun in open-air could be find there: sports, walking, having a little coffee-break or lunch, open-air theatre,(concerts, plays etc. there is a special program for this theatre), playgrounds for children etc.
In the summer it is a must-visit place in Amsterdam!

Very relaxing without all the bustle of tourists. I really liked this park. The Dutch version of Central Park. We came upon it a bit by accident as it was one of the stops on the Hop on Hop off bus tour. I feel you get a real sense of Dutch life in the park, it feels miles away from the crowds closer to Centraal Station, near the canals. I saw more locals here, families, couples, singles on their bikes with grocery bags. It just felt more authentic for lack of a better word. Nice open areas. Passed by a few restaurants and cafes and it would've been nice to pick a table outside and eat while people watching, if we hadn't eaten already. Beware of the bikers. Tons of bikers. Like everywhere in Amsterdam really. :)

Main parc Amsterdam. Amsterdams Central Parc :-) A grand parc in the center of town where tourists and locals gather around ponds, bars and grass patches. Often (free) concerts and nice place to smoke some local produce open air with the locals if your into that, if not you can just envoi a bit of nature and sit on a nice terrace or have a good run.

Pretty park, good for breakfast!. Very pretty and green park! We stayed and had breakfast at the restaurant that overlooks the park. Reasonably priced and is nice to watch the world go by as people wander through the park. We went in the winter so people didn't hang about that long. Nice to walk to with easy access to walk to the centre, nice little detour if your staying just out of the city!
Nice relaxing area. A wonderful place for walk or ride a bike. There is a great restaurant , called Vondelpark3, inside the park. Good food a and a formidable view.
Peaceful. Had a too short walk through the lovely park, just to get a rest from a busy touristic tour of Amsterdam, but next time I'll spend much more time!

Beautiful park. We went on a week day (weekends may be very crowded) and enjoyed the peaceful setting. There are cafes on the edge and lots of people enjoying the sun on the lawn. Due to time constraints, we could only explore a small portion of the park (is quite large in size). Be aware of bicyclists - they have the right of way in the bike ways.
Beautiful Retreat. This made a very welcome change from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam city. Lovely walks with even paths and access to lakes. Keep your eyes peeled for bikes, skaters etc.
Wonderful. Beautiful park very relaxing lovely views lots of people just sat chilling having picnics in the park

Everyone's exercising. Absolutely everybody is in here at the moment. Exercising or riding bikes. Its crazy. Beautiful park, beautiful people. I was the odd one out because I was walking. NOBODY WALKS!

Nice open space to walk, cycle and relax. We met with friends and had a simple lunch in a cafe in the centre of the part. Lots of lovely places to explore on foot or by bike. Children's play areas and paddling pools were great too.
A trip of a lifetime. This is where the population gravitates on a warm day. Cycle around the perimeter and you will become pleasantly relaxed, inhaling the pot fumes!

Love this park!!. Every time I go back to Vondellpark I love it. The park itself is huge with so much going on. There are people having picnics, playing with dogs, doing theater shows, and partaking in the wonderful festivities Amsterdam has to offer :)

The perfect place to relax. Beautiful park, spacious and with a cool atmosphere. Suitable for all. Several places to buy food and refreshments. Plenty of benches if you do not want to sit on the grass.

A beautiful haven in a gorgeous city!. Vondelpark is a perfect place to spend a day in, wandering around the lakes and rivers, or through the rose gardens and across picturesque bridges. There are cafes, a restaurant and an open air theate which stages free concerts regularly throughout the Summer months. Paths lead right from the busy centre of town and stretch for a mile or so, down to the more residential area of Amsterdam. There are many areas to enjoy a picnic, and even a barbeque, as there are areas specifically designed for them. There is a fantastic jungle gym hidden in a copse of trees which children (and adults) will love, and a children's play area which has an outdoor paddling pool. The park is very clean and tidy and though very busy (hugely popular as a cycling route) it still remains a haven of peace and quiet. There are a great many wild parakeets flying around, as well as jays, herons, geese and many other birds, and you can find yourself lost in your own little world as you meander around its paths. The entrance to Vondelpark is very close to many tram and bus stops and it also has many many entrances that come out on different side streets, and make for a delightful day/days out as you discover new places to eat, drink and shop!

Best place to people watch and relax!. After walking the city for a day, husband and I decided to sit under the tree and enjoy our coffee while chatting and people watching. The park is clean, a bit crowded in the summer including bikers. Just loved the atmosphere. Take time out and visit this park.

The part in the west is the best!. One of the older cityparks is the Vondelpark. It has a rich story and Iám not going to tell you that here, because you can find the history everywhere around in the park. The west part is the best because compared to the east part (main entrance) is more quiet and I can walk my dogs there freely. So if you see a health man with two corgi's its me.The parc has beautiful water areas and old, some more than 100 years, trees. The tracks are well kept and grasses are mowed weekly.You also can play all kind of sports in the parc. For childeren there is a magnificent climbing, wooden structure in the west part. Great place.Any way go and see yourself, a place you must have visit in Amsterdam when you are here!
Lovely kept park. A huge park.Very nice to have a leisurely walk or bike ride through.Lots to see and ideal for a sit and people watch.
Nice nature walk. Great weather complemented by the a wonderful garden in the center of the city. Museum area is a just 5 mins away.

Relaxing and laid back. Vondelpark has a very relaxed and chilled out atmosphere. It's a good place to picnic, stroll, unwind, or people watch. Vondelpark is quite large, so if you want to see most of it, I would recommend renting a bike!

We tell every one about Vondel Park! . To be honest we spent loads of time high in Vondel Park. A clean, well kept and sometimes entertaining park to sit in for hours. Wildlife around to keep you entertained. Plenty of secluded areas to sit down in.

Vondelpark - greatest park in Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is a beautiful park, lovely landscape, very nice atmosphere. You see al kind of people in the park. There are performances, kids gardens, terraces and nice places to have lunch or dinner. When you visit Amsterdam, the Vondelpark is a must ;-)

Must Visit on Kings Day!. Amsterdam is alive on kingsday and where better to spend the day with friends than in a stunning park providing large open spaces that's breathing life. Down each pathway traders set up on both sides alongside the surrounding water that can also be swam in!

Watch out for bikes!. This is a lovely little park in the middle of Amsterdam and is very popular with locals and tourists. many bikes pass though but there is grass and place to have a picnic style lunch. Often there are buskers to provide entertainment. Sit on the grass have a lunch and glass of wine or beer and then within minutes you are on the Leideslpein for many attractions.

Europe's Central Park. Popular, relaxed, bicycles, beautiful people, bars, restaurants, botanical excellence, free concerts, skateboards, grass, parakeets, water, lively, ducks, rollerblades, families, students, sunbathing, paddling...
It is a fantastic place to go on a Sunday and is just beautiful. I'm never bored.

Very nice, worth a walk around. Very nice park, lots of wildlife, greenery and water. Lovely little places to sit and have a bite to eat, or plenty of space to sit somewhere and have a picnic. Was a nice break from the clustered canals of Amsterdam

Wonderful. Its great that the bustling city of amsterdam has a green area like this where you can nap, ride your bike, walk, dance, jog, and eat!My boyfriend and I had rented bikes to go to the heineken museum and bols museum.. We then decided while we were in the area we'd ride to Vondel Park. I hadnt really researched this park before we went so didn't really know what to expect. It was busy; bikes, pushchairs, people everywhere.. But the park is the biggest park i have ever seen and was very well thought about. There is water, birds, bandstands and patches of grass to relax on. There was also music playing on a stage when we got there but we decided a sit on the grass would do us good instead. Its amazing how a place like that can make you feel somewhere else.A must see for a chilled out time in the park!

Lovely. A great place to hang out and stroll through throughout the day, feels a little spooky at night with strangers appearing out of bushes but thats a public park for you in an city around the world.

Kilte - Dutch Style at Vondelpark. Half an hour walk or so from the centre of the city, Vondelpark is absolutely beautiful! Especially when the sun is beaming down like it was for the duration of our stay! We enjoyed it so much, we postponed going to the Body World exhibition and returned for a mini picnic and 'chill & catch some rays' kinda afternoon!The eateries that are dotted in the park all look very good, although I cannot speak from experience. A fabulous green & watery oasis!

A lovely park. A well looked after park, worth a visit if your a tourist in Amsterdam be it on a bicycle or walking the amount of energy and happiness you get from seeing so many people outdoors exercising together.
