Beautiful sculpture park. Well worth a visit. The sculptures are beautiful and tell an interesting story of life, love, and death. Great spot for pictures. One of the most beautiful and interesting parks that I have had the pleasure of visiting.

Amazing park. It's a great place, walking distance from the center of the town. It's very vibrant. There are free concerts in summer, from friday till sunday. Ther are many people riding bikes, smoking weed, barbecuing, but you can also find a peacefull place to rest, read a book, sunbathe. I really liked the kids park, there was a big shallow pool and they were really enjoying themselves.
Lovely evening strole. it was a hidden gem behind our hotel. much used by cyclists, runners etc so keep your eyes open or you will get run down.

Beautiful walk, relaxing place. We were able to walk through this park from our hotel (the Apple Inn) to the museumplein. It is very pretty and provides a lovely setting for a picnic. There were actually fewer bicycles along this route than in the city centre! Though you still have to watch out for them. Part of the walk is along a river, it really is a place people come to relax.
Serene. Such a lovely park - one of my favourites of all time! Especially would recommend the cafe in the old Film Museum for a coffee/evening drink before heading somewhere for dinner.

Stunning!. absolutely beautiful! especially during the summer months!! This is the one place I can close my eyes and remember it like it was just yesterday! We rented bicycles and self toured the city... we thought we got lost but ended up here. It was amazing.

A green oasis in the city. We visited on the day when the "Silly Boy" festival was taking place in the park, so it was particularly busy, but even so there was lots of space to enjoy peaceful walks. There are a number of places to eat in the park, but we opted to try an eatery on the street to the west of the park that day.

Peace, quiet and some exercise. Wonderful place to escape and have some quiet time. Furthermore makes a great 3,5km running track should you not want to deal with the stop/start of running in the city.

fine if you like to sit on the grass. I didn't really like the park because there are not many benches to sit on. However, people sit on grass and many also barbecue in the park. It is very large and very green but not too beautifully decorated. After all, it is a park, not a garden.

Great for everyone. birds and rabbits to watch, nice loans to chill on, benches to sit, air to breathe. What else do you want from park:) We had a park-hopping that day we visited vondelpark and it was amazing, even though I can't see how a park can't be amazing unless it is vandalized or not maintained properly.
Visiting Amsterdam. Very pleasant and relaxing. I was very lucky with the weather so I enjoyed the park for a nice picnic.

Walk in the Park. Lovely walk in beautiful green open space in the centre of Amsterdam.There are a couple of café's in the park to stop and take a break.Nice change of pace to the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam.
Beautiful place, great for cycling. I cycled around the park in the noon, the park is really beautiful. Its a great place to spend time.
Amsterdam's Central Park. The park is very large and of course it has nice water features of it's own. Great area for a bike ride, walk or picnic.

A nice place to take a break. We had decided to rent bikes for the day in Amsterdam and stopped here for a well deserved rest. This park is peaceful and quiet, even with the people in it. You can rest by the fountains and simply catch some ZZZ under a tree if the weather is nice. I recommend you take your bike through here and enjoy the views.
Great park. Very beautiful park, lots of sport activities, biking, walking or just for enjoying your coffee. Near the Rebrandpark and the Museum Square.

beware of ticks. A friend recently sat on a bench for the afternoon, later he discovered 3 ticks on his body. Please check yourself thoroughly, they are very small. For peace and quiet this is not the place to be. Gets rather crowded in the Summer. More for the younger crowd.
perfect place for a picnic. nice walk and good place for nice picnic when it's not raining in Amsterdam which is an opportunity that you should seize right away.

Great for a cycle and a picnic . My friends and I hired a bike and cycled around vondel park very relaxing and just something fun to do to pass the afternoon. We took a picnic and sat by the lake. A nice bit of tranquility in the centre of busy Amsterdam!

Stunning walk. We were recommended to visit Vondelpark and were not disappointed. There are lots of beautiful walking areas, and little trails to follow. It is very busy with bicycles, but nobody seems to be in a rush so a very relaxed atmosphere.We found a little eatery by a pond and sat with a nice cold beer while people watching.I would recommend visiting Vondelpark, it is a great addition to this city

Quiet, restful park.. We rented bikes to ride around the park (about 20 minutes in a circle). It's a beautiful place to sit and relax, or watch the morning work outs. The non traffic roads are nice and wide and makes biking a breeze (especially if you are not comfortable on Amsterdam roads!). Take a picnic and find a place near the water.
Its aiiiiight. Don't take mushrooms here. Its too busy come back for a barbeque or get Draaaank!!! The park is super crowded though so maybe just do something else...
Stunning park. An absolute must to see in Amsterdam. Such a lovely park to go for a walk around. Highly recommended.

Dirty and crowded. After reading the positive comments for this park I was expecting much more. The first thing I noticed was the cigarette butts everywhere. Actually most of the city is one big cigarette pile. The park is disgusting with rubbish everywhere. It was crowded with young people smoking ( mostly marijana) and bike riders running you over. The park does not look like it is looked after at all. Not at all a nice place to sit and relax. Probably one of worst city parks I have visited.
Great park. Fantastic place to visit when in Amsterdam, whether it be on foot or cycle. A welcome break from the hustle and bustle.

Relax time for kids. A really great place to unwind after museums in the morning. We liked the green spaces, lush grass for sitting, playing and walking around on. Climbing equipment, paddling pool, lots of people riding bikes.

Busy, but peaceful park. Nice relaxing park, with lots going on. Would hardly believe you are in a city once in there. Ideal for cycling around, especially to try out the pedal brake bikes before venturing onto the roads!

Bike ride. We realised our hotel had a bike hire on the last day and we got to bike around the park! We had come from england and i have to say it was a little bit of a home away from home. It was great took about 20 mins to bike around. Beautiful scenery!

Lively, yet relaxing - always something to see. The Vondelpark always seems to be buzzing with activity - a perfect place for people- watching. And yet it is restful, with beautiful old trees, sculptures, flower beds, fountains and quiet corners. I'm always amazed how much wildlife there is to see - plenty of herons, storks and squadrons of exotic green parakeets.There is a choice of venues to stop for a coffee, cake or ice-cream - the stylish art deco Blue Teahouse is my favourite, but the melkhuisje is also very nice and the restaurant in the Vondelpark pavillion is a good place to meet up with friends for a meal.On a summer Sunday there is nothing nicer than to take a stroll round the Vondelpark, enjoy a snack in one of the cafes and then have a look at the free concerts in the openlucht theater (just next to the Blue Teahouse). Classical, jazz, pop... there's always something worth seeing. Yesterday there were some great tango groups - a bit of Buenos Ares in Amsterdam.Watch out for the cyclists and rollerbladers and if you want a bit of peace and quiet head out to the Amstelveenseweg gate - it is much more peaceful down this end.

Perfect park for cycling & picnic. If you are hiring a bike for a day in Amsterdam, which I think most city visitors will, this lovely big green spot should be perfect to cycle around and enjoy park beauty.The park is so full of life in summer days where you'll see loads of cyclists, runners, lovers, bbq areas, picnics and more !

Beautiful park. We spent hours sitting on the grass in tge park on a beautiful sunny day in october. There is a pond with cranes hanging around and ducks. You can see a church in the distance. Very pretty. Lots of people where hanging out doing the same thing. Very popular.
ENJOYABLE PARK. Huge park close to the museums area, perfect for a relaxing break. Unfortunately we visited it with a bad weather.

Right outside our door!. The first two nights we were Amsterdam, we stayed at the ApolloFirst hotel, which was right across the street from the park. Before arrival, we had read about the new sculpture collection in the park, but had no idea it was outside our doors at the hotel. We wandered around the park and the weather was perfect. It was peaceful and beautiful and. Jot overrun with tourists. This was clearly a place the locals like to visit. Nah at a find!

Beautiful & relaxing park, but beware of pickpockets/ thieves. Beautiful park... my family of 4 rented bikes and rode through this beautiful park which is very lush, with great bike trails and easily accessible. Please, however, don't let your guard down... we put our backpack down while I was photographing my family and the next thing we know, it was gone! I remember a man looking at me very strangely and as I watched him act that way, I believe his "partner" then successfully swiped my bag.

Fine. Fine for younger children
Otherwise a bit boring
Notjing spcial but kids can around
Nice place to get ice cream
Beautiful must visit park. Beautiful park to visit either by Bike or by foot, worth spending a while there on a good day with a picnic and a few chilled drinks.

It's a park - nothing more. We rented bikes and rolled through the park. Stopped a couple of places and chilled. Watched the dogs play. A nice park, and a good getaway from the city. But it's still just a park. :-)
beautiful park. this park is huge and very beautiful. it gets croweded with people running and practising other sports. it is near the most famous museums of amsterdam.
It's just a park. A large park filled with people cycling, skating, or just lazing around on the grass. Good place to just chill if you have nothing else to do in Amsterdam.

Big green space. After a few hours (or days) of Amsterdam, all I wanted was space to relax - a walk to Vondelpark rewards with broad turfed areas and interesting views of the surrounding streets.You may encounter a few unfortunates, but at no time have I felt harassed or at risk. If anything, the low-level occupancy is somewhat comforting on days when traffic noise doesn't carry to your chosen relaxation spot.Don't expect a fancy space - this park is about space to live in!

It was okay. We biked there with high expectations but felt a bit disappointed. It's a nice park, with lakes and bike trails. Nice picnic area. Nothing wrong with it really. We just expected something amazing but in the end it was just a park. The great thing we liked about it is all the life: all the people sitting by the water, walking around, picnics, and lots and lots of people biking. Good place to relax and take a time out from your busy tourist schedule.

Nice place to sit in grass. Went there one afternoon after trip around town. Quite a lot of people, but couldn't say it felt crowded. Only nuisance were bikes - couldn't afford relaxing walk without watching out for speeding cyclists

good bike ride. Hire bikes and ride in the park. There is a good playground for the kids in the middle of the park in the bushes somewhere. I mean the large playground with climbing nets etc. Also, ride on the streets of the a nice quiet neighbourhood which is on the west side of the park. However, the cafes are not so good. The toilets are scarce and you need to pay for them.
Great park for strolling. Lots of locals jog, and even more use this park as a short cut on their bikes. Very pretty--nothing to go out of your way to see.

Beautiful park. Perfect for a nice BBQ. My partner and I prepared a picnic for the park. The park is beautiful and full of runners, cyclists and other people relaxing with food and drink. You are allowed to bring a small BBQ with coals or fire tablets and cook as there is no fire ban. You can also bring alcohol and weed if that's your thing as it's all allowed (the Netherlands is great).
Beautiful. An excellent, beautiful park in the middle of the city. Some great little cafes, great little corner and nooks for exploring, relaxing, picnicing. A must in my opinion.

Lovely place to relax!!. This is a lovely place to spend the day!! I recommend that you take a picnic with you and find somewhere to just sit and relax once you have had a wander around the park. It is very big and lovely and clean!! If you have children there is a play area that is fenced off so you can set yourself up in there and let the children play in the large pool area, the water seemed very clean like it had been treated, our 10 month played in there without any problems!Definitely recommend a lazy afternoon in here away from the chaos of Amsterdam!!

A breath of fresh air in the middle of Amsterdam. A few friends and I were looking to get away from the busy urban life that Amsterdam offers. Sure it's more open than most capitals with all the canals and relatively low structures, but it's still a city.Vondelpark is that spot of nature we were looking for. Situated close to the city center, the Park is wide and open with large pathways, lakes, small forest-y areas.You can have a picnic or a walk with your partner or a laugh with your mates while enjoying a spliff. Usual things you can do in a park.Some nice restaurants and bars as well, so you can grab a bite and a drink if you get the munchies.
open space. This is a large green space good walking great people watching picnic is a great thing to do very rejuvinating
Huge beautiful spot. There are all kind of spots in the park, from the quietness in the grass near the water, to the high activity in the children areas. It is also a good area to do some sport.

Awesome. Absolutely wonderful park. Clean, green and a perfect place to chill and watch the locals go by. Easy to get to and you can even have a barbecue in certain spots. What more can you ask for. At trip to Amsterdam is incomplete without a visit to Vondelpark.

Beautiful park. This is a must-see on your visit. The park is HUGE! It has beautiful mature trees, lots of paths for bikes, runners, and walkers. It would be fun to have a picnic or try one of the restaurants right in the park on a nice day.
a must in Amsterdam. Been there on a sunny day. Spent a couple of hours just wandering and watching the ducks. The best place for quiet afternoon.

A true Urban Park. A little oasis of calm in the perimeters of the bustling city. Plenty of wide walkways, small winding paths, old trees, grassy spots in sun and shade, lots of benches, a water feature, bandstand, cafe, street artist performances, plenty of dogs, bikes, rollerbladers, children....all in all, a great place for all, if a little on the small side ! (or is that just by London Hyde/Regents Park standards?!)

A Lovely Park to Visit. If you are a tourist and you are tired of exploring the museums such as Van Gogh or Rjiks Vondelpark is your best option! It's a short walk from the Museums to the park. It's a very peaceful, beautiful and clean enough place to rest. You may find icecream sellers inside, the icecream is fine too.
Go by bike. Well worth a visit especially on a bike, lovely park, picnic areas cafe, children's area and lakes. Take any exit always good to explore the area where locals actually live.

Love this place!. I love só much this Park. Specially at summer time is really nice to take a place there with some friends and eat something, picknick, or just walking around and relax. And of course ride a bike there...
Beautiful Park. This park is a gem in the middle of the city. Beautiful birds and lots of space for picnics and relaxing. Very much enjoyed our walks there
Beautiful. Vondelpark was great when i went Very big park lots to see. Beautiful for photography. Highly recommend. Park is easy to get too
Big park close to fancy areas. This park is huge and have many spots to enjoy nature in peace. There are many lake! Very nice spot to calm down from the hassle of the city.

Amsterdam visit is not compleet if you skip this park.. Not possible to visit Amsterdam and not having been in de vondelpark. It is a must for ervy tourist to e able to say you've been in de vondelpark. Amsterdam visit is not compleet if you skip this park.

A little piece of heaven. Me and my boyfriend hired bikes and cycled to Vondelpark and had a picnic. The sun shone the whole day. It's a big park so cycling is a necessity if you want to see all of it. It's bike friendly and beautiful. There are also a number of cafes in the park with toilet facilities and sell delicious mint teas and other refreshments

Greenery for a time-out. At the very centre, the park is a good place to escape the streets and cars and just enjoy the nature. It is dog friendly, it is a good spot for runners and fitness groups, hangouts and picnics, and also for family with kids.A wonderful getaway spot.

Pleasant run. Went running this morning at 730am. Nice park but need to make sure you are aware of all the cyclists. In fact there are more cyclists than runners. Park itself is quite clean and big enough to satisfy a morning run
Good sceneries. Vondelpark wasn't as good as Amsterdamse Bos....It's not as big but still you can get your dose of nature while being in central Amsterdam.

Lovely park, but very busy. Lovely park sprinkled with cafés and fountains, etc. really nice for a walk, but you need to be on your guard as the bikes and runners are everywhere and they seem to have priority over pedestrians and will not compromise!

Great place to go for some calm. Amsterdam is unique, beautiful and at times a little crazy.
Vondelpark offers a unique chance to go for some quiet time just a stones throw from the centre.
A great green space. This is a beautiful park in the city and a great place to walk and unwind at the end of a busy sightseeing day. If you are a runner, it is a great place to have a run!
Saw very briefly. Its nice to escape to a park - I would have like to see more of this however there was little to draw the teenage girls in.
Nice. Nothing really special about the park. It is a great place to sit under the sun, chill out, grab a couple of drinks. It can get quite busy sometimes.
Very calm. The park is a nice place to spend your time in if you want to relax or just don't have anything to do in Amsterdam at the time. It's pretty big if you want to walk through it though.

Love this place!. This park is the most beautiful park I've ever seen. It's fun (we rode through it with our hired bikes) and enjoyed watching all the people, kids & dogs enjoy the spacious and beautiful area.

A very busy place. We stayed just outside this fantastic open space and really enjoyed exploring the paths. You need to be alert though, as it is full of people on bicycles or running and you could quite easily get run over as they don't hang about! There always seemed to be something going on in the park and there were several eating places if you were hungry. We liked The Milk House, where they did soup and sandwiches/
Fantastic place. This one one of the most beautiful parks I have ever visited, plenty of room for lots of people & lovely little cafés, plenty of entrance & exit to just come and go

Slightly underwhelmed . A lovely Park don't get me wrong with gorgeous restaurant located there also but I was overwhelmed by the amount of people smoking cannabis in the park. It ruined the experience for me as it was all I could smell.
The Park. Loved this park. Was able to jog every morning as we were staying close. Watch out for the bikers. They are everywhere.

calm summer relaxing. Fantastic relaxed space. Free outdoor music through the summer. Great for cycling around or just sitting under a tree with a book. Herons on the canal and a large number of ducks outwith my limited species knowledge.
walk in the park. Went for a walk, had a little snack at the shop inside, and enjoyed a cold Heineken. we really enjoyed the typical relaxing walk around the park.

Beautiful green space.. This beautiful park is definitely worth a visit and a great place to have some time out from site seeing. We hired bikes from our hotel and rode through the park which was a very enjoyable way to see it.
Average. It is an average park with too many people and bikers. We couldn't enjoy ourselves here. Not worth a visit.

A charming afternoon. We rented bikes and rode through this beautiful park. It was well worth it. Bring some bread and stop by one of the ponds to feed some ducks. A relaxing way to see part of Amsterdam's nature.

Great park to visit. Nice park to visit in Amsterdam very close to Van Gogh museum. It is a large park with lakes and lots of walking trails and grass area. People enjoy biking, walking, BBQing and sunbathing. Music is played in the park and other season activities go on as well. Lots of benches to sit down and relax. A must after a day at the museum!
Just nice!. I haven;t been there during a festival or a show! So I can say it's just a nice park, a little wild, like all the Dutch parks, I think. Lots of bikers and pleasant places to rest or walk.
Tranquility in the city. Excellent place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city, chill out, people watch or picnic. Close to Van Gough Museum
English style park. A great English style park with curved foot paths, artificial ponds, and marked trees. A wonderful place to run and walk in the city.
Gorgeous park. This is a gorgeous park to take a stroll in and enjoy being outside. It's a short walk from the museums and worth going out of the way for.
Beautiful. Its a fabulous garden,very beautiful and lively. However there are not enough sign boards. We did not find any play area of kids even after an hour of walking.

gorgeous!. beautiful, sprawling park. when the weather is nice, the park fills up with people relaxing in the sun, playing soccer, grilling, reading, running, and just hanging out. excellent place to bike through, run through, walk through, or sit down and relax.
Lovely park. I didn't stay in the park, I only walked through it. But it was very beautiful with the mix of paths, water, and open spaces. A great place to bike, roller-blade, walk, picnic, etc.

Nice break in the city centre. Park next to the major museums , easy to find , and perfect for a picnic in between the sights or the designer shopping the area has to offer. Suggest renting a bicycle to get around if you wish to explore all of it . Safe , and cafes offer pricey but good food.
Nice park . Well I like this park it's always been a nice walk if I'm going to make a short cut to the Amsterdam sign or to go like chill for real

Lovely. Simply lovely.. On previous visits we stayed near the park and I really missed being nearby this past visit. We were located near the station this time bus vowed to bike over to this memorable bit of green heaven. When we rode our bikes to this idyllic part of town my 12 year old actually said he felt as if it were a 'different Amsterdam'. Such a pretty park...really. Very relaxing. My son enjoyed it at age 4, 7 and now at 12. Oh...and I did too. But not revealing my age. lol.
Beautiful Park. Great place to ride a bike and eat a picnic! Just big enough to spend the whole day riding around it whilst stopping for a sunbathe or two.

Plenty to do. My hotel was nearby so I had a short stroll one evening. Not a formal park, lots of locals using it for running, cycling etc. there was a concert area and places to eat. It was all very cool and green on a warm evening.

Good park.Not great.. Went for a stroll around the park.The weather had been appalling and had blown down some trees so I didn't see this place at its best.Litter and moron free.Not as eye catching or oasis-like as other major city parks and not as landscaped. I wouldn't say it's a must if visiitng Amsterdam from what I saw.Amusing to see a geriatric falling asleep on a bench , his head lolling all over the place.That was me.It amused a group of lads sitting on the grass who were obviously ecstatic at seeing sunshine after days of apocalyptic storms.And who can blame them.

Beautiful park close to many Amsterdam attractions. Vondelpark is a beautiful park situated near other great spots in Amsterdam, such as Museumplein, Leidseplein, and Rembrandtpark, and definitely has its own goods to bring to the table. We went here to enjoy the sunny day and lied down on the grass for awhile, taking the weather and all of the surroundings in. I'm a big fan of Amsterdam's habit of putting fitnesstoestellen (fitness parks, or "adult playgrounds", if you will) in their parks so people can work out for free on the metal they set up there. There's plenty of space to bike or walk here, as usual per parks in the Netherlands, and there are quite a few restaurants and things to do around this area. Definitely recommended for a relaxing stroll or some exercise!
Pretty park with lots of space. I stayed right near the park and went for walks in it a few times. It's pretty, with varied landscapes and lots of spaces to do ... whatever.
A little haven of calm in the city centre.. A really beautiful park with lots going on in the summer, music, attractions and a perfect place for a picnic.
Quiet. The park was quieter then most places in Amsterdam during July. It's great to get away from the noise. Would recommend going to the park.

Green park. A big, green nice park where you could relax, walk, bicycle or bbq. I didn't walk through it all but as far as I can tell it was a poular spot and I would like to explore it more next time.
Nice place to go for a walk and people-watch. Spent a little time just wandering through and around this park and enjoyed the views. Very near museums and nightlife in Amsterdam

Fantastic Park!. Vondelpark is a very popular and busy place when the sun is out! Both the locals and the tourists were out in full force on the sunny day we visited. We took our boys (4yrs & 8yrs) in search of this great play area but we ended up at a smaller play area instead which made the boys quite happy. We spent just a good hour in the play area before exploring different areas. There is plenty of space for families, couples, and anyone who wanted to relax in the park. Very easy walking and stroller and bike (of course, it is in Amsterdam after all) friendly. We highly recommend this park especially if you have children!!
Piece of nature in the middle of the megapolis. Like: huge, lots of trees, birds, pondsDislike: nothing actually, but it was a little bit unusual to see police car making circles in the park area.

A beautiful park in the middle of Amsterdam. We were introduced to this beautiful park in the middle of Amsterdam by our city tour guide as a shortcut through the city and it was a respite on an otherwise very warm day. Lots of walking, biking, running, blading and laying on the lawns by the locals as we visited on a Saturday. The trees, shrubs and flowers were beautiful.

A nice park for relaxation. The park is large with many colorful flowers and many lakes with ducks , it is excellent place to spend a nice time for relaxation and a safe enjoyable place for kids to run and enjoy ice creams and the fresh air , it is ideal place for a family with kids allowing kids to have fun away from busy shopping streets and historical sight seeing

OK if you have nothing better to do.. As the weather was nice the Park was packed. People were picnicking, tanning and generally just chilling. The Park seemed nice enough, but nothing special, although ,in fairness I must say that I only saw a very little bit of it.
Perfectly spent day. We've got a nice day with lots of sunshine, found this lovely café with bean bags and enjoyed a small bottle of Prosecco while watching the bicycles go by

Kids slides are in SW corner, okay for young kids.. Beautiful park, lots of lovely restaurants, people hanging out. We loved how it was divided up into lots of little park areas, but no overall map made it difficult to find things with small kids along. Finally found crazy tall slides that are shown in many pictures of the park. Slides are more for older kids, 4-5 is minimum, 8-9 better. But that is it for that area. Our kids were pretty disappointed with park's offerings. After Luxembourgh Gardens in Paris this expectations for playgrounds have increased, and this was a little disappointing.The stick / wood playground was cool, creative, and they liked that, but still a little disappointed by playground equipment.

Beautiful.. Despite Amsterdam not being a particularly busy city, Vondelpark is still an oasis of peace inside the city. Wonderfully green with plenty of water and sculptures. A brilliant place to relax.

Give yourself a break and catch your breath in one of the nicest parks in Dam. Huge park in the heart of Amsterdam, right next to Leidseplein and Rijksmuseum. Place to chill, get lunch, tea, with barbecue spots and lot of space to do sports also. Park is always full of people, you might end up spending more than half a day there. Beautiful atmosphere and always quiet (unless there's a concert organised, but even then there's places you can't hear the music from).
Great place to just walk. People watching and fresh air are wonderful as you walk through the park. Watch out for the bicyclists, however!

Fantastic!. My friends and I went to this park our first night in Amsterdam after having so many issues with our Airbnb we had rented, and it was so relaxing. I recommend bicycling through the park as it's perfect for that. Keep your eyes out for hidden trails that lead to flower gardens and water fountains!

Perfect place for a cycle ride or picnic. This is a beautiful open space in the centre of town, paid for and setup by a bunch of philanthropic folks from the city. It's the perfect place to have a picnic or to cycle around, exploring all of the nooks and crannies as you go.There are outdoor performance spaces, a dog-friendly park, conservation areas and BBQ areas too. Well worth a visit if you are in town for the weekend.Top Tip - hire bikes for a day and cycle through all of the parks.
Near by. This is a green park nearby Marriott where you can take a great walk on a sunny day. it is only few minutes walk from Mariott.

Interrailing. After hiring bicycles, my party and I decided to explore Vondelpark, with the intention of only being there an hour or so. However as it was so beautiful, we stayed there the whole day, to have a picnic for lunch and then a disposable barbecue for dinner.

a lovely green spot in the outskirts og the buisy city. A beatiful if not the best in Amsterdam , that you just have to spend a day in. Bring along a picnic basket and a good botle of wine , and you can enjoy the Whole day. There are several tracks to walk on , beautifull ponds to rest by and here you see the greeness og Amsterdam at its best

So peaceful!. If you've spent any time at all in the center of Amsterdam in the afternoon, you've probably realized how hectic and intense and crowded this little city is. If you need a break from this, just go for a walk or a bike ride in beautiful, calm Vondelpark. A little off the center, it is located near Museumplein. Perfect spot for a picnic or a beer with your travel buddies!

A great place to escape the hustle of Amsterdam. In between rushing from attraction to attraction, I decided to take a stroll through Vondelpark. This stroll ended up lasting for 3 hours and it was just what I needed after a taxing day. Whether you're going to the Heineken Brewery, Anne Frank Huis or anyone of the amazing museums, it's definitely worth stopping by Vondelpark to take a breather. It's a stunning place to gather your thoughts, have a picnic and relax.

One of the best parks of Europe. A beautiful place - an oasis of nature, just off one of the busiest canals of Amsterdam. Great place to rest and take some fresh breaths while exploring Amsterdam. Enthusiasts can also make their own barbecue, if they want in the special designated areas.

Summer respite away from the madness. Wonderful park for jogging, walking or picnicking. We went the day after a major wind/rain storm but the downed trees and branches were cleared from all paths and the park was teeming with life.

Great place to run and people watch. Amsterdam's equivalent to Central Park, just smaller. About 2 miles to run around the outside. I love to run it in the early morning and then stroll through it in the afternoon when families, young lovers and partiers all share the large grass areas.

A beautiful place to walk.. We visited the Vondelpark in early May 2015. It was a great place to walk. If you run, it would be a great place to run. It was within walking distance of the hotel we stayed at - Hotel Aalders, so if you stay there be sure to take a walk in the park.

Great park and free music too!. This is one of Amsterdam's great places, for strolling, picnicking, roller blading and cycling. And in the middle is the open air theatre, Openluchttheater. First class music of all sorts can be found here, and hundreds of locals flock there every summer Sunday. Don't forget to give a donation when the collecting tin comes round to keep it going!
Beautiful Park in the heart of the city. Great on a summers day for just walking, sitting with friends or just to get away from the movement of traffic.

Lovely Park. This park was right next to our hotel and as the weather was beautiful we took a wee picnic of wine, cheese and apple for a walk. We were there for almost three hours. Very peaceful after a hectic sightseeing session in the morning and rest of the holiday. Makes a difference when the sun is shining
A wonderful oasis. This is a real gem of place where the locals and tourist go to relax and chill out. There are lakes and picnic and BBQ areas.

Beautiful place. Spent a Sunday afternoon here . Don't book a tour, go to the supermarket just close to the main strip and get provisions for an afternoon tea x we had a lovely wine / tapas for under 20 euros and a full afternoons relaxation. Much better than following a tour guide.
Amazing . Incredible park so much going on but such a laid back feel. It's soo big we didn't get chance to explore all of it, next time we will rent bikes and make a point to travel round vondelpark.
Love it. We went to this park with the bikes we rented and it was the best thing we did. Big and full of people walking, cycling or laying in the grass. You must pay a visit when in Amsterdam.

Thousands of people in the park at 10:30 at night!. It was a warm July and vacation time so the park was pleasantly teeming with people at 10:30 at night. We walked from one end to the other. We had been at Restaurant Blauw and walked back towards the Centraal station. What a delightful experience!!!

Beautiful . A very nice clean and well designed urban park. It seems rather small in comparison to other urban parks in Europe but it keeps its own charm. It is the closest park to the city center so expect to find it crowded. Also beware of the cyclists while walking.

Amazing park. Do yourself a favor to escape the crowds in Amsterdam and visit this park. It is beautiful and fun to walk thru it. There are a few cafes but we saw many locals picnicking in the park and wished we had done the same.

Enjoyable bike ride. Many people were out for a day in the park following a day of rain and severe winds that toppled many trees. The park bike paths are well maintained. We stopped briefly to listen to a free classical music concert that played to a full house.

I don't know why, but I absolutely loved it!. I just went for a casual bike ride by myself on this amazing sunny day. I sat on the ground and watched people and listened to music and read my book. It was amazing. There are also a few really nice cafes with REALLY decently priced food (which was a surprise).. I got 3 fried eggs, a couple of pieces of toast, salad and bacon and a soda/soft drink for 6 euros or something. Get to Vondelpark.
Lovely. It was convenient for us to go since it was very close to where we stayed. Felt great jogging in the park with local runners. Green and peaceful...
Great greenery. Went here on a sunny day and it was great. It's full of people but still a great place to relax or take a bike ride

Relaxing and beautiful. We spent a lovely afternoon in Vondelpark, in very warm and sunny weather. It's a huge park and beautifully maintained. On the day we went it was full of people sunbathing, playing games, playing music, having a picnic, cycling and generally relaxing. We walked round the whole park taking in the delightful rose garden and stopping for a cold drink at the cafe. Great for friends, couples, families.

Oh how I love this park!. Vondel Park is an oasis in this large, chaotic city. There are plenty of grassy areas and little lakes to lounge by and people watch. You can see walkers, joggers, and bicycles all in motion as folks traverse this park on their way to somewhere. I take a blanket and snacks with me but there are snack carts and restaurants on the fringe, as well as an Albert Heijns and Marqt store within walking distance. Dont miss a trip or two to this beauty!
Great for bikes. We rode out bikes around this park. It was nice, with colorful flowers, bike paths, green grass and live music.

My Favourite Place in Dam. My Advice is to grab a six pack of Juplier, a gram (or two) of Silver haze and head for Vondelpark. Such beautiful surroundings escape away from the hustle and bustle of the streets and relax in the sun. Bliss!
Beautiful. Lovely park with such a great family atmosphere. Myself and my boyfriend rented a bike and we had such a lovely day. It is closely located to the Hard Rock Cafe, shops and museums.

Beautiful!. Beautiful park in Amsterdam. It's huge and well maintained and has spaces for everyone. Playgrounds for young children, big spots for people playing soccer or Frisbee and space to set up for a picnic. A nice break from sightseeing.

Lots of dog droppings!. Needs a bit of a thorough clean up as there was lots of dog droppings and cigarette butts scattered on the grass. Many people also congregating to share a drink and smoke which confirmed why there was a stronger police presence on bikes than what we had seen in other parks.I enjoyed the grassy park area outside of the I AMSTERDAM sign more than here. That park has trees to lie under on a sunny day plus lots of room to play football and frisbee. Vondelpark was more limited in this regard due to its many lakes. It's also busier due to the bike traffic running through it.
Stroll in the evening. Beautiful gardens, nice break for the rush of the city. Go after dinner for a walk and see the sculpture and well tended gardens

Huge Park. Go rent a bicycle (you're in Amsterdam anyways) and take it to Vondelpark. We spent quite a long time leisurely biking around this park, climbing willow trees, having a picnic, and of course people watching. We went on a Tuesday afternoon and it was great. I heard on the weekends it gets wildly packed.

Were it not for all the litter .... I was most surprised on visiting the park again in July at the vast amount of litter everywhere in the park. This completely spoils the beautiful park and the scenery.Apart from the litter, it's a beautiful and scenic park and well worth visiting.Dont forget to take your skates if you have them as you can also skate round it!!

Relaxing spot in the middle of musuem district. This is the best place to relax after or before any visit to the attractions in the musuem didtrict, like Van gogh, Stederlijk musuem of modern art or concertgebouw. There is a supermarket called Albert Heijn under the big ramp st the end of the park close to concertgebouw. Buy something there & have a picnic there.
Prince of parks. It's a living space. Places to eat and drink, flowers, wildlife (look out for the parakeets) exercise, beautiful people, barbeques, art.

Fun way to spend an afternoon. Beautiful park located in Amsterdam that is a nice break from sightseeing. There are several food options available in the park, with lots of benches to sit down as well. We walked the entire grounds and enjoyed 3-4 hours there.
Great to relax. Great for families or indivduals, everyone just goes to relax or exercise or drink but there is so much space for everyone. Vondelpark is a must do when travelling to amsterdam.

Perfect place to cycle and lounge. There's plenty of calming and beautiful water features, and grassy areas to have a picnic or just relax, especially in the summer sun. The park boasts multiple cafes for true Amsterdam life. Doesn't seem to be problematic for families with young children despite the fact that people smoke cannabis, as it was still populated with families and dogs all enjoying the atmosphere together. Bikes are welcome which is nice since the roads are smooth and wide, perfect for cruising. Definitely worth seeing.

Beautiful well loved park. If the weather is good take the time to stroll or bike in Vondel Park. There are bike rentals near the park and early Saturday morning it is a good place to practice bike skills. (Note we are bike riders and only rode in Vondel Park while in Amsterdam as we felt that we were in over our heads riding in Amsterdam. We spent two weeks using Leiden as a base and rode everywhere.)

It's a nice Park!. My review: "It's a nice park. So is Central Park. So is Griffith Park. So is McCambridge Park down the street. It's a nice park!"My wife's review: "That's a bit harsh!" "I thought it was a beautiful park!" "Don't you remember the brick houses next to the park and how pretty it was?" "It was way better than Griffith Park, or even that park next to Buckingham Palace in London!" "Why would you even mention McCambridge Park?" "That's just stupid!"It's a (very) nice park!

A bit dirty. I was on a business trip to Amsterdam and went for a run through the park. I was disappointed. It was dirty and didn't have a nice atmosphere. This was middle of the day on a Monday. Couldn't wait to get out of there.
Peaceful and stunning. It was just a nice place to relax with a joint and look at the breath taking scenery, i could have stayed there all day
Nothing special.. Nice place for sitting out in the sun, but little to really make it stand out. A small tea room and theatre, but little to do other than sit.

Beautiful park in the middle of Amsterdam. Great place to walk, bike, and grab a to go order and eat at the park. Great place to people watch. All kinds from all over the world. Just a nice place to relax from all the crowded hustle bustle of the city Amsterdam.

Definitely worth a visit. Vondelpark is a great way to change the scenery in the middle of the city. Its also a great through road by foot or bike to get to other parts of the city.There is lots to see, including a pond, ducks, birds, and generally some street performers. There is also a restaurant/bar and food takeaway places. When I visited there were some people practicing rollerblading and the generated a big crowd watching them.

Amazing park with a variety of playgrounds. I went with my 3-year-old and we had a great day! First we went to the playground in the south-west corner. It has some great climbing equipment, but a bit too big for my child. There was a big sandpit though that was great fun. Next, we went to the treetop paths. While my little one was a bit slow in the paths, she found it great fun and went through 5 or 6 times. Finally, we went to the playground with a little shallow pool alongside smaller playground equipment (slide, swings, see-saw, climbing frame) and spent a couple of hours there splashing and playing. Such a great place!

Entertaining and relaxing. The park has many different food stands and features artwork that one can sit and enjoy while eating a Belgian waffle. I found it a very small version of Central Park in the sense that there were areas of grass to lounge and have a picnic but also food to enjoy with company. Although it is certainly not on the scale of Central park, I found the park enjoyable for a lunch time stroll.

Great for relaxing and running. Going to a park is always great when visiting a city in the summer. Amsterdam's Vondelpark is no exeption. Besides relaxing, the park is also a great location for runners.
Beatiful. Beautiful park. Can be reached by walk from Van Gogh museum.Enjoyed open air lunch and it was great.

A wonderful place. Vondelpark is a highly recommended wonder place for resting and relaxing. Located very close to Leidsplein.It is quite big and has 2 big lakes with lots of shaded areas to sit under and a handful of snack vendors. It just adds more charm to Amsterdam. Attached are some photos taken by me.

Beautiful park in the heart of amsterdam. This park is beautiful. It is a must for visitors in Amsterdam. I recommend to use a bicycle to visit the most of the park (as I also recommend a bike for general transportation in the city).

Why do this?. Leave this to young people who may feel the need to sit on the grass. You probably need to get there early to find a spot. Very little in the way of seating. Ordinary toilet facilities. This is a public park that is plain and simple suffering from overuse. There were some people badly affected by either alcohol or drugs. Over crowded bike paths which can be challenging for pedestrians to cross. Saw one accident that could have turned out bad. Beware the lesser used paths because they can be lined with poison ivy.

Lovely . This park is pretty and allowed us a nice respite from the city. There are a lot of cute dogs and interesting birds around like grey heron. Food and drink sold just about everywhere. Great place to go and relax :)!

Beautiful and peaceful... A must visit in Amsterdam. Don't miss the chance to visit Vondelpark if you are visiting Amsterdam. It's a pretty big park with a wide "road" on which you could walk or bike. I highly recommend biking through the park and occasionally resting and enjoying the view or time with your friends or family. For me, it was one of the highlights of my visit to Amsterdam. Just exquisite and so peaceful and quiet (even when crowded).

a large park in the middle of Amsterdam. Went in the middle of summer.Nice park, not very big , cyclists and people walking in the park. lots of couples enjoying n evening out.Some mobile carts with food and dinksMany seem to be locals and a relaxing atmosphere.Nice for a good stroll , probably better in the mornings.We went in the afternoon, most of the time is peaceful. However we found in the central area quite a few groups having a party. Quite a few individual drunks too.It did spoil the atmosphere somewhat for us.Surprising , people drinking beer in the park. Was there last summer(year) and were told off by the cops when quaffing a beer sitting on the edge of a canal. We were warned !
Relaxing!. Great place for picnic and just watch everything going on around you! My husband and I just grabbed a bench and watched everything going on round us,

Greak bike ride around the park. Lovely park! We hired bikes and rode around the park, we enjoyed it so much we turned around and cycled around it again!There are places to buy refreshments and plenty of green space to have picnics etc. A must do in Amsterdam!

Beautiful. What an oasis in the middle of such a fantastic city. We visited here twice during our stay. It was so nice to wander through the park and sit by the lake. I loved the amazing BBQ area they have. Delightful to see people arriving with their BBQ's on their bikes - cooking, playing music and having a good time. Its so relaxed and really beautiful. Its very central and easy to find.
Summertime. It is always a nice atmosphere in the park. You can sit in the gras and you also can BBQ. You can enjoy the Blue Teahouse.

Lovely park. Large park, lots of interesting paths, ride a bike or you won't cover it all on foot! Several places to eat, and portaloos dotted around. Had an excellent burger at the main eaterie, the one with kids play area attached.

Beautiful park. Wonderful park with places to eat, drink and sit throughout. Filled with huge green areas and flower gardens, pond areas and water fountains! I went in summer so it was very busy from 11am onwards - so much so that it was difficult to find a place to sit. But all in all, beautiful
A Beautiful Park!. I really enjoyed walking through this park every morning when on my way into the city centre. Incredibly beautiful park with many cyclists and families passing through!
Relaxing Location. Ideal spot to sit and watch the world go by after visiting the many museums which are located nearby. If lucky, there is often an open air concert taking place.

A perfect pplace to come for an afternoon stroll. We went there directly after lunch to burn some calories :) The place has wonderful water features, nice flowers, plenty of places for kids to play, and is generally arranged very nicely. If you want some diversity during your visit - this is a lovely place for a short visit.
Gents - yes, ladies - didn't dare :)
Great chillout during your visit. On a sunny day this is great to just chill, do some people watching, be amazed at the number of bikers and have a coffee or beer in one of the cafes.
city park. nice and big park, so long you have to walk atleast twenty minutes from one side to other, you have some ducks in the lakes and peacefully places in 0/24 living city
Nice place for a picnic!. Really nice and quiet place where you can relax with the locals, have a picnic or just a nice walk..
Relaxing respite in a busy city. It is a beautiful park, but it was just too hot to explore when we were there. We could see lots of people enjoying the grassy areas and lake

Lovely park near the Museumplein and the Leidseplein. The Vondelpark is a lovely place to go to walk, picnic and ride bicycles. There are restaurants and refreshments, and lovely gardens and fountains, too. The extensive paths were especially welcomed after riding our bicycles on the city streets.....it was so much more enjoyable! Especially recommended for family bike rides.
Beautiful park. Lovely Park to cycle through or to have a picnic in. Can get very busy but a lovely armosphere and includes a gym for those who want to burn a few more calories.

My most favourite park in Dam. I truly love Vondelpark. It's the one place I always yearn to revisit when i go to Amsterdam. I love the wide open spaces and how its used as a cycle haven- people commute to and from work, cycling through this huge park. The park is 47 hectares which is plenty of park for everyone! A great place to visit on a sunny day AND on a bike! You will truly love it like i do.

this park is wonderful. green, nice people, enough room to skate, play, relax on the wide lawns. the atmosphere is just wonderful. skip breakfast at your hotel and have a sandwich in the Vondelpark, fe at the Blauwe Theehuis in the Vondelpark.
Great for chilling. The Vondelpark is a great place to chill out: my friends and I kept coming back. There is a great atmosphere and places to buy fast food and use the loo in this extensive space.

Lovely park. A beautiful park with lots to see!
The park is really busy but it's so big it's not much of a problem
We cycled around the park and it was really a great way to see it. There's lots of sculptures, lakes and fountains. It's a really nice, big, open and clean area to visit.
Vondelpark. Lovely walk through this park, stopped off for a drink. Great to bike round. Great to take photos , can just sit and relax, have barbecues , play football lots to do
Lovely place to relax. Walked around on our final day, got a beer at one of the bars in the park- brilliant place to relax and chill out. Rent a bike and have a nice cycle round!

Vondelpark The most famous garden in the Netherlands. When in Amsterdam, you must have been in the park named after The ancient Dutch poet Vondel; the famous Vondelpark. The park has lots of similarities with the city it represents: Amsterdam. It is impressive, cosy, open, non-conformistic, you find people of all nationalities doing what They want to do at that moment. People jog, cycle, walk their diog, do excersis, barbecue, picnic, play and the sheer amount of people doing that all together gives the Vondelpark its magic. Go and walk through the Vondel park and smell your magic !Your life will never be the same; since 'you have been there'.

Nice park. Very nice park. Has a lovely path going through different routes in the park. A delightful pond with various birds in and some colourful flowers make this a key part of any Amsterdam visit.

Beautiful green space. Great for families and people who want to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. A good space to cycle and to go for a picnic. Near good restaurants and coffee shops, take a walk through the park after a good meal out.

Nice place to get some rest and quiet but not a destination. We didn't make Vondelpark one of our destinations but had old information on Tulip Island which was an exhibit last year. The website should be updated because it is not here this year. Vondelpark is a nice city park with safe walking areas and shade. It looks like they make a point to provide free arts and music as there is a packed schedule of theatre programming. It did bring many people which was nice. Compared to other parks I've been to it could use a decent clean up. I wouldn't suggest it as a destination but a nice respite from your busy walking around Amsterdam if you are in the area. We didn't feel unsafe but note it did seem like there were some people using the park as a place to sleep. You do find this in every large metropolitan city. It shouldn't be a deterrent because it is large enough to have a cool, shaded pleasant walk or bike ride. In fact, it is safer to walk and bike ride here than in the city!.We did like hanging out at Vondelpark3 a restaurant at the entrance. Here you will find a very healthy mix of guests, great food and atmosphere. Check out my separate review.

In the middle of action . The park is located in the middle of amsterdam you can get off tram#5 at RJK museum and walk fwd 300meters to park .recommended to go in the morning .the park is free to enter and has beautiful greenish surrounding.you can walk ,cycle,relax .. Picnic or even talk to friendly locals.if you have extra time just give it look .

Lovely but crowded park. We wandered about Amsterdam by tram and thought we'd give this park a visit. It was a sunny afternoon, the park was lovely, but it was well patronised. And you could get a little disoriented by the many curved paths
Beautiful and don't miss it. A very beautiful and relaxed environment. If you have time, spend two hours there and breath in the fresh air. A very good spot for photographer too.

Vondel Park. Beautiful on a sunny day,bring a picnic and sit on the grass and relax,or if u wish to exercise while away this park is a perfect spot for a long jog just watch out for all the bikes flying around try and stay along the sides...its safer,ul meet people from all walks of life and many difeerent cults and religions also like to gather here its quiet an extraordinary sight

Relaxing oasis in the middle of Amsterdam. This park was beautifully-designed. It is also quite large, but in spite of its size, it was very crowded when I went, maybe because it was summer and the height of the tourist season. Nevertheless, it is somewhat of an oasis in bury, fast-paced Amsterdam

Amsterdam's very own Central Park. Amsterdam's very own Central Park, Vondelpark is huge but easily doable on foot. Many quiet spots here but also a fun and vibrant park overall, where groups of people picnic, or workout, or just relax and breathe in the fresh air. It's perfect in summers.

Great morning start from here. My 14 years old son and I jogged to Vondelpark when we stay in Amsterdam. Round trip from one side of park to another is about 3 K, it's not a big park but nice to walk or jogging in the park. There are many beautiful birds to see.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park to enjoy a stroll or a bike ride on a sunny day. It's filled with people during the summer. One of the nicest places in Amsterdam for sure.
beautiful park. Very beautiful park. Lots of people practice jogging or outdoor fitness. Also perfect for long walk with friends or family. I really enjoy it.

Beautiful place for a bike ride. On sunny days you can easily spend an entire afternoon exploring, cycling, sunbathing and picnicking amongst the stunning scenery of Vondelpark. One of my favourite places to visit on a lazy Sunday.

Favourite spot in Amsterdam. Huge park to wander around, great for people watching all day and well into the evening. Loads of cyclists, runners, bbq areas, nature reserve for wildlife, really full of life! Beautiful place on a summer's day, Vondelpark 3 is a great place for a drink with it's terrace overlooking the park. Great to find open space away from the hustle & bustle of the city.

Very beautiful and relaxing park. We've visited this park twice during our 1 week vacation at Amsterdam. The place gets quite populated during the weekend however we still managed to find quiet areas to relax in. During the week it's very relaxing, perfect for a jog or bike ride. Will visit again when I'm back in Amsterdam

A Classic in Amsterdam. Although perhaps a bit over-touristic, even locals keep coming bank to the park because it is big enough to stay relaxing and it is a wonderful place to relax or just watch people. Very near to the center and offers enough services (toilets, food, drinks and ice cream)
Spread out, under renovation. Interesting area, but no main attraction? Some concert that late afternoon, dog walking, lawn tanning, etc!

Hire some bikes. With the IAmsterdam pass you can get something like 20% off the bike hire so hire some push bikes and enjoy the ride.
There are a few places to stop for drinks so take your time and enjoy!
Pleasant park. In the middle of the city there is a park where everything was perfect:) if you want you can just sit in the grass :) There was a lot of beautiful trees , lakes and benches :)
Great place for a picnic. The park is spectacular vegetation-wise, but you still have to keep your eyes on the road and watch all the people on bikes.
Great place away from the city centre. Beautiful tranquil park, found it very clean with plenty of places to grab a bite to eat or drink. Full of cyclist enjoying the atmosphere.

Amazing park hiding in plain sight. We rented bikes on our second day in Amsterdam and lot out with no set route. When we saw the gates to the park we ducked in. What a great and vibrant space!! So much activity and fun going on all around.
"An Oasis in the Middle of the City". A great place to relax and get a way from the hustle and bustle of the city. A walking and bicycle park. Great people watching.

A lovely park. Beautiful park with lakes and a lovely café. It was great just to get away from the busy City Centre and just sit in the park. Lots of people were jogging, biking, playing and just having fun. After walking the red light district it was good to get away from the smell of marijuana, however it wasn't long before some young guy sat behind us with the largest spliff I have ever seen!
Mellow out maaan. Good for tripping, watch out for the Herons though... And the Coots, in fact all the bird life is a little shifty...

Lovely place. Vondelpark is nice place to chill and its massive. Its right near van gogh museum, rijks museum and the concert hall. To get to vondelpark catch the number 2 tram intill you get to the rijks museum stop its about a 15 minute tram ride. Enjoy.

Free as a Bird. This Park is 120 acres in the Centre of town and is a great way to get out of the hustle of the city and relax. Initially owned by a few citizens to create a park for the city, than sold back for the public to use. Was apart of the hippies who frequented the place in the 60's and 70's and liberated Amsterdam and explains while most activities are tolerated in the park at night.
Great for a Run. Nice place to take a morning run without fear of being run over by a bicycle! The paths are flat, wide and easy to navigate.
Cool place to relax. Spend a few hours here, especially on a nice day when it can be crowded, but offers some good people watching
Have a rest. Have a rest at the Vondelpark under the shiny sun.Perfect place to relax while looking at the grey heron.

Great place to chill out. No better place to be on a beautiful day in Amsterdam than on the grass in the park with a drink. Lovely atmosphere although it can get crowded during good weather so be prepared. A must while in the city if you've got the weather to do so.
Peace. Walked through here a few times on a recent trip to Amsterdam - a haven of peace and tranquillity among the hustle and bustle. Very nice environment for a quiet cycle ride.

Lovely park. Stayed there for couple hours, it was so relaxing. There are many people doing picnic since it was sunday but it was ok. I could take a nap there. People do what they want there, bbq, dance, play a music, biking etc.
Great place for a Sunday walk. There are small water parks for children, many people pack picnics and bike/walk around the park on Sunday. It is a very relaxing place to be to enjoy an afternoon.
Beautiful Park. Great bike riding with a few places to eat enjoyed the bike riding with out the craziness of cars and scooters. In the centre of town and easy to get to.
Great Park. Ride a bike around or take a jog. This is a very nice park and it is a great place to escape the city. I would suggest seeing it!
Great place for a lazy afternoon. Good for a rest after long day of sightseeing, especially when hot. Pick some salad from nearby grocery store, lay down on the grass, take a book and enjoy
Peaceful, beautiful. It feels very safe to walk through here. Lots of people-watching to be done. Locals and tourists chilling on the vast lawns and next to the dams and rivers.

The Blue Tea House. The park is huge but the blue tea house is not as good. They serve mainly drinks and a few option of sandwiches. Not so much a place for a proper meal. So if you are looking for a to waste time, then yes. But if you are looking for a place for food, you better get your own food. Definitely a great place for picnic.
The place for a sunny . This is the best place to bike to on a sunny day.Just make sure to bring a nice picnic basket for you to enjoy the day.......
Peaceful.. Great to find a green oasis in the middle of the city. Vast area, just pick your place and enjoy the scenery.
Lovely. We stayed at Piet Hein hotel, right above the park and used it as a non-traffic option. Watch out for the bikes though! Great place for a evening walk after sightseeing.

Lovely. Such a great place for a picnic or a bike ride. There is a also a "Iamsterdam" sign there that is half as busy as the other ones. The place. It is acceptable to bring your alcohol and goods here and enjoy them in the open.
Beautiful Park. Go for a walk in this amazing park... and maybe stop for a beer or two :-)great place in the summer and winter

One of my favorite places in Amsterdam. The park is beautiful on a summers day, all the locals come out and there is a lot to see, such as performers, free concerts and much to do like bbq-ing, cycling around, have lunch in one the little restaurants, or just read a book in the sun! The park is beautifully surrounded by nice architecture.
Beautiful. A wonderful break from the busy city and all the bikes. We stopped for a picnic before going to all the museums in that area. A really picturesque peaceful place.

Wonderfully quiet in the evenings. Great for an evening stroll along wide, tended gravel paths, walking past quiet picnicers, open-air fitness classes, many types of songbird, mini-lakes and rose gardens. Restful and serene - a 'must-do'.
Lovely park. Beautiful park in the centre of Amsterdam, picnic & barque area. Plenty of hotdog vans & cold drinks although no ice cream. Perfect for a relaxing hour away from it all.
Nice Park. A very attractive park in the city worth a visit and to have a coffee and something to eat in the cafe we found.

Biking in the beauty. On a Sunday afternoon in June, beautiful weather, what could be better than biking through this glorious, large park? Stop as you wish, people watch or sit on a bench and enjoy the views. Fabulous.
A getaway from the city. a lovely park to visit when you need a break from the hustle and bustle of the city, wish we had more time to enjoy it

Beautiful park.. The Vondelpark is a great place to relax on a sunny day. Lovely scenery, very clean considering how busy it is... Great place to cycle, jog, or just take a walk! Perhaps not a must visit attraction for a short visit. But if you want to chill-out outdoors, this is the place!

Beautiful park. Came here on a sunny Saturday. Was really pretty and quiet. Very enjoyable watching all the bikes go by. Also had a hotdog from one of the stands, which was yummy.
A nice break from the city.

Love it.. Oh my gosh. I loved it here.
It's a nice place to sit and pretend you're a local... just a gorgeous spot to waste a few hours.

Urban oasis ringed by beautiful homes. I love the Vondelpark. It is the Central Park of Amsterdam, not as big as New York's, but beautiful, beloved, tranquil, green. Alive with joggers, bicycles, people their dogs and kids. Used to be a hippy hangout in the golden age of the 60s-70s, but no more. Wonderful place for a jog or a bike ride in the morning hours, cool and pleasant. Great spot for a coffee in the afternoon.

Well worth a visit!. We enjoyed visiting this park and would recommend it highly. It provides a place for a nice "green-space" break from the city! It is also fun to see the locals in all their variety and ages enjoying themselves. It helps if the weather is good so you too can kick back and relax. This is a huge city park with lots of variety for recreation and there is good public transportation to get you there. It is a very pleasant part of exploring Amsterdam. Enjoy!
Great for a run or walk. Centrally located and ideal for a walk or a run. Lots of people, but not crowded during our visit. Also offers a few places to eat.

Gorgeous. There is a lot to do in Vondelpark. Bike riding, walking, picnicking, playgrounds, eating. My friend and I rode our bikes through it every day we were in Amsterdam. I highly recommend going. It gets pretty crowded on warm summer evenings. Everyone wants to enjoy the park in the good weather. Definitely a place you must see in Amaterdam!

Cycling here fantastic. Gorgeous park with ice cream vendors, a children's swing park with attached cafe where you can enjoy a cold beer while supervising little ones, great people-watching and admiring the stunning houses next to the park.

Nice place to take a break. It was nice to sit near the water relaxing my feet and legs after walking around the city. It is a beautiful park and a nice way to unwind after rushing around to see the sights.

Lovely park. Lovely park to chill, relax, read a book or just walk through(in this case be careful about the gazillion bikes that might run you over). I loved the chilled vibe in there, when people lied next to their bikes and just chatted.
Nice park. Nice park to relax, people watch, have a picnic or ride bikes. In the summer, on the weekends, they have music in the park.
Lovely park. This is such a lovely park to chill in when it's a nice sunny day (or a normal day!) Loved cycling through it and it has a great atmosphere.
Fantastic, charming park. We rode bikes around the park and stopped a number of times to look at the fountains, have a drink, climb a partly fallen tree. It was so lovely we did a second lap!
See it all. Take time for the walk and cover the whole park, we saw a very limited piece, and then saw pics of what we missed----a lot!
A Walk in the Park. Beautiful park. There's always something going on so check it all out. It is centrally located and is easy to find.
My home there. Such a nice place to be. Me and my boyfriend spent the first night there because we didn't have reservation. It's safe, always open, clean, fresh. Just perfect

Is it true that public sex is allowed in this park by law? :)). I liked riding the bike in this park. Like all Amsterdam, it is very civilized. Didn't like it took less than 10 minutes to go around. But to be fair, i am comparing it with parks in Bucharest which stretch on tens of thousands square meters.Wish i had my homework done before i got there. I only heard public sex is legal when i returned home. Probably wouldn't have done anything but stil, not knowing hurts!

Peaceful!. Its a beautiful and peaceful park - if parks are your thing, you should definitely spend some time here. If you'd rather enjoy the cityscapes or history.. walk through it (while going to muesumplien from down town) totally worth it!

Beautiful park in the city centre. Great park to relax in- just be careful of the bikes :-) we were told we could rent bikes within the park, however we were unable to find this service which was a bit disappointing! Nevertheless it's a lovely park to escape city life!

Great place to chill out!. Not too busy, everyone of all ages are there. Lovely atmosphere, beautiful big pond/small lake in the middle with an interesting sculpture floating around!! We stopped there when we had a bike ride (hired from Black Bikes) and had such a great afternoon chilling out in the sunshine!

Lovely park. This park is beautiful. I thought the Tiergarten in Berline was lovely, but this tops that by a mile. We we also lucky enough to catch a free outdoor concert which was excellent! They have outdoor concerts every Sunday through the summer for free. Must see this on your visit.

Most beautiful park. This park is for everybody! You can enjoy a solo walk/run, have a BBQ with your friends (in certain areas) or have a great day with your kids. For children there are a few play grounds and in the summer there is a kiddy pool. Take the small paths sometimes to be amazed of the beauty of nature in the centre of Amsterdam!

Sweet oasis. It's a nice well used park with a lot of human interaction features. cafes with a views, pond with boats, playground, Picasso sculpture and manicured usable lawns with trees and heron nests. Good size to walk around in and very relaxing. Much cleaner compared to the rest of Amsterdam.
Nice park for jogging. Pretty nice park in the heart of Amsterdam. It has several ponds and paths going through all over. Looks well maintained and it has a few drinking fountains

Nicest park of Amsterdam. Go have a drink in the morning ('koffie verkeerd!') at the terrace of the Blue Teahouse (Blauwe Theehuis). Or just hang around on the grass and have fun with friends. There are even places where it's allowed to bbq. Don't forget to clean up your mess please! During summer, some weekends nice performances take place at the small open air theatre (for free!) in the middle of the park. Check out the Vondelpark website or the notifications at the entrances of the park.Though I love this park, try to avoid it at night!

Coolest place. This is one of the coolest spots in the whole world. Besides being a large and beautiful park, it's a great place for people watching. Amsterdam people are colorful and diverse and they love to spend time here. It's lovely just to chill here and watch everyone do whatever they're doing. And yes, you can also spot Dutch celebrities here. If you have any clue who they are...

Small Central Park in Amsterdam. Best place in Amsterdam for the summer to walk around. The Blue Teahouse is a great place to stop. You have tennis courts there and children's playgrounds. It was built by the Catholic 'nobility' of Amsterdam to have a nice Park in their community that originally was not a part of Amsterdam but Municipality "Over Amstel". They buit their houses and villas next to the Park in the area that is now called "Oud Zuid".

You havent been to Amsterdam if you havent seen Vondelpark. This famous park is one the best sightseeing routes for a day out in Amsterdam. It is very much a busy park with people doing everything from painting to yoga to exercizing and simply walking the dog..It is surrounded by beautiful houses and you can spend a whole day just wondering aroundIf you are in Amsterdam ....do it

Central Park on the Amstel. This is a very walkable park with beautiful and varied trees, shrubs and plants. There are also lovely sculptures and fountains. Open air restaurants provide refreshment and are child friendly.
Oasis of calm. An oasis of calm in a busy city with plenty of green areas to relax in or just watch the cyclists, entertainers or the world go by.

A park really. Can get a little busy during the hot sunny moments. But a decent size park to relax and potter around if you are around the area. Appeared to be family friendly. There is an outdoor amphitheater!...Explore it

Walk, bike, hang out. It all good here.. Vondelpark is a rough oblong shape with lakes, winding paths, and many shade trees and benches.Locals use it for biking (they bike everywhere!), walking, jogging, and just sitting and picknicking. Free concerts are given during he summer, and it is a great place to people-watch in relative safety (no cars or trolleys, and few speeding cyclists) Depending on your map-reading skills, a stroll through Vondelpark can be a pleasant short-cut to other parts of the city. Like everything else we saw in Amsterdam, it is well and thoughtfully maintained.

Beautiful Park - Very Relaxing. This was a beautiful park very impressed and was a sunny day too spent most the day there wish I knew of a loo on the park though so I could of stayed longer but were not aware of any.

Nice calm walk in the park. Just around the corner, as is everything in Amsterdam. Nice quiet park with paths, streams, statues, greenery and bird species.
Well worth a visit even if it is just to enjoy a short break from a busy schedule.

Love this park!!. This is a big park in the City Centre and provides a great place to chill. Perfect spot when the sun is shining. Nice pools to sit around and a good place for a picnic. Food and drinks available in various areas. Outdoor music stadium has various artists which can still be enjoyed sitting in the park at no cost. Great place to recharge batteries after a heavy night!

Chilled. Nice if you get the weather. Lovely big park that doesn't get too full despite heavy footfall. If you are with friends then you can sit there, relax and take it all in. If on a couples holiday it is nice to just walk through and build up an appetite.

Beautiful Space in the City. perfect place to walk around, relax, or have a picnic. Cool place, filled with ducks, birds, and wild parrots! Grab a bottle of wine, some food and relax after touring Amsterdam.

Amsterdam's central park. If you haven't been to the Vondelpark, you haven't seen Amsterdam. It is that simple. The park is not that big (actually, it is ideal for running, one round is 3,3 km), but it is the center of the Amsterdam outdoor life. If it's not raining, that's to say. You simply go there, take some coffee, beer, wine and joint with you, sit down and watch people pass by. Walking, running, cycling, skating, dancing, tai chi-ing, etc. Have fun!

A unique quiet place not too far from the maddening crowds. We stayed a couple of blocks from this park. It was a great place for a quiet walk or bike ride a bit away from the maddening rush around the central museums. There are other park environments closer to the central museums, but they are often busy--particularly in the late afternoon. So, if you get tired of the masses of humanity, go here for a quiet walk. We were only here in the daytime; so, we don't know about the safety later in the evening.

The right place for a picnic. Lots of good spots for setting up your picnic with your family. Around a lake or a kids park, many trees to get unto the shades or get some sun into your face in a breezy afternoon. Many dogs wondering around, mostly with sensible owners that know not everybody likes dogs, but some not. I thought I would see less garbage on the floor though - bottles of wine, cans, paper cups and hundreds of cigarette butts (these are everywhere!).
Quite Nice!. A beautiful park for outdoor walks in nice weather. Locals enjoy it. There are a flock of wild parrots there!

Oasis in a large city. This was near our hotel. A nicely maintained park with lots of cyclists, runners, families with children and pets. A really nice place to relax while walking, picnicking or a place to read amongst nature. Felt very safe. The landscaping is beautiful and the park was clean.

Good park, but too busy.. It's nice, sure, great for jogging, but it is so busy, especially on a hot day. There are other good parks in Amsterdam with far less people.However, the Old South and Old West suburbs north and south are quite beautiful with many classic Dutch brown cafés.

A big, active park. There is not a lot of green space in Amsterdam, so Vondelpark is a popular spot to visit for runners, walkers, the ubiquitous bicyclists and people just looking to relax. There are paths, ponds and even restaurants if you get hungry or thirsty. There's not a whole lot to do besides people watching, but it's a nice break from the frenetic pace of th city.

And you thought Central Park was cool.... Great park! There are adorable cafes throughout. Rent a bike, take a stroll, do whatever. The people in Amsterdam are so laid back and friendly. Really, anything goes. Highly recommend...

Quite busy - but nice. Went on a hot day, so was nice to sit beneath the trees and get out of the busy streets of Amsterdam. Was very busy, and a bit noisy but overall pretty. Also don't go on a full bladder as the porta loos are really really bad!

Very relaxing. Vondelpark is nice and relaxing, especially on a hot summer's day. It's not of the same stature as a Central Park (what is?), hence not a five star review. But a nice, relaxing hour or two can be spent here.
Don't miss it. For joggers, cyclists or people just wanting to walk around, this is a great place to do it in the middle of the city. Very relaxing.

Great place to bring the kids. It was hot when we visited and it seemed like all of Amsterdam was at the Park enjoying the weather. It was a great place to run around with our little one, clean and plenty of space to spread out!
Lovely bike ride. We biked through the park during our 3 hour Bike tour. Relaxing break from the hustle and bustle of this vibrant city. Nice spot to take a break at some point during your visit.

Group of friends. What a lovely park, very nice to visit and relax in. we visited the park with our hired bikes and it was great to ride and stop and just take everything in, well worth a visit on your bicycle.
