Grab a hotdog across the street and pop a squat. We enjoyed the Heineken Experience and walked down here for a hotdog at the park. It was beautiful!! Hotdog stand was located just across the street. Must visit while you are in the city!

Vast and beautiful!. Immediately after renting our bikes, this was our first stop. We locked the bikes up by the cafe and sat on the terrace for a coffee and chocolate croissant. We then started on a leisurely ride around the park.We had gorgeous weather the day we visited the park, so I'm sure that helped add to the magic of the experience. The park is filled with beautiful winding paths set around pretty ponds, fields, and small patches of woods. We saw a heron nesting, and green parakeets fluttering overhead as we biked along.There are some beautiful and interesting sculptures throughout the park as well.If you have the time, you could easily make a day of it without regret.

A relaxing change of pace. In the midst of a busy, touristic city, this park made for a lovely relaxing late afternoon walk. It was such a pleasure to see families and couples, dogs on and off leash, playing and relaxing in the middle of the city. As a person who lives in the country, I value green space and trees highly, and yearned for them after a busy few days of sightseeing in Amsterdam and the Hague.
Ideal for an early morning stroll, visit on a Saturday. Ideal for an early morning stroll, visit on a Saturday morning to see people with far too much energy working out.....
Green and interesting. Open air concerts in a very nice green surroundings. Worth a visit. If you have some spear time in Amsterdam - a must. Unless it rains then think Museums... :)
beautiful on a beautiful day. beautiful clean park with lots of room to relax. the weather was beautiful and the atmosphere friendly
Great spot on a hot day.... Great place for relaxing on a hot day, just a great feeling there. Also perfect size for a good walk and some time "away" from the city...
very nice. lovely park in central Amsterdam; plenty of pathways to walk cycle, picnic or just hang out with the local residents.

Great inner city escape. We spent a few days in Amsterdam exploring the city, and going to Vondelpark was the best way to spend the afternoon. It's a little busier than some of the other parks but it's very open and a nice change to the tightly packed streets of Amsterdam. The locals are very friendly, and we had a lot of fun chatting with people walking dogs or playing soccer. It was so hot in Amsterdam this July that Vondelpark was the best place to lie down in the shade and relax, would recommend taking a few drinks or a picnic and soaking up the great atmosphere.

A wonderful Sunday walk. What better place in Amsterdam to see all the locals out enjoying this large expanse of park in central Amsterdam. From bikes to yoga to tai chi to people watching, whatever takes your fancy. Also great for photos with many lakes. Don't buy a water from the little van, byo from outside as at € 3 for a small bottle why get ripped off?

Love it!. This is one of the most beautiful places of Amsterdam. A very big park with lakes, ducks, birds, tea-houses and coffee houses. You can have big walks here without hearing the noise of the city. I love to go here any time of the year!

PARK YOURSELF HERE. A favourite with the Dutch and its easy to see why. Minuets form many museums, the canals, tram and bus stops. Large open spaces and water features as you would expect. If you are hiring a bike then its perfect fro a lazy, no traffic ride. There is an open air theatre but you need to find out what and when is on plus a restaurant with in and outside seating. At weekends and evenings it is a hive of activity the likes of which I have now found in any other city park.
Beautiful park for biking or strolling. Great way to take a break from site seeing, definitely bike to this park and play frisbee, run, or just enjoy the people watching.

Tranquillity in the middle of chaos. A great park to take a time out in and escape the chaos of Amsterdam. It gets busy but theirs plenty of room for everybody. A rode my rented bike every morning around the park just like many others do, a very beautiful park. Comes out at one end at the Max Euweplein, Holland Casino and Hard rock café.

Fabulous Free Amenity. Large park, trees, large grass areas, pathways to explore. A beautiful place to sit, jog, cycle or wander to enjoy the surrounding wildlife and greenery. Also a fantastic place just to sit and watch the rest of the world go by.

Not as good as Hyde Park or the English garden Munich. Quite a lot of "druggies", not all of whom leave one alone - I used to smoke dope, but now get relaxed on red wine (mostly Chilean) and don't bother other folk.Despite the healthy offerings at most Dutch supermarkets (Albet Heing, thank you so much) offer, the Vondelpark stalls offer junk food - take your own picnic and wine. I really liked walking, sitting and resting and looking at the incredible range of bicycles and the incredibly beautiful Dutch women.
Rent a bike and go there!. Beautiful place to go riding a bike or just walking and maybe to do a picnic. The park is very beautiful and everybody goes there. I recommend a lot!

Low your pulse.... Well, this may be the most famous and most visited park i A'dam, but there is a reason why.You really calm down when you get here.Pack a picnic bag, bring some friends (or a good book, if you prefer thast), find a nice spot on a lawn, and enjoy and relax. Low your pulse, and just feel life.In the summertime, there is usually a lot of music and entertainment, free of charge, in the weekends. Just check the parks website http://www.openluchttheater.nl/english/This is for sure one of our favorite spots in Amsterdam.

Nice place to relax. I went here a couple of times during my visit. Bring some snacks and sit in the grass and kick back. If it is hot out you can cool off in the pond. Really worthwhile to stop and visit.
Nice place. Beautiful park just to hang out in. It was extremely hot when we visited so we didn't spend much time but it would have been a perfect place to enjoy the outdoors
You should definitely see :). One word is enough to describe this area which is peace. You should not leave Amsterdam without seeing Vondelpark.
Cute and pretty. Little oasis outside the very busy Amsterdam. It's a nice park to walk around or have a picnic. If you have free time and like outside give it a go

Special Respite from the Crowded Streets. Absolutely beautiful green park filled with meandering paths and open spaces to sit and relax on the grass. I recommend biking - no steep climbs or fast descents - which is a lovely way to experience this special place. Plenty of vendor carts selling water and the occasional snack. Several entrances/exits at various points around the park. A pleasant go-at-your-own-pace bike ride.

Beautiful Urban Park. I really like urban parks and this is one of the best. It is beautifully landscaped, and there are tons of people (which I like). Of course, since it is Amsterdam, the park is packed full of bicycles, but also plenty of people walking on the paths and sitting on the grass.

One of my fav in Amsterdam. A hang out in Vondelpark is a must every time I visit Amsterdam. It loactes in the city center. It is very huge with green color everywhere and people biking or jogging around, very cheerful.
Lovely. Never seen a more beautiful park, there are lots of places to stop and grab a bite to eat. You could spend hours walking around.
Go on a bike. We did one of the cycle tours that took us to Vondelpark. Beautiful day, beautiful park. Full of Amsterdamers enjoying the grass and fresh air. So much to watch...

Bike ride through vondelparc. Although I don't necessarily recommend a tourist to rent a bike in Amsterdam, it's pretty frightening, we decided we could manage a ride through the park. We rented bikes 2 blocks away, although I noticed you could rent in the park, which might be safer. The park is beautiful! So many people picnicking and enjoying the beautiful day. We enjoyed the ride even though there were some congested areas. Lots of little lakes throughout the park to sit and relax.
Sun hunting . Was here in summer, very crowded. Not many place to sit down. But I took many beautiful pics here, and I love how people gathered here celebrating summer :)

Amazing!. Hire a bike and ride around the beautiful park of Vondelpark, sunbathe infront of lakes and have a refreshing drink at one of the many options to drink and eat ad enjoy an ice cream theen a walk into the shops just a 5 minute walk away

Beautiful lush park, ponds, birds . Wonderful walking paths, bike paths. Felt completely safe and comfortable. Also check out the Roos, which had a nice garden coffee shop. It's at the east end of the park at PC Hooftstraat.Just outside the east end, hop on a canal tour boat.

Nice place to chill out. We visited on a swelteringly hot day after spending most of the morning at a museum. It was the perfect place to relax and take a little walk around the lake. The place was packed though and it was hard at times to dodge in and out of the bikes whizzing past. We only got to see a fraction of it and had it not been so hot we may have taken more time to explore the rest of it.
Chilling all day long. There is nothing like Vondelpark in a hot summer day. Beautiful landscape, fountains and great atmosphere!

The Parc the in Amsterdam. The Vondelpark has everything! From tennis to kids adventures....The parc is set up in a beautiful way to see and smell nature! Nice little puddles and swimming pools, animals and entertainment. Also to have a bbq the Vondelpark is the place to be. Specially designed places for this are all through the parc.Many cafes with children activities and good snacks to keep everybody happy.From morning till evening it's a place that has and gives energy to all ages!!

Great park , peaceful place. Vondelpark is a must whenever your visit Amsterdam. IT's position and it's size make it very easy to be accessed by wondering tourists. If you find a green space under the sun or in the shadows don't hesitate and take sit, after a little while you will be relaxed and you will lose the track of time.
Small Park.. . It's a small Park. Not much to see. But it's a quiet place in the middle of the city. Lots of bicycles. Great for a small walk not much more.
Very nice park right in the City!. We really enjoyed our time walking through this park. It was clean and obviously a weekend destination for many city dwellers.
Not the best big city park. Worth a short visit, but we were quite frankly a bit disappointed. We've seen much nicer parks in other European cities. I didn't seem very well-kept.

Great Sunday afternoon . Good place to spent a nice day outdoors,it is pretty big park where you can walk or ride your bikes..Very often they have like a free music shows in the park and that's very nice to drink beer and listen to music and travel in the park.
Worth a visit on your bike. Loved this beautiful park. Lots of lovely places to stop and explore. We had lunch at the listed building, can't remember the name but it was lovely.
Nice!. If the weather is good, go visit vondelpark!! A lot of people but still a very relaxing atmosphere. Always watch out! cyclists everywhere :D
Awesome. Very chilled park and right in the centre of Amsterdam! You have to bring your own drinks and food because there aren't any restaurants or bars around.

Great way to spend an afternoon. Me and my family came upon Vondelpark one afternoon while walking through Amsterdam. It's a beautiful park with lots of open spaces and nature. Many people were relaxing on the lawn, riding bikes, or eating at one of the restaurants in the park. We stopped at a little concert that was going on and had a beer. Very relaxing!

Nice park in the city. Vondelpark is nice. Many people were jogging and enjoying the crisp spring weather as I was visiting. It wasn't extraorindary but it was still a decent park. I wouldn't go out of my way to see it but if you need a break, it is a nice place to relax.

Average European park. The Europeans like their parks-and of note, my 10 year old says they are not parks because they don't have playgrounds. The Vondelpark is a large open space with trees. On the warm day we visited, there were lots of people sleeping and lounging on the grass. There was quite a bit of garbage laying around and the grass looked like it had see a lot of traffic. If you want to people watch, this is a good place to do so, but there are so many more exciting things to do in A'dam!

Amsterdam's Central Park. What a wonderful place to stroll or ride bikes. So many Amsterdammers bring their children here to enjoy the playgrounds, or the cute shallow pool on a hot day. Others talk and walk, or have picnics. Look for the sculpture of the little man holding up a fallen tree, or the Picasso.
My favorite park in Amsterdam. Huge park with a lot going on. Relax, walk, bike and a great place to partake in the finer things Amsterdam has to offer.

A Pleasant Surprise. We spent a couple of hours strolling through this beautiful park and probably only scratched the surface.You can do what you want there - enjoy the gardens, cycle, sun bathe, jog or just sit back and people watch.We rounded off the visit with a drink at the Blauwe Theehuis (blue tea-house) a 1930s built cafe which looks like an upturned boater hat.
Vondelpark. Beautiful place and excellent park with seperate areas peaceful in some and lively in others making it an interesting place

Good for watching the world go by. We decided to walk through the park two days as the weather was so good. There are 100's of bikes everywhere but as long as you keep to the pavements you're ok.Lovely park , very clean & statues & features in it.We had coffee's in a cafe by a lake & watched Heron's fishing. Lovely relaxing spot.
Nature. I like the natural nature but i dont like some gangs that are a little bit fishy. It is very big so you re not going to turn around it in a 30 mins

Beautiful art and scenery!. We had a lot of amazing experiences in Amsterdam, but nothing can touch the simple fun of riding bikes around Vondlepark. The park is full of life, with people enjoying the outdoors and having fun. In addition to the unreal natural beauty, the park contains many beautiful sculptures. Set aside time to explore this beautiful space!

A piece of peace in the lovely city of Amsterdam. I cycle through the Vondelpark to work everyday, and not a day goes by without enjoying this beautiful park. Whether it is for a lunch, a walk or just to hang out with friends and a bbq, the Vondelpark has it all. Be sure you pay a visit to this beautiful park in the middle of the crowded city of Amsterdam!
Countryside in the city. It's always a happy place with so much going on. We love to ride our bikes in the park - feels like we're really on holiday !
Green oasis. Perfect for a little walk, close to Museumplain. Nice little green oasis where you can escape the tourist crowds!
Great park. Very nice park for walking and cycling. Gets busy with good weather. And please clean up after yourself. The litter is a problem.

Great atmosphere, relaxing and always great to attend.. This park is always busy! With lots of areas to sit down and have some food/drink. Lots of BBQ areas. In fact if the sun is out you'll struggle to find a free space of grass. Also a great park to run around. Would recommend going to chill out in.
Wonderful park. Great park for kids, families, couples. Have a relaxing drink at the Melkhuis while the kids use the playground.

Beautiful park. This is a very beautiful park and a great place to spend outdoor. You can relax and chill by the lake or have a picnic with family and friends. The cycling path is convenient but please ensure that you do not walk on the bicycle path.
Great park. Went for a cycle around here. Well kept park, busy and nice to sit and have a drink at the restaurant and relax. Would recommend
Amazing park. Massive park, makes you feel like one of the locals, its gorgeous, if your a nature lover you will love this. Make sure to rent a bike to see round it

Beautiful park for people watching. This is a lovely park to sit for an afternoon. They have a cafe with outdoor tables that allows you to look over the lake with some lunch and people watch. I would recommend this as a rest stop when walking around the city.

Cycle or relax. This is certainly a nice place to cycle around as the park is of a considerable size with multiple bike paths, however it is also a trendy hang out spot should you decide to visit with friends and just prefer to sit on the green.It is one of (if not the) most popular park in Amsterdam so there will not be a shortage of people, particularly during the summer, so you can expect a fun and lively atmosphere.

A must when in Amsterdam - especially in summer!. Located in one of the nicest neighbourhoods in Amsterdam, the Vondelpark is probably the best place in Amsterdam to either relax, do some workouts or just walk ... and absorb the Amsterdam life ...Tip: do watch out for bicycles during rushour; people can get annoyed if they need to brake suddenly so maintain a straight path on either side of the road.

Tidy and close to nature. Vondelpark is a good place to relax on the grass. It’s tidy and enables you to lie down by a canal full of ducks, seagulls and other birds. Judging by the amount of people it is a very popular destination, so expect it to be crowded.
An escape from the city. The quietest, nicest place in Amsterdam with fresh air, lakes, beautiful landscapes. It was an escape. Spent there the evening, very nice.
Beautiful place. Wish we'd brought a picnic but there is a restaurant near the lake. We biked here and it was gorgeous, grass is a bit scratchy bring a blanket!

Beautiful park in the heart of Amsterdam. A nice park to walk and relax by one of the benches, or on the grass. It is also possible to barbecue or bring one's own lunch and have a picnic on a nice sunny day.
Big park. Nice to rent a bicycle and ride around beautiful flowers and a good please to relax and take a stroll.

Love this park!. This park has it all. Quiet, relaxing spots. Active, more bustling spots. I have seen some cool animals at the park. Good for people watching. There is usually live music at the park, food and drink vendors. Great place to exercise or to just relax.
Lovely place to go for a cycle. This is a great place to go for a cycle or to just sit out with a picnic on a nice sunny day. Would highly recommend a visit!
Not much to see, great for a walk. I love this park for a walk, but cannot say it a pretty or anything to really point out. It is a haven of calm in a busy city.
beautiful park. give it a go, its honestly lovely, little walk from the centre but its certainly worth it. i would go again in a heartbeat

Defo worth a visit. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked this park, I was expecting a run-of-the-mill grassy area however there were interesting routes to walk, with lakes, wildlife, bridges, cafes, old houses and statues. It was very lively as the weather was dry, with families having picnics, a baby shower party, people playing music and lots of BBQs. Very relaxed!
stress free. stress free atmosphere this place...lovely smells and sights...will surely go here again. i would ideally carry a picnic basket with me if i had a wife and kids.

My favorite place to go jogging!. I love this place. It's simple. It's big, but not too big. There are lots of different designated places for different activities--dog parks, children's areas, running paths--so it's always a buzzing, motivating place to go. Also, there are a few bars. That's a plus. Check out Vondeltuin on the west side of the park.

Lovely park. Found this park by accident while exploring Amsterdam. Spent some time enjoying the sunshine and resting our weary feet. An oasis of calm in a busy city but do watch out for the bicycles - the laws of road and paths do not apply to them!! A perfect find.

Huge park pretty much in central Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is a short walk from the Rijksmuseum and is extensive with a number of lakes. It has a number of places to buy food as outside cafes and also food carts. The place teems with people enjoying themselves with picnics, playing games or just lying about. It is quite crowded at the museum end but thins out further down the park. There is a lake which was quite secluded with a number of fountains which are beautiful, as are the rose gardens. The only thing that jars is the huge amount of small litter in the form of cigarette butts and packets, bottle tops etc. The Dutch appear to be big smokers and dispose of their cigarette butts anywhere. Lovely place to spend few hours in.

Great Park. I was staying near this park! It's was great to have a walk round it! There is one thing please stick to the gravel path when walking otherwise you might get run over by bikes! It's like a high way of bikers! Then it's is the biking nation!

Not What I Expected. I have heard great things about this park but was a little disappointed when we got there. We did not stay long. It was a little dirty and filled with people drinking and smoking pot. It did not seem very child friendly for being a park.

The most fabulous park!!! You can easily spend a whole day there. Its got restaurants in it too.. It was top of my list of places to visit during my trip, but I could never have imagine how beautiful it was going to be. Lots of things to do. Beauty everywhere you look. Locals use it as a shortcut on their bikes so watch out while on the roads, although they are wide. You can actually explore the park on hired bikes which are all over the city. We came across more than 6 lakes and am sure we didn't even cover the whole park. I would highly recommend it and nothing written here can come close to explaining the magical beauty of Vondelpark.
A pleasant start to our bike tour. A very beautiful park, biking through it was a great experience. The variety of trees an plants was unexpected.
Best park ever!. This park is the best! A little bit outside of the center, close to the museums you'll find a little slice of heaven for you to chill out and escape the noise of the city!

Nice place to relax on a sunny winters day. I walked through Vondelpark on a mild spring day in May 2015. It is a pleasant place to just take a nice walk or have a picnic with friends and family. There are paths throughout the park with plenty of cyclists and pedestrians using it. There is a restaurants and a play area for kids. Many people walk their dogs in this park. Apparently free concerts are offered here from time to time. The flowers and trees were nice to look at.I would definitely recommend any visitor to Amsterdam to at least take a walk through this park - it is apparently the largest park in Amsterdam.

The best urban public park !. I traveled with my two boys ages 12 & 13 and absolutely loved it ! It was great place to grab lunch go for a stroll,rollerblade pick-nic. Beautiful ponds ,wild life, great playground. In addition to open air there. After visiting the museums and city it really was a nice place for some down time ! Close to the Leidseplein and the Museumplein. Good area to say near by with families.

Great place to people watch. A lovely park where you can wander and enjoy the water features and the gardens or just sit and people watch on a bench or if one of the cafes. Just beware of the cyclists everywhere and travelling at speed.

Beautiful area. We didn't stop and spend any length of time here but took in its calm and atmosphere as we cycled around on a bike tour. The weather was cold and damp but on a Sunday morning there were plenty of people enjoying the surroundings and many joggers, cyclists and others exercising enjoying the area.

The most popular place for sunny days!. It is an enormous park, where for sure you will find something for yourself. From great surface for running and rollerblading, to places where you can make bbq. There is not really a shop where you can buy some snacks etc., so i reccoment to buy it before! You can chill till late night next to the water (park is getting closed around 3am), have some drinks and meet many new people, since when it's the most popular place for spending warm days :)

Great place. Vondelpark is amazaing place to walk, run or bike in Amsterdam. You can find some restaurant there.. A lot of small lakes, you can workout there or only enjoy chill. I love Vondelpark. Vondelpark is very close to Rijksmuseum and for me it was the best experience in Amsterdam. n
Beautiful park. Had a lovely stroll through the park in the May sunshine, it was fabulous.Lots of bikes, as you would expect in Amsterdam, very clean and well presented.

Great park. This is a great park just to have a stroll around in or to have a picnic! You can enter the park in different directions and during the summer, you can usually find an ice cream truck. There are also a couple restaurants in the park, so you get a pretty nice view of the park while eating out on the patio.

A lovely way to spend a few hours.. Stop by a local sandwich shop or bakery and make your way to the park. There are great walking and biking paths. There were all kinds of activities going on by people of all ages. We just took our lunch and enjoyed the nice weather. Evidently there are concerts there and it is easy enough to find out who is performing and when. We would have gone back if we had had more time.

Vodelpark in Amsterdam. The vondelpark is a lovely area for strolling, biking, walking or running. Located in a nice area of the city with good cafes and restaurants and close to the museum area. Well worth a visit

Beautiful Oasis just outside the city. Vondelpark is a beautiful tranquil place just outside of the hustle of Amsterdam. It's a great place for a bike ride or a place to have a rest after a log day of museums or canal cruising.

Nice city break. Spent time at this massive park withing the city . It a place wher locals chill out , scores of cyclists /footballers/barbecue parties make this place worth a visit.
The amphitheater looked like a wonderful place , unfortunately I couldn't watch any shows there.

Main thoroughfare for cyclists. After breakfast thought we would take a leisurely walk through the park into the city. Took us about 40 minutes. Felt a bit out of place as we were walking, whilst the huge majority of people were going through the park on bicycles - only to be expected I suppose for Amsterdam. Park is more of a big open space with lots of trees, bushes and water with the usual selection of birds and a main thoroughfare for cyclists.

Beautiful park!. This is a great place to escape the city a little and get some "green time". Good place to run. The paths are wide - as usual, watch out for the bikes. Lots of open green space for picnics or a game of football. Awesome people watching!

A must visit for local flavour. It is very important to get the local flavour of the city being visited....Voondal park in Amsterdam is one such destination.best time to visit in the evening one will see barbeques happening all around...whether its a date couple,all boys,families they will be all having fun riding by cycles chasing ducks,blowing the biggest bubbles possible.....one lovely corner I saw in the park and has stayed with me,is how the citizens care about each others belongings.there was a green cage for lost and found stuff...it had everything on it from baby shoe to keys to thank you notes what a lovely thought...

Nice park in the city. Loads of photo opportunities, or just a relaxed afternoon in the park. Good for bird watching, a picnic or a nice stroll. Was impressed with the size of the park, lots of places to sit and relax.

Great melting pot, a leafy microcosm of the whole city. There was so much going on, so many people, so much to watch and see. A people watchers paradise.There were people out running, walking dogs, cutting through on the way to work, cycling, hanging around in groups (not threatening!), singing, etc etc.Grab a sandwich and a beer, find a bench and just enjoy an hour in the Vondelpark.Despite being busy, there was always a space to chill and relax.

Lots of fun . Having read reviews here I was fearing a very crowded space but it was not as busy as I expected. We had a very enjoyable cycle around the park, sat for a while people-watching and had coffee at the melkhuis while the littlest played in the playground. Would definitely recommend it if you have kids.

People watched for HOURS!. This was a great park to just take a deep breath and enjoy the hundreds of cyclists pass. Great spot for picnicking or for some ice cream on a park bench. Really was a highlight while in Amsterdam.
A relaxing afternoon!. Went for a bike ride through the park and came upon an outdoor concert. Spent an enjoyable several hours listening to music and drinking tea. An urban oasis.

Perfect for a quick run. This park is well maintained and a perfect set up for working out. I went for a few runs during my stay in Amsterdam and while I was running I saw several fitness classes going on as well. It is also very safe and clean feeling so perfect for picnics or a pleasant stroll. On the weekends in the summer there are free concerts.
Relaxing!!. This park is really beautiful and a great place to have a picnic and I'd seen they have entertainment at night

Very relaxing. This park is very relaxing, especially for those who come from a very noisy environment. The people are just enjoying a sunny day, dog-walking, jogging, riding bikes or just lazing about in grass. I've read there are live free concerts but we've not seen anyone this time, however we enjoyed very much.
peaceful spot. This is Amsterdam's version of Central Park, and it is a lovely place to take a stroll, rest on the grass, and people watch. The trees are large and old and interesting.
Normally nice but dirty. Nice Park normally but when we have been there it was really crowdy, dirty and noisy. So it's not a natural beauty to me.
Great park. A great park during the summer months, lots of people having picnics & relaxing. Great for cycling and running around.There is also free outdoor concerts during the summer.

Pretty well laid out park in central Amsterdam. We took the tram from central station resulting in a short walk to the park gates. It is a lovely, mixed use park with spaces for walking, cycling, football, BBQ and a choice of cafes.We were able to watch a number of herons at very close range which was a surprise in the centre of a city this size.
Just a park?. Nothing special, just a park at the end of the day but been to nicer ones. Ok to stroll around but wouldn't spend much time here...

One of my favourite parks in Europe. I have been here quiet a few times and always enjoy my time in the park, its much bigger than I initially thought and now everytime I go I find new parts of it- such a relaxing and peaceful atmosphere in the centre of such a beautiful city!

very good, but sometimes very crowded. One of the green lungs of Amsterdam, popular with both inhabitants and visitors. Go there for a game, a BBQ or a birthday party as do the Dutch. Or just relax and enjoy flora and birdlife. Best on a Sunday morning, very crowded on weekend afternoons, but you can Always find a quiter spot to relax. And yes there is some modern art as well, sometimes concerts and events. Enjoy !

Pretty but tons of trash. A beautiful park, but there was trash everywhere with cigarette butts littering the grass, the pavement and the water. I get that cigarettes are much more common in Europe, but it was hard to look past all the litter - pretty disgusting.
Beautiful park. We were there on hottest day of the year and it seemed half the city was in the park! Lovely lakes, bridges etc. Very relaxed and the bar in the middle was great

Get a bike and get here!. Loved this park. Me and my girlfriend weren't very confident on the roads straight away with our rented bikes so headed here straight away and it was perfect! Beautiful scenery and a nice route right to the bottom of the park and back.
A beautiful place. This is a truly beautiful park. If you have some spare time to chill when you visit Amsterdam come here and do it
Well kept!. A very clean, well kept area. There were building works in the area when we were there but apart from that it was well maintained. Not a piece of rubbish in sight!
Wine and Picnic Time. Go find a bottle (don't forget the opener) and some Olives and Cheese and Meats - and hunt for your picnic location. We found ours next to a little lake.
Nice place. Great place to walk and rest while you are visiting Amsterdam, mainly whe you are in the museum area.

Don't miss Vondelpark. The beautiful flowers, especially the rose gardens, and entertainment all through out the park,. Don't miss Vondelpark. The beautiful flowers, especially the rose gardens, and entertainment all through out the park. We were especially lucky to catch an operatic concert while we were there. And it is free!!! You can bicycle, skate or stroll around the park. It is beautiful!!

Enjoy the sites and sounds but don't miss the Rembrandtpark. The Vondelpark is a lovely place to be on a summers evening, with thousands of visitors eating, playing music or soaking up the sun. But if you get tired of all the people walk right through the park and visit the Rembrandtpark instead. Its much bigger, less manicured and much, much quieter.
Lovely big park. Lovely park to sit in, busy but everyone was doing the same thing and chilling. Not far to walk to at all and restaurants all around.

Great place to stroll around. This is a nice place to escape to as you can take a leisurely stroll around the park and also there is a nice cafe to have something to eat and drink and while away the time. However be warned that if you don't keep your eyes peeled at all times you may get knocked down by cyclists or joggers !!!!!

Well laid out haven so close to the centre. We visited the park twice during our long weekend break. The first time was on a warm Saturday, and it was very busy, but still lovely. So many of the locals and tourists just sit about and enjoy the surroundings of this interesting park with lots of water features/ponds, paths, trees and grass. There are designated picnic areas where the smell of smoke barbeques was unmissable. And several people were also partaking in recreational drugs. On our second visited it was on hired bicycles and we felt quite safe cycling round. You don't feel intimidated to go at a speed you are not happy with. And we got to see the whole park. I would certainly go back on another visit as the way that the paths, lakes and trees are laid out makes it interesting. There is also somewhere to eat, and an open air theatre.

A Breath of Fresh Air in a Big City. This "Oasis of Serenity" in the midst of busy Amsterdam is the best place to come to relax. It's lush green landscape is amazing and it also has lots of water bodies.

Great city park!. The Vondelpark (named after Dutch poet Vondel, whose statue is in the park), is the largest park in Amsterdam. Visited by tourists and utilized by locals for hanging out, meeting friends, sports etc. So throughout the day and most evenings there are people about, a relaxed atmosphere and during the summer months music performances in the open air theater in the middle. It is also a nice way to travel if you need to go form west to the city so indeed lots of cyclist cross through the park. Definitely worth a visit or to take a break when you are strolling through Amsterdam and watch the locals go by.
Beautiful. A great day spent at the park chilling the grounds are well maintained I totally suggest hiring a bike to get around. Loved Vondelpark
Beautiful park. Absolutely beautiful!! Nice to sit and people watch. Grab a bite to eat, relax while to world passes by

wonderful bunny sculptures!. There are a series of large bunny sculptures decorated by various artists, and a good set are at Vondelpark. I bought a magnet of one of my favorites and the proceeds go to UNICEF.
The park in the city. Great open space, nice cafes, you can be lucky and catch some free shows, especially music. Downside loads of bikes, so need to be aware.
Relaxing. Beautiful park with lovely flowers and fountains. Lots of space for walking and relaxing. There's portaloos and rental bikes around. A good family park.

Nice park. Nice park, very close to Museumplein.
We went on a Friday afternoon (it was sunny and the weather was fantastic). It was very crowded, but fun nevertheless

Great place to enjoy nature. We were staying fairly close to this park so decided to opt for a change of pace and see what the place was all about. It is obviously a spot very popular with the locals as there were a lot of people walking with children and dogs and numerous cyclists and the occasional runner. There are several little lakes, statues placed throughout and some eateries as well. An enjoyable place to spend some time on a nice day.
Nice Park for a stroll. A nice park to stroll through and chill on the grass. Not much to do but when the weather is nice, it's a nice stroll.

A Walk in the Park. Very active park - lots of cyclists and rollerbladers.There were a lot of people walking their dogs, eating their lunches and just enjoying a wonderful day. There are lots of beautiful trees and flowers. Easy walking.

A lovely park. We were staying quite close to Vondelpark & so had a good walk around it one day. It has many lakes, statues, picnic areas & open-air theatre/live music spaces. We enjoyed an afternoon coffee in the large café & it was very nice to sit outside & enjoy the view. The only drawback was that we unfortunately saw a lot of litter. You also have to keep your wits about you as you walk around as there are bicycles everywhere!

Beautiful place. We went to the park with friends and had a lovely time. We had hired bikes so had a nice ride around, it is a beautiful park. There are lots of places to stop and places to eat and drink. We had a lovely time, perfect for a sunny day.

Majestic park. I guess I could say iv'e been to a fare few urban parks in my life, including some of the great parks around the major European cities, but Vondelpark is one of a kind. It a massive green park, complete with ponds and streams, with snaking trails all around, and a magical corner behind every bend. Always full of happy Amsterdamers or sunbathing tourists, and even a number of cafes and bars around the central area. If you're in Amsterdam, never miss this Gem of a park.

Large touristy park. A very large park, with easy access from almost anywhere in Amsterdam, but it feels like it's always full of people, especially tourists.Bike rentals around it make it a great way to explore the park in a couple hours. On foot would take you much longer.There's a large playground area for the little ones and we found it very, very helpful - if you know what I mean! Bike lockers available there.Still worth it though, but like I said, expect lots of tourists.Despite the crowds, the park is very clean and safe.If you want a place that's quieter, where the locals go, try Amstelpark.

Very nice and big park!. Great park, quite big. Rent a bike and take a ride, have a picnic. It's a park so you can watch people do their thing. In the summer there are theaterfestivals like salsa, have a drink or lunch at the Blue Thea House (Blauwe theehuis). Just check their website!

Perfect for a sunny Sunday. We went at 3pm on a warm Sunday, lay down on the grass and took a long nap. Other people were also sleeping around us, it was like a huge siesta party. Very clean, great for biking and picnics. There are also ducks coming to ask for bread, if you give them some they will not leave you alone!

A beautiful picnic spot. This park is incredible! Just steps from the busy city, it feels like you just stepped into the country side! Great for biking, running, meandering or a picnic with your sweetheart.

Everything you need from a city park. Vondelpark is extremely accessible - there's an entrance on Leidseplein and dozens of other entrances off residential streets. It has an open air performance space, a bandstand, cafe, restaurant, ice cream/hot dog stands, open spaces and shady ones. Vondelpark is very well used - on warm evenings it's heaving with people wandering, barbecueing, chilling etc. BUT beware cyclists zipping along - they take the tarmac road, pedestrians are on the unpaved trails - and most of 'em are fast!!!

Great place to chill.... Very nice park in a central area of the city. Depending on when you go, it can either be very loud and hectic or very quite and calming. Even in the worst conditions you can usually find a little corner somewhere to relax. I recommend checking it out if you are in the area and want to chill out for an hour or more...
2015. Great park for riding and walking very large park great for everything we had a picnic best afternoon in the dam

Such a pretty park. Large bike paths, beautiful greenery, sculptures and what looked like a flowery garden area.You were able to have barbecues here, though we didn't. More than one place to eat within the park as well.It was a lovely park just to walk/bike through or lounge around in for hours on end. Definitely worth the visit.

Beautiful. Rented bikes from Mike's Bikes (highly recommend, very close). Park itself is a nice size for a leisurely ride, lots of little roads going off to statues or sights. Some beautiful houses to see off the dam's. Also lots of great photo opportunities!

No place better!. It was a sunny sunny day, we packed a picnic brought our weed, hopped on our bikes and headed for the lovely Vondel Park ... so relaxing really good atmosphere - no place better! If the sun is out this is a must!

Perfect picnic. On a beautiful day my hubbie and I bought a few bits and pieces in a nearby supermarket and then sat by the water in the park for a picnic lunch. And it was perfect. Lovely food, gorgeous surroundings, great people-watching. What's not to love. A great way to spend a lazy afternoon that I would totally recommend!
Day in the park . Got to say this was totally amazing. Lovely park and very clean. People having nice bbqs and just all round great atmosphere. This is a must see.

Large green space with lots of people and lakes. Nice place for having a picnic,if you find some free place on the grass to sit down in nice weather. You can find a self-service BBQ, people playing different kinds of games and music. There is an open-air theatre with some innovative shows going on. Beware of bicycles, like everywhere in the city, the park is also a place where you are surrounded by them.

An oasis in the middle of the city. The "People's Park" is a quiet respite in the middle of Amsterdam. It's a great place to have a sandwich for lunch away from the general hustle and bustle of the city. Very beautiful and well-kept, it's a great place to also watch families at play, rollerbladers and, of course, bikers. It's an easy walk to the Museumplein and the Leidseplein, If you want a place to catch your breath and just enjoy a green oasis - this is it.

You can do everything you like.. The para is very beautiful, it was full of people in a Thursday night. Each group doing something different: some biking, some running, some preparing a barbecue, some listening music.
Tranquil area of grass & lakes.. A beautiful area of Amsterdam to have a lovely evening stroll in the picturesque park, and very close to the Hard Rock cafe for dinner.

Lovely space. We stayed close to one entrance to this open area and always walked through it on the way in and out of town. It is a lovely park to explore and to enjoy the quiet space to chill and relax. Many people enjoy sitting on the grass relaxing with food and drinks. Be careful when walking through there are always alot of bikes riding fairly quick.

A nice city break when you walk between City Center and the Museum Square. When you walk from the center of Amsterdam to the Museum Square, also visit the Vondelpark. It is a nice park with lot's of interesting people to watch.
Full of life, and relaxing too. Was a great day out, loved it a lot. It is a walk of about 3,5 km on their run track. Most used park I've ever seen, in a very good way.

very big park. its a nice way to relax but I do find the park too big tho and most of the lakes look the same beautiful fountains tho I think it would be great if there were a few market stalls just to make it more interesting. maybe they could put another pub in or a café . they could put more ice cream stalls on because I couldn't find an ice cream van around the park but loads of play areas and loads of space to run around very beautiful to look at . they could do with a land train as the park is huge and would be great for the lakes and a paddle pool would be awesome too .

Beautiful Vondelpark. We had amazing weather during our visit to Amsterdam so Vondelpark was crazy busy. The atmosphere buzzed with activity and was full of people chilling out or playing sport. Many people were barbequing or having picnics. Walking or riding their bikes. Playing or Listening to music. Just fantastic.
Great Park. Great park to relax in and watch the people skate by. Good park for children too. Take a break from the hustle and bustle and relax here!

An oasis in the middle of the city. Beautiful park where locals and tourists come to relax. There are coffee houses and restaurants all around, so you can have something to eat and drink. You can park yourself in a coffee house and just relax and take in the atsmophere or you can take a blanket and a picnic and just take the day off.
Urban Oasis. Great park for all ages .. strolling or cycling , eating or drinking , sports or chilling under a tree , it caters for everyone

Beautiful. If you would like to have a walk and get in touch with nature see some really beautiful and scenic lakes and trees I recommend this park for you. It really is lovely and we were lucky enough to have great weather on the day we walked through it this meant it was a very busy park however this never took away from its beauty. Really outstanding.

nice way to relax from city life. it's near to city, nice to go there sit and relax or have a take-away lunch. If weather is nice, there is always a lot of people, sp great way to just observe the pulse of the people.

Rent a Bike. We rented bikes and made our way to Vondel Park. While we weren't brave enough to bike the streets of Amsterdam, we thoroughly enjoyed a couple of hours exploring this park by bike. It is a bit like Central Park in NYC on a smaller scale.

Beautiful Park needs respect it deserves. If you happen to ride your bike or stroll through this green oasis of Amsterdam on a rare sunny winter day, you will be rewarded with a beautiful mix of unpretentious nineteenth century garden design and inviting paths that bend through ponds and gardens and open greens. But all too often, the park becomes blighted by visitors who don't respect what a beautiful gift they have in their city, whether local citizens or visitors from a far. Be prepared for litter, beer bottles and a less peaceful atmosphere that a great city park should offer which is such a shame. For a better experience, head to the Westerpark where you'll find a good atmosphere, pleasant surroundings and cleverly restored gas refinery turned to entertainment venues and restaurants to quench your senses and palate.
beautiful park. beautiful park with lots to do and see!.Its also located right next to the museums defiantly recommend hiring a bike and cycling around and chilling by the lake!

Great place to relax. Very lovely park with lots of grass and ponds. Lots of people laying out for a weekday afternoon. Probably the most swimming suits I've seen without an actual place to swim (the ponds don't count). There are some snack vendors around and a cafe in the middle of the park. Perfect place to take a break from walking around the city and sight-seeing.

What a park!. This park is easy to get to from most parts of the city. A longer but fun walk from the city center through all the canals and amazing architecture. Find the entrance to the park just past liedsplane and as soon as you walk past the gates you'll feel a calm come over you. wander and enjoy the beauty of a true city park! A great 1/2 day break from the attractions and crowds and a must when the weather is nice.

Lovely Place on a Nice Evening. Enjoyed our walk through the park on a recent sunny evening. It was definitely the place to be - packed with walkers, runners, bikers, and those enjoying sitting on the lawns enjoying drinks and/or food.

A nice walk...and it's free!. We walked through Vondelpark on a beautiful sunny day. The atmosphere was very relaxed. Residents of Amsterdam where out and about enjoying the park with picnics, bike riding, reading books, sun bathing, walking and carriage rides. Worth a visit--and it's free!

Beautiful Park next to the Museum!. When I was there, the weather had just become wonderful...everyone was out in the park..the tulips were in bloom...It reminded my of the 70's as young people had boom boxes and the people where eating..throwing frisbee etc...It was people watching galore. Fun day!

Lovely Park. We had a great afternoon in this park. We had met up with family who were visiting from the USA, we shopped and took a picnic with us and sat near one of the many lakes. Great Park and so near to the Centre

Cant miss this!!!. A beautiful park and definitely not to miss! I was there before the Amsterdam marathon and the whole park was abuzz with runners, food, frolic and fun!!! Its one of those places you just want to belong to!!
Good place to relax. It's a good place to relax but nothing much to see. My 30 months old daughter played in the play area and we had a tea. If you have more time to stay then it's on to visit it.
Beautiful getaway from the hustle of the city. If you need some peace and quiet then walk over to the cities most relaxing spot. Filled with pond, bridges and little cafe's.
Wonderful place. Very nice looking place for rest with friends or bicycle ride. When sun is shining there are a lot people having barbecue there. Lots of kids as well.

A great feel for locals in Amsterdam. Great park for walking, biking or even having a picnic (on a sunny day). We biked across the park and got a feel of how locals spend their weekend in the park, how fast they really bike ;)
Good place to pick up some fried and go it by the water.

One of the most gorgeous park in Europe. I spent an entire day in the park with my daughter of 3 years-old. There is a nice playground (not too big but enough for her), with a sand closed area where children can play with all the sand toys that people put there for them (lovely attitude!). There are lots of bridges and little rivers and lakes, lots of grass areas where people can where people can lie down under a tree. And every Sunday it seems to be a free concert in the theatre. It was sunny and we enjoyed it. What else can I ask?
lovely park. a beautiful park used by locals and tourists, good chocomal at the tennis club with free wifi as well :)

Lovely to cycle around. Not as big as Hyde Park I don't think, but still a lovely place to go for a cycle in the sunshine and loads of grassy space to relax too. We ate and had a few cocktails in Vondeltuin too which was really nice - definitely cycle on over there!
Lovely park. We took bikes to the park and cycled around for a while. Even in February it was beautiful and very relaxing. The park's huge and you don't feel like part of the city.

lovely park to laze in in the sunshine. we went there on our first day as it was so warm - people out enjoying the weather, BBQs and a nice walk
the portaloo's spolit it a bit though - the smell....

Love Vondelpark. Vondelpark is a must-visit if you're in AMS. We stayed at the Conscious Hotel just outside Vondelpark. Any time of day you will find people in the park, exercising, cycling, walking, or just visiting with friends. It's much like the Central Park of NYC in terms of size. We visited on the 150th anniversary. There are several restaurants at the north end and countless trails and walking paths. Great for an afternoon picnic!

Rode through every morning and evening of our visit. A lovely place to ride through, sit in, walk around. We saw the storks nesting and just loved the clean fresh air of this beautiful park and it's slow easy pace. Make time to visit it.
Loved it. Great place to relax and have a wander around. Picasso sculpture is a nice wee find. Also some cool markets for crafts at times.

Nice park, few facilities, quite busy. This is the biggest park in Amsterdam. It won't take away your breath like other parks in Europe, but it's long enough to jog properly, the air is clean and it's very busy with bikers and joggers.It's not Kensington Park or something, but a nice place to stroll if you're around.
Beautiful Park!. The Vondelpark is absolutely beautiful and large. I really enjoyed strolling through the park, people watching, and just relaxing in this wonderful environment.

A small slice of heaven. When you walk through this park - it almost feels for a minute that you are outside the city. I walked through here several mornings before the city awoke (about 6 or 7 am). It was super quiet with only a few bikers and runners getting in the morning work out. There is not much to do in Amsterdam before 9 or 10 am - so this is a perfect getaway before the daily tourist grind!

Big and nice. A very big park where people are relaxing, very clean, lots of children,people singing, doing barbeque. There are some ducks in the water to feed them if you want. A great place for picnic.

Lovely open space. In a city short on open space this park is a sanctuary. It is well kept, there is no litter or do mess. No beggars , no homeless people. No anti social behaviour. A credit to Amsterdam

Nicest park in town. This and Westerpark are two very nice places to spend and afternoon from May to September. A lot of nice Spots, activities and even cafés permanently offer a good option to enjoy the view and disconnect from the city. Worth a visit.

Our family's favorite attraction in Amsterdam. My family of six rented bikes and rode around the beautiful Vondelpark which we unanimously agreed was our favorite experience during our four days in Amsterdam. The scenery was beautiful.

Beautiful big park.. Beautiful big park. Lovely lakes and fountains and grass areas as well as lots of places to sit and watch the world go by. This is a popular park and it's easy to see why. There are courts to play games and a an area for children including a pool. I would highly recommend taking some time to enjoy this park.
To walk. Walking, riding a bike... spending some time... nice park....... Shows in the weekend... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ...
Beautiful and relaxing. I loved walking in the park. Beautiful and relaxing. My hotel was close by and I walked from the hotel to the city center every day of my stay.

Absolutely stunning park - world class.. Easy to walk or bike around, everyone is chilled out, lots of people into exercise but not showing off - all kinds of people and different ages. Animals exist here, which is nice. Paradise.
A lovely walk. If you have an hour or two spare, take the time to walk the park end to end. You won't be disappointed.
Beautiful park, nice area to stay. I love the park. If you love people watching when travelling like me, you'll love hanging out here. Also, there are several playgrounds for the little ones.
Beautiful park. Do a walk or bike ride through this beautiful park. We saw ducks, swans, and a blue heron. Located neat the museum so easy to do both in a half day.

Enjoy the unique park atmosphere as a reflection of the true Amsterdam spirit?. The Vondelpark is one of my favorite places to be in Amsterdam. If you think you have seen it all you will be surprised. You may positively expect the unexpected there: it is a great place to walk, run (big loop is 3,3k), boot camp, skate, blade, cycle, listed to music, do a BBQ, walk your dog, ride a horse, just lay in the grass, climb the hanging tree bridges for kids, see the many parrots (!) or visit one of the popular terraces in the sun: Blauwe Theehuis or Vondeltuin are popular with locals. Be careful during sunny weekends on the bicycle as it can be very crowded, but the atmosphere always remains very laid back and relaxing.

A Relaxing Break from the City Hubbub. This is a large park set in the centre of Amsterdam, not far from the Reikmuseum. It is quite extensive and well used by locals as well as tourists. We sat on a shady bench and watched a blue tit feed her young in a nesting box. At on stage she had to see off an inquizitive woodpecker. There are several lakes throughout the park with ducks and other birds waiting for you to feed them. On the day we went there were also two men giving free entertainment to the children by creating lots of huge bubbles for them to burst. All in all, a pleasent way to spend a few relaxing hours.
relaxing. The Park is in the centre of Amsterdam ,it is a nice place to relax, on a nice day. watch the people roller skate, or just sit and have a coffee or a bite to eat, well worth a visit.

Relaxing park. The park was a short walk away from our hotel, and offered a relaxing contrast from the hustle and bustle of the city. We were fortunate enough to have hot weather in May so we sat on the grass with a small picnic and enjoyed the peace and quiet. The lake in the centre was calm and stunning to look at. All in all worth a visit.
Great Place. This is a really nice park that you can take your time to walk around. Or you can sit and watch the world go by. Nice to take a break from all the walking around Amsterdsam

Something to do for free. Visited mid afternoon and although very busy it was lovely to just sit down, chill out and just watch the world go by. Take a picnic with you and make an afternoon of it. Was a very sunny afternoon when we went so was lovely to just sit there and get a tan. Is also close to the city center so is nice to come and chill and get away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam.

Charming, great early bike ride activity for the time displace American!. A relaxing and charming part of any bike ride around Amsterdam. It is awesome to take a break from the bustle of the city streets. If you are from the US and Amsterdam is your first stop, rent a bike the night before and lock it outside your hotel, then when your jet lag wakes you up at 6 or 7 am go see a deserted, wonderful Amsterdam!
Gorgeous park and fun photo opportunities. Our hotel, the Park, was right next to this place and we thoroughly enjoyed walking through often! Great for a stroll, picture taking, and just relaxing.
peaceful and serene. park is well used and loved by the people who visit. a gentle oasis not too far from the centre and trams are convenient

Great park!. What a wonderful respite in the center of Amsterdam! On Friday nights you can see lots of young groups having picnics and just hanging out playing music, etc. During the day there are joggers galore, as well as the million bikes of Amsterdam! Great park to sit down and chill out
Simple tranquility. V nice and relaxing stop . Great for all ages. Chill zone take a sandwich and drink and just watch the world go by

Nice park. It is my first place that I will come when I reach Amsterdam. Just walking around, sitting there and watch some people play with their dog.Take a picture on that big I Amsterdam... It is a place that we can relax a second before and after long walk to enjoy Amsterdam. There is a nice hotdog that we can buy to enjoy the park at the lunch time.

green lung in Amsterdam. Vondelpark is a very pleasant park with an open air theatre, located just outside the last Southern canal ring of the old Amsterdam city center, close to Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum.
Nice park, open spaces. Went for a run here - it's a nice, scenic park with open spaces and a few playgrounds. Picturesque lighting and very clean.

such a nice place to relax. the vondelpark is a big park, to sit by the water with your friends , to ride the bike and just relax and get the vibes of Amsterdam.We hired the bikes next to the Asics store (leidsplain tram stop) it was about 14-16 euros per bike for bike (some of the hotels have their own bike rentals)

Great place for almost anything. Beautiful place to run, bike or just relax. Amsterdam's Central Park but with an intimate scale. The park begins as a narrow garden and widens as one reaches the outer rings of the city.

Amsterdams own little Central park. With hundreds of green parrots flying around making noise, this park is the garden for many thousands of locals who live in an apartment without a garden of its own. Especially on a sunny day this makes for an interesting mix of all sorts. Kids parties, expats, joggers, business people and elderly all share their park with the many tourists of all ages who have found a nice place to rest from the real attractions. And it's free!

Relax, hike, bike, and drink. Real city parque, which offers plenty of shaded relaxing spots too.Easiest to visit by bike and select your favourite area!Especially (going west) after the Eastern and central part of the parque, you find many calm and spacious areas.Buy some food and drinks in one of the surrounding shops, many are open until 22:00. TIP: Get quality bio food (fish, meat and wine from the shop "Marqt" at the Overtoom 21), Marqt offers food with respect for nature, made responsibly and with passion.Perfect for a wine and dine picnic!

Serenely tranquil, even with large groups of people in proximity. Took a stroll thru Vondelpark to grab a cold Heineken, followed shortly thereafter with an ice cream cone to cleanse the pallet... The grounds have gorgeous landscaping and is clean and well-kept... Even in a "throng" of people, it was relaxing to just pull-up a patch of grass and watch the world go-by...
Park Vondel. Beautifull for a walk , running or biking. Exellent neiborhood.Beautifful restaurant inside de Park

A great getaway situated near city-center!. With paths stretching for miles, Vondelpark offers a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam streets. You can soak up the sun on one of the many grass plots, sit by the water or find yourself on a peaceful bridge in the woods. A must visit in Amsterdam on a nice spring or autumn day. You are bound to find romantic couples, teens playing sports, and families as Vondelpark will instill a sense of tranquility on your vacation!
Beautiful Park. If you like to stroll along with your partner or just find a small cozy spot to people watch then this is an excellent place to go.

Where the Amsterdam people go. Enjoy the park where all the Amsterdam inhabitants go to relax, bbq, picknick, run, bike or simply hang out together with friends.
Beautiful park in the middle of the city.
Fun in the Sun. Vondel Park is a beautiful place to spend an afternoon. Very large, music, plenty of reasonable cafe's and great for mild jogging, walking or cycle rides at all times of the day
nice park. watch out for the bicycles on the footpaths, plenty of benches to sit and admire the views, very cold and windy when we stayed in march, would have been nicer in better weather

Beautiful place to chill out. We spent the large part of a day in Vondelpark, which is a lot bigger than expected. When we arrived initially it was pouring with rain so we took shelter in the cafe which is slightly over priced although the food was good and there's open views into the park. The rain soon cleared and we took a stroll around, taking rests by some of the lakes and grassy areas, the park was buzzing with people and had a really nice atmosphere. Great place to spend a sunny day

Great city hide away. The Vondelpark is always a nice retreat from the city, every season it's great to walk and explore.In winter you can see people skating, in summer it seems the whole of Amsterdam is celebration something in the park or having a Bbq, spring is ideal to see the storks if you're lucky or just the trees coming back to life after a long winter and fall is ideal to catch those last rays of sun and see the changing colours of the trees.

Nice but don't go on your own... The park is beautiful but I wouldn't want to go through here on my own, although it is busy, pretty and great for pictures there are a lot of guys drinking out of paper bags as you walk up to the big lake and it is quite intimidating.

Nice place to spend the afternoon on a bank holiday with jazz in the park. Nicely kept and maintained park. The dog part has dogs running about. There was a bank holiday jazz thing on a stage going on when we visited with a bar, seats and people with children and picnics - it was a lovely atmosphere. The park is lovely just to wonder around. We stopped at a busy but cute cafe at the edge of the park for coffee on the way home after the wander - cake is of course necessary - queue was long but nice sitting out in the spring sunshine.

Stunning Park. We wandered into Vondelpark for lunch after spending the morning at the museum. The park is beautiful and well used - young mothers pushing strollers, joggers out for a run, business men riding through on their bikes.The restaurant was also a nice surprise - good food, friendly service and reasonably priced.
lovely park for a quiet rest. If you are stressed out with shopping take a trip to vondelpark where you can sit and and watch the world go by, take a little pick nick with you
park. it was huge, plenty of space to run or walk around, we did'nt manage to see it all though as time was limited for us
Beautiful park. Gorgeous park for a bike ride, picnic, aerobics. Lots happening here. Even a couple cafes. Definitely try to visit while in town. Close to the Van Gogh and rijks museums.

nice and beautiful garden. We visited vondelpark during king's day. parents with their children are selling stuffs and performing in the park. The weather is good, park is clean and well organised. We had a lovely dad

Beautiful Park. Such an amazing park! We wandered through at dusk guided by my nephew and his girlfriend who both live in Amsterdam. It was stunning and peaceful even though it was filled with other people. They all had such reverence for the space that it was hard not to feel the same. A definite must-see!
The Central Park of Amsterdam. Rode a bike through on a Sunday... just beautiful. Families with children, dogs, soccer players. Say some parrots flying around as well. Idyllic and beautiful.
Great. Great experience, people chilling, exercising and relaxing. Very nice park! If you like the laid back nature of the Dutch you'll love this park

Lovely cycle through the park. Plenty to see in this park. We only took a quick cycle because it started to rain but it would be great in sunny weather and plenty of interesting sculptures and fountains
Beautiful. We walked through this park every single day on our way to the city centre and everyday we found something new and beautiful. I suggest walking and taking in all the views.

Very pleasant park. This is a very scenic park within the museum district of the city. There is a picturesque lake that runs through it, and there are various cafes along the way. It is clearly well used by locals and tourists alike. Well worth a visit.

Beautiful. It is definitely worth a visit if you want to relax, or even are only close by. The park is within a short walking distance of the Museumplein with the main museums and is a great place to sit down and relax and people watch.The atmosphere is very calm since many people are just relaxing or having a picnic on one of the many grass lawns that the park has to offer.

Great for a cycle away from the raffic. This park, close to the City Centre is used for leisure, and also as a means of getting around the city by the locals. A cycle around it is most enjoyable, as it is car free. I had a coffee and cake in one of the cafes, the cake was wrapped in plastic and chilled and really rather tasteless.

Central Park of AMS. A day of sun made for warm relaxing. Good number of people in spacious park. Good birds, many benches, friendly folks. Nice example of how euro -civic development can present Nature in a way that people can get a lot of use from, yet not use up. Your picnic blanket should be water resistant.

Park. Brilliant park, great scenery and an unexpected tennis tournament to watch :). Despite the rain, the park offered great shelter and very easy to get too on tram from central station. It's Tram number 1 from Stand B and it's 5.50 euros I think for 2 hours travelling time

Great place to rest and see locals. In May/2015 the IamsTERDAM logo was there and very easy to take photos without crowds.
Great place to rest for a while, while locals run and do their sports.
Easy to reach by tram and a great place to sit down and eat that snack/drinks one bought at the local supermarket.

Nice Walk. If you end up near Vondelpark, it's definitely worth some time to walk through it. There's a great restaurant where you can get stop for a drink or food. Take some time to sit down and take in the locals.

Lovely for a bike ride. On a sunny day this park was lovely. We had a nice chilled ride around the park in the tree lined paths and then sat and had a break with a hot dog near the lake. It's also close to the museum square so that's nice :)
just beautiful and relaxing. enjoy this park every time we go , family friendly park fun to explore and walk around in nice weather. theres a cafe and children playground area.
Very pretty. Lovely walking park within the museum area. Lots of art and the I amsterdam sign which you must see if you go in person.

Nice to take a walk from museum area to good local neighborhood and good food. Nice park in city, just south of museum neighborhood. Bike baths, strolling lanes, lots of locals. Cool green parrots flying openly

A great park for a walk.. This park is of good size, but not too big to walk on all the pathways in an afternoon. There are some nice gardens and places just to sit and people watch. And there are some larger spaces were people are sun bathing or playing.

Just a park. I dont understand peoples obsession with Vondelpark. Having been to Amsterdam well over 15 times, it was only this month that I visited Vondelpark for the first time. It is just a park. It has lakes, benches, people lying on the grass, alcoholics with their bottles in brown bags, all the things that ANY park in the world has, nothing special. However, having said that, it does have one of the I amsterdam signs in the park, whilst this sign isnt as busy as the one in Museumplein, it still has people cosntantly on it (I waited over 40 mins trying to get a picture of the sign without people climbing on it, humping it, standing in front of it, taking millions of selfies, etc and then lost patience and gave up on my picture). In my mind this park doesnt represent Amsterdam because to me Amsterdam is canals. However if youre looking to get away from the canals and spend some time in a park, then I expect youll enjoy this park far more than I do.

Relaxing park to watch people cycle to work. We used the park as a nice route to from our hotel and the museums. We stopped at Lidl on the way to buy breakfast, and then sat on a bench to watch everyone cycling to work, or jogging around. Very relaxing. Nice clean park. Couple of food outlets.

Lovely. Very calm atmosphere, lots of space to relax on the grass and enjoy the sun. Was able to smoke in the park with no bother. Some people playing music loudly so could enjoy that. Nice arty statues and lovely water features!

Lovely :). Perfect if you want to take a short break, just sit down, enjoy something to eat.You just have to realice that all of Amsterdam is meeting there, so it's quite crowdy and not all to quite- and - like everywhere in Amsterdam- be careful of racing bicycles! But it's for free and a nice place to get some new energy :)
A haven from the city. Lovely open space with great planting and interesting birds. You would have to stay in grassy areas if walking but great to cycle around.
Relaxed atmosphere. Spend a leisurely couple of hours here, definitely worthwhile to escape the hustle and bustle of town traffic!
Nice park. Park was right behind our hotel so we went here for s smpke, very quiet lovely place, cyclist, dog walkers and joggers at all hours, the lake was frozen I bet its beautiful in the summer x

Lovely park in Amsterdam but take a bike so you can get around it all. We went to the Vondelpark on 21st May 2015 on a lovely Spring day it was beautiful but it is a large park so I suggest you hire a bike unless you want to be there all day.Not even flowers to get 5 stars but a lovely park if you want peace and quiet.

Relaxing park. It was a lovely park. I hired a bike for next to nothing and spent a couple of hours just riding around. It is a very big park and has a nice, relaxing atmosphere. It is a good place to go to take some time out after a few weeks of busy travelling - and to get away from the crowds!

excellent place to chill. Vondelpark is a great place to unwind. one can see the life of the city with people jogging and riding bikes, have a fun time along with the beauty and presence of the greens. Must visit
Loved it. Cycled around here its such a great place to be on a hot sunny day to relax and wi d down from the busyness of the city madness

nice park. Unfortunatley I have not been here in summer, but the park looks very nice and I am sure it is an amazing park to chill out in the summer. There is a lot of water, places to barbecue, they even have bars and something that looks like a cinema. Above all it is in the middle of the city, perfect!!

A wonderful little patch of green. Just a short walk from our hotel, it was fun to sit on the grass and enjoy the warm sunshine on a beautiful clear day. It was a Sunday afternoon and all the locals were soaking up the sun, grilling and playing games with their children. Reminds one of Central Park in New York City, but much smaller.
How beautiful to have in the city. It is just beautiful to stroll around and the bird life is amazing to watch. Great place to get out of the city centre.

Lovely cycle around the park. Not a huge park but lovely to cycle around. On a warm day it would be lovely to see by the lake and enjoy the water fountains that can be found around the park. We enjoyed a coffee in the park cafe and were able to lounge in the sunshine on the oversized bean bags. A pleasant way to idle away an hour and a half.
Casual walk. Was a nice sunny day to walk through here with the missus. Some ice cream vans and nice secenery. Would recommend to just chill out, and good place to smoke some weed if you like.
Awesome. It's under construction, but it's beautiful. The nature catches you, there are not so many people around, there are benches you can rest.

A lovely change of pace.. Vondelpark is easily accessible by foot, canal, tram and bus. It is beside the Museum Quarter and provides a welcome change of pace to the rest of the city. It is a great place to people watch, grab a snack or a drink, and let an hour or two drift by.We saw herons, baby coots and ducks on the many ponds and lakes.However there isn't much in the way of dedicated children's play areas - the one we found was very basic and a bit of a let down.

Beautiful park. A beautiful park with lots of open space and water!It is a very popular location so is not 'quiet' - in fact, there are many, many joggers, cyclists, skateboarders etc! - but there are wide paths and it is a large area. There are a couple of cafes/restaurants - we visited one for a coffee which had a large outdoor seating area from where we could people-watch! Definitely worth some time during a visit to Amsterdam!
It's a lovely, huge park.. Lovely place. We went there in winter but it was still nice. I would compare to Hyde Park in London.
Wonderful place for a walk. Not far from the Rijkmuseum this busy but beautiful park is a great place to either walk or find a spot to sit and relax.
Greenery. A beautiful extensive park, about 20 minutes' walk from the Museumplein. We saw some interesting birds in the park.
A good place to walking. The Vondelpark is one of the most famous park in Europe, you could pratice sports (biking, jogging). It's a very familiar place, children will enjoy the park.

Picture perfect setting. Vondelpark is the postcard of Amsterdam. Locals and tourists from all walks of life enjoying beautiful natural surroundings, right in the heart of the city. Go and treat yourself!
So much happening here!. We enjoyed having a beer in a outdoor cafe. We enjoyed other food and souvenir shops. It was fun for all ages.
Visit the park during King's Day celebration.. It was great and all the neighborhoods in the area displayed all of their items for view and for sale.

City park, much used, accessible and much liked.. Showing signs of age, maintenance is slipping and flower beds weedy. Pleasant atmosphere, good place to have a quiet chat, not a patch on NYC's Central Park

Very pleasant park. This park is where folks go to enjoy the sun, run, catch up with nature. It is well laid out and the ponds are pleasant. An excellent place for a run or to sit and watch the birds.
Pleasant stroll.. Nice place to amble around and find a bench to rest weary legs after wondering around the canals. Keep your eyes open for the local Herons who also like the park.

Lovely place to wander. Lots of space, plenty of benches, gorgeous green areas with lots of trees, walking paths, flowers, ponds, and people watching to keep you occupied. Perfect on a lazy sunny day when you can lunge and enjoy. Also a few food carts with hot dogs/ice cream/snacks if you feed a pick me up.

What a joy. It was beautiful weather and my family and I had hired bikes and rode through the park stopping off here and there to look more closely, eat lunch and play in the playgrounds. We came back again a few days later. It was wonderful.

Nice place to spend a nice day. Large park area in the city centre is always great, no matter which town it is in.
Very popular and often crowded, but you should be able to find a peaceful place too if needed.
A Breath of Fresh Air. A pretty oasis that,yet, has pleanty of life about it. Mind the cyclists! This little park is nicely placed close to the shops and museums.

Girls weekend. This park is stunning - a great place to people watch all day.
It is a vast park that you can walk around for hours relaxing or getting an early morning walk in.
There is a great cafe which serves fantastic selection of food and drinks with some comfy rocking chairs to relax on

multi-use park. Great place to ride a bike, walk, run, skateboard, picnic, or just sit and watch everyone go by. We walked a loop around the park and saw all of the above. We felt very safe and enjoyed seeing a slice of real life.
Nice park for running. Good place to running but not so long. Also perfect for picnic or just get out from traffic and crowded street
Very nice. Very nice very relaxing! Would definitely recommend going here. Need to watch out for the bikes everywhere but that's Amsterdam in general

A real green isle in the Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is visited by many citizens and tourists.
