It is full of people enjoying a sunny day, dog-walking, jogging, roller-skating, listening to music, people-watching, or just laying on the grass. For the children there are some playgrounds. Vandering nice strolling paths you will find different attractions starting from statue of the poet Vondel with a lot of flowers around, fascinating trees and water ponds.
Beautiful. Visit here in the summer months and it's beautiful and peaceful, perfect for picnics etc, wild ducks wander about, great place to hang out with friends and family

Beautiful green area. The Vondelpark is the huge green area near the Museumplein. It has a beautiful river corssing it, so you will find a nice place to rest under a tree or near the river.It is, however, easy to get lost inside of it and end up in the other side of the town (that happened to me!). The park itself has little to no signage system, and the one you find might be unhelpful. Basically, go there, take a look, make some nice photos and walk more around: Amsterdam has much more unique places to visit.
Beautiful!. From all the parks in Europe , Vondelpark is one of the greenest! You can run, make a picnic, listen to music , ride your bike, etc. It is full of green parts, small lakes and fountains.
Nice park. We were cycling in this park a sunny Sunday. A very nice park. A lot of People and everybody were satisfied with the sunny weather

A great place to run away from traffic in central Amsterdam. Early this morning I ran from our apartment in Utrechsedwarsstraat along Stadhouderskade next to Singelgracht past the Heineken Experience and Rijksmuseum Museum to Vondelpark. I enetered the park and ran twice around the perimeter road inside the park boundary. There were lots of other runners and it was very peaceful and enjoyable. Was surprised to see a lot of litter floating in the lovely lakes. I got back to the apartment after about an hour's running and 11.5 km of very pleasant running without any cars to annoy me.

Beautiful and restful. Spend time in Amsterdam viewing the sites, dodging the bikes and cars and so on, but at some point take a quiet walk through the Vondelpark. It is a very large, very green space enjoyed by many people, but it never seemed crowded. Sit by one of the several ponds, watch the fountains and birds, have an ice cream or coffee or meal at convenient locations, see a concert if you are there at the right time of year/day. IT is amazing that such a nice park can be found in the middle of such a large, bustling city.

Nice stroll. My husband took a short stroll into the park on a Saturday. There were a lot people lounging around, walking, bicycling, etc. It seems the locals really enjoy getting out in the fresh air. I didn't think there was anything exceedingly spectacular about the small portion we saw. Just a nice green space.
Gorgeous park. Loved our bike ride through the park trails...over 3 times lapped around. Lots going on and things to do and see for everyone. Highly recommended!!!

Nice place for a walk.... i love the park... its nice place to have a mellow cruise with my longboard, weekend morning biking, or just have a walk.... the place was soooo nice with lots of tree, smooth pavement and good views around... its also nice for chill or having a little picnic. :)
Love it!!!. So peaceful and relaxing. Great atmosphere. Would defintely recommend to anybody that wants a relaxing afternoon in the sun!!
The park to begrea. Great place to unwind. At the Vondelpark is a relaxed atmosphere. Bring your own drinks and snacks and enjoy the sun, music and each others presence.

Astonishing. This is by far the most beautiful urban park I have ever been to. I was there towards the end of autumn and the landscapes were absolute amazing. It is a good place to enjoy nature, have lunch, relax or take a break from your tour through the city. This is a must-visit place in Amsterdam.

Lovely, Large Park. Beautiful park! Stayed near there and walked through a bunch of times. Loads of plants, flowers, trees, shrubs....greenery! Places to sit and relax. Bikes galore. Be careful where you walk. Wish we had time to take a picnic in the park. That would make for a great lunch!

Large city park. Actually I was expecting a lot more out of our visit to the Vondelpark, maybe it was the time of year in late March, there was no colour, no flowers, unstructured gardens. This city park was popular with cyclists and dog owners, I could see that in warmer months it would be a great place to escape for a picnic or a walk.

The Shreves visit Vondelpark.. My husband and I were looking for a place to people watch and just hang out for a while. This park is perfect for this. When we were there, we heard live music and smelled food cooking. We also found beautiful flowers! Such a wonderful little park! Do not miss it.
Relax in the Park. Watch the world go by. We enjoyed the park even it was filled with people on a sunny long holiday weekend. Lots of beautiful trees, still room for ducks and dogs.

Lunch in Vondelpark. We grabbed a picnic lunch, beer and wine (from a shop called B&B just nearby - they were a bit busy and the service a bit chaotic but the food was awesome) and we took in the ambience of Vondelpark. Just a really enjoyable time, people watching and getting a little sunshine. It is a beautiful park. Take a little time out from dodging bicycles and relax.

Beautiful!. What a beautiful and peaceful park to go for a walk, run or just take a break. Note: there is a 2nd "I AMSTEDAM" sculpture within the park that is less busy and easier to get a photo on/of.

Beautiful, clean, green... perfect to spend an afternoon. Vondelpark is really beautiful. You will find lots of families, youngsters, couples, joggers, etc. The place is buzzing most of the times. But it is big enough to give you enough space and serenity. If you are visiting any of the museums in museumplein, it might be a great idea to club this on the same day. It is a great break after you have a long museum experience. You can take your own picnic basket and settle down somewhere, or you can visit the Blauwe Theehuis which is a small eatery in the middle of the park. Its the perfect park for a stroll, a jog or a picnic.
Amazing!. Lovely park , maybe the best one in Amsterdam, ideal for a sunday late breakfast after an amazing night in Amsterdam, you can also walk into the park it's just amazing!
geweldig. nice place big and so many things to see and to do really big park so many tourist too .. this park is really big and nice soany people running and biking so be careful while walking!
very pretty. t was nice to have a walk around the park, very relaxing. A good place to sit and have a quiet few moments
Nothing special. Had a nice walk here to break up the day from dams but overall it was not a particularly special park. There were some interesting birds but other than that nothing really stood out.

Lovely park. reminded me a bit of Central Park in NYC. Lots going on and very busy as it was a Sunday. Very family orientated take a picnic or there is a nice cafe there that do the most amazing tuna rolls

Lovely Park but needs attention. there is no doubt this is an impressive area but spoilt by some of the visitors behaviour, the need to update the cafe in the centre and the couple of beggars. Still worth a visit but really needs a general upgrade of the faculties.
great city park!. Amsterdam is a quiet city but walking thru a park makes you more serene! just watch out for the bicyles they go really fast!
Breathtaking. Vondelpark is stunning, it has gorgeous views and I'd definitely recommend hiring bikes to ride through it. You can get some incredible shots too.

Great for a stroll. A lovely green space in Amsterdam, lots of families, dogs, tourists (of course) some drunk folk (but they're everywhere aren't they?) Lovely for a Sunday walk before lunch, lakes, a fountain, ducks, herons, statues, some quirky wood carvings, allow yourself a couple of hours.
Fun for a stroll. It was a beautiful park and we enjoyed our Saturday afternoon stroll, beer in hand. Quite busy on the weekend but the people watching was spectacular.

A beautiful oasis. We arrived in Amsterdam early so took the opportunity to stroll through Vondelpark to the centre. What a fantastic green space within a capital city! The paths through the park are used by many bicycles, there are cafes and also an open air stage, and there are a lot of playground areas for children. The best bit for me is the wildlife; I saw storks, herons and parrots!

Very nice park, please rent a bike. Very central and nice park. Near Museumplein. Please rent a bike from MacBike near Hard Rock Cafe, especially with your children. Very easy riding, calm and beautiful park.

Amazing play structures. If you are in Amsterdam with kids this is the place to go. The play structures are like none I have ever seen in the States. They go up, around and over. The rest of the park is beautiful and green everywhere. While we were the the "traveling" IAmsterdam sign was also in Vondelpark. It is a beautiful restful retreat but can be quite busy on a sunny day.

Magical Park. An absolutely magical garden, everything is green and blooming, may small lakes with fountains, nice and sunny coffee kiosk and a rest. great place to hang out with kids (playgrounds and many places to run)a wonderful idea is to grab a bike, to buy some cheese and fruit ride to the park, find a magical spot in nature and just lain down relax and have a nice picnic.
Beautiful!. Was a very beautiful park!It was very clean and one of my favourite places in Amsterdam.Would recommend taking a walk through it if you go here.
Love this park. This park is just wonderful! Nice to just hang out or have a BBQ! Also a good park to have a run in or a stroll around with you're skeelers !

Beautiful Park. Spent an afternoon there and it was a beautiful park. It is kind of hidden as Amsterdam is very compacted. However, when you enter the gates it just expands and it is worth it to see. Very close to the museum district which is nice as you rest your feet after the Rijiksmuseum and Van Gough Museum

Wonderful oasis of quiet. A beautiful park filled with locals enjoying themselves. Beautiful specimum trees and interesting sculpture scattered throughout. There are several restaurants within the park where it is possible to sit and contemplate the people. A wonderful place to get away from the crowds.
Beautiful park. Very green park with lots of people exercising, riding bicycles, walking, or visiting. A nice place for a picnic. It is over a mile to walk thru the park.

Great for chilling and running. We were looking for a park to run with my friends and Vonderpark has been our choice. It's well located, next to the Museum place and not so far from the Center. It's not very long to go around but it worths it.
Even in winter a sight to behold. It was chilly, and remnants of snow were all around, but Vondelpark retained its absolute beauty during a relaxing stroll down its length. This is a must-see!
Very average park. useful for joggers and cyclists, but did not seem very attractively planted or well looked after. there are a few cafes there

Beautiful Park. We spent a morning strolling through Vondelpark - very relaxing and a real escape from the busy streets of Amsterdam. We missed the peak of the tulip blossoms, but found many nice areas to sit and relax and watch the joggers and bicyclists pass by.
Nice park. Visited this park on Saturday when the weather was off/on with sunshine. It's a very beautiful park, a nice walk through the sunshine.

Gorgeous park. Rent a bike near the Hard Rock cafe and start exploring the park. Vondelpark was the most favourite highlight of the City. Really recommend going there especially when the sun is out. Take some time off and enjoy the nature.

Cute. I visited this park twice. Once on King's Day to see all of the children selling their goods, which was adorable, and once a few days later. The park was very nice and a great place to stroll through.
Great park. Do have a bike so as to go aroung this hudge park. Great place to jog, walk, or have a picnic. If there isn't much sun do take a jacket with you
very nice park!. After our diner we walked through this park, it is very big and is has nice atmosphere. you will see a lot of locals here what is a good thing!

Relaxation and quite. My second time in this park and not my last. This time I travelled through the park using a bicycle, which is definitely a must do. A lot of passages, birds, friendly people and benches with great views. I also enjoyed having packed lunch there... totally worth it

Nice design, but too much trash. I liked Vondelpark, but there was too much trash in the winding bodies of water in the park. Plenty of people lay about the park, BBQing, playing, running, and smoking.

Take a stroll through the park. Vondelpark's a great place to visit in Amsterdam if you have a bit of time.We went on a rainy-ish day, and it was still full of people jogging, walking their dogs, etc.The stroll around the park is quite nice (probably better on a sunny day) so if you have some spare time, it's worth visiting for sure. It's close to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum, so you can combine the visits.

Hired bikes around the corner from the park. Lovely day so decided to hire some bikes for a couple of hours. Safer for us than in the city centre as we had not been on a bike for years. The park has fountains, pavilion and cafe. Seats all around or sit on the grass. The police patrolled around slowly in a car a few few times in the two hours we hired the bikes. Most enjoyable six days we had in Amsterdam.
awesome place to wander. ambience, solitude, beauty. lovely to ride a bike through, walk your dog, just stroll with friends or alone. the blue herons walk right up to you. glorious.
Tranquility. A lovely space in a crowded city, a peaceful time out after soaking up the rest of the city and shopping. Make it part of your day to collect your thoughts and enjoy a quiet coffee.

Great view of Amsterdam life. This park is great . Good for a run, walk or bike , if you are game. There are also a couple of eating options in the the park so check it out it is in the Museum district.

Vondel park. It is a beautiful park all over the year to walk,bike, gouging and to enjoy nature.
Not comfortable with some spots with drunk people.
A little piece of Nature. Nice to have a big park with lakes in tje middle of the city, a place to run off to When tired of the buildings and tje crazy city center.

Really big, open space park!. Vondel Park is brilliant. There's lots to walk around, and see! It's a very relaxed and tranquil place. You can walk around, sit on the grass, have a picnic! Whatever suits your fancy. We saw lots of dog walkers, people playing Frisbee, and football. I'd definitely recommend a visit to this park on a lovely day!
Beautiful!. We had a wonder around Vondelpark and all I can say is that this place is beautiful! We visited the Vondelpark cafe/bar and ordered some drinks for a reasonable price!

Cute little park. This park was right in the middle of the street and we found it kind of by accident. If you're looking for the 'I-amsterdam' sign to be a top tourist there's one here that's a lot quieter than the one near the Van Gogh museum!
Just watch out for all the bikes, but that goes for anywhere in Amsterdam!

Nice place to visit and walk around. Even though this park is a little bit far away from central Amsterdam, it is completely worth the visit. Either walk or bike to this place to experience new parts and bring a blanket with you to sit down and relax.
Beautiful patk. Rent a bike and go there! Without bike you will definetly won't be able to see the whole park, we're not sure if we managed by bikes - it is really huge.

Lovely for relaxing on a sunny day. It is a very large park with ice cream & hot dog vendors dotted around. There are various ponds. I had lunch here in a small but very popular cafe, it seemed to be very popular with the locals.
rent a bike first. loved ii! great park to go around by bike or running. Dont forget to take a pic at the "I am sterdam" monument!
Probably Better in Summer. This was a nice park to walk in but not a great deal to see or do at Easter time. I suspect it is much more lively in the summer.
Quite place in the middle of Amsterdam. Nice and green place in the heart of the city. Great place for couples and families. Enjoy the quite place

Beautiful park in the middle of the city!. An oasis of freshness in the middle of the hustle and bustle of amsterdam. Lovely little cafe inside the park which is quite relaxed and visited by locals. Perfect on a nice sunny day to get a taste of how locals chill out on weekends!

Beautiful place to stroll. We arrived in Amsterdam on their first day of warm spring weather and the park was jammed --but, this made for very interesting "people watching". It's a beautiful park in the midst of a bustling city.

Centra Park in Europe/Amsterdam . A nice surprise in the middle of the city. Like the more famous centra park in New York... A beautiful green area in the middle of the city..a lot of water, trees, grass...
Ideal for relaxing...
Not large/impressing like the New York version... but nit less appealing...

Nice Park in City Center. Very nice park in a center of Amsterdam. The only problem was with some people smoking weed in some areas. Overall nice place for a picnic or to spend time with family and children.

Beautiful Park. This park is huge! It is such a lovely place to visit. There is so much to do, you can hire bikes from just outside. There is a big restaurant in the middle and plenty for children to do.

Lovely park in the middle of the city. When I visited the park it was full of people waking, running, cycling and hanging out. It was quite tidy with large bin containers strategically placed. I especially liked that there was a nature conservation area and multiple places to sit outside and have a drink. It is a nice little escape from city life in Amsterdam.

Very nice.. Vey nice park in the middle of Amsterdam. Nice for an evening walk or even a picnic.
In some areas many people smoking weed, makes it impossible to stay there with a baby.

Beautiful park. Relaxed park with cafes, ice cream sellers and an open air theatre. There are lakes, plenty of seating and it is well sign-posted so you can find your way around. Lots of cyclists cut through the park but they are polite and pedestrian aware.

Beautiful park in middle of busy city. We always visit here when in Amsterdam. It's easy to spend most of the day here - take a picnic or visit the lovely Art Deco cafe in the middle of the park. Great place to relax and watch the world go by. Would love to live near this park.

nature and picnic. good spot for abit of a walk and a nice little picnic in natural settings if the weather is nice.
we had good weather so packed a little picnic and sat by the pond just relaxing and watching the ducks and birds etc.
it was peaceful and a very nice afternoon out.

A Lovely Oasis in Amsterdam. Walked the length of this delightful park on a sunny day. Stopped for a coffee and enjoyed the surroundings. Saw many birds en route. Thoroughly enjoyed the break from the busy-ness of the city.

Rent a bike and take a pedal around. Me and my travel companion stay 10minutes away from Vondelpark and it was such a lovely place to visit. We decided on our last day in Amsterdam that we needed to hire bikes and ride around the park at our leisure. Its so pretty and well kept. My tip: if you want a picture on the IAMSTERDAM sign, go here. Its a lot quieter and prettier background than the one at the Rijksmuseum.

Amsterdam's Green Space. South of the city is the park. Amsterdams answer to Central Park or Hyde Park. Get away from the hustle and bustle of city life and walk through the park. There are refreshment options should you require them,

Needs a cleanup. This is a great park to walk in on a sunny warm day. There are some really lovely flower gardens and pathways. However, there was a lot of litter/ garbage everywhere which certainly detracted from the experience. The park looked like it had not been cleaned in weeks. Just the day before we had spent time in the Begijnhof which was a total contrast in every way. People need to pick up after themselves, for sure, but the state of Vondelpark was a bit depressing.
Real Amsterdam!. A stroll through this park gets you see authentic Amsterdam. It's where the people who live here come and relax, have a bike ride, a coffee, a picnic or listen to some music.

Beautiful park in the museum district. Popular area especially with the locals and especially on weekends. Well kept, although on a Sunday there was quite a bit of evidence of partying the night before (beer cans, paper, etc.)
A Beautiful Walk in the Park. Very large beautiful park for an early evening walk before or after dinner. Great for a bike ride as well. Very safe and busy.
Excellent Park!!!. Excellent park and 2 blocks from Hotel Vondel. Just an amazing park with trails and walking paths. There were coffee places to sit and enjoy the outdoors as well.

Tick box exercise . Vondelpark was essentially a place we HAD to go to. All the guides said so. You must visit it. To be honest though, it's just a big park. I'm no park connoisseur but I wouldn't go to far out of your way to visit this place. It's neat and tidy and nice to stroll through but we quickly moved on once we'd visited.

A beautiful stroll thru the park. A sunny afternoon in May, the park is beautiful, several places to stop for a meal or drink, lots of walkers, joggers, cyclists, lay on the grass and enjoy the sunset, and watch the people go by. this is where you go when done with museums for the day, and still too early for dinner.
Next pls. Was standing in front of the Entrance. Not amused by it and just walk away. Sorry but Im rating this attraction based on the first glimpse at the entrance. Might not take into account.

Pretty but not worth going out of your way. We were wondering around and frankly took a wrong turn, ending up at the park's entrance, so we walked through. It's pretty but nothing all that different from most other such parks. So, unless you love parks or happen to be in the area for some other reason, this is a sight that can be missed.

Not really worth it!. We thought Vondelpar,k was very ordinary. Best feature was the tulip display in the centre near the (small) pond. The whole place was full of young people lying around in the sun smoking ??? . We visited on a Thursday so one could assume that many of those lying around were unemployed. No wonder our hotel was full of other young people from outside Holland who had found it easy to get jobs. Vondelpark seemed to be a meeting place for rappers playing very loud music, or am I just an old fart?

mandatory to go!. Vondelpark is the ideal place to ride a bike in Amsterdam. It's quite big, so by foot you won't probably be able to see everything. It's a great place for picnics or even just to lay down on the grass and relax. I trully recommend it!
Clean. What a clean and very large park. Easy to walk around in but I would suggest renting a bike. Tons of bikers, walkers and joggers.
Beautiful. One of the best tours we were ever on. Highly recommended. Pavilions were very well done. Especially the Orange pavilion with the emphasis on Van Gough.
Great space. Nice to picnic wonder walk cycle chill in the park cafe there also nice water features definitely recommended a hour or two away from the hustle and bustle of city centre

Picnic day!. This is a nice park to come and have a picnic. Amsterdam is full with different stores where you can make your shoppings. Cheese, wines, pates, breads, hams or whatever you need. Come early, because the park will be crowded soon, if the weather is sunny. Find a place near one of the many ponds. They are full of different kind of birds around. Last time when we were there, in front of us came a Common Crane, which kept company to us for couple of hours. Well, the wine was fine and all the eatables were tasty. Another great day in Amsterdam.

Relaxing in the City. Following a Canal boat trip, visiting several sites followed by a city Bus tour we decided to 'Hop Off' the bus into Vondelpark. The sun was shining and the bus commentary described the park as 'Amsterdam's answer to New York's Central Park' - we were not disappointed. Walk, Ride a Bike, Sit, Eat, Drink - do as you wish. A great relaxing break from the city. Then hop back on the Bus.

Take a break and breath of fresh air!. In a city break a nice big park completed the experience, particularly in the spring or summer. Careful as you walk in, there are bikes (it is Amsterdam!) and skateboards coming at all directions! It's a nice place to walk around, hire a bike and cycle around, or just to be. Grab a picnic, sit by the river, on the grass and people watch. A nice break from packing all the sights in.

best place to decompress from museum overload. We stumbled into the park by accident. We rented bikes for the whole family and asked where could bike safely. Mac bike rentals which is a few blocks from the park told us to follow a path and we'll see the park. Lo and behold from the path we saw the park.The park is very big and the pathways are very wide. The pathways are wide enough to share between joggers, bikers and those leisurely strolling about. No cars are allowed in the park. There are benches scattered around the park where you can sit and ponder the meaning of life if thats your thing. I loved that we could bike safely inside without any cars to worry about. To our surprise there were even ducks in the lagoon inside the park. Tips in exploring:We biked through the park and i think this is the best way to explore it as it is too big to walk around in. Make sure you remember where you entered as you can easily get lost in the park and forget where to exit. If you are with a group make sure you have phones as you are liable to lose each other inside the park. Keep small kids close to you as dogs of all sizes run unleashed. Bring some cash so you can buy snacks from the food carts inside the park. Better still go to the park armed with some cheese, sandwiches and drink and have an impromptu picnic. 2 to 5 hours is more than enough to explore the park.If you are suffer from touristy site and museum overload, this is a good place to decompress and relax.
Wonderful Green Space. Lovely green space full of locals, running and cycling on Sunday morning. A great place to get away for the city.
Nice place to relax.. Vondelpark is a very nice place to stay at for relaxing, enjoying sun and meeting people. There are nice plants and water.

Vondelpark-lovely park. We stayed in a apartment about 2 blocks from Vondelpark. What a beautiful park! We went there twice in our 10 day stay in Amsterdam. So well maintained, lovely bird life and gardens. We had poffertjies and hot chocolate at The Melkhuis restaurant, it was delicious. It was worthwhile to go and see and enjoy when in Amsterdam.

Peace and tranquility!. Our bed and breakfast was steps away from Vondelview Park and provided a very peaceful start and end to each day of our visit to Amsterdam. It's a haven from the sounds of busy streets with trolleys and cars. In March, the spring growth is just beginning and you are treated to some of the signature smells of new growth and the freshness of the air. This park is popular among locals and visitors alike and is welcoming of those out for a quiet stroll as well as those biking for leisure! Although on a smaller scale, it has a similar feel to Central Park in NYC. great place to be.

Beautiful Park. We had a great walk around the park Saturday 2nd May, the weather was really nice and the sun was shining, lovely to see families, groups of friends, lovers, people riding their bikes and running around the park. Lovely gardens all kept well and loved the different ponds. Worth a visit.
not impressed. we live in london and we have better parks than this one. we liked it because it also has the I amsterdam letters and less crowded

Excellent place to walk or just chill out. The park is south-west of the city centre, 1.9km from Dam Square (25min walk).It is a long, thin park, just under 2km long, with lakes, fountains, public-toilets, ice-cream/snack sellers and a couple of cafe/restaurants. We stopped at one of these - 't Blauwe Theehuis - where we had a beer on the roof terrace (waitress table service) and watched the world go by.There is also one of the huge 'I amsterdam' signs in the park and an open-air theatre.

Beautiful park. This park is great for a wander and to stop and enjoy some people watching. It is big enough for walkers and cyclists to share the space and there are lots of places to sit and relax, read a book or eat some tasty food.
Beautiful park, Bike around!. Wonderful park. See the Dutch biking with kids, Nature, very green, Cafe inside, Nice to have a picnic

A place of rest. After wandering around Amsterdam for the morning I was pleased to visit Vondelpark for a rest.If you are expecting peace and quiet you will be disappointed as there are loads of people about but not disruptive. Many people were cycling through and lots of people walking around enjoying the view and nature. I saw a heron whilst I was there.Very pleasant.

Lovely, Picturesque park. This is a large, very relaxing, picturesque park. I decided I wanted to have just a brief respite from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam proper. I entered the park on foot and spent about two and half to three hours there, sitting and strolling. You can also ride a bike through the park. There is at least one restaurant which I noticed where you can get something to eat, drink, and use the facilities. There are many lovely flowers to view and there is also a lake.

Good size park with facilities. This park provides a good amount of grass area, though not a wide open space. It mainly consists of paths wandering through ponds and grass areas with some cafe and toilet facilities
Lovely stroll.. We were there in early March, trees just beginning to bud, which was great because then we could spot the green parrots who live free in the park trees. Amazing that they stay there!

Beautiful park to relax away from the busy city. We rented bikes and rode to a market to buy cheese, wine, bread, fruit, salami, and got a treat from a coffeeshop. When we arrived at vondelpark park we set up for the day to enjoy the views and sun! Could have spent all day here.
Lovely park. A lovely park we walked through a few times, lots going on joggers, walkers, cyclists. lots of streams and ponds, some cafes etc. A relaxing place to watch the world go by

Start here for Kingsday!!. Such an active park and fun place to walk through before you start in the Kingsday craziness! Kids are selling things, braiding hair, making cupcakes, playing music and it's just such a cute and fun experience to see as an international traveler!

A nice park. I like to visit parks instead of galleries and museums when I travel, this one is pretty good. The 'Iamsterdam' sign is a drawcard for a photo op and the park would be a nice place to sit on a warm day. Not super interesting to go for a nice long run (4km around), but a good little green patch in the city.

City escape. Nice park in the city, though away from main areas. I took one of the trams to get there as it was about 1.5miles from my hotel. Went running several days and it was nice, though very crowded. Lots of bikers, runners, walkers and mainly a lot of people relaxing on the lawns. For me it was fine for running but a few too many people to have a relaxing picnic

See Amsterdam relaxing!. The Park is not famous for it's flowers or nature. In the past it was a Place to buy Drugs. When the weather is fine, it feels like the whole town is relaxing here. Sitting in the ground and doing BBQ. The Park is so big that a bike can be usefull.

An escape. Vondelpark is a very lovely city centre park, nice gardens, areas to sit and just while away the hours. Great fun watching the manic cyclists compete with the walkers and joggers for space on the road, it is a bit chaotic and care is needed but great fun. Lots of different walks with places to stop off for a drink, or bring your own.

Kids Spot. Lovely inspiring park. A Bit wilderness in the Heart of the city. Big Green spaces - my Kids Enjoy climbing on trees, relaxing in the wide areas of the Grass landscape. Beautiful small Rivers inviting to play.

A beutiful relaxing place in Amsterdam.. We were in Amsterdam for 5 days. We visited Vondelpark on two consecutive days, the second day being the very crowded King's Day.The park has some wonderful bridges and lots of paths for walking and cycling as well as lots of different plants and bird life.The park is a nice relaxing place to get away from the busy streets of Amsterdam and you can spend a long time exploring the different areas of the park.For something to eat in the park try the Blauwe Theehuis for delicious freshly made sandwiches.

Pretty, but typical. Not as big as it looks on the map. If you have young kids who need to blow off steam this is a great place. There is a small playground / exercise station a few minutes walk from the city side entrance, and a larger playground with more swings and things at the restaurant / cafe in the middle.

We were there on King's Day. Amazing.. Vondelpark is a very lovely city centre park, a bit wilder and much less manicured than, say, Hyde Park or Green Park in London, therefore, to modern tastes, much more attractive. In springtime it is full of nesting birds and ducks leading their ducklings to the water. But on King's Day, every path is crowded by the sales pitches of the children of Amsterdam (with some of their parents) attired in orange (the colour of the royal house) attempting to sell their unwanted toys, games and clothes. Many of them are most creative and entertaining in their efforts, featuring musical instruments, acrobatics, competitions, and goodness knows what else. It seemed to us that while they were all there selling, in their hundreds of thousands, nobody had come to buy. Still, they were all having a gret time. If you go, remember to wear something orange, or you'll look out of place.

An oasis in the city. Central in the city with lovely manicured lawn areas, trees to shade under. A lovely place to escape the busy tourist zone.We visited "Kings Day" weekend so it was festooned in orange and full of people beginning early celebrations.

King's Day Extravaganza. Beautiful park every day but really happening on King's Day. Kids and parents from all around bring out unused toys, games, clothes, etc. and set up a family-fun atmosphere. Great experience for Americans while living in Amsterdam!

Wonderful park in the city. What a great find, this park is a fantastic oasis in the city.
Great for a relaxing stroll or stop at the cafe and people watch, be careful of all the bikes racing around on the same paths for pedestrians
A park like many.. If you have seen the city, walked the canals, etc. etc. etc...then yes, nice to see the park. Suggest make it last on your list of things to see in Amsterdam
nice walk in the park. Vondelpark is a peaceful break from the busyness of the city. Take a walk in the park if you have time. There is also an "I amsterdam" sign in the park.

Good to pop by for a look if you happen to be in the vicinity. Avoid the BBQ area if you do not want the smell of smoke on your clothes as the park goers made the park a mess with their discarded litters and food waste. Do not come near this area if you are here to enjoy some fresh air.
Really pretty area. This is a lovely little park with water running through it. Fantastic houses nearby and very close to the museum area. Well worth a visit.
A lovely place to walk and Chill Out. A great place to have a relaxing walk and see the Dutch enjoying themselves on a day off or a Bank Holiday- and it's free !!

Great for a safe cycle ride. We were taken here on a cycle tour of the city.
The park was busy on a sunny day, eveyone enjoying exercise and sun shine.
Nice grounds and fountains, all very well kept.

Kings Day Fun in the park. Children set up there wares to sell, and perform for you- everything from screeching violin to hip hop dancers and more. A REALLY FUN EVENT FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, as outside the park on King's Day, things get a bit wild and crazy.On a regular day, it would be a fine day to stroll or ride your hike, but on King's Day it is very crowded.
voldelpark. lovely park just short stroll from centre good facilities big café nice swings park for the children plenty water and wildlife overallvery nice exreience

beautiful place for a morning walk. Our hotel was directly opposite to vondelpark. on our second day we woke up early and had a morning walk through the park.you will find many people walking, running and biking at the park. it is very well maintained with beautiful sights to watch during your walk.

lovely park. The park is very spacious lots of lakes and few fountains statues and café. if your a bird watcher like me parakeet's blue heron and swan geese are a plenty. and just a lovely to sit a relax

Visit is a must. This park is huge, delightful water features, flowers and more. We strolled around the park just taking in all the little extra that make this park special. they have a great big park for the kids, plenty of places to sit and just look. There is a lovely little café by the lake where you can sit and have a beer and watch the birds and the ducks. Only downside is watch out for the dog poo don't think they have grasped the idea of picking it up.

Great green park. Perfect for a walk or running, or just breath if you are near Museum district or Leidseplein area.From April it becomes a meeting point for lot of (mainly young) people; barbeques, training sessions, running, skatting, ... or just lay on the grass.
Peaceful find in the city. We stopped here on a bicycle tour, and it was lovely. I wish we could have stayed here longer, but did have time for one cup of warm chocomal!

Central Park of Amsterdam. Beautiful, peaceful park setting in the middle of a noisy, busy city. We were fortunate enough to see it a few days later on King's Day (April 27), when it was filled wall to wall with happy, partying people celebrating the King's birthday (and selling used books and clothing). Pretty amazing both times.
Nice walk. Nice bit of urban greenery in the centre of Amsterdam.Lovely park, excellent for a stretch of the legs.

a beautiful park. It's a lovely park and I visited on a sunny day in April.Lots of people sitting on the grass having their own get-together, playing ball and some couples making out.You need a bicycle if you want to explore the entire park because it's quite long.

Great atmosphere in the summertime. We live close to the Vondelpark and it is a great place to visit when the weather is nice. You will see families and groups of friends barbecuing, having a drink, and generally enjoying the sun, If you are visiting Amsterdam in the summer I highly recommend going for a walk or a bike ride through the park or grabbing a sandwich somewhere nearby and having a picnic in the park.

Fresh Air and Lots of Exercise. I really like this park. Very accessible. Quite large. Lots of greenery, and the grass is ideal for picnics. For those who love cycling, skateboarding, or simply trudging along on your own two/four legs - Vondelpark is a must. You can even have a barbeque in the park!

Great people watching.. Had a great relax lunch in the park. People everywhere riding bikes, walking there dogs, smoking weed, sunning themselves. The stories behind the park are very interesting, the person that donated the park to the city, wanted all dogs to run free in it. And they do, watch the land mines.

Family park full of Amsterdam atmosphere. The Vondelpark is I think one of the first public gardens of Amsterdam. The romantic design hides the fact that it is in fact a very thin stretch of meadow/parkland a few hundred meters wide running 2 kilometers westwards from the old city perimeter to the west. Take care when you plan to go there as in the rush hour local bikers drive a deadly course from East to West or vice versa. On a sunny day families find a place near one of the playgrounds. There is even a shallow swimming basin for the kids! Great to escape the bustle of the town.This Monday of course it was busy all kinds music, games, acts and children's flea market during the King's Birthday. Great time despite the morning chill

Oasis!. If you need a quiet hour or so to eat your sandwich and escape the city then this is your destination. Some fascinating wild birds to spot, and nooks and crannies to explore, but beware, you're still not safe from those pesky cyclists...
great place to sit and relax. sat in the park for a while only. lots of people prefer riding bicycle there.There were people soaking the sun , music . good environment

quiet place, many people. a quiet place surrounded by flowers, trees and small lakes. A lot of people training, jogging, cycling, walking... just the way of life of people there, was interesting to be in the middle of all this.

A lot bigger than you think. A great open space on the outskirts of Amsterdam, we spent a couple of hours just wandering around and found a cafe near the entrance that was great to unwind and watch the world go by.
Awesome place to sip a beer. When the weather's nice, get out here. Avoid the cafe by the entrance...there are calmer ones in the middle of the park.

Good and the bad. A beautiful park to hang out, run, walk, cycle and skate. Walk your dog or enjoy a small bite - regardless what you envision you can do it there (no seining though) great kids areas, cafes, there are rabbits as well. Unfortunately the party edicted Dutch and hordes of tourists transform this park almost daily into a pile of trash. That's one of the most annoying facts of this city - people just don't give a sh..! Should you consider a run or bike ride try not to do Saturday or Sunday afternoon unless really bad weather or you love run slalom or the thrill of an ex ident waiting for you any second.
Beautiful Park. It was so close to our hotel so we had chance to visit. Really nice park, visit if you have time. Locals are hanging out, running, listening to music.

Favourite place in Amsterdam. If you're in Amsterdam you have to make time to go to Vondlepark. If the weather is nice as well then it is perfect to just go and chill out for a few hours. Nice cafe/restaurant in the park as well.

Amazing Park!. My friend and I ended our day at Vondelpark, but we wished we hadn't! That park is big enough to spend the majority of your day there! The park is awesome; there are tons of people there even early in March when it's not incredibly warm yet and so much activity going on it's the ultimate place to people watch! We didn't get a chance to walk through the whole park because the sun set on us, but I highly recommend going and walking the whole thing to really get a feel for what Amsterdam is like! :)

Never Ending. Wow i don't think we have ever seen such a big park , very pretty , lots of paths & lots of people chilling , braaing , cycling , running , a great place to hang out to relax. Very picturesque
Lovely park. This park is wonderful; lots of green, flower blossom, clean environment n cafes. Suitable for all to enjoy a sunny day!
Such a lovely atmosphere. Vondel Park is so relaxing, regardless of the weather. No trip to Amsterdam is complete without a visit.

Lovely walk. Went on a Sunday at lunch time. It was a beautiful day and so we had a very nice walk and enjoyed some people watching. We also had a nice quick lunch at one of the cafes in the park. Highly recommend.
Great place for a walk on a nice day. Lovely park with tons of space for wandering, running, or bicycling. When the weather is good it's crowded but still a pleasant escape.
Oasis in the city. What a beautiful park! It was great to have so much natural beauty so close to the city. We were fortunate to be staying right on the park.

Bikes!. We walked around Vondlepark on our first day in Amsterdam and our two year old daughter enjoyed the numerous playgrounds. The next day we hired bikes from a nearby hire place and cycled around. Very enjoyable but wasn't massively impressed with the cafes in the park.

Relaxing and pleasant park.. Relaxing and pleasant park, near all attractions. Used by lots of cylists, joggers, keep fit fanatics. Good walks and nice place to stroll around early morning or late evening. Closes at 9-00pm.

Charming.. It's a lovely city park and well worth a walk or a cycle around its many lakes and ponds, especially on a sunny Spring or Summers day. The little cafe is a must with really friendly service and a typical Amsterdam laid back atmosphere. The beef sandwiches were delicious!

For a sunday stroll or ride. If you want to get a feel for life as the locals do it, city parks are a good place to start. Vondel Park on a Sunday morning is such a park. Join the Amsterdamers as they stroll, roll, cycle, skateboard, jog and do fitness programmes around the park. It is flat and generally like any other city centre park but close to the Museums . The best way is to cycle round and mingle in.

Great place to bike. This is a great park on a sunny day. We rented bikes (near the main entrance - through the square across the street) for three hours and then had lunch. The hotel from The Fault in our Stars is also a few blocks away for all of you with teens who recently saw the movie - a must for one of my girls.
Relax. After visiting several museum this is the place to relax in the sun with a coffee. You feel you are miles away from the day to day rush of central Amsterdam. Just mind the bikes.
A park for all. A great park with something for everyone, including cafes, a children's playground and cycle tracks. MLS

Pretty, open, fun spot. You must stroll through this park and get a feel for the city. Kids climb on the huge "Amsterdam" letters; street performers rove around; there is a playground. A good spot for people-watching!

Beautiful park, biked through. I enjoyed my bike ride through this park. There were lots of families enjoying the space, the ride was very flat. There are also beautiful expensive homes beside the park.

A Traditional Park. A nice green space through which to walk to the city centre.Fairly basic in things to do, but the locals bring out the rugs and picnics at the weekend. It would seem that at any time you walk through there are numerous joggers, cyclists, and keep-fit groups around.

Disappointing by city centre park standards. More of a worn grassed area with some water features than the grand city centre parks that you find in other cities.Make sure you take something to sit on, benches are in short supply.There are some parakeets living in one of the willow trees (which was about the highlight of our walk through the park!).In it's defense, we were there in April which is early in the season but spring colour was in short supply.
Stroll in the park :). Relaxing Sunday stroll in a lovely park - beautiful scenery, birdlife and of course lots of cyclists!!

Nice place to spend your day!. My wife and a group of friends spent the day in this park. We attended a little concert and walked around for a while. Great place for picnics or just to hang out and spend some free time. The place is very big.

disappointing park. We came on Sunday eveving, the place was crowded with young and drunk teenagers, very noisy. But I have expected to find a clean park with many flowers and nice views. The park is dirty and not beautiful as expected. Its the beginig of Spring time and it was disappointed. I have been in similar parks at Dublin and London, much more beautiful at this season.
Beautiful park!. Beautiful park for picnicking, bike riding, etc right in the middle of Amsterdam. Don't miss it. Spend a few hours on a nice day.
Beautiful park. Nice park to have a walk or snack. There is also a good quality playground for small children. Watch out bikers! :-) Enjoy the sound og silence!

Hire Bikes. What a great park - lovely sunny day but would recommend hiring bikes to see all of it. Enjoyed icecreams and a bit of 'people watching'
Handy before / after museums to relax

Park that welcomes everyone!. Vondelpark was great! It was beautifully green with lots of nooks and crannies and walk ways / Bike ways around it. Great for families to play games like Frisbee or bocce ball. Great for the youth to hang out (there were several locations around that had people playing drums, guitars, etc together -- just hanging! I was surprised to see some motorcycles on the grass (that would not fly where I live!) but many people were just hanging out, reading, walking, picnicking, biking, running, drinking (again, not sure if it was allowed!)

Beautiful relaxing Park. What a lovely restful haven in the middle of this city. Lovely cafe's to sit and people watch (or the bikes passing by) serving lovely food and drink. Don't miss this little treasure if you visit as it really is wonderful.
Worth a walk in the spring. It was a quite spacious park located in the city and close to several well-known tourist spots. It's worth to visit after a tiring day in Amsterdam just to relax.

Doing your own thing. If you want to know why Amsterdam has a reputation for tolerance, come to this beautiful park on a Sunday afternoon. Pedestrians old and young, push chairs, cyclists, picknickers, bithday parties, and even a grey heron mix happily together, The lawns are free for sprawling, barbecues and ghetto blasters are authorised or tolerated and as long as you keep your eyes peeled for speeding cyclists, you can wander happily for a couple of hours just oberving the stunning views as well your many and varied fellow human beings! Food and drink stands, cafés and restaurants cater for the hungy and thirsty - and the heron picks up the scraps!

Place for some silence. When you get tired of the city noise - spend a few hours here on foot or by biking. Already in early April there are several flowers and trees blooming, you have water and fountains and you have a birdlife - and a few coffee shops. Easy to reach i.e. by tram number 12.We did this one instead of queuing for hours to get into the museums...
Good place. The Vondel park is a public urban park of 47 hectares in Amsterdam, Netherlands. beautiful place to visit.

Enjoy your time on the grass or run. After my Van Gogh museum visit I have walked 10 minutes and I faced with this gorgeous park area. To rest a while and drink or eat something this park is the best choice. After the hilarious blue and yellow colors of paintings of Van Gogh the nature will help you to relax and enjoy the time in Amsterdam
Vondelpark. Magnificent to walk, run, ride. Fabulous part of Amsterdam - early mornings and evenings best as can get very crowded.

Great city park. Very peaceful large open area quite near the museum district (Museumplein) with lots of nearby hotels so you can take a break from the city noise and relax for a bit. Recommend renting a bike and bringing a picnic lunch.
Most likely a spectacular park in April and May.

Pleasant but more signage needed. This was a very nice park, clearly used extensively by the locals. We were looking for the restaurants but became very lost in the myriad of twisting paths and lakes. We saw a lot of the park as a result, but would have appreciated some signage or the occasional map.

Relax away from the hustle & bustle. Springtime I the park was all about beautiful displays of tulips growing in tubs on the water. People of all ages relaxing in the sunshine. Van Gogh Museum and Rijks Museum as well as the Diamond Museum surround this space.

Tranquil. Great for a cycle or stroll. We enjoyed the calm away from the busy streets and ended up spending much more time there than planned. Be adventurous and explore some of the exits as they take you into interesting residential areas you would not otherwise explore.

Amsterdam's back garden. A pleasant park to wander around - walking, running, cycling, skating. Clearly well used by locals and not just visitors so great for people watching. We were there on Easter Sunday so lots of people and nice atmosphere.

very nice. .. but not worth going out of your way to visit. Went last week and whilst the park was very busy - on a sunny weekday - there wasn't too many plants to see and it is mainly grassland so nice for office workers to spend their lunchtime in.

Beautiful Spot for Tourist Downtime!. had a lovely walk from one end of the park to the other. Even the people on bicycles seem to be moving at a slower pace in the park. There were lots of families enjoying the beautiful weather. We Americans tend to move at a much faster pace than our European neighbors and I loved seeing the families pushing strollers!!
Gorgeous city park.. Huge and beautiful. Obviously the locals love to lounge on the grass and enjoy the sunshine. Good place to ride the bikes without the traffic.
lovely park for a walk. This is a good sized park near the museums and on the edge of the central area. It's beautifully kept and well used. It's the perfect size for a stroll out of the dense city.

Great park!. There on a busy spring Saturday and most of young Amsterdam were enjoying sunshine and the first blossoms. Beautiful park w amenities. Great for walking, bike riding lounging sunbathing. Cafe in park doing well as sun was out everyone enjoying a good time

Beautiful. As soon as wel stepped through the gates - It was sunny and warm which made us feel like we were in central park. A great place for a stroll or jog. Great for walking dogs. I wish I had hired out a bike or some skates. The only down side is that there are so many cyclists that cycle whereever and whenwver they like... there is so system in place! Nearly gor knocked over aroun 20 times. There was a lovely littlw cafe which was reasonably priced where we got a latte and a muffin. Nice day.

Delightful park. We walked through this park to the centre of Amsterdam from our b and b. It's such a lovely place to walk through and people watch. So many bikes and bike-adaptations to clock on the way. These Dutch know how to live!
lovely park. lovely large park in amsterdam, great place to sit and relax with a picnic, children loved playing in the water fountain
Spring and Summer. perfect for hangout, barbecue, jogging, walking and relax during spring and summer time.................................................
perfect place to find yourself. Huge park with lovely trees and mini lakes. The ideal place for bicycle alone or not. Also open late at night, feeling no danger at all.

Beautiful on a sunny day. It was very warm and sunny and nice to walk through the park. It was very busy at around lunchtime but we found a little spot to sit in - be careful of the bikes, they come from all angles!!

My fourth favourite park ever. I love Vondelpark. The first time I walked it, it was raining. Regardless I had a thoroughly nice time. On my most recent visit it was gloriously sunny. My mother and I walked round the whole edge, stopped for a glass of wine and decided we'd enjoyed it so much, we walked round again the other way.Beautiful park. But as with the rest of Amsterdam, beware the cyclists! :)
Some green in the city. The park was nice with quiet a lot of lakes I did miss seeing the flowers. Being in Amsterdam we thought there Would be Loads of lovely tulips which there wasn't.
Beautiful park, good for a casual stroll. If you like to people watch or take a stroll, this is a lovely park. Went on a Wednesday just after noon and it was crazy packed!!

what a brilliant open space. My wife and I bimbled around this park before going off to see Van Gogh exhibition. What a fantastic area for Amsterdammers to enjoy. Saw parakeets, herons and many other species as well as cyclists galore. Well worth the effort to walk around this park
Disappointing. The sun was out and the park was heaving with students, loud music and hundreds of bikes. No way was it a leisurely walk in the park.
Lovely for a rest. Lovely for a rest - very beatiful and easy to find a relaxing spot! Recommend even for those looking for a jogging spot!

Beautiful Park. Sit back and watch tourists, locals and the like have picnics, exercise and walk dogs. Theres beautiful lake and fountains everywhere. I recommended renting a bike and riding around the park as there is so much to see!

A green oasis in the city. An unexpected oasis in the city close to the museum district. Several kilometers of walks and cycle ways surrounded by mature trees, lots of birds and small lakes with waterfowl. Saw a flock of green paraqueets, quite exotic....

Very nice park. This is a very pleasant destination for a walk, bike or picnic. It's really crowded at times but there's room for everybody and sometimes folks playing their guitars make it even nicer !

Lovely sunny spot. Lovely spot close to the center really enjoyed sitting in the sun there. The first day I was a little confused of the whole pedestrians, bicycles, and tram systems. You have to stay out the middle bit unless you are cycling or jogging I worked out, almost ruined a couple of cyclists day, sorry.. I know now :)
Grab some food on the way. Great place for a picnic! I didn't even know there were parrots (or whatever green birds) in Netherlands until we got here.

Lovely park. Went here on the 12th April to walk off breakfast, it was a beautiful sunny day which obviously helps a park review. It's very spacious, has a place to eat, is well used by cyclists, joggers, walkers, families, and the occasional rollerbladers. It has some lovely houses to admire on the banks of the canel too, which a nosey female I loved - worth a visit - definitely - a great place for couples, families, friends and children.

Giant park but filled with litter.. Now I'm not sure if there was a major event near the vicinity the night before but the park was littered with trash all over the place. I hired a bike and circumnavigated the entire park but found myself dodging litter as I was riding. Bins were over flowing and the wind wasn't helping either. The park itself is roughly 2 blocks from the rijklmuseum.

A nice place to walk and relax. I love this place. Live nearby and in summer just come here to relax.
Take your BBQ set and enjoy fresh grill in the park. Just do it on the proper spots.
our trip. Just an ordinary little park. Nothing special but pleasant for a walk. Beware of cyclists who come at you from all directions!!
The nicest place in Amsterdam. Get some bikes - some lunch and go for a ride and picnic. Its the most beautiful place to sit, people watch and enjoy Amsterdam!

Beutiful park in the centre of the city. Beautiful park, perfect for walking. It would have been nice to have a bike rental at the entrance gates so you can cycle through the park and drop off at the other end.

Beautiful. The park is beautiful and a great place to
Have a cycle ride! There are restaurants and other attractions in the park too.

Lovely park in central location. Quiet and picturesque.. Lovely park in central Amsterdam.
We stopped off here on our way to the Van gosh museum.
Beautiful sunny day, so lots of people buzzing around, sitting admiring the views.
Had an ice cream and chilled on a park bench.
Worth a stop if the weather is good, but beware of bikes flying through...

Perfect place for a stroll away from the museum quarter.. Very large park which is ideal to get away from the hustle and bussle of the museum quarter.Slightly disappointing because there were hardly any spring flowers to see except for one large flower bed in the middle of the park which you could easily miss.As usual for Amsterdam a very large number of bicycles to be aware of.
Vondelpark. Beautiful space in the centre of the city! Have visited in spring & winter!! Recommend a visit - make sure you visit the cafe in the middle!!

Beautiful!. Big park closed to The museum zone.
Even if the weather wasn't good we enjoyed it!
The nicest thing is the tree with the hand that keep it.
To see

Nice leisure parc. Connected to the citycentre, you can find the Vondelpark. Many people from Amsterdam like to go there for some leisure time. You can find some great sunny places to drink a wine or beer.

Beautiful. Very peaceful and has character.
Liked the cafe within the park.
Nice place to walk and cycle as well as take picnics.
Today...park was so full of litter.. I'm sure it's not the usual. Today...so much trash...detracted from what I'm sure is usually a beautiful park.

Nice, but not outstanding. It's a lovely park, but not something to go out of your way to see! If you live anywhere in the UK you will probably have something more spectacular on your doorstep. The little café is cute for it's architectural value, but that's about it.

Time to relax. We enjoyed a short break in Amsterdam and wanted to see as much as possible in what short time we had which meant a quite exhausting itinerary but a relaxing wander through Vondelpark helped us recharge our batteries between sightseeing, shopping and museum visits. The park is lovely, quite central and well used. Surprisingly large there's lots of water (lakes) and the Pavilion has a restaurant, bar and sandwich shop (we enjoyed a great sandwich sitting in the sunshine). The wc's are clean too. Vondelpark is worth visiting and is the ideal place to relax and catch your breath before hitting the canals again!

Really nice park. I fancied an escape from the general noise and traffic in the city. I enjoyed walking round and taking some pictures.It's a really nice park. Well worth a visit if you enjoy a walk in the park, or just want an escape from the city life. I noticed a green parrot in a tree, and thought it must be an escaped pet, untill I saw more of them. A pleasant surprise.

perfect place to chill. Amsterdam has plenty of water, lots of cafes, squares and other places to sit and relax. But Vondelpark provides what every city needs-a green oasis. paths wind their way through copses and around water. Good cafes, Just the place to sit and enjoy a coffee or whatever. Now with nesting storks! Brilliant.
Dreich. Had a walk through but as March nothing much to see, was freezing and damp and an indoor attraction was more inviting.
Lovely Park to relax in, But watch out for the bikes. This is a great park to relax in, even if it's just briefly when walking through town. It is very peaceful first thing in the morning.
Large park with scenic views. The ponds and statues and bridges make this a beautiful park that seems to be well maintained. On warm days, expect lots of people enjoying the lawns and walkways.

Visit this if you have hired a bike for the day. Stopping at the outdoor cafe and enjoying a hot chocolate in the park. As it was beginning of April and cold there wasn't much to see here. Busy place for cyclists , joggers, roller bladers and families
Super parc. This parc is Nice to walk and enjoy naturé and birds ! I like to run there ! Nice atmosphere :) i live in amsterdam since one Year.
Bikes galore. Relaxed atmosphere, lots of bikes and some good cafés. Huge park to walk round great for kids. Some great people watching to be had here.

Great open space. A great place for a stroll or bike ride not far from the city away from the traffic. Not to crowded I the middle of the day,bu t obviously a shortcut for commuters travelling to work.
city park. Vondelpark is a very popular well maintained park, nice and spacious. Great to have a nice walk in the open.

Good cycling area. Lots of grassy areas, ponds,trails and tracks. A great area just to cycle, walk and relax in attractive and peaceful surrounding.
If you rent a bike - take in this ark, you will enjoy it!

A lovely walk away from the busy City centre. The park is beautiful and certainly worth it if you enjoy a nice stroll. There are people walking their dogs and lovely green areas to sit by. If you are in the mood for a little adventure give the tree house looking thing a go... It's pretty fun for children of all ages!
Even interesting I the rain!. Cafe sells lovely food and drink from coffee to alcohol. Busy little place in the park. Helpful staff.

Relaxing Day. We visited Vondelpark just by chance but was very happy we did had a nice walk and a drink in a very busy restaurant not sure of the name but it was a really relaxing and a nice place to just watch the world go by

Great day out. Spent a few hours here on Easter sunday and had a blast. Great park to just chill out in and enjoy the day go by. Would suggest tacking a picnic and a blanket to sit on as the mud can be quite soft this time of the year

What a place to relax!. Very scenic place to wander about. Enjoyed seeing people walk their dogs (or having their dogs walk them!) and others just siting enjoying the winter sun. Can imagine it being even more beautiful in the spring and summer.

Average park, muddy pedestrian paths, too many bikes whizzing about, no tulips at all!. Really average park. Overhyped and overrated. No flowers to be seen anywhere. Pedestrian paths were just muddy yellow clay which makes your shoes dirty. Cycles take over the nice concrete paths and you have to look everywhere to stop being hit/run over. Not really much to see! Surprisingly no flowers at all, let alone tulips, to be seen. Just worn down grass. Okay if you want to just have your lunch somewhere and leave to see the next attraction. No big deal, don't come here especially (unless you've just been to the national or van Gogh museum and fancy a walk about).

A romantic stroll. We strolled through Vondelpark on a crisp, clear Sunday morning. So engaging to watch the cyclists, roller bladers, children and dogs go about their business! There are a few beautiful coffee shop and restaurant stops.

Perfect to ride a bike.. It´s a "must visit" in Amsterdam. Beautiful landscape, very clean, great to visit by bike. During the week days it's very quiet and you can sit by the lake and enjoy the view and bring some crumbs to the ducks.

Busy but tranquil. We visited on a relatively sunny morning, so we're expecting the park to be busy with walkers and cyclists. It was but it still felt quiet and peaceful. Worth spending a couple of hours mooching about and watching the world pass by. Loo's aren't well sign posted tho' and could do with updating. All in all well worth a walk and for a "people's park" it is litter free.

The place I grew up. Vondelpark, the place I grew up as a child, will always be in my heart as one of the very special places in Amsterdam. Still remember the ice skating we use to do in wintertime, climbing the chestnuttrees especially in autumn, building an organic hideaway from pure natural material when I was about 7 years old. At the age of 9 I made my first and only "tomahawk" and after trying it out I was delighted that it stuck in the tree I aimed at. Even tried out a boomerang of natural material, even though my skills were very basic. Later I enjoyed the free concerts in summertime (June to August), one in particular (Steel Pulse) was so well visited I decided to run home to see it on television. I just could not get close enough, so busy it was that day. Queensdays it used to be one of the best places to go to, not just for chilren, for grownups as well! Music, theatre, freemarket, open-air chess and many familiar faces ... There is a very nice terrace in the middle, called "Het blauwe theehuis" an at the end, just before de Amstelveense weg, you can enjoy pancakes and "poffertjes" in a nice garden, there are several playgrounds for children an even for gay people there is a famous place to meet, the "rose garden". You name it, the Vondelpark has it! One of the best places to hang out, any time of year and especially with good wheather. In one word: unforgetable.
Vondelpark - a great find. Really pretty and deceivingly large!! Pretty tea house which is very busy!! Note where you are as we got slightly lost so keep an eye on signposts.

Vondel park - Amsterdam's garden. Lovely for a stroll, run or cycle. Its the main green space in the city and well used by locals and tourists. there is a café for coffee and snacks, a bandstand - not in use during visit in late March / early April.

No decent playground. The park is nice to go for a walk or to do some running, but with a kid it is disappointing because we have to walk for a while to get to the so called playground, but it proved to be very small, without swings or slides, just 3 climbing things that, according to my kid, were no fun.

Simply beautiful. Me and a few friends stayed at the hotel Central Park which was right on the doorstep of the park so we took a walk round and the park is amazing so nice to just walk around and sit on the grass! If we had more time we would have hired bikes to ride round on. Highly recommend a visit here.

A tad boring if I'm honest..... We walked here from the Iamsterdam lettering and I imagined it to be stunningly beautiful.It's just not that great.There is just a path either side you walk down another for bikes and a few trees.Not even that many trees?!There are no flowers to make it look a bit prettier and there are drunks in little groups which I always find quite intimidating when I'm with my daughters and I grew up in south East London! I was expecting more....

FREEZING SO WE DIDN'T LINGER. And late March meant that trees were not 'in leaf' , but I have been here before and recall it is very pleasant when the weather is more clement. Pleasant walk back to our hotel on Willemspark Weg from the Leidesplein
Beautiful. The weather was not too great when we went here but the park is beautiful and really well kept. However, be careful of a few drunks which sleep under the bridge!
Would be lovely in the summer. A beautiful setting that would be wonderful in the summer. Although it was busy it still had a very calm and peaceful atmosphere.
Nice at night. Nice well kept park. Very busy with bikes no matter the time of day. If your feeling like chilling out for a wee hour worth a visit.
Was ok. Average, but a must see for the fault in our stars fans! There was nothing unusual, but the greenery was a welcome sight.

Worth a visit - especially on a sunny day!. It's a lovely park, especially on a sunny day. I wouldn't go on a grey day as it's quite miserable. There's a lot of walking routes though BEWARE OF BIKES or you may get ran over. Parakeets are everywhere and they're beautiful to watch, there's also herons, ducks and geese. It's just off tram route 1, get off at "OVERTOOM" and follow the signs :).

Amsterdam's Central Park. Vondelpark is located southeast of the Canal District but is easily reachable by the #2 Tram or a number of others. Great place to take a walk, do a picnic, or just relax. King's Day is coming up and the park will be filled with People and kids selling a wide variety of items. Its like a city wide garage sale and no taxes are collected on this day for items sold between people.

Nice place to spend some time. It is in the heart of a bustling city and is a good, well-maintained park. Nothing like NY's Central park but actually quite peaceful. You can spend some time here...maybe alone with a one you love. Not much to do except tracks for running. There is a restaurant here...but I did not go in
Very nice park. Surprisingly quiet park near Amsterdam city center. Good for jogging, walking, biking or taking pictures. Popular among both locals and tourists.
Great atmosphere. Beautiful lush green oasis and minutes by bike or tram from the city centre. A lovely wee escape from the masses. We hired bikes and it was so nice to cycle about this park.
Nice escape from the business of downtown.. We took a couple hour break here so our 8 year old Son could have some fun. This is a very nice and clean park, and it had good kids play structures.

Dutch Central Park. A pleasant well tended park. Nice to walk through. Lots to see and admire. A haven for walkers, runners and cyclists. Something for everyone in this park and all major sight seeing is easily accessible from the park

A perfect runners match. The park is beautiful and a very nice venue to run. Urban area. The running loop is around 3.5km so it is a distance that many people will feel very comfortable at. There is an ASICS shop just nearby where you can get a shower and a locker for 5Eur and they organize running clinics.If you feel hungry after having a shower you can always go back to Vondelpark and have a salad in any of the terraces available there.

Very nice, green and friendly park. When visiting Amsterdam we decided to walk through Vondelpark as I read really good reviews about it. Park was full of cyclists, walkers, runners and dog walkers. Everyone was smiling and seemed happy.Loads of lakes and canals and few ice cream stalls. Lovely visit.
Wonderful!. Very convenient, best place to relax after the tiring visits to shights and museums. Clean place, it's a little heaven into the city's noise.
Good for walks. Beautiful park to take long walks, ride the bike or run. It's a good option to spend some time reading and observing people. Very nice!

Great theater in the parc. During the summer month in the park there is always a program, I personally love the dance that is mostly on fridays. So lovely to sit outside and enjoy the dance of the varying dance company's that show their competence. Sometimes great sometimes not to good but the atmosfhere is great and welcome.

A different world. It's worth taking a little time out to walk around this beautiful park.We went on a Saturday when the weather was warm,it was full of joggers,cyclists,picnickers and people just relaxing.In the centre there is a lovely cafe serving snacks and ice cold draught beer.Would recommend.
Huge park for a lovely stroll. We walked around this park and it was massive! Its beautifully kept and there is a lovely cafe in the middle for you to sit down and grab a bite and drink in.

A lovely stop between your Amsterdam bike rides. It's nice to walk around, to spend time, to have a break between your sightseeing or bike rides. Or simply to hang out and picnic. It's huge and green and shady with big trees. I circled around it with my bike and it was really enjoyable. If you stop by, go to a cafe called Blauwe Theehuis for a cuppa tea/coffee and a piece of Apple Pie. It will be a day to remember.

Great People Watching!. You must stop by the Vondelpark, if not just for the people watching. It's a nice walk around the park and is probably beautiful when all the flowers are in bloom. The Vondelpark's history also adds an extra layer of intrigue.

Amsterdam's Central Park. It's a very pleasant place to stroll and people-watch. I was shocked to find parrots and storks in the city park! We really enjoyed having lunch and coffee sitting outside overlooking a stream. The food was only fair at best ( thin sandwiches, soups, fries ...) but the setting was so nice it was well worth it!
Escaping the city. Vondelpark was like an oasis within Amsterdam! Even in winter it was still green! If you feel like you need to escape the busyness of a city head to Vondelpark!

Great place to go running!. I didn't go to any of the attractions here, but I thoroughly enjoyed several runs and bike rides through the park. There are many other athletes that regularly enjoy this park. Beautiful!
A peaceful haven. Away from the hustle and bustle you are soon whisked away to a tranquil place even when there are plenty of folk around, great little eateries too.

Lovely for a bike ride or a picnic. Vondelpark is beautiful and a great place to enjoy a bike ride, a jog, a picnic, or just people watch. I especially like going for coffee or breakfast and then watching rush hour bike traffic go through the park. There is a nice cafe and coffee accessories store called Brandmeester's just around the corner from the park entrance on Van Baerlestraat, just down from the concertgebouw and Museumplein.
Lovely. A lovely large park in which to take a peaceful break from the hubbub of the busy tourist trail. Watch out for the bikes especially at dusk. Everyone uses it as a shortcut.
Rent a bicycle. I did two loops around the park with my brother. Bring binoculars and a camera for the bird watching. Spring time will be especially beautiful as everything will be in bloom!
Amsterdam's Central Park. Beautiful setting for a bike ride or a picnic. Lakes cafes and bike trails. A great way to spend a sunny afternoon

Great place to walk. Lovely long walks round the park with lots of places to come in and out of the park, and places to cross the water. I was surprised to see and hear green parakeets flying wild and gathering in the trees. Herons seem quite oblivious to people and dogs and it's lovely to see them up close. The grassy area between the lakes which is gated so that people and dogs cannot access it, is full of rabbits running round freely. The two cafes seemed lively and welcoming. Just be very aware of cyclists as in Amsterdam in general, as they are everywhere and tend to fly through the main gates in both directions at once. There are lovely views of the residential areas that surround the park. It was very cold and wintry when we went, but I expect it's even nicer when the leaves and flowers come out.

A Treasure of a park. The beauty and the accessibility of this park for people. I enjoyed seeing the families and the biking and the birds. It snowed on two occasions that only made it more beautiful.

come and see the parakeets. I came here on a sunny March afternoon. I just came for a stroll, it's a large park and you can also cycle round it. There are tearooms but the highlight for me were the parakeets which made the park colourful. It's a very relaxing place and close to the museums so ideal if you need a break from all the culture. The police have a strong presence in the park and I didn't have any problems while I was there- though I am not sure I would want to be there at night.
Beautiful park. Beautiful place to go for a picnic or a stroll, the plants are beautiful. However be aware of the buskers or homeless guys begging, for those who get slightly frustrated or nervous.
A bit like Central Park.. Lovely park very busy with lots of family's and cyclists.Will be beautiful in the Spring.Plenty to see kids Weill love it.
2012. Very nice place to visit . Don't miss it in good weather,better if you go with a bicycle and I hope to be enjoying with my comment thanks.

Nice!. It was a cold, grey day but it was still full of people. It must be beautiful in spring or summer when all the flowers are in bloom. It was fun to see the ducks and watch all the different types of birds.

Worth a visit, but go at the right time. Enjoyed a wander round the park and ate lunch outside on the benches. Nice to see it so busy with a variety of people around. Like any public place, you do need to be careful. My view was tainted as within 5 minutes of sitting down, a man tried to sell us beer and a large group of people were smoking something slightly suspect!
Nice. Great place to take a nice walk and explore. Lots of locals jogging, hanging out and biking. Reminds us of Central Park in nyc.
