Beautiful and full of wildlife. Me and my boyfriend have enjoyed long walks around this park in the sunshine. It's beautiful and all the different type of birds really surprised me. Be careful of all the bikes if you are walking though!
Big park, lots of people. Full of people jogging, biking or walking their dogs. Young, old, singles, couples, families. Really very nice atmosphere. It's really worth a visit
Nice park for walking. Struck by a large number of birds, especially parrots flock that suited noisy concerts in the evenings on the trees at the entrance to the park.

Great place to relax or to take a walk. Every time I'm in Amsterdam I make time to visit Vondelpark. Its a great place for a walk and the park contains various amenities from basic bathrooms to restaurants and bars. So take a walk then find a patch of grass and take your shoes off and relax for a bit in this scenic park, you won't regret it!

Not to be confused with Wandle Park in Croydon!. Passed through this lovely park on a cycle tour of Amsterdam, stopped for a while and had refreshments in the cafe. It's a lovely place, even in the Winter sunshine. Recommended if you need a little break from the rest of the loveliness that is Amsterdam!

Great for sightseeing and exercising!. Big, clean , fun , lots of sports you can practice, jogging , walking , stractegicly located! You have many way outs to various parts of the old city!
I reccomend , specially during spring and summer time!

Walk in the park. Coming from Toronto and having a friend whom lived around the corner from this park was amazing. While I am used to seeing smaller sized parks within a city scape, it was refreshing to see all grilling food, walking pets, playing games, tanning.... enjoying life in the green...
Beautifull . It was another great surprise in Amsterdam! Lovely park with lovely flowers and trees!!! Besides people using drugs in there (not so used to that!), everything else was ok!!!
A peaceful place. A beautiful park. Sunday afternoons, locals turn out. most are friendly, even to Americans. Hint: don't try to sleep overnight. The cops will take your sleeping bag.

very pleasant but beware bikes!. Lovely big park, enjoyed a Sunday morning stroll here. Bonkers to see so many people jogging and exercising in it. Also lots of bikes riders who don't seem to care so much about pedestrians!
clear nature. very big and nice park to walk through. stunning, green and beautiful. one of mustsee's in Amsterdam.

Beautiful Park. Vondelpark is a fantastic park that offers incredible scenery in the heart of Amsterdam. There is plenty to see and explore, and riding your bike or walking through the park is quite enjoyable. Even sitting down and having a beer with friends, watching people and fauna enjoy the wonderful atmosphere is enjoyable.The park is much larger than it originally seems, and offers plenty of space to explore. It can get quite crowded at times, but there is generally always a nook to relax in well away from the crowds.

Go there in the summer. You want to meet nice, funny, special people? Go to the park and enjoy! Just sit on a bench or on one of the terrases, lie down on the grass near the water for a picnic. Everything is fine here.

Beautiful park within a beautiful city!. Thoroughly enjoyed my walk through the park. I got a takeaway bagel in a nearby cafe and sat on a bench watching the world go by! Lovely lakes and beautiful greenery. Would be romantic for couples.
Afternoon in the park. Clean and peaceful place good way to spend an afternoon! Lots of nature and wildlife to see ! A couple of good cafe aswell!
Lovely Park. Lovely park perfect for getting used to cycling before attempting the cycle lanes. Even in January it was very pretty and lively.

Gorgeous scenery. I went for a long stroll in Voldelpark one afternoon and got so caught up with the beautiful natural oasis that I actually forgot where the hell I was. So I just continued strolling around and honestly this pas os breathtaking. Lots of locals jogging and cycling, very friendly too. The vegetation is one of a kind and there a beautiful little bridges that cross the ponds making it romanesque, really.

Don't forget to,visit Vondel Park. You're at the end of your visit to Amsterdam with limited time to do anything much. Go to Vondel Park. It is a gorgeous place to end your time in Amsterdam. In early March the trees were bare but still the Park looked lovely. A perfect place to walk in safety and enjoy the surroundings.

The perfect plan for a job or stroll in the park. Vondelpark is one of my favorite place in Amsterdam. There are always people running, biking, walking, rollerblading, kids playing and people having a picknick on the grass!

Simply amazing!. This park is lush green and huge! After a long day of sight-seeing in Amsterdam..we visit this park and hot the much needed relaxation and unwinding! It is a beautiful park and you can easily pass half a day lazying and basking in the sun here!
Amazing park. if you want to see the most beautifull park of amsterdam i recomend you vondell park its really amazing and big.
Must visit!. Absolutely sunning, especially around the time when the sun is setting! A great place to walk or cycle or skate or pretty much anything around!
Great for people watching. I live in the Vondelpark area and go a number of times each week walking my dog there is always something going on great place any time of year
A "cold" park. A nice park, like many other big parks in big cities, but since most of the year it's very cold here, it's not very enjoyable to hang around.
Beautiful! Well worth a look!. Such a beautiful place, full of people and a great place for a bike ride! There is a lovely place to eat at the main entrance to the park which over looks the water!

Magnificent park. Vondelpark is a wonderful natural oasis in busy Amsterdam. Great walking /bike riding paths through a landscape of trees and plants interspersed with lakes and hints of the surrounding houses. Even in Winter this park is so beautiful. Couple of good places to eat and many benches and other areas to relax and enjoy the surroundings.

A nice stroll in Amsterdam. I have heard that Vondelpark is something similar to the Central Park in New York, NY. Well, my first impressions where really not the same as in New York besides of the size which is bigger than a usual park in Europe (in my opinion). I can tell that it is a really nice walk passing by mostly bicycles (which is nice). I was there in March 2015 which could be the reason that the park was not overpopulated which made it a lovely place to take a walk. I would recommend it definitely.
Relaxing. A really nice, litter free, chilled out, massive park right in the heart of Amsterdam! What's not to love!
large park with all things for leisure. A very large park with just about everything you could think of to sit and watch the day go by or to do exercise,drink and eat
nice park. Nice place to have a picnic or to rest from your sightseeing while having a beautiful view of a lake and trees.

A big and pleasant park. The Vondel Park it's nice and has lots of green. Too bad I went on winter, so there were no flowers, neither the trees were green. Still, it was a nice place. If you enjoy nature, running, o outdoor exercise, thats a very nice spot of Amsterdam.

Quiet urban escape. Cruising through by bike is an absolute delight! Even in March when we went there we wandered around and found people doing all sorts of sports. If you are travelling with kids/ toddlers there is an excellent cafeteria/ restaurant next to a pond with a protected playground and quiet terrace outside. It is a common "pit" stop so even as a customer using the WC has a very small cost.It is very recommendable to visit Vondelpark.

Great place to ride your bike.. If you hire a bike in Amsterdam you will find that you are always starting and stopping and constantly on the lookout so as not to collide with a car, a pedestrian or indeed another cyclist... However, the Vondelpark is a great place to ride your bicycle in a more relaxed style, there are places to stop for a rest and also a café with outdoor seating to sit and enjoy a drink and relax,,,
paradise for walk. i think anyone who visits Amsterdam have to go at least one time at Vondelpark. A peaceful endless park with a lot of green and lakes inside.. also very nice for a bicycle ride

Beautiful park. Really great place to stop and people watch and gaze at the waters after lunch. Lots of locals and tourists and lots of people on bikes as you'd expect. Felt we could really relax here after all the excitements of the city

Lots of space but not so many attractions. Nice park for sport activities such as running, jogging. It was quite busy with cyclists and runners in the middle of the day. Also I didn't see many playgrounds and attractions there compared to other parks.

Beautiful park space in the heart of the Museum district. This park is beautiful and definitely a place to socialise as it is as the centre of Amsterdam's cultural hub. It is a great place to people watch and just soak in the atmosphere.
Great space. We had hired bikes and this was on a suggested route. The park is lovely and open and was full of people on bikes enjoying the space.

Great place to be. This is great place to watch people live outdoors. Families, students, older couples, and teens come to this park to enjoy nature and relax (although this comes in many different forms at this park)it was a great contrast to the red light district in the city.

A green oasis. The largest of the city's parks it is very well used by locals and tourists alike. Even though we were here in March many locals took the opportunity of a mild day to set out their picnics and barbeques
Nice park to wander around for a hour. Very pretty Park away from the city centre and nice to wander around for an hour to escape the crowds. Bit far out but worth it on a nice day.

Would be lovely in summer. Unfortuanly I only managed to visit Vondelpark for an hour and I feel like there was so much more to see. Its full of tourists and cyclists and I imagine it would be lovely in summer.
Nice park. I went to Voldelpark in winter. I liked but it's probably best to visit in summer or spring. Still I enjoyed a walk in this park.
Beautiful. A beautiful park set in the heart of museumplein. Great for a stroll along on a summers day or for a spot of lunch.
Superb open space. With cafes and small lakes, this park is a great space, can see it being very busy on sunny days, Amsterdams version of Central Park

Very nice !. What a lovely place in the middle of Amsterdam ! We cycled around the park on our rental bikes as this was a great way to see it all. The park has many people doing yoga and fitness regimes ! It generally has a nice feel good factor about it ! In the summer the place must be gorgous with all the summer flowers in blossom. Lovely place to have a picnic in the warmer months ! Full of wildlife ! Amazing.

GREAT place to spend a summer Sunday afternoon.... just strolling...relaxing on a blanket...roller skating/boarding(is that still allowed? i know live music, except for the permited performances isn't)...or taking in the EXCellent live music performances they usually have scheduled in the afternoons... can hardly think of a better way to spend the day...LOTS of things to do in the area...on one side there's Leidseplein, with plenty of night entertainment spots...cafes and restaurants...on the other(south) side of the park there are also a number of decent places to eat...and the north end is very close to museumplein, where you'll find the stedelijk, van gogh and rijksmuseums...don't forget the sunscreen...

Great park. Even in winter this space gives you that relaxed feeling only nature can give, not that there's a lack of nature all around Amsterdam but this place is truly magnificent and inviting, if you're lucky to have sunny day in Amsterdam spend it here strolling around listening to the birds sitting next to the water.

Awesome escape from the city. Vondelpark is an awesome green oasis in the city of Amsterdam. It is a fairly big park. Some of the landscaping hasn't been kept up in awhile, but that could have been that I was there in September. It is still worth a visit.

Romantic walk in a clean setting. The park was lovely and right next to our hotel. We went for a long walk around the park spotting some wildlife and people watched as they went about their day to day business. The park was really clean and the bedding plant areas were well looked after.The big pond housed many different birds from ducks to a stalk, it was refreshing to see.At night couples strolled through to get from A to B, but be careful there is an adult natured side to the park that comes alive at night. (Quite an eye opener lol) Either way being so close to Central Amsterdam, the people of the local area should be proud of the well kept, pleasant setting they have.Top tip: be careful, cyclist ride fast through the park so make sure you watch where your walking.

Serene city park. Even on a cold grey day it is a lovely space. The city center feels so small and cozy. We wondered where the folks with dogs let them run. At this park. It is next to the Van Gough museum so walk a few extra feet and check it out.
An oasis of green and peace. It is a beautiful place to sit and contemplate and people watch. A bit disappointed with the the shabby tea rooms, not as good as expected.
A nice quiet walk. We walked here when we had some time to kill before going to lunch, very relaxing and, as normal, full of cyclists!! Watch where youre walking

If you have time, put it on your list.... Wonderful park - reminiscent of Central Park in Manhattan. Trees, grass, bike riding, jogging, dog walking, carriage strolling, and peace - all there to take in, to be part of, or to just relax with while watching. A couple of nice places where you can get a hot beverage in winter or a cool one in summer - have a cognac or tea and watch the sunset, alone or with your someone else - you will not be disappointed.
Pretty place. Its a pretty park, great for relaxing and hanging out with friends or family. Its a really big, open space and a must for anyone visiting Amsterdam
Beautiful park. It's so quiet and beautiful, great for chilling, reading a book or just riding your bike. Enjoy the silence in the center and watch the birds and flowers, they are beautiful!

What a brilliant park. This is such a great park. It's is huge and serves as a great place to go for a quiet walk to get away from the business of the city. My girlfriend and I really enjoyed walking here, watching all the dogs and enjoying the beautiful trees. There are kids play areas too if you are travelling with children. If you want some peace and quiet, make a b line here. It is superb.
Amazing park. Great park, with so many good sculptures and a really amazing cafe with reasonably priced food (best goats cheese salad!)

Awesome park. Vondelpark is the largest park in Amsterdam and a must see if you are in the city. The park offers you the chance to simply walk around and soak it all in, a welcome break from the go-go-go mentality that you often feel the need to have when travelling

clean well layer out park. if you are visiting and are looking for some peace and greenery this is a perfect place to visit. There are some nice drink stalks and a small cafe in the park which offer great refreshments.
such a beautiful park. cycled round the entire park twice we loved it so much. so civilised. you can walk or bike it. theres a few cafes or restaurants around it too.
Great park. Went on a sunday, packed with people so great for people watching and walking around. Lots of birds, making it nice to watch. Look out for the bikes though

Great escape from the vibrant city centre. Gorgeous park, with lots of different walkways and paths, just be careful its always busy with joggers and cyclists, dont get in their way. Great for a peaceful walk away from the stresses of city life. Our hotel was overlooking the park so for us each day started with a walk through the park, very nice way to start the day :-)

Great refuge. We walked during in a nice winter sun and ran into the main building, called Vondelpark CS. They had a great winter room, where you could sit in the sun. Some people loved to sit in the open air, but that is only good for the smokers.Only self service, unfortunately.
Quited as heaven. Very nice park where you can see lots of people enjoying themselves. It is also very close to the main museums so if you like you can also spend time there.

Used to live across from the park. I used to live across from the Vondelpark. A great park right in the middle of the City. You can spend hours there in summer. There is a wonderful Theehuis (Blue Theehuis), the open air theater. Lots of wonderful restaurants in the neighbourhood, all in walking distance from the Leidseplein, Americain Hotel (great terrace).The park itself has a nice history. It is names after Joost van den Vondel, famous Dutch poet. It was bought around 1860 I think by a group of individuals. First part of the park opened in 1865. Last year, 2014, the City celebrated its 149th year anniversary of the park. All in all worth a wonderful long viit.
Beautiful! . Lovely place to visit. Would recommend hiring a bike as the park is bigger than what we expected but was a beautiful place to finish our last day.

Great for getting away. If you want some peace and quiet or just to cycle around without the worrk of traffic this is the place to go. A couple of good places to get a coffee or something to eat makes this an ideal place to rest from the busy streets of central Amsterdam.
Interesting park. Take a guide book and read the stories as you wander around, some very interesting bits.What looked like parrots were high in the trees which surprised me
Good for a bike ride!. There are many parks in Amsterdam where you can sit and relax or ride your bike but I really liked to do this in Vondelpark!
Good place for a cycle ride. Rent a cycle and ride through this park! Photography enthusiasts would definitely love going here, great spot for a picnic as well.

A great way to spend an afternoon. My friends and I went to Vondelpark after we went to the nearby Van Gogh Museum in the morning. We bought some lunch food from a nearby supermarket and had ourselves a delightful picnic on the grass. It was fun to people watch, soak up the sun, avoid being hit by bicycles, and of course pose with one of the classic "I am Amsterdam" signs.
Perfect place to stroll, walk, by bike.... beautiful park, in the middle of Amsterdam. Sit down on one of the terasses and look at the most variety of people passing by. I really love this place.

Great place to Bicycle!. Lovely park to just take a walk or ride a bicycle. Good way to spend a lazy day. Sit on a bench, eat snack and do nothing. When weather is sunny, it is a bonus. Recommended for people who are staying in Amsterdam for 4+ days.

peaceful, amazing and beautiful. At the moment this place is my favourite place, I've just got back from spending my anniversary here and we rented bikes and cycled through the park with the locals everyday and it was so peaceful and so picturesque. You have to cycle or take a long walk around this park, you won't regret it!
Clean park. Clean park and great during the summer hours, in winter time it is also fun for example to go with kids. But nighttime it can be scary for some people, but it really is not.

Relax and good atmosphere. Trip to Amsterdam has brought me to visit Vondepark. Although it was a short time, it was a great nature to experience and to be inside the nature. I went there during winter and the weather was quite cold, but I still could enjoy a green nature.If you visit either in spring or autumn, it would be the greatest moment to spend at. Such a beautiful lake and very nice environment.It so easy to get here by tram.I took tram #1 and get off at Leidseplein. Need to walk a bit to the entrance.

Friendly and festive!. Took a walk through the park on a lovely spring sunshine day, plenty of people excercising and playing around. It was a very nice experience and I would love to have a park like this in my hometown. The bathroom facilities and restaurant however was not very nice.

Beautiful park. What a beautiful park!! It's a nice escape from the busy city! However don't look too closely at the water or the ground. Very polluted with garbage and cigarette butts everywhere! Cleaning crews would be a great idea!!!!
Beautiful even in winter. This is a beautiful park, even on a cold winters day. We were on bikes and it was lovely. There are large paths, so sharing with walkers and runners wasn't a problem.
Nice relaxing walk. Nice place to go and have a wander away from the bustle of the city. Nothing majorly spectacular but the ponds are nice. It's a lot bigger than you think too! Good afternoon trip

very nice walk. if you are prepared to dodge the cyclists who can have little regard for pedestrians, this is a lovely walk on hard surfaces through very scenic park. We visited in February so there was no foliage but it was still a good, 45 minute walk out
love this place. you can enjoy your stay in amsterdam perfect at this place. come and chill in the park, you can find for sure a little place to stay.

Sunday AM run. Liked - at 8 am the Vondelpark was busy with people running around it. I undertook two loops of park and had a great time. There was a few people sitting on benches smoking weed but the area felt safe and relaxed

Amazing place. Stayed right next to Vondelpark and went there couple of times. Its beautiful lakes , lawns and fauna are a must see. Great space to exercise, walk or just take a break from city life. There is a nice coffee house bang in the center of the park so a hot chocolate in winter is strongly recommended. Cannot wait to check it out in summer with all the trees in full bloom

Enjoyable. Go spend some hours there. If you don't feel like walking, ride a bike or have a picnic. In fact it's the best place to go on a bicycle if you need to practice before sharing the lanes with locals.
A ideal place to rest. A ideal place to sit and rest for a few minutes to several hours without getting bored of the beauty of the park.

Clear your head on Sunday morning. Beautiful park in the centre of the city which is very popular with runners, in line skaters, cyclists and dog walkers alike. An entire circuit of the park takes less than an hour and there is always something to look at, including wild parakeets.Plenty of cafes and snack bars for those who need a rest!

Lovely walk. This park is beautiful. I stayed in a hotel pretty close to the centre of the park and it was a great place to walk through to get up to centre Amsterdam.Just watch out for runners and cyclists.
Nice Park. If it's not raining it is a place to be and hang around. Very nice buildings around and the mix of the nice architecture plus the nature is amazing

Great place for a Bike ride. We were on a bicycle ride from downtown out to the country side ultimate destination was a working dairy farm/ Guda cheese factory/ Clog manufacturer. The ride thru Vondelpark was very nice it was spring time so the park was Alive with new Tree growth, flowers and beautiful lawns, a very relaxing place to bike through.
Fab for cycling. Wonderful park area with café. Perfect for cycling around watch out for joggers or you could do that too.

Beautiful-but just a park. Strictly for nature & fitness enthusiasts... its pretty big and beautiful and awesome way to kill time if you have plenty of it. But if only there for a day or two like i was then would give it a skip...

Spacious Park but nothing special...... We went to see this park on a week day afternoon and there were some dodgy,homeless people at the very entrance of the park.There was nothing fairly unique about the park,maybe because it was winter but I am sure that its beautiful in summer.Definitely a nice place to go to if you want to escape the buss of the city and cycle through some green spaces and trees.

Beautiful park - great for a stroll. We spent a beautiful afternoon strolling the park, which is scenic and beautiful. It was busy but not crowded and most wonderfully found this delightful bistro to sit outside on the water with a glass of prosecco and enjoy!

Great for biking. On our last day in Amsterdam we decided to take a bike ride throughout the city and, after visiting the Rijksmuseum, drove to the Vondelpark. Since it was could we decided not to walk but just bike across the park's outer perimeter, which was very enjoyable - this truely was an unforgettable time. The park is pretty spatious, despite its limited physical dimensions, and offers wide lanes for walkers, joggers and bicycles. Highly recommended.
Lovely place for running walking or cycling. Went running twice around the park and it was gorgeous, full of little bridges and paths so you can have a nice wander around

Must-see. During my week-long stay in Amsterdam I passed by this park frequently and have to say that it's beautiful to see at any time of the day, but particularly around sunrise/sunset. The houses around it are very classical Dutch houses, so if you're looking for a picturesque walk, make sure you stop by. Having visited Amsterdam in winter, I wasn't expecting the park to be nice but was very pleasantly surprised.
every city should have a vondelpark. joy to see this lovely park used by everyone in an integrated and friendly way. football, chilling, picnics, art, cafes. its got the lot
Great place to be at. If you have some time for yourself, great green park to go. İ found lost and found fence is so smart. Exactly it is middle of city but different atmosphere.

Nice park. A nice escape from the clamor of Overtoom street. Visited by people from all levels of society, the park has a casual atmosphere, great for people-spotting and silent reflection. Also a great place for birdwatching. The park is generally quite nicely kept. The only drawback is the water, which is dirty with the occasional beer can bobbing around. I hope they fix that come summertime.

Cool!. It is a huge park, super quiet, great for a walk, to relax and stick out on the crowded and cramped city. In winter does not offer many things, but I think in the summer is different. Is in a nice residential area, very beautiful.

Wrong time of year. February probably is not the best time to visit here, i am sure the summer months bring more attractions, as it was this place was quite average- Would like to see it in full bloom however

Very restful park framed by museums.. Situated in the Museum Quarter this park is surrounded by Museums and eating establishments.There are numerous events conducted throughout the year as well as people from all over the world enjoying the vast lawns and enjoying all that Amsterdam is about. In our 3 visits to Amsterdam we have chosen to stay at hotels near the park or within easy walking distance.

Crowded, but good for jogging. Went here for jogging during business trip. Quite crowded and need to be aware of bikers (like everywhere at AMS).Nice coffees too and people having own picknics around too.

Vondelpark on a bike in Summer!. Make sure you bike around or walk around, have a picnic on the grass, buy some Dutch cuisine and enjoy the sun and atmosphere, best after 5 on a week day as people come down after work, plenty to watch and see. Good times

Beautiful. Close to a tram line, easily found. I didn't explore the whole place but we walked around for a while and sat and just took it the beautiful surroundings. Next time I'll explore it properly but from what I saw, absolutely beautiful!

Beautiful. Our hotel was on the edge of the vondelpark and it made a lovely morning walk. The bridges and lakes are beautiful and the birdlife is amazing. The rose ringed parakeets really make this park special.

Alright. The park is very big and there's definitely a lot of greenery. Coming from Australia where there are lots of park we probably had high expectations, but it was really just a typical park. The weather didn't make it any better for us either because it started raining when we arrived (it was really cold that day as well!).We didn't stay for long but I'm sure we would've enjoyed it more if we went at another time of the year and when it isn't raining!

Great afternoons with family. We lived close to Vondelpark and spent many afternoons there in the spring and summer. The kids loved to run around the various playgrounds, and the outdoor cafe is a fantastic place to sit and enjoy a beer.

Nice park with wildlife you wouldn't expect in town. Came to see the park after being in the museum area. It doesn't seem anything special until you notice the seemingly tame herons wandering around the lakes and the sound of woodpeckers drilling the trees. Don't bother with the fancy looking white building cafe - seek out the round blue and white one with seats outside as they do a lovely hot drink and cakes!
Park setting, picturesque. This park is directly across from Rieks museum. The gates are ornate and worth the stop for a picture. Otherwise just a park to roam. Plenty of bikes and very clean

Rollerblading heaven!. Went cycling, running and rollerblading through this lovely park quite a few times. There is a real vibe of healthy, outdoors fun here and a lovely café to get a hot drink in if you get tired. Much smaller than many London parks but charming and local. Try the apple pie in the café for a re-fuel. Delicious!

Beautiful park. A beautiful park and a beautiful and lovely way to explore the city. In winter as well as summer a nice walk seeing everyone jog and enjoy the scenery. A shortcut to the museums and nice restaurants.

Calm and relaxing. Calm and relaxing place to go.
Really lovely just walking around, big tress, friendly ducks, although we decided to have a nap in the grass and were rudely woken by a duck biting our toes.
Nice to ride a bike around too.
Lovely wide open spaces. Lovely place to go for a walk and people watch. Loads of people running, on bikes and just pottering around. Perhaps not a place to visit after dark though
Nice park, but too crowded. Visit the smaller parks in Amsterdam, like Westerpark or Sarphatipark on a sunny day. Bring a beachtowel and a bottle of wine and enjoy the sights.

Must been there!. I have my weekly run in this park every sunday since 1986. When in Spring and Summer is crowded, music, soccer (football) playing, frisbee playing. People picknicking, drinking. A must see and been there. It's relaxen.

Beautiful central park. This park is really a hidden gem. It goes on for miles, but a placid lake and lots of greenery for all the nature lovers. Every time I walked through here, there were troves of people either on bike or just relaxing by the water. Great place to get some fresh air and walk around or sit and read a book.
Beautiful. Quiet serine park, very relaxing. Couldn't believe how clean it was considering the amount of dogs being walked, definitely would advise a visit if you're in Amsterdam!
Great to stretch your legs in.. Wonderful open space to walk in with ducks and other bird life. Watch out for the numerous bikes though.
Nice park.. Nice clean park to relax in if you're tired after sightseeing! We only saw one corner but think it is big.

Lovely walk. This is a lovely well preserved park. Plenty of water and plant life. Just watch out for bikes. The park is quite large and has many opportunities to stop and have a brew or a beer. There is a cafe in the middle which has the smallest toilet known to man if you fancy a laugh.

The park of all parks!. Love this place been there 4 times now can't go to Amsterdam without visiting Vondel Park! Big loads of trees loads of benches some nice spots to sit and watch they day go bye!

A pleasure to walk through. Vondelpark is huge and so lovely. Lots of paths to walk and bike through, large lake, cafes (and toilets) a perfect place to spend a while in a sunny day. Look carefully and you will even see parrots hidden in the foliage! Tram lines are just at a walking distance making the city center easy to get back to.

Fantastic City Park. Vondelpark is both Enormous and Gorgeous. It is fairly close to the Van Gogh and Rijk's museums. This is a wonderful park to while away a few hours in the sun. They sometimes show movies outside at a building in the northeast section ( with a cafe and toilets) during the evenings in the warmer months.

Live like the Dutch do. It was in this park and my partner and I decided to move to Amsterdam. We just fell for this city, hard. Vondelpark is huge and I would love to visit in the summer. Great for biking if you dont feel ready for the cutthroat Dam streets just yet. Adventure playground, outdoor theatre, lots of cafes and lakes to wander around. Its easy to get back to the city as well, the trams run alongside it. Really lovely morning out.

Great Park. Absolutely gorgeous park with parakeets, bee hives, herons. Lots of paths for walking. Two cafes/restaurants in the park one of which is a listed building. Lots of cyclists and joggers in the park. Big lake. Been through it many times. A pleasure to walk through.

Most beautiful park in the Netherlands. Vondelpark offers you beautiful nature in the middle of the city. The park is close to the museum and famous shopping areas of Amsterdam. In the summer the park is great for a picknick.

relaxing. so many people in the park, riding bikes, walking, playing sports... it's nice to see it being used in the winter months by the locals. I'm sure the summer is a really nice time to spend time there.

Green and tranquil. I can't say that Amsterdam is a city where you can see a lot of people rushing around but still Vondelpark is a perfect break to have a walk, jog, bike, eat or even feed some ducks in the lake. The park is quiet big so if you have limited time, getting organized will help you to see the essential parts.
Lovely Park!. A massive yet tranquil park. A joy to stroll after all the great shops in centre. Well located- literally off main area of centre.a must go to when in The Dam!

Great little park to walk around.. I went out to this park on a cold February day, but it was a nice walk and it was nice to grab a hot cup of coffee in the center of the park, inside of heated building. Ducks and other birds were playing in the small rivers and even hopping from the ice into the unfrozen parts of the water (some quickly retreating and huddling in a crowd).
Beautiful. Beautiful park, great for some peace and quiet when the city gets too much. We went in the winter, but I can imagine its even better in the Spring/summer.

Not top of the list, but a nice extra. The Vondelpark is first and foremost a green space for Amsterdam residents. Yet if the weather is nice and you have time to spare, go an have a look at how Amsterdammers spend their free time cycling, jogging or picknicking. There is nothing upmarket about the facilities, but they are cosy and good. The Blue teahouse has a nice terrace in summer. Walk out at the northeastern side and you find yourself in the middle of Amster dam's best shopping area: van Baerlestraat/PC Hooftstraat (this part IS upmarket!).
Lovely for a winter walk. Beautiful lakes and birds. Near to the heart of the city but easy to walk to. Very cold but enjoyable

Stunning!. There are great pieces of art scattered through the whole park! It was so fun biking and walking through the park and stumbling upon these pieces. Make sure to stay out of bikers way, though!
Very nice park. Very nice park. Cycling there is a joy. Also very nice for walking jogging or even just chilling on a nice weather day.
Vondelpark. Nice place where you can spend time with your friends, walking with a dog,cycling just rest after Noisy city life.

Great place to hang out in the afternoon. Frisbee, music etc.. Loved going to this park in the afternoon 2-4pm . The park was less crowded and the afternoon sun was still warm and inviting . It's a nice place to nap for a few winks before your next adventure .

Lovely walk . Our hotel was near here so we decided to take a walk through, being February the trees were bear and no flowers were out, but, it was still really pretty, lots of trees, a few duck ponds and a couple of caf�s. If you're near this park take a walk, get away from the manic roads and bustling streets, enjoy.
Good for activities. I have walked in the park but if you rent a bike, ride in this park sounds like good. Or you can sit on the banks and watch people.
Winter beauty. Even in winter there is beauty here in Vondelpark. A variety of birdlike, peace and quiet, frozen ponds and streams, all within a short walk from the nearby shopping street.

Local running track comes alive in Spring and Summer. The Vondelpark is a large city park that attracts both locals and tourists. We locals use it for running, walking the dog or just for a stroll in the sun. It comes alive during warm Spring and Summer afternoons on which bbq-ing is allowed.
Be aware of cyclists, it is a busy bicycle route!
chill. I had one of the best expiriences there, it is so relaxing and going around on a bike makes you feel out of place, chilling in front of the lake its so cool
nice wander/ cycle.. ringed by hotels, food est, shops etc. easy walk. fast journey through to centre. good kid run if they are feeling fractious.

Beautiful park. A beautiful place for a stroll, picnic or a bicycle ride .
The Tea hose in the middle of the park is great for a light snack and a drink .

very nice park in Amsterdam. I took the HOHO city sightseeing bus and got off at this stop. Walked along park to the De Hollandse Manege (horse museum).Watched people taking riding lessons mainly dressage which was interesting. I would love to see a performance here but they are not offered most days. the tour was ok, but as a horsewoman who has seen a lot of stables there was not much of interest.

Best parc in town. The Vondelpark is a beautiful parc between the old south and the centre of Amsterdam. It's very well maintained and there's place for everyone. You can even organize a BBQ in the summer to hang out with your friends. There are several cafe's and even a restaurant which are all fairly good. Do not mis when in Amsterdam!

Great place to relax and spend time!. Vondelpark is so nice to spend time in, we rode our bikes for an hour throughout a few times. We visited the fountains, the theatre (which hosts free music, even if it's pouring rain!) and a moving in the park! All events we encountered were free :) and the park is well maintained and included is plastic picnic blankets (if you can find the folding boards). Tip: great for riding bikes in (rent a bike from a off the beaten path bike rental store for better prices, local bikes (not the ads on wheel) and good friends). We rented from AJAX bikes. Tip: in the summer they host an array of free music and in the park movies!
Very beautiful & scenic. It was a beautiful park. Full of beautiful flora. The ducks & birds were in the pond. I sure it wold more beautiful during summers.
Beautiful!. Go for a sandwich in the Teahouse, a beautiful hidden gem. Vondelpark is so big and beautiful, probably nicer in the summer, but it was still wonderful to walk around.

best park to relax in amsterdam. If you want to chill in a nice park but watch people and things going on, this is the place to be. We were there having a bbq and enjoying the diversity of people around.

Need a break ?. If you need a break of visiting museums and others shops, the Vondelpark is very nice to see. I think you need an hour to completely walk around but it is very nice, beautiful and relaxing !
Always good!. Its always a good idea to take a hike, run or just lay down and relax in the Vondelpark. In summer people take their BBQs and enjoy the Dutch summer.
summer's best. in summer, you must visit this park, you can also do family gathering and other party,, very nice park

De Vondelpark,... don't miss it !!. De Vondelpark, the biggest park within the inner-city of Amsterdam ( from the Amstelveenseweweg until a 2 min. from the Leidseplein) is a BEAUTY during the summer ( the park is then crowded) , but also during the wintertime.My hotel was near the park and every morning ( in the freezing cold ), I walked trough the park.Don't forget to visit the Blauwe Theehuis, a gorgeous rounded building, designed in 1937 by the Baanders brothers in the International Style. Ask, in the Blauwe Theehuis, for an apple- strudel with whipped-cream :-)
Nice park. Had a morning walk through the park. Nice and beautiful weather in the cold month of Jan. Got to walk a bit from the tram station but it's worth a visit and to have a picnic in the park.

Much better in summer. Walked a quick circuit on a cold weekend in January and struck by how stark it is out of season. Much better in summer when there's more going on. Always nice to get away from the bustle of the city, quite peaceful and the open space is a nice counterpoint to the packed architecture.

Very nice park. Went here for a morning run in January and the park is very nice - even in the winter. The park is easy to access and suitable for everyone. Wheelcairs or strollers - no problem :) I can only imagine how beautiful it looks during the spring and summer months. I will definately come back to Vondelpark next time I visit Amsterdam.
Peaceful. Great city break. I had the opportunity to listen to a live concert. It was very relaxing after visiting museums.

Trip Highlight. As i was staying across from Vondelpark, i often cycled round. It is a beautiful park, even in the cold! I wasn't expecting such a beautiful park as i had never heard of it before. i would 100% recommend to anyone that goes to Amsterdam to rent a bike and have a blissful ride around the park

Magic !. Although the time when I visited the park was cold and fogy I can say that this was an experience that I will never forget.
The park it's magic by itself. It was like a fairytale !! It's nice for morning, afternoon or even night walks. Beauty which you cannot miss.
Perfect for a Sunday walk. If you fancy a bit of fresh air and a break from the museums this is perfect. It's like most parks within cities and so it's just nice to take a walk.

Nice for a break when in the city. Even on a cold winter morning, Vondelpark was a great place to visit. Recommended for a relaxing stroll away from the busier nature of the heart of the city. Watch out for the bikes if you're on foot

Such a great find. Found this park on our first day arriving in Amsterdam was only a 10 min walk from our hotel (Iron Horse), was fantastic every Friday they have live music to basically as far as I can tell celebrate the start of the weekend! After a walk through the park we saw every walk of life from parents and children to people who had jut left the office (bikes everywhere as per the norm!) People were having bbq's listening to music reading books no one was bothering anyone! There were several works of art displayed through out the park which was interesting and a tulip island (Im not sure of this as we were there at the end of the day but was displaying an unbelievable display of colours available to buy during the day)After a walk through the park we were fortunate enough to stumble across the open air theatre which had the junior version of the royal ballet company practicing. You were able to have a Heineken and enjoy the performance!We left and again stumbled across an early evening performance in the Vondelparkpaviljoen..... This was such a treat sitting out in the sunshine while an amazing orchestra played many well know classical delights (im not cultured enough to know what they were but you would know them if you heard them!) I genuinely say was probably the unexpected highlight of my visit.

Awesome place to laze and walk ground.. This is an awesome space for a good walk, jog, run and just taking your dog out for a walk. Amazing space to spend some time with family and remember to keep mobile and other technology away. I am sure you will enjoy the scenic beauty. There is separate area to have a BBQ and stuff.Ohh I almost forgot, you obviously can cycle around here. A good place to just Chill out.
so nature. quiet place.great for walking and chill out.awesome birds.people playin football riding bike.if you want you can have picnic on the ground
Beautiful park. Worth a visit after a dat at the museums or shopping. Lovely in the winter when we went but I would imagine it's even better in the summer
Awasome park. An huge park with many different scenes in it. Highly recommended if you need some chill.Many people likes it, so sometimes it is a bit tricky to find a spot to sit down.
Lovely park. Great park for strolling, cycling, running or skating in. Very well kept grass areas, clean and free from litter. Cafe in the park for drinks and snacks.

Great Park for a Walk. Vondelpark was near our hotel so it was close to take a walk in the park. The park is large and really nice. Very busy, too! Nice to see people out and about. Lots of green grass and some beautiful fountains. Play areas for children, a park for all ages. A great place for a walk when visiting Amsterdam or for a bike ride. Lots of bike riders all over Amsterdam!

AMAZING. I couldnt even tell you what I disliked about this. Huge park, beautiful scenery. From early hours to later on there are people running everywhere and bikers and dog walkers... in a nice way, not annoying! Everyone looks so happy and active and you can take great walks which I thoroughly enjoyed. Cant wait to go back in hotter weather and relax there ALL day..!!
a beautiful walk. if you enjoy a walk in the park, then this is a must! a leisurely circuit will take the best part of an hour. so great to see so many people out walking, with their kids

Best Place In Amsterdam. Fortunately, for us this park was just in the neighborhood. It was just right behind our hotel and hence we visited it twice in a span of four days. The very first time we walked through the park.It has B'ful fountains, green grass and some good adventurous play area for kids. We visited Amsterdam during fall and hence the park was covered with so many colors and shades. The second time we rented bikes from our hotel and explored the park on our bike. There is a bful cafe by the lake, perfect for a good view and hot coffee.
A lovely Dutch Park. A wonderful place to go for a walk with the Puppy.Many people hang around here and there is always a good vibe everywhere.Cyclists can have a field day!
Great to chill and people watch. Amazing huge park, great to sit and watch the world go by. There are a couple of establishments to purchase some food or drink too.

Beautiful Park. The park was absolutely beautiful, and although we never saw all of it, we were amazed by the surroundings and nature in which the park had to offer. We had a little time left before departing for our flight home, so we decided to take a stroll through the park as we had heard about it through friends. One of the park's entrances was right on the street that our hotel was situated on, in the shopping hot spot for those with designer taste, or art lovers, in museumplein. The park is filled with people on bikes (don't worry of being ran over as they have cycle paths!), joggers, tourists, or just people walking through with their dogs. The park has a lake in the centre and is teeming with beautiful birds that look like they've escaped from the zoo! They also have amazingly large houses which are stunning to those who have an eye for architecture. There is also a stage and restaurant but I am unsure of what is properly inside the building. I would recommend going to the park if you like to explore, take photography or just want a scenic walk.

Beautiful place to relax, stroll or ride. If you want to see Amsterdamers at leisure (or on their way to work or school). come here. A stunning park with plenty of space to relax, eat, rest, ride and walk.

lush. We jumped on a tram from centraal on a lovely spring day and shortly arrived near the park.it was so serene and beautiful, the flowers were in bloom and it was warm.we had some cake and coffee.next time we go I am going to hire a bike to get around

oasis. A real oasis for Amsterdam. This park gives the calmness outside the frantic explosive energy within the city. It was closer to the hotel and hence could visit frequently either in morning or evening.

Amsterdams coolest park!. In the middle of the city cenre its one of Amsterdam coolest parks. Surrounded by greenery, bikes, people running around or just chilling in the gras. Its a perfect place to sit down on a sunny day.

Large park in city centre. Great for a walk or cycle. Lots of bird life including herons and moorhens. I'm also sure I saw parrots of some description!!!
Easy to get to from the Museum district and city centre.
Beautiful all over the year. Beautiful place to go all over the year. Summer time: take a long bike ride. Winter time: skate. A must-go in Amsterdam.

A very personal experience. Well, the park is wonderful, and I'm sure you can find beautiful pictures all through the year in the web to prove it. What I have to add to that is the fact that I will never forget the amazing colors of the changing sky in mid-January, when I went there. I might have taken over a hundred pictures of the sky alone, one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen. Every time I looked up, it looked amazing and different from the last time I checked. I guess I wouldn't have noticed it at all if I hadn't been in that open space of the park. Take a break from the city anytime of the year and I'm sure you won't regret it.

Ace!!!!. Must visit .. Summer I would say is the best !! You can chill in the park . Anything goes take a picnic , get our f the city for the day .. Across from Hard Rock Cafe .. Which is lovely food;)

The place to chill. Apart from our other visits we go to Amsterdam for Christmas. Part of our regular trip is to go to the Vondelpark and have a stroll after breakfast.It is a beautiful park with lots of people riding around, running or just walking. there is a surprising amount of wildlife too.Definitely an ideal place to get away from the hustle and bustle.The blue spaceship café does reasonable beer and food too.Last few times we have basked in the sun on Christmas Day.
Romantic Park. Amazing garden! Great to take a walk, sit and observe people passing by.... Also good for a romantic pic nic. I went in fall time... and the weather was great.

Beautiful park! loved it!. Wonderful stroll :) A very big park, you can wander for hours. Very peaceful, amazing nature. I don't think you can buy food there so I would recommend to eat first \ bring food with you :)
vondelpark. i liked the tranquill setting in the middle of a town. Families and couples were enjoying the afternoon walk.

Beautiful, huge park with so many attractions. Easily accessible from hop-on hop-off bus, stroll around the lake, enjoy the lovely gardens and old residences. Wander to the pavillion and have a coffee or drink and listen to free music. The whole park is used widely by locals, it's worth taking the time to wander and watch the families, skateboarders, students enjoying the beautiful surrounds.

Spectacular place to take a break and enjoy nature or a picnic. We were there in mid September, but the weather was warm, 20 C - and the city teems with history, museums, great restaurants and always activities and people. So having a stroll and break walking past ponds with ducks, swans and herons, water features & fountains, many different types of trees and expansive green quiet was perfect for a picnic and to take a break from all the sightseeing and museums. This is well loved park by the locals.

Lovely park. Very nice park to walk through, although lots of bikes so best to keep to one side.Looked like there were stages and live music and very scenic. Worth a visit, especially during Summer as I imagine it would be lovely.

better than I remebered. The last time I visited Vondelpark was in the 70s (man) and it was ok cool and groovy back then (maan) but I had avoided it on my last few trip to Amsterdam as I tought it might be a bit dodgy - well how wrong I wasWent there this last time and found that actually it had had a lot of money spent on upgrading it and have to say it is about as good as city centre parks get, lovely gates and entrances, lovely features, and generally lovely but didnt suss out if there were any loos - there might be but I didnt notice them if there were.There a hotel/restaurant by one entrance that looked pretty swish so although we didnt visit it it looked worth a visit next time, another restaurant/café in the middle and and at warmer times of year theres a stage that loks fairly impressive for outdoor gigs etcOne or two scallwags lurking furtively but mostly and overall vibe very nice, lots of parrakeets flying round, herons and other birds. Don't know what its like at night but daytime a lovely family safe place
With the sun, this parc is unbeatable. One of the true gems of Amsterdam. Once only open to the Amsterdam elite that lived around it, since 150 years the parc is open to everyone...just gorgeous!

Parking off. Vondelpark is lovely , great meandering walk through tree lined paths . Only disadvantage is that we were traveling with kids and they had to witness people shooting up drugs under the bridge . That was disgusting !
Beautiful. Simply...beautiful. The garden of the city. With its path in the green and in the relax in the center of the city. You must go here.

Lovely Local Park. We visited Vondelpark on a crisp, clear December day. The park was a lively place populated with joggers, walkers, people feeding ducks in the pond, families with children. We liked the lost and found - a tall mesh cylinder with clips where people attached stray gloves, hats, etc.

Nice park. It is a quite big park, located close to the museum zone of the city. The park is very nice, you can have a walk and relax a bit. You don't feel to be inside a city as it is very quite in here, there is no pollution and you see a lot of birds and animals hanging around, even though it was winter (I was here on the 31st of December). When you walk, try to keep your right and mind the bicycles because they ride quite fast. I strongly suggest to have a walk in here just to have a break, relax and enjoy what this city can offer you.
Love this park!!. It's not a huge park, but it's beautiful, especially on a sunny day, be it cold or warm. Get on a bike and explore. Sit in one of the cafe's!

Sunday Morning Stroll. We woke up on Sunday morning to lovely blue skies so we decided to go for a leisurely stroll to Vondelpark, it was very busy with joggers, and there was a kettlebell class going on in the middle of the park. very nicely laid out and spotlessly clean.
Beautiful park. Beautiful, open park, filled with locals and tourists alike. Beautiful bridges and sculptures and room for games, walks, picnics and bike rides!

Lovely place to walk and enjoy fres air. Even as we visited the park in December it was full of life. Birds walking about, a lot of people jogging and riding bicycles. Probably even more charming in the summer. Nice Place to just strolla around and you can stop for coffee or beer in lovely restaurants.

Lovely tranquil area - but mind the bikes!!. Stopped off at Vondelpark from the Hop on-Hop off bus. This is a lovely quiet part of Amsterdam, if you don't mind being on constant look out for the bikes. This place is lovely for a stroll, even on a December day. The scenery is lovely and there is also a small cafe in the centre of the park. The cafe does not look very inviting and is quite cramped. We sat outside and had a very tasty sandwich. I imagine that it gets very busy during the summer as there seemed to be mostly locals there. If you are coming to Amsterdam do visit this lovely park.
Take a bike. Rent a bike and spend some time there, definitely worth a visit. Charming park in the center of the city.

Beautiful stroll, amazing architecture.. After we visited the National Museum, we took a stroll in the nearby park. Very beautiful, very calm. Full of all ages and lots of every day people despite week day, "work time," which surprised me. The architecture of the homes adjacent to the park let to numerous photographs. They had a variety of water features, lots of sitting areas, and it was adjacent to cafes, the canal, and other sites. I am very glad we took the time to walk through the park; it helped cement Amsterdam as one of my favorite European cities.

Beautiful park with nice art, but terrible people throughout. The park is large and has some very nice scenery and artwork. When we walked through it, there were hordes of people (many native English speakers such as us) drinking, smoking, and partying loudly throughout the park, leaving their trash everywhere, and playing with the artwork.There was litter throughout the park, much of it accumulating in the water where we saw families of ducks, etc.The artwork itself was very cool and unique, and we couldn't get enough of it. It was just difficult to navigate through it all with all the disrespectful people around.I don't know if it was the time of year, day of the week, whatever, but it was very disappointing for a beautiful park with interesting art to be so polluted with people and their junk.We also biked for a short section of the park on a bike-tour of all Amsterdam, and we did not get the same impression during that.Clean up the litter, and prevent people from being jerks (if possible even), and this would be a fantastic 5-star park.

We went through this park on a yellow bike tour and i cansee why its so popular with the . We went through this park on a yellow bike tour and i can see why its so popular with the locals. It takes you away from the city and has so much green space to have a picnic and just watch the world go by. Have a good time in Amsterdam :)

Best oasis in the city. If you wanna sped some time in the nature almost in the city centre of Amsterdam, you should definitely go to Vondelpark. Very good for walks, running, bicycle riding or just have a breath of fresh air. One of my fav places in Amsterdam, that I visit everytime I go there.

Just beautiful, and larger than you think!. Vondelpark extends beyond any of the maps we had, so we didn't realize just how large it is - worth an early morning walk, especially if you're staying in the area. Ringed with stately homes and filled with friendly dogs and their friendly owners.

Lovely Old Park. I went to the Vondelpark in winter but it was still very nice. It is a large green space not far from the museum area and is surrounded by beautiful Victorian and turn of the century mansions. There are a number of small lakes with surprisingly tame birds including herons that you can almost touch. In addition you see many green parrots which are native to India and the Middle East which are descendants of escaped birds who have adapted to this climate. What I went to see in the park was a Tea House built in 1937 in the Art Deco style which is very distinctive and would not look out of place in 1950s America. This park is a nice retreat for a tourist with time on their hands who wants a few moments of pleasurable escape.
Worth a visit for lunch and a break.. Good spot for a break, visit one of the eating establishments for lunch, do some people watching, etc.

Nice place for a walk or a run. The place to go running in the centre of Amsterdam. Be prepared to run on concrete - in some places you may find a track on the grass - but muddy in the rain.
Nice place for a walk too- you may even spot some birds - and a couple cafés and restaurants.
Just a Park. Visited in Dec 2014 hence nothing much was on. Have been to many parks in UK and France and this did not stand out as something spectacular.
Just the place for you!. If you fancy a stroll with your loved ones or a walk to ponder and meditate, then this is the place for you!

Great for runners. If you are a runner, you will love running in the Vondelpark. The complete round is 3 kilometers so you can do a few rounds or go outside the park. Amsterdam is a good city to go for a run. Ok, it can be very crowded but if you go early it is very nice. In spring or summer, just relax in the grass after your run and watch the locals. Have fun!

Great for People Watching. If you are in the area, stop here. It is a great park to sit and just watch people go by. You can grab a bite to eat there, picnic there, listen to music, run, and much more. Great park.

Beautiful park. I have to say that this park is very beautiful, I spent my Xmas day there. It was quiet and not that many people despite the holiday. It is much better than any park in Warsaw. I recommend this place if you like nature swans and quietness.
Nice quite park for a nice walk or run. And after a walk in the park you go for a drink in the bar/restaurant VondelPark. This makes your visit a nice ending.

vondelpark. too bad...i sure would have appreciated the park in warmer seasons..although...like at hyde park...in London...the park could have been cleaner and better minded and some flowers could have been planted
Amsterdam. A beatiful place to visit and spend some time in amsterdam, you can enjoy with bike or by foot, but it is really nice

Lovely park for a bike ride. This is a great park close to the city centre where you can either have an autumn stroll or do what myself and my friends did - go on a bike ride. You cannot rent bikes directly from within the park itself however we rented ours from a place nearby - MacBike Tours. This is located near the north entrance of the park, cross the road, over the bridge and through the mini shopping square and you will find it on your right (it is also located near the Kleine Gartmanplantsoen stop). The park enables you to cycle round a couple of times with a couple of variations however don't expect to spend all day discovering new paths. There are also spaces to stop and eat (in the summer this will be great for picnics) cafes and restaurants and is definitely worth a half day breather from city life.

A peaceful oasis in a busy city.. Beautiful and big parc in Amsterdam, a great place to chill or stroll/bike through. Look around and you'll find the most beautiful birds around. Love it here, very peaceful!

Great space in the city. This park is used by commuters, leisure and families on a regular basis. A beatific vast and open space in the city of Amsterdam. Sunday sees families getting their fresh air; taking this quite seriously. A great place for kids or adults. I particularly enjoyed people watching!

Breath of fresh air.... No, quite literally, I feel quite revitalised every time I'm here!
Even if you don't join the masses cycling or jogging around the park, it's nice to sit down and watch the world go by. Sometimes it does make you wish London parks were like this too. Hyde Park might just be getting to that level!

Lovely large park. Walked through the park at night, has several entrances, ponds, bike path and large walking path. Felt very safe with people running, walking, skate boarding, dog walking and riding their bikes. Their are large lanterns throughout the park. Clean and serene, there is a Restuarant in the middle and the large beautiful Restuarant and bar at the entrance near Leisplan.

B-e-a-utiful!. One of the largest, most incredible parks I have ever been to! In the middle of a bustling city, this place is out of this world! With things happening on every corner, it's not a surprise to see why the locals love it so much! Perfect when you want a day of sightseeing but with nothing too strenuous. I was here on my last of 10 days in Amsterdam and it was beautiful!

Lovely place for a walk. Really nice park to wander through and spend a bit of time in to get away from the busy streets! Loads of joggers and cyclists but plenty space for everone and overall a great spot to chill out and wander around.

Lovely park. Lovely park for a wander around. There are lots of birds and pretty spots to take in the lovely views of the water and trees. We went in winter but I'm sure this would be a perfect place to have a picnic in summer.

Gorgeous scenic walk. While you in Amsterdam, its posibble to see a lot of good picture spots, water channels, long houses and zillions of bycicles. But nce you gent in Vondelpark is like a relax for your peace of mind.
Excellent. This is one great park. Hire a bike and ride around this treey and very large park in the middle of Amsterdam.

Nice park in the city. It is what it is- a welcome green space in a city! Nice to stroll through after walking around the busy city and it's handy to cut in through as an alternative route at times. It was close enough to where we were staying so we walked through parts of it a few times.
Park. Very clean and tidy no rubbish. Hope to go back in the summer. And most of all no dog mess. People in and around the park the people where friendly and polite.

Amsterdam's answer to Hyde Park. Just beautiful. The perfect place to go with a picnic or on the bikes to chill out for the day. We lost a whole day in the Vondlepark in May. Much like London's Hyde Park there were people there for all sorts including birthday parties, a daytime nap under a tree and a bike ride.
Lovely park. Great place for a walk with the family on the way into the City. Plenty of tram stops nearby. Very wall maintained park with lots of water features. Lots of busy cyclists and joggers!

Best Park ever. I live close to the Vondelpark and spend a lot of time there BBqing in the summer, running troughout the whole year. Having coffee at the Blauwe Thee huis. Or just relaxing and lingering around. In the summer try to catch a free concert at the theatre in the park.

It's More than a Park. I thought it was a lovely park to walk through. But, it also works as shortcuts to get you around the city! I did not know that until one night I was lost & to my right I saw a side entry to the park, & it got me back to my hotel!

Like a mini Central Park. I just love taking in the outdoors of the city park. I love taking a lunch and a blanket there and hanging out for the afternoon. It's even great to people watch and to see all the various activities. Once time I got involved in playing Frisbee with a group and more recently I made friends with the inline skaters! There are also a couple of GeoCaches in the park! I LOVE Vondel Park! It is a must visit for me!

Well worth a visit with the kids. Looking for a break from the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam (and the canals!), head over to Vondelpark. It was too wet for us to hire bikes (which we would have loved to do) but even in the intermittent rain it was great to wander around and see another aspect of Amsterdam.

a breathtaking during your visit to Amsterdam. It was the second time we visited this place. During winter, it is not the best place to go. The pathways are muddy.We didn't find the toilets.Many bikes.Surely better on a sunny day ... but it was wintertime and a rainy day.

even in winter - especially for bird lovers. even withzero flowers, a walk through the park in bracing december morning is a treat. multiple birds - from the usual coots an amazing malards geese and jays, to a complete surprize of green parakeets!
NICE. Nice place, only for an hour or solittle bit dirty, a lot of people, some of them homlessa standart coffee house

A green oasis in a busy city. The Vondelpark is a great place to relax, walk, to ride bicycle, enjoy fresh air looking the birds that decide to remain in this city oasis during the winter. Once the sun appears the park bustles with life.

Good for a cheeky meander. I imagine in summer this would be even better. We went on a fairly chilly day but still had fun. Loads of dogs around so it was fun to see them all tearing round. There's a massive wooden adventure fort - not sure if it's meant for adults but it's big enough so we had a run through that and there's a couple of geocaches hidden around if that's you thing too.
Anti-stress park. In the midle of a bike controlled city, this is the place where you can walk relaxed!With a big fauna, the colours are beautiful.Loved it!
Great place to chill out. It' s a Big Park, great to walk or just sit and relax. There is also a lot of bikers too so you must be aware when walking. I totally recommend it.

Nothing special.. For a park in the winter, there were plenty of people taking a stroll, running, and dogs unleashed, all dodging the millions of bicycles. However, to me it was just a park. There weren't any pretty sights or spectacular flora (not that I was expecting it in the winter), but there wasn't anything that blew my mind or captivated me. Just a bunch of tourists, natives, bicycles, dogs, and dirt paths.

Good for walk. We walked from one end to other end of Vondelpark, to reach to the downtown. Its a nice green place, and connects the city at various openings. You can see a lot of people doing jog, cycling and if you are a dog lover, this is a nice place.

A Nature Lover's Sanctuary in Amsterdam. I'm a nature person (don't ask me why I chose to come to Amsterdam in the middle of winter), so finding Vondelpark in the middle of December saved me. I'm staying near Rembrandt Park, which is nice, but I definitely love Vondelpark a whole lot more. It's more busy, but it feels a bit more wild. And there are a few cozy teahouses to pop into when it's raining or you feel like sitting somewhere to write letters to loved ones. Plus there are sooo many cute dogs to watch, and if you're very lucky they might say hi to you.

A charming park for a stroll. In early October, it was still quite nice, with flowers. We enjoyed listening to people playing music. As others have mentioned, beware of the crazy cyclists, as well as dog crap. As an American dog owner, I was surprised how many people let their dogs free without leashes. It must be heaven for dogs. But the downside was owners who pretended not to see their dogs pooping. I wouldn't go there after dark because of the clumps of men standing around, smoking pot, but not looking very mellow.

Peaceful. We visited Vondelpark which was very near with our hotel . when we were there it was quite peace there. only fe people who were riding their bikes or jogging, even in the coldest of weather it was charming to be a part of what seems to be everyday life for many of the dutch.

Don't miss this beautiful park!. My husband and I were staying near Vondelpark so we walked over and were surprised at how much we enjoyed it. Since we were there in December the weather was chilly, but the day was sunny, and we didn't mind the cold. In the warmer weather it would be even more enjoyable.

Not a winter park. The park though beautiful was a bit bleak during the visit in December. Our hotel overlooked it and it was wonderful to have such a large open space so close to the centre of the city. One thing we could not get our heads around was the cyclists and their total lack of care when riding towards pedestrians so we were glad we did not have stray children with us.
Gorgeous Walk. Had a lovely walk through the park, slightly cold but still beautiful! Lovely place to have a picnic if it was warmer.

The weather was cold but the park was still lovely.. We visited Vondelpark which was very near our hotel as we were told about the "residential parrots" of Amsterdam having been on the walking tour. Everyone was out walking their well behaved dogs, riding their bikes or jogging, even in the coldest of weather it was charming to be a part of what seems to be everyday life for many of the dutch. Did we find these parrots, well we did spend a lot of time looking up. I said to my husband that the dutch are probably looking at us thinking "ah tourists who have been told "stories" about parrots which do not exist" ... and 2 minutes later 3 of their green parrots appeared in the trees overhead. Our walking tour guide, Monique will be proud of us.

nice peace of nature in the middle of Amsterdam. Many people find there joy here adults but also children spend a lot of time here. You can also have a drink a nice lunch or dinner in one of the restaurants or pubs you have here. Good to do.
Sunday walk. Clean, well marked paths. Great fun to see so many joggers, cyclists and walkers enjoying the park. The views of the local houses are good.

Rent a Bike, Lovely Greenery and Water Features. The easiest way to explore this gorgeous park is by bicycle. Lots of bike shops around Amsterdam that let you rent one for a few hours- affordable! It was nice to see many families and happy children chasing the ducks about :) Yay nature!
Prettiest park in Europe.. Large, green, water features, seating, cycling, relaxed, friendly. Nicest park iv strolled around ever in Europe. Beautiful.

The best park I have been to!. This park is huge, lush and extremely beautiful. There are several bike rental shops nearby, and one should make it a point to rent one. Biking through the Vondelpark is an absolute pleasure. During summers one can set up a BBQ and have fun with friends and family.
A great place of peace and quiet in the middle of the city. This park is a gem and filled with life—joggers, art students, people taking a nap in the sunshine—very relaxing spot
Great way to start the day.. Lovely way to start the day. Beware of cycles. Walked through here to get to the Van Gough Museum. Calm and peaceful apart from the bikes.

Safe to cycle.. Lovely big friendly park which was great to cycle around. We had hired bikes and although enjoyed ourselves found some a little daunting, however the park was a lovely break as you could cycle safely. Cafes were in the park, bbq area, we saw a couple of parakeats in the trees but you could hear many more. would visit here again if in Amsterdam
an oasis in the crowd. great nature and peace. you can take a long walk throught the all lake and trees. it's also graet for cycling.
So Dynamic!!. Place gives a good vibe!! You can find very chill parts, you can also have a lot of fun and entertainment!! Just very cool to spend some time up there!!
Can't Miss Experience. Next to Central Park, Vondelpark is my fave place to hang out on a blanket, read, write or just people watch!

A beautiful green area in the heart of Amsterdam. I loved everythink in this beatifull and well keeped park.You can find bars and lunch restaurant.You will not find great food but all around the park you can find best food solutions for any kind of taste.
Beautiful park. The park was a great place for a walk, and led us to a canal where we went on a tour of canals and lake.
Great Park. This is a big green park at the south of Amsterdam. At the evening you see lots of joggers. Are we in America ?

SPACE TO RELAX & HAVE A BEER. After a visit to galleries it great to clear your head with a relaxing walk through the Vondelpark's woods, ponds and meadows. This park is similar to the Englishergarten in Munchen and has a number of great places for a snack and a drink. We particularly liked the whilst Blauwe Theehuis (Blue Tea House) a great pavilion with loads of outdoor seating. But the park is also a great picnic spot too. On a sunny day it’s great o escape the bustle of the city and just wander between the lakes and ponds. There’s a relaxed buzz - its also a great place to meet new friends.

Review by a local. Ok, so this park is only 5 minutes from my house - a review by a local.It's a great place to go to, sit down and relax, or take a ball and play some football (US guys - read: soccer). Go to the supermarket/grocerystore, buy yourself some bread, snacks, soda, beer and/or whine, and relax here for some time, do some people watching and enjoy yourself.You can also go to one of the few bar/restaurants in the park and sit down there.Something to realize though: when the weather is really good in the weekends, this park will be quite (or very) busy.

Fall in love with the Vondelpark. A place to run or yoga or do yoga run, longboard, rollerskate, bbq, meet-up with friends, have a drink in a bar, with kids, and now do this all at once: can be done in the Vondelpark. If you like to experience how locals live and how tourists do the Amsterdam thing, go and hang out in the Vondelpark, my favourite,

One of the most beautiful parks I have ever seen. The park is amazingly beautiful and there is always life and dynamism with people running and cycling all around. Lets not forger the beautiful families playing all kinds of sports, especially football:) I fell in love with this city and park.

A must-see spot in Amsterdam. A lovely place to wander about, get lost & explore. Even in winter, just wrap up warm and set out. The whole park is very varied, with trees, large green open spaces, bridges, streams... plenty of space to exercise, go for a bike ride, walk a dog or just wander aimlessly.

A great place to people watch.. A long, landscaped park used by weekend walkers, fitness fans, bicycles.. well, everyone! A mix of ponds, fountains, wooded areas, play areas and cafés, there is something for everyone. You also get some beautiful views of the adjoining city architecture. This is a lovely park to stroll through or just sit back and watch the world go by.
Rubbish weather . This park would have been great if it wasn't for the weather. It was quite rainy and the park was not very busy and we had to cancel our full day here

Picnic in the park!!. Spent the day with family at the park, after grabbing a lunch at the 'Albert Heim' grocery. Had a SUPER relaxing time 'people watching', and taking photos of the gardens, and pods/fountains.

Vondelpark, Amsterdam. Who said that to describe a great destination you should write many long lines?
Hence: the Vondelpark is beautiful, spacious, well-kept, green, clean and hosts many activities, especially in the warmer seasons (you see, just one long line).
Great picnic place. If you are in Amsterdam for a couple of days, this place is great of an outdoor relaxing day! pack up some food and have a great picnic there! ;)

Natural Gem in the Middle of this Large City. There were plenty of room for walkers, joggers, skaters and bicyclists. Plenty of large trees and water and if you get tired there is a small restaurant over the bridge in the middle that has terrific hot cocoa, coffee or tea.

good place to walk after the visit to museum. Located not that far from the city center, it is just two (?) blocks from the Rijksmuseum. Not only summertime, but also in Novembe (!) it is nice to walk there. Night of Saint Martin thousands of families joined with their children to walk along the park. Amazing experience
lovely park. do make a visit here. lovely trees & water bodies and all the joggers, walkers and cyclists give a visitor a real feel of Amsterdam.
A pleasant walk. Spectacular fountains and a tranquil oasis in the middle of the city - though there seemed to be lots of people who thought the same - it was very busy even on a November evening

VERY LOVELY, QUIET REST PLACE. Either walking, or biking or just strolling, this is a beautiful park in the central area.nice to have some down time when visiting all the wonderful things to do in the great city of amsterdam
