Good option in amsterdam!. Excellent park!Its huge . You should rent a bike to get in because its quite far away from the center.Its a good option to get away from the tourist area and take a breath of fresh air. I recommend it!Funny experience
Great Park. Large, open park. Well-kept and fun for the entire family. We really enjoyed the entire city and the park system.

walk was an intro to culture of city. cyclists with amazing contraptions to carry kids and stuff - never seen such great variety elsewhere, lots of toddlers having a great time on cycles, swings, just playing! the rain could not dampen the spirit of the enthusiastic walkers, runners, cyclists! saw a dog swimming with the ducks to fetch a stick his master would throw into the pond! Amsterdam at its healthiest best!
Peaceful. I really enjoyed my afternoon stroll in Vondelpark with my boyfriend. We stopped for a beer in one of the pubs before taking in the beauty of this park!

Wonderful autumn. Wonderful relaxed park where people cycle (no surprise in Amsterdam ) , run, do thai chi, and really everything else. Perfect place to watch the world go by , forget about bustling city, all worries and just sit and listen to Rose-ringed parakeets over your head. Yes, you will be surrounded by parakeets, you can also feed by hand very cheeky herons. You can see how much this place is loved by locals even in late autumn.

Big, busy, thriving. This is a very popular and busy park. If you are looking for a quiet picnic, look elsewhere! But it's great for a stroll, to see locals doing their thing, maybe take a bike ride or run through park.
Nice green space. Very popular with Amsterdammers - similar to how New Yorkers feel about Central Park. Not that many flower beds and most of it given over to lawns and scrubby, wildlife areas.

A bit of heaven in a bustling city. You can ride your bike, take a stroll, see performances, get a bite to eat or just find a moment of zen in this often busy city. Perfect for a picnic with some of the wonderful food offerings nearby.Sit, relax and people watch.

A haven!. This park is a little haven in the centre of Amsterdam! We went for a walk in the park on Saturday morning and it was great to see the locals making the most of it either jogging or cycling.
great park ,serene environment.. its a very nice park walking distance from rijksmuseum,and you must visit it.beautiful and good for spending at least an hour.
Crowded. Vondelpark is a bit too crowded and busy, but after a long walk around the park (yes, it is very large) you can find some peaceful and nice corner to sit and relax there.

a real family and city park. We went there on a sunny November 2014 Sunday, it was packed with all sorts of people, tourists, locals, families, joggers, beggars and the lot. The park has three outlets nowadays. The former film museum, the tennis lounge as well as the circular restaurant. The atmosphere is very relaxed in the park were beggars, jugglers, tourists and locals mingle.
Stunning city park. Absolutely fantastic way to spend an afternoon. My only compliant is there should be more W/C's scattered throughout the park.
Great park. Mostly busy in summer, always crowded, its seems good for morning and evening walk. lies near to the central.
Beautiful and Tranquil. With many paths crossing the park, there are sections where you feel like you're in the woods, not in the city. A lovely spot for a respite from museums and sightseeing.

Beautiful and relaxing. We rented some bikes and spent a morning in the park, complete with a picnic breakfast. Great way to escape the city and just sit for a while or ride bikes safely. Beautiful sculptures, beautiful landscapes, and neat people doing neat things. It's vast enough to spend a whole morning or afternoon in.
Great place to bike and picnic. A breath of fresh air in Amsterdam. Lots of green spaces, ponds, flowers, trees and bike paths. Some restaurants and outdoor terraces. Great for people watching.

Large and clean city park.. This is a pleasant area to visit at any time of the year. There is a large pond, easy walking and cycle access and appeared to be immaculately kept. There is a café but we didn't visit it. Congratulations Amsterdam!
Greenery in Amsterdam. A refreshing area away from concrete and buildings . Not large by other city standards. Good walking areas with trees and grass. As this is still Amsterdam, Beware of bicycles!

Gorgeous!. I think Amsterdam without its building and urban infrastructure would have looked like Vondelpark. I love the way they have designed it, in some part of, it seems you are in the jungle and far away from such a crowded city.
If you have free time.... Nice park. Nothing especial about it, but still a very nice place to spend an afternoon if you have some extra time and the weather is nice.

Where are all the hippies?. Last visited this park in 1969. At the time was a tent city of 'hippiedom' and an unsupervised 24-hour party. Today park has been returned to its former self, with comfortable walking/bike paths, greenery. On way to the museum district.

Beautiful large park in downtown Amsterdam.. What a great place to stop and rest your weary and wobbly legs after an extensive to the Heineken Brewery and Rijksmuseum which are close by. This is a large, peaceful sea of green in this wonderful town of canals and culture!

Good place to chill out!. Amsterdam can get very very busy! If you need some time to sit down and relax and just watch the busyness instead of being in it this is the place also at the bottom is the Rijksmuseum with the famous 'IAMSTERDAM' lettering!

An oasis in Amsterdam. This is the ideal getaway, we stayed at the opposite end of the park from the museums. Ideal place for a calm walk. Just watch out for the bikes which crias cross the park, and much of Amsterdam.
A lovely place to relax and see birds. We particularly enjoyed seeing birds not typical of North America, such as a tree full of green parrots. Very relaxing to walk through here.
Lovely stroll with the locals. This park reminds me of a quiet stroll in the country. Watch out for the bicycles or you could get run over.

Awesome park in the middle of Amsterdam!. Vondelpark is great for taking a break from sightseeing or just enjoying the nature. Take a seat at one of the benches and just enjoy the nature or look at all the bikers and joggers pass by.

The park that is Amsterdam. I never tire of the Vondelpark, on a sunny day it is so vibrant with the variety of bikes and cyclists, people out to picnic or sunbath, families, a great mix of lakes and pathways. Bustling with life. And central in the city. It is much smaller than Hyde Lark in London or Central Park in New York, but does have that sense of feeding a city. It's also great to see the crane's nesting up high. Great place to be.

Calm and Beautiful. We stayed close to the park during our visit to Amsterdam. The park is huge and very good. There are bikers all around. There are ponds and fountains in the lake which make it all the more beautiful.Nice place to have a stroll
Beautiful park and great for bike rides.. Take your bike and spend a morning walking around the Vondelpark. It's simply awesome nature and sights. Very relaxing and nice.

Pitch perfect . We went here to relax and watch the sun go down . Great place to eat some truffles and watch everything going on. Visuals were brilliant and the hustle and bustle seems to slip away to form a nice little buzz in the background . Mother natures finest all the way baby!
Pleasant and vibrant. Nice area to stroll and relax. Lotsa people with their pets. Strolling around in the area is a good choice if that is your cup of tea.
Nice for a walk. Good to have a little oasis in the middle of the city with some nature and fresh air. A bit too many cyclists to watch out for, but it is Amsterdam afterall...
Very nice, but too much tourists. Park is lovely and very big. There is also little lake. During our stay there was too much people and too much shouting in the park, we can´t enjoy it well.
Beautiful and Relaxed. A lovely insight to the locals chilled way of life, a nice chilled walk to walk off all the waffles and coffee!

don't bother in winter. it's a park - nothing more to add but as there's a 50 word minimum, I'll point out that there are lots and lots of cyclists and it's probably a lot nicer in the summer, in the winter there's really not much to see

Nice time. We went here because we happened to pass it on our way back from Anne Franks house to central and decided to have a wander round. Very nice park, plenty of space and a nice river to look at. Couple of interesting sculptures, bridges and a nice play to hang out in and chill if you have the time.
Perfect for walk. this parks looks very big and cover very big area. would be good idea to spend the time family and friends in this park but in summer , specially.

Wonderful Getaway in the City. This park is a beautiful getaway from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. When we went, there were numerous groups of people exercising, playing games, walking dogs, and doing lots of other park-like activities. You can spend an hour or two just walking around the water, enjoying the sights. There is a small restaurant in the park if you are hungry or thirsty, and there was also a stage, which, I assume is used during the summer time for shows. We walked back to central Amsterdam from the park, which was a pretty long walk, but there is so much to see and do that it helps the time and kilometers pass quickly.
Lovely park. It was a nice and quiet place in busy Amsterdam. But some placed especially in the lakes were a lot of trash...
near to my hotel, good for walk. Big park lies near to the leidsplein, speciall good for summer time to spend the time with family and friends. must visit park in amsterdam.

Good For Cycling and Walking. A large public park with no admission charge. There is at least 1 cafe and other refreshments.It is popular with tourists and locals. It is also quite close to Rembrandt Park which is also worth exploring

A Great Escape. As we walked around the park one bright and sunny morning we came across lovebirds flying among the trees! What a nice surprise! We were strolling; there were runners, cyclists, young and old enjoying the outdoors! We stopped into the cafe for coffee and tea, but the folks were unable to serve us our first choice so we settled for Americano. Vondelpark is a great escape in the city.
A great place for a break. A wonderful spot to take a nice walk and relax on the grass near one of the many ponds. Not as many bikes as other places within the City so a nice break.

Great for a picnic. We visited in October and were lucky enough to have some fantastic sunny and warm weather. We walked to the Vondel park after visiting the Van Gogh museum and stopped for a picnic after a stop at a nearby bakery for sandwiches and cakes. Really pleasant.
One of the most beautiful places in Amsterdam!. Leisure with kids, ideal for jogging and cycling, cafes outside. A quiet and picturesque place.free.

Not as good as some city parks.. We took a morning stroll around the whole park and to be honest was a little disappointed. I understand that it is Autumn and that the temperature was on the low side but there wasn't a great deal of activity going on for a clear dry day. There were a handful of dog walkers, another handful of joggers, plenty of cyclists going about there business, a small group playing football and that was about it. The whole place seemed a bit plain. That said it is great to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city and is only a short walk from the Museumplein where there was far more activity going on at the park there. It took us nearly two hours to take a very steady walk round and we did stop in a pleasant cafe for a coffee. I am sure it is far more appealing, vibrant and colourful in the spring or summer so maybe one day I will find out.
Beautiful. Wonderful park. An oasis of quiet and repose away from the relative hustle and bustle of the city. Loads of cyclists and joggers, very quiet. Time to relax among the trees and shrubs.

A great park in the city but signages are confusing. A great park in the centre of Amsterdam. I was there in Oct during Autumn and the view was beautiful. Joggers, cyclists, outdoor freaks and dogs' heaven! The only complain I have is the signages are a bit confusing, all in Dutch. Its a huge park, so it would be good if they have maps guiding you.A must visit if you are a nature lover.
Amazing place. Good space to walk by... and to breathe ! All green ! A lake, a cosy bar... and much different people ! Just sit and watch !

walk in the park. went during the day as we had our dog with us, the weather was good, this park is well used, well looked after and clean, well worth the small walk from the centre, you could bring a picnic and have a laze around
Such a peaceful place.... This is a lovely place to relax and get away from hustle and bustle of the city. You can have a barbecue or just relax.

Evening walk in the park. Very quick review - we went through the park as it was the shortest way to the restaurant. It was already dark, but the park was very well lit and there were lots of people jogging and cycling there - so the walk was completely safe!
Beautiful. Having a park in the middle of this vibrant city was just fantastic to sit and watch all the locals cycling and skating with their families, just brilliant
realky active park. Watch out for cyclists, but great f or a scenic walk and people watching as it is a really busy place for active people
Amazing. A very beutiful place near Van Gogh Museum and Hijkmuseum and perfect to spend few minutes after visiting museuns. Also, is from there my best picture I take in my entire life!

on the look out. One of the nicest parks in Amsterdam. If only for the people one will see. Different people, dependent on the time of the year as well as the type of weather. The Vondelpark doesnot strike me as a special place for plants as you will see often in the UK. It is however one of the nicest places to be to look at people (whilst having a drink or two).

Art & Nature. More than just a beautifully landscaped park, you'll find a couple of peaceful cafes and free concerts during summer months. A huge Picasso sculpture (a fish or a bird, depending on your perspective) stands in an open field. It was a gift from the artist in 1965 on the park's 100th anniversary. Dogs are allowed to run free everywhere, except children's playground areas. Well worth a visit!

Busy, but worth it. We were here a few times this past June (2014) as the apartment we rented was only a few blocks away. It gets pretty busy in some spots (especially near the main entrances), but once you move away from those areas there is peace and some beautiful scenery to be found. Pack a lunch (and maybe a couple drinks) and enjoy the sun and people watching. I would also strongly recommend renting bikes if you want to see the whole park because the grounds are HUGE; just make sure you learn the rules of the road as best as possible to avoid any mishaps/ angering the locals :)

Beautiful. It's a beautiful park with great water features. Super popular with young people and tourists. Had a few drunk guys disturbing people during the day while we were there which made us super uncomfortable. There are police driving around but it's a big park so it's hard for them to catch these guys.

The whole world in a park. Always nice to visit The Vondelpark Meet people from all over the world Summer days packed with tourists Nice places to have a drink and/or eat something Busy in the firts part.. quiet in the backpart of the park ( towards Amstelveense Weg)Childrens playground/'swimming' pool.. bbq area.. Dogs heaven.. bikers heaven Rose Garden really worth a visit
A walk in the park. To escape the city take a walk in this great park. Meet, greet and watch interesting people or drink something at Vertigo.
Beautiful. A lovely place for a mid afternoon stroll. Such beautiful scenery and a lovely cafe to stop off in and warm up.

nice greenery. As the biggest park of Amsterdam (excluding the Amsterdam forest), Vondelpark is the 'lungs of the city' where locals and tourists alike come for a piece of nature and peace and quiet. Biking, rollerblading and other non-motorised sports are welcome.

Beautiful park with many interesting features.. This park is gorgeous, the largest in Holland.There are many lakes within the park, vast expanses of grass, trees and bushes. There are several places to eat and drink in the park, making it attractive to visitors of all ages.Locals use the park as a means of cutting through the city and like everywhere else in Amsterdam, there were cyclists in abundance.There is a very friendly atmosphere and not the slightest hint of trouble or groups of loitering youths trying to intimidate visitors as can be the case in the UK.Nothing to dislike.
just walk! don't stop. don't sit on the first bench you see. keep walking to the heart of the park.grass is wet so bring a blanket

Excellent green space in a busy city. After a busy morning, we had a slow walk in a large, quiet park and enjoyed the sight of many family groups having a good time in this oasis. We were entertained by a small group of very talented inline skaters as they completed an obstacle course in a variety of ways - including backwards and on one wheel! The wide paths were simultaneously pedestrian and bicycling kid-friendly.

Calm and Clamour. Well worth a visit especially if you want a break from trawling around the nearby museums or just get away from the hurly burly of the city. Lots of cafes, lakes, wooded areas and felt very safe.

local park. lots of herons and folk walking their dogs
Nice relaxed park
cafe in the centre should you want a coffee
a lovely peaceful haven to sit and relax and people watch
Must Go in Afternoon. Beautiful park to visit in a sunny afternoon- make sure the sun is out when you go there. Best place to relax or read a book or picnic in Amsterdam.
Chilled vibe. This is the place to be (specially in summer) for your tanning, play a bit of soccer, catching up with friends or lovely bbq and some drinks.
Great place. The vondelpark is a beautiful place to ride a bike or take a walk through. Or alternatively could make for a great picnic spot

Great place to chill in the middle of Amsterdam.. This is a great place if you want to have a break and enjoy the sun. It's okay to sit on the grass and have your lunch, or even a cute picknick with some wine. But don't forget to pick up your trash when you leave.It's in the middle of Amsterdam, but there are no traffic sounds. Just the sights and sounds of all the other people around you having a great time. And for the commuting Amsterdammers (people from Amsterdam) it's a green shortcut. They are in a hurry, so if you hear a 'ding ding' and you are on the path, just step aside for those bikers.It really is a green corridor in the city. Amsterdam's own Central Park. BTW, Tripadvisor, it's van Baerlestraat with ...RL... (no 'd' )

An oasis of peace in the heart of Amsterdam !. Take a break... take a stroll ... or take a bench and relax in this oasis corner of busy Amsterdam.You will not miss the park as you walk through lovely Amsterdam's major sights. A welcoming sight in all season's changing colors. Summer time: families picnicking; biking ; seating by the lakeside ; a nap by the green, green grass. Whatever is the temperature of the day, it is relaxing to be in this park. Accessibility to city trams from the central station. Restaurants and cafes are everywhere. Or bring your own in a backpack. An urbanized park worth promenading while on an Amsterdam exploration.

A little bit of quiet in the City centre .... We rented bikes and road around Vondelpark for half a day. Its a welcome place of quiet in a busy city! There are 3 bars in Vondelpark where you can sit inside or out, and enjoy a beer or hot drink as well as some food. The park does have a reputation for being a breeding ground of cannabis smokers but we thought it was beautiful!There are no bikes to rent in the park, so you will have to find somewhere nearer the city centre to rent them and then ride down.

A lovely walk and beautiful scenery. This was our first stop in Amsterdam as it was literally right by our hotel. We went early on a Saturday morning and walked all around the park in the sunshine- gorgeous! We saw lots of birds- herons and parakeets and the atmosphere was really lovely. Lots of people running and doing boot camp type fitness classes out in the open and lots of people just mooching like us. There is a lovely tea house as well in the middle. A lovely place to get away from all the hustle and bustle.

LOVE IT. I just love the Vondelpark. Every season is wonderful. In summer it is a great park to have dinner on the grass. it is a very populair park to run (a round is around 3,6K). Especially on Sundays of early Saturdays. Great to rent a bike and bike trough the park. Very near other facilities like the Rijksmuseum, van Gogh and Stedelijk museum. I just love the park for many occasions and another must see when you are in Amsterdam.

Full of life. It's a great place to be with your friends, couple, children, or pets!a vibrant park with many water ponds and fountains,you can just stroll down the amazing park,sleep on the grass, or admire the flowers and view.If you have been on a long walk and would like to rest and have a snack it's the place to be,just grab your snacks from any near buy cafe or super market,and sit in the park enjoy your mini picnic and rest your feet.if you also love photography,landscapes there are amazing,make sure to bring your camera with you and wait for the golden hour before sunset.definitely a place to be when you are in Amsterdam!

Vondelpark on Mike's Bikes. We did a Mike's Bikes tour for part of the day, and really enjoyed it!! Our guide was fun, we covered lots of the sights, and spent some time riding around Vondelpark. When you have limited time in a city, this is a great way to get some exercise, while you are exploring.

one of the best urban parks anywhere. On a suny day its gorgeous and best place in town to people watch. Quite large so be prepared to walk a lot but ots of places for food and drinks, blue tea house is fantastic. We actually had bikes so it was easy to pedal around and see everything, lovely lakes, birds, great pictures can be taken here, all in all a tremendously relaxing venue to stroll or ride round. Go there!
The Blue Tea House. On a Sunday it is a great place to hang, go to the Blue Tea House. Been there since the early 1920,s and renovated in 2009 a nice place to have a coffee and enjoy the park

RELAX. Visited this enormous Park just on dusk and it was streaming with people socialising, relaxing, going for a jog or just gazing at the marine folk in the lake (ducks). Some were cooking sausages on tiny little portable BBQ's. We sat on a bench seat after a very long day of visiting museums and taking in the wonderful culture of this lovely but very busy City. A great place to ponder, observe and have a chat. I recommend you visit and just follow your nose around the many paths.
Beautiful Park. The park is pretty big.Great to go cycling and then to stop somewhere with a nice view to relax and rest. You'll see some great street performances as well.
A lovely place to relax and take pictures. Beautiful park! I recommend every one to have a walk around and relax. Ofcourse with a beer will be more enjoyable
WOW. A huge place!!! Very quiet. A lot of ducks, rubbits and birds. U can spend there all day !! A nice place for picknic. Kids can run and play as much as they want. Amazing
Huge park in Amsterdam. You will need time to walk in Vondelpark and map too, it is big enough to spend hours there.Nice ,silent park in Big city, nice to jogging therebestJormaa

Lovely and sunny. This park is just huge.I'm from London and obviously think I know everything about parks.This park is more surprising than Central Park in New York. Just lovely.Everyone comes here. All age. And not just to sit around to smoke joints.Those that do do it in their quietly and don't seem to bother others.There are lots of benches and so may benches to sit on and enjoy the views.A truly delightful park.

Good spot to have a break from city live. Do it like the locals: grab a bottle of wine and some snacks, sit down and enjoy a picnic in this green oasis in the middle of Amsterdam (alternatively you can put on your runners and take a jog of course...)
Terrific City Park. I've visited this park many times. It is well-loved by Amsterdammers and a great place to people watch as well as ride a bike.

Very serene. What a lovely place, an oasis of calm a stones throw from the busy roads and crazy bike riders of Amsterdam.I generally find it hard to switch off and relax, but yesterday the Universe came together for me and laying by the lake I had some of the most peaceful, present moments I've ever had in my life.I think I only got about half way in, so next time I'll be sure to explore the rest of it.
stunning. beautiful park...nice short cut into central Amsterdam...full of joggers & cyclists...safe at night...
Beautiful Park. We traveled around Park on Bikes. Was a very relaxing place hiding inside Amsterdam's city. Just Beautiful.
nice and tranquil. A great getaway from the city centre a beautiful green park with the best restaurant of Amsterdam, De Kas on one corner.

Love this park!. Beautifully maintained park centrally located, great for jogging, walking, cycling, feeding the ducks with kids, taking kids to the playground. Also has a variety of cafes and restaurants to cater for everyone's needs. Can be quite packed on sunny summer days though, would advise the Beatrix park or the Amstelpark for more quietness.
Lovely walk in the city centre. Great green space in the city centre. Lovely to see the space so well used by cyclists, walkers, joggers and families
Lovely park. Loveliest park of Amsterdam and a great place for biking, jugging, running and sitting for reading a book or having a picnic.
Take a bike & go here!. It's a typical city park, - you'll find nice trees, greens, water (with ducks), & contemporary art objects. Great place for runners + cyclists.
Beautiful and nice atmosphere. I just love this park! The scenery is lovely, there are a few nice places where you can have a drink and the atmosphere is very laid back.

The Central Park of Amsterdam. Vondelpark in Amsterdam was reminiscent of New York's Central Park. I immediately forgot I was in a bustling city as I strolled through such a relaxed setting. The locals were enjoying the sunshine, going for a walk or a bike ride, exercising their dogs, playing games and just relaxing in a beautiful environment.It is quite a large park with fountains and cafes and many photo opportunities.Pros- it is free- there are cafés to enjoy- it is relaxing- there are great photo opportunitiesCons- noneIt's a great place to watch the locals enjoying themselves.

Typical city park. Nice green space but very much a "city park". Lovely to see the greens, trees and water features but very busy, need to watch out for bikes (typical Amsterdam). Pleasant cafes and play areas if you have children.

A wonderful park. After a whole day spent in museums, shopping or just walking in the busy streets of Amsterdam, it was a pleasure to spend some time in this lovely park.A great place to walk, run, or ride a bicycle and breathe fresh air..
Stunning. A beautiful park, worthy of a walk in the nice weather! such a lovely area, it would be a shame to miss it.
Lovely city park. Ran through it one way and walked back after the Half Marathon. Lovely park with trees and lakes and well worth visiting twice!
Big park but not attractive. I think that Vondelpark is a great place to the citizen of Amsterdan, but don't offer much attractions to the turist. Only a park, with nothing different to see.
Wonderful park. The park is very nice and big. There are nice Restaurants. You could travel by foot or by bicycle. There was a Rosarium with with different roses in it.

Central place to relax. This park reminds you of Central Park in New York. But this one you can walk around it. You just have to look out for the hundreds of bicycles that will pass you whilst you are enjoying the different areas of the park. It is a park for family gatherings. Plenty of shade and grass. You will enjoy the walk and the surroundings on offer

Amazing collection but crowded!. It was good,the collection obviously is amazing but so much people in the museum that you really don't enjoy it as you might expect! If you have short time at Amsterdam buy the tickets in advance, the ticket line might take you some time under the sun. Note for students: There is NO student discount. Only if you are under 18 there is free entrance.

lovely sunny autumn afternoon. We really enjoyed spending a sunny Saturday afternoon here. We brought along some picnic items and found a perfect bench by the lake and fountain. There was also a free concert going on which we could hear, and it provided the ideal musical background. Very tranquil, even with many other visitors and bicycles. One of our favourite memories from our holiday to Amsterdam.

Excellent for a run, even under rain. The park is very well located, therefore, a quick walk from most popular hotels is very short, a perfect warm-up for a quick run.The trails are large, so no problem to share with walkers and children.The ambient and sights are nice and well maintained.
Must see. Huge park, rent a bike and go for a ride with no hurry. Beautiful green features, lovely colors in the Fall.

nice and central but very crowded. good spot to picnick if you are not scared of crowds. in the summer i prefer the much calmer funnen park in the east or amsterdamse bos. there's just too many people in VP, and in rush hour mad cyclists occupy the main path, and scare pedestrians with their mad bell ringing

Much to enjoy at Vondelpark. I visited Vondelpark twice on my recent visit to Amsterdam. The first visit was a brief ride-through as part of a bike tour and the second was a much longer trip on foot. Vondelpark is a lovely green oasis, fairly close to the center of Amsterdam. There is much to like at the park, but perhaps my favorite aspect was the chance to see native Amsterdamers "chilling" and relaxing in their largest park. If your hotel is a long way from Vondelpark, it may not always be worth a visit. But, if you are anywhere in the vicinity, then I recommend Vondelpark as a rewarding place to while away an hour or two.

Beautiful. Great place to chill and hang with friends, have a picnic or play some tunes. We hired bikes and rode through the park, sitting down near the lake to escape the rushed, busy streets of the inner city.
Scenic and Relax. We cycled around the park and really love and enjoyed the time spent in the park. The route is scenic and quiet.
Amazing outdoors. Amsterdam's largest park, great for walks or bike rides in all seasons. In summer just grab a book and sit until it gets too dark to read

Wonderful Park. Absolutely lovely park with plenty of walking to do, certainly takes a lot of time to walk round so I would recommend getting a hire bike with a basket, loading up with a picnic and having lunch in this amazing park - be sure to stay off the main cycle road if you are walking!Would definitely recommend the visit!
only i can just said wow. In centre of city, very big, and for relax as created. Very quite, when you will be in Amsterdam you must check it.

Beautiful green space. Beautiful green space in the middle of a big city. Very vibrant and full of people enjoying nature. Nice to take a break here from the buildings and rushing crowds of people and bikes.
rent a bike!. cycling around the park was one of our fav thing in Amsterdam! you can also get a picnic basket! best way to experience Amsterdam and Amsterdam live style!

Lovely park. Absolutely wonderful, its a must if you are in Amsterdam, lots of walking, biking, ponds and birds! The only downturn is no bike rental inside or immediately near the park. I would have loved a complete go-around on the bike!

Just Beautiful. What a great park. Lots of biking and walking/running trails. Ponds, trees, grass are abundant and it's truly a gorgeous and relaxing park that fits in nicely in this great city. There are a couple of cafe/restaurants that offer patios to sit outside and take in the beauty and people watch. Come here to relax and enjoy some downtown with those you hold dear most.

great park. Fun, bright park to enjoy on a beautiful day! Great way to escape the busy city! Although like the rest of Amsterdam, you need to keep an eye out for the speeding bikes and inline skaters!

Life history of Van Gogh beautifully done. We loved the friendly atmosphere and staff = 100% and so nicely done with all of Van Gogh's influences, learnt all about him, and hadn't expected so much history. Great free wifi there.
Fabulous park. Residents compare to Central Park. It is beautiful, green, with lovely walking and running paths.There is a flea market on Sundays. A definite place to relax while in Amsterdam.
take a break. we walked here for a bit while staying in the hampshire hotel and loved people watching in a nice park

Nice park on a nice day to relax and chill. Nice how they had an area for bbq plus a structure for lost property, with a number of lost keys and odd bits.Hug park that I didn't have time to fully explore but good for relaxing, cycling or running.
Nice park. This was next to our hotel. Lovely for a stroll and really soak in the atmosphere of Amsterdam but be careful of the cyclists

World class very well kept, always green and calming park. I love this park,
Every single spot in it, is making you calm and opens your soul
Perfect for:
Read a book, photo, relax, smoke, see people, hear the silence
Great park!. This is a great park to visit. Very well kept and of a good size. Had a packed lunch here and enjoyed watching the world go by. Love it!
What a nice place!. Really beautiful park, with lots of people running, children playing, people chilling... Can't wait to go back!

NICE... It is city park, a very big one.... At weekends you can here music, people is laying down at grass, which was unusual for us, walking, bicicling. It was not very clean but with so many people... Nice place to rest for tourist walking all day and here is restaurant (beautiful one) for those with fet pocket and also a cheaper drinks and food all around.

Cafe in Vondelpark. Easy, serene, efficient table turnover serving continental cuisine. Nice teas and little touches. Food good but you are paying for location. You might not have the leisure to linger on a busy day, but you will enjoy your time there.
Very Pretty. Nice to just go walk around and hang out for an hour or two. Lots of locals, tourists and families go here to enjoy the scenery.

Lovely oasis in the city if weather is up to it. We enjoyed unexpected sunshine and warmth on our 2nd full day in the city so walked from Jordaan to Vondelpark and all around the beautiful grounds. Lots of lakes, fountains, trees, gardens and birdlife and at least 2 places to relax and people watch over drinks and some food but we strolled back instead to nearby Leidseplein to soak up the sun and atmosphere. The park is well recommended if you've already done all the museums etc.
Lovely and serene. Great place to go and sit on a bench and just enjoy the peace.Quiet for a big city actually. Watch the fountain or the water birds.

A lovely place for a sunny afternoon break from the bustle :-). We rented bikes and cycled through here with the Dutch and tourists alike. Sat by the fountain in the centre, drank mint tea and watched the world go by one sunny afternoon. A good atmosphere and feels like a safe place, there are multiple cafe's and toilets. Spot the PIcasso sculpture. Near the museumplein.

A park. Just one of the places to seat and watch how the city runs during weekend. Not just the one. Special one. Seat on the bench and watch. You will be surprised unless you are not from Amsterdam ;)
nice and large park. Very nice, however would be more appreciated by tourist in spring/summer. Rent a bike and have a tour around the park :)

Long green park with plenty of hidden places. We walked through this park on the way for lunch, stopping at one of the cafes for a quick beer and take in the Autumn sunshine. You can easily forget you are just a few minutes walk from the busy bars and streets of Amsterdam.

for a little get away from the hectic city.... Just a piece of green and water in the middle of town..
Very nice coffee place in the center of the park overlooking a duck pond.
Yay. Beautiful space to spend some time in. Very clean, safe, and quiet. Good if you need some dog time or want to sit and people watch.
What a brilliant public space. Hire a bike, take a picnic, find a tree and people watch. Fantastic. The ponds, flowers, wide meandering roads and beautiful cafes make it a great afternoon visit.

Beautiful park to visit. My partner and I stayed in a hotel near to the park so thought we would have a walk through it on our way into the city centre.
It certainly was a worthwhile experience in the Autumn sunshine.
It was so peaceful and relaxing.
We're certainly pleased we found it
A peace moment in the park. It is a really good place to do the morning walking, or jogging, or to ride a bike, or to have a picnic. There are some free music festivals during the summer.

Beautifull park for everyday. Its a great location within city center for a nice rest in the park, a great BBQ on a sunny day, a run in the morning or in he tevening, a romantic walk or a day out with the familly. The residential area around is also interesting to visit and enjoy.

We forgot to bring our camera with us!!!!. Shortly after checking in at the nearby Best Western Apollo Museum Hotel we decided to explore the nearby area and came across this beautiful park. Even though it was late afternoon the park was full of people strolling about, jogging or cycling. One thing that surprised us was hearing bird-calls that sounded very like parakeets that we have previously seen in zoos. We were not mistaken when we saw a couple of them flying about between the trees. Our only regret is that we hadn't brought our camera or mobile phones with us, they were being recharged back in our hotel bedroom. Unfortunately with so much to do in Amsterdam, and only two days in which to do it, we were unable to return to the park.
Lovely. The park was so lively, yet was vast enough for you to find a place to sit on the grass. I enjoyed the small lakes and greenery.
DO NOT MISS IT!!. It's a great place to visit and take pictures . GREAT VIEW and only 10 minutes walking if you're in laidspleen

A must see in Amsterdam. After getting lost on rented bikes for around 2 hours, we finally found our way down to the Vondelpark. Perfect for families who need to tire children out and couples/singles looking for a quiet spot to relax. Beautiful park with plenty of ponds/lakes, greenery and paths to cycle or walk around. There are a lot of dog walkers (which we happened to love) but a lot of the dogs are off-lead and happy to sniff passers by! Lovely looking cafe/pub in the heart of the park with plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Well worth a walk around if you down around the museum end of the city.

Nice green space within the city. Amsterdam doesn't seem to have a lot of green space within the city. So Vondelpark is a nice spot to enjoy some greenery: Lovely lakes with waterfowl, walkers, joggers, cyclists, etc. I always felt a little uneasy about where I was walking because I was never sure if I was in the way of bikes. I felt like I was always looking over my shoulder. But it's a beautiful space.

Beautiful Park to visit. We visited this park while on a recent trip to Amsterdam. Well worth the walk around lots of photo oppurtunities so take your camera. There are food and drink places included , beautiful gardens, the IAMSTERDAM sign and information centres. On visiting Amsterdam for places of ointerest I recommend this.

A nice time out.. After visiting three museums we stopped here for a bit of time out. It is a large park with plenty of room to explore. It seems to be always busy and full of life. Many people walk their dogs here, kids play, people sit. It is beautiful with large grass expanses and mature trees. There are also a number of trees suitable for climbing making it good fun for kids.One thing to remember is the bicycles still move just as quickly thought the park (sometimes even faster than normal) so be careful to stick to the pedestrian paths and look before you cross the bike paths.

Beautiful, full of life. If you like bird watching, go. If you like biking in beautiful places, go. If you like sitting in nature, go. It's a beautiful escape from the city... People exercising everywhere, people just sitting around chilling, rollerblading, biking, running... I loved it
A Great Park to Visit. Well a visit to this park found it to be very clean and well kept make sure you bring your camera especially in the Spring and Summer.

Pleasant lung in the city. Near the heart of the museum district is the Vondelpark, much used by Amsterdammers. It is a pleasing park with large irregular ponds and fountains. In one pond there is an irregular sequence of fountains of varying height and duration that provides great stimulation.If the park were better maintained, I would rat it more highly. The grass could be a little better tended and there were obvious weeds in several places. Some litter and dog droppings diminshed what would otherwise be a delightful spot.Still well worth a visit and a stroll. You could spend a couple of hours exploring the park.
Very large and pretty park. Great park for recreational activities, hanging out, having a picnic or going to concerts! Also recommendable with bikes.

My favourite park. The park is clean and in the summer it's very busy. Sometimes I went trough the bike with my bicycle at night, but it was full of drunk homeless people. So I suggest not to be there after midnight :)
Nice route to the museums. Very pleasant park that we walked through on our way to the Museum quarter to visit the Reichs Museum.

Amsterdam Version of NYC Central Park. Fantastic park. Lots of folks biking, running, walking, playing sports, strolling about. Very kid friendly!!! Great little cafe reasonably priced. Nice retreat after walking the many streets of Amsterdam!!

Relax in Amsterdam!. A friend recommended I went to Vodelpark and I'm glad I did. It was a warm day and it was so relaxing and calm wondering around away from the hectic city. It's a huge park and beautiful.
Gorgeous!. A must for everyone going to Amsterdam. The park is alive with families and people having fun! Don't miss it!
Bring a bike. this park is beautiful and is a perfect place for a bike ride, we rented bikes from our hostel and took them on the metro and then cycled here, it was worth it!

Peaceful Retreat. its worth the long stroll from the heart of Amsterdam down to Vondelpark to get a little piece and quiet. Stroll through the park any time of year. We have done it in spring, summer and autumn plus a New Year's Day stroll and it's worth it every time to get rid of any hangover from the previous night. A cafe right in the middle allows for a stop off for a bite or a drink
Relax and Picnic. It's a big park in the city, you can go after the museum and relax a little be. You can buy things at the grocery store and eat there. Has nice gardens.
A very nice park. Want a nice park to stroll through and take in the scene? This is it! A very peaceful place to go for a bike ride, walk, or just to chill.

a little peace in the middle of the madness. Vondel park is bam smack in the centre and is a great park. Very busy if the sun is shining and it is a summers day. But makes for a lovely walk, with cafes dotted around the park its perfect for a snack break.

Relaxing, peaceful and pleasant. This was a cracking place to visit, it was extremely pleasant to ride through the park with my girlfriend. We enjoyed simply just cycling through the park and taking in our surroundings. It was very relaxing peaceful. Definitely worth the visit if you're cycling around the city.

Get a bike and go!. Get a bike and go! This is a huge park with cafés and it's always a good place to get away from the noise and traffic. We saw a five piece orchestra practicing on a Thursday afternoon, not uncommon to see here in Vondel park.
nice park. lovely park close to park plaza so handy if you want to pop out and have a picnic etc or just chill in the sunshine!!
Peaceful and Lovely. It is an excellent place to take breath during Amsterdam walk. You should visit here at least once. Lovely park.

Refreshing. This park is such a refreshing break from the city. We're not local, so found it fun to plop onto a bench and people watch (or cyclist watch, more like). The greenery stretches for a while, which made it perfect for a long stroll.
Nice park. Went on 28th September, and a sunny day. Took a bottle of wine and had a picnic great to be able to do that. Good to see people sitting about with a big drug bong chilling out!

Running in Amsterdam. As an American, where roads belong to cars and rail trails to pedestrians and cyclists, I found Amsterdam a challenge for getting in a run. Vondelpark is perfect - only bikes and pedestrians. There's a restaurant if you need to hydrate and portapotties are placed around the park. Plus it's lovely!
Precious. The most stunningly beautiful park. A must-see in Amsterdam to relax and enjoy peace and quiet. Recommend: take your lunch to this magical place and enjoy the views while you eat.

A place to relax. place to relax and recharge and also to get to know the lifestyle of the wonderful people of this town.
Well kept; just watch out, as in all Amsterdam, for bicycles which pass at high speed in multitudes :-)
Great for an afternoon walk. Vondelpark is a very nice and peaceful park, we had a nice few hours just relaxing after our long walk around the Rijksmuseum. Wish we had of taken a picnic!

Lovely park. We walked thru part of Vondel Park every day during our stay as it was part of our route to the city centre. We also did a complete circuit on our last morning in Amsterdam. Its very well used particularly at weekends when people meet for picnics and family get togethers on nice days. Its a pretty park with lots of little water features and little paths to explore away from the main paths. There are hundreds of people on bikes at all times of the day, people jogging and doing exercise classes. Certainly not like British parks. No wonder the Dutch people look so fit and trim compared to the English!
nice chilling place. Nice place to make a break from sightseeing and "filling up" your batteries. A lot of people trying to sell you illegal stuff there.

a chilled place. a big park with everyone just hanging out doing their own thing.
a perfect place to chill out with your buddies and knock back a few drinks under the shade of a tree or by a pond.

Lush Green space right in the center of the city. We enjoy going to vondelpark off and on. It is very conveniently located in the centre of the city and has plenty of nice restaurants and eat houses around it. Children love the place. You are more than likely able to see performances by musicians and other artists. Nice place to be for stroll!!
Nice park on a sunny day. Lots to do and see great place for kids, nice coffee shops and food. You can sit and enjoy the people or play sport or whatever takes your fancy

Lovely place for a time-out. Went for a long day-time trip in the park with my boyfriend, and had a lovely time. We were planning to go to one of the free concerts in the evenings as well, but didn't have time for that this time. The park looks very well maintained without looking too "constructed". Even though the weather was nice, and the park was quite crowded, it was still possible to find some peaceful spots. Another plus: When I finally dared to enter one of the portable toilets, I found that it didn't stink at all. I don't know if it was just luck, but I was very happy about it.

Lovely but crowded. We were there on a beautiful September afternoon around 5 and the park was packed! People were having picnics and taking advantage of the fine weather. There were times when we had to jump out of the way of people on bicycles, but other than that it was a nice visit.
An excellent break from the crowds and heat. We ran every morning throughout the park. It was a great break from the heat and crowds. Not as big as Central Park or Hyde Park, but still fantastic.

Bustling. The park is quite large and we only saw a small section of it but then we did stop at the Pavilion Terrace for wine and frites and watched the world go by. It was Sunday and very popular with families, with or without bicycles and trailers, dog walkers, people sitting on benches and rugs enjoying the sunshine. It was very pleasant to relax in the midst of bustling Amsterdam, worth more than one visit if you have the time.
Pleasant green space. A large park with lakes and plenty of benches to sit on. Ideal for a little relaxation after sightseeing and a contrast to the busy tourist areas of the city.
Relaxing Park. Nice space, outdoor park that's very relaxing. Beautiful park, sit on a bench and read for a bit. Tons of wildlife and people around.
Pretty. Nice area for walking. Beautiful park. Nice place to sit and relax. Great place to enjoy nature or just people watch.

Nice space. This is a nice outdoor space to enjoy the sun and the warmth of a lovely spring day. I was kind of hoping there would be more to do there. There seemed a definite lack in toilet facilities for the amount of people that congregate here and also a shortage of places to get food and drink. The ones that are there are soooo busy you have to wait for ages. Its a great people watching space however.

Random adventures to be had. Make sure to check out the park! It was a lot of fun and just gave off the Amsterdam vibe. Was really relaxed and chill and everyone was really nice. Just go up to a group of people and they are pretty friendly. Good thing to do is rent bikes and bike through the park.

Beautiful scenery. Walking through Vondelpark on a warm sunny day is beautiful, the sun sparkling on the lakes, people sun bathing, dogs running around, joggers, bikers and people just enjoying a peaceful walk. Perfect for a picnic or taking the children to play in the park. Would recommend to anybody to take a stroll through here to get away from the busy streets of Amsterdam and enter a peaceful area minutes away from the city centre.

Oasis in the middle of Amsterdam. This was out first stop after arriving in Amsterdam. It is a beautiful park with great people-watching. WATCH OUT FOR THE CYCLISTS! Take time to walk through this park and enjoy the flowers and ponds.

A great park away from the centre of town.. Stayed in a hotel on the edge of the Vondelpark which made for a nice walk into the city each morning and evening. Full of people jogging and cycling, exercising and just sitting to relax by the ponds with fountains, birds and flower beds. A couple of cafes too!
Great escape from the city. If you are looking for an escape from the city...this is a very good place to go. Could benefit from a good food outlet as the ones available are not impressive
Picnic time. Awesome. We had a blanket and some wine on a sunny day. The neighborhoods around are nice too. Just a beautiful, relaxing park.

Enjoyable but nothing special. Walked around for about an hour. Was quite peaceful and enjoyed people watching but having been to the Luxembourg Gardens in Paris earlier this month it didn't really compare.

Vondelpark is Amazing. We spent our first morning strolling the park. Everyone was out enjoying the great weather, all the moms with their little ones tucked in line. The waters and fountains are very pretty, a must stroll if you're nearby.
Great place for pictures!. It's a nice place to chill and enjoy in Amsterdam. Not that far away from the city but at least your ears take a break from the citys noise.

Take a break from the pace of the city. A walk to Vondelpark provided a welcome break having paced around the City sight-seeing. Take an hour or to two chill out and recharge the batteries.
Take some lunch or some beers.
Nice and clean and right next to some of the big attractions, Van Gogh, House of Balls etc....

Not a great park. Stopped by to check out this park .. not sure why it is rated so high as we both thought is was a pretty bad park ...
Yes it is nice to have a park in the city, but it was dirty and lots of interesting people were hanging out .. I would not return here
Not great. Not the best park expected a lot more and found it to be dull and rather boring.There was little there and the water within the park was stagnant and full of shopping trollies.

Picturesque. Vondelpark is an awesome place to visit to just chill and have some quiet time in Amsterdam. It is close by to the Museum Square and Leidseplain areas if you want to escape the hustle and bustle.

A lovely public park. A short walk outside the main part of Amsterdam, Vondelpark is a very pleasant area full of runners, walkers and bicycle riders. It is a peaceful area, with ponds and herons nests. This is a nice retreat from the more hustle and bustle areas of the city.
Beautiful and chilled. We had bikes and cycled around here. It was great and had a couple smokes it was nice and chilled. I also see murr from impractical jokers which was pretty awesome!

relaxing park. Relaxed, calm atmosphere in a hectic city. Nice for a walk around or as we did, to have a nap on the grass. Great to people watch, nice and busy especially on a sunny day with plenty of space to relax.

The green in the heart of the city. It is nice after a day of traipsing about to sit down and have a nice time in this park. Based on the English design of having large open lawns but the Dutch influence of moving lines and much water, it is a pleasant park to sit down and relax in. My only down on it is the amount of rubbish that the poor authorities have to battle with.

Great place to relax. We rode through Vondelpark on a bike tour and then immediately decided we had to go back to see more. It is a beautiful green space and a great place to relax, eat lunch or go for a bike ride. Worth the visit!
Fabulous for cycling, tranquil environment. Great relaxed café at one end, easy going, good for kids, nice healthy food, good beer. A great place to chill out.

The city that stole my heart. This is the most amazing park, in the most incredible city in the world.
Take some truffles and enjoy the ride.
Love the park!. Great place to visit, we enjoyed jumping on some swings that played music and also just walking around seeing people running, walking dogs , riding bikes etc. beautiful park to visit.
Lovely Afternoon. Def go and visit, it's a lovely free park and you can just walk around or sit down and enjoy the sun. Bring a picnic lunch with you to enjoy

Lush!. This park is like no other with its pretty exhibitions and floral displays. You do get a taste and feel for the European way of life here, nobody's rushing around, Young and old are just enjoying the surroundings..

Great park. We only got to explore a little of this park due to time constraints but what we saw was beautiful! There seems to be a lot to do within this park and we would love to return to continue exploring!

Beautiful & serene. Very peaceful & great place to people-watch.
Lovely terrace at Vondelpark 3 restaurant & good breakfast.
Gorgeous Park. I was lucky to visit this park on a beautiful sunny day.Its a park...Erm you can cycle, walk, run, go on the swings, maybe have a picnic
A Great Place to Eat and Relax. We enjoyed lunch with friends at the restaurant and then hired bikes nearby and spent a wonderful afternoon cycling around this wonderful park.
Amsterdam's version of Central Park. Quiet oasis in a bustling city. Thank goodness for separate biking paths so walking was a delight. Lovely plantings, interesting street musicians.

Wonderful park. If you want a place to rest, be in contact with nature, see the exotic dutch parakeets, enjoy a Hoegaarden with lemon looking at the sunshine, this is the right place to go if the weather helps.

Nice and relaxing..... My first time in Amsterdam I stay right next to this park. It never fascinated me at all but it was in Dec 2003. I rented a bike and rode the entire park. It was relaxing and peaceful during the time of Sept 2014. I wouldn't recommend walking to the park. Simply because if you seen one park, you've seen them all.There is random food and drink vendors throughout the park. I guess I was lucky and didn't run into any homeless drunks and potheads. It was kinda busy during the day but there is plenty of spots to sit and relax. I figured there would have been more park benches. Given the size of the park. One word of caution is about the night time in the park. It can get on the shady side from what some locals told me.

Highly recommended!. We enjoyed much to stroll around on a sunny day in the park with a pair of bikes that we rented nearby. The park is not so big if you travel with bikes, so 2-3 hours (picnic time included!) are way than enough time.

Wonderful place!. If you are looking for a place to have a picnic, a walk or just a place where you can spent a few hours resting and enjoying beautiful nature, Vondelpak is the right place for you in Amsterdam! Don't forget to take a picture with the lovely fountains in the park!
Lovely park.. Lovely park, lots going on. Worth seeing it by bike. We used Mike's Bike Tours which were fab: great fun, entertaining and knowledgeable. The cycling was terrifying though.

Gorgeous. I always feel that the best discoveries are made best by accident, of course I would have seen it on a map but to find it on this slow and quiet Sunday morning was special.The landscape is beautiful, the mature trees and slightly turning colours give it an air of tranquility yet it is full of life. Families, cyclists and runners all combine to make it feel like a vast experiment in human movement where peaceful co-existence is almost made by an arrangement that seems organic. There are numerous pathways and areas to sit and relax or sunbathe if the weather is good, you see remnants of parties gathering in the morning daylight, friends coming together to either end an occasion or to pick up where they left. Even the pooches seem to be entranced, one mama pooch had a head cone on and was toddling calmly on a lead while her pup was scampering about, he came around to the front to check if it was her and then ran around the back and jumped on her shoulders it was hilarious.Lots of trees to sketch and fascinating patterning in the bark and some strange growth patterns, this is a place to fall in love with, to fall in love in and to revisit whenever you can.There are cafes and bars and usually an event or two ongoing, such vitality this city has.

Sunbathing to suduko. It was Sunday and a beautiful day, Vondelpark seemed the obvious choice. We walked from Jordaan, had coffee and salad at one of the cafés, then walked a circuit of the park, trying to stay off the main track.What a lovely way to spend half the day.Admittedly, there were a couple of rough looking guys at either end of the park, there are not a lot of flower beds and a dedicated bike track would have been good. On the other hand, there was just so much going on from families celebrating birthdays, kids learning to ride bikes, people painting, to dogs being trained in a roped off section of the park( this was better than watching a comedy show).This park is well used by locals and tourists alike. The was also a "fun/fundraising" run going on. So.....lots of people, lots of energy and lots of people watching opportunities.

Not the world's best park. If you like grass, the occasional flower bed and lake, perhaps bunch of teens smoking pot and homeless people, then this is the park for you.I wouldn't say this park is unpleasant, it makes for a relaxing walk or to sit and rest for a while. But not worth walking all the way just to see it. I'm sure every country has better looking parks for sure.

Good weather there. A huge park in the center of Amsterdam, with a few lakes, cafes, etc. I was lucky to occur there in one of the sunny days of this September 2014, it was possible to sit on the grass having an improvised sunbath :-)

Lovely day at the park. It is in the heart of the city and it is lovely to walk around, ride a bike or read a book. Me and my boyfriend walked a little and then had a lovely picnic, a chill afternoon at the park.

Beautiful Park. Highly recommend a visit. The park itself is huge, has plenty of wildlife, walks, cafes, ponds and areas to sit and relax in. My girlfriend and I spent a wonderful sunny afternoon sunbathing on one of the fields after strolling around the park. It's also a perfect place to sit and people watch as there are always plenty of interesting characters milling around the park. You can also smoke weed there as long as you are discrete and away from any children's areas.

Lovely place for relaxing. In a city of canals, there isn't a lot of open space, so it makes sense that residents embrace places like this. The park is beautiful, with lots of expansive fields, ponds, benches, walking and biking paths, and mostly locals enjoying the outdoors. A nice place to spend a couple of hours to unwind if you want to take a break from the city.

Pretty park but don't go out of your way. I was a bit disappointed when visiting Vondelpark, it is very small. However it is pretty so a walk through if your passing by is a nice escape from the city.

Tranquility in the middle of bustling Amsterdam. If you are looking for a little time out and chance to recharge your batteries in busy Amsterdam, a short visit to Vondel Park will do the trick. Lovely quiet place where there are lazy games of football underway, people eating picnics on mats and slow cycles passing by. It is well maintained and all that a public park should be.

Lovely park. It was nice to get out into green spaces and utilise the restaurants and cafes in the park. This place was a hive of activity and it was fun to see locals out and about doing normal things.

You could easily spend a day here.. This is quite a big park and would take some time to cover it all on foot, if you want to do that, hire a bike! There are lots of space to sit and enjoy the summer weather and a selction of small lakes with floating exhibits.There is also a large statue of Mr Vondel who I believe the park is named after, the inscriptions would have been interesting to read but I do not speak thr Dutch tongue.We only spent a short time here as the rain came on, during this time I did not see a public convenience.
Good. It is not the best attraction in Amsterdam , I had a long stay in Amsterdam so decided to spend there couple of hours..not bad! It's beaceful and saw lots of joggers

Nice place for a picnic. A great little park for a bit of a stroll and to eat a packed lunch. There are plenty of benches. There are also a number of curious if somewhat amateurish sculptures, a bit like very large primary school papier mache projects. The park is named for the poet Joost van den Vondel supposedly the Dutch equivalent of Shakespeare. There is a statue of him in the centre.
Excellent Choice. If you have some hours to spare, go bycicle on the park. The view is fantastic and you are going to feel like a local.
Bikers paradise. We rented bikes for a day and explored the park. Lots of bikes but everybody watches for the other. Don´t forget to bring your own food

I had my hopes up!. Hearing about Vondelpark (pronounced Fondelpark) I had certain expectations to see a beautiful central park like area with many people picnicing and reading on the grass. However unsurprisingly the small paved roads within the parks were filled with bikers either doing it for pleasure or hurriedly passing through to get to work!
Biking through Vondelpark. I rented a bike and biked through Vondelpark on a nice daY. There were lots of people enjoying the sunshine and grass. Is always good people watching
A walk in the park. The park was a little off the beaten track and to be perfectly honest wasn't what I expected. It is rated as one of the best parks in Amsterdam but not much too see.

A Beautiful park. We took a romantic stroll through this park one evening and did some people watching, it is always filled with bike riders, walkers, runners, dog walkers and more throughout the year and we just happened to be walkiing through during the later part of the Summer so it was beautiful and green. If you visit I recommend you visit the park and other parks in Amstedamn.

worth a see.. we really enjoyed going to vondelpark on our visit to Amsterdam. although it wasn't very busy and col (we went in January) I would defently go back in the summer as I can imagine there would be lots going on. its a beautiful park.

Nice Park. Vondelpark is very big, yet quiet, all day long people passing by on their bikes, other jogging, walking their pets, etc. Nice and green. What i liked less was a group of homeless people there in a corner, but what can you do about it.

The most awesome of parks. The Vondelpark is just awesome. You can just lazily pedal round it for a few hours on a sunny day, stop off for a beer or coffee or snack in a cafe / bar, sit and watch the ducks and dragonflies, admire the sculptures. Very relaxing, we always come here when we visit, weather allowing, as a natural stop-off on the way from / to the museums.

Perfection. Beautiful! My favourite spot to relax and take in all the lovely scenery :) ate ice cream and just layed on the grass, even had a cheeky nap! Definitely worth a visit. Bring a picnic!!! I wish I had
Great statues. Brilliant relaxing day in the Park with all the statues and art, great picture opportunities in all directions.

A Quiet Beauty. My Hostel was literally right next to this beautiful park. It;s always alive with people of all walks. Young budding couples, yoga groups, musicians, friends on a picnic and soon YOU! Don't pass on the opportunity to walk through this wonderful place. If your a fan of the outdoors, this is a MUST SEE for you!
Nature at its best. A beautiful park, that seems more natural then planned. Great to see so many dogs and people using it, it gave a good perspective as to who the people of Amsterdam are. Beautiful.
Vondelpark. My hotel was facing Vondelpark. It is a nice place to walk around. Sunday it was very busy and crowded.

Park what is almost two meters below sealevel. As a native from Amsterdam, I often cycle through the Vondelpark. I prefer this park in the morning, because than it is less crowded. It is very popular amongst many people young and old. In Amsterdam many people live on small square meters ( 65 averige ) and have no gardens, so the Vondelpark is used for it. You see people having BBQ, dancing and having personal party' s I like to take a walk around the park and end up having a beer or glass of wine at the terrace of the new restored restaurant Vondelpark 3 what opened in March 2014.

Magic city. Amsterdam is a wonderful city. One has to hire a bicycle there for the true experience.Walking around a big city is always tedious and there is little room for cars in central Amsterdam.Cycling around the numerous canals and parks is a magic experience.The centre city area looks like it is unchanged for centuries.Thank Heavens it was not bombed during the Second World war.!
amazing outdoor space. beautiful park, lots of flowers, cool trees, bridges, lakes / ponds, and activity. great for a picnic / relaxing

Beautiful place to bike. I cycled around Vondelpark on my last day in Amsterdam, and it was so idyllic! The artistic sculptures displayed throughout the park are worth checking out, and it was clearly a popular place for people to meet for a picnic, as there were many people scattered across the grass and lounging near the ponds. The roadway around the park was very smooth, and so would also be suitable for anyone wanting to rollerblade

Free Concert in the Park!. On my last night in Amsterdam, I had the evening open to visit the Vondelpark, which was steps away from my hotel. As I walked in I could hear all sorts of music and found myself in the most amazing free concert! I could not have wished for a better ending to my trip, and enjoyed the night with hundreds of people listening to different music from Opera to Rock!

Park . The park is absolutely beautiful, very spacious and clean. The canals/lakes within the park and around it are lovely to look it. There are toilets and water fountains around the park for free. It is well kept, and the perfect way to spend the afternoon.

What Central Park wishes it could be.... We came here after a visit to the museum. Sat down in the palace terrace and pretended I lived in those days with a splendid glass of wine. The views, the setting and the atmosphere is just great. So wives , after dragging your husbands into the museum this is a great reward.

Big...big park!. Very nice park, very big we couldn't even see it all. A magical moment happened when we wanted to leave: we passed by a lake and a beautiful girl was playing some violin... special moment.
Lovely. The park is so beautiful. We visited this place on a weekend. Just sat around. Would totally love to come back again.

way too big and plain boring. This park was hyped up way too much by people who probably live right next to it. Sadly I found the park quite boring as it's so big and not very scenic. Our parks in England are a lot more picturesque and the wildlife much better. Also more dogs. Also I didn't get run over by a gang of people on bikes. They should offer a separate lane for these people.At weekends they have some bands on where they flog you overpriced beer and offer very little seating. I was pushed around by the rude people here which really put me off. The bands are quite mediocre and not famous, you've never heard of them probably. Also they refuse to speak English so I didn't really understand the schedule so I've had to mark it down. There are some nice pubs and bars in the park which is great however they are way overpriced so I can't really recommend them.

A pleasant reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas. I think the title says it all. A very nice place to spend some quiet down time, especially during the week. Stroll, jog, bike or just simply chill and watch the people go by.
Paradise in the city. We had a pic nic by the lake at Vondelpark and we totally enjoyed it. The place is ideal for that. Also, is really worth it to have a long walk all around it.

Very nice peaceful space for a walk or jog in the bustle of the city. It reminded me of Central Park in New York with the amount of people walking jogging and cycling around it. Head to Vondelpark if you want to take timeout from all of the hectic sightseeing and museum visiting. The park has famous works of art, lakes, outdoor concert space and several cafes for food and drink with in it and the Hard Rock Café and other eating and drinking establishments just outside of it. I was amazed by the amount of people that were visiting it on the Sunday I visited and yet I never felt like it was packed.

It's a park.. It is just a park at the end of the day just like any other. It's not something you should definitely see in Amsterdam but if you have free time I would suggest a nice walk / picnic there (even though they have nice cafes there anyway) Very beautiful but I would suggest staying clear from it at night

Ride a bike and enjoy !!. Really a great place to visit ! I spend an afternoon there with my friends and it was such a sunny day, we enjoyed every minute of it :D Rent a bike to visit, it will be even better !

beautiful park. Beautiful park, nice and flat with good pathways to cycle,walk or skate on. Plenty of areas to use toilets or get refreshments, snacks drinks and beers. Good wildlife areas. Always felt safe. Right in the city with good access.

Just a big park. Just a big park, during daylight it is really nice but at night I don't recommend. I was sitting at the bench with my boyfriend and the bench next to us was a guy absolutly drunk vomiting all the time. We wanted to change the bench but there was the same story.

Rent bikes and ride!. Beautiful park in the city with man made lakes and trails to walk or ride bike throughout. Plenty of spaces to sit and lounge or take things for a picnic. Also has a cafeteria style spot where you can buy snacks and drinks.
Beautiful Park. We cycled through this park several times. It was lovely to visit. The kids liked the play ground stops. Lush and green with pretty gardens.

Beautiful park, close to museums. This is a large, tranquil, beautifully landscaped park, ideal for a walk and break between museums, or a picnic. Frequented by dog walkers and joggers and at certain times of the year there are free lunchtime concerts and other outdoor entertainment.

A Walk In The Vondelpark. Great place to visit for a morning power walk or an evening stroll. Wonderful people watching here and lots of interesting art. There are several cafes serving croissants and lattes for breakfast and good sandwiches for lunch. Spent lots of time here as it was close to our hotel, the Marriott Amsterdam.

Peace. What a great place to dream-off a visit to one of Amsterdam's coffee houses. Just lie on the grass and listen to the bikes chinking by, runners' thuds or catch glimpses of a remote conversation. Was that a heron? Were they green parrots? Is that man really walking on his hands? Is my girlfriend that beautiful? Yes to all, don't worry yourself, the White Knight is fading.

Walk, sit, relax. A fantastic place if you just want a stroll or sit down for a while and relax or cycle. We went there about 4pm. It was warm and sunny. The park was full of people--walking, playing, cycling, sitting down or lying down. Watch out for cyclists--hundreds and hundreds of them were charging up and down the park. Some were getting home after work and using the park as a shortcut and many were simply cycling for pleasure.
very large park. keep clear of the many bikes riding through the park. there is a large pathway where bikes cycle. i have never seen so many bikes

A great location to hang out or go for a run. My husband and I rented bikes and road around this park one morning. I was amazed to see how many people were out running and walking their dogs. This is a really nice park and I would recommend taking the time to pack a lunch and relax.
Gem in the city. we went there on bikes after visting the museum and it was very pretty and a nice cycle or walk through- on a nice day a picnic would be ideal

Great place for a stroll. Best visited in nice weather, it is a great place for a stroll and some people watching. There are at least 2 cafes we know of, and places to get ice creams. Nice to see the wildlife around the lakes too.

Good place to relax or have a picnic. My buddy and I had a rough night before, so we decided to buy some sandwich food and go relax in the park. It was entertaining watching the people and enjoying the birdlife.

A Vonderful place to relax. Just a 15 minute walk from the center, Vondelpark is a great place to take some time out.
We used it as a picnic spot, and wandered around happily for a couple of hours checking out the art installations.
Look out for the high-rope style assault course, tucked away in the bushes.
So beautiful!. People watching here is a must! The park is beautiful and I spent hours sitting there. Locals don't mind if you smoke here, so it's great to chill out and relax.
Nice place to just relax. This park is a nice place to just hangout and relax with your friends or even by yourself and just have a picnic.

Perfect to relax. If the hustle bustle of the city is getting a bit too much, then this is the place to be. Beautiful park with loads of chilled out people, animals, bikes etc. Lots of cafes along the way too.
A piece of peace and quiet. Great park, well formed with lots of open spaces and facilities for kids, teenagers and adults to entertain themselves. Nice deflection from the busy Dam streets.
Nice morning jog. Pretty park for a job outside the busy city streets. Close to Rembrandt park as well for an extended run/walk.
Nice large green area park. This is a nice large green area in the city and you get too see the city day life... lot of people walking and doing sport....
Nice surprise close to the Hotel. When looking at the city map, realized this park was right down the street. Found it to be a lovely place for a morning or afternoon stroll.

Go rent a bike and have a ride around. Good for a walk but could be a long way! Would recommend to cycle round, there are great roads all the way round for cycles. Cute dogs, nice restaurants, great for picnics, stonesthrow from museumplein, go now!
Morning run. Perfect place for a morning run. No cars, no scooters and tropical birds and small rabbits keep you company.

Sweetest little park. We took the opportunity to ride our rented bikes around the [ark, and it confirmed our suspicions that almost anything can happen in Amsterdam! We say puppies hanging out in baskets, buskers doing their thing, massive and wonderful interactive art installations and even a wedding!! It was truly wonderful, and beautiful!

Don´t miss this and book a hotel close by. This is a great part of Amsterdam. Take your bike and ride around in the park. Have pic-nic and just relax. You can find nice spot where you can both have very much people around you or be almost by yourself. It is great going here if the weather is hot and sunny. I also think that staying in a hotel or rent an apartment in this area is good. Because you will live in a more relax part of town and still be fairly close to good restaurants and interesting sights.

Ride a bike around the park. Beautiful public place, many interesting pieces of art, including a Picasso. Rent a bike and ride the park, better yet, grab a picnic and sit somewhere and enjoy the calm.

Beautiful!. Vodelpark is Amsterdams answer to London's Hyde Park, or NYC's Central Park. It's got everything you need, and on a hot summers day it makes a perfect paradise to explore and relax. I visited on a 35° day at the end of July. Ride a bike, bring your own BBQ, Vodelpark is very laid back. I can't wait to go back.
parks. good lungs for the city, and for people watching. not sure about relaxation but you can take a rest there after walking the pavements.

A little bit of peace and quiet. Lovely to get away from the hustle of the city for a few hours. Friendly park with plenty grassy places go chill out. Easy to get to with a number 1,2 or5 tram from centraal station.

One of the best parks in the country. The Vondelpark is a place full of activity, but also a place ideal to relax and kick back. The atmosphere is great, the park is green and pretty clean; it's the best way to get out of the busy city streets for a while. It's walking distance from the city centre, so make sure you include the Vondelpark in your visit to Amsterdam!
