Great park!. I liked this park it was really big and cool sculptures. There were nice restaurants with bars in the middle so we sat outside on the patio, had wine and people watched.
Oasis in the middle of the city. Lovely place to take a break from the bustling city. Very green, with ponds, bike and walking trails. Sit on a bench and watch your fellow park dwellers go by!
Good spot to relax. Nice, well kept park. Full of all different kinds of people. Great place for a picnic, frisbee, soccer, or throw a blanket and take a nap.

A must thing to do when in Amsterdam. Love love love Vondelpark, Hire a bike and cycle round. A must when in Amsterdam. So much going on, nice T-shop, ice cream van and lots of weird & wonderful people mooching round. A great place to people watch. X

Picturesque little park in the heart of a stunning city.. It's lovely to have such a large park area in the centre of the city. My boyfriend and I rode our bikes around in the sun and it was so romantic and just made a fun day out. There are play areas for children, picturesque little ponds with benches to sit and relax. We saw some people doing yoga, some going for a run, some just relaxing and having a smoke or a picnic. There is so much space, there's no sense of feeling packed in and you can wander round or relax for hours here. It is clean and well kept, definitely worth the visit, especially on a Summer's day.

No fondling in the Vodelpark. Clean, nice space. Good for an early morning jog. Went Via I AMsterdam sign which was deserted at 7am. Gorgeous run. Seen a couples of bars/restaurants in the park too.... looked nice enough.
Fantastic place!. Great place to hang for an hour or so. relaxed and beautiful.Many groups of people doing sport there.
A perfect picknick spot. In summer I go sit on a bench during my lunchbreak together with my work friends:) But this is in summer a very nice picknick place.

Silent. Huge park in the middle of the city, very green and lot of water, provides peace and calm to everyday busy routine. Come here to get some silence, make a picnic or just a walk or bike ride. Shadowy and sunny at the same time, warm and fresh, it might be great to visit if you have kids.

Great place to chill and hang out.. It is nice to go there and just hang out with friends and have a picknick. There are also lots of places to have a coffee or some drinks. The Melkhuis has a big playground that makes it a good hang-out when you are traveling with kids.
A nice urban green space. Great place to feel like you are escaping the crowds a bit. This is very close to the Rijsmuseum and other central spots but very quiet and lovely.
Great park. This is a great place to walk ,ride bike or sit and relax with a book!! We took our lunch and just sat on a bench and people watched!!
nice park. A large park.A mixture of cultivated and wild areas.3 cafés in park.In the summer their is outdoor music etc.Nice for just a walk.
Fantastic. It was the first time I thought I might come back here! And I really did - just because of the atmosphere! This park is very nice place!

Nice oasis in the center of Amsterdam!. This is a nice and large park in the center of Amsterdam. There are always interesting things to see and do, just sit on a bench and watch things. It's also fun to just ride your bike through this park. Lots of commuting bikers, runners, and activities like bootcamp. It is kept very clean too!

Great Park - so much to see. We rode bikes in the park and found it to be quite beautiful so we returned to take pics and sit awhile. I have never seen a park this utilized. Every park activity that you can imagine was taking place and it seemed so alive. The thing that was a bit off-putting was the number of pot smokers. While they did not seem to congregate where small children were or near people with young families the smell was apparent and as a person that gets sick from the smell it did make me want to move beyond some groups of people quickly. There was music playing in the park and a number or places to get food. Although we missed the tulip season arriving in July there is a part in the park where tulips are planted in such a charming way. People kept showing up to take pictures in this area. Great place to take a picnic.
Beautiful Park. Excellent place for a picnic, beautiful trees and gardens. You can ride your bike through the park or take a walk. Great experience

An oasis in the city. Great place for a morning run or afternoon stroll. Art is dotted though out the park.Its so tranquil it is easy to forget about the cyclists - DON'T, they use the park and have right of way :)

Excellent city park. Very spacious, lots of things going on and a great place to access nature, chill or just stroll mindfully whilst still being in the city. We loved it! Had our butties here and a beer!Children laughing and enjoying themselves everywhere, but watch out for the bikes ( even if you're on one!) they're everywhere - but Eco friendly and acoustically friendly !It's a great park - enjoy.
Peaceful. Nothing spectacular but a nice break from the hustle and bustle of tourist Amsterdam. Recharge and get back into the race :)
Beautiful park. This is a lovely place. We rented bicycles and rode through the park. It is very peaceful on a Saturday morning.
PARK. Lovely park within easy reach from city centre by trolley. Lots of trees open spaces and water features We were there on a warm sunny day which of course always helps

Very nice park. A great place to go relax on a warm day either walking around or lying in the sun. A little busy, lots of cyclists, on the main routes through but when you get away from them it is very nice.
Great place to unwind. Despite the fact that there is a lot of people, it is still a very relaxing place to be. Very clean and well kept. Nice place to have a stroll after a busy day.
Just like any other park. Nice to walk through as a change from the streets or shopping- good cafe with outside terrace- but nothing special as far as parks go
Beautiful stroll!. It was quite relaxing strolling through the park! Lots of open fields to have picnics at or to people watch.
Very busy. Lots of very young people with many cycling to avoid the main streets. I could see that when festivals were happening, it would be amazing.
Beautiful and relaxing. A lovely large park in the centre of what is a very bustling city. Lovely for just chilling, having a bit of quiet time. Very pretty and well kept.

Lovely park.. Killing time in the morning before returning to UK. Sunny day. Very pleasant park, busy but not crowded given was bank holiday week. Many people passing through the park on cycles/ on foot as there are several entrances/exits. Lots of open spaces and things to see for all ages. Few scattered eating/picnic places also. Very pleasant place and unexpectedly tranquil given the amount of people passing through.
Relaxing. A good place to chill out with a picnic away from the hustle and bustle of the city streets. Interesting artworks and lovely walks. Recommended

an agreeable place. the park is an agreeable place to spend a couple of hours.A good suggestion is to rent a bicycle and go through the alleys breathing the cool air of Amsterdam.There is restaurant inside the park but it close at 17 pm.
Beautiful. Although I was not there with the tulips the park is a Beautiful place in general very relaxing and a nice place to sit relax. Email some friends back. Home

Lovely place. After a couple of days of backpacking this park was a real treat. There were loads of art sculptures from the community all around the park. Upon entering there were students playing classical music for a token of gratitude. We found a quiet place by the stream and fell asleep for a couple hours without worrying about having our stuff taken, and there was a restaurant nearby for a snack after. Lovely.

Beautiful park, near tramline, great picnic spot. We biked all the way around the perimeter of this park several times. Lots of people enjoying the outdoors in the summer. Fun sculptures in the park. Great people watching. Easy to walk around and cycle.

Vondelpark. Lovely Park, Very big. We didn't have time to walk all the way round as it was so big. Popular with runners/joggers. Very calming/soothing. Very clean but then everything about Amsterdam is clean.
A beautiful and fun Park. We came in with the kids and immediately fell to the charms of this lovely Park. The kids had plenty of places to play and climb.

I fell in love with this place. This place is beautiful, the atmosphere is amazing. Everything is clean. I been here during summer so I've enjoyed many days there, one of those days ee hired bikes, and spent the afternoon riding around.
Just loved it.
Beautiful.... ...for long walks! It is an fantastic atmosphere and you wont recognize that you walked an hour if you take the big round.

Pretty. I go running around here and the park is quite pretty with lots ponds, beautiful trees and well maintained park filled with walkers, runners, cyclists. Unfortunately there is a bit under the bridge which is a bit seedy but they don't seem to bother anyone. Dogs are leash free here in this park if that is a concern. A few places to eat and plenty of places to park yourself with a picnic if you wish.
Basic park. Expecting more and after half an hour decided that was enoughBetter things to see and visit if you are pressed for time
another park. yes its kind of pretty but if you've seen one park you've kinda seen them all - not a patch on central park though !
Beautiful park. What a beautiful park. Lots of joggers, cyclists, art on the lawn, pond. Watch out, the cyclists have the right of way!

Disappointing. It was pouring down when we visited, which didn't help, but nevertheless, thought that this park didn't have much to offer, save for being an open space. Not particularly attractive or well maintained

Lovely park. Vondel park was great. We hired bikes, and spent the afternoon riding around. Really bike, and loads of nice spots to stop and chill.
Does smell a bit of weed though!! (comes with the territory i guess)

A great place not to miss in Amsterdam. A large located in the city centre and other main attraction including Van Gogh Museum and Museumplein. Lots of things and activities for you and your family to do or you can just simply walk or relax and enjoy the good weather and peaceful atmosphere in the park.The water park is the attractive place for kids in Vondelpark. Remember to bring your swim suits (which I forgot and my daughter was a bit disappointed).You can easily spend several hours or even an half day there.

I guess you have to go there.. It's one of those things in Amsterdam that you kinda need to check out, of course it's a park and it's not going to change your life, but it's a important landmark, so take your walk and enjoy

Nice family day out. Hadn't heard of the park before but glad we went. For Londoners its a bit like Battersea Park if you want a reference rather than Kew or Richmond Park; i.e. Its not got rare species nor is it wild, but plenty of open space and some wild life. We saw birds and rabbits. Our toddler loved it.

Wonderful park. Vondelpark is a must-see when in Amsterdam. A free experience that won't leave you disappointed. A stroll around the quiet park will leave you calm and relaxed, it's an escape from the lively city of Amsterdam.

Average park - experience marred by drugs. Large park in the center of the city. We had looked forward to spending an evening relaxing and people watching. Unfortunately our plans were marred by the open drug use in the park which polluted the air and made the experience not family friendly.
City fun rain or shine. The perfect place to cycle round on a rented bike when visiting Amsterdam. Great place for families and friends.

Great place to people watch. Great park. Just go there and walk around and people watch. So much is going on from food vendors, people doing entertainment for coins, lovers just wrapped in each other arms. Great place to relax and people watch.
chilled. loved this park went here with my friends sat and had a few beers and a picnic beautiful garden with lovely chilled out atmosphere

Best Part of Amsterdam. Free and fabulous! The Vondelpark is a must-see in Amsterdam. Nestled in the heart of the city's tourist attractions, it acts as an escape from the hustle and bustle of crazy Amsterdam. I would highly recommend visiting here if you have rented bikes as the paths are easy to cycle on and very picturesque.
A refreshing visual reminder of why we all need to exercise. It was liberating to see this park so well used, a hive of activity. Sadly let down by a bit too much rubbish lying around the bins.

Lovely stroll. Lovely park to walk round, there were art scultures in the park. There is walkways to walk round. The park as cafes and a music stadium where they must do live music. Nice and peaceful. They have water fountains in the park too

Great park. I mean it.. I visited a lot of parks and this one clearly stands out.Lots of green grass, lots of water, clean. Flowers, chinese garden.Plenty of space to walk, run, bike, relax, picnic...Very importantly it's not in the middle of nowhere like many other parks but there are shops, musems and other attractions around it so you can for instance buy a sandwich and eat it there.I wish there were more benches and spots in the shadow though.It felt good to be there despite the hot summer temperatures.

Quirky park for the locals. This huge park is well used by Amsterdammers. They have two set areas for BBQ's and at the weekend this is taken full advantage of.There are lots of quirky statues around the park, some floating on the water.The paths around the park are great for walking, and keep walkers and cyclists separate which, considering the amount of cyclists in Amsterdam, makes a real difference!We also found a lot of people sitting quietly at night in small groups, smoking their Coffeeshop products. It just goes to show that this park is for everyone!
Soggy ride!. Hired bikes from nearby MacBikes started off then the heavens opened up. It was fun scorching around Vondelpark during the downpour Honest!

If you have kids in Amsterdam head straight for this lovely park. The Vondel park is a fantastic green space in this lovely city. Great for picnic, riding bikes, strolling, playing, looking at art and people watching. Lots of great cafés and places to play and paddle. Just watch out for the bikes everywhere!

It is Central park of Amsterdam. I always love this park, there are always people biking, hiking, exercising, sitting. It is a must do when you are in Amsterdam, it shows you how the people live in the Netherlands, they like to be outdoors and with friends. This park always reminds me of a miniature central park of NYC. In summer there are free concerts. There is a playground for children and you can rent skates.

Pretty gardens. Had a walk through one sunny afternoon - plenty of things to do on the park Stopped for coffee in one of 3 tea rooms - pity the litter wasn't picked up and you had to pay to use bathrooms !

Chill out park. Simply amzing green place in a crazy city !! what you will see is way better than what i will put in words. family gathering for picnics, bikers spinning around, people enjoying the sun, friends gathering and playing music ...
very nice and very green. if you like parks: go there! lots of water places and in the evening lots of life: all the young people making sports...

Lovely Park with nice eatery. We had a lovely walk through the park where people were having picnics, birthday parties, and even a wedding reception. Others were riding bikes - all ages - or pushing strollers. A nice calm place in a very busy city. We had lunch under the trees at De Vondeltuin and it was very good. We were pleased to find vegan offerings in a park - beet hummus and grilled vegetable sandwich was excellent. They do not take credit cards

Must Visit. This is a beautiful part of a magnificent city, you don't know where to put your eyes. No point in summing it up with loads of paragraphs in a review, if you're in Amsterdam just type it into Google Maps & get yourself there. The walk from Dam Square to Vondelpark is superb!
good place to unwind. very close to our hotel, good place to go for a leisurely strollnice curios all the way, watch out for cyclists and skaters who can be quite fast
Beautiful. This is a lovely haven in the heart of the city. Sit & have a coffee in the cafe and watch the locals bicycle around the park. It is truly a lovely experience.
Wonderful. The park should be renamed to WonderPark. It's gorgeous and quiet.As everything in Amsterdam, the park is very clean.I had a nice time with my girlfriend.

Wonderful park. This park is massive, beautiful, and full of art, lakes and fountains. My partner and I rented bikes and cycled round for an afternoon (cyclists do seem to have right of way!). It's so big that even on a busy afternoon it doesn't feel too crowded. You could forget that you're in the middle of Amsterdam. If you want to see the whole of the park but don't want to spend a whole day there definitely rent a bike. There is also a free water fountain at the entrance near the Rijksmuseum - perfect for filling water bottles.
Very nice park. It is a lovely park with a man made lake. There are nice looking cafes around the park. Just watch out for the bikes, you gotta be quite alert otherwise walking can be risky.

An Interesting Park with Sculptures and Live Music at Weekends. This large park is easily found once you get to the Leidseplein. If you are walking watch out for the cyclists, and particularly the tourists on bikes, as they appear to always have the right of way. There are a number of nice places to eat, interesting sculptures, and a music soundshell with live music at the weekends - see the vondelpark website for details.
Amazing park. So much going on.. We enjoy walking through the park, there's so much to see. There are buskers, ponds and fountains and so many people just enjoying the outside life.
Nice. but when you are used to London gardens you are not impressed, it was drizzle when we went so that might have spoiled it, lovely art all over thoe
Nice..but. So vast space of green area ..giant trees and variety..so many breath taking lakes...good for sport walking, lots of bicycles ..sporadic restaurants...but......crowded

a superpark. Huge park with walks and cycleways by lakes and fountains,several restaurants(we enjoyed a good lunch at expected prices but the staff were so welcoming). Lots of play areas for children.
We spent about 1.5 hours here between museum visits.
Amazing. Perfect place to rest and have to calm down after a day of work, it has as well all amenities for a big park
Wonderful. A park full of interesting sights, perfect place for people watchers. be careful of the motor bicycles.
Adventurous. Can be crowded at times but even then there was plenty of space to have your own little area without being disturbed.
Great ambience. A great place to chill and soak in the atmosphere. Must visit during the afternoon/ early evening to enjoy a drink, specially with kids.

Best Park In Amsterdam. Picnics, walking, meeting friends, cafes, ice creams, music, sitting in the sun/shade, or even smoking some weed. This park is everything Amsterdam represents at once. Firstly, Amsterdam is not known for its great weather. If there is a sliver of sun out this park is full to utilize every ounce of the sun. Who knows when you will see it again in Amsterdam. The park has cafes that dot the interior or edges. Some are gardens are some are upscale cafes. Winding paths are good for walks and bikes can be rented. Picnics and friends will be sitting everywhere. If you have the uncommon occurrence of a sunny weekend you may have troubles finding an empty spot.While not the greatest activity by yourself it is truly a good place to be with friends. Still have a look at Dutch culture to see how strong bonds are made with friends by meeting in the park very often as opposed to shopping malls.

Picture perfect. This famously beautiful park is big enough to get lost in, the perfect setting for a picnic or just a casual stroll or cycle. It also includes an open air theatre, playground and a few food stalls

Great park. Rent a bike and come to ride around the park. It has several places for a drink and a bite to eat. There are several awesome play areas for kids, a venue for performances, and at the moment, art sculpture display all around the park! A must do when the weather is nice! A rose garden and several fountains are available for picture opportunities. Otherwise just enjoy the people and dog watching!

Lovely afternoon!. Great place to head if you need to escape the crowds and traffic and have a wonder around this beautiful park. Around every corner is something to look at, sculptures, fountains, open air music and poetry, cafes and playgrounds.Get the tram down from the city centre as it is a little bit of walk!

Perfect. This is an amazing park. The first night we arrived in Amsterdam, we took a night-time stroll through Vondelpark, and felt very safe, even in the dark. There is a film museum, which we unfortunately did not have chance to visit, and tea houses/bars in the park. We rented bicycles on one day of our holiday, and cycled for about an hour in this park alone - it's huge, beautiful, and there are sculptures all over to attract your gaze. We also noticed there is a BBQ area, that joggers and cyclists flock here to exercise, and the occasional smell of weed suggests a very relaxed atmosphere in general (much like the rest of this amazing city). It is an oasis of calm, not far from the hustle and bustle of life. Now easily one of my favourite spots in the world
Chillout. A lovely park, away from the main tourist area so get a bike and cycle here. It's worth a cycle around and a picnic too. Some really nice lakes, houses and great for people watching.

Great for relaxing & people watching. Spent around 1-2 hours exploring Vondelpark by foot. A nice setting to set down a blanket and enjoy a picnic; especially by the water, and also to find a bench and simply sit and watch the world go by.Dog friendly too so quite a few dogs roaming around. Would recommend renting a bike if tight on time.

Bike it, jog it, picnic it: love it. Need a break from the museums, the coffeshops, the Red Light nuttiness? Take a break from your vacation and wander through the Vondelpark. It's urban park bliss. And if you want to go window shopping, or enjoy overheating your credit card, visit the luxe shops a block or two away from the park entrance.

Great place if the weather is decent. Vondelpark has a relaxing, laid back atmosphere with all age groups seeming to enjoy different aspects of it. I spent around two hours walking around looking at the odd sculptures and simply enjoying being in a natural environment.

Watching and being watched. It is a quite big park in the centre of Amsterdam. Locals come to let the dog out, doing excercises, having picnic or just hanging around. You see all kind of activities such rollerblading, skating, juggling, jogging or cycling. In the summer there is concerts every weekends. When the sun shine, people laying down all over the grass. It is not easy to find a place without people around you. If you like sun bathing among the crowd, this is the place. Watching and being watched. But if you like to see the park self, come early in the morning. The best time is in the spring or Autmn, for the flowers or the changing colour of the trees. In the snow, vondel park has totally different view. The park is easy to find, take tram no.1, 2 or 5, stop at Leidseplein and then 5 minutes walk to the main entrance. From June 15 - August 29 there is exhibition "Art Zuid" ( artwork) junior scattered all over the park. You can have good food in the restauranst in the park and also a film museum
Beautiful park. Lovely park and nice to see some greenery aside fromAll the buildings, really nice place to walk, sunbath or just relax

Wow!. What an oasis! Huge, full of surprises at every turn. Even more fun late evening, full of joggers, families, people just hanging out by the lake, it all felt very safe. Saturday night stumbled into a free concert at the open-air theatre. Great place to chill out when the city gets a but too much.
Green oasis. This is a lovely park, full of diverse activities - children playing, joggers, people sat chilling, others smoking their hash. All very calm - although refreshments exhorbitant!
Worth a visit in between museums. Easily accessible from museum district and worth a visit to relax. I found an amazing number of birds at the park considering its urban setting.
Gorgeous. Go to the duck pond! Record some of it, be patient, See all the people spending quality time. See all the statues. Bring a picnic. Unusually fun.

Nice spot!. Easy to access from the heart of the city, this green space highlights what makes Amstersdam fantastic.
People doing things that make them happy; music, playing soccer, drinking beer and hanging out. Lots of joggers, walkers, dogs and cyclists. Tolerant and inclusive.
Nice art throughout the park...influenced by English garden design. Good to walk...although better to ride.
Recommended

Ridiculously fun. We rented bikes and took a spin through the park, stopping for photos, ice cream, etc. There are lots of people taking excercise classes, families, kids, seniors, walkers and bikers. I loved it.

Busy and good for peoplewatching. This park seems popular with locals and tourists. if you are people watching in a city with so much tolerance and diversity then expect a good show. I saw my only drunkard here from the whole weekend. there was a free live concert happening as we arrived and so eateries were very busy, toilets not very nice.
Green hangout in the city. Walk through the park, play football, have a drink, sit in the grass, for the ultimate city-park experience
Not sure if this is the right park. It was an easy walk. Lots of people and different from what we experience at home. Well worth having a walk around
Beautiful park. This park was amazing! We walked through it and really enjoyed the atmosphere. Restaurants as well as snack areas. Great park for picnics.

Beautiful park!. Such a beautiful well kept park, kept very clean and tidy. A lot of places to explore! My boyfriend and I sampled the local delicacies and spent a good fraction of the day wondering and lounging about here. Maybe this review is little biased in that sense, as it looked like one of the coolest, pettiest places on Earth. We were almost certain one of the streets on the fringes of the park was the most beautiful we had ever seen. Regardless, it is a lovely way to spend a day or enjoy a cycle. It's not too busy either, with plenty of spaces to chill out without massive crowds. Definitely on the to do list if in Amsterdam!
Full of people smoking pot. The park was packed with people. I think there are other not so crowded parks where it doesn´t smell "strange"

Beautiful and charming. A really beautiful place, It's a pity I couldn't stay longer and relax I went on a really nice weather day of June, they were announcing a festival that would begin in the evening.

Fantastic Park, Local Hangout. This is the spot to be. Very popular with locals. Lake, walking and biking trails, tons of grass and trees. Bring your friends and BBQ, dogs and spend the day. I was by myself in my apartment and was invited to join in many celebrations. Great restaurants surround the park. Very busy on summer weekends. Short walk from downtown, museums etc.
Great place. Used by everyone, locals tourists alike, best bit for us was our hotel was at west side and we could cycle from there thru park to city centre, much more fun than tram and quicker

A lovely way to spend a couple of hours. We spent a couple of hours walking/sitting/people watching on a sunny afternoon. There is plenty to see and good facilities in the part if you wish to stop and have refreshments.

Everything in one. It doesn't matter what you want, you'll get it there. People were running, biking, skating, picnicing, playing football or just chilling. The park is kept in tip-top condition as well. It was a pleasure to stroll through and see so many different groups go about their business.

Absolutely beautiful. Take a morning or afternoon to rent a bike to ride through here--it is absolutely gorgeous. Unless you have several hours blocked off, there is no way you can see it all on foot (hence my advice to rent a bike).
Beautiful and peaceful. Very clean and well maintained park with plenty of wide open space and amenities too. If you're looking to relax for an hour or more then this is the place to go

Nice park to spend a long summer night with friends. This is a Nice park to spend a long summer night with friends. Bring your own drinks and bbq and you will have a receipt for a nice evening with your friends

Central Park of Amsterdam. Great people watching. Nice jogging and walking paths and also paths for bicycles. Great spot for a picnic, nap, or walk in the park. All sorts of people come here including those who drink and smoke (both tobacco and marijuana) but nobody was being disruptive or unpleasant.
A lovely park. A great walk out, stop for a coffee, appreciate the art - ignore the sleeping vagrant people, mind the bikes and roller-bladers.
Vondelpark. big park - great to cycle round away from the roads - dangerous if you are a pedestrian trying to cross the path though!

Perfect for a relaxing day. The park is clean and full of interesting plants and artwork, there is a small paddling-pool for children as well as peddle boats and snack food stands. There are plenty of lawns on which you can sit and relax, as well as wide path allowing for cyclists and walkers to pass each other easily.Really lovely scenery for people who just want to people watch, amble, cycle, or sunbathe.

Daily walk through Vondel park. Vondel park is located near Leidseplein and easy to find. I go there for a coffee and wall almost every day. Its always nice getaway from crowd, or just make a break from your work...

A green oasis!. Join the Amsterdam crowd and relax in the wonderful Vondelpark. Enjoy yourself by seeing other people enjoying themselves.There are some nice tea gardens, but you can bring your own food for a Pic-nic sur L'Herbe as well. Do however take away your own waste and disposals.
Great for jogging. This is a great park to start your day with a run through the park with all of the locals! It is also great to come in the afternoon and enjoy the scenery!
BEAUTIFUL. If you are in Amsterdam you must go to vondelpark, it's lovely, it is a purpose built park with lots of atmosphere and its just very pretty and relaxing.
Walk or bike arond. A small and cozy park for those who enjoy art and watching people. Bring your picknick and camera! The most unexpected can happen. Bike around in 30 minutes. It's small.

Rent a bike and ride around Vondelpark . Busy park. Lots of different kinds of people here, good for people watching! We rented bikes and spent a whole day cycling around the park enjoying the sun. Great place for relaxing and enjoying the weather. Definitely recommend visiting here.

Lovely way to spend some time. A lovely maintained park where everyone just wants to have a nice time. Few cafes, good children's play area, lots of wildlife, full of interesting arty things (10ft high KFC bucket with birds nesting in it!!) Even running free concerts throughout the summer months. Probably avoid Saturdays and a bit crowded at the Amsterdam end - very close to the museum district.If it's sunny - just go.

Lost in the park. We were heading to dinner through the park one evening, What a fun experience. Everywhere we walked, people were out biking, exercising alone or in groups, running…park is huge, beautifully green and landscaped. Amsterdam folks are active & in great shape from all their outdoor activities!
Beautiful green lung. Was lovely to walk in the park and to do some bird watching too. Stunning gardens. Pity about the few bums that lounge around in the park.
It's a park. Spent some time here but wasn't overwhelmed by it. Not worth a visit if you haven't got the time. Seemed to be a place for youngsters to smoke weed and nothing of great interest here.
fun, lots of people watching. Nice place to unwind and watch the world go by. Many happy hours spent reading and chilling by one of the many lakes.

Overrated. Nice park. Unfortunately, Amsterdam has a problem keeping the park clean.
A lot of dirt, cigarette butts, ... makes it difficult to enjoy lying in the park. A pitty.

If you want to Relax at a park.... The Vondelpark seems to be loved by Amsterdammers as well as tourists, and it was full of people. Everyone was enjoying a sunny day, dog-walking, jogging, roller-skating, listening to music, people-watching, or they were just lazing about in grass. Free concerts are given at the open-air theatre. Other attractions are the statue of the poet Vondel, the cast iron music dome, the Groot Melkhuis with a playground for children. We bought some hot dogs and drinks and made a picnic out of the day! It was great!

Worth a Visit. Very enjoyable park that is located a little outside of the main city. I think you can get a decent feel for the Dutch community and how active their lifestyle is by visiting this place. Hundreds of people jogging, running, biking, and out playing sports. There are also plenty of benches to people watch or just take in the park itself. Plenty of restaurants inside as well to grab a bite to eat. It is also very walkable in my opinion as I was able to walk all the way from one end to the other in an hour and 1/2 time. I was quite happy to be able to visit.

Tranquil park away from the crowds. Cycled through the Vondelpark and enjoyed the mid summer tulip display (a new breed of tulip they are trying that blooms past springtime). Lovely green space with a large pond, public sculpture etcthat is a peaceful respite from Amsterdams tourist crowds. Great place to run, cycle or stroll.

Amazing Park. This park is absolutely beautiful, I went there as a couple and had a drink in the bar/restaurant in the park, sitting out on the terrace with a view of the park was lovely (quite pricey though). Then walked through the park which is stunning. It is a great place to have a picnic as there are loads of people doing the same. It is big enough to find more secluded spots as well. The only issue is its out of the centre. Definitely worth the travel!!
The Park in Amsterdam. As in most European Cities there is a big Park for people to enjoy,Vondelpark is the one for Amsterdam.Take a walk, barbecue, bike or just seat and enjoy life!
Beautiful park. Our hotel was situated next to this park and each day we walked to the city center via this beautiful park and enjoyed it. Great place to relax!
A break from the touristy crowds.. A great park in the middle of the city , easy to get to and get around in. This was a good break from the crowds that were on the streets.
Great place to chill out. We spent a wonderful afternoon here on our last day, very relaxed, a great people watching spot. very pretty loved it.

Woderful park to relax. A wonderful park to relax and see foul in the wild such as ducks , egrets, swans etc. So quiet and peaceful with fresh air from the trees. Worth a visit to unwind from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam's centre.

Perfect for a picnic. The scenery is lovely with a pond and benches. A perfect spot to have a picnic, does not feel like you are in a city. I would recommend going to a supermarket where the food is a lot cheaper. Supermarkets are dotted around the city, we got a big bag full of food for round 15 euros. We had a walk around and chose a spot near the pond. It was a very nice atmosphere, people reading, relaxing, dog walking and sunbathing. Same as anywhere else in the city, there were lots of cyclists passing through.
Beautiful park. loved everyhting about it. it is beautiful to stroll through the park. there are lovely sculptures along the way. there is also a free theatre with music shows during the summer

Nice after dinner walk. We decided on spur of the moment to walk through the park after dinner. With the daylight lasting to just after 10 pm, we had a nice long leisurely walk enjoying the many sculptures. It is definitely the gathering places with people cooking out, playing music and in-line skating. Would be a great place to picnic if you are spending the day in the city.

Perfect chill out spot. Beautiful! Picnic on the banks, early morning stroll and walked through late at night. Very safe park and a great location. Stay nearby personally found it to be the best area to stay in.
Free park. Place is awesome and free. Like any place on Amsterdam watch those SPEED RIDERS. Place has lot's place relax. Place has also lots place takes photos and video shots.
Really beautiful.. it's a huge park in the city centre perfect to have a long walk and enjoy the peace of the area. You can even have a picnic, sunbathe,go jogging or simply have a rest.

Bustling urban park. We spent one afternoon at Vondelpark on a hot summer day. It seems like a very well designed public space with numerous crossing footpaths and clear signs for people walking and biking. There's an open air theatre and at least two cafe/restaurants. You will also find lots of food and ice cream stands dotted around. It's an interesting place to explore for the eccentric public art, fountains, ponds, bridges and food. We ate and had wine at Vondel 3 while people watching which was lovely.The highlight of the visit for me was Tulip Island (pictured) It's a roofed bandstand in the middle of a pond with a bridge surrounded by tulips. Visitors seemed to be able to pick tulips for a fee. I didn't go onto the island just relaxed and read by the banks of the pond.The only negative I can think of is how busy the park is. We were there on a Monday afternoon so I think it probably gets even busier at the weekends. Although the park is big I don't think it's large enough to hold that many people and still allow some calm and peace. That said, I'm sure if you were determined you would find somewhere off the beaten track. Another reviewer also mentioned homeless people and beggars. I did notice them but they were harmless and they are no more a problem here than any other urban park I've been to in Europe.
great for bike riding. we rented bikes for 24 hours and found this park was great for bike riding. It was a great place to stop and take a break also.

Big and beautiful park!. This park is so big, with lots to look at and explore, from flower gardens, playground/parks, restaurants, concerts and just beautiful art pieces. I don't even think me and my friends explored it all, though we were there for a good hour or so. A lovely park to take a walk, have a picnic or meet with friends. Would love to go back and explore the rest of it.
Gorgeous Park. A superb green space a few hundred metres from our hotel. Great for everyone to visit with such a lovely atmosphere.
A pretty place for a morning walk. A pretty but small park in the city - nice place to walk & sit on a bench to enjoy the sculptures, gardens and people-watch.
Take a breather after the museum. Easy to get to after the museums. Bring a bag lunch and sit near the water. ***************************************************************

Nice park!. We visited the park on a lovely summer's day. The park was busy but a great walk. There are different areas depending on what you want whether an area for the children to play, climb trees or an area to relax as a couple.

lovely park. is the park to visit in Amsterdam, was a sunny day so we cycle all day and had a picnic.There are quiet areas too and the ponds/lakes are very pretty.I close to the museums so a nice place to have a rest after a full dayTake your bike!

Excellent park. We went on a bike tour which took us through Vondelpark.The park was busy with walkers, families, runners and people just passing time.Would have loved to have been able to spend more time there.Take a picnic, bottle of wine and relax away from the usual tourist traps!
Relaxing. Beautiful scenery, relaxing atmosphere, and excellent paths for biking, jogging and strolling. Enjoy on a sunny day and you won't be disappointed.

Beautiful. Me and my boyfriend rented bikes and spent the day exploring Vondelpark. It was a beautiful sunny day and even though the park was busy we found many spots to have a sit down and take in the beautiful surroundings. It's a huge park and extremely beautiful, definitely worth the visit if you're visiting during warm months and whoever you are with. A great place to spend the afternoon.

Fantastic park minutes from city centre. Lovely 'informal' park. Used by locals and visitors from early morning to late at night. Great atmosphere & felt very safe. Perfect for picnics, sunbathing, relaxing, cycling, roller blading & children's park and paddling pool. Fountains, herons and 3 cafe / restaurants all very reasonably priced. Live, free concerts throughout the summer

Lose yourself in this great park. We came to this park during our bicycle tour of the city and this was surely one of our most favourite parts as it was so serene and away from the hustles and bustles of the city.Do visit this park for a lovely quiet experience. Biking here is recommended as well.Amazing place! Wish I had a similar one in my city as well!
Sunny and busy. The park was full of people, locals and tourists alike. Such a great vibe and the best place to spend a lazy summer day
A great way to relax. Amsterdam is a busy place so it's nice to be able to take some time out and relax in the park with a coffee or just to take in the views

Nice place to stroll when it's sunny. It rained several of the days we visited Amsterdam. We strolled the park on a sunny day and it was very pleasant. It's a huge park, with paths to stroll alongside lakes. We couldn't walk all of it, but we enjoyed what we saw.There are lots of sculptures, many of them are silly but fun. There was a gelato stand, which was refreshing.
Quiet and relaxing. Strolled here after the Van Gogh Museum to sit and rest. Lovely grounds and excellent café. Biked throughout it on another day and enjoyed it again.

Rubbish and druggies and homeless. If you have a child, be aware this is no tame city park. Young adults picnic and drink and smoke and whatever and leave mountains trash (and maybe a drug or two) for others to pick up. There are a fair number of rather unwashed characters lurking about. Just keep a sharp eye out . Between the creepy folks mentioned and the free drug culture, it is a wild place at times. The police are aware. When I asked two, I was told that the city council wants the park rules to allow all this but the police try to keep a lid on it.Just so you know. Be careful for your children.

A park with personality. Well located south of the main hub of Amsterdam, Vondelpark was a lovely getaway. Myself and my girlfriend enjoyed a leisurely stroll around the beautiful lake soaking up the sun. Many benches line the walk meaning you are never too far away from a seat. A must visit location if you are in Amsterdam!

Vonderbar!. We trapsed through this park and marveled at its beauty, as well as the variety of happenings throughout it. People were running, biking, watching a children's puppet show, etc. Plus, there were different ponds throughout it as well as a canal by its side. If I lived in Amsterdam, which would be a dream come true, I'd go here every weekend.
calm and serene. What's special about this park is the large amount of birds flying around! we enjoyed walking about and just lazing about on the benches.
BEAUTIFUL. Always a nice experience (especially when the sun is out). Waterways and small lakes in the middle. Rent a bike and explore! DO IT.

The most amazing park!. Heard about this park and decided to rent a bike and ride down there as it was about 45 minutes away from the Centraal Station. Make sure to go on a day when it is not raining! It is a very big park, especially made for biking, walking, running etc. Everyone is doing something and the scenery is absolutely beautiful. A true Amsterdam experience!

we felt like teenagers on our hired bikes!. We had a fab time riding around vondel park on our hire bikes. We hired bikes for 12 euro's for 24 hours and went to explore the city. The separate cycle lanes make it a lot easier to get around and makes you feel safe. Mopeds are also allowed to use the cycle lanes and can also ride through the parks. There was a free comedy and music festivals going on whilst we were there, so worth a google search before you visit to see if there is anything going on.We brought a cake from a local bakery and took it to the park to eat. We found a tea shop in the park and sat and had tea and cake in the sunshine. Overall, we had a great time. We felt like carefree teenagers on our bikes cycling around without a care in the world.

Absolutely love this place!. One of my favourite parks in the world - a haven for everyone who lives there and a chance for anyone who isn't purely interested in the café culture to chill out in Amsterdam. Pretty handy for Leidseplein.
Great place to picnic. We loved the Vondelpark. It's a great place to picnic and to ride bikes through. Go to the nearest market, pick up some bread and cheese and have a picnic.

Nice green space. Nice park very near our Hotel (Hotel Iron Horse). Lots of interesting residential architectural styles. Lots of shops and eateries near by. Know for open-air concerts. We did not see any this trip.
Nice to have a picnic. Nice green place in the city, to do a break, with a snack & drinks.Near the museum square.Thats good for a sunny day

Great spacious city park. Well worth seeking out an a nice day. Vibrant and busy park with a nice friendly vibe (like the rest of Amsterdam). Nice to stroll around and lots of cafés and resting places.

A walk through the Vondelpark. A nice city park with lots of space. Everyone seemed to be there as it was a very hot and sunny day. We walked to the terraced cafe and had some nice sandwiches and a cold beer. Very relaxed atmosphere. It would be the only place that I would ride a bike in Amsterdam.

Can't miss!!!. Visiting Amsterdam without going to Vondelpark is like visiting New York without going to Central Park. It's an obvious must see and a great break from the city. There are a number of cafes, but you can also just grab a book and sit on the grass for hours.

Beautiful Park. We road our bikes through here, walked through the park, and also enjoyed dinner at a restaurant in the park. Don't forget to check out "tulip island". You can cover a bunch more of the park if you have bikes.
Beutiful. This park is gigantic and a great quiet place for a bike ride. There's a restaurant with good coffee next to a playground. Pretty much every parent's dream combination.

Very nice place for a stroll. Beautiful park. We were fortunate enough to be in Amsterdam for the Quarter and semi finals of the World Cup. Watched the Quarter finals at Vondel Park with mostly locals. Awesome time.

Lovely. Stumbled on this place while exploring Amsterdam and it was a good find... Worth cycling round and has a great little cafe called Vondeltuin in one of the corners - great for a morning/lunch time bite to eat as it is good quality and reasonably priced.

City beach. Great place to hang out and have a picnic on the grass. Can be busy but this is part of its attraction as one can watch street artists and play a game of soccer or simply relax in the friendly chaos. Walk on to the southwest it gets quieter there if you prefer. Check out the concerts and performances in the park theater.

Great place to relax and enjoy Amsterdam. There was a lot of activity happening at Vondelpark when we visited it. Though we didnt catch any of the famous open air concerts etc but we still had a good time sitting around the water and getting pictures taken on the "Iamsterdam" One tip: bring takeaway food with you for an impromptu picnic on the grass!

Massive!!. We didn't manage to walk around the whole park, we underestimated it's size for our already sore feet, but the parts we did see were lovely. It's so nice to see so many people out enjoying the sunshine - cycling, walking, sitting on the grass. It's nice and peaceful after the busy city centre.

Large and nice park for picnick, walks or simply a meal. We stayed at a house for a week very close to the park and ended up using the park every day to access downtown. The park has a lot to offer with art, noumerous paths, ponds and restaurants. It is ideal for a walks, workouts and bike trips - and also for a small picnick or a meal at one of the restaurants.

Lovely park!. Loved it! The weather was outstanding, so it was filled with groups of people having little barbecues and hanging out. There's lots of sculptures scattered around the park. Lovely for riding a bike!
So pretty. This park is sick at night. There are less people and the lighting is stunning, Have some extra fun by picking up some truffles :)
Nice area. Very popular area in Amsterdam. Beautiful green spaces, nice paths, vendors sell souvenirs, food and attraction tickets.
Lovely garden for a walk on a nice day. Huge park with gardens, ponds and a few sculptures. Lovely for a walk on a sunny day, or a little bike ride.

Beautiful & relaxing. I went there a couple of times and I had really good days spending with friends just to relax. Thats a park in the middle of the city center and is nice to have just a walk there or sit down for a picnic and even some festivals that might occur in the area....

A beautiful park and fantastic ice cream. A really beautiful park on a gorgeous day. We couldn't find a play park but the ice cream was absolutely fantastic. Some parts of the park were a bit dirty but not worse than you would expect for a large park in a big city.

Beautiful public park; great for biking. Wonderful, large, free public park in southwestern Amsterdam, near the major art museums. You can rent a bike in the nearby Leidesplein area and cycle all through the park. Highly recommended.
Nice walk. Nice walk to get away from the busy streets for a while. Not much to see but peaceful and quiet. Interesting artwork spread around.
Oasis in Amsterdam. Just across Leidsestraat you can enter the most beautiful park with a lot of room and a few restaurants. Good for a walk and a small lunch.
relax. very comfortable relaxing gardens to rest. within easy reach of many places. a lot of people really enjoy their day in this park.
Beautiful Park. The park has lots of ponds and areas to walk or bike. Its quiet, clean and very relaxing. Great place for a picnic.

Beautiful and relaxing. Great park
Best to be seen on sunny days you can enjoy sun light in very relaxing place
Good for families and coupls

Amsterdam's Central Park. Lovely set Park.
Vast greenery. Lakes and wildlife.
Vendors for food and drink.
Lovely for walks and relaxation.

The best place in Amsterdam. There is literally nothing better than cruising around this park for a few hours on a bike and then laying down on the grass in the afternoon. One of the best memories I have of being in Amsterdam.

Clean, quite and relaxing. Walked and cycled this park and it was really pleasant. Also managed an hour lying on the grass too. Seemed very good for children especially on bikes. Lots of couples just chilling out too. This must be on your list of things to do if you visit.
Beautiful Day. We visited on a sunny Saturday and the park was full of local people. It was a nice walk through the park to people watch.
Nice setting.. Lolvey place to spend the day here with a picnic etc. Places to eat and drink though. Too many bike riders. Plenty to see and relax.

good for locals. This park is good for locals but you can skip it as tourist;.
It is a central city part and has a lot of strange people inside.
Nice park. Had I only known that action is on weekends only. Did not find program in English in the net, I am sure it exists. We just walked there and watched other people. Nice picnic place.
A beautiful, huge park full of life!. A very nice park in the centre of Amsterdam full of young people. Try a bicycle ride or a walk there. Then, lie down onto the grass. The sense is awesome!

Lovely way to spend the afternoon. I was there on a beautiful day, so there was a fantastic atmosphere with a mix of locals and tourists. Also had a great photo opportunity at one of the big lettered 'Iamsterdam' signs, one is situated near the entrance to the park. Well kept portaloos as well!

Chill out and relax. Vondel park is just a place to chill out and enjoy. Wide open spaces, cafes and music all make up the place where Amsterdamers like to play and relax. See families on bikes or picnics, lovers, friends are all here...the place is also well policed and so if you need some time out and some open space...come to vondel.
Magical. Just take a stroll at this wonderful park in the heart of Amsterdam. Relaxing and full of life. Great break from all the traveling. Magical atmosphere.

Still Vondel after all these years..... Green break from the hustle & bustle: people watching people being people! Now, if each of us picked up one piece of someone else's litter, what a wonderful world it would be...

Green Space on the Edge of the City Centre. Vondelpark has something for everyone- barbecuing, fitness classes, bars, dog walking, wildlife, play parks, cycling and much more.There are dedicates areas throughout the park for various activities. You'll also free find concerts in the summer months, rollerblading every Friday night and various activities throuhout the year (art in the park, opera recitals and markets on King's Day).Even if you find yourself walking or cycling home through the park in the early hours it still feels wonderfully safe.A point is lost due to 'park poo' (come on dog owners!), smelly portaloos and visitors who don't pay attention to those on bikes (some will walk four abreast, take up the entire path and ignore the bicycle bells).Look out for the highlighter green parakeets- in the winter you'll spot them easily amongst the bare trees.

A happening place. We stayed a few minutes from the park and were able to enjoy the frisbee that we always travel with one afternoon after a day of eating and museums. Even on a chiily March day the park was a lively greenspace.
a sunday stroll. great place to sit and relax and watch the locals, especially on a sunday with the added bonus of free concerts.
a walk in the park. Think Central Park on a smaller scale. Beautiful, peaceful, lots to see and enjoy. There are playgrounds for kids, paths to stroll, and activities taking place.
Amazing Park. Everyone is so relaxed, kind, a lot going on, BBQs, bike rides just fun fun fun soo unique loved it!
great place to chill. A lovely park for a stroll - lots of wildlife about , ducks, squirrels, paraquets and of course locals on bikes.There is a decent cafe in the park with friendly staff.

Green,beautiful walk through this clean park!. We really needed a change from the craziness of city center. Decided to go there on Sunday and enjoyed our walk. Loved the flower market. Picked some tulips for FREE and will take home to grow! :). Sat on a side path and watched the ducks,very relaxing. Do not like the fact that the are always bikes around you. Need to be on the lookout!
Music. The open air stage is a great place to enjoy free music, also the park is great to wander around, have a pick-nick or a drink. You can barbecue on different spots there.

what a beautiful place to relax. We walked throughout the park, taking in the sights and sounds, the people and the wildlife. We felt it was a peaceful & tranquil area. The only draw back were the public conveniences dotted around. The small portaloos we found were out of place and perhaps more permanent fixtures around the park would have made the experience a little more enjoyable.

Beautiful park. Awesome place to chill and hang out. The place is full of all sorts of groups as well as families. There are couple of restaurants in area and people are also selling cold drinks straight out of bags filled with ice.
Okay if the weather is good.. Dodge the cyclists and find a quiet spot. Took a picnic and relaxed for a couple of hours in the sun
Fantastic Space. Try not to get run down by grumpy Dutch people on bikes. Although 99% are friendly. Look out for free music events.

So nice. We went and spent the morning here. It was beautiful. We walked around for a while, admired the flowers, water and art. We had tea at a cafe on a pond. It was so nice. Make sure you go here even for an hour.

What an amazing park. We were so pleased to ride around Vondelpark and to spend a Sunday afternoon here. There were many playgrounds for children, it was completely buzzing with people and bikes everywhere.

Beautiful Park. We went for a lovely walk around the park after visiting the Van Gogh Museum. Very pretty with lots of people walking, running and cycling making it have a lovely relaxed atmosphere. Had a spot to eat in one of the cafés in the park. Well worth a visit.
Chilling. Had a great time sitting in the park with my wife...reminded me of hanging out in Central Park. We would definitely return however had a difficult time finding it...

Lovely clean park. This park is beautiful and very clean. It is the perfect place for a sunny day in Amsterdam. There is a cafe on site that isn't very cheap but the toasties are top class! There are porta-loos dotted around the park but they look well maintained (I didn't actually use one though as there was a toilet round the side of the cafe). There are a number of little parks for children to play in. The park is huge and even when busy it still feels peaceful.

Perfect Place to Spend a Day. My wife had heard of this park and really wanted to check it out. We took the tram there. They have a large stage in the park and a band was setting up when we arrived. It was raining a little but nobody seemed to care. The weather was great for hanging at the park and having a few heinekens while watching live music. The Park reminded us of central park in NYC. Its own peaceful haven in the middle of the concrete jungle. We will definitely go back to this park when we return to Amsterdam!

Lovely, expansive, great for people watching. Not much else to say in addition to the other reviewers--this is a lovely park in the middle of the city. It's huge and a perfect place to hang out and people watch. You'll see some dogs off leash, but most if not all will be terrifically well behaved. You'll probably have to worry more about the many cyclists, skateboarders, etc. that will zip by you on the paths--but that won't be a big deal as long as you stick to one side and listen for the familiar bike bells. Keep your eye out for a handful of large sculptures throughout, including a Picasso.
Expected more. Its just a park, I think I expected more. I went in december and it was very cold. Maybe it's nicer in the summer.

Very pretty. Plenty of green space, interesting sculptures, nice water features and parrots flying amongst the trees, along with other nature to boot.
Seemed very popular with cyclists, but was very accessible for walkers as well.

A place to relax. Don't worry if you have walked a lot during your stay in Amsterdam, take a bike and go to the Vondelpark and you'll get immediately new forces. There are some areas for children where they can play under your supervision and you can relax reading a book or simply doing nothing

A great green space to take stock and reflect and to rest your sightseeing feet and blisters.. This is a great place to just sit and rest or to have a game of football . it is a well used park by locals who picnic there and for tourists alike. There is a restaurant and it is a great place to sit by the lake with a drink and very trendy. It is a energising park and well loved by the locals. We spent a couple of hours just taking in the scenery and took another hour to amble around and another hour enjoying a drink at the outdoor terrace area of the restaurant watching the people go by on their bikes, feet and skateboards. I loved this energising space.

Like a mini Central Park. . Vondelpark is absolutely beautiful. Was on the off chance we decided to go and we ended up hiring bikes. We cycled around vondelpark for hours. Definitely recommend it to any who has a spare day in the dam. Made all the better by the sun being out.

What a great place to spend a spring afternoon en route from Kenya to Kent. With three colleagues we made this visit on A lovely cold spring Saturday afternoon in February en route from Charity Develoment Business in Kenya to home in Kent.We had a day to spend and enjoy the layout of the gardens and the tulips in early bud with other bulb flowers beginning to emerge after the long wet winter.A lovely place to be to walk and relax and certainly worthy return visit
Vondel Park. Quirky and cool with loads of statues and lovely gardens as well as places you can shelter from the rain
beatufil park. take your bike enter the park en smoke the best what you can do in amsterdam the hole day rain rain you be crazy otherways

Sunny time at vondel park. We rented bikes and enjoyed a sunny day at Vondel park. Great opportunity to have some beer, cheese and relaxing time near the lakes and fountains and ride the bikes in between

Beautiful park. We walked through on a Sunday and it was ful, of people enjoying the outdoors. If you want to rent bikes with young kids but are concerned. Bout doing the biking in the streets of Amsterdam, here is a great place to do it!

Great for Families and Kids. Since we recently purchased brand new bikes and didn't quite know how to ride them the local bike shop owner told us to practice at the nearby park, Vondelpark.We walked our bikes, with newly installed kid chairs to the park and hopped on once we entered the park. There were bikes everywhere and the tracks were full so we took our time and made our way around the entire park. We saw a large cafe nearby, Groot Melkhuis café that had a large play area for our kids to let loose so we stopped, ate our lunch and had a cup of coffee at the nearby tables. It was great, we got to relax and watch them run around and make new friends for nearly 2 hours because they refused to leave. Two ice creams and another 1/2 hour riding our bikes around the park we headed back into the city, experts at bike riding and fond of Vondelpark.We'll be back soon for more riding adventures!!

Grab a bike and ride around!. On a sunny day, rent a bike and ride around this park! Then take a break along one of the lakes on the grass, have a look at the modern art sculptures or stop at one of the bars. Relax!
Feels like Home. It is just like central park but only a bit smaller. Great and friendly people, very clean and a nice are to do some early running.
Very nice to cycle around..... Great way to see locals relaxing on a sunday,, suggest a bike ride there , around it and then off to the Rijks Museum !!

Homeless and drugged out ruin park for kids.. I took my 9 and 7 year old boys to this park to relax and possibly to find a playground. Other than feeding the ducks, which they did love, I found the park to feel unsafe. The number of homeless people and people on drugs was overwhelming and I didn't feel like my kids could run around safely and enjoy the park. If I were going for a run or bike ride, the path looked awesome. But if you are going to spend outdoor time with your kids, I would skip it!
Really beautiful, full of life. Lovely park with lakes and food vendors, a quiet retreat from the busy city and bikes. It was quite busy but theres plenty of space for everyone.
Beautiful park.... A very beautiful part of Amsterdam - a must to visit. Very tranquil and peaceful. Lovely for a leisurely walk.

Beautiful park!. What a lovely place to come and sit, chat with friends, drink and watch the day go by. We spent a few lazy afternoons here eating, and enjoying the peaceful yet bustling atmosphere. A far cry from London!

Peaceful break. A good place to get away from Amsterdam traffic (you still have to watch out for bikes) and enjoy a stroll like the locals. It was a good contrast to the museums and buildings to sit in the shade in the park and enjoy our picnic lunch. It is a well-designed urban park with ponds, trees, natural areas, artwork, and people just enjoying themselves and relaxing.

Chill in the evening. Do visit the vondelpark, situated about 4 KM from Dam Square. A team may be boarded from dam square for reaching it. In the evening, it is full of local people jogging, talking and enjoying. A supermarket is nearby from where u can purchase a beer and relax in the garden. A very good place for seeing the local culture and enjoying a picnic.
Calm & Tranquillity in a Bustling City. Gorgeous open park. Relaxed, lots of lovely friendly people, safe, child-friendly....just like Hampstead Heath in London.

Take time for a picnic. We were in Amsterdam for 5 days in late June. The weather was perfect and we walked through parts of the park a few times. On our last day, a Saturday, we bought some cheese, meat, bread and wine at Markt and had a picnic in the park next to a pond. We so enjoyed hanging out with mostly locals and their dogs and soaking up the sun. There was an ice cream truck so we topped off our little picnic with ice cream. Vondelpark is a great break from exploring the city.

Beautiful in the Sunshine!!. Well worth taking a stroll around this beautiful park in the south of the city. Really pleasant and it seems everyone in Amsterdam goes here to enjoy the scenery and sunshine.We stopped at a café in the middle of the park worth going upstairs and enjoying the views from the upper deck while having a beer or coffee.
Lovely and vibrant park.. Vondelpark is celebrating 150 years and there were plenty of activities to mark this landmark. Free entertainment, including a free concert, and a free lunch!
Peaceful. This was a lovely park with loads of water features, bike tracks (of course), open grassy areas and some very weird sculptures. Loved it.
happening park. Beautiful art scattered throughout, ability to exit the park to grab a bite, beautiful people biking and walking, Dogs and families having fun, yeah I likey.

Pretty Park in the heart of Amsterdam. We rode our bikes through this park which was very enjoyable as the streets are very busy and the local bikers very aggressive. I don't think it makes for an enjoyable walking experience as there were many other bikers doing the same thing. There was a temporary art exhibit which was pleasant to experience along with the lovely gardens and fields.
Nice relaxing walk. Spent a couple of hours around this area, when the weather is nice its lovely to stroll around and take in the sights

Vondelpark very large. It is clear the Ameterdammers enjoy their park. If you want to stroll in the park you need to have a lot of time. We discovered that the park can be very tiresome if you loose your direction.There is not many signs to establish where you are.On a cool evening there were a lot of people walking and socialising in the park.

The best part of Amsterdam!. Loved this park,it surprises at every turn.And a good idea the sculptures act as markers on the map to where you are as very big park.So many young people having BBQs and enjoying themselves and people of all ages on bikes skateboards and skates!
Vondelpark play spaces. Can someone tell me where the vondelpark tower is located? what about the tree house? Any specific directions would be very appreciated! The park is great...
Giant Park. walk, ride a bike, watch people, watch the birds, view pieces of art, listen to music..this park has it all..great way to relax
good place to chill!. its a lovely and large park and nice for a wander and a people watch or even in our case just to chill on the grass!

Great for a run. I went for a morning run around the Vondelpark before checking out of my hotel, which was a mile or so away. It's an excellent escape of a different sort of beauty than Amsterdam already offers.
An oasis. Huge park. Was very close to the hotel i stayed. Loved it. Breath of fresh air in the oasis of green patch.
Great for jogging. Great for jogging in the morning. Nice weather in this time of year. No up hills or down hills. Wide lanes for either bicycles and joggers.
This is where Amsterdam comes to relax. This is a very large park, well-maintained and well used by locals and visitors for exercise, relaxing, eating lunch, etc.

Chill out and people watch. There's not a lot to add! It's a lovely park, wander around, sit on a bench, watch the world go by and talk nonsense with your friends. A nice sunny day helps. We watched a group practicing acrobatics, not a show or anything, they were just doing it.As with everything Amsterdam, keep half an eye open for the bicycles when you're on the paths.Bonus, if you're a cheapskate like me, it's free!
Put this on your list. Thoroughly enjoyed this experience. Queues are bad there so pre book on line, very easy to do and saves a lot if waiting around!
Must see!. Beautiful park. We didn't even see the whole thing as we got distracted by the restaurant that had a great patio. We only had wine, but their food looked amazing!

Give yourself a few hours to walk or bike around the park.. This park has been compared to New York's Central Park. I've never seen as many people in Central Park as I have on a warm day in Vondelpark. This park is near the Rijksmuseum. Rent a bike at Mike's and ride around, or just put on a comfortable pair of shoes and stroll around. There are a few places where you can stop and get a beer or a glass of wine and a snack.

Not Sure. We had gone to the Hard Rock Cafe and the entrance to the park was across the street so we decided to explore the park. When entering the park there was garbage scattered all over . We encountered a number of groups of middle age men that looked to be homeless drinking beer. We did enjoy some parts of the park but we did not stay long. Maybe on another day things would be different. I have read other reviews and people seem to love the park. I would say give it a try.

Sweet park. This park literally provided a great breath of fresh air one freezing trip to Amsterdam. I'd no idea it got that cold. It was a nice contrast to the crowds and the looming buildings around central Amsterdam and right in the middle is a café which looked good though we chose not to use it. We had a good long walk around the place before heading out to a quite different part from where we came in, and had a coffee.

Not as good as five years ago. I have visited the park several times over the last 30 years and recommended this as a place for our friends to see. What a disappointment, there was litter everywhere, far too many cyclists going at great speed. Many benches had dirt or rubbish on them and it was generally rundown. There were many drunks and more drug taking than we saw anywhere else.We visited the cafe to get some light refreshment, and met with the worst service in Amsterdam. No light food only meals, at 3.30 in the afternoon. So we left.

Peaceful park great for kids. It's just a short walk way from the main shopping area. We were traveling with our 10 and 12 year old and they can only take so much shopping in one day. We took a couple of hours off and strolled through the park. Last time I was there, you could rent inline skates. This trip, I could't find the rental shack. Nice place to unwind and refocus.
Very nice park. I loved cycling round vondalpark it was very nice and clean worth going to see if you visit Amsterdam

An enjoyable green space for free. Right by the museum area of Amsterdam is a lovely park where you can picnic, hang out, or enjoy a romantic stroll: all for free. There are lots of interesting details, from charming bridges to funky statues. And of course the requisite friendly herons. If the day is sunny, definitely get out of the museum and take in the greenery!

A beautiful inclusive park. The park is a must visit on a warm day. The park is excellent for cycling and resting up around the many modern sculptures or ponds. The park also offers two cafes.The park benefits from a good mix of tourists and locals alike.

Amsterdams own " Hyde Park". Vondelpark is the ideal place to take children on a summers day.It has lakes,paddling pools and a childrens playground;all ideal for active children.the park also contains a bandstand and open air theatre,where you can listen to concerts and watch plays during the summer months.It is also very popular with joggers and rollerbladders.The park is also home to a wide variety of wildlife including squirrels,ducks,parakeets;and even cows sheep and goats grazing in the pastures.

Vondelpark. The sun was out and so were the people. From a lazy afternoon by the lake to mates with bbq's to learn to dance Swing or Salsa, this is the place to spend a sunny Sunday. And it's all free.

Just sit on a grass and enjoy. This is one big park, with small ponds and it's really nice to sit back and really enjoy after a hard day of walking around the city. There are bathroom facilities and there is a small shop in Vondelpark itself so you can buy some drink and snacks. Also there are a few stands with hotdogs and other similar food. One hour maybe two is more than enough for visiting it but you can stay as long as you want to enjoy.

Beautiful park. Very big, lots of different sections with lakes sometimes performances, and quiet sections further into the park where you can relax. very beautiful and a lively place on the weekends.
Lovely Picnic. Huge park. We bought cheese and wine and had a picnic in the park. It was a lovely afternoon spent by the fountains.

Just a nice park. Its a nice green park thats all.If you go on a sunny day i guess it should look nicer than when we went, gray and raining day.it just boring.As for the good part there is a almost hidden "I amsterdam" billboard that you can take a photo with as the one in The Rijksmuseum (National Museum) is so crowded you cant really take a photo there.Another must tip:Download amsterdam city google maps to you phone so you will see where you at in Amsterdam offline,( any time no need for internet connection)Together with the Tripadvisor you get to see the best places of what Amsterdam has to offer and how to get to each one.
Good walking. Good place to see the locals, few tourists are there. Large park (for Amsterdam standards), We had a couple beers at the restaurant at people watched...But it is just a park.

True Beauty At a It's Best. Try to plan your trip to Amsterdam during tulip time. This attraction unfortunately is only open during that time. The flowers are everywhere along with bridges & fountains & music. Don't miss going here.

Stroll though the park -I amsterdam sign. Took a stroll through the park. It is long and narrow, and I didn't walk the whole thing but enjoyed what I did see. Lots of cyclists (of course) but not many joggers. Saw a beautiful lake and monument. There is another I AMSTERDAM sign here -there was no-one else there when I went (10.30am) so I was able to get great pictures by/on it! Much less crowded than the famous sign in Museumsplein, where there are people EVERYWHERE and it is impossible to get a shot without people in it.I'd recommend visitors to take a stroll here -even if only half an hour! It's only 5 minutes from Rijiksmuseum so come here after/before that!

Walk through it all.. We visited the park a number of times during our recent visit to Amsterdam to take in a live music series that was occurring at the outdoor theatre. It wasn't until the last visit that we decided to walk through to the end of the park. It just kept getting better and more interesting. One of the better big-city parks we have visited.

I've seen better city parks.... If you only have a short time in Amsterdam I wouldn't recommend this park. Unless you really need a time out from all the hustle bustle I wouldn't bother. No interesting statutes or pretty landscapes only a boathouse cafe selling rubbish fast food and beer. Besides the usual bikers, joggers, etc., it's full of the party tourists looking for a place to drink or "smoke out". Average experience at best.
Check out the claiming structures!. If you have kids under 10 years old, find out where the climbing structures are and go there! The park is amazing, you could easily spend half a day there.
Nice for a stroll. Large park in museum area. Many benches to sit on when tired. Food trucks for snack. Nice for a relaxing afternoon.

Loved it. This is the place to mix with the locals & just relax! I suggest renting a bicycle, packing a lunch & enjoy an afternoon here. The summer is filled with free concerts too! It's a nice break from the hustle & bustle of the city.

Beautiful.. We stayed in a hotel a 20 second walk away and walked through Vondelpark every day. I even joined in with the runners one morning at 7.30am and i've never seen so many people so lively. From dog walkers, cyclists in suits on their way to work, and even people on roller blades, there really is a sense of community in this park. Definitely a must see when in Amsterdam, especially when the sun is out, there are people having BBQ's and some people sleeping next to the lakes after a long day in work..

must see. Great for rest, walk, wicnic. You can drink beer and have a grill in the park. There is a restaurant and amphitheatre where there are free concerts all summer almost every day. Programme is available in the park. There arealso bars where you can buy a beer and some snacks. Chill out.

Filthy dirty with weeds everywhere. Walked around this park on our last day in Amsterdam.Amsterdam is a filthy city with rubbish and dirt everywhere and this park was no exception.There were drunk stag parties drinking, fast food rubbish, overflowing bins and stinking nettles and weeds everywhere.Poorly maintained park that needs some serious attention

Superb!. Fabulous open park with cycle and walking routes all around. We had a lovely morning cycling around in the relative safety of a park rather than a busy road!Beware of the very expensive cafes/restaurants in the Vondelpark itself - you are better off going elsewhere for food!

Beautiful park in the centre of Amsterdam city. Wonderful place in the middle of the City centre, mainly visited by locals and experienced tourists. Very beautiful, especially in spring and summer. Open air theater often provides great free concerts mainly at the weekend.
Iamsterdam. Nice park with Iamsterdam sign mostly free of tourists. Not fat from museum square and not so far from city centre.

Needs to be cleaned up.. Sunny day, plenty of folk out for a bike ride and a walk - and ample opportunity for people watching. Characters welcome!However, grass strewn with cigarette butts, cans floating in the water, trash everywhere and large garbage dumpsters sprinkled around on the grass. Guess they hope the public will do the trash collection!
A lovely space in a busy city. Quirky, lots of sculptures and features make this a nice place to visit while you can take time out of the hectic pace of Amsterdam.
