nice spot but they should tidy up more. a very nice spot and you can have free entertainment here we've been lucky to see a symphony concert and a reggae one
don't miss the suburbs around the park very beautiful architecture buildings
Relaxing!. Take some time to enjoy the day. We sat out in the park for a few hours and watched the day go by. Great for people watching, and just slowing down.

Beautiful!. A great place to go for a run, picnic, or people watch. The paths are wide for runners and bikers and the large amount of well-behaved dogs make the park that much more fun. A definite must when visiting Amsterdam when you need a break from sight-seeing.
Great place to stay and chill. Cool place. Definitely you will to visit the park and chill, drink, smoke, whatever you like. Kind of Amsterdam's Central Park.
Nice place to relax. A lovely open space, lots of interesting sculpture and cafes to sit and watch the world go by. A place to take a welcome break from the hectic pace.
Get a bike first then head to Vondelpark. If you have the time available and if its a sunny day then renting a bike or walking to visit vondelpark as part of your day is a must for relaxation.

Open space, but few playgrounds. The title says it. It is a very popular park with people in their teens and twenties, but there are very few amenities for younger children. A couple of nice places to stop for a coffee or a drink.
Beautiful walk!. Such a lovely park, however only one place it seems to hire a bike. Maybe find somewhere else (loads in town!) and bike there. There's lots of art and lots to see.
an heaven in the busy city. it's such a calming nirvana - just take a blanket, some food and bottle of wine or beer, and enjoy the green nature. a MUST in Amsterdam.

Fantastic Lazy Day Walking. Amazing views, places to get a drink. Big enough to seclude yourself from everyone if wanted. I have walked through in cold and warm weather and it still looks amazing. People running, walking, bathing, meeting friends. Perfect for everyone!!!!!
A gorgeous park. A wonderful open space, lots of cyclists and roller bladers, great sculptures, occasional art exhibitions.
Pretty park. Shame about the rubbish.. Beautiful surroundings with some gorgeous views and even a stork's nest, but there was a lot of litter and never-ending cigarette butts on our visit.

charming park. managed to cycle few rounds around Vondelpark ;D very entertaining location.. like most of them in Amst ;D
very nice place but littlebit busy on weekends. Some live shows with all kind of music. Feels very safe. Will visit again but on less popular times ;D

Fantastic park!. I stayed in Vondelpark during my visit to Amsterdam, and it was fantastic! Having such a huge and beautiful park right outside my window and right outside the doorstep really added to my experience of Amsterdam. There is also an I Amsterdam sign in the park, and it is a lot less crowded than the one in Museumplein. I would recommend going there for photos. Beautiful ponds and trails, this place is a great place to walk, jog, or bike. Also, a great place for a picnic!
Vondelpark. Rent bikes and go to Vondelpark!! It's beautiful and you can spend hours there, a nice peaceful break from the busy city. It's a splendid park and a great place for a picnic.

Boring common seaside resort.. Nothing but pubs and souvenir shops. Nice lake, no beach, but you can see those anywhere. The maze area was quite pretty but not worth the drive to the area. I suppose we still expect a oldey world sort of Holland with windmills etc which no longer exists.

Nice park in Amsterdam. This is a nice park in Amsterdam that has lots of grass, lakes, some places to buy snacks and drinks, a small outdoor theater area, and looping jogging/biking paths. I saw a lot of people on bicycles, joggers, walkers, people just laying out on the grass.It was perfect to hang out and chill at, and on my second trip to Amsterdam, my bf went for a jog in the park while I went for a stroll. And afterwards, we had a little picnic with some food we bought from Albert Cuypmarkt. :)

Absolutely a must see. Had an awesome time walking around the Vondelpark during the afternoon. Very beautiful scenery and a great loop to walk around with a few hidden spots to sit at. I would also recommend renting a bike and riding through it as well.

If you are backpacking on a budget, this place is a godsend.. A park well worth a visit, events going on every night we were there. Amsterdam is too expensive and this was a godsend. Staying three nights in the first city of our backing packing across Europe tour meant it was expensive to have a few beers on a budget, or even eat, as half a pint of beer was knocking on 7euros. The park celebrated it's 150th anniversary and we witnessed a good band with a busty singer entertain the crowd. Lovely stuff.

Gorgeous park in the summer!. Brilliant for cycling as it is really flat! It's a really lovely, busy park full of people doing different things.. picnics, cycling, jogging, even yoga classes! Wish we could have spent more time here.

go for the quieter areas. wonderful park. Can be crowded and with the bbq's look like a refugee camp but the mood is very mellow and pleasant. Skaters should join the Friday Night Skate which starts at the big white house

Big park sometimes with stage performances. The park is good to chill at, hang out with friends, take a stroll, have BBQ, read and nap...in the summer there are also a series of performances at the stage.

Great place if the weather is decent. Vondelpark has a relaxing, laid back atmosphere with all age groups seeming to enjoy different aspects of it. I spent around two hours walking around looking at the odd sculptures and simply enjoying being in a natural environment.

Great park. We hired bikes on the Sunday of our trip and cycled from Centraal station to Vondelpark. The park is lovely, the paths are wide enough to accomodate cyclists, joggers and walkers, it was great to cycle round it. We had lunch in the cafe at the side of the park, it was lovely and the highlight was getting my picture taken at the i Amsterdam sign in the middle of the park.
A lovely green space in the heart of the city. Within walking distance from our hotel this was a lovely large park to escape from the hustle and bustle. Beware of the bikes!

Always something to do! Free and soak up the atmosphere!!. Not having any plans we decide a day through the Vondelpark would be a good way to enjoy the weather and the gorgeousness park. We were not let down we managed to catch the last day of the Open Lunch Theatre last weekend and were treated to an afternoon of Brazilian themed music. A lovely afternoon, sun shining and mixing with all cultures enjoying a chilled laid back afternoon. A few chilled beers, my other half and not much could be better than a perfect afternoon. If you love watching the world go by and people watching, take a wander, grab a bench and enjoy. We continued our afternoon by some pics with the Iamsterdam and a few more drinks in the local cafe/bar, the Blauwe Theehuis. What a great day!!!

Nice Park. It's a beautiful park with nice fountains and walkways. Early in the morning, you have to be careful walking because so many Amsterdamers commute through this park on bicycle. TIP: The "I AMSTERDAM" sculpture is present both in this park and at the Rijksmuseum. The sun is far superior for photos in the park in the morning and it is less crowded....much easier to get a picture.

Relax in Amsterdam. The Vondel park is so lovely to walk around. There are many entrances to enter from. Many tourists know the Leidseplein area so you can cross and enter after the casino . The vondel park is lovely to ride a bike around or walk. There is a large cafe and playing areas for children. In the summer you will see the park full of sun bathers picnic spots and music.

Morning walk and hangout. Vondelpark is an amazing place to relax and to take a long walk, we thought we would just go there once in the trip but we couldn't resist ourselves and went another time a day before we left. It is definitely a MUST!

Pleasant greenspace in heart of city. I like the Vondelpark. I tend to wander round here when in the city - it's a refreshingly large space in which to escape the crowds & more touristy spots. You do need to keep your wits about you for the multitudes of cyclists, tho'...much like Ams in general :0)

Nice park to stroll. Nice park to stroll, but be very aware of the cyclists. I was fortunate to visit on a very clear, sunny, cool day and leisurely strolled and people watched. There is adequate spaces to stop & rest, food vendors to get a snack, and on the day I was there, the traveling I Amsterdam sign was visiting the park. There is a sit down restaurant located in the park, but we did not eat there on this trip.Next visit, I plan to take a picnic basket with sandwiches and wine & spend the afternoon relaxing.

Oasis in the middle of the city. The Vondelpark area is a huge public garden very well laid out with enough benches for people to sit and walking trails. It is slam in the middle of the museum-district, and a number of tram lines intersect closeby. A very good opportunity to bicycle around (though I personally didn't do it)

Lovely park!. I ran in the park every day I was in Amsterdam. Great loop, there was an art exhibit going on which was fun. There are parrots flying around, and clean toilets (portos) that are convenient. Felt very safe and was well enjoyed.
Good. Just a park... If you are lucky enough to not get caught by the rain. Good to ride a bike, relaxing, jogging or picnics. A lot of high people but they don't bother.
Time to while away your time. Nice peaceful park to ride thorugh to take in nature away from the cobbled streets of Amsterdam - sit and ponder by the many waterways.

Beautiful park. We cycled through the park on a bike tour. It's quite a big park - a few places teeming with tourists, but other than that it was rather serene. Some really beautiful photo opportunities as well, if you're into photography.

Nothing special. I dont know why this item keeps coming in the list of "things to do." Amsterdam has so many other better things to offer. The park was very dirty. Maybe people like it so much because they get high and lie down there. Either way I cant give a very good rating to this. Just an average neighborhood park, but dirty.

Get your Bike and go!. Voldelpark is a must in Amsterdan.Yes, it´s only a park. We visit during the summer, so, no many activities outside. But was a great day, riding a bike at the park.Try your own pic-nic moment.

Mediocre park. The guidebooks really talked this park up, but I found it to be really mediocre. It is not comparable in size, beauty or variety of attractions to any of central London's parks, or Central Park (NYC) or Golden Gate park (SF).It's quite an ugly space that feels crowded with too many cyclists. There are a couple of cafes in the park. We had a drink at one of them and strolled for about half an hour, but as I say there was nothing much to enjoy. Quite a lot of dry dusty areas and no flower garden that I could see. I really couldn't see what the guidebooks had been raving about.Don't go out of your way to seek this place out. If you have spare time then I guess you could kill an afternoon here, but in my opinion you' be better off walking along the canals looking at the local architecture.

Beautiful Place. It is a public park close to Leidseplein square. The park is large and beautiful with an open theater and a lot of green areas. i was lucky to stay in a hotel next to the park.Entrance is free.

One of my favorite places in Amsterdam. Vondel park is a huugeee park with lots of space for walking, cycling, running, bbq, picnic, reading or just gazing around. It has a few small lakes and a fountain. It is just perfect for any kind of activity and makes you relaxed instantly.

Charming!. I could sit there hours hours and the restaurant located in the park makes it quite possible. Whether going for a stroll, a bike ride or to exercise like the locals do it's a beautiful place to relax.
Beautiful!. This is an amazing area of woodland, ponds and rivers. The park is full of people enjoying the sun and having BBQ's, runners, sculptures, play areas and plenty of benches to sit on!

Awesome park, Bike ride, Ice creams and relax. We took bikes from Macbike which has a store opposite to park entrance, which costed us 12.5 Euros for 3 hours including the insurance. This is a nice place to relax and ride bike. Most of the bike riders in park are tourists, so no worries about the daily commuter Amsterdam locals. There are few ice cream and hot dog carts in park, we tried Vanilla ice cream (1 Euro), which was exceptionally tasty, but we did not like the blueberry ones. There is an Iamsterdam miniature here, we can take photos and kids can climb on the structure.There were few bands performing and entertaining the crowd. I would suggest to keep half day for Vondelpark if you are coming with kids.
Nice break. Beautiful park, a nice way to spend a few hours and rest your feet. Lots of activity during the weekends, families and dogs, etc.

Great place to relax. On our last day we spent the morning relaxing in the park and enjoying the sun and flowers. It is a very clean park with police riding through the park making sure people weren't doing anything wrong. There is also an IAmsterdam sign that has much less tourist around so you can get a really good photo.

Fabulous park. This park is beyond fabulous! Our kids (both under 7) loved the park, the dogs, the ducks, the ice cream but especially the playgrounds. There is a tree fort as well as many other smaller playgrounds spread through out the park. We began and ended every day here during our visit.

Amazing park to ride through. We hired bikes and ended up spending an afternoon riding and hanging out in Vondelpark. The weather was beautiful which helped. We found many people relaxing and sun baking on the grass. Great memories!

Boring, Nothing Special. As a tourist, I don't think it is worth spending one's limited time in this park.It is not particularly interesting or pretty. Moreover, it is frustrating to walk through with the unclearly marked bike paths.

Awesome place to relax, ride a bike, or sunbathe. Its the place to be in Amsterdam while on holiday and the weather is good. Grab some beers and go and chill in the park, or pose with the Amsterdam sign which is something every tourist should do while in town.

Vondelpark the great outdoors. Vondelpark is one place to visit on your trip to Amsterdam,visited by tourists and locals.In summer there is plenty of entertainment ie music,dance and outdoor plays in stunning surroundings 15 min walk from town or 5 mins by tram.

Relaxation. Visited this park in our bicycle tour and then went back again to stroll in the park and relax. In great weather, this is one of the best things to do in Amsterdam. Lots of people just sitting in the grass and enjoying the day. Worth doing.
A nice respite from the city traffic and old buildings.. We had a gorgeous sunny day to enjoy the park and relax after a few days of travelling. Pick up a picnic and enjoy the outdoors.

Not so much to see in Winter!. A beautiful park with plenty of space for families etc, however there's not much really going on in winter, which is fair enough. Would be a great picnic spot in summer! And the lake is stunning. Good central location.

No Better Place to Spend a Nice Day. The Vondelpark is an incredibly facility which the people of Amsterdam are very lucky to have available to them. The park is enormous and there is a great mix of people along with a great atmosphere there on a sunny day. Fantastic place to spend a couple of hours if you are staying in Amsterdam for a few days.

A bit of paradise. This park is serene and beautiful, with various kinds of birds flying and swimming in the ponds. The people are very civilized, peaceful. It was a pleasure sharing the enjoyment of this beautiful spot.

Relaxing afternoon. Spent some time walking around and just relaxed on the grass while eating hotdogs and ice cream. There is a big "I AMsterdam" sign in the middle of the park which is great for photo ops.
Nice Park, Very Good. The park was very nice, well kept and lovley when it was sunny. You could just chill out by the water in the sun and relax

Great atmosphere, lots of room. The park is very big and busy, but you can find lots of quiet places everywhere.On the weekend we were there, the weather was super hot, and there were people lying all around the park, which gives a very fun atmosphere.We had brought our bikes, so it is also very nice to cycle around the park. Or you can rent a bike off course.If you have some time to relax, the park is highly recommended.
Picnic in the park. We stopped off in an albert hynes store on our way to the park and had a beautiful picnic in the park.

Great for a picnic!. As a tourist in Amsterdam, this was a fun park to check out. We went on a very nice day, so there were lots of people there, but it was not too crowded. We picked up some supplies for a picnic at the Albert Heijn near the Van Gogh museum and had a great time.
Really beautiful park. Went here a couple of times on my trip to Amsterdam in April. It's a stunning park, probably one of the nicest parks I've been too. Will definitely be going there again :-)
Enjoy walking and biking there. The park is very relaxing. We enjoyed both walking and biking in the park. The park is close to museums.

Romantic park with great view of nature!. This is one of the most beautiful and clean park I've ever visited. It is however, very big but well worth the time to take a morning, afternoon or evening stroll just to earn yourself some fresh air. My boyfriend and I visited the park in the late afternoon after the whole day of visiting other crowded attractions in Amsterdam. You need to be careful when you wanted to cross the other side of the road as you will need to avoid being hit a massive amount of cyclists. They also have the infamous "I AMSTERDAM" sign just right in the heart of the park and it is very much less crowded compared to the ones in front of Rijksmuseum so I guess that would be a bonus. Perfect place to have a picnic if you like but remember to take your rubbish with you!
Great place to relax. We had good weather and found this a great place to watch the world go byA large park with a variety of cafés, and v well used by locals
Amazing. Simply the best park I ever visited. Dont visit it if you're not in the mood or the weather is cloudy/rainy. It changes the whole perspective of the place.

Slice of peace in a fun, busy city!. Similar to Central Park as it's smack in the middle of a dense urban setting, this is a perfect place to rent bikes from Yellow Bikes and ride over. Grab a ice cream and enjoy the beauty!
Beautiful and relaxing. Everything in Amsterdam is beautiful, and the Vondelpark specially charming, relaxing, it is like a romantic movie.You wanna. Stay there forever.

beautiful park to visit. this park is perfect for a walk, a ride or just to sit and enjoy.We hired bikes and enjoyed the easy and relaxing scenery, stopped for a delicious ice cream and sat near the pond to watch the ducks, so many people were enjoying the fantastic weather, a beautiful place to be alive!

Great for picnic, between museums. This park if between several of Amsterdams famed museums. Its a great spot to rest between museums, good for a picnic, but there are also food stands and cafes you can enjoy snalcks and full lunches if you want.

Amsterdam young at leisure in lovely park!. Just spent 1.5 hours wandering through this park on a late hot summer Sunday afternoon, before the Whit bank holiday- it was heaving , largely with young people and young families: lots of cyclists, some roller skaters but most were picnicking or BBQing in party- like groups complete with bunting hanging from trees. I suppose when many Amsterdam residents live in flats it is not surprising they take to the park for the day! Interesting to see. I recommend you leave the park briefly on the south side - along Koningslaan ( you can get back in at the Hoofstraat gate) and look at the lovely houses backing onto the park and canal ( including the British Consulate) The park itself has lovely shaded planted walks and lakes.
Beautiful. Amazing garden. You can walk there every day and you will always find something different. Perfect to relax, read a book, enjoy a BBQ or just do some sports.

the most wonderfull park you could go to. A bit late reviewing this but has everything going on here with plenty of buses taking to and from,a perfect place to relax and eat out either in the park or just outside the main gates

Chill out here. Many Cyclists around so watch children ... but plenty of grassed areas. Overall this is a lovely park with several places to chill out with a drink / snack & just watch the world go by.

Our first morning started with a run through Vondelpark. After arriving late in the evening, the following morning, we enjoyed a pleasant run to Vondelpark and a couple of laps of the park itself. In amongst the locals commuting on their bikes at speeds where they were all a mission, our two laps were fun and relaxing from the hustle and bustle of city sightseeing. There had been some overnight rain, so the park had a refreshing feel to it, and was very green and clean.
A superb inner city park. Similar to Regents Park in London, with an open air theatre. Very well usede by locals and vistors alike, a superb place to stroll and chat. A haven of green in the city.

Must visit for children. Our children love the park ! Been there five times and we absolutely love it . We met with friendly locals there and the park , the playground , feeding ducks experience , the climbing trees prove some of the uniqueness of this beautiful park.

Pleasant park to escape from the crowds. The park wasn't far from my bed and breakfast. It was a great place to end the day of sightseeing before heading back to home base. Well used. Lots of people walking, biking and just relaxing.
Lovely park. Vondelpark is worth visiting for a picnic on a sunny day! Great scenery and plenty of space to explore. Bring a blanket & lay in the grass like the locals.

Central Park south of the Centre. If you are tired of sightseeing - hard to believe in this storybook city - but after three museums and hundreds of gingerbread houses maybe a "green"break is just what is needed. But Vondelpark is more than just green, it is a most creative space for resting and running. Very close to so many really unique restaurants and stylish shops that you can combine a trip to Amsterdam's "South" and escape the tourists. Being a New Yorker, its really like Central Park also surrounded by the excitement of the city but so close to the finest shops and restaurants not to mention the Museum of Modern Art and the Metroplitan. In the summer don't forget the weekend music festival.

Beautiful on a sunny day. I liked the well maintained lawns and the freedom the place excuded. There were children playing about, young people rolling on skates , families out on picnics, officers with laptops discussing important matters with collegues. Not to forget the lovebirds nestled in one corner and the usual tourists lounging around. Must not miss

Great place to walk. Must go to experience Amsterdam!. Great place to take in the nice weather and the activities of the locals in Amsterdam. Plenty of places to stop and sit along the paths to just relax and people watch. You can easily picnic in the park, bike through the park or stroll at your leisure. Great atmosphere for relaxing. Don't miss the newly renovated cafe, Vondelpark 3 terrace, for a coffee or apertif.
So beautiful!. This park is absolutely beautiful. Great for a bike ride, run or walk. Very clean. So much greenery and lots of ducks and other birds.

A beautiful and well kept Park. A big park (named after the great Dutch poet and playwright of the 17th century) to relax, walk around an enjoy the gardens. There is not the hundreds of cyclists like in the city itself, so one can stroll in peace without dodging bicycles!

The best place to chill. The park has a great vibrant feeling to it. Lots of groups of all ages chilling in the green grass with barbecues, eating, talking, dancing, smoking and just having fun. Lots of children as well. The park is very big but realy clean and secure with police in bikes. Great place for a bike tour as well.
Good place for a sit. A good place to relax. Well connected between the hustle bustle and the museums, it can offer a good place to sit and relax whilst touring Amsterdam. Has a good feel to it too.
Beautiful. We walked here after our tour of Heineken. It is a beautiful park and very lively. We could have walked on through the park, but our legs were giving out after a long day.

Great Park, but be nimble to dodge the bikers. This is a wonderful park that recalls Rock Springs Park in DC and Central Park in NYC as the great urban parks of the world. In early May, it was superb, with people of all ages enjoying the fresh air, sunshine, and a huge number of birds. The trails were loaded with bikers. As pedestrians, we had to dodge them because they barrel on through.

Great park in the heart of Amsterdam. This is a very large park, clean and cozy. ideal for summer activities, u can take a walk, cycling, reading, or just take a nap... but the portable WC (toilet) was dirty and stinks.

Beautiful Park - watch out for joggers & cyclists!. We walked from our hotel at the bottom of the park on a beautiful Sunday morning, what a lovely open space, well attended by a million runners, sunday strollers and cyclists, so keep your wits about you! Top of the park spits you out a very short walk from Leidesplatz, were you can sit outside for a coffee, beer... or something stronger at the Bulldog Coffee shop across the way... Lovely park, follow it all the way down and see the beautiful houses across the small lake at the bottom, stunning neighbourhood!

Beautiful Park - watch out for joggers & cyclists!. We walked from our hotel at the bottom of the park on a beautiful Sunday morning, what a lovely open space, well attended by a million runners, sunday strollers and cyclists, so keep your wits about you! Top of the park spits you out a very short walk from Leidesplatz, were you can sit outside for a coffee, beer... or something stronger at the Bulldog Coffee shop across the way... Lovely park, follow it all the way down and see the beautiful houses across the small lake at the bottom, stunning neighbourhood!
Beautiful. You can just sit and appreciate the view, or jogging, or walking around. Good place to go if you eat magic mushrooms.

A must.. We bought a picnic from a supermarket. Fresh bread, ham, cheese, wine and beer. We found a spot in the sun, close to water, with some guy practising, or just enjoying playing his guitar just over the water. It was very busy, a beautiful day, great for people watching and walking. It's a slice of Amsterdam. Will return to experience this place soon.

A mini central park. Everything in Amsterdam is walking distance, or bike or scooter so this should be a place to tick off if the weather is good. We cycled through it and walked through it and enjoyed both visits. Lots of people having picnics in the sunshine.

beautiful park. Its a great place where you can spend a peaceful and quiet time right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city and the park is huge with greenery all along and water bodies and a whole lot of ducks and birds. In true terms the place is none less to a oasis.

A lovely public parkland. Vondelpark is just 2 tram stops from the Van Gogh Museum (Route 5 from Centraal Station and runs past the Convent Hotel). After visiting both the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum and a very pleasant lunch in the Cargo Restaurant just across the park from the Rijksmuseum) we decided we needed some fresh air and nature to allow the magnificent sights at the two museums to settle into pour memories.The Vondelpark was ideal for this. We entered the park from a side entrance accessible from the tramstop via an exquisite residential area that overlooks the park - lots of Mercedes and other expensive vehicles in the car park here).The park is simply beautiful - lots of green grass, winding paths through trees in the first bloom of spring, a lake with white swans and other water birds, families walking and playing together, lots of bike-riders (there are everywhere in Amsterdam) - but room to breathe and enjoy nature.The park is free and extensive, One could spend several hours wandering the various trails. A truly lovely place to get oneself reoriented

Relaxing bike ride. Perfect place to escape the busy city. Beautiful tall trees, ponds and lawns. Large paths for bikes. I was not confident enough riding bikes on Amsterdam streets but was very comfortable in the park. Good place for picnics otherwise there's also cafés inside the park !

Great for all ages. I think our kids loved this part of our trip the most. There was a small play pool (not a swimming pool), a playground, and plenty of open space to play futbol or frisbee. I noticed restaurants located in the park but didn't eat at any of them.

Supper relax and fun. Get yourself sometimes during the day and visit this park. It is clean, fun and so much energy. Somehow you will feel relax as well. I happened to stayed close to the park that I could walk to it. Lovely , bravo!

Great escape from the city. I wheeled Dad in a rented wheelchair (he walks slowly). The wildlife and well maintained gardens are refreshing. There is enough space to accommodate walkers, joggers, and bicyclists without conflict.

Great picnic location. A brief trip out to Vondelpark on a Sunday. Excellent weather for the day and very busy place. This location, although a little distant from the centre of town (we walked there from Central Station) would be a perfect location to take the kids and have a picnic. It close by to many museums so there is other things to do too. There seemed to be some kind of music on stage during our visit. We did not stay as it was packed out but had we planned things better we may of got a seat. However, that's not what we went for anyway so no loss to us. We grabbed a few beers in one of the café bars in the park which was nice and relaxing, although the wife's sent her tea back as the glass was a it dirty. Minor irritation for her and it was quickly replaced so again no biggie for us. We also took a hot dog of one of the vans which was very typical and tasty and reasonably priced given the location around 3.50 euros each. We have paid much more in London Parks for the same fare!All in order, a good location to visit on a nice day. I sure there is much more to do than have a picnic but beware of the bikes and watch out for the young ones, cyclists are not very observant and kiddies are bound to get into bother if left unattended. Otherwise, enjoy your day.
amazing place. It is a awesome park where you can relax in front of one of the many lakes it contains or just have a walk around along its wonderful paths.

Something to see, best on a nice day. My Vondelpark visit was on a rainy day, so the park would certainly be better in the sun.That being said, it's a lovely park, lots to see and very large.Not many attractions within the park, but nice for a bike ride or stroll. Open space for bbqs and picnics.
Nice escape. Lovely park to spend an hour or two to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Cafes and good play area for young children. It was very quiet when we visited, no entertainers.
Take a break. What a beautiful area to just chill out in the warmth of the sun, friendly people and plan the next adventure
relaxing park. its a very lovely park, can get crowded on summer weekends, many wild life for a park in down town Amsterdam, nice pathways, many young people..

Beautiful Park. The Vondelpark is so much fun on a sunny day. Amsterdammer's love to be outside and have picnics. Bikes are allowed but you may not ride motorized vehicles in the park. Dogs are allowed to roam 'off-leash'. There are several outdoor cafes and hotdog carts if you are hungry:-)

A stroll in the park and put your feet up.. Living close to the park, I might be biased just a little. But if you want to escape the city hussle for a bit, the Vondelpark is just the place. Also if you want to have a drink in the sun in one of the bars/restaurants like Vondeltuin or het Blauwe Theehuis. Feel like a run? Go around the park. It's just about 3,5km but you can do it twice if you fancy it.Especially good in the summer; the park is packed with people all enjoying being outside as much as possible.
clean park! oeople sun bathing. great park, no gangs, nice atmosphere; not as many street performers as a couple of years ago though
green green Amsterdam. walking and biking through Voldelpark is a relaxing excape from city rythm. There are a lot of birds, flowers and spaces to take sun.

What a lovely Parc.. This city park is situated very close to the Rijksmuseum and Marriott Hotel. Very relaxing for the business traveller or romantic for couples. In the summer there are regular markets and concerts.

nicer parks to visit eg the Beatrix. a lovely park but definetly not one of the most stunning you will see in the city and perhaps as so busy. A welcome break form the hustle and bustle of the street though.
Familiar. Was unsurprised to find out that the park was based on English designs as it was very similar to many parks back home, nice enough but no surprises.

Beautiful. Such a gorgeous park and id definitely recommend it!! What was even better is that me and my partner rented bikes to go around this park and to travel round the city and it was the best experience I have ever had!

Beautiful and breathtaking scenery. This place is truly an oasis in the city. After a whole lot of walking and city exploration, there is nothing more comforting that getting to spend couple of hours in this park. The whole place is stretched over miles and miles with greenery and views that will blow you mind. The place also has a whole lot of ducks, water bodies and birds for a good nature watching session too.

What a way to use up the sun. Went there Sunday afternoon. It was sunny and Amsterdam was out. Full of bicycles and characters.The large cafe was totally great. Serving thousands of people with a system which works.Go.

Relaxing and rejuvenating. Imagine acres of greenery in the middle of the city.... vondelpark is that and a lot more ! Water bodies, soft grass patches, ducks sunbathing by the water, birds singing in the trees, people reading, cycling or just strolling hand in hand. This park makes you feel years younger in just a few minutes.
Nice day. We bought picnic food in a nearby supermarket and spent a great afternoon, in the sun, people watching. Great!

A green oasis in the city. I was with a group heading for a lunch function at the Milkhouse in the middle of the park - birds spotted included parakeet (yes really), crested grebe, several herons, coots, moorhens and chinese ducks . Wild areas, trees and mown grass - also an open air concert which could still be heard on the other side of the lake - and very relaxing and laid back ambiance if you chose to do this and bring a picnic rather than buy a ticket to be in the audience. A nice place to relax and recoup your strength for the next activity - only 5 or so minutes walk from the Museum plein. Don't forget to look for the sculptures in the wall of the underpass - there is also a picasso statue which I did not have time to look for
Bike friendly. Handy park not park to walk to from leidseplein - most people had bikes through the park but plenty of places to sit with a picnic. Busy at weekends and very child friendly
Greenery and cyclists. A beautiful park and lake but too many cyclist spoil the peace. There is a stork nesting on a pole which is unusual
Peaceful day in Vondelpark. you can spend your day taking rest drinking wine after the exhausting nights of this lovely city. You can ride bcycle or just lie down on the grasses

Busy place!. The park is buzzing with activity lots of people and events going on. Seems to be more of a local than a tourist crowd. Not exactly a quiet tranquil place but lots of fun to wander around.

beautiful park great for a walk on a sunny day. I visited for the first time in 2012 it Is a beautiful park I was staying in NH hotel which is very close.
gorgeous place and relaxing. great for a walk or just sitting feeding the ducks :). a must do when visiting Amsterdam especially on those sunny days.
very big so a lot to explore.
Very pretty. Beautiful park! Very large with many ponds and trails. It was easily my favourite place in Amsterdam
A nice place for a walk. The park is beautiful. The houses around the outside are nice. The water is nice. Not too crowded. A good place to spend some time walking and relaxing.
Relax. perfect place to relax for your feet after a long walk at the steet for the canals. Sit down at the lakes and enjoy the life of the birds there

Great city park!. Vondelpark is one of my favorite city parks. It's very beautiful. Just wander around exploring and you will find lots of little unique and fun areas. The people watching is excellent too.
Springtime wonder. This is a beautiful park to visit. You can walk around, sit on benches, enjoy the ducks and birds, go to one of the cafes or just enjoy the wonderful vegetation.
lovely. perfect place , should rent a byke at mac and go to park ,you can lay all day on grasses , half of the day can be spent there !!
they say it changes when the sun goes down.. Basic park that made a nice walk, well laid out with a wide cross section of humanity in attendance. ?. I would be cautious after dusk

Superb to cycle round. Biked round the park one Saturday afternoon with friends. It was lovely to see so many people enjoying themselves outdoors. Nice clean city park with lots of mature trees, ponds, lakes and play areas. Brilliant for picnics and hide and seek :-)
Vondelpark. A lovely and clean park that allows you to enjoy a quiet stroll through a beauiful park. The park is very well maintained and had many benches to enoy sitting and watching the people.

Beautiful Park. Beautiful place in the middle of the city. Perfect for a stroll or a picnic and also has playgrounds if you come with children.We rented bicycles from "Mac Bike" near by and really enjoyed the ride in the park. I was afraid to ride in the city with all the trams and cars coming from everywhere but in the park it was perfect and safe :-)
Very pleasant place, nice to see people out in the sun. Whilst it was very pleasant the cafe we went to was a bit of a disappointment. Lots of people out on a fine and warm spring day

Spectacular neighborhood. A beautiful park, serene, peaceful, fabulous neighborhood. Take some deep breaths and relax! The homes surrounding the park are stunning. Run around the lake in the early morning and visit in the evening as well. A great sense of calm and well-being.

Vondelpark. Named after the poet Joost van den Vondel, sometimes described as the Dutch Shakespeare, the Vondelpark is to Amsterdam what Central Park is to New York City. Running out from pretty near to the heart of Amsterdam, like Central Park it has traditions going back to the ideas of what a central city park should be about. Though it doesn't boast a reservoir (it does have several arty ponds) it is a tranquil and leafy arm out from the centre. If you're cycling it's a breath of fresh air, offering in its length a good car-free connection from the centre out westwards.At the heart of the park is its open-air theatre. On a warm summer evening the atmosphere can be magical. Since the 1970s it has been a centre for remarkable performances.Today the open air theatre has come a long way from the original makeshift stageIt is about to announce its 40-year since opening celebration programme for 2014 on http://www.openluchttheater.nl/programma. In the line-up there'll be no shortage of stuff in English or where language isn't important so don't be put off by the Dutch website - translate where necessary - and check out the programme. All performances are free. Just roll up and take a seat!There are cafés and a pleasant restaurant in the former film museum / pavilion.At present the "special species" field is host to a stork nest. Stork Piet, the breeding male for a number of years now, has a bad leg and there has been considerable controversy about whether we should intervene and fix it or let nature take its course. Although he holds the roost at the moment, he will, because of his leg, be unlikely to be able to mount and fertilise his current mate this year. If he falls from dominancy another male stork will be likely to spot her and fly in to take his place.If you're visiting Amsterdam, even for a short time, you should certainly plan at least a walkthrough of the park. It will help you get the feel of the city, its history and its present-day culture. If the weather's in any way clement (which it usually is) then it's a great way to relax after say a concentrated diet of museums and cultural venues.

Great park in the heart of Amsterdam. This is one great (I think the biggest) park in Amsterdam. You can recover some Energy and walk in the green. I think in summer you find a lot of attractions or events in it.
Come relax here. Not too far from the Rijks, this is the perfect place for a picnic or to indulge in recently acquired coffee shop fare.
Big Park!. Great place for a long stroll! Good for people watching - you'll see all sorts, old, young, runners, cyclists, the lot.

Awesome Park. I loved the park. I went for a walk through the park with my sister who is living in the Netherlands and got a nice little guided tour and decided to go for a bike ride a few days later. On my way back to the hotel i decided to ride through the park and had a great ride. Beautiful landscaping and water features and very busy with people running, riding, picnicking, and hanging out.

Perfect for a morning run. Used this park for morning runs on a business trip to Amsterdam. Lots of people were out there exercising as well. Seems like the perfect place to go for a picnic, a walk, a run, take the kids to the playground,...

Peaceful park. Like many parks, this provides a quiet have in the middle of a busy city. Gravel paths, a lake in the middle and a variety of eating places make this a quiet getaway or a place to ride bikes, run or picnic.
Fantastic and spacious park. Visited on a lovely sunny day. Plenty of space and facilities for children including playgrounds and an open air theatre. Lots of outdoor cafés.

Waste time, play something or just walk around with your dog. Went there in summer and hence was able to roam around in the park till 9 am without bothering about daylight. This park is huge and has very good spots to relax or walk your dog or go for a job or cycle run. The park is very well constructed right in the heart of the city. Reaching the park is no issue, one just has to get down at the Rijksmuseum tram stop. The place is just a 10 minute tram ride or a 20 minute cycle ride from Amsterdam Centraal. There are many street food shops within the park selling hot dogs or ice cream if you want cheap food. There are also a few fine dine places within the park. I saw a group of people bringing their own barbecue to the place and having a blast ( the cooking and playing all have designated spots).The park also has an Iamsterdam insignia in case you were wondering where to get one of those signs and have your photos clicked. Overall a really nice place to see and relax. Even taking a walk in this park is beautiful.

Pack a picnic. This park is incredible! It is definitely worth grabbing a sandwich and picnicking among the locals and amazing scenery. Even if, like me, you are not brave enough to bike in the city it would be worth renting one for a few hours just to follow the path all the way through (the park is much tamer than the streets!).
Go outside and enjoy the sunshine! :). A must see when you're in Amsterdam. Get a glass of wine in the Blauwe Theehuis and watch the world go by.

beautiful park. had a lovely wander around this place beautiful fountains and bridges and lovely cafe on one of the ponds with no overprice coffees etc.. very peaceful would definately come back to Amsterdam for this park alone

Nice park close to the city centre. Vondelpark is a large park near the city centre... it was quite busy on liberation day when we visited - full of families and couples out and about amongst the gardens, lawns, lakes and trees.Well worth a visit on a sunny day :)

Nice park; be careful around the bridge. Any city park is a pleasure to be in. However, there is a road bridge passing over it from side to side, about half way into the park (it's a long and narrow park), under which some very doubtful-looking youths were hanging around in a rather menacing way. Best to keep away from this area in anything but broad daylight.
Great park for families, jogging, and people watching. The weather was perfect when I went and the park was crowded on a Sunday afternoon with families, picnics, cyclists, and runners.
A nice place to rest. Visited on a warm sunny day. People were lying everywhere, barbecuing, it was nice. But yeah, basically it's "just" a bautiful park.

Great Park. Yes - this is just another park in a big city, but it was still very nice to walk around during the day. Tons of different bike and walk paths. Definitely a great place to ride your bike through and it's not big enough that you also can't walk through it.We actually ate lunch at one of the few restaurants in the park and surprisingly, it wasn't that bad or overly priced.Vondelpark is a great place to spend a few hours while in Amsterdam.

Amsterdambreak. A large park with multipurpose paths for walkers, cyclists, joggers and skateboarders. Very quiet place in the middle of the city to relax and enjoy trees shrubs etc. Also a good restaurant not too far from the main gate ideal for lunches.

Just another park except this one is full of students smoking canibis joints surrounded by millions of bikes.. It was a lovely sunny day when we visited but even with the good weather we couldn't really say that this park was special. Not worth a visit unless you have never been in a park before.

Time to breathe fresh air in Amsterdam. Well worth taking the time out of Amsterdam's busy areas to breathe in some clean air into the lungs. A lovely park frequented by tourists and locals exercising, and wildlife too. We found it a peaceful relief to spend time here.

Pretty little park in the museum quarter. Pretty little spot to stop for a picnic whilst visiting the 3 museums in the area. The houses surrounding the park are very beautiful. You can sit and look at them for quite a while.

Peaceful. A magnificent place to relax and enjoy the peace and quiet of nature. We stopped for lunch at the Restaurant which was full of atmosphere. Our order was delayed so they offered us a free coffee. The park was full of families and bike riders enjoying the sunshine.
Absolutely beautiful. Hire a bike and ride around... Amsterdam's parks are slightly less sculptured and are better for it. Beautiful lakes, ducks, and some tulips.
Charming park. A very nice park, lovely plantings, the Pavilion provides a charming place to snack. Not a matter of sight-seeing, but good for a stroll or bike ride.

A beautiful, sprawling park. Its gorgeous in the spring, with tree lined walks and rivers. Its also lots of fun on King's Day! Its good for families as well, bring some food and have a nice picnic lunch!

Lovely Retreat. Vondelpark is a wonderful park to walk, observe birds and waterfowl and sit and watch people. After hours of looking at spectacular art in the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh and/or Stedelijk go to Vondelpark, give your eyes a rest and relax. There are vendors selling drinks, ice cream and hot dogs. Plus the Film museum is located in the park.

Good for cycling!. We spent a couple of hours here. It is a bit tired in places but there is a nice lake and some fountains and cute little ducklings at this time of year. Seems very popular with cyclists. We had a coffee in the blue café but then found a nicer looking one. There are few undesirable types hanging around. Worth a visit if you want to get away from the canals and busier shopping districts for a while.
Lovely park. Not a must-do definitely, but a lovely green space in which to relax or walk around in between seeing any other must-do sites while in Amsterdam.

Oasis of calm with interesting wildlife.. I spent a couple of hours wandering though this charming, spacious park between visiting museums. As a keen birdwatcher I was delighted to find a stork just metres away from me strutting around collecting twigs for its nest. Further along a heron was fishing, oblivious to cyclists and roller skaters, and a pair of egyptian geese swam in the lake by the cafe with their tiny chicks. I discovered my third Iamsterdam statue: this one sports a gold crown. It was not a crowded as the signs in front of the Rijksmuseum and at the airport. I would imagine it is beautiful in summer when the flowers are in full bloom.
Great place to walk relax. After a few hours of dodging bikes and scooters along the canals, this is a great place to walk, sit at a bench and enjoy some quiet time.
Cycle through this lovely park!. My wife and I hired bikes to explore Amsterdam and spent a delightful time riding through this beautiful park.

Relax.... Vondelpark is a lovely green space nearby museum district.We walked round Vondelpark during visit to Amsterdam. Cyclists, runners, walkers, dog walkers and roller-bladers using the park as a place for relaxing.You can spend some hours in the sunshine just relaxing.

just a park. Nice park close to the city center, I dont think this is really special, not a ''must go'' definitely. But is nice if you just want to rest for a while, there is a little bridge where you can take nice pictures. Avoid spending time here if you are in Amsterdam for a little time.
Lovely park. Our apartment in Overtoom was only about 50 metres from the park. Walking through virtually the whole park was a great way to get to the Museum Quarter.
Good relaxing time in a busy city. Lots of runners, cyclists and dog walkers but there is plenty room for us all. Great place to have a walk in calm surroundings.

A city oasis!. It was wonderful to enter this leafy area full of ponds, fountains and birds. So peaceful as a break from the city. Also several good cafes. This is a popular place for locals who cycle round the park or exercise their dogs. We went there 4 times in one week it was so good.

An oasis in a busy city. We walked round Vondelpark during a recent visit to Amsterdam. It is an amazing space, akin to Central Park in New York or Hyde Park in London. It is well used, with a steady stream of cyclists, runners, walkers and a couple of roller-bladers using the park as a place to exercise or relax. There are several places to get a coffee, or something more, and we spent 2 hours in the spring sunshine just wandering and relaxing with a coffee. A must see.

My favourite place to relax. After a leisurely walk around the park, I usually settle here for an hour for a couple of beers. Extremely friendly waiters and I love sitting on the upper floor on the terrace.

Relaxing afternoon. Between the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum we decided to take a break so that we don't get bored and exhausted. Headed for Leidseplein to get some Vlaamse Frites and then took the bike and dug into the park and the fries. I have to say they were both amazing. With amazing views, huge gardens and lakes, Vondelpark is a biker's must-do and a tourist's escape from the busy touristic life of Amsterdam.
You can do anything here!. Literally anything. We got smoked and drank here, it was a beautiful sunny day and it is a huge, beautiful park. Loved the day we spent here.

Beautiful!. A huge recreational ground boasting a beautiful, scenic atmosphere. We went on King's Day, so the entire park was full of (orange) Patriotic locals and enthusiastic tourists! Lots of room to sit, light a BBQ, grab some food (or AMAZING ice cream.. hazelnut is the best...) and enjoy by the water.

Brilliant for relaxing and exploring on bike!. Vondelpark is very large and I was fortunate enough to stay in the Stayokay hostel in Vondelpark. As part of a group we decided to cycle around the Vondelpark and explore the many different features of the park including a stage for performances, a park for children and plenty of cycle and pedestrian space.We approached one of the 'burger van' style shops for food and drink and the 2 guys working there were very friendly and polite, even teaching us some Dutch! Overall the Vondelpark was a very peaceful and tranquil place to spend the mornings!
Great place to spend a warm evening. enjoy yourself walking through the green paths and inhale the pleasant atmosphere. Just watch out - there are hundreds of wheels everywhere.

Amazing place if weather allows it to be. This park is amazing has so many cool little places and in the summer the weeping willows are the perfect little hideaway if your lucky enough to find one for yourself. What we always do is rent bokes buy everythign for a picnic and go here in the summer such a beautiful park! i can only reccomend it to anyone looking for some relaxation in amsterdam!
A good place to relax. If the sun comes out join the locals and chill in the park. A good place too to have breakfast (from 0830) or a light lunch with a side dish of fresh air.
Park in Amsterdam. A nice place to spend a sunday. Green lawns, good walk. It iis worthwhile a visit while in Amsterdam for some more days.
Nice park but not an attraction. This is definitely a very nice place to take a walk or just to sit outside, though I wouldn't call it a "must see" in Amsterdam. There isn't too much to see.

Rent a bike and ride. We absolutely love this park. It's a big, beautiful, bohemian gem in the heart of the city. We had our bikes and rode though the park, stopping to relax, people watch and just take in the local atmosphere. Here you will see people of all ages playing sports, jogging, roller skating, having picnics and just relaxing and enjoying the simple things in life. There is a lake as well as cafes scattered throughout the park. This is a must see/must do during a trip to Amsterdam.
A beautiful park near the Museum District. A good central park to get away from it all. There was a nice little bar/cafe to enjoy a glass of wine or tea close to the entrance.

Koningsdag Crush. I had the pleasure of spending an hour or so on Vondelpark during King's Day; this is probably one of the vastest and impeccably kept public spaces I've visit.The Park was crammed with visitors and locals (selling pretty much all of their unwanted junk), as well as Musicians and other vendors, which i guess sort of kills the point of visiting Vondelpark to take on all it has to offerz
Beautiful Park. Vondelpark is a lovely green space right in the heart of the city.NIce place for a picnic, or just to relax
Wonderful Park. Just beautiful area in the centre of Amsterdam to clear yoyr mind and be fresh. I just love Amsterdam

rent a bike and ride. This was one of the highlights of our trip. We rented a bike from Mac Bike and rode around the park for a while stopping for a few breaks to enjoy the scenery and the lakes. There are a few nice cafes in their too.

If you need to escape the crowds. Plenty of green space just to wander around or sit and get away from it all for a while, Still seemed peaceful even on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Mixed crowd of people, some families and those with picnics - although also some drinking parties there, however there is space to avoid the rowdier elements. Beware the cyclists and mopeds .

beautiful park. Had lovely stroll around this beautiful park, very relaxing its hard to believe its in a busy city. Nice walk with cafe and very easy to find its close to leidesplein and hard rock cafe. Good if you want nice break from this busy city to recharge yourself .

Great place on a sunny Sunday. All of Amsterdam seemed to be enjoying the sun here on Sunday.loads of room for cycling or walking the dog.good spot to take a seat in the sun with a picnic from V and D,read your book or people watch.
There is a cafe in the centre but it was basic.

Beautiful. Loved this clean and green park with its lakes, colourful tulips and cyclists of all ages and types! Spent a lovely sunny afternoon there with my family people watching and sunbathing on Easter weekend.

Peaceful, beautiful and free to sit down!. In a city where it feels like you have to buy something to sit down ANYWHERE- Vondel Park in Amsterdam is a much welcomed relief for the feet!!!! Went there for an afternoon- but think I could have stayed all day!
Peaceful, beautiful and a great place for people and dog watching!
Lovely spit to ride through. Lovely park and good to see Amsterdammers relaxing. We hired bikes and rode around the city and through the park

Beautiful, large and peaceful park. We toured the park on bikes and it was close to our hotel. We saw it at a good time of the year with nice weather and trees and flowers beginning to bloom. it was sunny and warm and everyone was out and enjoying the day. Wide and beutiful walking and bike lanes that gone on and on. you will enjoy on foot or on bike.
relaxing place. we enjoyed biking around, watching the different places and get relaxed on the water with a delicous ice cream
Reeeeelax. Such a beautiful park to wander around with lovely cafes hidden away and little paths that would make you think you are in the middle of nowhere.
Gorgeous. Hire a Bike and guide yourself around this splendid park. Gorgeous flowers seating areas and watch the world go by
Don't miss the green parakeets. A pleasant stroll through Vondelpark finished with a picknick is a must in Amsterdam. Look up in the trees for the green Parakeets (like small parrots).
Lovely Park. We spent a couple of hours at Vondel Park, it is a lovely place with well kept grounds and memorial statues surrounded by beautiful tulips. Very nice place for a walk around.

DO NOT MISS THIS!. We were in the park on one of the early nice days this spring and it was fabulous. The landscape is beautiful and works of art appear here and there. The ice cream vendor was just right. It is the people parade here that made this place so cool. On a nice afternoon it is a paradise for people watching.
Relaxing Afternoon. This is a beautiful park near the museum district of Amsterdam. You are even allowed to drink and smoke here, which makes it relaxing and very fun to people watch!

Just beautiful!. My boyfriend and I spent a sunny afternoon in the Vondelpark in Amsterdam. This tranquil place was a contrast to the bustling city and the chance to picnic and watch the ducks was very relaxing. The park is huge and it is full of beautiful flowers, ponds and bird life. Visit the romantic Vondelpark, you will not be disappointed.

Great place to bike or roller blade. Good pavement -- something not found on many of the bike paths of amsterdam and also less aggressive bike traffic. Also has a few playgrounds and a nice place to get a beer.

Surprises in every tree or pond. A great breath of fresh air in Amsterdam. A must after the closeness and high density of Centrum. Watch out for some surprising birds in particulate, including a seasonally resident stork.

Nice oasis. We stayed just outside of the Vondelpaark, and walked through it on our way to downtown Amsterdam. Nice paths, fairly crowded on a warm spring day, as an urban park should be! Nice variety of birds and plantings, if you are a nature buff stuck in a city.

VONDELFUL (WONDERFUL). Vondel Park is a human parking area after travelling Amsterdam and get a rest with green and ducks. Good design roads, sit areas etc.
A very good place to read books or short fiesta.
Enjoy Vondelpark. Vondelful...(Wonderful)

Leaving you Relaxed. This beautiful park in Amsterdam is well worth a visit. Although we only biked through during a bike tour, I was in awe. It is a beautiful place, bustling with love and joy. I also quite enjoyed looking for the green parrots that now call the park home. If you are looking for a little bit of relaxation while visiting Amsterdam, make sure to take some time to enjoy the Vondelpark.
Great place for a walk. Spent a Sunday afternoon In the Park which was very pleasant. Very busy Park comprising Cyclists, Joggers, Pedestrians and Animals

It can be really busy. We were today there, 6 of us! And it was fully packed, but very nice, whenever the weather is nice, you see people laughing again, jogging and families walking around, I love it!
Wonderful place. Such great place to walk through and watch pace life on Netherlands wish you could tech us Brits how to do it !
Great atmosphere. Great atmosphere at Vondelpark. It was nice seeing people, young and old, enjoy a walk or a run in the park. Great two mile running circuit as well.

So clean and green!. We rented bikes and took them over to Vondelpark - it was a joy to cycle around the park and stop in various places to watch the beautiful scenery and birds. Stopped also for some fries and beer! So clean and green!

A very nice park. Although we didn't spend lots of time in this park, it was a very nice park. It had lots of grounds and many directions to wander in. Was very busy when we went, we found a nice cafe, lake and a gelato stand :D
Huge busy park! . The park is really huge and it's almost always bustling with activity. It's a nice place to have a few beers with friends.

Relax in the nicest and most "behomean" park in Amsterdam and The Netherlands. Relax in the nicest and most "behomean" park in Amsterdam and The Netherlands. Experience the cosmopolitan atmosphere, music and nice flora. This park has always been famous in The Netherlands for its liberal and progressive atmosphere.

Nice parc in Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is one of the oldest parcs in Amsterdam. It's always busy, people walking, running, skating, riding bikes. There are couple of places to sit and eat and drink and watch people passign by. In summer there are performances in the open air theatre. In summer people are sitting in the sun on the grass, eating, drinking, sometimes BBQ.

A lovely place to ride through. There are lots of little ponds and beautiful birds i had not seen before in Australia.A lovely park to have a ride through on your hire bike or to run through in the warmer weather.

Love it. Vondelpark is an amazing park to spend summer afternoons, can get super crowded, with lots of peopkle playing freesbee, making improv barbaques and a hole lot of drinking. Really fun and lots of things going on.
Full of colors, from the trees and the millions of flowers. Drastic change in the winter

Peaceful and great for a bike ride!. Travelled to Vondel Park on a sunny Saturday afternoon using Yellow Bikes. Got a little bit lost but locals could put us on the right track :-)The park was pretty busy as it was such a nice day but was a great place to take a little picnic and enjoy the scenery.A few bridges and ponds around and plenty of space to ride your bike. Visit Vondel Park in the sunshine for the best experience!
Nice city park. Relatively small park in the middle of Amsterdam. When the wheather is good it is crowded. There are spots you can barbecue.
Sit in to watch the locals. Even as a local (me), it's great fun to just sit here (bring some food & drinks) and watch the locals commute, sport, palaver and stroll

centralpark in amsterdam. Best green spot in Amsterdam. Wether you go for a walk, a bycicle ride, a run , rollerskate or for a coffee in the sun this is the place to be. If you go with children go to Het Melkhuis good playground and lots of place for the parents to enjoy. Without kids I would reccomend Het Blauwe Theehuis.

Green. Enjoy a nice green park full of running, cycling, walking, skating (3.3km track), picnicking, sleeping, bbqing (on separate area) and chilling people. And probably enough surveying police, because there's not a lot of trouble.

You should not miss this very relaxed green lung of Amsterdam. Strolling, picnicking, flirting, jogging, biking; everything is possible in the Vondelpark which is very close to Leidseplein and the Canals. On a sunny day the park is packed with groups of people enjoying themselves while having a relaxed time over a barbecue or just drinks. If you want to meet and chill this is the place to go.

Beautifull and sprightly parc. This parc is an anybody's friend. When the sun is shining it seems that every inhabitant and visitor went to this parc to meet friends, to make music, to have a BBQ (only in the fields where it is allowed!). It is a nice mix of cultures. But day and night, sunny or rainy day you will always find people running through the parc, alone, with a friend or with one of all the training clubs who use the parc. In the su.mmer there is an open-air theatre with free concerts. The website is only in dutch.

Magic. Vondel, one of the great parks of Europe. Always nice, always happy people, always free. Huge, many areas to chill, bridges and lakes. Great restaurants and coffeeshop in the middle of the park, overlooking the lake.
Green heart of the city. For 30 years I come here to catch my breath. Especially around the little fountains near the Rosarium. At night it is beautiful too.

Finding tranquility in the city. This is a lovely park area in the heart of Amsterdam with lots of good walks, and attractive views. There are a couple of good cafes as well if you just want to sit down and enjoy the nature.

Great Place , Lots of good views, lots of human activity of all sorts. We went there one Sunday morning and it reminded me of New Yorks Central Park. All sorts of human activity : jogging, cycling, people playing with their children, people playing with their dogs, people eating at out door areas..plus the view was great of the mixture of lakes, lawns , tulips ( that helps) ...We thoroughly enjoyed our walk in the sun in this park

A wonderful City Break. Within walking distance of key museums and attractions, this oasis is easily accessibly by public trams, transport, Pick up a take-away lunch and have a park picnic with kids....
Only if you have spare time.. Pleasant walk with one or two surprising features: parakeets, a camel (yes, really), a pair of storks and a friendly heron! Great for people watching!
A nice quiet space in Amsterdam. A large and well maintained park in a fantastic area of AmsterdamWorth a visit to escape the crowds but also close to some of the best shops in Amsterdam

Beautiful surroundings away from the bustle. Great for families. We enjoyed our visit here. We took tram 2 to leidesplein from centraal station. It was about 5 mins walk from there to the main entrance. Full of cycles and joggers. Lovely and clean place. Took ages to find the playground in the centre belonging to the cafe but it was worth it the kids had a great time in there on the body castle and sandpit. I imagine it gets so busy on hot summer days so the only improvement I would make is to have some of the park inaccessible to cycles as it can get a bit crammed for people wanting to walk and take in the scenery

Lovely park in the centre of Amsterdam. It was great to take a couple of hours to wander round the park which, despite joggers, cyclists, dog walkers etc still didn't appear crowded. Lots of lakes and paths and well worth a visit. Several places to get a coffee and something to eat.

Beautiful. This is a beautifully kept park and was full of locals and tourists on the day of my visit all out to enjoy the sun and the scenery. There is a variety of wildlife which can be found in the park which you wouldn't expect in the centre of a city.There are lots of benches to sit and people watch and take in the surroundings. Very popular with cyclists, runners and dog walkers.
Good walk. We walked the length of Vondelpark, and used the 'flying saucer' tea room. There are a variety of paths and lakes - excellent experience.

Great place to run!. I enjoyed a nice Saturday morning run through the park. It's took me 30 minutes to run the outside loop of the park running at about 8min/mile. It's a great place for people watching too.
While away an hour. Lovely, well kept and safe, this city park is easilly accessible from the museum quarter. I spent a lovely lazy hour just wandering around the small lakes and people watching.
Love it. Nice place to cruise on your bike rather than the manic-ness of the roads! Also, the park is HUGE so there's lots of good spots to set up camp.
Lovely space. This is a beautiful park , within easy walking distance of the city centre , with lots of green , little lakes , kids areas etc

Great people watching. If you want to see a cross section of Amsterdam life and the people this is the place to go. Go on a sunny day find a good bench and watch the people, bikes, skaters, dogs and life go by. It was wonderful and has given us loads of memories.
Laid back. Really lovely park where everyone seems really happy. BBQ's, music, beer and the rest are all allowed to create a relaxed atmosphere in the sun.
Great place for the kids to have a run around. Perfect place for a picnic, a stroll and a sun bathe. Our 10 year old liked the play area and the den building section. Lovely.

Overrated but nice. The park is pretty but it's not as grand as most of London's and there are some serious undesirables hanging about there too. You can get a hot dog fresh for a couple of euros though but no where to pee as is often the case in this city

Nice for jogging, bikeing, walking and poor pleasure. A nice oasis nearby the main attractions like van Gogh, Rijksmuseum etc.,
but as anywhere: be aware and look out for all the bikers who eeks to belive they wncthecark and the city....

all life is here?. Whether you hire a bike or jog or just stroll do visit.
All life is here from the weird to the wonderful, just enjoy.

Peacefully Fun.... The power of the ambience inside Vondelpark successfully bewitches the visitors. The feelings of safe and comfort felt all the way through. It changes the mood into the most positive core; whether you like it or not, you will smile all the time, it's just peacefully fun...

one of the best parks I've seen. This is a beautiful and big park, with lots of nature for its surroundings, Its the perfect place to go for a nice stroll, a jog or a bike ride, lots of people come here to do those things, it was a pretty busy park when I was there, maybe because it was a nice sunny day.

Tranquil retreat. During our recent visit to Amsterdam we visited this park for a tranquil retreat from the busy city and we were glad we did.
The park is very peaceful, with beautiful gardens and lakes. Very popular with cyclists and runners.

Average Park. The park has nice gates that make you think it might be something special. However, once you enter it is just an average park. There are some lakes in the park and it is fairly large, but nothing special.
simply beautiful. relaxed and relaxing atmosphere, cool people, spectacular view! loved it. good ice cream and hot dogs. huuuuge park with a lot to do and see :)

Ongoing summer of love. What a fun place. Somehow the spirit of the 1960s and Woodstock seems to live on in the Vondelpark. Whether you want to people watch, tight rope walk (yes, really) or just relax, this is the place to go.

Good place to chill. A good place to see a slice of "real" Amsterdam life. People walking there dogs, cycling to work or school, people jogging or doing keep fit and loads of people just relaxing and eating a sandwich or reading a book. There is always a spot to sit. Please take your rubbish with you when leaving. This is the only down side :)

Large Park for kids to playing. This is a nice large park to stroll around with a few places for the kids to play and a couple of places to have a drink and a snack. Just make sure your on the right side of the path to avoid a collision with all the joggers and cyclists.

Perfect for running or exploring. Close to many hotels, this was a great place to run a few laps and take in a well-designed green space. Like everywhere else in Amsterdam, cyclists take priority so be prepared to run on the side of the wide lanes. Be especially attentive around the entry/exits to the park where bike lanes merge and it is easy to be caught in the wrong place quickly.
Great for Kids. Lovely play area for kids and very clean and pretty. If the weather is nice then it is a lovely way to pass the afternoon.

Larks in the parks. On a sunny day in Amsterdam, unseasonably warm, had an impromptu visit to Vondelpark, hadn't been in years. It's just a park of course, but somewhere nice to sit when in the southern part of the town, good place for a picnic.
lovely park. beautiful park but look out for the motorcyclists who are not supposed to drive through there! Very peaceful and yet only minutes away from the lively places!
A must see!. A busy yet most chilled atmospheric park you will ever visit! Take a bike, a bottle of wine and a friend and enjoy the stunning views!
Fantastic Vondelpark. I was fortunate to stay at the Hotel Vossius Park directly next to Vondelpark , which is a must place to visit with it's fantastic relaxing atmosphere and great walks.

Beautiful stroll on a sunny Sunday morning. Lovely park to stroll around just beware of the bikes and joggers. Eating places within the park for sandwiches etc. Children's area was well used. Good way to spend an hour or two

Love the open air. There is nothing more Dutch than a bike ride through Vondelpark. This place is wide and open and busy with people coming home from/to work or families coming home from violin lessons or school. It is a great way to see a beautiful part of the city . Its safe and even though it was a little cool in March, its perfect weather for bike riding
Great Park. Great Park to walk, ride a bycicle or just take a coffe or a fresh ment tea.Very relaxing and allows you to escape of the city confusion.

Clean, peaceful, relaxing setting. This park is very well kept. Nice trails, beautiful views. I went there on a Sunday and there were quite a lot of people enjoying the park but it was not overwhelming or crowded.

Beautiful park . We went to Vondelpark on our first day in Amsterdam. Beautiful weather and a lovely park to walk around. We sat by one of the lakes and several Herons flew down and fished while people were walking past very closely. Lots going on. We had a beer and coffee at one of the cafés in the park.
Nice walk. It is a very big park, we only went round a part of it, lots of lakes to walk around with some pretty scenery to look at

Very nice park close to leidseplein. This park is situated about 60 meters below sealevel! A bigpark where you can run, walk or bike. There is a area for barbequing. You can even see some birds and small animales in certain area of the park,. There are restuarants in the area. It is a relaxing area, bur can be crowded.

Fantastic place to run, walk or simply read a book. Vondelpark is the largest park in Amsterdam, very populated everyday and at any hour. Rounded by emblematic buildings, Volden Park offers to visitants a calmed atmosphere and fantastic widely opened spaces. It's also a beauty place for take photos and watch lake ducks.

Nice Walk.. Me and my girlfriend had a nice walk around the park, the spring bulbs were nice and it was well kept. It is however just a park like many others and isn't special in any way. It was fairly busy as well and it wasn't a particularly nice day so I can only imagine it being packed in the summer. Good to kill some time but you won't be missing out if you have other things to do.
Peaceful. Had a lovely walk around vondelpark. Excellent place for a morning run or picnic. Beautiful spring bulbs scattered through the gardens
Disappointing. I think the gardeners need to take strip to London to see how to make a park look attractive to visitors wanting to walk around and just look.

Great to ride around by bicycle (3.3km in total).. Nice cafe. Lovely green community space in the middle of the city.In March not much foliage as the trees had been pruned so it was relaxing to spend time here as well as in the Botanical Gardens.
Great place to chill!. Apart from some crazies in the park, this is a great park to just sit around and chill with some friends, especially on a nice sunny day :)

Perfect for a bike ride. We had hired bikes and decided to go for a picnic in a nearby park,I would recommend taking your bike around the park as it is large but also because it's just so enjoyable riding round such a beautiful place. One of my favourite parts of our whole trip.
You have to visit this park!. The best park in Amsterdam, it's a pity to visit the city and not have a walk here, especially in spring-summer. Just sit on a bench and enjoy the Amsterdam spirit!
Lush green and huge!. Great lush green park with huge amounts of space to roam about. Our kid ran his heart out in the open spaces and still didnt had enough. Good spot for a private picnic too.

Enjoyed the park for a quick bike ride.. Nice park in central Amsterdam, we hired some bikes from MacBike (nr Hard Rock Cafe). The park is not massive like the parks in London but we enjoyed our ride. Do try the Mint Tea at the cafe.

most beautiful park of Amsterdam. Vondelpark exists 150 years. It is the biggest and most beautiful park of Amsterdam. As soon as it is warm enough lots of people spend many hours in the park. Also for running it is very suitable.

Lovely Park and Restaurant. The park is well maintained and has two cafes - one a round house which is quite basic and the other the Melkhuis is a bit more upmarket with seating next to the pond. The park is occupied by storks and green birds which look like Paraquats(?) and flying Dutchmen (and women) on their bikes but all of which add to the experience.

A heaven. What a nice and huge place to relax or ride a bicycle...Green , water , ducks and calm...food and drinks are available and entry is free...after you finish with museums , go there to relax and to enjoy the nature

Beautiful bicycle ride. We were told we had fo visit the park and im glad we did! We hired bicycles near our hotel and rode through the park in July. Was very beauitul! Would be nice to take a picnic there and enjoy the view.
Little ducks. Nice park with a few attractions and ducksFiremen on display the day we visited which pleased herself Quite romanticCyclists think they own it -beware

Lovely park.. We spent two evenings here in the sun. It's full of people jogging, running, cycling, playing frisbee etc. It has a great family atmosphere and is huge for wandering around. We didnt get very far into the park but we passed 2 restaurants and a few vendors with icecream and drinks. A lovely (and free) way to spent a few hours.

Too early!!. I am sure the Vondelpark would be nice once the trees and flowers are out. We visited in early March and it was just a nice stroll. A few drunks hung around the pond/lake in the middle but didn't make too much fuss. Great for a run if that's your thing! Still had to watch out for bikes!!!
