Great place to relax. When we were backpacking through Europe, Vondelpark was one of our favorite places. It was a great place to relax, have a picnic, and the stage had entertaining performances. Would highly recommend visiting Vondelpark when in Amsterdam.

lovely park. Stopped off at this park on a Sunday when the sun was still around but the temperature was starting to drop. Real shame I didn't stop hear earlier when it was sunny and warm.In the park there was still hundreds of people of all age groups enjoying the sunshine and the park. From jogging/running, cycling, skating, football, hoola hooping, snoozing, relaxing and chilling, smoking and drinking. Perfect for a stroll around the park, I only did small section of the park before sitting and did a bit of people watching for a bit.
Lovely green space to walk run or cycle in!. A beautiful green space near to the Rijksmuseum, a place where you cam sit and relax in the sunshine and watch the Amsterdammers taking exercise!

Beautiful. It is nice to either walk around the whole park or rent bikes for the day and bike around. There are plenty of kids and lots of joggers. There are also no shortage of flowers blooming around the park.
lovely walk around the park. A nice quiet place away from the city... lots of green, nice cafes, nice ponds, birds and animals. Everyones happy... definitely recommend.
great park!. Beautiful park just outside the main hustle and bustle.. Will surely hire a bike next time! It was a warm winter day, like most of Amsterdam this place is chilled!

Nice Park. Tranquil, and calm area, great for a run or gentle cycle.
Nice little cafe inside, great for the kids or an Irish coffee on a cool sping day.

Very calm. A very nice park, and very calm considering the amount of people there, and a lovely green area in the middle of the city. Me and my friends spent a happy and zen afternoon there after some of Amsterdam's speciality brownies.
Nice park on the Edge of Amsterdam City Centre. Great place for a walk or a run also good for people watching. Surprised to see parrots this far north!

Paradise has a portaloo. This park can be beautiful in the summer. Certainly gives Amsterdam another dimension that, say, oosterpark or sarphatipark just don't. We particularly enjoyed riding around on yellow hire bikes

Small Central Park. Nice green place to be in the middle of the town, but be aware of all the joggers on the sunday morning! It looks like the Amsterdam Marathon is happening and not all joggers like the fact that non-joggers take a walk in their park.
Disappointing park. It's not a very pretty park and there wasn't anything to do in there if you didn't want to ride a bike. Maybe it was just the time of year that we went.

very romantic. On our way to the Hesp, Café Welling and Verdigo, we happened upon Vondelpark. In a city of mostly bricks and cobblestones, the park is refreshingly green. The day we walked thru the park it was cloudy and romantic and you can people watch on a bench or as you stroll. Café Verdigo was closed due to it being under construction, but will be back.
Nice place to relax. Great park, it was cold, but definitely a good place to have a picnic and enjoy the city. A must see while visiting Amsterdam

Paradise Nature. The park's greenery and plants will make you wander around. This park is perfect for cycling or just having a stroll. It will make you feel as if you are in the midst of a jungle. A must visit, considering its free!

Beautiful cycle. Large clean and tidy parkland with nice lakes and wildlife. Many pathways and excellent to cycle. Hired bikes and spent 3 hours in the park. A couple of nice bars in the park with terraced areas so a little refreshment could be had during the cycle!. Lovely place and highly recommended.

Vondelpark. If you have a lot of time on your hands. I would recommend to go to this park, it is nice and quiet and full of wildlife, family's and cyclists. It is a huge park so if your not a big walker then maybe go on a bike.

A beautiful, relaxing walk.. A huge green area park where you can have a very beautiful walk. Lots to see including many species of ducks and birds. We loved this park, its so relaxing and different from the centre of Amsterdam. We stopped by the water's edge and just looked at the amazing view of the park. Definetely recommend it to everyone.

Great place to escape the crowds. Lots of paths and open spaces with lakes and ponds. Great if like me you relish a morning run - although beware that first thing in the morning it seems to be used by about half the cyclists in Amsterdam as a route to get to work. As a visitor from the UK I was pleasantly surprised to find no litter , graffiti or vandalism. The Dutch are just so civilised.
Green Oasis in Amsterdam. The park is a green lung close to the center of the city. Just peaceful and ideal to get some rest and even worth to see in winter time.

lovely park. We spent a few hours in Vondel park although the weather wasn't very good. Large park plenty of wildlife. During the day we stopped off and had food and drinks in 2 lovely places one by the waters edge and other café was on different levels overlooking park. Would be lovely park in summer months.

Cycle round the park!. What a great place to cycle around and take a time out from your sight seeing. Really pretty and relaxing. Not that Amsterdam is too hectic, but it's a nice place to just cruise around and appreciate.

Amazing Park, Beautiful Place. We went in February when the air was very cold and the park during sunset was beautiful. A really romantic walk through the park before hopping on the tram at the other side. If you fancy a few hours quiet time while visiting Amsterdam you couldn't go wrong here. We've also visited in the summer and it's a lovely place to sit out in the sun and not be disturbed as it's so big.
Beautiful park to sit and relax. Beautiful park in the city centre. Great place to have a picnic and watch the world go past, or just have a recuperate before hitting the city shopping again!

Lovely Park. Very clean and pretty park that stretches for what seems like miles. it was very pretty and a popular cycle route. There is lots of art areas and plenty of photo opportunities. It would be lovely in the summer to sit and read a book in the sun and watch the world go by.

Vondelpark - would be better in spring/summer!. Lovely layout - but I think we just visited at the wrong time of year (Feb) as it was a little bland scenically. Can imagine it's beautiful in spring/summer. My daughter wanted to go on the "Space Age" slides at the far end that she had read about - but they were not very fast or exciting!However we still enjoyed our walk, & seeing the locals walking, cycling & jogging through the park.

A great place for a Sunday stroll. A great park, much bigger than I expected. You could spend the when afternoon walking around it. Lots of water and little bridges. A play area for the little ones and a couple of cafés where you can sit and have a drink. It's very popular with joggers and bike riders.

our daily walk. a great place for us to walk everyday through before setting for the day visit in the Dutch capital. Plenty of places to look at, water features, a couple of great venues for lunch or a coffee, great kids playgrounds and great art here there and every where around the park, a great start of the day!
Very pleasant vibe. Nice place for a glass of wine, good conversation and people watching. Soak in the personality of Amsterdam.
Great jogging. It feels like half Amsterdam is jogging - many many people run here at Vondelpark. And it is no problem for woman alone either - even in the evening.

Great for a bike ride. This park is close to Mac Bikes cycle hire. (near Hard Rock Café) Perfect for a picturesque and safe one hour cycle ride, Surprized and delighted to see green parrots/parakeets perched in the trees. Snowdrops were very pretty but I imagine this park is even better in the summer.
Lovely walk. Lovely walk around, ideal on a nice warm day, plenty of sites to see, central location. Nothing to dislike, kept clean

Excellent park to escape the hustle and bustle. This was a great park. We went for a walk around it one morning. We sat in the café and had coffee and walked the world go by. Great way to recharge the batteries after a dayt or two of visiting museams etc.
Gorgeous!. Beautiful! Definately visit if you are nearby. Just a lovely way to spend a free morning in Amsterdam and best of all, FREE!

Nice park for some peaceful moment. Our tourist guide at Amsterdam, told us that this is the oldest park in Amsterdam, built in 1850. It’s a huge park spread over several acres of land with several people strolling around leisurely. The park offers some wonderful privacy to families and couples who are looking for some good time together. I had visited the park with my Fiancée on our Amsterdam tour last year. She had a conference to attend for a day and I came along with her for Holidays. The canals had boats in them and the weather was wonderful, especially for a day outing. We spent half a day at the park and came back towards late noon. We did have some snacks at a quaint café just outside the park. Nice place.
great for people watching. Visiting the park in February was going to be a bit on the cold side. regardless the park is still great for a walk and watching all the cyclists pass by.
Lovely park!. Huge park, full of all kinds of people and birds. Not too many cyclists either! We spotted lots of pairs of love birds which was lovely for Valentine's Day!

A lovely morning cycle. Cycled around Vondelpark, at roughly 10:30am on a Saturday. The park is wonderful space for dog walkers, runner, exercise classes and cyclists. Would love to spend more time here, maybe in the warmer months.

Nice park for a leisurely stroll. Nice open space for a stroll (away from the hustle and bustle). Lots of lakes and water fowl. Well worth the visit if only to see the wild green rose-ringed parakeets!g

Relaaaaaax & walk. Take double looks on your shoulder before you change direction, as it looks a run way for bicycles, if you are from outside, always choose to go by the terrain walk across the road (I guess that it is supposed where we should walk)Beside of that, the seagulls, the ducks, the crows, the trees, the lakes, the greens.... oooh yeah, extremely relaxing).It's a go.If the weather allows, take a rest and a picnic on the grass

Enjoying a lovely walk. I went with my friend there and the park is beautiful. We kept on walking and talking. It was beautiful.One could take out his dog there, go for a bicycle ride, go for a good jog.What I dislike is that I couldnt find any public toilet
Vondel park. Some renovations going on in the area, but still a wonderful zone of peace and tranquilly in a busy city. Excellent for our toddler to chase ducks in!
lovely to walk. if you have a nice day to walk through here is lovely in the spring the flowers are amazing look forward to visiting again in the summer

mini kensington gardens. similar atmosphere as in kensington gardens, always many people present, many joggers, dogs, doves, old trees, water.Enjoyed my walk and the surroundings, only people with bikes or wheelchairs cannot get out on the sides as there are just stairs thereYou have to walk through it's entire length
Simply beautiful. Next to the museums, this park is a wonderland that you should totally visit. If possible, do it in the sunset, the view will be breathtaking!

Simply a good experience. A very nice park, very easy to be knocked down by bicycles! LoL
It's a huge park so if you wanna have some privacy it's simple as well. There's a nice cafe in there where you can relax or have break after running. It's very fun sittin' down on a bench and lookin' at the different kind of strolling-people.

A great space to walk.. We walked from one end to the other, cutting out walking around the roads and vehicles. Many people walk through, with dogs, children etc. Lovely areas to sit and watch the wildlife. Lovely large lake.

Staying in this area, clean and quiet. I probably should not be rating this today. The weather is not the best and challenges you to comment on the outdoors. Very rainy today and a trifle chilling to the bones.
Walk round park. visited in winter so trees were bare yet it was still interesting with cafe and bandstand - saw herons, green parrots.

Best place on Queen's Day. This was my favorite part of Queen's Day. The canals with boats and crowds are fun, but Vondelpark was beautiful and friendly. There were many different snacks to eat for very little money, lots of adorable Dutch children selling juice, fruits, or even manicures, grass to sit on and relax, and just amazing people watching.
If you are there during the summer.... During the summer Vondelpark is a great place to run and relax. The park is clean, flat and beutiful. When I was there (summer) there was several concerts.

Great location to spend a hot summer day. The Netherlands do not have many hot summer days in a year, but when you are around in Amsterdam and it happens to be such a hot day this would be the place to spend at least a couple of hours in. Great for walking and relaxing. People just bring their towels along like on the beach, but then chill out in the grass. Great experience.
great for a run when visiting the city. felt safe running as a single female, beware of the manic cyclists though! Lovely and flat and one loop of the park is about 5k.

walking in di park. nothing to dislike this is a beautiful park, im summer time theres concerts, plays, all kind things goes on this park. and the best part its not like in America where you can not be in the parks after 20:00uhrs, WHAT IS A PARK FOR!!

Go in the summer. A big open air park that is just a gorgeous space in the city. There are restaurants/cafes there but it's nice to just sit and take it all in. I loved riding a bike thru the park and took that shortcut everyday on a 4 day stay. Spend some time in the sun in this space and it's a lovely distraction from city hustle and bustle.

Very quiet and relaxing. We walked from our hotel through the park to the city centre, It was very quiet and relaxing hearing the birds tweeting. It was busy with dog walkers, joggers and bike riders but the park is big enough for you to enjoy the hussle & bussle from the city.
beautiful grounds. we visited there early in the morning before the Van Gogh museum opened. beautiful grounds and fountain.

Rent a bike & go!. This place is wonderful. Its so peaceful. We started to walk around the park at the beginning but then we decided a bike would be the best option - it was amazing. Just riding along being able to take in all the surroundings was fantastic. Would recommend an hour or so here :) A picnic on a good day would be ideal also
Get a bike!. It's a wonderful, large park! Rent a bike and ride around, or go jogging. Too large for just a walk.

Great for an afternoon stroll. My buddies and I stayed just a few blocks from here for a couple of days. We took a nice stroll through, settled down and threw the Frisbee around and hung out for a couple of hours. It was really temperate with plenty of small ponds, trail off-shoots, animals, etc. We even had a couple of folks promoting their band by cycling around in a push-cart type setup handing out cards which was nice. I'd highly recommend spending an afternoon enjoying your friends, the environment and Amsterdam in this park.

So Peaceful. When you enter the Vondelpark, you may feel like it is an ordinary park at the beginning. But after you spend a couple of hours there, you will see people reading, sunbathing, or just chilling around. You can make a bike tour, and have a rest after. Highly recommended to spend daytime in Amsterdam.

Great ride through. Rent a bicycle for a ride around town and go through this park. Bring bread for the birds, maybe a blanket to sit on... Even just riding through is a real joy. Practicing your riding skills here is a good idea
Rent a bike here. If like us you don't fancy negotiating the numerous tram lines and cycles tracks of the city - rent your bike a cycle around Vondel Park - perfect way to pass a morning
Lovely walk in the park. Definitely worth going to have a walk around, little ponds, greenery, relaxing. Recommend taking something from the coffee shops there....

Beautiful place. Watch out for the bikes though. They're everywhere. Lots of dogs too. A beautiful walk through the park that I can imagine would be incredible is summer.
Great coffee in the cafe too.
Beautiful. Was lovely for a winters stroll although I think it would be lovely for a relaxing couple of hours in the summer or a bike ride though... must visit while in Amsterdam :)

2 hours flew by. This fantastic park is free for all to enjoy, numerous lakes and varied bird and foul on show including a couple of local herons. There's a bar/cafe on one side and at a leisurely pace covering the whole park 2 hours will quickly pass, watch out for all the runners, cyclist and dogs and you'll be fine

Awesome park!. We visited vondelpark with my boyfriend! We were so excited with this park that we visited it twice! We went there with our bikes! The park is enormous if you are on foot then you will need 2-3 hours to see it! I think that the bike is a good choice because you could see the whole park in an hour! There we saw ducks and many spices of birds! People there go for a walk some of them with their dogs, other go for running and other just riding their bikes!If you have children Vondelpark has 6 playgrounds! It is the best park i've ever visit!!! If i lived in Amsterdam certainly i would visted Vondelpark every day!!! I recommend it without doubt!! I wouldn't suggest you to visit Vondelpark in the evening i some people told us it becomes dangerous.
Relaxing spot. has a great cafe in the heart of the park, has plenty of walking area, be ready to spend a few hours in there and just chill and relax

Huge city park. We enjoyed a break from sightseeing by having a coffee and relaxing on a park bench. Lots of joggers and cyclists. Would have like to rent a bike but time did not permit. Wonderful green space-Amsterdam's version of Central Park
Lovely park all year round. I love strolling through this park every time I visit Amsterdam. Wonderful paths and beautiful ever changing colours - and a beautiful Picasso to boot!

Lovely area for a bike ride.. My friend and I hired bikes out for the day and spent a bit of time in Vondelpark. It's pretty big and has got some great open paths which are perfect if you want to ride side-by-side or practice before you get onto the streets. We found it very tranquil and much more enjoyable than riding through the Amsterdam streets. Stopped for a rest, lovely area. Definitely somewhere to go if you are on a bike, if not, go if you want nature, skip if you aren't fussed.
Great for a bike ride or a run. Not too much green space in Amsterdam, I rented a bike and biked through this park it's lovely. Also saw a lot of runners, would have liked to do the same.

A beautiful park and place to relax. We rented bikes one day during our stay in Amsterdam and cycled through the park on a Sunday. The park was full of families, runners, skaters and cyclists, it was a wonderful experience and as the weather was nice (but cold) it was a lovely way to see the park. The park has roads / paths and only took 30 minutes to cycle. Well worth a visit on a nice day. There are 2 restaurants on the grounds if you want food / drink. Prices looked very reasonable.

Fantastic park with lots to see and do. Took me a long time to actually go inside this park, a thing I have regretted not having done before. It's quiet, spacious, beautiful and has many surprises, it's more like being abroad (outside Holland) were it not for the cyclists. Nice entrances and exits, beautifully designed or layed out. An oasis in a small/big capital town.

Pretty park. This park is perfect for BBQs( in selected areas), lying on the grass and reading a book, exercising, drinking beers/wine, family picnics, cycling. It is a huge park with a road of running and cycling, lakes, trees and restaurants. It has a very relaxed and chilled out atmosphere. Perfect for the long summer nights.

Oasis at the center. I was there during the summer of 2013 with a group of friends. We got lucky and had a perfect weather for the week, +30c and sun was shining. The park is awesome! Lot's of grass and open space to have picnics, area was clean and cozy. People were extremely friendly and happy. Next time I visit Amsterdam, this is definetly the place to stop for a while. Authentic park full of life and happy people. I recommend.

a lovely park in the middle of the city. Great for an cycling, Amsterdam style, if u don't feel so confident on the roads. The natural foliage around the pond makes it a beautiful picnic spot. A nice place for a breather in between museum visits.

Beautiful park. Definitely stop by here when you're in the city. Large park, can walk around and take in the scenery for as long as you want. Wonderful to just lay on the grass and people-watch and bicycle-watch as well. Very well-maintained.

The Vondelpark. This is a wonderful park...the largest in Amsterdam, Opportunities to stroll, see some sculpture, nice playgrounds, rent a bike and get some exercise like the locals, lots of jogging too, lots of bird life. A relaxing time in Amsterdam.

Beautiful Park. Vondel Park is absolutely beautiful, my wife and I hired bikes from our hotel around the corner this park was our first stop. Its an easy park to navigate, I would suggest going around it on a bike is best. This park should not be missed!
Mind out for the bikes!!. Its a pleasant park. We went in the Winter but I would think it is far more impressive during the other three seasons.

Lovely City Park. This is a great place to come with kids, as a runner or biker or to walk around as a tourist. Vondel Park has amazing trees and lakes, pretty houses that don't take away from the scenery and people of all types peddling through the streets of the park. If you are visiting Amsterdam, definitely take a minute to grab lunch and coffee at a nearby cafe and stroll through the park to get a sense of daily life, one of my favorite parts of the city.

I Love This Park. Vondel Park is a beautiful and wide open expanse close to Leidseplein. You can get there by tram 1,2,5 from Centraal Station.The park is the perfect place to take a stroll and people watch, particularly on a Sunday afternoon. I also like to ride my bicycle in there while I listen to my favourite music. Vondel Park should not be missed and is a perfect haven in an already wonderful city.

Beautiful, calm park in the midst of busy Amsterdam. This was such a nice park to visit and to take a short break from the hustle and bustle of the streets of Amsterdam. I'd recommend walking the path and if you're able to stop at the small restaurant at the center of the park. It would be a wonderful place to stop for a cup of coffee or perhaps a pastry. (We did not stop there because we'd just had lunch!)

Pleasant winter stroll. We visited this on the last morning of a short stay in Amsterdam. We travelled out by tram line 1 and back by tram line 2, so we could walk diagonally across a good part of the park. Even on a winter weekday it looked attractive and well cared for and there were quite a number of people around. We saw a variety of ducks on the ponds and were fascinated by the green parakeets! It seems a very relaxing green space, easily accessible, and gave us a lovely break between sightseeing in the centre and our trip back to England.
Very pretty. This a large park, and I imagine in the summer would be great for chilling out with a picnic and some drinks.Definitley worth a visit, easy to get to.

Great city park. This is a nice city park. Even on a very cold day in November there were plenty of people around just walking, riding bikes, etc. It was great to see the locals make full use of the park all year round.

Enjoyable Winter Stroll. Walked through here in the middle of winter, beautiful park with lots of bridges and ponds. My boyfriend and I especially liked climbing and taking pictures on top of the wooden playground.
Awsome !. Take the time to walk and take some pictures. It is an amaizing park, a lot of sights and green lowns. A lot of kinds of animls, kids playing, running. Simply fun !

It's the Amesterdam's London Hyde Park. Beautiful park to walk through in a very pleasant and gorgeous residential area. We were staying at the Park Plaza hotel so every time we were heading to central Amsterdam we walked through the park and again on our way back. Lovely t see so many many people on the bikes and running and just going for a stroll. Architecture of the houses around it is stunning as well.

Relaxing Park. A great park in the city. There are lots of play areas for kids. Lots of trees and nice way to relax in the city. There is a cafe in the center that serves drinks and has a patio area. Lot of people walking dogs, jogging, riding bikes, feeding the ducks in the ponds, and playing on the grass.

Lovely way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a crazy city with an incredible nightlife, however it is also a truly beautiful city that has a lot more to offer than just the red light district which can be lost on a lot of younger travellers. Vondelpark is an oasis in the middle of the city where you can spend a leisurely afternoon. It isn't as far away as it looks on the map only about a 15 minute walk from the palace, I think it is amuse see in Amsterdam.
Beautiful!. Beautiful park in Amsterdam with cozy little pit stops for coffee and pastry! lovely walk to the museum district from Overtoom.

Great relaxing location. I like everything about this park. the place is well maintain so the place is always green. People come over the for jogging and bike riding and the atmosphere is perfect.
There is a coffee house in the middle of the park in a great location so don't forget to stop for a drink,

Gorgeous place. It was nice to get away from all the hassle and bustle of the city, to escape to this little piece of paradise was so special. Museums close by and good transport as well. A must see for garden and wilderness lovers!

Great green piece. A great place to bike on...
No need guided trip, just bike, stop at the nice rest points and enjoy the athmosphere which was really great.

Brilliant park. We visited the park with bikes we had hired and it was a great place to ride them as it was very large. There are many benches and open spaces to sit. There was a very nice atmosphere, definitely worth a visit in the summer.

Best for meditation and sport. My favorite pkace in busy Amsterdam, and it always had some nice events on weekends. The park has a jogging/cycling path that stretches over 10km. Nature is impossibly beautiful everywhere you look
Nice park. Went round it on hire bikes, nice park to visit and just chill. Lots of people about on that Sunday mind, all with the same idea!

Great place to walk and enjoy the nature.. Vondelpark is a great place to take walks and enjoy the nature. As in any other place in Amsterdam, be aware of bikes!
I'm definitely going back in the summer time.
wonderful green lung of the city . Especially when the sun is shining: the perfect retreat!!! Even in December we enjoyed some fresh air and the nature there during our trip.
Great place to bike. The paths in the park are wide and perfect for biking. It is a nice break from the high pressure biking on the streets near traffic and throngs of cyclists.
Summer Essential. This is a summer essential in Amsterdam when the sun is out - grilling, picnic, sports, bikes, kids, fantastic!

Relaxing. Just a walking distance of 5 minutes from the centre of the city is this beautiful park. A perfect place to have a morning or evening walk. It was very near to our hotel and we got curious when we reached at the gate of it. Walking walking and walking takes you to the other part of the city. Well mainained park with resting places and water scenes. This must be a perfect place for a summer picnic. A lot of people were moving around. Even locals use this park to cross over from one end to another.
I Love This Place!. Such a charming and lovely place to visit in Amsterdam. We visited during July and the weather was gorgeous - we spent a good 2 days here just sunbathing and chilling - loved it.

Big and beautiful park. Better to rent a bike to visit the park, it is really big and nice, you may find some monuments and statues along the roads, it is open not sure if it is 24 hrs, but people were still strolling really late and very early.
Big. Although I did not travel the length its good place to go for a quiet walk on some down from the main city. Beautiful houses nearby, along with museums.
Great for a wander. Lovely park to wander through whatever time of year. There are ponds and trees etc. A Sunday stroll was highly enjoyable.
Awesome place to chill. Would bike into the city on a nice day, pick a spot and have a few beers and smokes with friends. Perfect place, its really big and beautiful.

don't miss a bike ride or stroll here. This is one of the more charming parks in all of Europe. Known for the hippy hangouts of the sixties, it is now home to every class of traveler and Amsterdam resident. A joy.

Serene spot in Amsterdam. It was late Autumn when I visited so I didn't see even one single person in the park. It was strange because I think the weather was great. The park itself was beautiful and serene. It was good for picnic. =)
A beautiful park. I went through this beautiful park by bike, along with many locals and tourist. Amsterdam is ideal for cycling. The park is always buzzing with people, a great place to be.

Very good for a picnic !. Nice and relaxing place. Best to visit in late spring, summer and early autumn. You can walk around enjoyung beautiful scenery and relaxing atmosphere of the park. On weekends I used to buy some "take away" food and enjoyed it with friends sitting on the grass near the pond with ducks, swangs and other birds :)Vondel park is a good place not only for a relaxing day but also for an active day with family, children and friends.
For Spring and Summer. In December, nothing more than a place to do your jogging. Cold and windy. Should be a nice place to spend some hours during the spring and summer.

Sunday in the part. We rented bikes and spent a delightful Sunday afternoon in the park where all the locals go - couples, families with children, all ages. People walking their dogs, riding bikes, roller blading. You can be super active or just leisurely walk through the gardens. There's a cafe in the park if you want to have refreshments. Also interesting birds, fountains, and gardens,
pandj amsterdam visit.. A beautiful park area in the middle of town, well laid out with a nice atmosphereGreat paths and very popular.

Best spot in Amsterdam. it is really nice place to walk and have rest!it is much bigger than you think!if you rent a bike will much easyier to see all around!But i allways prefer to walk to walk around than you can see all the beauty of this park.Specially in a suny day it is perfect place fot your meetings pr spending a nice day around!

Nice park, bigger than you think. I had an appointment on the west side of the park and took the 310 bus from the airport into town which put me down on the east side. I had not realised how long the park was - a good 25 minutes walk from one side to the other, amid all the cyclists and joggers. Very pretty park though, greenery, trees, ponds, ducks - nice! Eat your picnic lunch there in summer. Toilets at the Western entrance.
Go here!. Rent a bike for the day, bring a picnic lunch and ride around Vondelpark for a day. It's a great place to meet up or wind down at the end of a day exploring.

Wonderful Green Space. Vondelpark is a great place for a short stroll (1hr tops), a picnic or a bit of exercise . With most of Amsterdam taken up by buildings, canals and roads its a treat to find such an expansive green space, even though as a walker or runner you still have to fight the bicycles. It can easily be "just a park" if you're used to wide open spaces or haven't been in cities for long, but short of Amsterdam Bos, there's not much nature, which makes this a nice place to be.

Greatest spot in Amsterdam on a sunny day. Fabulous place in Amsterdam. Great historic park with nice terraces and a nice mix of people. The Vondelpark is for everybody. The rich people living around it, the business people who work there, students with wine bought at the supermarkt, the youngsters with their joints and cell phones, plus there are four great playgrounds for children. Always so much to see and do. During the summer months there are free performances at the stage in the center of the park..

Peaceful place in the city. Great park, near to Leidsplein. In the summer you can find a lot of people that makes BBQ in the sunny days. There are a lot of good fileds where to stay with your friends, some playgrounds on the trees, a panoramic bar. Good mainteinance makes the park peaceful.

Fun place to stop by. In the middle of Amsterdams museum district, it is great for the token "I AMSTERDAM" photo and includes a couple over priced cafes. If you are hungry, walking a few blocks over in nearly any direction offers a larger variety of cuisine and friendlier prices. The little playground has a slide and jungle gym, which is great if you are traveling with children who need a break from the city and historical areas.

Great. An amazing park right in the middle of the city. I was there on a Sunday and there were a lot of people jogging, walking their dogs biking and enjoying the lush green areas. It is great for a picnic and relaxing if the weather allows it.

This is a great place to relax. Londoners would recognize Vondel park as the "green park" of Amsterdam, and there is lots going on. We've enjoyed concerts there, movies at the restored old theatre, long walks and plenty of bike rides. its not exotic, but its a summer haven.
Nice park. The bf and I had a wander round the park on our final day. Such a lovely park. I would love to see it again during spring and/or summer

its awonder park haha. wooow this was too wonderful iwas their with mwanje steven we were meeting some friends en it was just perfect because even cats en dogs hahah even babies were out enjoying,people were all over every where so it was kind of colourful because the weather was good that day so people were sun bathing ,biking around , some were playing football ,playing music en drinkin that was just owesome
Awesome. Very very very beautiful park. Would reccomend everyone who ever visit amsterdam to go to the see that park!!!
A really Wonder park !. The ideal place to rest and relax... in summer time !Wonderful for a morning run, or a walk with your love, or just for laying down on the grass and watch the clouds !

beautiful park. Vondelpark is the most popular park in the Netherlands and it's located in the Amsterdam Oud-Zuid. you are allowed at Vondelpark to have picnics, but dispose of your rubbish properly,daytime recreation, barbeques, acoustic music, cycling and skating, but only on asphalt paths and not on the grassand sunbathing everywhere...The dogs are welcome but on a leash near playgrounds and you have to scoop your dog's poop! Instead is prohibited selling food, driving a scooter, moped or car and staying overnight or campingThere is an open air theatre with shows from June until August and several bar/restaurant

An oasis. Just like NY's Central Park, the Vondelpark is an oasis smack in the middle of the city. It stretches for a couple of kilometers and is quite beautiful in all seasons. Of course, it is most crowded in summer, with places for BBQ or just to hang out. You can find early morning joggers, strollers, tourists - the lot. Accessible for bicycles, but not for other means of transport.

Green City Center. Great place to relax from the hectic city life in Amsterdam. Walk, skate, cycle, wheeler or skeeler around the park, sit in the grass, enjoy a fresh cup of coffee at one of the terraces, watch street artists do their thing. You haven't been to Amsterdam without visiting this park in the heart of town...When you enter the Vondelpark through its main gate, find the scaled model of the building as shown in the picture attached...
great park. Fantastic park if the weather permits... or the turists. It can get quite full in summer but if you are in nice company is a great place to be...

Join the Amsterdam people in the cities garden.. This is where the people of Amsterdam go to run, bbq, drink, walk, meet friends, play soccer, frisbee, bootcamp, play loud music, rollerblade/skate, etc!

Green oasis. This is a beautiful park in which to take a stroll or ride a bike. There are lots of paths going off the main road to explore. The Groot Melkhuis is a great spot in the middle of the park to get a quick snack or cappucino.

Wrong address. You either visited the wrong park or tagged tge wrong place !!!!the real vondel park is really huge park just behind museumplein.
I walked to there this morning. No thanks to address aubmitted

Lovely park for all.. Lovely green space for all...locals, families, tourists. Can get very busy with cyclists at times, like all places in Amsterdam. Loved running here, even in a wild storm one morning! Can get boring after a while if you are used to hills however!! Playgrounds are rustic but kids love it.
Hire a bike and off you go. We went in the colder months, I can imagine how beautiful it would be in the summer. You must hire a bike and ride through it, pack a picnic and do what you please.

One of my favorite parks in Europe. I love this park because it feels endless and it's a taste of heaven in a city.
This park is converted into a huge open
stage during queens day, free performances throughout the park and it's all creative people from 2 years old to 100.
Pretty any time. We walked through the park daily to get into the centre of Amsterdam and it was beautiful in the Winter so must be stunning in the Summer!

A nice park but it won't make our list of must-see attractions. In June our family of four (parents and sons 18 & 20) rented an apartment near Vondelpark. We arrived by plane on Sunday afternoon and a lot of places - including restaurants - closed early. We wandered into the park for something to do and hopefully something to eat! It was busy with locals enjoying the unusually warm weather. It was a nice enough park but really didn't have much to offer (starving) tourists. The Trip Advisor write up states, "a popular place for tourists and residents who can enjoy a variety of outdoor activities such as biking, hiking, jogging and picnicking" but since we weren't really doing any of those things and were, instead, desperate to find a restaurant open on a Sunday - we were disappointed. However, if we didn't log so many sight seeing miles and wanted an early morning jog this may well have been the spot. Eventually we came across a round stone building that turned out to be a cafe. We sat outside and each had a cold beer - that lifted our spirits some - before exiting the park. It turned out Vondelpark was not ideal for our first stop in Amsterdam. Sorry, Amsterdammers!

Beautiful park. We discovered the park when we hired bicycles from the yellow bike company. It is a lovely park in the middle of busy Amsterdam. It has benches to rest on and paths all through the park. It was busy with others on bikes and people walking through the park. It has a lot of art such as statues dotted around so there is always something to look at. Would recommend a stroll or cycle round the park if you are in Amsterdam.

A great park. super and clean park with interesting sculptures. It is a major thoroughfare for bikes but fortunately the dutch are tolerant of wandering tourists! Safe place, interesting, attractive and lively oasis in the city.

Amazing park very central. This park is Very centrally located near the leidseplein. For me it was just across the street as we stayed in Park Hotel. I love to go for early morning jogs and it is really perfect for that. You can easily do a 30 min or one hour track, It was always full of locals and tourists who were living in the area. It felt easily as bog as Hyde park. Minus point however is that it gets pretty dark at places in the nights. Hence I wouldn't go for my night walks.

Always something to do. The Vondelpark is a great park to relax, have a picnic or read a book. Wonderful for people watching as well. During the day it's lovely, especially in summer, I would be careful at night, especially alone.
Lovely. Our hotel was situated next door so had a stroll round..very pleasant,however,as with everywhere in Amsterdam..watch out for the bikes!!

Most amazing public park in Europe. This beats out any other public park in Europe in both beauty and upkeep. The Dutch are famous for their gardening and landscape art, and it shows through in the variety and quaint beauty each section of the park provides visitors. The sightseeing in terms of tourists and locals is top notch, as is the seclusion if you just want to write or relax in the sun. You're also a short walk from various historic neighborhoods and museums, should you want to wander. I always visit Vondelpark when I am coming through Amsterdam.

Pleasant ride on a bike.. We went all around this park with bicycles and there was much to see. A lot of people walking, running, cycling, playing with kids, with dogs... Next time I would take more time to enjoy this place!
Awesome. What a nice park. No matter how the weather is, you can make sure there will lots of people around. Coolest place in the city for your running!
Beautiful Park. Our accommodation was at the far end of the park, so strolling through on a sunny autumn morning was lovely.

Great on a bike!. Rented bikes for the day and cycled all around the park on a Sunday morning and it was like the whole city was cycling with you. Kids, adults, dogs in baskets etc, it was all there (except for the road rage). Great fun and a fantastic way to see the city.

Undescribable. A beautiful park in Amsterdam, we went cycling here and it was amazing. It has water bodies and different birds all around. People were jogging, cycling and sitting on the benches and enjoying this beautiful park. Amazing place, must be visited by every tourist.
It's just another park!. To me, it's just another park! Unless you have a lot of free time, else, it's not really necessary to be in the your top visiting list.
Very good place. This is a very big park with water and bridges. Is a good place to go if you wish to try truffles (magic mushrooms), which are sold in the SMART Shops.
Very large park. A lot of nature. You can take a nice walk to breath fresh air or do some sport. It's a park who is always full of people.

Beautiful Park. I rented a bike and rode all around the park, it was stunningly pretty and there was a well placed little cafe.
It's a great place to lie around, read, listen to music and smell the famous fragrance of Amsterdam ;-)

A Quiet and Lovely Respite from the Bustle. First time I've had the chance to wander around the park, and it is lovely. Lots of paths, ponds, gardens, great place for a run or a walk or just to sit and ponder or rest. A number of cafes are available for coffee and cake, beer, food. On a warm day people flock to it and sprawl about the lawns sunning. After or before a day of pounding the bricks, it's a nice and needed break.
wow!. if you are in amsterdam you cant miss the biggest park!everyone goes there for either a walk/run/pic nic etc!!

an excellent place to rest. I was surprised about this place! you should take some time to visit this park. It is amazing! You have grass , you will find some lagoons, many people, families and on sundays attractions. You can cycling ou making a lovely pic-nic there! If you love the nature I would recommend this place to you!

nice city park very old very calm very nice humans. nice city park very old very calm very nice humans its an walk for more than four hours middle in between the city amsterdam you can walk from overtoom to leidseplein its more than 3 kilometers walk small lanes some with bikes!

wow!!!. what a place to loose yourself. stroll for ages admiring the art ,fountains ,or simply lay back and people watch. Its well worth a visit and lots of wee bars and cafés to visit (depending on where you enter the park) lllloooooovvvvveeeeedddd it 1

I love all the people, so full of life!. I've run and biked and walked through Vondelpark on several weekend visits to Amsterdam now. It is full of life! Always people riding, running, walking, relaxing. When your away from home for a weekend it is a great anecdote.

Tranquil, well laid out park. A large, green, leafy space perfect for a stroll or cycle. There are a couple of cafes and bars located inside to pause and relax in. The park is a manageable size to explore in a couple of hours, or less if you have a bike. Make sure you stroll off the main paths and onto the paths that go into the centre of the park to get a different perspective.
Relaxing stroll. We love exploring city parks, so aimed for this one (also featured in a book we'd read!!) - stopped at the cafe in the centre of the park for cake & coffee, too; recommended!

Beautiful Landscape. Nice flat trails for all to enjoy both paved & dirt. Very green with lots of locals walking/playing with dogs, riding along with family cycles and exercising. There was a cafe in the middle where one could sit and enjoy the nature. Good size and great location.

Vondelpark. Beautiful park that is certainly worth going to for walking or biking! Has a lot of duck ponds and statues. One entrance to park was right outside our hotel so we went many times for long walks.

TRANQUILITY IN MAYHEM!. If you are in Amsterdam and are sick of all the sex, cannabis, busy streets, tourists etc etc, and you just wanna chill, come to Vondelpark!Its basically the equivalent of Central Park in Manhattan. Its a nice getaway from all the mayhem outside. Ideal to cycle around.And if you must know, you can happily smoke a joint in there providing you do it out of the way and not directly in front of kids.

A bit of a fresh air. Nice city park , just about 20 minutes walk from the city center. Lots of cyclists and people jogging there all day , doesnt matter what timee you get there. has a few lakes with the usual ducks, swans etc. Perfect for chilling out, after the loud city. All the food vans are ridiculously dear, (0,5l water 2 euro, hot-dog 6euro etc) and hard to find a public toilet working or just open! recommended to go before you get to the park :) or do it in the bushes!
Busy park. Lots of push bikes,joggers, etc. It has at least one sit down cafe and mobile food/ soft drink sellers. Lots of trees to shelter under if it rains.
A run in the park. Vondelpark is a wonderful place for a morning run, I only experienced it during the Amsterdam marathon but it has a great potential.

Heavenly!!. Right in the heart of the city and very close to the Museum Quarter it's truly a heavenly experience to either walk/ Jog or cycle through the vondelpark...With walk ways lined by trees and water columns the time you spend in there is going to stay with you for a very long time indeed... Perfect way to fill your lungs with O2 ;) and enjoy some relaxing time at one of the many benches

awesome scenery and foliage. this park is huge, but very serene to walk through. quite a nice place to bring food and a joint to and have a picnic! or just the food if its not your thing... but hey, when in amsterdam....

Great place to relax. It's just a beautiful place to walk and have some rest from quite a noisy city centre. There are a couple of cafes. a LOT OF ducks and fantastic trees that bend towards the water and very nice to seat on. It's the only place (in my opinion) where you can safely cycle and see how fit all the Dutch really are!

A walk in the park. After visiting the Rijks I wandered through Vondelpark and enjoyed a lazy stroll on a beautiful day. Stopped in a café and had a coffee outside to get off my feet for a few minutes. Could definitely bring a picnic and a good book and spend a lazy afternoon here. Would also be nice to take a bike through.

Real city park, worth a visit. It's a real City Park, very close to ao Leidseplein and Rijksmuseum. Used to be populated by hippies in sleepingbags many years ago, but these days is a very lively park filled with people jogging, with strollers, lots of nice shows and performances in the open air theatre.

You have to Bike there!. Great experience while biking at Vondelpark! You have to do it, it's a must in Amsterdam!
Peaceful, charming and great nature.
Very recommended for at least one hour to keep up the great mood!
picknick. this is a great place for a picknick in the summer also outdoor theatre the peoples favourite.a great place for sport ie tennis
Running through the park. We ran through Vondelpark as part of the Amsterdam half marathon, next time we will take a leisurely stroll through this beautiful area!

Huge city park. We had a few hours to kill on a hot day and walked for a couple of miles through the park. It reminded us of our own Golden Gate Park in San Francisco. There are even wild parrots, just like we have in San Francisco.

Fun and beautiful space. Good for outdoor barbecues in the summer, great for a quick jog in the spring and fall. I avoid it at all cost in the winter and late at night as there can be some questionable people hanging about

Very pretty !. This park is gorgeous ! Perfect if you're looking for a long walk. Definitely take some food along with you and if you're looking to hire a bike while you're in Amsterdam then definitely visit this park.
Stunning.
Lovely park. Enjoyed a great walk in this lovely park on a beautiful October day. 3 nice areas to stop for refreshments. Was a busy time on a lovely sunny day. Watch the bikes!
Great place for a picnic. Go during good weather. Loved people watching. Suggest you get a sandwich or other fast food and have a picnic in the park.

Not really for children?. We chose the Vondelpark as one of our 'destinations' during a two-day trip to Amsterdam with our small children (<7 years) - and were somewhat dissapointed. It was a sunny afternoon, quite a few people in the park, wide open lawns, marihuana fills the air... but we wer looking for some of the playgrounds mentioned by several guidebooks/internet. Found only one which was rather for small children, rater small and rather concrete...I had expected more for children - but on the other hand, we just saw the northern half of the park. Maybe the southern part is filled with natural, interesiting, modern playgrounds...?

an oasis in the madness. A great place to relax when in the area sight seeing. Grab some lunch from nearby cafes or supermarkets and chill in the park and recharge your batteries. You could easily spend hours strolling around and people watching

Cycling In Vondelpark. I enjoyed a bike ride through Vondelpark on a warm, sunny summer evening. It is a great place to take a picnic, sit on the lawn, people watch and relax or go do some exercising!
green escape. I went running here each morning and enjoyed the peacful atmosphere. It is also nice to walk around and just watch the locals.
Nice park. Beautiful park, good for walking and bicicle. Its farthest distance is around one kilometer from one edge to another, so, no problem to cross it walking.

Reminds me of Central Park, NYC. What a great place to relax, walk and people watch. This park in Amsterdam reminds me of Central Park in NYC, which is the copy of Amsterdam. The park is clean, easy to walk around and has several nice restaurants close by. Grab a cup of coffee nearby and a sandwich and enjoy the spread out on the lawn. What a great place to hang out in on a Sunday afternoon.

Best Park Ever. I loved everything about the park, very clean the people where outside doing exercise, dogs running everywhere and people just chilling having a nice time with their friends. Also they say that after 10 pm it's legal to have sex in that park so watch out where you step at night .
Outdoor Gem. On a beautiful day this lovely urban oasis stretches through sections of the city (one end very near the Museum area as well as major shopping) and provides the ideal stroll.

Interesting Park. This is a park in the center of Amsterdam. I'm sure in the spring, it would be gorgeous; but in October, there was no color. There are several little lakes and plenty of places to sit and relax. As a photographer, it was a great place for bike and people watching.

A must when not rainy..... Really nice park where to sit, read and simply relax at day light. Were there in September so flowers were almost crippling but gardeners take good care of the garden and it was simply so relxing to walk around, sit a bit and continue afterwards.

Quiet, water and trees. The park was quiet the day we were there, which was nice. It was clean and had orderly walking paths.. The absence of children was sad. I am glad someone saw children when they there there. When I asked at the hotel about the absence of children and play areas, he said they were mostly outside the city. There were dogs, ducks, teens and adults. We were minority seniors.

Beautiful park, & a great place to see the locals. Beautiful park, and really fun to visit. Lots of locals barbecuing, and we got invited to join a couple of groups. This was just a really really pleasant place to visit.
Beautiful. What a great way to spend a lazy afternoon watching the cyclists go by and feeding the ducks. Nice wee cafe in the middle as well.
Vondelpark. A gem of a large green space in the heart of this wonderful city, a pleasure to walk or cycle around
Dont miss a great bike ride. It is very close to the city center and you can bike it the whole day..the 2 cafes are very expensive again , so take some snacks with you to make a lovely pick nick..!!

Lovely park. It has it all--lakes, views of stately houses, play areas, fountains, beautiful paths. A popular jogging spot on weekends. In fact, it's so big it's best explored by bike or on a morning run.
Vondel in the vondelpark. The greatest park for an early morning jog, walk or cycle. Friendly happy place even more so for all the happy children and dogs.

A beautiful park.. Vondel park reminded me a lot of Hampsted Heath, but a little more tropical. Loads of really nice spots to sit with your friends and some amazing trees, plants and wildlife (loads of parrots!). Great place for a first time truffle experience.

Vondelpark - Amsterdam's 'central park'. Very quiet compared to central Amsterdam, around 30mins walking from centre. Fairly flat, you can either walk or cycle around the park, enough space for cyclists and walkers, BBQ areas in the summer, areas for younger children, just beware of cyclists. If you are into wildlife photography ... Gray Herons frequent the area, and tolerate people, getting close up photos of these birds are easy. The statue inside the park is surrounded by tulips march - may

A beautiful and tranquil oasis. Vondelpark is tucked away in a quiet residential section of Amsterdam, far away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Tree lined pathways and gorgeous lakes are abundant. Biking is allowed on the paved roads and there are plenty of non-paved walking trails for those who want to take life a bit slower.There are plenty of grassy areas to relax under the sun or to have a picnic. Surprisingly enough there are a few fantastic restaurants throughout the park to have a quick bite at. Nothing better than sitting on a terrace and watching the world pass by.Vondelpark is certainly not to be missed when visiting Amsterdam. It certainly is a beautiful and relaxing escape from the busier side of Amsterdam.

Lovely. Rode our hired cycles around here.stopped at the blue teahouse for a sandwich and coffee .weather was a bit chilly to walk around , but I would imagine in walker weather it would be lovely to sit out and watch the world ...or locals go by x

A welcome area of greenery in the city.. During my first visit to Amsterdam, I stayed at the Algemijn Maatschapij Voor Jungeren in the Centraal Hotel on the Leidsebosje adjacent to Vondelpark and explored the extensive grounds at weekends.
Although the Leidsebosje is now completely redeveloped, Vondelpark remains a pleasant haven.
Place to relax . Vondelpark is an excellent place to take an afternoon stroll or even sit by the water and relax as the hippies play various types of music.
Things to do on a cold day. Have a hot chocolate in the 'blue tea room' read the paper and watch the wildlife...including the human

Nice beautiful park. Voldelpark is a very nice place to have a break during the busy day in Amsterdam. It is spacious so it is easy to find a peaceful place for relaxing or just walk around and have a picnic!

Magnificent. We stayed in Amsterdam for 3nights and cycled through vondlepark each day. What a privilege this was to be part of the community in their day to day activities. Families, people interested in physical wellbeing, community coming together. Vondlepark is a wonderful part of Amsterdam - very relaxing and far removed from the very busy side of this beautiful city.

The green heart of the city. Do not miss the Vondelpark! In summer it is a very lively place, packed with picknickers and bbq folk.. (there are two dedicated bbq fields! do not sit here if you do not bbq, your clothes will need to be washed) In winter an oasis for a quiet walk. At the south end of the park you will find (march-october 'de Vondeltuin', a great outdoor cafe-restaurant, next to a kiddie playfield. All year long open is Het Melkhuijse, mid-park, also with a playground. So also ideal for kids. Also somewhere in the middle is het Blauwe Theehuis, also good for a drink (but service is slow here). The former filmmuseum had a great cafe-terrace called Vertigo, but the city in its infinite wisdom decided to close it and sell/give it to a broadcasting company, which was/is an outrage and a slap in the face to evcery local. this summer saw a temporrary replacement but it wasn't as good at all, hopefully they create something better next year.But of course the very best spot is a place in the grass and just enjoy the fresh air. Clean up after you're done drinking eating though!

Beautiful park. Ride bikes, walk, picnic, beautiful place. Perfect place to spend part of your trip in Amsterdam. There appears to be a couple restaurants but were closed in the evening, I bet having lunch there would be stunning.

Vondelpark. This is a lovely place to walk around on a dry day, lots to see and I was licky enough to go when they had live music playing, what better way to while away an hour than in the park listening to music with a big glass of beer.be warned Its a very large park and you will need plenty of time to just stroll around.

Stroll in cool comfort. Vondel Park is near many attractions and hotels. It is a good place to take a break for being a tourist. Shade trees, walking paths and quiet but very near the action of sightseeing.
Lovely Park. A quiet and beautiful place to walk, bike or just relax. Do watch out for bicycles. Also lots of ducks and blue herons, which is rare in a city.
beautiful park. a big park in the city almost like central park in new york lots of people walking or biking along the pathways

Vondelpark. Vondelpark is close to a number of hotels and restaurants. Hotel Best Western Appollo Mesuem Hotel, Marriott Hotel are nearby. Hard Rock Cafe is nearby as well. Vondelpark is a hugh park in a city. Beautiful park with lakes and jogging tracks. Very nice to walk to enjoy the beautiful park with many dog owners walking their cutie dog. It is nice to walk in the morning or evening even if you are a visitor. Let your day begin with inhaling fresh air by walking in the park.Beware of bicycle as there are so many people cycle to work. What a city in this 21 century! Was a eye opener . You will find the freshest air here!
Vondelpark. its right near museumplein so after your done checking out museums just head on over to the park great place to relax

have a picnic and relax. A huge park, great for having a walk or cycle inside. You can enjoy a coffee to one of its cafeterias, have a meal, or take your own food and have a picnic, which I recommend. A great place to relax between the sightseeing.

A park for all. If you enjoy the out doors then vondelpark is a must visit.Large area with water features,ponds a cafe in the centre that looks out over the grounds.On most Sundays during the summer period there's live music and shows only a short tram ride or walk from city centre

Amazing Park. This is such a beautiful park and one of the biggest that i have visted ! It must take a good hours walk or so to walk around the ouside of it and then in and out of the middle path ways etc ... Every where u look theres wildlife of a different varity. There are people running and walking and enjoying the park in allways ,theres even an adventure climbing area for the younger ones ,a brilliant place to come in the summer and there is a cafe towards the middle of the park with ok prices
Evening stroll. lovely location to get away from the busy centre. lots going on. well kept, very clean. we walked round but there were plenty of joggers and cyclists.

Massive park for cycling, picnicking and relaxing. Lots of scenic spots to cycle to or sit down, chill and people-watch. Families and dog owners will have a field-day.Dog-owning famlies who cycle, even more so.

two green hours in centertow. We were five minutes away in our NH center Hotel.It's a very big park with several little lakes.You can find different atmospheres as it is very large.We enjoyed it late in the afternoon and also (more) early in the morning (2hours).Lots of runners ,a few tramps that don't bother.The only matter for us was ,as it is in all the town ,the totally irrespectfull ,quite dangerous and ayathollah minded bicycles.Nevertheless,a very positive reminder of the town and also of this park whose entrances lead to several different parts of the town.

Great place for a picnic. If you want to nibble the cheese you have just bought at a market , or take break from tourist-infested ( and pricey ) restaurants , the Vondel Park is a splendid place for a picnic ( OR to walk off a good lunch at one of those restaurants ) , AND it is only a very short walk from the big three museums .
Lovely park with many things for toddlers. We loved this park and our 2 year old didn't want to leave- the playgrounds here are amazing we could easily spend a day or two here walking and playing!

Fun 1-2 hours riding and picnicing. We rode around the park and stopped to enjoy the local color. It takes about 30 minutes to ride around the perimeter. Pack a lunch and stop at any one of a number of scenic spots or dine in the park's casual restaurants.

Lovely. I walk amd cycle here often, yesterday I passed a tourist who was wonderingly descibing the place as a utopia. Its great for families with kids and there are several family friendly eating establishments.

morning walk round Vondelpark. Rush hour Amsterdam style, a morning walk in Vondelpark is really amazing think M25 only 1,000's of bicyles. Off the main route its a good green space to walk round and set yourself up for the day of museums and canals.

A beautiful, dog-friendly oasis. We had 4 hours to kill with our terrier before our train connection departed, so it was gratifying to take advantage of the wooded paths, the small lake views, and the cafes. The heavy bicycle traffic did little to dampen our enthusiasm, since the riders were both considerate and accurate in their rapid traversals through the park. It helped that the weather was perfect on the day, Sept. 27, that we visited the park.
get lost in the park. rent a bike and become a local for the day. buy a sandwich and ride through the park. find a quiet spot by a lake, sit in the sun and enjoy.

Green space in the centre of Amsterdam. Had read of concerts etc. during Summer but found nothing of that ilk. VERY good place for cycling round but a bit uninspired at this time of year. Water a bit turgid and grotty looking. Well used.
Nice to chill. Was there by bike (the only way to travel in Amsterdam), and chilled in the park in the afternoon. Was chill. Relax.
A nice place to laze around. A nice place to laze around after a tiring walk within the lanes of Amsterdam. It is a very huge park.
A peace of heaven. Peaceful, beautiful park! You can sit on the grass by one of the lakes, rent a bicycle or sit in a cafe and just chill :)

A gentle respite in the heart of Amsterdam. Lovely spot to chill out for a couple of hours right in the cwenter of Amsterdam. Lots of paths, playgrounds for the Kids, at least two restaurants and several hot dog stands, lots of little lakes, and ample seating. If you haven't already discovered this, here is where you'll discover that Amsterdam is NOT all about flowers, or the red light district or the coffee houses where you can score som legal pot. No. Amsterdam is all about Bicycles. To commute, take the kids to school, take the younger kids to a play date in the park, grocery shop or just for the fun of it. The Bicycle is king in Amsterdam and really throughout the Netherlands

Huge Beautiful Park.. This is a great place to have some peace in Amsterdam if a quiet walk is in need after the hustle and bustle of the City Centre. Full of meandering paths and picturesque lakes it's a haven in the heart of the city. There area couple of cafes and bars too. In the warmer months there is some awesome Ice cream for sale from stalls in the park too. A great place for a gentle cycle or rollerblade too.

Peaceful and beautiful scenery. I loved walking through Vondelpark on a nice sunny afternoon! there are still a lot of cyclists and joggers, but it is a nice hideaway from the busy city streets surrounding it! it is peaceful still and its nice to take your food and enjoy a little picnic!
oasis. It was so nice to wander through the park away from traffic, noise and hustle and bustle. We were delighted to see the locals making great use of their lovely park.

Even a park can get top rating. I never thought I would love a park so much of the many attractions Amsterdam has to offer. But my husband and I spent a happy hour cycling around Vondelpark and I have not enjoyed myself so much in a long time. It is beautiful and peaceful. A great break from the city. You can even do a picnic here if you like...
Oasis in the city. Quiet and relaxing after a long day of sight-seeing in the city. Amazing to have such an oasis in the middle of the city.

I was expecting more.... I had expectations of a park like one might fine in Paris or NYC. I was disappointed to find it very standard, like it could have been anywhere. I would not bother visiting unless there is an event going on there or you are planning to exercise.
Beautiful & Scenic Place. Stayed beside here for 3 days & had a morning jog through - very cheming as fellow joggers & cyclists passed by. Nice little café in the centre for coffee too.. Fantastic!!

Great escape from the city.. Lovely green space with lots of bird and people watching. We were there in early fall so the gardens were finished for the season but it was still a lovely park to wander through. There are cafes to stop and relax in. Definitely a nice alternative to the busy tourist areas.
Typical Park. We visited here due to all the recommendations but we felt it was just like every other park you see in the UK. It is pretty big though!

Great place to chill out. Really nice area to cycle around, if a bit busy with people. Also recommend running around Vondelpark. Loads of groups having picnics, BBQs, etc.. great atmosphere and felt really safe.

Loved the Vondelpark!. The Vondelpark was great. It's really a lovely park, it's quite big, and there's lots of paths, ponds, and cute herons. Lots of bike traffic too so make sure you're on a walking path and out of the way of the bikers! We walked around the park after a long day of touring the city so we were quite tired, but I still loved it and would for sure like to go back and spend some more time just relaxing and people watching. Everyone seemed so chilled out and happy there, there was lots of people playing with their dogs, having picnics (it helps that you can drink in public in Amsterdam!), and just having a good time. The day we went the weather was beautiful so it was definitely the place to be!

Great park in good weather. We moved here in July and living temporarily in the Pijp. In the morning we go to Vondelpark for our morning regime, as it is a 12-minute walk from our flat. It is a great place to exercise and we have been seeing the same people in the morning. There are also yoga groups who practice on the lawns as well as other kinds of workout groups. It takes about 70 minutes door to door, doing a walk/run.Also in the morning, the municipal workers are cleaning up so the park is in shape for the day. The flowers are very nice and it more green space than some formal gardens. We also enjoyed watching the resident stork with her chicks whose nest is well off the path and protected from people and dogs, but is viewable for birders.Speaking of dogs, they are very well-behaved, and owners are very good about cleaning up after them. I have found this park to be an enjoyable part of living here, and can't wait for the Pavillion to be finished with renovations in April of next year!
It's ok for a park. There is nothing much special, but it's a big area, so if you have a pet, or like the nature and walking in the grass it's a nice spot to spend some time and relax

Run, Ride or Chillax. A must see on a warm spring/summers day! I went for a run around it and it was fantastic to see so much going on. All the locals were out basking in the sunlight, bikes everywhere. It a a thoroughfare for most of the riders! I would definitely run around it again!

A great escape in a great city. Amsterdam is one of our favorite cities, in part because of this little jewel in the middle of the city. Wander around and take in the local culture as people BBQ, run their dogs, play soccer, ride their bikes or just lounge around watch the ducks. When running around this city starts to frazzle your nerves, escape to Vondelpark and slow things down. Only minutes from the Leidseplein, yet you would never know it once you are inside its' green embrace...
Beautiful. Nice big open space plenty of room to lie down and chill out from the traffic. Its just beside the rijksmusem. It took about half an hour to walk to from the centre of amsterdam.

Vondelpark offers a piece of tranquility in Amsterdam. Vondelpark is about 2 miles from central Station and about half a mile west from the Rijksmuseum. After a morning walking around the canals there is no better place to find a patch of green grass and relax for a few hours. At 120 acres and an average of 10 million visitors a year you can still find your own space. Vondelpark has an open air theatre and childrens play areas. Their are numerous cycle paths along with many hidden paths leading to romantic little bridges.a main feature of the park are its beautiful lakes and enchanting fountains. I've included a few photo's.'t Blauwe Theehuis (The Blue Teahouse) is a 1930s Modernist pavillion that overlooks one of the lakes. this is a wonderful spot to enjoy a quick snack or an extended lunch.vondelpark is a delightful place to spend an afternoon with family and friends

Great city park.. This park is big and is one of the best city parks I have visited. Great place to go for a bike ride. Great for people watching. Great for a long walk. Great place to lounge in the sun.
the best park in europe. democratic. that's all you need to know to go there. beautiful sights and lake! close to the main museums.

Vondel Park. Lovely park to walk around when the weather is nice!
Full of joggers and cyclists, nice place to wander.
Nice park. Amsterdam is a great place to rent a bicycle and see the city. And if you want a break from the street scene, take a cruise through Vondel Park. Very relaxing.

Pleasant Inner City Park. Very pleasant park. Not a great one like Central Park in NYC or Golden Gate in SF but enjoyable for a half day. A good spot to get your bicycle acclimatization if you have not been on a cycle for a while and want to bike around the very busy and risky bike lanes in Amsterdam. Very flat. Locals obviously enjoy the park.

Go for a walk.... Vondelpark is a bit like the Central Park of Amsterdam. It's a great place to go for a long walk away from the city streets. And if you venture to the end away from the central part of the city, you can see some incredible, beautiful old homes (many are now offices, but they're still well maintained).

Vondelpark. We had a walk around here, it was ok, but think it would have been better to go round on a bike. There was more pathways for bikes we didn't do the whole park on foot but it was ok from what we saw.
lovely. It was a lovely summer with the temperature at 30degrees. It is a huge park , about 30 minutes walk from central station. nice for family picnic.
Lovely walk, jog, ride, or excercise. Large park in the middle of Amsterdam. Great for outdoor activities when done touristing.I went there to Tai Chi away fromthe hotel.
Lovely park for a stroll. My husband and I went for a morning walk to find breakfast. What a great place! So peaceful! Found a little cafe (actually saw two). Would totally recommended a visit.
Rent a bike for this one. We walked and biked through Vondel park several times during our visit. For those familiar with Central Park, Vondel park is certainly as big and is quite scenic.

Neighbourhood park. Its a neighbourhood park where a lot of locals are seen jogging and strolling their dogs around the huge area just like any other parks. There is a cafe located inside the park, and if you wake up early, you can take a stroll to enjoy e quiet serenity but again there are many nice restaurants in other parks and cities too. Can give a miss if you don't have much time during your stay in amsterdam.

A very pleasant afternoon.. My wife and I went to Vondelpark after lunch, and enjoyed strolling round Amsterdam's finest park. This is a very pretty park, with a fountain in the lake, a playground, a bandstand and even a theatre! I was also delighted to see grey herons, rose-ringed parakeets, and some Egyptian geese. There was also an ice cream van, so all in all, a very pleasant afternoon.

Pretty Space. This is a nice green space (a welcome difference in this city of water). It's a great spot for a picnic or a rest in between sightseeing stops, especially since it's so close to the Rijks and Van Gogh museums. There are some pretty ponds in the park, and it also has a restaurant in it if you want another option besides a picnic. The houses surrounding the park have some pretty details (decorative tiles) that aren't in all parts of the city.

Lively and peaceful at the same time.. If you follow your nose,with your back to the Leidseplein, you see two large hotels.To the leftyou can see one of the Parks entrances. Although it's very clearly an Urban park.It's a very pretty place, there is a lot of activity in some places, and you can also find a quite bench or patch of grass. If you are planning to rent a bike, this is a good place to " practise", before you brave the more tricky canals. In the middle of the park,is a restaurant/ coffee shop .

Mind the cyclists - and runners!. This is a nice enough park running from near the museum area out wards... Lovely waterways and nice trees but it is a haven for cyclists and runners so if you are merely on foot it's OK but not really that special...

Worth a look and short stroff. City parks are always delightful. Voldelpark was full of cyclists and runners. The park lacks the charm we had hoped for but is still worth taking a look if you have the time.

Great place to ride your bike in Amsterdam. We rented bikes and after dodging cars, pedestrians and other bikers, we found the Vondelpark. Wonderful place for a leisurely bike ride. We found an outdoor sculpture garden a short ride outside the park which made our bike adventure even more pleasant.

Beautiful. Large park in the middle of the city, it's a great place to spend a sunny day, very beautiful park with a big lake or river in the middle , not sure what was that but there are bridges to cross it. the park is good for cycling or walk and fresh air
Beautiful walk on a sunny day. Beautiful park in the middle of the city. They had a sculpture walk on display. Just be careful of the Kamikazee bicycles

Perfect place to relax!. It is really peaceful and relaxing. It just feels great to lie down on the grass and feed the ducks in the lake after a tiring day of full of visits. It is also great for breakfast or lunch. Just get your sandwiches and drinks and enjoy the beautiful view.
Very nice park. This is a lovely park and a great place to take a casual stroll on a nice day. Lots of walking/cycling paths, some ponds and green areas.

Vondelpark: peaceful for people watching.. Went on a Sunday. Hot sunny day. Hundreds of people jogging. Hundreds of people on bikes. Tourists on rented bikes. Tourists on bike tours. Buskers playing accordions and clarinets quite well. Parents with children on baby seats on bikes. People with dogs on bikes. Lots of people with dogs. Dogs jumping in the water fetching sticks and balls. Cafes with seating areas next to the lakes. Ice cream and hot-dog sellers. Children's play areas. Police on patrol. Lots of lakes. Lots of bird life. Bandstands. Places next to water for having barbeques. Families walking round. Lovers holding hands. Roller skaters of all ages. Free toilets around the park. Flowers. Greenery. Nice park, would go again. People smoking cannabis. Close to city centre. Great for people watching. Stage for concerts, not being used when we were there. Clean park. Enjoyed.
Beautiful!!. My husband and I loved just walking around Vondel Park! It is so beautiful! Take a picnic and a bottle of wine and relax taking in the beautiful scenery!

Your View on this Park Will Depend on Your Parks at Home. We have very beautiful parks where I live so this park felt average to me. I think if you come from somewhere where you do not have nice parks, you might be impressed by this one. I was not impressed. The grounds were not very well kept in my opinion and the landscaping was average. After reading so much about it, I thought it would be better. We walked through and walked out. Good for a stroll but not somewhere I long to picnic.

Good people watching spot. My friends and I walked from our hotel to this park and sat on one of the park benches for a good hour. We enjoyed watching people walking, riding their bikes and saw some funny and weird moments happen. Overall a nice place to relax. It reminded me of Central Park in nyc
excellent. When you walk over there you would feel that you are in out space very calm place and wide area.It is very nice to spend several hours away from crowd.
Great place for cycling. Good roads and plenty of foliage. Nice, if a bit crowded park just a short bicycle ride from the center.
