Nice park but not outstanding. Not extraordinary.. This is a nice park for walking or bike riding. But it is overrated from what we could see. It does have proximity to the Van Gogh MUseum and The Rikismuseum.

Excellent place to unwind. The hotel in which we were staying in was really close to Vondelpark so one day instead of going for the tram to the city centre we decided to walk it to the park. Believe me it was well worth the walk - this land if really a respite from the hussle of the city and it is really worth the walk.

A Great Place for a Picnic. There is a food market underground in front of the Stedeliijk museum at Museum Plein. Grab whatever you would like to eat, with the store entrance at your back walk straight down Van. Baerliesstr. two blocks. Lots of people walking, bike riding, rollerblading, and picnicking. Like everywhere in Amsterdam, we felt very safe. We had dinner and spent some relaxing time people watching.

Very Nice Park.... Lovely for a pick nick, ride a bike or just walk out around - when i was there there were people from everywhere and for all kinds of reasons - walking, laying on the grass, bicyckling, having lunch and so on - there is nothing you can compare this park to on a sunny day...

Great place. Vondelpark has everything you need if you want to get "out of the city" for a bit. We spent a few hours here but would have liked to spend more time. Great place to walk, relax, people watch, and enjoy the outdoors.

Great place to cycle round but quite small. Some lovely places to stop for a snack or a beer on a sunny day but park itself is quite small. You can cycle around it in about 10 mins - great place to go and cycle if you are not a confident cyclist
Lovely. This is a lovely place to go for a walk and sit in the gardens we done this with A few beers on a lovely warm day we were there for the day
Sit, take a book, relax. Trees, a lake, no traffic (except bicycles of course...this is Amsterdam) a lovely place to just chill and soak up some Vitamin D or read a book.

Perfect for a ride through or for some relaxing time. While in Amsterdam, from my hotel, I used to ride through the park every morning, on the way to the touristic attractions of the city. The park is close to the Museum Quarter of the city, very central but still huge, with several small lakes, lots of green and key spots normally taken by a very diverse crowds for some relaxing breaks, specially with the good weather. I would recommend tourists try to book a nearby hotel like I did, so you can get to enjoy a little bit of the park everyday.

More like Tramp Central. Just a short tram ride out of he centre and upon entering the park I was greeted by an elderly unshaven gentleman relieving himself upon a carefully tendered bush - I suppose I should however be grateful it was only the bush :(

Great place for a walk or run!. Lovely People's park in the centre of Amsterdam, near the Museum Square. Lots of lawn, trees, water features like lakes with abundant variety of wild life - birds, mammals etc. Well maintained and policed, this is a great place to walk or run away from the bustle of traffic. There is no escaping the usual demented array of bicycles, however! The laws are the safest if you are on foot!

Bliss. When the sun is out and you want to relax by yourself, friends, girlfriend. This is the place to do it. I've been to Amsterdam 3 times and I will always come back here. Everybody is just chilling out relaxing and there seems to be a really nice vibe about the place. Everyone seems to be in there own little world there (Some brought on by the help of the local coffeshops :p), so despite there being a fair amount of people in the park you feel like its just you and the people you're there with :)

A great place to spend an afternoon wandering. This park is worth taking the time to visit. A wonderful open green space in the city. There is a good Café-Bar, a lake and areas for you to have your own BBQ if you wanted to
A lovely walk in the park. We went here for a picnic and very nice it was too. A lot like Hyde Park really, but it was nice for a walk and relaxing. The toilets weren't so nice however.

A nice oasis in the middle of the city. A great place to enjoy some green space if you need it, also there is a great cafe to sit at and watch the world go by where you can buy coffee, wine, beer and snacks.

Perfection. Plenty space for Frisbee, chilling at its finest. Lots of places to walk about and the area is well maintained. places to eat are abundant and artwork all about to keep things interesting. Its a nice walk from old Amsterdam and a pancake house just next door. Heavenoh...a bar/pub/club by night opens in the day to sell delicious Dutch food and fantastic burgers in cute wooden plates. That food is why beer exists.Its a wonderful place to spend a lazy day. It is Amsterdam (close to the coffee shops to ;)
nice. The biggest park in Amsterdam have a few lakes and the green grass is perfect for a picnic with friends or the one you love. Is a must see in Amsterdam.

In love with vondelpark. I am truly in love with vondelpark :))) my husband and I spent 2 days of our stay in amsterdam in this beautiful park ...its just super relaxing to sit by the lake ...watch different kinds of birds, enjoy the shade of the trees and the sound of nature ..I just love it ...and if I ever visited amsterdam again I would spend more time in the park..
Oasis in city. The weather was brilliant and it was nice to relax in a green space.Took some bread and cheese and spent nice afternoon water hinges the world go by,very relaxing.

Lovely Park. This is a very big and lovely park with lakes in and around, and random bridges.It is great to see all the bikes riding through here, everyone in the daytime sits close to each other but separately, and it is almost as if they were there on their own :) It's a lovely sight! Everyone does their own thing and bothers nobody. You never see that in England.Really breaks up from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Peace in the city. With or without kids, this oasis is a wonderful way to take a break from the museums, restaurants, and bustle of Amsterdam. Beautiful trees, gardens, fields, and walking paths—not to mention swingsets and sandboxes!—make it well worth a picnic visit.

It's a park. Full of homeless people. Sure, they're friendly, and drunk, but it's really not too nice. Maybe I was just in the wrong part of this park, but after 2 trips through, I began to avoid it and go around.
Beautifully well kept park!. Our hostel (Stayokay Amsterdam) actually looked onto the Vondelpark. A beautiful park to chill with friends on a summer's day or to walk through in colder times.

Worth walking through but not anything special. Guess I was expecting more but it is really quite average for a city park. I liked the ease of walking but disliked lack of any eye-catching landscape, sculpture, waterfalls, etc.

A gem in the city centre. The experience of visiting this park was really relaxing because the park is so beautiful and this is one of my favourite parks that I've visited. I would recommend to bring your lunch to have a picnic here in between your busy day trip schedule. However,one thing can be improved is that there is few free restroom in the park.
it was lovely and warm. the park was lovely and the green was fantastic but at the end of the day it is just a park, very similar to the one outside of my home.
Need to visit if you are in amsterdam!. We rented bikes and spent a good part of the day there - had lunch took pictures gorgeous summer day in Amsterdam!
Fabulous. So many great things to see. I wish I could have visited when Van Gogh still lived there. I really want a bed like his. =)

At one with nature. A slice of Heaven in the city. massive green space so picturesque and tranquil in the virtual centre of Amsterdam covered in snow its beautiful or bathed in sunshine it's gorgeous. Ideal for a picnic or to be at one with nature
Great park for those who appreciate nature. Vondelpark can be compared with NY's Central Park though it's much smaller. It's a lovely park to visit and would say it's a must for park lovers.
Surely the most chilled out park in the world.. Lie back on the grass in the sunshine as hundreds of cyclists and pedestrians wonder past you. Join the masses seeking relaxation.
A must on a sunny day in dam. I love this park perfect if you fancy a less stressful bike ride or stroll, there is always something to watch and a few bars for good measure.

A must!!! 100% recommended. Vondelpark, were do I start... We just loved it. There is something for everyone! It's beautiful. Well kept. Lots of area to sit and enjoy. There are a few places to eat and drink. Not too expensive. The is an amazing playground, like a ropes course. Really well designed. We spent a lot of time just sitting enjoying each others company and taking everything in. Be careful of the bikers. We also took a bike tour that went through the park it was lovely. 100% recommended
Running route. Nice place to run, did a couple of rounds through the park due to tight schedule. There's also a nice place to have drink or just snap something.

Death by pot or bicycle?. You can choose to either be run over by a bicycle or breath in so much pot that you can die. Honestly, ONLY come here in daylight and walk through with a focus on the splendor of this lovely park!

Our favorite part of Amaterdam was biking in Vondelpark. The park was so lovely and happy. Our 8 year old daughter loved biking here. It was much easier to bike here than through town. Biking in this park was picture perfect. It is a must do when in Amsterdam. Could have biked there all day long. Highly recommend!

Large open city centre space. I was a little disappointed with the park. It is a large city centre space but it was a bit tatty and there was a lot of rubbish lying around.
Having said that, it is an interesting diversion if you want to get on the road.

Gorgeous, enormous park. We went on a lovely day and found a quiet spot by a pond where we pickniked and fed the ducks. We also cycled through the park twice and realised how expansive it is. It's really pretty and there's a bit of scenery for everyone. The main cafe is a great hangout where you can sometimes catch free performances.
Loved the place!. Was beautiful and relaxing. I love that the city is so relaxing anyway, but wandering off the main street for a quiet nap in the park seems so natural here :o)

A place to ralax... It's a place to go every hour of the day and sit down next to the waters. Bring something to eat or just a lot of beers and enjoy the fantastic view of the park. You can even go there at night as there are a few lights and it is quite romantic for couples.

A little piece of quiet in the city. Admittedly it was a scorching hot day when we visited and it was lovely to sit by the lake under some shade. Quite a big area and very busy with cyclists (just for a change)!!!!! Lovely cafe, have 30cif you need to go to the toilet. Nice place to chill.
Happy cycling. This was very chilled out place to sit and relax. We wanted to give the traditional bicycles a go and this was the safest place to go, the roads are a bit manic!

Amsterdam's green lung. Vondel Park is exactly what Amsterdam needs. Step inside it and you are taken away from the madness that is the city, into a thoroughly civilised, English style park.There are lakes and fountains, band stands and tea pavillions, coffee houses and milk houses,and miles of paths.Dogs and cyclists are mostly well behaved, and seem to take life less seriously than the joggers.You could easily take a picnic along and spend a lazy afternoon sitting on the grass watching the ducks, or you could walk for what seems miles.

Bustling place to 'people watch'. City centre park which is very busy in the summer but pleasant enough to stroll through and have a restful break between visiting the various tourist sights - some of which are in close proximity to the park.
like in all capital. A central park, a lot of green in the heart of the town... like in NY, Paris, London, etc. very nice in summer, with the rivers, the small swimming pool....
Hub. It has everything, except proper toilets! Great place to see the dutch in action, cycling, roller blading, mothers fitness groups, old people fitness exercises, cyclists of course!

Lovely park. Great park. I stayed in a hotel just across from it so we could wander into it. There are children play areas so they can burn off some energy after museum visits. Watch out for the cyclists though, as they rule the park.

Great park with loads of people. Liked: wildlife, leashed dogs, runners, walkers, and beautiful ponds/trees/foliage
Disliked: speeding bicycles, overflowing garbage receptacles, dog feces

Beautiful park. It's not as beautiful as they describe it, but it's alright. There are many more beautiful parks in Europe, so.. This one is clean, it's rather spacey, perfect to take a bycicle ride there. The lake is beautiful, it gives you a peaceful sensation to lay on the grass, look at the water and people going by or play something, talk to your friends, i don't know. Mostly, things you can do in any park. Maybe it will be even more beautiful during springtime, when many more types of flowers are bloomed.
relaxing park. it is a relaxing park where you can go and have your own packed lunch and relax without any extra stress around :)

Nice. Beautiful park, one of the prettiest i've ever seen. We had our bikes so getting round it was lovely, we also sat on the grass near a pond where a heron appeared next to us. Perfect place to chill out with a smoke and a pancake!
Beautiful park to enjoy. This really is a park for everyone, from fitness fanatic to those that just want to lay in the sun, also there are regular concerts or jsut great for people watching
Beautiful. Busy but just lovely on a warm day in June. Also during the night by the lake. Lovely place to go and not far from the central
Peaceful Vondelpark. Awesome place, situated slightly out of the busy center, great area to chill out and enjoy the surroundings. Very peaceful area, would recommend going!
Great day out. There are usually lots of things going on in the park, again good to just sit and people watch. Some good art around as well. Good cup of coffee to be had in the park.
Great location for cycling. We spent a lovely afternoon cycling around the park - it's big with plenty to see and lots of places to stop and eat. Highly recommended for a relaxing afternoon

Most beautiful park I've seen. That is a park that makes you wish all cities had a park like this. We had a picnic there and what I loved the most is there are many different people to do many different things but none of them disrespect each other.

Pretty but busy!. A lovely park that we enjoyed cycling around. Be aware that when its warm everyone else will have the same idea as you as it gets very busy! However there is plenty of space, public toilets all over and a very pretty place to be!

Busy but relaxing. Huge park with all manner of things going on. There is a real buzz in this place, but do watch out for the cyclists - just because you are in a park doesn't mean they won't buzz you as you walk through.Very relaxed atmosphere for people of all ages and nationalities either out for a stroll or just relaxing in the warm summer sun. Do visit if you get the chance.
A lovely park with a good vibe!. Its a very busy park with green parrots flying around some great features and a good tearoom where you can get an alcoholic beverage if you so wish :)
Sunny Sunday in Vondelpark . Best thing !!. Clean safe , Cafes , wonderful day spent in the park . Get a bike get relaxed get happy :) Lots of trees and toilette . Just in case .
Central Park of Amsterdam. This park is beautiful with it's fountains, ponds, and expanses of green grass. It is very pleasant to just stroll through the park people watching. :-)

Great place to chill and have a good time. One very important part of Amsterdam are it's parks and the Vondelpark, the most famous of them all, is truly the best of them all. The park has a lot of entrances, so it is quite convenient to pay it a visit where ever you stay. The more popular is the one near Leidseplein. The park has a lot of ponds and a couple of cafes and restaurants. The best option, though, is to grab something to eat and drink, lie on the grass, enjoy the weather, see the birds and the bees and just CHILL. There are three (maybe more) BBQ points in the park as well, good to congregate and party. The park has a lot of garbage bins for the revellers, but not everybody uses them though,which is quite sad. This summer, the Gementee (municipality) has made a provision for around 10 portable toilets in the park, which has mde the park more popular, I am sure. A must visit place for visitors to Amsterdam and a frequent haunt for residents of the city.

Oasis in the Center of Amsterdam. Hire a bike and spend an hour or so cycling around Vondelpark. There are plenty of tree-lined avenues, places to stop for photo ops and also for a coffee or a light meal. Vondelpark makes a nice change from the streets, trams and hoards of tourists around Leidseplein and it's obvious that heaps of Amsterdam's residents spend time here chilling out and absorbing some of natures beauty.
Enjoy biking in the park. I rented 2 bikes and biked around the park for 2 hours. It was very enjoyable. The park is beautiful and with a lot of attarctins near by

Great park, pleasant to be there). Walked through this park several times (as I lived 300-400 m away from it;)) and came back each time with pleasure - beautiful green area in Amsterdam, a lot of people having rest all over there!
So pretty and not very crowded. We didn't really venture in very far, stopping at a statue but it was so peaceful and quiet. So well managed, and a lot of wildlife a well ( herons, parakeets etc ) :)

Great place to relax or jog in Amsterdam. I ran every morning in Amsterdam and found this park on my last morning run. This is a beautiful spot to run, walk, or relax. There is a restaurant with outdoor seating that looked very nice (wasn't open in early AM). Its amazing to see all the people biking through the park in the morning on their way to work!
One of the best parks in the world. This is an excellent park to visit especially after 6 pm when most museums and shops are closed. The park is beautiful, tranquil with a cafe and many attractions.

Awesome. Absolutely huge park. We cycled around it and it took us ages. Plus the 4 days we were in Amsterdam were sunny and warm so it was packed with people having BBQ's, smoking and having a good time. Im sure the weather made it a much nicer experience but it is well worth a look.

beautiful. walking through Vondelpark was an interesting experience as the park is completely different to the English parks near myself. the park is beautifully kept and well used by tourists and locals. Had no fear walking through it in the dark as there is loads of people around no matter what time you go, its well lit and the police patrol the area on horse and bike, just to keep an eye on thingsOnly one negative is they could do with a separate walking and bike path in some areas as its very busy with both and they both have to take effort to avoid each other.

I've seen a lots of much nicer parks.. I was hoping to find myself in a nature area to counteract the business of the city, but it was really just an extension of it. It was super busy, the nature areas were fairly average and the ponds had an oily film. Disappointing.

Lively park. Lively park with a lot of atmosphere. Lots of runners and cyclists. Watch out for the cyclists as walkers/cyclists all appear on the same path. Impromptu music to be had, open air 'lido' type paddling pool, and concerts/theatre in the open air.

Great to unwind. The Vondelpark is ideally located just outside the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam and is great for walking or running around. On a sunny day it's usually very busy. Great place for a picnic or feeding ducks.
Gorgeous park. We borrowed bicycles from our hotel and took a ride on a sunny afternoon - what a treat! Lakes, ponds, flowers, dogs - it was picture perfect.

Pleasant Park in the Center of the City. My wife and I liked to just sit and watch people, birds, and dogs in this quiet park close to our hotel. The park has walks around a large winding pond with large trees, and it is surrounded on one side by large, stately, century old buildings. The park is popular with locals, children, and people walking their dogs.

Wow !. Vondelpark is the best park that i have ever visited !!! Its perfect for couples, individuals, families, friends, to relax, to have fun, have a walk with your dog, and much much more.
Vondelpark is the biggest Park in Amsterdam, you can bike there too.
Do visit this park, spend the whole day there you wont regret it

Take a stroll. Get up early and take a walk through the park while sipping your morning coffee. Have you breakfast later. Walk on the path away from the joggers and bicycles. Lush blooming tress and lovely lakes/ponds. Or go later when the sun is settig

Very nice park for relaxing.. Very nice park for relaxing and jogging (atleast midday). There is a cafe (Blue teehouse) in the centre of the park where it is possible to buy beer and some food, also several hot dog stands around the park.

Quick bike ride. The park was very close to our hotel and it would have been a great spot for a picnic but we never managed to do that. When we rented bikes we rode through the park - it is a large park with various areas inside it - a restaurant, ampitheatre, play areas.

Your average park. Vondelpark is just your average green area in the middle of a big city. At the time we visited - early in the morning after coming from the Rijksmuseum - nothing special was going on. Just people taking a stroll, sitting in the benches and lots of cyclists - watch out for those. It's ok if you want to take a break from the busy centre area, probably more exciting when there's actually some events going on.

Beautiful. We hired bikes whilst in Amsterdam (when in Rome!) We cycled all over Amsterdam, however Vondelpark was just beautiful it's hard to believe that this spot of tranquillity is in the middle of Amsterdam. An area definitely for locals.

Loved it. With the failure which was trying to visit the Anne Frank house, which had a enormous queue, stilling fresh in our mind - we needed to find something to do, which was also a unique selling point of Amsterdam. We found ourselves visiting Vondelpark!When we visited on a cloudy, drizzly Thursday afternoon. It was a beautiful, tranquil location to visit with many paths to explore, large ponds and the ambient noise of birdsong (and raindrops in our case). Inside we spotted a stage area, and an open air cinema area. There were also a number of what looked like bars and restaurants inside the park, we didn't check these out.When we went it was fairly quiet, although as usual there were a fair amount of cyclists about. On a sunny day, this would be a fantastic location to stroll for a couple of hours, or sit down and enjoy a beer near a pond. However I can also imagine that it gets quite crowded on a sunny day.It felt like somewhere you needed to pay to be, however no, this is a fantastic public park and was one of the highlights of the trip. I think the stop we got out at was "Van Baerlestraat" on tram 5, but you can also just walk there from Museum Quarter ("Museumplein" stop).

Tranquility with a Beer Reward. After taking in the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum or Museumplein, walk over to and through Vondelpark to escape the crowds and take a leisurely stroll along the many paths of this passive park and once you reach the northern terminus, you are greeted by the welcoming "Hard Rock Cafe" sign, just across a road and canal.

I enjoyed running in this park. I enjoyed running in this park during my trip to Amsterdam in August 2013. There was ample dirt and grass surfaces to run or walk and lots of people exercising and riding their bikes to work in the morning. There were more people out picnicking and lounging in the afternoon and evening. A very pleasant experience.

Nice enough, ut slightly over-rated. Had a stroll through here on a beautiful early evening. Very busy and cycle traffic made it necessary to go carefully. Pleasant as a bit of fresh air but not very special,

Lovely Park. Excellent park with many buskers, group of 5 lads were entertaining a group of people so we stopped for awhile and listened. They were just ordinary lads doing something they enjoyed for any change that was given.

Amsterdam Must: Bike&Relax. Our hotel was behind the Vondelpark. So we always rode our bike through the park to explore amsterdam. We loved Vondelpark. We just stopped at random and relaxed at the different ponds. There are also some nice café in the park and a theater/stage. There was a free comedy show, but we didn't go because it was all in dutch. But the theater/stage is a really nice location. Everybody that goes to Amsterdam has to visit this park. Its a must do!

Wonderful calm in a busy city. Had a wonderful morning cycling through the park and had breakfast in the open air cafe. Parrots flying free in the park. Also well skilled jackdaws steal your tubs of butter, jam, muffin papers. Lovely environment in and around teh park.

Oasis of green. We biked through Vondelpark and stopped for lunch and a beer at a restaurant there. A very happening park with walkers, cyclists, and inline skaters. On hot days the park is teeming with people trying to escape the heat of the city...lots of places to find shade and cold beer!

Peaceful. The park is large and gives you plenty of space to do whatever you want or watch other people do whatever they want. The biggest plus is that they have outhouses that are clean as far as outhouses go. I saw a variety of rollerbladers, jugglers, birthday parties, bocce ball games, but mostly people picnicking and reading.
ok. This is ok, i understand why people like it, if you dont have wide open spaces where you live, but we do. Its just a park with lots of people.

Amazing park within a busy city. This park is a must go for anyone who travels to Amsterdam. Not only can you take a break from the busy city centre, but also enjoy a relaxing lie or cycle throughout the park with its lovely little cafes. I also recommend walking by this park at night as you may be able to find some lovely live music or during our time, free film screenings :)

Nice area. A standard park, good for walking, cycling, jogging etc... And there are a few nice cafes. The park has some nice lakes and a small performance stage. Nice for a walk to connect between the fashion area and the museums
Pack a picnic lunch!. A beautiful park to ride bikes or walk through, and the market is nearby, so stop and pick up goodies for lunch and then enjoy!

A nice place to relax. I have visited Vondelpark on 2 out of 3 of my visits to Amsterdam and would highly recommend it. I find with most city breaks that a breather at some point during the trip is a must, and in Amsterdam Vondelpark is one of the best choices to do this, providing an oasis of calm after you've spent time walking the streets. There are plenty of places to walk (or cycle of course), and lovely bridges, fountains and open spaces to sit. There is a fantastic cafe in the park which has a lovely sitting area outside if weather allows. The park is free to wander round and we found the cafe we used to be a fair price too.It is easy to get to via the tram network, and is close to Leidseplein.

A little bit of nature. The local people use the park as their back gardens so you will find families and friends having picnics and hanging out. It is a lovely place to strol through or sit and eat. There are sculptures throughout. We stopped at a cafe and had a drink while people watching.

Rent a bike and ride in Vondelpark!. What an amazing experience. This is where all the natives "hide out" in the summer time... There's a lovely little cafe by one of the ponds where the hydrangeas are HUGE and the view is "vonderful!" It's self-serve.
Nice respite. Nice to rest up in a leafy park in between museum visits, inexpensive dining options tabels and benches for eating if you are lucky, good waffle treats

Rent a bike and ring your bell!. If you've ever cursed or almost been run over by the bike riders in Amsterdam, do what I did. Rent a bike after a 15+ year hiatus and try to dodge the pedestrians. The park is lovely in the spring. We were delighted when we happened across a concrete statue donated by Pablo Picasso, "Figure Decoupee l'Oiseau",1965, called "the fish" by locals.
The perfect park. A lot of space with the family. The son are running wild through the grass. Be careful though. Bicycles, bicycles, everywhere...If the weather are perfect, your day will be!
Whizz round by bike.. A park with a cycle track around it. A few fountains and lakes. Thats all. Nothing outstanding but a good place to exercise in a busy city.
Nice and relaxing. Spent an afternoon relaxing in Vondelpark. It's very popular, and we enjoyed it very much. A great place for a picnic!

Beautiful park with ponds, benches. Vondelpark was a wonderful place to just sit and relax. there were ponds and small streams, people playing music, plenty of huge trees with shade, plenty of grass to lay on or benches to sit on. Great to people watch :) Bring a picnic and you won't regret going here!
Good for biking.. Vondelpark is excellent for biking during the Summer Season. Do not miss to rent a bike or to engage in a bike tour to visit the city and to experience an Amsterdamers' lifestyle.

A wonderful park. a beautiful big park with sculpture all around the park. If you want to job or ride your (rented) bicycle, this is the place to be. On weekend, you will see group exercising together as well as impromptu pick up game.

The best things in life are free. Vondelpark in the midst of Amsterdam is THE place to go, when you need to kick back and relax. Bring your sandwiches (or buy in the park), a frisbee or soccer ball, a blanket and take five from the buzzing surrounding. Listen to the concerts or watch skaters, cyclists and laid back coffee shop goers drift by.The park also have what looks to be a very cozy restaurant at the far end from the Rijksmuseum and several playgrounds som time can quickly pass by once you go through the gates of The Vondel.

The green lung of Amsterdam. If you want to meet the real life of the capital of the netherlands go into this park and enjoy the life. At moment begin in the Vondelpark the exhibition Art Zuid. In the Vondelpark you meet Figurs of Pablo Picasso.
Nice. It is a nice park. The unseasonable hot spell made it to be rather crowded and busy. The cafe we went to in the park was nice to people watch from.

Stunning Park. This park is a must visit, great for just walking, cycling, jogging or sun-bathing. Lots of locals go here as it is a friendly and lively place. There are even areas where live music is played and cafes to eat and drink. During the summer it is a must.

A lovely park. Accessable for most visitors to the city, the Vondelpark is generally considered to be the best of Amsterdam's parks. Pleasant and spacious, with features to appeal to all age groups, it certainly merits an hour or two on any visit to the city.
Beautiful park. Enjoyed a long walk and a boozy picnic round the lake. A must visit in the dam! This is the scenic side and a very tranquil wasy to spend a day.

chill-out place. This large park in the center of amsterdam is a delightful place to relax and chill-out. There are ponds, cafes , restaurants and draws large numbers of both tourists and native Amsterdammers. In the summer free concerts are held at the bandstand. A great place to simply take a break and relax.
Great place to hang out for the day!. Who doesn't love a big, beautiful park? The layout is great and manageable. The Teahouse is cool and a great place to chill and have a beer or a coffee.

Best park ever!. Having rented bicycles from Mac Bike, we decided to "test-drive" the bike and were advised to go to Voldelpark located just around the corner of the shop. This park is definitely the best I've ever seen(maybe even better than Central Park!) There are many different parts for one to explore. Lined with trees and smooth cycling paths, it was great for cycling especially for kids. You can also stop by one of the many ponds to just relax and bird/people watch. Bliss. Away from the mayhem of the city.The park has also plenty of cafes and even areas for local performers performing music.This place was a personal piece of heaven for me :)

Great park. Best time to visit the park is when it is average weather and than just stroll around or go for a drink at some of the places. When very nice weather the park is too crowded and people leave too much dirt/waste.

Worth a Visit. A charming park, filled with an interesting collection of trees, with a series of lakes inhabited by a variety of birds. The park has wide bike paths that are shared by pedestrians. It is well used by the local population, including a variety of fitness groups in the early evening.There a several public buildings, including a Tea House where we sheltered from a passing storm and had a warm cup of tea.
Relaxing. Relaxing, clean atmosphere with a few hippies spread throughout the park. Mainly a bikers thoroughfare in the midst of the city. Nice cafe's to enjoy a coffee and soak up the sun!

Amazing!. This giant park has all sorts of attractions for all: amazing playground for children, quiet rivers with ducks, cafe, summer theatre, a lot of place for playing with frisbee\barbeque\birthday party. Love it!

interesting. I sat on a bench and watched the world ride by. Teenage twins hired cycles and rode around the whole park. I am really impressed, it looked like local people out in the evening enjoying the good weather and the grass. Fascinating watching the different ways people transport children, dogs and goods on their cycle, no helmets, no safety harnesses.
Beautiful. Loved every moment of my walk around the park, the little cafe in the middle was excellent too and decent value

Deceptively Huge!. Really great park right in the centre of the city with a somewhat tiny entrance that then opens up onto this huge park.Lakes, trees, running tracks, grassy areas, some cafe's. We even stumbled upon a free concert in the concert venue!Lounged around on the grass in the sun by the lake for a while. Walked around the loop.Great place to escape the tourist masses and chill for a bit - if you want!

Go in the early morning. I guess I'm a bit biased in my view about the Vondelpark as it's 'my" park. That is to say I live nearby and use it as my garden. I think I know every corner and it is a beautiful place for a wander, that is, if you go in the early morning when you have the place relatively to yourself, give or take the odd fanatical jogger or an early dog walker. There is a large paved perimeter road if you wish to skate or cycle, but the nicest paths wind through the park, where you'll find water features and even a rose garden. If you go on a hot weekend afternoon you will find mayhem, which can be fun and colourful if you like other people's BBQ smoke and someone else's taste in rap music. After 11 it's the domain of the guys who sit and drink strong, cheap lager and fall asleep on the park benches. Join the fun or set your alarm and see it in peace.
beautiful park. ventured through the park via bike..what a beautiful and peaceful place and perfect for cycling! Definitely would spend more time here..
Gorgeous. Sooo nice and relaxing, the weather was beautiful when we were there so it lit up the whole park! Really nice people.

Lovely stroll. We had a lovely stroll around the park, great if you want to grab some sandwiches from the local supermarket and sit down for a picnic. Some great entertainment on through the summer evenings too.
Best park ever. We only went through a little bit of the park and I stil loved it :) Definitly a place to bring a smoke and some munchies.

Hang there at night, drinking and smoking, if you're of legal age, of course.. Nothing like it. Amsterdam calls for some of those mundane pleasures in some of us and as that is my case, I decided to get a bottle of my favourite scotch and a quantity of cannabis from a local store to stay there at night, listening to some tunes with my partner.Nobody bothered us. Stayed there until 3:30am, and a cop came by. He looked at me as I had a cannabis cigarrete and an open bottle of alcohol by my side (both of which are illegal). I did not react because I am no criminal. He just let it go and walked away without saying a word. So it really reflected once again the dutch spirit of "don't bother me, I won't bother you".If you're going to stay there and keep it to yourself, great. Make sure you remember people live near the park and noise may be a disturbance. You don't want to disturb anyone when you visit their city and they don't want to disturb your party.Have fun!

Great piece of greenery in the city. We strolled through the park on a very hot day and stopped for a coffee at the cafe. In the sun its very pretty and bohemian with people doing yoga on the grass or riding through the park on bikes worth a stroll
Nice park. Lovely large green park in the middle of a city, would recommend a visit, take a towel to lie and sunbathe or cycle round if you are too nervous to go on the streets.

Big and nice park - to walk, run, cycle or just enjoy. I rented apartment near the Vondelpark and walked/cycled every day through. Lot of people enjoying in the same place.Nice lakelets all over the park with fountains inside.

Oasis. If you know St. James's Park in London or Sefton Park in Liverpool, you'll be somewhere near Vondelpark. It has it all: lakes, rivers, fountains, rose gardens, wild spaces, rope walkways, an open-air theatre, bars, and restaurants. Well worth a visit in its own right, but also a great spot for lunch and the very best way to walk to the south-west of the city.
Beautiful!. Loved this place! Very relazing and beautiful atmosphere. The park is very clean and well maintained. Also, perfect for a long quiet walk.
Beautiful. What a lovely park! Quite possibly one of the nicest I have been to, not counting oosterpark. Very scenic and peaceful. Nice place to stop by for a picnic.

The heart of Amsterdam.. We stayed in a hostel almost inside Voldelpark, so it was a great part of out trip to Amsterdam.This park is a family friendly place, we saw lots of people riding bikes and playing sports here. It also has some great lakes and fountains. On the other hand you will be able to see some people smoking pot in this park, but since this is a legal thing in Amsterdam, it will not really be a problem.All in all, It's a great place to spend a spare time. I wish the weather was better when we went to Amsterdam, so we would have enjoyed the park even more.

Beautiful park. It was a sunny day when we went the park was buzzing. Lots of bikes about, plenty of places to sit in the sun. We went to the stage area and watched a couple of bands. It was free and there is somewhere were you can get a snack and a drink that's not expensive. Worth a visit.

A most attractive open space.. Beautifully set at the bottom of Amsterdam, (if you think of the Central Station being at the top) this allows you acres of attractive walking and sitting, with some fine planting and mature trees and landscaping. It is rightly popular with local inhabitants who use it for relaxation and games. The southern andwestern edges of the park are bordered by an expensive residential area, and worth a visit if you would like to see examples of expensive middle-class domestic architecture of the late nineteenth century, including the church that Cuypers built and where he worshipped, now converted to other uses.

Take a break from museums and sightseeing.... ... and relax here in the green veil of Amsterdam. Stroll and relax away from the cars, motorbikes and fast bicyclists. Have your picnic lunch and get away from the commercial aspects of AMS.

At the summer, very cool. Something was very funy, for me from Brasil. It was very hot, bright sun, like my country. I haven´t see anywhere to refresh mysefl (except drinking beers rs). A dutch girl answered me: "refresh here?! No, we refresh at our homes, taking a shower". kkkk

Nice walk. Vondelpark is a lovely spot for a quiet walk, but I wouldn't really put it on the same level as other great parks in the world. It's worth walking through once, or even better, riding through on a bicycle, especially if you're coming in to the city centre from that side of town.

Lots of activity, great for a summer time picnic. Beautiful to stroll through. Crowded in the summer time. Have known friends to sleep on the benches and not get hassled. Watch out for bikers, skaters, tourists. Can get very busy with good weather but worth it to relax in the sun and you can bring your own rose to drink outdoors.

beautiful and great for skateboarding. love this park, it was the dutch equivalent of HYde park or central park. beautiful with little streams and lakes, the paving was smooth making it great for running or long boarding

Nice park. This park near the centre of Amsterdam is a really nice place to stay. In summer it is crowded at some places, but if you walk deeper into the park, beautifull free spots are there to find. A swimmingpool for the little one and an Original rose garden.

good for a run or a walk. With Amsterdam's cycle and tram traffic, it is hard to relax on a run. Go to the Vondelpark and do a few interconnected loops. No mechanized traffic (except city vehicles) and the bicycles follow a predictable pattern - low risk of collision!

Beautiful. I think that we maybe struck it lucky, as I am aware that Amsterdam can have very changeable weather, however we were fortunate enough to visit when it was over 30 degrees and blazing sunshine. The park is huge and people seem to flock there when it is warm to cycle, jog or just sunbathe and eat ice cream. There was a traditional music event occuring on the band stand when we visited, just generally somewhere to while away the hours if you want a bit of a break from walking or the bars.
oasis within the city limits. On a sunny day, it is great to be there and sit and watch people go by. Get yourself a spot near the water, a bite and a drink or an icecream and relax.
fantastic park. a lovely green tranquil area transporting you away from the hussle and bussle of Amsterdam. Fantastic place to chill with a picnic.

Old Amsterdam's Central Park. However much I love this city to bits, my one gripe is that there aren't enough green spaces open to the public (the canal houses have huge private gardens in the back)So this park, which sprawls over a large area and has many gates (and therefore many entrances and exits from every direction) is the one place every Amsterdammer and tourist flock to, given the tiniest amount if good weather. People play music, smoke weed, skate, cycle, make barbecues all summer, creating a very festive atmosphere. The park is large enough that if you walk a bit longer, you can always find a quiet(er) spot where you can find your own oasis. There is an open air theatre which has fabulous programming throughout the summer. The Julidans festival has a wide range of gigs and workshops in the month of July. So well worth a visit...
nice park in the city. Vondelpark is a nice city park with all green inside. There is beautiful place to sit in it on/near lake. you can rent a bike and enjoy biking.

Vondelpark the place for the inline slalomscene. If you want to meet locals hanging-out and just relax and enjoy the sun this is the place to go. This park also host the Amsterdam inline skating scene with their popular Friday Night Skate. Starting at "het ronde bankje" near de Filmmuseum. In the weekends this place is either crowded with the local inline slalom skaters or a group of drunken homeless people. This depends on who comes first. If you are harassed by those drunken junkies please report it to the police because that is the only way to give the place back to the skate scene.

Great Place for a Picnic between museums. After visiting the van Gough Museum we stopped at the local A&J Supermarket and purchased pre-made sandwiches, fresh fruit and some drinks (they supply a free knife/fork/spoon and napkin) and walked over the park for a nice picnic at a bench under the shade. Great people watching spot - just watch those bikes if you have to cross any paths!
Nice and safe.. Very nice park, with easy access. For a picnic, rest, bike travel or family gathering. it is clean, safe and beautiful.

A breath of fresh air. Amsterdam seems to have a can-do attitude. Where many parks welcome you with a large list of things you are NOT allowed to do - barbecue, walking on the grass etc - here you'll find things are relaxed and easy going. Sure you are only allowed to BBQ in certain areas of the park but these are vast and provide fireproof 'tiles' set into the grass for disposable BBQs along with a fireproof bin to dispose of them afterwards. There are lots of toilet 'points' scattered around and a good number of recycle bins. The park was really busy on the warm evening we visited but everybody seemed happy and the whole area was clean and felt safe. There was an underpass beneath a main road in the centre of the park with not a single bit of graffiti. The park is laid out in the "English Landscaped" style with winding paths and curving bridges over the many waterways. Lovely

Good place for running and relaxing. In the Vondelpark you will find a nice running track of about 3.5 km. Especially in the weekend you will find a lot of runners doing their training rounds. And if you want to relax the grass areas are suited for that. In the evening it can be very crowded and due to the many barbeques smelly as well. Afterwards it is a mesh, but the cleaning department of Amsterdam does a good job and so the park is clean again in the morning.
Green heart of Amsterdam. Perfect spot to stroll around for a few hours and watch the Dutch or being watched. Crowded on sunny weekends, but wonderful park in the heart of the city. A must see.

Lovely place to people watch & picnic. We bought sandwiches, munchies, and drinks, and took them to this delightful park for one of our most memorable lunches in Amsterdam. The people-watching is incomparable, the surroundings beautiful, and this day was warm but not hot, so we really enjoyed it all. Highly Recommended.

Too crowded park with some atmosphere. The park is more like a crowded city than a place to rest and to enjoy nature. But this being so, it has some atmosphere of very different people meeting each other and many activities taking place at the same time. Nevertheless, if you need some rest or want to read, visit one of the other less crowded parks, like Beatrixpark or the huge Amsterdamse Bos.

Vondelpark. Great place to take in the sights (people) and sounds of Amsterdam. If you're a runner, this is your park. If you're having a friendly outing, this too is the place. Come one, come all, it's a must visit on any trip to Amsterdam (whether on foot or by bike).
Wonderful atmosphere. Massive park, really pretty, and on the day we went they had a free open air concert. The place was full of people having a good time and there were lots of families there.
nice city centre park. you have to be been there ! nice park with three nice coffeeplaces, just for a walk and BBQ, take your picknick lunch of diner with you and just sit down at the floor.
dream park. This is our "central park" of Amsterdam, better than NY city, a bit smaller but people here have far more freedom than in any other park in the world.

A small "Central Park". This long stretched park (two miles long) is a bit like Central Park in New York. You can see the buildings (though not skyscrapers) along the park's boundaries. Lot's of people strolling, running, roller-skating and cycling through the lanes. Picnick on the lawns near the ponds. Sit back and watch the people going by. Take a beer on the terrace in the centre of the park.

My favourite place in Amsterdam. You MUST come here in the summer if you happen to be in Amsterdam! You can have a picnic, a smoke (If careful :) sometimes even a BBQ! It's nice to even just sit on the grass and people watch while you take in the fantastic city of Amsterdam.Highly recommended and possibly the best place to 'chill' in Amsterdam!

Renaissance masters. Some of the world's greatest renaissance paintings. Photos allowed!
Not cheap. Long entry line but moves quickly.
Relax.. Head here for some quiet time in Amsterdam! You'll probably need it. Vondelpark is huge, enjoy bike riding, tennis, roller blading, or just laying in the grass.
Great atmosphere. A very beautiful and calm park to enjoy a stroll in the sunshine! Very easy to get to on the trams or walking (We walked from Leidesplein and it only took around 5 mins)

Overrated and Overcrowded. Vondelpark has a great location near the Museumplein and other tourist hotspots. It is however, enormously overcrowded and does not really offer anything special. It is not particularly pretty, well laid out or special. There are however often (free) events in the park that can be interesting. All in all, I can recommend one of the other parks (there are enough) if you want to have some R&R away from the crowds.
Great place. A lovely park, to either cycle around or just chill out on the grass. They have a stage where live bands pay music, it's a great atmosphere. Well worth a visit when in Amsterdam

The best time i spend without spend a cent.. We visit and for make a picnic in the middle of Amsterdam...really relax and full of life..the park it doesent close but its better to not stay really late arround 11 most peopple had gone..so plenty of time to put your feets on the ground smoke and drink some wine and dont forget a lovely company make the best hangout in Amsterdam with not spending a cent.

Amderstam Experience. We strolled into Vondelpark and got introduced to the "scene" of Amsterdam. Hundreds of bicyclists riding solo or side by side on their cruiser bikes, texting, on the phone, talking, zig-zagging through pedestrian traffic or zipping around curves...and no collisions. As a road cyclist, I found it fascinating, entertaining and quite intimidating. Our week in Amsterdam featured 4 days of sunshine, so the locals were out in throngs. The grass was covered with people hanging out, enjoying beer or picnics or bbqs. The grounds are lovely, lots of green & water.
great for a stroll. lovely to have a park so close to all of the major attractions and so well used....watch out for the cyclists though as they certainly 'rule the road' in Amsterdam.
Vondelpark. Fabuous park in the heart of Amsterdam! Stay in a hotel near here, we stayed at the Marriott, steps away from this park.

Gorgeous Park in the Heart of the City. What a beautiful park! We walked through the park as a short-cut to get back to our hotel, but we loved that on a nice day there were literally hundreds of people out and about, eating packed dinners or even napping on the lawns, catching up with friends, strumming guitars, running, riding, and walking. I probably wouldn't go wandering through here at night, but during the day it's just gorgeous!

Great for people watching. Very beautiful park in the middle of the city. My wife and I spent about an hour walking the paths and people watching. I would have liked to spend more time there but our schedule would not allow it.

Does what it says on the tin. A nice place to relax, and walk about, however it is just a park. If your looking for activities then this is not the place.
Still worth a visit if your in the area.

A great retreat from the heat!. A great place to find a shady spot in the heatwave of July 2013! It's good to sit under a tree and watch the world go by or walk through the park to enjoy the various wildlife (animal and human).

buzzing with energy!!!. A beautiful park. Serene, large, and buzzing with energy.
This parks amazing. Bring a picnic or even a bbq, hang out, take in the sights and relax.
Always packed and always something going on, from free concerts to individuals strumming away on their guitar a great place to hang out.

An Enjoyable Escape. Not far from Central Amsterdam, Vondel Park is a nice place to spend a few hours while visiting the city.We do so while on a set of two wheels and have fun enjoying it's numerous bike paths. We watch others relaxing near waterfalls, ponds or taking pictures with bright colorful flowers as a back drop.For me, Vondel Park is like Central Park in New York city and is always worth a visit when I am in Amsterdam.
Pretty park. Lovely park for picnicking, cycling and BBQ-ing. Large park with lakes, mature trees and no cars. Great place to relax.

Anyone for a BBQ?. The park was packed mostly with people under 30. For some reason they were all packed together and there were loads of BBQ's being lit. Others had picnics and we did see someone coming with a casserole! People were drinking, smoking and listening to music. There was a very obvious police presence, so I can only assume it got more rowdy as the night went on

Amazing park for relaxing. Very old and lovely park. Named after a famous 17th century author Joost van den Vondel (earlier called Amsterdam park). the biggest and most popular park in Amsterdam. Lost of space for a picnic or relaxing. The trees are amazing. Containing several places to eat (haven't tried any of them), and multiple pieces of art including "Fish by pablo Picasso" the only outdoor Picasso sculpture?
walk. Common park, nothing special! A lot of people, someone is sleeping on the grass, someone came to the picnic. Nothing to do except just enjoy of area.

Park. We had spent a lot ot time walking and needed a rest day! We bought food at the suoermarket and sat in the park and had a picnic, Great big place ,ponds,ducks, fountains, great to watch people go by, good if you have kids that need to run about!
Lush. Such as great place to hangout, have a picnic and read a good book. Its great because all of the locals hangout there

A large park right in the middle of historic Amsterdam. I guess we were lucky as the weather was great. We went there twice. Once on foot and the second time with bikes. There is a bike rental shop (Mac Bike) very close to Leidseplein and Vondelpark. So even if you are scared riding bike in Amsterdam (like me), this is your chance to walk to the park with your bike and then enjoy a rather danger-free bike ride in the park. There are also a number of restaurants in this park where you can find a lot of different food and drinks.
A beautiful park. This park is absolutely stunning- we spent an afternoon there with a picnic and it was perfect- definitely worth a walk around.

A good break between Museums. The north end of the Vondelpark is close to the Riyksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum but the park is quite large and is worth visiting on its own if you have a few days in Amsterdam. We went on a Thursday in July and I was surprised how many people, seemingly all Dutch, were enjoying the park during a working day. Earlier that day someone had told us she enjoyed taking at least part of her holidays at home in Amsterdam and I can imagine this would be a good reason. There are lots of trees and streams with little bridges and places serving food and drinks so you can unwind on your own or amid company.The easiest access is by tram and there are many different trams that run alongside the Vondelpark. You just need a map that shows the tram numbers and routes. I guess it would be at least an hour's walk south from Central Station but quite accessible by bicycle if you rent one.

A world away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Vondelpark is a beautiful, green getaway only minutes from the city center. Grab a bike, pack a bite to eat and something good to drink, and pedal to the park. Find a relaxing spot to sit, visit, and watch the world go by. You won't regret it.
A nice park to spend a sunny day. A nice park to take a leisure walk or just to relax when the sun shines in Amsterdam(which happens once in a blue moon)

Beautiful City Park. Vondel Park makes a real change from the hectic, noisy atmosphere of the centre of Amsterdam......The variety of trees, and the broad walks make a cool relief from the heat of this July.The park is clean and neat and seems a great place for residents and visitorsto take children and walk dogs. This was our first time to wander around Vondel Park after a number of visits here.....and we can say that it is an ideal place to walk off a big lunch, or experience a 'change of scene' from the old-town atmosphere of the centre and the charming canals.

An enjoyable walk around a busy park. An expansive park, Vondelpark appears to be the heart of Amsterdam during the sumnmer months when you are looking for somewhere to relax or to work on a tan.During the day time it's great to stroll as a couple (or with family) around the gardens, while in the evening it turns into a more adult oriented crowd - some of who unfortunately end up drinking too much.Staying at a hotel directly opposite Vondelpark was great - but thankfully the double glazing in the windows kept the noise out in the early hours of the morning while groups of younger travellers drank throughout the night.The evening experience aside, it's a great place to visit during the daytime. Good cafes located nearby where you can buy some coffee and sandwiches and enjoy them in the park.

Sunny Day. We visited this park on Thursday of this week, as we had fantastic weather on our visit.Bring your own food and drinks, take a blanket and have a picnic.Great people watching, plenty people smoking their coffeeshops purchase! but be warned lots of police about.Great place to visit, also a lovely area to walk around.

Parakeets in the city park. During our time in Amsterdam, we made a point of visiting the Vondelpark and spending some time in the drizzling rain to sit and listen to and observe the wildlife (human included). We were much surprised to discover birds that looked like parrots, and some research while sitting there said that indeed, there is a breeding population of parakeets that established itself in the late 1970's when someone released them. A lovely place to enjoy some green time in the middle of a beautiful city.

Great afternoon. My wife and I grabbed a bottle of wine, some bread, meat and cheese from the market and had a picnic for a few hours on a nice Saturday afternoon in the park. Just talking and people watching. Things just work a little different then what I'm used to in Canada. I would defiantly try to make it here for a couple hours of free fun in you're in the city.
Great for jogging and strolling. Beautiful park with great views and paths. Much quieter in the early morning for a jog. Also great for an after-dinner stroll.

It's just a park. We strolled a bit after a short walk from a museum and only ventured up to 't Blauwe Theehuishad for a drink. I expected more flowers and nice gardens, but there's not a lot of landscaping, just grass, people sleeping on it, nothing special.
Fun and interesting. Definitely worth a visit, have some great photo shops, pickled herring and cafe restaraunts overlooking the water

Lovely Park in Central Amsterdam. Lovely Park to wonder through or take the weight off your feet after a busy day. Close to the Seafood Bar - a must visit restaurant. Also close to the famour Amsterdam Letters.Lovely.

Wonderful park. Take the time to enjoy this park. Afternoons are especially nice with all of the people out for strolls, exercise, walking dogs. There is a restaurant that is in the park that is open until 5:00 each day. Nice to have a refreshment after walking.
Picnic time. Picnic in the garden rose, wine at the little restaurant near the lake, people are happy with its sunny in Amsterdam...

Amsterdam Park Life at it's Best. This is a beautiful city park, on par with parks such as Hyde Park in London and Central Park in New York. Here you will find Amsterdamers from all walks of life enjoying and using the park. There is are special areas for BBQ's, lots of modern sculptures and monuments to enjoy. There are some great cafés and restaurants inside the park. It has a very relaxed atmosphere and is clearly well used and loved by all who visit. There are playgrounds, rose gardens, water-features, wooded areas, sports recreation areas and plenty of benches to relax on.It's perfect to go and relax after exploring the nearby Musuemsplein or Leidseplein. It felt very safe and would definitely recommend for families, unlike some UK parks which seem to attract some more unsavoury characters.

Nice Stroll. Vondelpark is know to be the "Central Park" of Amsterdam. We enjoyed a leisure walk through the park. We didn't walk very far so I can't give a good review on the aesthetics of the park. However, we originally planned to do a picnic, but the weather is always cold and windy so we enjoyed a brisk walk instead. It was interesting to observe the Dutch locals hanging out. This was the only area where we actually saw joggers as everyone else in the city is always riding bikes. Vondelpark is also close to the Blue Boat Company canal cruise departure point. We noticed huge clouds of smoke and thought people were barbequing. We learned quickly they were smoking weed! Got to love Amsterdam!

Vondelpark is a wonderful experience. If you stay at the Hilton Hotel, this park is just a four-block walk and worth every step of the way. Plenty of paths and trails, wide paved areas for bicycling or walking, endless friendly people, plenty of shade and plenty of open grassy areas to catch the sun. Its free, its safe and its wonderful.

A Bit Run Down. After reading the reviews of this park, I expected an immaculate garden and grassy area with old folks strolling, couples having romantic picnics on the grass, and kids playing on the playground, in the fountains, or riding bikes, etc. To be honest, the park is a bit run down. The lake/ water features had lots of algae, although admittedly, city workers were running loud machines in an attempt to get control of the problem. We strolled through the park in late morning, and there were still plenty of hung over partiers sitting on park benches with a glazed look in their eyes, smoking cigarettes or pot. We were told by the locals that there are people who live in houses within the park boundaries. In the mornings, their job is to clean up all the trash, broken glass, and other accoutrements which are left over after the prior night's revelries.
Must see. You must go here if your in.Amsterdam, we had a lovely few hours chilling in the sun. Nice to watch the world go by
Vonderful. Went here after visiting a smart shop and the Van Gogh museum. It was the perfect end to a perfect day.
Beautiful. Best place to go for a run-huge beautiful park right in the centre of the city with fountains, loads of different people and places to eat

Lovely park and secret tea hut. We came to the park, for a break from the hustle and bustle.Walking through the park you get a sense of calm and tranquillity, as we were walking though the park we came across what we thought was a tea hut and that it may well be shut.I was wrong!! Was very much open and they served more than tea! there were alcoholic refreshments and food on offer plus like most places in Amsterdam there was free Wi-Fi just ask the server, who was friendly.Waste away a few hours and enjoy the scenery in this treasure!

awesome park. vondelpark is one of the best parks in amsterdam. its huge, its beautiful and its nature at its best. weekend music (rock, pop, metal etc) is the best part of this park. bring a picnic with you and enjoy.
A pleasant break. A great way to rest your feet and see the locals going about their business. See how many different bikes you can see!

This place has it all. to fully enjoy this great park you want to be here on a sunny day, then go sit and relax under the warm sunny skies with some friends or without, bring your fries with mayo and beer with you or if you're feeling artistic you can grab your painting equipment and find one of those perfect to draw spots by the lake, or take dreamy utopia photos of kids running around this awsome place, or catch one of the live bands that are occasionally playing there. either of these will easily take you away relaxing on a sunday or on a day off while you won't even feel the time passing.
Beautiful park. I loved the little lakes in the middle of the park. It had exits everywhere so you could walk onto the streets and not get lost. A few toilets around would have been nice.

Ride a bike.. Ride one or walk from one end to the other and air your lungs for a minute with something other than the red light and coffee shops. There are numerous cafes to enjoy a bite and a refreshing Heineken.

Such green grass. I loved this park it's busier than most parks because of the I am Amsterdam sign but it's a pleasant surprise once you walk past a bunch of buildings to this huge field of the greenest grass. I loved it and it's conviently located by the Von Gogh and the House of Bols.

Lovely park to spend some time in. We visited this park on a blisteringly hot day, but there appeared to be plenty of shady spots to walk in, and once you got away from the dangerous cyclists, you could actually enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.

A green lung.. If you want a place to stroll and gain an impression of life in this city, you couldn't do better than take an evening walk in the Vondelpark. Folks are out running, cycling, walking their dogs and chatting..... peaceful and pleasurable yet in the heart of town.

Just like Central Park!. This was a really nice park! Lots of people biking, swimming, and just hanging out. My husband and I biked here from uptown to see Heineken Experience and Van Gogh. We stopped here for a ride and lunch by one of the lakes. It was fun biking through and relaxing in the grass. Bring a blanket! There is also a sandwich shop inside the park, which sells gelato too.

Oasis. A beautiful 'lung' of green in the city. Many, many bikes and we saw an accident while we were there, so not amazingly relaxing but a nice change to city streets and canals! Shady when it's hot too.
A haven amidst the hustle and bustle.. A great park to stroll around. Watch out for cyclists tho!! And the parrots. Just great. Could do with 1 or 2 smaller cafesCheers

Beautiful park. This is a great park. Very large and plenty of space to have a picnic lunch. There are always talented musicians playing everything from drums to violins around the park. It was cold when we visited but still had a lot of people there. A great way to spend a few hours to relax. Be ready to breath in a lot of second hand smoke! :-)

Pretty Park. We went late in the day on a Sunday. There were not as many families as I expected. There were lots of small groups of young people drinking and smoking. I didn't feel comfortable. Maybe earlier in the day is better. The park itself is nice with a pretty bridge and small ponds. Lots of birds. We were able to see the green parrots that live wild in the trees.
Very nice. Beautiful park. It has a few places to buy snacks and drinks, and some sculptures scattered around. It would be nice for tourists if the physical map in the park had a "you are here" sign.

Great park in the middle of the city. Was lovely to walk through and soak in some of nature's offerings and there's a restaurant within the park though we didn't visit. However we did walk across the street once out of the park and rode one of the many riverboats for tourists.
great fun!. one of the best days of the year with sun i spend it with my girlfriend at vondepark!!huge and great also for kids.!

A Must-see in Amsterdam. At least in the summer, a visit to Vondelpark is essential. The park is truly gorgeous and well maintained. It’s no surprise that Amsterdamers flock there to enjoy the outdoors. It’s a happy and attractive place to rest, relax, observe, participate, bike, play tennis, and for youngsters to enjoy the wading pool. I’ll return every chance I can.

Great atmosphere on a hot day!. We went here on a really hot day in July and there was barely anywhere to sit..it was absolutely packed! Lovely atmosphere, music, alcohol, BBQ's, very very social. Probably not a good place to go in the heat if you want peace and quiet as there's lots of people and hustle and bustle. There's a port-a-loo in the park and a hot dog stand..both look as dirty as each other. Take a picnic! Really nice place to hang out and worth a visit if you like that sort of thing.

A beautiful cycling route!. Most areas of Vondelpark bicycles are permitted, so you can cycle to the very end. This park is a perfect place to chill and watch life go by. Bring a picnic blanket so you can lounge on the lush grass, some snacks and even some coffee shop treats. Even in winter this park is a must visit.
average park. It has an interesting history but i'm not a huge park fan when i'm touring a city. I would give it a look just for the experience.
Beautiful Park. Loved the beautiful gardens. Wonderful place to chill out and relax. Fairly busy on the bike paths but we walked and kept to the footpaths

Fantastic place to relax. Loved the atmosphere, the people and the general happiness of the place! We went on a sunny Saturday afternoon and although it was very busy, we loved being there with real Amterdamers!
Good for people watching. It's a nice big park to relax in on a hot summer's day, you can walk round the lake, sit on the grass and let the world go by, have a bbq or a smoke.

Beautiful Green space for a summer picnic. Walked to the park from Conservatorium hotel on Museumplein,:Cross the street and follow the trams round the corner, then turn right at the cafe on the corner. We picked up delicious rolls with cheeses, ham etc made to order by an excellent wineshop across the street ( a friendly customer buying his lunch to take back to his office informed us it was one of the best in Amsterdam) and five minutes later were in Vondelpark. Wide paved paths (but as everywhere in Amsterdam watch out for the cyclists as not all warn you they are about to run you down!). Beautiful walks in the centre of the city, lake, masses of seats on which to laze or watch the ducks etc on the lake - just a pleasure to be there on a fine summer's day. There is a coffee shop - no frills but good coffee in this beautiful spacious , well treed 'green lung'. Accessible from many points as takes up a large area. Near Museumplein there are several small restaurants for before or after your walk if a picnic doesn't appeal: one diagonally across the road from the hotel (does good breakfasts and prices at dinner for a wonderful Dover sole HALF the price of the upmarket restaurant down the road opposite the Concertgbouw), A deli next door, but recommend the wineshop further down the street, or the cafe across the street on the corner down which you can reach Vondelpark.. Excellent coffee and good food in the cafe. Very reasonable prices at all these establishments.

Great park with great entertainment. We love the park and the location! It offers a quite respite from the city trams and rush life. It is a great place to have a picnic at or check out the BLAUWE THEEHUIS!

Average park. Nothing special about this park. There are no exotic features or special areas.... nevertheless, you can spend some time there enjoyin the good mood from the crowds there. Maybe if you go for a barbecue you can have more fun... you can by these "barbecue disposable kits" and join the locals.
For summer afternoons it is a good choice.. On summer there are plenty of events, including a really nice dancing festival. It was a glad surprise !

Nice space to amble in. We had a wander here for most of a morning. Nice open space, very green, lots of ducks. Well marked paths and plenty happening around e.g. tennis courts, children's areas, some artwork. And places to eat and have a coffee or wine.
Nice for a stroll during a sunny day!. We spent a few of our Amsterdam hours just hanging in the park while watching the bikes to pass around. Relaxing place!
Wonderful on a sunny day. The park is very big, and is full of people just relaxing. A very nice place for a leisurely stroll.

Such a lovely place! Green island in the middle of the city!. It's fanstastic if you visit Vondelpark during a sunny day! The place is always clean and quite, so big that even when crowded you can find your own personal spot where to relax, read or only take a bath of sun.There are a lot of ponds and lawns, foothpaths and bike lanes. Busy during the summer also due to the open theater, it deserves a visit indeed!

Beautiful Park. A beautiful park to relax and walk in. We love city parks and this ranks amongst the best that we have enjoyed with lots of space to find your own little piece green to sit and picnic wattching the world go by on their bike!
Quiet and lovely. A lovely little park. Nice to bike ride without the traffic of the streets. Perfect for people watching.
Escape the hustle and bustle. it was cold, and not many people were out at the park. but it was a nice little walkthrough during the day.

Cool place to relax and enjoy. The park is awesome! The walking paths are nice to walk off some of the great food. The grassy open areas are nice for sitting and chilling. My wife likes the lakes to go and feed the ducks (she says the were asking for the stale bread she brought).

Museum is great.. The logistics of tickets and signs could be a little more organized. Otherwise a good experience. People may want to go later in the day say 4 pm and have a shorter wait and better experience.
Most amazing park. This park is simply amazing. Beautifully laid out for the bikers, joggers and leisurely walkers. Great way to start the day with a nice cup of coffee.

Perfect place for a run in the heart of the city. This is a gorgeous park with lakes, meadows, sculptures, beautiful trees & flowers, right in the heart of Amsterdam. Our hotel was about a half mile away, so I'd jog over past the Rijksmuseum early each morning to run a couple of loops around the park before starting our days of museum-going. What a great way to start the day! Must beware of all the bikes, but there are definitely tons of joggers, there, too.

Dirty, untended, lacking colour (mid June). We went in mid June, having read all the great reviews of this park, and were left sorely disappointed.The park was not tended well. Cigarette butts were everywhere; plastic bottles and rubbish were in the ponds; there were lots of patches of burnt grass, possibly where people were having bbqs (we saw some doing this while were there).The park was almost all just green. What flowers were selected meant there was a splash of purple here and there. Dead tulips were there too.In the bushes you could see weeds as tall as your waist.There were men looking around suspiciously and when we past them, they smelt like the "coffee houses".You have to watch out for cyclists as they don't seem to care about pedestrians. (No bell ringing etc)---We're huge fans of parks in general but this failed miserably.We're confused by this park being rated so well.Definitely missable if this is what it's like at other times of the year.

Lost but who cares.... On a map, Vondelpark doesn't look like much, but the winding paths, small bridges, seeming dozens of water features make this not only Amsterdam's Central Park, but a real change of pace from the touristy stuff. Just be prepared to be lost, as we were, since the guideposts were absent for the most part.
beautiful. It´s such a nice place to visit using a bike and to make a pic-nic or just walk:)it´s so green i really enjoyed it.
A good place for picnic!. This park seems to be the lungs of Amsterdam and if you want to have time out of the hazzle of the city - this is the place to be.
Pleasant. A pleasant park to walk around on a warm day... fun place to people watch, see wildlife and just chill out!
Lovely relaxing place to sit & picnic. Nice little park in the middle of Amsterdam, free entry with a great hot dog vendor outside. Plenty of benches to sit & relax watching the world go by.

A bit of Nature in the city. The Vondelpark, though not the size of Central Park (nor with its extremes of elevations - Vondelpark is quite flat), has varied landscapes, from very carefully pruned and planted gardens, to wild marshland, complete with nesting wading birds.

Centranl but quiet. It's a lovely place for a time-out after a long day shopping or visitin museums. Vodelpark is very close to "Rijksmuseum", "Van Gogh" Museum and the "Stedelijk" lots of families, locals and tourists. Close to it is the dutch Asics-Store to continue your Amsterdam shopping-experience....

People and bird watching. A wonderful park to walk around in, and watch people and birds. Fairly large with plenty of walking paths. Be careful of the people on bicycles. Lots of other people exercising. Looks to be a well used park by the people in Amsterdam. Walked through there several times during my visit because it was so pleasant. Can be busy on good days, but parks should be used.
Lovely park for a cycle. We hired bikes and cycled round the park. There was lots of joggers and dog walkers alike. There is a cafe in the centre of the park were you can get a drink.
Just perfect!. Beautiful park in the city. Great for people watching, bike riding, picnics, day-drinking, walking the paths...really whatever you want. Peaceful and very scenic!

Good picnic and excercise spot!. Go on a sunny day and take a picnic or go in colder weather and wear warm clothes and buy a takeaway coffee from one of the cafes inside Vondelpark. We wanted to hire bikes but couldn't find a hire place - if you also want to ride around the park, find out where to rent a bike first! The gardens are well maintained and there are some cool sculptures around. Take a camera!
Relaxing haven in busy Amsterdam. Nice break from the hustle & bustle of downtown, and a good place to relax, lay out, and enjoy a few drinks.
Great place to chill. This is a great place to sit and chill, lots of nice small lakes, all walks of life venture there and a great place to watch the world go by.

Quiet, green and enjoyable.. This walk in a park is a nice contrast to the busy food lined streets in Amsterdam city. The park has good walking paths and cycleways and dogs are welcomed. We were entertained watching a youth training his jack Russel small dog. There are ponds with a variety of resident bird life and the trees above shelter dozens of birds, among them some Parrot species.There are many joggers and cyclists and this park is said to provide entertainment for ten million visitors a year. There are special areas for a family BBQ and very few "do not" signs.A very enjoyable peoples park. Take your camera as there are always a few unique shots to be taken.
Vondelpark Amsterdam. Gorgeous place! Always entertainment and beautiful view of the city. Wonderful place for a walk, picnic, entertainment, or just to clear your head.
