Nice place to stop and take a breather!. Very large park with lakes and good walks. Plenty of skaters and cyclists. There's a bar in the park where you can get a coffee or a beer and although its a bit basic its pretty cheap for Amsterdam.

Lovely sunny day strolling in the park!. A haven away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Easy to find on the trams and a short walk from the tram stop. Great to find a peaceful place to sit and watch the world go by.

A nice park, but every big city has at least one.... The best part of this park to me is all the ways the locals have of enjoying it. This says a lot about the people who live nearby. Europeans generally have less space in their living quarters than we Americans have, so a lot of their lives, especially their leisure time, is spent in bars, restaurants and parks such as this one. You will see people playing at many different sports, reading, "courting", sunbathing, etc. This is a nice place to walk around on a sunny day. I don't know why this is considered as a tourist "thing to do" since it's really no different than Hyde Park in London or Central Park in New York.

Peaceful park for a ride or walk through. A fantastic place to get away from the hubub of Amsterdam. There were a number of sculptures around in the park when we were there, and that added to it. Although there were a lot of people about, walking and biking, there were many green areas to sit in by some water and read and relax. I think there are cafes about too, but we didn't go there.So close (within) the city, easy to find, and a nice looping walk down one side and up the other. Great to do after visiting a museum, to clear the head and enjoy the great outdoors!

Relaxing park. A huge park, and a nice place to go with family and friends for a day of relaxation. MAny people go jogging and walk their dogs here, plus of course the cyclists are everywhere. Just be careful to look out for them if you are taking a stroll and your mind is wandering. :)
Oasis. Pleasant surroundings and, as you would expect in Amsterdam, full of bicycles and dogs! However, a great place to sit and relax.

sit and watch the world go by. this park is great just chill out like every one else there is allways something going on.its easy to find and in a great location.you see it all here from the smokers. yes those kind to the familys . if its i nice day get your self a picnic and chill

What a nice place to relax...... Amsterdam is such a place that you really dont need a car to walk around. We walked to Vondel Park and found a lot of young and beutiful people having good time. It was in June. Perfect. Nice weather, structure very confortable and huge... you can walk the whole day if you want.Garden well cared and people also take care of it.Must go in Amsterdam specially to relax after a party whole night... :-)

Nice reprieve. Vomdelpark is a nice break from busy city streets. Lots of walking paths. It's near the Museumplein, so it's a good visit after going through one of the museums. The "tea house" (which also serves beer) serves food, so we had a nice lunch.
A real jewel. Don't miss the chance to walk through this park. It is a wonderful place for people watching and a leisurely stroll to get the flavor the city.
Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful and well kept park. We hired bikes yesterday and spent the day in the park - the cafe on the water was fantastic!

greenery to enjoy. Nice place to spend a day or half. calm and quiet - not very clean though. easy to reach by a tram .
huge trees an nice birds.
a very good place to get away from the buzz and relax!!!

smaller, but refreshing green space. nice green space very close to city center but if you are looking to run like i was, you will run out of distance pretty quick, but it was a nice mix with the city streets.
it was crowded, always people about - good for safety, but not so many that it was hard to run/bike

A great relaxing place. I visit it during a Sunday morning. Weather was great (not raining!) and lots of people and families enjoying the park, doing some sport or fitness.
Enjoyed the proximity with the city and houses, must be fantastic to live near by.
Nice relaxing park. If you like the parks in London, this will be the same. Very big, a lot of room to sit on grass or ride a bike around. Very safe feeling.

SNOWY GARDEN!. The day I came it started to snow! when I woke up in the morning Vondelpark were WHitE! and it was snowing! first time i have experienced snowing in my life! And i have noticed that vondelpark its he perfect place for a good walk in the morning, exercice, dogs walk, romantic walks
Hmm. Not what we expected, large open area and some interesting shops and coffee shops near by easy to get to by tram.

Lovely wide open spaces. After spending all day in the city, navigating the narrow streets, Vondelpark is an amazing place to to hang out and have a picnic. The park is also home to the I amsterdam sign, so had lots of fun climbing on the sign taking pics
Good park in the city. Nice greenery, with lakes, ducks and flowers. Good cycling and walking. Well maintained, and very popular.

Beautiful park. It is very green in May. It is full with a lot of bikers as in the whole city. There are a lot of small artificial lakes and a lot of birds. You could have a break on the grass and breath a fresh air. It is a nice place for walks.

Countryside in the city. You really can forget that you're in a major European city while chilling out for the afternoon in Vondelpark. There are so many paths to wander down and the water fountains and lakes should manage to eat a fair slice of your camera's memory card. A must when the weather's good.

Lovely park. This is a lovely park in central Amsterdam but very busy full of locals and tourist't on a sunny day.
Go for a walk, run or just lie in the sun and enjoy this lovely park.
Amazing for cycling and chilling out. The green birds were a surprise. Atmosphere calm. An oasis in the middle of the busier areas. Could cycle all day here if we weren't saddle sore.

A little crowded. Spent about an hour wandering around the park, which was pretty but just way too packed. There was actually almost nowhere to sit and relax, which was why I spend the entire time I was there walking.

Lovely park, a must visit place in Amsterdam. Great if you fancy a stroll, brilliant if you're renting a bike. For bike riders the vondelpark offer a circular route round the lovely landscape, with many lakes and open spaces it's the perfect for a midday picnic.
Green Getaway. Just a short ways from the hotel and busy streets of Amsterdam, Vondelpark is a great green space to go for a bikeride or picnic.
Great spot for a walk. Big park just outside of Amsterdam city centre, you'll get there easily with tram 1. Nice scenery and a perfect place for a picnic or just chilling out.

great for all. Liked - views, good for laying in the sun, lots of people but not overcrowded
Disliked - expensive ice cream van (still bought one though!)

Good place for a safe cycle round. Though Amsterdam is obviously very cycle friendly, Vondelpark is a good location to have a risk free ride round in a pleasant environment to make the most of your hired bike. We were pleasantly surprised that there was some free (donations gratefully received) open air entertainment on over the weekend we were there which added to the enjoyment which probably increases my rating from average to very good if I'm honest.

If you want to be in nature, this is the place. It is a nice, big park. You could walk for over an hour and only be half way done. Spent the day there just watching the wildlife and people. We also went without the truffels and it was beautiful. Nice place to have a smoke and watch the Dutch. Lakes and a few statues.

Green in the city. One of a number of parks in Amsterdam, this was a pleasant area to watch the locals go by and relax for a while. Beautiful and clean with a number of vendors selling hot food and ice cream.

I did not get the attraction ..... We took our kids to the park and it was a kind of "okay park". We walked there because everyone is so thrilled about it, so we walked for 45 minutes to see if we had missed the attraction.I usually love parks, but this was crowded - full of people, bikes, stoned tourists ... we left then, a bit disappointed. Nothing wrong with the park, but you won't miss anything if you haven't seen it.

lovely place to visit. My friend and I hired bikes and cycled all the way around the vondel park. we had a lovely time and would recommend cycling around the vondel park to anyone going to visit Amsterdam with the intention of seeing the sights.

Lovely place. Such a surreal place as its so big and just like the country side but you know that the city is like 2 seconds around the corner. Lovely place to relax and take a picnic is the weather's nice!

Nice park to relax in. Vondelpark is Amstrdam's analog to Central Park in New York City. While much smaller, it has its charms. It has a nice 3.3 km path around the perimeter, ponds with gardens, a few outdoor restaurants. It is a lively park with many people engaging in variety of activities - running, cycling, walking, strolling. We spent a Sunday morning strolling the entire park, stopping for a beer at an outside table, and it was quite enjoyable.
Like central park. Fun very busy park.Lots to do and see. Went a couple of times during our stay. Plenty for all ages.Just go.

Great park. On a day when we hired bikes we travelled down to Vondelpark to eat some lunch and relax. Plenty of space, with lots of little lakes to sit by. It was clean and green and made a very nice place to stop off.
it is just great. changed since I was last there in the '70s with sleep ins in the park but still great to relax in, walk in, have a picnic in

This is not an English Garden or French parterre...simply Dutch. The Rose Garden section is a big disappointment if you compare it to London or Paris equivalent prestige parks...otherwise it is a great place to stroll along the varied lakeshore and copse pathways....always very busy with exercising locals.....three great outdoor cafes to chill out far from the traffic noise...come on Queens Day for the party and flea market.
Nice park near the museums. Nice park near the Museumplein, very calm and relaxed atmosphere. Lots of people running and on bikes. Should go for a stroll around the park at least once on your visit.

Huge park to calm you in the busy city. A very big park in the city, like Central Park in New York. A good break if you have been looking at so much city. The entrance is near to Rjiksmuseum and accessible by Tram.

Nice respite in the middle of town. In walking all around Amsterdam, we had a chance to check out Vondel Park. With two boys (ages 12 and 13) in tow, we always have a ball or frisbee in the day pack. We sat while the boys ran around for 1/2 hour to burn off even more energy. The good news is that the park had a nice walking path - - which is important since I was continually worried that we'd get run over by any number of bicycles! The bad news is that it was quite littered and the cigarette butts are everywhere.
Great Park. What a lovely parkVery well laid out, great place to relaxBBQ area well thought outNice to stroll around the lakes

Beautiful little paradise in the middle of Amsterdam. Gorgeous park in the centre of Amsterdam, definitely worth going to on a nice sunny day. I particularly recommend getting some freshly squeezed orange juice and going to the upper balcony floor of the cafe in the centre as you get beautiful views across the entire park.

Busy!. Stayed near here and walked through the park on a Saturday morning. It would seem the whole of Holland exercises here and we had to dodge runners, bikers, walkers, roller bladers. Was fun though and beautiful.

Reminded me a little of NY Central park. Beautiful park with many bike paths, lakes and shady or sunny areas to rest your tired feet after hours of walking this wonderful city. It was filled with young people, children and dogs as the we were there on a beautiful spring National holiday.
Must Visit!. The Vondelpark of Amsterdam is like the Central Park of New York or the Golden Gate Park of San Francisco. It is a must see, and it is a great place to jog, bike, or simply people-watch.

Brilliant!. Really a lovely place to spend the aft..! Very very scenic. Great place to go joffing/cycling/dog walking lol. Unf the grass is full of ciggarette butts and the off can here n there. That aside i had a blast at te park! A must go
Great park. Nice park for a walk to get out of the city landscape. Museums close by as well as the fashion district. Watch out for cyclists though! They are everywhere

take a walk through the park. if you have a chance to spend a little time - walk the park, especially on the weekend when families and friends are out picnicking, playing soccer, and enjoying the wonderful scenery. you can also rent a bike if you like.

Very Relaxing. We were blessed with good weather while visiting Amsterdam so we took a stroll through this lovely park. The flowers are beautiful and everyone was just relaxed and enjoying the sunshine. A nice break from the crowds

Beautiful Park. What a lovely park....especially on a very beautiful day. Nice playground for a toddler. Would have loved to spend more time wandering about. Definitely worth a visit when visiting Amsterdam.

Dutch love the outdoors!. Park is very busy on a sunny day, lots of people enjoying BBQ's, drinks (alcoholic is legal in public in Holland), smoking (cigarettes and drugs), just playing in the sun. Lots of bike routes and lots of people using bikes, all ages from very little to very old. Wonderful to see a park so busy on a summer day!Also it stays light until 11pm at night, so lots of daytime to enjoy. Safe even late at night.
It all happens here. What an alive park, modern day Hippie Scene. It's wonderful to see People with bikes, dogs off leads and so many People on picknicks or walking and talking.

Picknick. Music, acrobatic practises, all kinds of people in the park. People trying to sell cold heiniken beer or ice coffee. We got some grocerys and we had a little picknick and sunbathing. Al walking distance from our hotel. After a whole day we went for a fast fresh up to go for dinner at a restaurant terras. After that we went out clubbing.
Picturesque. Lovely park with loads of path and grass to enjoy! If weather is nice take a towel to lie on and a picnic.

Peaceful place where Amsterdammers go when weather permits. A huge green spacce in the middle (ish) of Amsterdam which fill with happy people on sunny days. Good cafe.Lovely lakes and fabulous houses overlooking it.As always in Amsterdam everyone is so careful not to impinge on the enjoyment of others.

Lovely oasis. I felt our visit to Vondelpark gave an insight into Amsterdam life. Cycling, t'ai chi,yoga all happening in a quiet oasis in this lively city.Great for a picnic, or a coffee in one of the cafes.

Enjoy the walk. I saw the park last November found it by accident. I had 48 hour boarding pass for the public transportation. I have this habit when I travel to just go out and board a bus or tram and when i see something of interest i disembark and check it out.The Park is well worth seeing and walking about. It was a very relaxing thing to do for the afternoon.

Loverly Park. This is a beautiful park full of lakes and rivers . I went there towards the evening and it was a lovely park to hang out with friends and go for a nice walk . The High light of my visit would have to be the Tree walk adventure play ground which was a wooden tall structure with bridges going through the trees was so fun even if it was for kids . Fantastic Park Really enjoyed it .

Cute park but too busy. Its a lovely park to walk around but always too busy, you cant have a calm relaxing time there. If you want to chill out, better check other parks in Amsterdam...and there are many of them
Vibrant Park. Beautiful park with great atmosphere and plenty to see and explore. During the summer months there are free concerts in the park. Just be aware of bikes flying about in all directions.

Paul R. The park is nice and green, but nothing special. It's not far from the Rijksmuseum. There are some stalls where you can buy candy etc. A lot of the locals drive through the park on bikes from and to the city centre, but not annoyingly much.
Nice. Great place to remember how to ride a bike ! ;) Good to relax in a very well preserved Park that locals seem to love

Nice park to go for a stroll. The park is very famous to locals and it's conveniently located at walking distance from the city center. It's a nice place to just walk around, sit in the grass or go for a drink. There are a lot of things to do for kids also.
Beautiful. Vondelpark is related to Amsterdam the same way Central Park is to NY and Hyde Park (or Regent's Park) is to London. A beautiful green area in the city.

Beautiful park. When visiting Amsterdam make sure you take a nice walk through Vondelpark. It's at the border of the city centre, you can bring go for a walk or a picknick, bring a book and relax under a tree.
Central Park Amsterdam. Fun people-watching and a lovely stroll after the museums. We walked through the park and had dinner at Blauw.
Great park to spend a sanny day walking around. It was a great day out in the park, very large area, ideally you need to ride a bike to go round, lots to see, if is a sunny day is a must.

Cycling aroud the Park is a must. We had bikes for the whole of our stay in Amsterdam and spent a good hour or so exploring the park by bike. We stopped to climb trees, run over bridges, chase ducks and play around in the hidden massive wooden jungle gym.It is awsesome to see so many people running, cycling and doing boot camp in the gardens - just makes you want to stay active!! Oh - and there is a fanastic "lost and found" monument at the entrance to the park where you can place any items you find in the park (i.e. lost keys, gloves, hats, wallets, whatever). Very clever!

Beautiful!. Any trip to Amsterdam is not complete without a stroll through the beautiful Vondelpark. The views are breathtaking and it is so peaceful that it is hard to believe you are in the middle of a city!
Beautiful place to relax. Dont miss a visit to this beautiful piece of greenspace and grab a hot dog from one of the many vendors - they are sensational !!
Beautiful Park. The weather didn't cooperate, but beautiful park to stroll through. Very peaceful, leisurely walk, birds, plants, flowers, etc.

a microcosm of Amsterdam. Moms and dads with kids, couples on a nice stroll, harmless rasta types smoking a J, people walking their dogs, relaxed cyclists, tourists, retirees - a little of everybody you'll encounter in Amsterdam. Don't worry about the hippies. Just look at the storks instead!
Beautiful and peaceful place. we went in a beautiful sunny day, lots of young people biking running, and a delightful open air concert

Lovely Park. This was a nice park located next to our hotel. It was very pretty. We went on an exceptionally hot Friday evening. The park was alive with cyclists, dog walkers, and groups of people relaxing by the lakes.

Lovely, large green space. After attending a Sunday morning concert at the Concertgebouw, we strolled over to the park to check it out. We discovered lots of green space and a real hubbub of activity. People were picnicking, riding bikes, playing games and simply enjoying themselves.There were water features, beautiful flowers and different kinds of water fowl roaming about.A little further on we came across a bandstand with tables and chairs and food and beer stands. We sat for awhile and listened to a very good group. On the way back we came upon a couple of casual restaurants within the park.Great place to stroll, ride a bike or bring the kids for a break from sightseeing. You may even be lucky enough to catch a free concert.

It's just a park, but it was at the back of where we were staying. It's a nice park with the usual things - plus a constant stream of all kinds of people cycling through it.This is Amsterdam after all. We were able to walk through the park from our accommodation to the Museums and the canal cruise. Lovely.

Spacious Park. This is a very big park and we just walked there from central Amsterdam. It was shiny but a little colds. We saw many people riding bikes, walking with their dogs, and jogging. There is also a small cafe there. It is a nice place to visit if you have a few hours to kill but other than that nothing special to do there. If you are thinking about a picnic - it's the perfect place.
What a delight!. Lovely park, people everywhere, nice places to eat, park for the children and of course the pushbikes!

Not worth mentioning. Can safely avoid. I was attracted to visit this part seeing the comments provided by fellow travellers. It was a big disappointment for us as we had set aside 2 hours for the park.I found it dirty, full of litters and full of characters whom you would like to avoid. Did not feel safe at all. There are a few small lakes and I could easily see plastic bottles and polythene bags floating around. Grass were long as if it has not been mowed since ages. Lot of people on the bikes not caring for anyone in the way.Just to confirm if I was seeing really what was there, I visited the park once again next morning, but situation was the same. I am not sure if I visited the park at the wrong time as I am surely confused by the excellent review people have given this park. There must be wrong in the first week of May. But then this is what I saw.

Always a great outdoor venue. We always go to Vondelpark when in Amsterdam, especially when we get bicycles from our hotel and the weather is good. This time, it was packed with thousands of people enjoying the wonderful May weather.

beautiful park !. huge beautiful park - makes a welcome change to get some open space amongst the tiny crowded streets of Amsterdam. There are cafes, toilets, play areas for kids, ponds etc etc. Beware of bikes though. Everywhere!
City parking. A nice park, but busy. A nice place for a break from sightseeing. Not the biggest or best city park in Europe- Hamburg has that honour- and watch out for bikes!

Vondelpark is wonderful in the sun. We enjoyed strolling through this park and sitting on the grass on a bright sunny day in May. The park was quite crowded but orderly and it a lovely urban park worth a visit.

Rent a bike and take a leisurely ride.. This is a lovely park and a very relaxed spot compared to some of the busy streets of Amsterdam. If your tired of dodging cars, bikes and trams, take a nice stroll or rent a bike and cruise through here. You will love it. Grab a small lunch or a couple of sandwiches and spend the afternoon without the craziness of Amsterdam's streets.
Beautiful garden. This is a lovely walk. In the summer I imagine this is the place to be with live music. The gardens are beautiful and got some fabulous pictures here.

Fun in the sun! Be seen in this scene!. Amsterdam just bustles, so if you want a little more quiet, and some greenery, take a stroll, or bike, here! When the sun comes out, so do the locals and tourists for a seat on the grass, or on the many benches.
basic park with basic instincts. I found couples under trees and in bushes 'enjoying themselves'.Apparently it is allowed in this park.
Lovely park on a glorious sunny day.. Excellent park to loose a few hours with an ice cream- definitely helped that the weather was sunny and warm!

Take a picnic. And just enjoy a few hours in the park. It's fun to people watch and there are some cool sculptures in the park too. It's also just a short walk from Museumplein, so I took a break between museums to relax for an hour and eat. Just be careful to stay off the bike paths. There are kind of compacted dirt paths for walkers and the paved paths for bikers.
Pleasant Park. A very nice park to take a leisurely stroll with interesting architecture to admire, just beware of BIKES!!

Nice green park. It appears to be very nice. Lots of green! We were by the park and it was getting late. We walked a little into it, but did not venture into the Park too much. Saw dogs playing and appears to be a nice park.

Huge park with lots to see.. Went to this park on a Sunday with friends. We're all on our early 20's and loved it.There's hundreds of cyclists and dog walkers which are enjoyable to watch pass by as you have a drink in one of the cafes. There was also a live band playing 80's/90's hits which created a really great atmosphere throughout the park.We walked here from the Van Gogh museum in under 10 minutes then got a number 1 tram back to the centre.The only thing missing for me was a lake for pedalos/rowing boats - but that just me being picky.
Sunday afternoon stroll. What a lovely place to be on a sunday. So many people jogging, cycling and walking. A nice quiet area in a busy city
Popular park for a walk, cycle, jog. Need to dodge cyclists and joggers. Large informal park with small area of formal flower beds. White Storks nesting on special platform.

something for everyone. This is a beautiful park... perfect for a romantic stroll or a bicycle tour. There's a playground for children, an outdoor cafe where you can sit and savor simple refreshments & people-watch, a band shell with free live music. Great place to visit.

cafe in the park with outside seating. Cafeteria line up with pre prepared food was averageand did not tempt us to eat more than a piece of cake between us. Great spot with wharf like deck area and the sun actually came out for 12 minutes

Great Museum Break. Picnic, Beer Garden. This park is the main green space of Amsterdam. If it is a sunny day with warm temperatures it will be filled of locals taking in the uncommon sun. This is a great place to have a picnic or relax with drinks on a cafe patio. There play areas for kids and wide green spaces surrounded by good landscaping. Walk on many of the paths or rent a bike. It is also a great open space to have a smoke in the sun. It is after all Amsterdam. Bathrooms are available in the park and at the cafes in the park. Remember to bring a few small coins as some charge a small fee.

So many different birds!. We loved this park! It has several ponds and is full of beautiful trees and many different kinds of birds. It made for a very relaxing walk late in the evening (in May, sunset occurs around 10:30 PM in Amsterdam).

Great to Bike Around. Bring your bike here to bike around and enjoy the outdoors. In the winter there is not much going on here, so people jog, walk, bike around in the park- plenty of space for everyone. A couple ponds are nice to sit around too.

Open-Air Pleasure. No better place to spend a sunny Sunday morning. Great for a stroll and people-watching. Big enough to get a decent walk, but watch out for the cyclists who can treat pedestrians as a nuisance (to be polite!).

Beautiful Park. Huge park centered in the heart of Amsterdam. Beautiful landscaping, of course, as the Dutch don't do anything halfheartedly. Relax or rent a bike. Several entrances so have fun exploring as we did. Amsterdam is just one amazing exploration after another! :)

The place to be on a sunny day.... Stunning and extensive park just waiting for you to go and have a lie on the grass in the sun. Take a tennis ball and a friend (or your dog) for added amusement. There are a couple of good cafe bars / restaurants too if you get peckish or just fancy a beer.

Worth the Wait.. We arrived at 13:00 and waited 1 hour and 15 minutes in rain to buy tickets. However, once you are inside you forget about wait. Exhibit is very well laid out and information about pictures is well worth reading if you didn't get audio guide. Would try to arrive at 9:30 for 10:00 opening. Very glad we went.

Lovely spacious green park!. Lovely park to cycle round, have picnic, walk, relax, chill and is quite big too. Very nice to sun bathe in summer. Quite open with grass and gravel and path sections goes round in a u shape. End point is near designer shops and dam casino.

You have to go if you go to amsterdam. You have to go if you go to Amsterdam. Like the central park of Amsterdam. Well maintained and well used. Lots of outdoor art to enjoy, easy to forget about the city once you are in the park. Be prepared to walk a lot, maybe better to visit the park with a rented bike. Wonderful landscaping.

Similar to NY Central Park. This park is huge and has many entrances. It is decent place for a good long run. Recommend this for your relaxing time (especially if you are tired of shopping in the neighboring area) or day picnics

Great for a relaxing walk. Was a great escape from a ton of busy tourists wandering the streets near Centraal station. Loved having a really nice and relaxing stroll through what didn't seem like a busy city anymore.

nice for a short break in a busy city.... Like all inner city parks, the attraction is getting off the street for awhile. Nothing special here, still a nice place for a 'sit on the grass' break. Yes there are lots of people on a nice sunny day and people bring their dogs. Yes there are a lot of bicycles and areas where bike/walking paths were mixed. No it's not worth your 'must-see list' for Amsterdam, however do stop and enjoy if you are nearby. My huge gripe (which applies to the park and Amsterdam) is this; how insane is it to consider anything motorized and street legal eligible for 'bicycle sidewalk lanes and paths'. This was just stupid to allow motorcycles on a bike path anywhere.

Great park to relax in. Big park for city dwellers to have a walk or a picnic. Saw a lot of people jogging and relaxing on the lawns. We enjoyed the outdoors and the beautiful kept flowerbeds with tulips and other flowers.
Amazing park. This place in Amsterdam is simply amazing, in particular on Sundays/holidays when Amsterdamers flock in to enjoy their week-end in the park.

The gym of Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is the hot spot for all joggers and bikers in Amsterdam which is understandable. It is really a big green spot in the centre that offers a 3.3 km circular path that is well prepared for bikes and runners/pedestrians. Lots of water arrangements and nature elements.

Spring Stroll. Great way to spend a Sunday morning in the Dam.Beware of the bootcampers/runners/cyclists though.
If all this exercise is too much,try the tea room.I recommend a healthy mint tea!

Lovely place to wander about after a coffee shop stop.. I loved this park and it provided hours of relaxation on a bright warm afternoon.The park is in my opinion somewhat similar in its setting and feel to Holland Park in West London although much bigger.There are interesting sculptures dotted around the park and also some lovely features including the fountains in one of the several ponds and the great Art Deco style cafe which really is worth searching out. There are some islands located in ponds which are closed off to the public and presumably used as nature reserves, these added some mystique and made me want to come back, sneak in and expolre!Down sides not enough loos and the flower beds are a bit dull.
lovely park. great park to relax and watch other tourist or locals passing by.park is orginally floating on the water can you notice?
Relaxation. Lovely place for a relaxing walk -- easy paths within a large park -- seemed to be well used and seemed safe -- good for a family visit

A park is a park is a park. This is a pretty park that we walked through a number of times to get from our B&B to various restaurants. It is quite pretty, but is not anything out of the ordinary. The English Garden in Munich and Central Park in NY can be noted as sites to be seen, but not really Vondelpark in my view. If the park happens to be on your way to a destination, then definitely walk through it, but I wouldn't go out of my way to walk through this park.That being said, it was pretty cold, dark and overcase each time we walked through, so perhaps it is quite different on a beautiful sunny day.

Vondelpark - for Joggers. Unfortunately the weather was not very appealing when we visited, so that there was no outdoor activity, just joggers and passers by.We went to the "Blue Tea House" in the Center of the Park. It is run by young, friendly people. We got ourselves two cups of absolute coffee-free coffee, they were just hot water. Our young friends , meanwhile, listened to some nice music and smoked grass.
Very Nice park near the museums. This is a very Nice place to spend An hour or 2. You can also hire a bike near by and ride in the park. The surrounding area is also nice to walk.

I missed the parakeets. I was there on a very nice Saturday afternoon and enjoyed walking in the park. It is very nice and the atmosphere is qui te relaxed with families and people strolling and enjoying the park. As I was attracted to the Park to see the parakeets and discovered that I was probably to early in the season this was my only deception. It is however a nice break.
very beautiful park. We visited the park in May, when almost every tree there was in blossom. it is a very peaceful place, nice for walking and rest from the city noises.
Very nice. This park is veryyy nice, full of life, here and there you can find beautiful scenes to enjoy. Enough benches to sit and relax after long hours of museum visits!
Go heron watching!. Pleasant park to strool or cycle in or just sit and watch the world go by. Herons abound here and don't seem to mind the people. plenty of seats to sit and pass the time.

For a perfect city stroll. The Amsterdam "Vondelpark" might be a great escape from the cities hussle and bussle while you have the chance. Great green environment with plenty of places to sit in the grass, hide under a tree and enjoy a freshly squeezed soft ice cream at one of the stalls.Look at the people and enjoy the show that is called "life" with bicycles, babies, dogs and couples creating your entertainment and get lost in an oasis of peace before hitting the cities crazy night life. Perfect time to visit is when the leafs are green and the sun is out. So in Holland that means June, July and August... Don't miss out on this spot...

Beautiful. We passed by Vondelpark every day in our bikes to go to the city center, lots a people, lovely green areas, we could hear the birds. On sunday we were exausted, so we stopped and lay down on the grass. It was great, despite the cold weather, the sun was shining so we stayed for more than 2 hours.

The lungs of Amsterdam.. Vondelpark is worth a walk through, to escape the busy centre of amsterdam. Contemporary artwork is positioned beneath the cherry trees. Watch out for the cycle lanes as can get very busy but plenty of room for all. Pleasant and clean
Beautiful park for a bike ride!. Wish we had parks like this in the U.S.! Rent a bike, ride around, take a picnic and relax. Perfect for people watching on a beautiful holiday afternoon.

excellent place for a walk or a jog. Excellent park to have a walk, ride a bike or jog. Very clean, a lot of birds - all kind of them (we saw even some green parrots!), many trees, green grass and flowers... Fabulous place to spend a few hours in the sun :-)

Lovely place to spend some time. We took a bike ride around here during the lovely weather in May. Lots of people around relaxing or exercising etc and a lovely vibe to the place. Plenty of places for good photo opportunities and think I spotted a coffee spot too.
An oasis of green in the middle of Amsterdam. Riding a bicycle through it, the parrots that seem to have adopted the park and are a thrill to see.

Beautiful Space. My hotel was nearby.
Very pleasant stroll through the park.Tulip Beds in bloom.
Lots going on, nice to sit on a bench with an ice-cream and people watch!
A great park to walk around...and even have naughty fun!. Aside from the tranquil serenity that abounds among the rose bushes and trees in this park, go there after midnight for some voyeurism. Wink.

Huge Park. We were glad we decided to have a walk in this park, has great facilities, open air concert area, coffee shop, lots of space and some paths that are bike free as we were getting a bit weary of dodging bikes. As it was may bank holiday the park was packed but still great to see it being used by so many.

Peaceful & Serene. So glad I visited this park, its very green and beautiful. It's a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the city. I enjoyed walking around and admiring the ponds and wildlife. There is a restaurants and plenty of food stands if you wanted to grab a quick bite to eat.

great place to relax. Just hit up a "coffee shop" and relax in this park. It's huge, and beautiful, and on a warm day is basically the best spot to lay in the sun in all of Amsterdam. There's also a pub thing in the middle if you fancy a pint.
Big park.. This is a great park to ride a bike and have a quiet lunch looking at the flower beds. Lots of small lakes and parrots!!!!!
Lovely stroll on a sunny day. The park is right next to out hotel, NH Amsterdam Centre. It's free and its a great way to spend an afternoon away from the busy bicycles and centre of town.

Spend some time here, chillax. I spent about an hour here everyday I was in Amsterdam just watching the world go by. It was right next to my awesome hostel, Flying Pig Uptown, and the atmosphere in the park is really interesting. The amount of indiviual people going by is something to see.
beautiful. Just beautiful for walks, bike rides and a few great kids playgrounds as well as cafe's and a good alternative route to take into town.
Beautiful park. Great park with plenty of places to visit. Took bikes around the park and was great to learn the rules of cycling in Amsterdam! Felt very 'local'

Lovely park. Lovely park with a lake, plenty of space to sit and on sunny days well worth a visit - very clean. We went on a sunny day and people were having bbqs there, you can buy ice creams and drinks, have a massage

A charming afternoon. If you value a few moments of peace and quiet, this linear park filled with bicyclists, people of all ages, and quietude will charm your socks off. It's easy to get to from just about anywhere in the Centrum or the Oud Pijp, and it is tidier than many similar parks in large cities elsewhere in the world.
Vondelpark. Very crowded. Didn't make an impression on me. But on a sunny day it seems to be the perfect retreat for the Amsterdammers.
Beautiful scenery, a must visit in amsterdam, museum area. scenic, tulips, cycling , jogging area. Great to see on a sunny day visit !!!!! Always stop by the park

Serenity in the middle of the madness. Lovely for a stroll in the sunshine. Couple of cafes to grab a bite or take your own picnic. Hire a bike, laze on the grass and prime people watching space. Fantastic.

Very big. The park is so huge, you'll see people walking, bike riding and simply enjoying their time.
Grab your drinks and snacks and just have a relaxing time.

Nice park for people watching.... It was a sea of orange during our Queen's Day visit. Nice park. A bit dirty, but there were a lot of people hanging around, laying on the grass near the lake. Several vendors selling snacks in the park. Nice location in a quieter neighborhood, away from the hustle and crowds of central Amsterdam.

did not enjoyed it. As I can see I am one of the very few people who did not enjoy the park. The reason was all the bikes and dogs let loose around me. Unfortunately this is not how I relax and constantly trying not to get hit by one of the bikes. It was just a park after all nothing else. We saw some parrots and a heron so this was the highlight. Nothing like the beautiful parks in London filled with flowers.

Nice park. As part of a cycling tour we saw a part of the park. It was nice what we saw but it is no different from a lot of parks the world over. I say this as i know a lot of people have it on their lists to see. Would be lovely on a gorgeous day with a picnic I imagine.

Pleasant way of walking into town. A nice place to walk. Grey Herons on the lakes. A pair of Storks nesting on a platform. As usual watch the bikes particularly when exiting the park near Leidseplein.

Nice walk. Close to Marriott hotel
Was filled with all kinds of activities on Queens Day
Nice lake to walk around
Some vendors
Huge park. This park is massive, we never got to the end of it, lovely to walk in on a warm day. There are a couple of cafes to sit and watch the parakeets.
The Green Lung of Amsterdam. Great place to walk around. The gardens are a good place to relax. Although some areas are a bit worn out it is still a great place to sit on a bench and watch the Swans.
beautiful. We were lucky enough to have really good weather so a visit to the vondelpark was wonderful and a welcome change from all the pavement pounding sight seeing

Ideal for the budget traveller. If money is tight (as it always is when visiting Amsterdam, especially on a weekend) then spend some time in the sun chilling in Vondelpark with a packed lunch, checking out the different art displays, and admiring the nearby architecture/surroundings. Even the locals flock to this park because of its beauty, so enjoy!!

Beautiful!. We visited Amsterdam a few weeks back and very much enjoyed Vondelpark! We rode our rented bikes through the park for probably a few hours. Even though there were a lot of people, it was peaceful and very relaxing. I would definitely recommend it.

Oasis in the City. After walking the busy streets, it was nice to stroll through the park. Many locals seems to be out enjoying the weather and the park. Lots of water features and birds to watch. Lots of bike riders (as always in Amsterdam) joggers and picnickers.

A Great Stroll in Amsterdam. Our walk in Vondelpark was most relaxing, and reminded us of Central Park NY....with urban buildings on either side of our grassy area dotted with lakes. Although we didn't cover the whole area, and it was cool and cloudy, we can see why this is very popular with the locals.
A nice place to rest. The buzz of the city in Amsterdam is tiring and Vondelpark is a beautiful place to just sit and be while watching people bike, roller blade and skateboard through.
Vondelpark. Went for a run but landed spending time in this very beautiful park in a lovely area. Great for any age group. Clean and well kept.
Perfect. After a busy day exploring the city, vondelpark is a welcome relief from the buzz. A lovely, relaxing greenspace, a very enjoyable park.

Skinny, pretty Park. Vondelpark is a good place to admire the dogs and people of Amsterdam. It is not in the center of town but only about a 20 minute walk from the Dam Square or there are tram stops. Or rent a bike and be like the Dutch!

Brilliant afternoon.. We hired bikes and cycled down to the Vondelpark. It was such a pleasant place and great to bike round to see everything there. Summer or afternoon this place would be pretty, there wasn't anything special to see there but it was a really nice place and very relaxing/chilled area. Would definitely visit again.
Make it a must see. My wife and I went and took a lunch and spent a nice long time basking in the sun and people watching.

Beautiful. Its basically a lovely place to go and have a walk!
What else can you say!
Beautiful park for a walk or jog, or to just sit and watch the bikes cycle past. (How they manage to be so graceful astounds me!)
Great for a walk. It's a great place for walking or jogging, you can have nice views and take a rest. It's very close to the museum area and the touristic boats have stops close to it.

For a warm day. Vondelpark is a great place to watch the world go by. Have coffee and apple cake, see all the things that Amsterdamers do on a bicycle. Hands in pockets, carry the kids on the front, take a passenger on the back side saddle and talk and text on the mobile too!

Relaxing, huge. Our hotel was at one side of the park while many city attractions were on the other, so we walked through the park several times. What a relaxing park! However, as anywhere in Amsterdam, beware of bicycles when crossing the street. Kids playgroung at the farther side of the park.

Take an end of the day stroll. This is a very popular place to unwind. Our hotel the Marriott Amsterdam was right by the park. It was a nice way to end the day walking through the park and seeing the birds native to Amsterdam.
Beautiful. Love the Vondel park, I visit every time I'm in Amsterdam, bit of a walk, but worth it, also there is a tram
Nice-ish park. Nice place to wander for some green space, but not on a par with Regent's Park. Don't inhale too deeply as you go around though!

Beautiful Parkk to Chill. You should visit this park if you are in Amsterdam in a beautiful sunny day. Take your beer, some snacks and friends than chill just like a typical Dutch who sees sun light :)
Definitely a beautiful park, must see!

A pleasant park for a stroll. A lot of walkers, cyclists etc take advantage of this very pleasant park. A nice cafe/restaurant in the middle provides a quiet retreat from Amsterdam city life. Well worth a stroll.

Lovely park. We took a morning and had a lovely walk round the park on sunday morning. There is loads of people running walking doing other activities and was quite busy and made the walk very enjoyable. Watch out for the cyclists.

Jewel of green. As a Floridian I sat in this park on a sunny day all bundled up and enjoyed watching all the community coming out from a long winter to enjoy the park. Trees were just starting to bud and a few flowers here and there. I will return on each trip to Amsterdam.

A great place to blow away the cobwebs the morning after the night before. Situated right in the centre of town this park is well worth a visit, long or short. It can be a microcosm of Amsterdam life. Commuters rushing to work, Mum's strolling home with the toddlers after dropping big brother or sister at school and joggers & cyclists getting their exercise.There are also plenty of coffee shops and cafes nearby so you can treat yourself after your workout.

April in amsterdam. Although it was a lot cooler than normal it was so nice to be close to a park to just walk around and enjoy nature. the park is one area where you do not have to dodge cars or trams but there sure are a lot of joggers,bikers of course and dogs ;)
Walk & watch. A lovely park shared by residents & tourists. Plenty going on whether to participate or just enjoy. A perfect place to spend a sunny afternoon in the city.

Nice park!. This park is huge, we have never managed to make our way around it fully after visiting 3 times. There is a lot of open grass which would be great in summer to chill out and there are playground areas, cafes with outdoor seating which serve food. One thing i have never done is hired a bike to ride around, that will definitely be on the list next time!
A good place to relax. Beautifull park to go to with friends, family, spouse or solo. When the sun is out there are small ponds you can sit by with something to eat or drink on the grass or benches

One of my favorite places in Amsterdam.. Vondelpark is full of surprises. Beautiful wildlife everywhere you look. Nice big pond with a fountain. There is an open air theater but sadly there were no shows on during the week that we stayed but keep an eye out for those. The park is surrounded by some amazing looking buildings. I saw child minders taking groups of children in carts and teenagers taking the elderly for walks. It is a very relaxing and happy place.

Escape in Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is a great escape in Amsterdam. The green space allows you to catch your breathe and get away from all of the traffic. Enjoy sitting, resting, walking, running, or cycling in the park.

Pleasant Park for a Quiet Stroll. Though quite a distance from the central area, if you want a quiet stroll - or place to jog in Amsterdam - this is the place. There are wide lanes for biking/running and dirt trails for walking (to help stay out of bike traffic) and lots of open area for romping with a dog. We enjoyed the relative peace and walked the perimeter - which probably is close to 3 miles.
Peaceful retreat. On a nice sunny day (Amsterdam has only 26 per year, we are told) this is worth a stroll. Wander round the lakes and shrubs. Peaceful but not spectacular.
lovely place to walk. This is a gorgeous park, worth the transit ride to spend a quiet, reflective afternoon. There is a lovely little pond, well manicured lawns and paved walkways.

Sunny, spring day in Vondelpark!. Vondelpark is lovely. There were some musicians playing live music in the park. Tons of people biking, and just a nice, relaxed vibe. We sat and watched some birds, I climbed some fallen trees , and we admired the beautiful houses near vondelpark. It's definitely a nice little oasis in the city, and it's well kept. Would love to go again! Definitely worth a visit

Huge park in a great location.. A friend and I cycled to the Vondelpark on our hired bikes to have lunch and watch life go past.The park is a very good size, and we cycled lazily around the paths for nearly an hour before setting down next to the lake to eat our lunch. The park is well maintained and I would definitely recommend it to any visitors as a nice place to relax.

Beautiful and full of activity. Recommend renting a bike for this, but walking would be nice too! Plenty of locals walking their dogs, walking with their families, jogging, biking... easy to feel like you're a local too!

Relaxing. I had a pleasant March stroll in Vondel Park when I visited. Though it was cold and the weather a little grey, I still enjoyed it! A very calm, relaxing and communal spot in the heart of Amsterdam

A pleasant morning. We hired bikes near to vondelpark and cycled the whole park with our family. A busy park, with a play area and a couple of cafes. It was extremely popular with joggers and cyclists. Pretty and well kept

Vondelful!. Vondelpark is a pleasant green oasis in Amsterdam. We had a great time strolling around and resting on the grass by the water. Many people opt to cycle in the park as well, and it's also probably worth noting that the urban park is dog friendly. I recommend going there when it's warm and sunny to get best experience out of the park.

Great for a sunny afternoon!. Bring your friends, a few drinks and enjoy of the park. Just remember it will be crowded, so be careful. When it's raining then just bike around or take a walk through it.
nice oas. Nice place from pulse and crowds in the city. Here are real nice houses surrounding the park and it's worth a stroll around to look. :)
A big park in the city. It is a very big park.If you like walking or riding your bike.When we visited it in April the weather was still very cold but i believe that in summer would be better
oasis. large and well kept park, great for walks or rollerskating or "walking" your kids or dogs, the Lungs of the city
cycling!. Go here for cycling, definitely! So leisurely and fun. The views are gorgeous, and perfect for when the weather is good. Easy to cycle to from the city centre, too!

Vondelpark - nicely laid out; dog friendly.. I like visiting Vondelpark. It is nicely laid out. Fun place for walking, bicycling, birdwatching (lots of parakeets) and people watching, as mmainly walking your dog - which is what I mmainly do. It can get quite busy on the walking/biking path so if your dog is a bit exciteable as mmy little doggy-friend can be, it is best to keep your dog to the designated dog play area. There are BBQ areas and a couple of play gym areas for the kiddies. Every April 30th (Queen's Day) the park is soley designated for small children to do their little activities and sell their little things in a park wide fair. I hope to check it out this year!!!

Lovely park, watch out for the bikes.. I walked through this park with my wife on the three mornings that we stayed at a hotel at the wrong end of it. It was early February so there wasn't much colour in the flower beds. There were plenty of parakeets flying around and singing for all they were worth. In the late spring I imagine it to be lovely. In all the time we were there I never saw a fat Dutchman or woman and in this park they are either running or cycling like mad or walking dogs. The cycling can be a nuisance especially about 8:45 in the morning on a week day, when most of Amsterdam are cycling to work (bikes are King here) it makes it so difficult to cross the park paths, it's like watching a never ending table tennis match trying to find a gap to cross. But as I say come late spring/summer it's going to be lovely.

My favourite place in Amsterdam. You will see all manner of life in Vondelpark; parents and children, cyclists, joggers, dog-walkers, buskers, even the odd fancy dress or two, and when you think you've seen it all, a superfluity of nuns cycle past!It is a lovely place to walk round, and you can lose a day just exploring, or sitting and watching the world go by.

Explore the options. Bike, canal or walk to Vondelpark, where you'll be greeted by the sights of tourists, locals and all manner of pets enjoying the beautiful scenery and taking it all in. The nearby houses make for some great architecture, and the ponds and fountains are lovely, as well.

Large park, plenty of paths and parakeets!. As people have said, it is a large park and there are plenty of paths to cycle, walk, run, skate around. Fun areas for kids to play in. Would be more beautiful in summer I am sure - but now it is fun to spot the crazy green parakeets!

Nice walk. Nice walk round the park. Nothing you couldn't see in Hyde park or any other park around the world (runners, ducks, families out for a walk, trees etc) however quite pleasant for a sunday morning stroll.

Nice, that's all. Having visited different parts of Britain, i just couldn't feel enthusiastic about this park: it's nice indeed, but nothing special, definitely not by British standards.
It's a good place for a short lunch break, but i wouldn't recommend on making any special efforts to visit it.

Vondelpark Amsterdam. In the Vondelpark a bird lives on the head of the big statue of Joost van den Vondel, Dutch poet well known if you dive into the history of Dutch litterature....his statue is impressive, the bird on his head crowns and blesses his poems! The Vondelpark is a real citypark, tourists from all over the world pas by on a rented bike, if not, they' ll picknick under the trees and make music or enoy a BBQ. the atmosphere is relaxed. Lots and lots of joggers keep on moving around the park, trying desperately to stay in " form". if you feel like a city break from the busy shopping streets in Amsterdam, drop by in the Vondelpark. If you are lucky you find the rose garden either full of tulips or roses....and the parrots are all over, supervising the greenery from above. Enjoy! It' s all for free, a gift from Amsterdam!

Nice and quiet. Vondelpark is like Central Park, but smaller. If the weather is good, the park will be pack with people, but still you can enjoy it on your own pace. There are fountains to ease the heat and areas to play.Playgrounds and entertainment for kids to do. Cafe's with healthy snacks and food, good coffee. Great views to enjoy on the bench. Walk, cycle or skate what every your thing is. In the winter you can ice-skate and have a cocoa with whipped cream. Peaceful strolls in the middle of a busy city. On Qeeunsday it's packed with people who've come to see kids who perform or sell stuff. Sit on the gras and absorb the vivacity. Amsterdam truly never sleeps. Vondel Park is a great place to visit and take a break from the busy city.
Amsterdams answer to Central Park (NY). Green belt, lush in summer, concerts in summer months. Good walking, bike riding space; great for people watching.

Beautiful. Even though I visted the park in February when it was cold (but not snowing!), it was a beautiful park. Myself and a friend took a stroll through the park on our first afternoon there and really enjoyed it - we want to go back in the summer! There were plenty of places to stop for a bite to eat or something to drink, and I'm sure it would be a lovely place to spend a summer day.
Peaceful. Very peaceful garden. Huge! Ideal for a picnic in summer! Worth a walk around. Be careful of the million bikes.

Speldid park just few minutes from Leidseplein. It is the perfect shortcut when you cycling and a really nice place for walk both for you and your dog. Even if there is a lot of wind or cold, the lakes and the beautiful scenery will compensate for that. There is also an exit near Leidseplein, so you can combine it with a coffee or a bite. Finally the entrance is free.

Green heart of Amsterdam. The Vondelpark is a large green space. It is a great space to relax, and enjoy. I find it a great place to have a picnic - there are many shops where you can buy sandwiches, rolls and drinks in Amsterdam - certainly most bakeries usually have a delicious assortment. There is a lovely outdoor cafe in the Park which I cannot recommend too highly. It is a place to sit and watch Amsterdammers enjoy the air - Sunday morning and lunch time is a particularly good time to go.One great advantage of the park is that you can cycle there. I would recommend that if you hire a bike, then you head there to try it out, and get confidence. It is much safer than starting off in the busy streets.

Coffee in the sunshine. Though a bitterly cold wind, the stroll through the park was lovely with its lakes. Mind the cyclists - keep to one side!Great cafe half way down with lots of tiered outdoor seating - out of the wind and in the sunshine, a fabulous way to relax before heading back into the bustle of the city.There's an ice cream/snack van in there too!

Promenade through the Park.. Even in the chill of a freezing April day, a promenade through Vondel Park brings a spring to your step. Enjoy the wide open space, lake and stroll around taking in the beautiful 19th Century villas that surround the park. See the locals walking their pooches, cycling and promenading.
Nice park. It's a nice space with plenty of ponds to watch the ducks. It's let down somewhat by groups of people drinking under the bridges and crazy cyclists!

Very big. The park is very big and it is easy to get lost if you dont know your way.I went there one afternoon in March with my boyfriend, and the weather is pretty bad. It was really cold and flowers and trees are not blooming yet this time of the year. However, the view of small ponds and greenland is really nice and relaxing. It is good for picnics too. I also have seen many people renting local bikes and cycling inside the park. I would definitely do so next time if the weather is better!

Central Park of Holland. This park is huge! We went in the early spring so the foliage wasn't at its peak, but it was still beautiful. There are little shacks dispersed in the park to stop and grab a bite to eat. A couple playgrounds for the kids as well. The park is right in the middle of the most beautiful neighborhoods in Amsterdam. Simply beautiful park.

Great outdoor space. Great outdoor space and so very vast. I felt like we were walking forever looking for the famed playgrounds to have my son exert some energy before the evening. We found a few of the playgrounds, but I think what this place could really use is a few public maps posted around the park or even online from the city or tourist board. Also some of the playgrounds we did find were not in as great of shape. It is a nice public park for sure and great for bike rides as I could see many doing that.
nice stroll when the weather is warmer. The park is lovely even in bitter cold so when it is warmer I can imagine it's outstanding. Lots of bikes, plant life and a meditation walk

Easter Market. We visited the park for the Easter market which I found online via 'I am Amsterdam' prior to our visit. Nice location excellent selection of stalls, mostly food. Has bench's and tables so you could actually sit in the sun and sample the goods. I understand this type of market is regular at different park locations all over Amsterdam.

A must visit for every tourist. Lovely, huge , green space with lotsa trees and fresh air.I recommend having a picnic inside the park while watching the people jog, ride their bikes and playing on the grass.
Lovely green space. Great to walk, run or cycle around with a decent cafe in the centre. Nice to sit in the sunshine with a coffee watching the world go by

tired of all the canals ... spend a few hours at Vondelpark. Amsterdam with all its canals and the beatiful houses along these canals is of course something you should experience both by walking along the canals and from the numerous boats touring the canals. But having spent Easter in Amsterdam and having wandered around the canals for miles and miles we decided to have a look at Vondelpark. Even though it was rather chilly and spring this year is very late and Vondelpark is still rather "wintery" we enjoyed the atmosphere. Just looking at all the people jogging, walking their dogs, playing with their children or just strolling around in the sunny but crisp weather was a wonderful way to spend a few hours. So if you want to see another side to Amsterdam which is only a short walk from the center we can recommend a stroll in Vondelpark.
good walk round the park. good fresh air with the people from Amsterdam walking, dog walking, riding bikes, jogging and general enjoying fresh air
Just a park. Typical in-city park with space for ball-playing or relaxing. Not a major or important attraction for tourists.
Beautiful Park. Beautiful park really enjoyed taking walks around the park of a morning even whilst chilly! Can understand why they say it is the central park of amsterdam

Afternoons at Vondelpark. Our trip to Amsterdam always involves spending an afternoon or two walking around the beautiful Vondel Park. We take a blanket and a bottle of wine, some nibbles and we relax near a lake and watch the world go by.

An quick, fun park to stroll through. Vondelpark sits in the heart of Amsterdam and is a beautiful park. It isn't too big or overwhelming which I think is perfect for an easy afternoon stroll. Amsterdam is a pretty busy city so I highly recommend spending some quiet time in this park.
Beautiful park in the city.. There are gradual slopes but no hills. It is easy to ride bikes, jog or walk on the paths. There are lots of people around for people watching.

Great park. Walked through this beautiful park, plenty of people playing with their dogs, riding bikes and running. Unfortunately it was very cold so we didn't spend too much time, but in the right weather it would be a nice diversion from shopping and museum hopping.

A quiet walk in the park. Found when walking around the city this is a clean an pleasant park.Given the time of year it was cold so some of the streams were part frozen.The park is a fair size so took ~1.5 hours to walk around.

A place to relax. A lovely place to get away from the busy streets of Amsterdam, take in the impressive gardens and have a nice stroll around. Ideal to take a paper or book and have a bite to eat. Always better on a nice day, needless to say.
Loved it. Lovely cycle around Sunday afternoon, great way to get rid of a hangover. Better when the sun is out though
A Beautiful Park. A beautiful park. An afternoon stroll through it must for any trip to Amsterdam. There are a few nice little restaurants to grab lunch and a beer as well.
Forest in a city. Spacious and pretty like a liitle forest wittin a city. The house that bordered it where quite beautiful.
Great even in winter. We went cycling on pur hired bikes around Vondel and had a great time,, fed the ducks and saw some swans and squirrels. NIce and quite , bit cold but still fun.

Large Park in Amsterdam. Visited this park in Amsterdam in March. Nice to have somewhere that you can walk in a big city which reminds you of England. There is a lake in the middle and has paths for walkers and cyclists. There is also an area for people to play football.
Lovely Park. This is a fabulous park in a busy area. Catch the Number 1 tram. Just around the corner from the park on Overtoom Road is a Value for Money Indonesian called Kartika.

Nice green park. The main location for a run when you are living in the center of Amsterdam. On a visit a nice walk in the green, but there is not really anythinhg special to see. If the lakes are frozen in winter, iceskating in the Vondelparl can be very nice. On a nice summer day it can get extremly crowded and it can be hard to even find a square meter to sit on the ground.

Well kept and well used. We enjoyed a sunny walk through this well kept park. It is well used by locals, especially cyclists, so you have to keep your eyes open. We were delighted to see a pair of storks nesting within the park on a purpose-built stand. There are various bridges and entrances, which make it easy to use the park as a thoroughfare to walk from one area of the city to another.

Used for running & leisure. If you want to see the typical Amsterdamer you should visit the Vondelpark. A wide spread diversity of people visit the park to get away from the city to relax. Good park to go running, you will not be the only one though!

Awesome place with character. I love this park because every time I wander through it I see or experience something new. The park is quite large, but easy to navigate and filled with art and a really cool tree that leans to the side and most of its roots are exposed...almost a living work of art itself. Definitely a must, enjoy!
Art & Music Park. The whole summer there are great activities & free concerts at night or in weekends. The atmosphere is relaxed and you can bring your own picknick and wine
YAAAAYY. one of my favorite spots to chill when in Amsterdam!! When the sun shows its face this is the place to be

A beautiful escape from the city. A nice park to go for a picnic, take a walk or ride a bike. It's very cute and rather large so we didnt see a whole lot of it. But what we saw we very much enjoyed. If I lived in Amsterdam (I wish I did!) I could see myself coming here a lot.As a tourist I wouldn't be upset if I didn't get the time to squeeze it into my itinerary, but if you do have time it's a lovely walk through the suburbs of Amsterdam to get there.
Pretty. Lovely park to have a stroll through. Clean and quiet. Close to other attractions in Amsterdam and as always, near to a tram station!
so green. I was alone when i went there. The garden is extremely wide, endless horizon, very green , few flowers and fresh.It's located in a snob region, houses around it are typically snobish
Are we still in Amsterdam?. Way too cold to spend any time here in our recent visit but I've been here before in the summer and it is a very pleasant hive of activity

Bike around or walk around. In the middle of the city centre there is a park created and it is well maintained. This must be a busy place in summer time. To reach Leidsesquare it is 3 minutes walk. Most of people hire a bike and bike around from one corner to another corner of this park. I loved the place and the location of this park

Go with a camera. Stayed in a hotel quite close to Vondelpark. Was cold in feb but the scenery and views well worth facing the chills. More photo ops at the is park, well worth going to get away from the bustle of the city centre.
beautiful. great for a day to get away from the city, would love to go to see some music on the stage there...... in the summer of course
Pleasant way to get fresh air. Lovely pathways and it's free! Great place for some peace and quiet away from the main roads.Take care though not to run down by the cyclists.

Bike Central. Stayed in a hotel next to the park, so walked it daily.
Very popular with joggers but watch out for he bikes, they seem o have the right of way over everything.
A little bleak in the winter, but come spring/summer this park should be fabulous.

Pleasant Green space. We were here after visiting the Rembrandt exhibition at the Rijksmuseum. It was a very cold day but we enjoyed getting away from traffic and walking around the park. It is obviously a place for cycling , jogging and walking, and sitting in groups drinking!! We felt perfectly safe and stopped at one of the cafes for a coffee before continuing on our tour of the city..

Central, well maintained, surprising. This park is lovely: it's very near the centre, it's been maintained by professionals who love their work -as I didn't see in other parks- and it's full of surprises. You may be there to have silence, or for a pick nick, or to bring your children to play, there's even a theater and podium for music and one stand comedians, restaurants and cafés. It's clean and huge, you may use it to recover from the noisy centre or to go for a run. The only minus is the staff of the café in the building where the former cinema-museum used to be, can't remember the name. The staff is rude and has more attention for their mobiles than for helping customers. But there's another café a bit further, with a playground for children, with excellent staff.

Lovely place to sit and have a picnic!. I walked through Vondelpark many times on my stay in Amsterdam. Is is a lovely walk with loads of beautiful things to see and do! Plenty of space to sit down and relax with family and friends! A great atmosphere!

Great place to relax.......if you like parrots!. A lovely park pretty close to central station. Lakes, trees and a whole load of parrots flying around!Me and Pat thoroughly enjoyed our time in Vondelpark and would recommend it to anyone escaping the hurly burly and the hustle & bustle of modern day Amsterdam.

Cycling heaven. After a day of visiting Amsterdam's sights and culture, we would always spend a good hour or so lying in the park, or riding our bikes around. Its an enjoyable and vibrant park that I spend a lot of time in.
jewel in the city. lovely place! and the treetop adventure park in the middle was a great find! nice touch was big green 'lost and found' cage at the entrance :)

Just Feel the Beauty..... Large, Attractive, awesome city park. I had visited when it was light snow...and the weather, scenery was awesome..Its a very nice atmosphere! Would definitely recommend a walk thru it!
Full of Dogs!. Lovely park to stroll through, even in March seemed busy. Full of dogs. No doggy bins over there, so watch your step!!

Lovely walk on a nice day :-). We visited the park whilst on a short city break as it was round the corner from our hotel (WestCord Fashion Hotel).The park itself is very vast in size and we only managed to walk round half of it before heading back to the hotel to rest our feet!Wish we had hired bikes as it seems a great place to bike around.Watch out for the joggers & the bikes though whilst walking round!!

Nice walk on a sunny day!. We were lucky the weather cooperated - it is beaautiful, relaxing and wished could go on for ever. Interesting "lost and found" items hung on a grille around a post. Very busy with bycicles, kids walking by, and families. Too bad the cheese place was closed!

Busked there. walked around the park, it has a great atmosphere. the police are a bit more laxed in the park, a popular place. when I went there it was sunny so everyone was out, there is a small lake .It was busy when I first walked in the entrance, but it gets quieter the further you walk in the park.
Fast and furious. Everything in Amsterdam seems so busy and hectic. You are not going get much peace in this park. You have to watch out for pple on the bikes, scooters, jogging etc

A lovely Sunday walk location. We visited Vondelpark on a weekend away to Amsterdam. We were flying back on the day that we visited and so wanted to spend some time enjoying the lovely weather and stretching our legs before getting back on the plane.It seemed that all of Amsterdam visits Vondelpark on a Sunday which made for a lovely atmosphere. There are plenty of little benches, bandstands and cafes in the park to enjoy and its a perfect place for walkers and cyclists alike.
Lovely Park. Very nice park , so nice to be there and relax , have a drink with friends and enjoy what Vondelpark has to offer .

Look for the Picasso Statue!. While it was FREEZING when we visited Amsterdam, our cycling through this park was a must. The quirky architecture of the buildings is charming, the Picasso statue super cool, and the greenery aplenty in the city center unbeatable. Would love to return for a summer picnic!
the most amazing park i have ever seen. just perfect to walk, to run, to have a pick nick, to see the lakes, the trees and the birds...you will loose if you wont visit it!!!

Great place to take a break.. Central to Amsterdam, it was a great place to have a small picnik and think about the days travels. You know, give your feet a rest, your stomach a snack and your mind tie to digest. I enjoyed this park as much as any other. No cows though. I was promised cows.

Quiet but busy. A bustling park of a decent size in the heart of Amsterdam. Take a walk around (will take you a bit more than an hour) to get away from the busy streets of Amsterdam. Pickniks during the summer, many concerts on the weekends during summer. During the week you will find quietnes.

Wrong time of year. Unless I missed something, this area is not as big as described in guide books. I was also promised cows and saw none! If you get the urge to hire a bike whilst in Amsterdam then this is a safe place to start. I imagine that in the summer there might be more going on but it was a bit bare and cold in February.
Good park. It's a good place to jogging and pratice others sports. It's also a peaceful if you want to relax a little bit.

Amazing park in the heart of amsterdam. This is a well maintained green and beautiful park in the middle of amsterdam centre. Very near to all the happening places. One can go there with the bike and you can also walk down the park. This must be a nice and rest giving place during the summer time. Well kept.
Vondel Park. Very beautiful park if you're kean on relaxing or going for a nice walk. It's quite big and is very spacious..the lake is beautiful also.

Beautiful large park. We entered the park from the west where you can see beautiful traditional houses which have the park as a backyard. The views are really nice, especially the ponds with numerous and very hungry ducks;) We enojoyed strolling there as it was very clean, peaceful and not very crowded. Close to the east entrance there were more people as there's a university or something like that nearby.
Great Park. I liked everything there although it was rainy! people playing with their dogs. park very clean. nice lakes and trees inside!
nice place for a stroll. really nice part of city for a walk nice greenery and a lake to take in so the place to head if the noise of the city get's to much

Lovely city park. Lovely to walk away from the city but then a quick walk back to the attractions. Beware of the many cyclists who don't seem to understand that tourists not used to the numbers of cyclists!!

A good place to relax. A good place to relax, but It can become crowded during the summer months (especially in the afternoon and weekends). Enjoy a stroll around the park and be sure to visit het Blauwe Theehuis. A place where you can drink your coffee, eat a sandwich and enjoy the views.

Made me want to move to Amsterdam. I took a wrong turn one very cold morning and found myself at the park. It looked so inviting that I proceeded. Despite the weather, the park was being enjoyed by walkers, young mothers, couples, ice-skaters and particularly dogs who were off-leash (and very well-behaved). The park itself has a lovely landscape with winding paths, lakes and some very tall trees.
A nice park. A nice place to hang out in Amsterdam. Very green. Lots of people on bikes. Definitely check it out!

Lovely relaxing vintage place. Beautiful walk around the ponds and grassy areas, very quaint watching the cyclists pedal through the park. Excellent place for a picnic pity we went in the winter though

The New Central Park. We all know how great Central Park is in New York, how the Retiro is in Madrid, how the Tuileries Gardens are in Paris and how Hyde Park is in London. However, the Vondel Park is highly underrated for what an enjoyable time it can offer you.

A park as they should be. A lovely park, big enough to get away from the bustle of the city but not too big that you get lost. A bit of a walk from the city centre but well worth it!It has everything you would expect from a park, families, kids playing sports, water and statues etc etc. If you're hiring a bike (which I completely recommend!) be sure to cycle through here on your travels.
Wow!. This is a fabulous asset the community of Amsterdam. It's so beautiful and immaculately kept. The City Govt. does it's self proud here.
Lovely park in the city. This is a pleasant park to escape to and when we were there the autumn colours were lovely, but as always watch out for bikes.

Place with potential. Luckily we visited the place when it was completely snowcovered and all its water canals, pools and small lakes, almost completely deeply frozen. But some few places stayed unfrozen to contain the many ducks, geese, swans, seagulls and other birds. There were also people jogging in the cold, riding bicycles, or skating the little lakes. A small group of youngsters even attempted some ice-hockey. All in all, a very lively place, with lots of beautiful views and photo opportunities along with excellent means for walking, jogging, cycling and even skating. All that, only minutes away from the center's borders.
Vondelpark. Vondelpark is a huge park in amsterdam. A great place to relax & maybe go for a bike ride.Scooters are not allowed inside ... don`t repeat my mistake....

Lovely in any season. Vondelpark is a delight at any time of year. In the spring and summer cycle through relatively early and be amused by the doggie training classes, quacking ducks, sulking herons and the infamous, cackling green parrots. Take a picnic and just kick back next to one of the lakes or for the more enthusiastic, there's plenty of room for Frisbees and other such energetic stuff. There is a formal children's play area, tennis courts and the avenues are wide enough for cyclists, rollerbladers, joggers and everyone else. There are tea-rooms, open air theatres, bars and restaurants aplenty. In the winter - all of the above apart from the picnic!

Relaxed stroll in the park. This large park has so many green spaces as well as ponds - it is really nice to just stroll through, go for a walk, lay in the grass and look at the clouds or have a fun picnic with friends.

gorgeous park. walked around this park in January, it was very cold but looked lovely with all the snow and frozen over rivers. didn't make it around the while park as it's massive! would love to see it again in the summer!

Nice park. The park was just behind our hotel so it was easy for us to go here. It was a nice park, not so different from the other parks we have seen in Europe. Lots of people walking and biking. A quick run through would be enough.
Wonderful place to run and relax. Amazing place bang in the middle of the city. Very peaceful, beautiful and relaxing. Must visit - go there, grab a beer / coffee, relax and do nothing !
