Parrots in the snow. This winter Amsterdan had it fair share of frost and snow. The canals were frozen, and beautiful Vondelpark covered in snow. Snow or no snow, the Dutch enjoy life and it shows in the park. A curious experience was to see the wild green parrots that live in the park, light up on the white background - how they survive in Amsterdam is beyond me.

Vondelpark, a little spark.. Wanted to give a 3 or 4 star rating as we went in the winter so the snow was very slushy around and the cafes and restaurants were closed. It is a nice place to have a little walk or cycle but not a place to spend hours on end there really, good little place to have a detour from the busy central amsterdam. Adamthetraveller x
Vondelpark. beautiful area. close to Van Gogh museum. great to relax there after being on the move all day. As said beofre, beware of the cyclists as they come at you from all angles!

A nice park. Nothing more...nothing less.. I like parks; especially in the summer. The Vondelpark is nice...It's not Central park but it's nice and it seems as big. Good to have visited but not very eager to go back.

Do not forget to bring your camera with you!. Great walk! Although its not a good idea while the temperature is -5 C. I personally feel comftable walking through parks and observing locals and tourists enjoying Amsterdam. For me it is a nice place to relax.

Perfect place to enjoy your "trip". Ok, it's just a park. But it's very central, just a few minutes from Leidse Plein, and the best place to retire to with Alice and look for Wonderland. If your not in the mood for fairy tales, a walk will do, or put on your rollerblades and skate it!

Bicycle is King at Vondelpark. My old Hippy Friend told me, "Dude, when you go to Amsterdam you have to go to Vondel Park! It's where all the beautiful people are!" He had apparently camped out there in the love and mushroom Fest period of the park in the early 70's. I was excited to get some great portraits of said people and so I got my better camera around my neck and headed off for the day. It was July so of course Amsterdam weather wise it was "all seasons in one day". I had an umbrella and hat stowed in my bag and a sweater tied around my waist, and layered tops on. You just can't be sure what will happen in the sky from hour to hour even in "high" season. When I left my pad on Prinsengracht it was sunny but blustery. Vondelpark entrance has a photogenic vintage gate and opens into what is a general plan to an English rose garden, but its a 120 acre rose garden. The park was first developed for strolling and riding in the 1860s and it seems it has had a turbulent history between walkers and riders and more recently with people wanting City permission to have sex in the park legally as long as they "took their garbage with them". Here is an excerpt from Vereniging Vrienden van het Vondelpark which is Vondelpark's newsletter from 'Friends of Vondelpark', "Already in the 1880s and 1890s the cycling in the park caused hindrance. First the park management tried to resolve this with restrictive measurements against cyclists, such as special bike paths, limited opening hours, and fines for cyclists that were going faster than a horse's trot. It was only after mediation of the Algemene Nederlandsche Wielrijders-Bond ('General Dutch Cyclists Union'), that helped fund the park, that a park guard was installed and cyclists were again permitted to cycle normally." The Park sports a tea house, a small Film museum, a bandstand, some statuary, and a water feature. Lots of people with strollers and jogging shoes, and lots of bikes, no hippies, no spectacle, just small clutches of neo-dreaded pot smoking local happy people singing and talking. The Park itself while pretty, was unremarkable and tidy (I stayed away from the bushes), BUT the "Lost and Found" towers are a great read, and the decorated bicycles of certain individuals who festoon their baskets or handlebars with fake flowers and what-not are quaint. I appreciate this creative effort and it helped me remember I was in Amsterdam. So don't grumble about the bikers and get out of the way people!
great vfor a brisk walk. would be even more lovely in warmer weather(was covered in snow and ice but still a lovely place to walk
Great park. We walked all the way around the park on a Sunday morning. It's full of joggers, walkers and cyclists. A very large park with lots of entrances.

Loved it :). We visited one afternoon, it is a lovely park also for a jog.. It is perfect for chilling in the afternoon, I imagine it is one of the perfect places for a picnic or also a ride with your bike..
good park. great park for all ages plenty to do here would recommend and not that far from main amsterdam centre by bus or tram and it a big park

Beautiful Park, watch out for cyclists. Beautiful park on the centre of Amsterdam. Great play area for the children. The cyclists though are a hazard and think they own the place. They almost knocked over my 7 year old son and wanted to blame him when he was walking on the side of a path, and there were no other paths.

Gorgeous park. Watch out for the bicycles! We came here in September on our honeymoon, and walked through this park several times as we stayed at the Conscious Hotel nearby. It was a little chilly due to time of year, but cannot imagine how relaxing and fun it must be to stroll during summer. The park seems like it never ends.

a beautiful and nice park. It is a nice and beautiful park in the middle of amsterdam. Not very far away from many tourist attractions. Well maintained and must be very cool in the middle of summer months.
Very beatiful. It´s was very nice. It was too cold but I enyoey the view. And people skating in the lake was very nice lo watch

Relaxing. Beautiful park in the Stadhouderskade part of Amsterdam. Perfect for chilling out late in the afternoon.There you can also catch a glimpse of Dutch people with their family or friends and of course, one of the great traditions of life in Amsterdam: riding a bicycle. I as lucky enough to visit Vondelpark on a sunny day and it made for even more enjoyment.

Beautiful Park. Although the park was busy, walking around was still peaceful and enjoyable. It is a beautiful park and very large. We were there a couple hours and did not see all of it. If the weather had been better, I would have enjoyed a picnic or longer walk. There were street musicians in various locations throughout the park. All very enjoyable.
A Sunday walk. huge open space. It was raining but we still enjoyed our walk. Saw a Mandarin duck on the waterFed the gulls and jackdaws with our leftover bed picnic

lush, green park with all sorts of people and animals. Nice to walk around the place but like any other park, you'd have to be cautious with the people around you. Also, there are a few decent seats or benches so when the grass is moist, it's challenging to get a comfortable and clean place to stay at. That's just me though. :)
Beautiful. Clean, very beautiful. Went on a cold but sunny day and was stunning. Worth a visit if you fancy something different from the hustle and bustle of the red light district
Calm and relaxing. Vondelpark is calm and relaxing, we enjoyed many strolls in the winter cold through the park every morning during our stay in Amsterdam
Walk at Sunset. It was a feeling of great Surealism. I was strolling t hrough a Park in Europe. I had dreamed of these things never really expecting them.
Great for running. A park with a great atmosphere, lots of people out running and cycling. One circuit is about 4-5K. Nice to sit out in the sunshine.
Even in the winter, gorgeous. Lush and green, immaculately maintained, and meandering without making you feel like you'll never find your way out. A gem among major city parks in the world.

Very green and unique atmosphere!. A few months ago I had a meeting with a friend from Canada, I took him from Schiphol Airport to Amsterdam. From there we went to his hostel. This was located very near the Vondelpark so we walked across it. I was delighted about the unique atmosphere, this is only possible in Amsterdam: young white dreadlocks playing on Chinese instruments, hippies enjoying their marihuana, gay people hand in hand without being afraid to be molested, business men having a quick break, so many different people. And the enviroment is beautiful, very green with lots of huge trees and seats, this is another side of Amsterdam, very relaxed.

A quiet and green stroke in the city.. Whatever season it is, the Vondelpark is a great park to visit. In Summer you can find plenty of grass to sit and walk on. You can rent bikes or rollerblades. There is always something to look at.

Light and Easy Vondelpark, Amsterdam!. Had a lovely walk in Vondelpark on an early cold and breezy February (2012) evening. Something I've always wanted to do (even if the flowers were yet to bloom) is to have along walk in a park without worrying about sunburn or whether I need to carry an umbrella . A good place to have a breather after days of sightseeing and getting lost in a city to another.
lovely. Went for a lovely walk through the park, was better in february when all the lakes were iced over and the locals were skating on the ice, Very clean and well kept
Good park. Nice place to visit for a relaxing walk if the weather is good enough. Like many other big parks, grass, lakes, seats, big house nothing spectacular in comparison to other large parks.

Great for running. I loved being able to get a run in on my trip to Amsterdam. The park was full of runners, walkers, and just people enjoying the park. The pavement also has dirt paths on the side which is nice!
The soul of Amsterdam. Not as big as you would think but it is the very central point of Amsterdam. Rent a bike and explore Vondel park. A great place to enjoy the nature and watch the world go by.

Best place for dog watching!. On a sunny day, Vondelpark is the best place to go and relax. It is full of joggers, bikers, skaters, walkers, and all sorts of other -ers, including lovers and dog walkers. The dogs are delightful - mostly friendly, running about, full of joy and frolic. All shapes, sizes, colours and ages. There are a couple of restaurants where one can go for a warm drink or to relieve oneself of the effects of too many liquids. The Groot Melkhuis has a clean toilet at the back that you can use for 30 cents and a deck in front with tables and chairs facing a little canal from where we watched the sun set.
Excellent park. If it is a sunny day in Amsterdam, just go and chill in this park as lots of people do the same :) You can make your own bbq, lay on the grass or just relax.

lovely place just to chill and people watch. I love this park, so relaxing and quite despite being full of cyclists, runners and dog walkers.Only ever been in the winter months but i can imagine that the summer months would be even lovelier. There is also a wild flock of parakeets that live in the park which was slightly unexpected the first time i visited this park but now every time i go i look forward to seeing them.
oasis in the city. This is the place where Amsterdam folk go to relax and play.Open air concerts a cafe and people watching are but a few of its delights
Great fun for cycling on New Year's Day!. My second visit to this park but we got more out of the visit this time by cycling around it. A fanatstic experience I would recommend.

Perfect Park. What a lovely surprise this is in the heart of such a busy city. It is such a fantastic amenity for the people of Amsterdam and they most certainly use it either walking running or cycling. I would love to see how nice this would be in the middle of summer. With the surrounding buildings it looks very like central park in New York. There are 3.5kms of walking trail so don't leave Amsterdam without going for a stroll.
good for a walk. Every morning people walk, carry babies, joging...so relaxing. But remember that in winter or spring can be very cold...

Awesome place to take a stroll and chill. My husband and I walked most of Vondelpark in an attempt to get lost.......We ventured into the park with nothing on our agenda, which proved to be beneficial. The park entrance we encountered was located, almost hidden, behind a street of residental buildings. You can tell as you walk, that the park is used as thoroughfare (cut-through) for some commuters, as well as a spot for relaxation. We bought some provisions, found a spot to sit and wasted the afternoon away, eating and strolling through the most beautiful scenery!!
Silent. It is within the city and easy to reach.Since it is winter it was too silent but nice.Its around full of city attractions, I like there

Vondelpark - enjoy!. Great place to escape from some of the mad touristy areas of Amsterdam. Hire a bike, cycle around, walk it, explore it - enjoy a picnic. It's what the locals are doing. Lovely escape.
A very big and nice park to stroll. Its a very nice place to walk around, there is some beautiful ponds. Its close to the main museums.It is very big.
very nice. Great place to chill, have a picknick, go for a walk, do yoga. Especially in the summertime this park makes me feel alive

People watching hub and the park that makes the city tick. I lived in Amsterdam for 2 years and this park is truly the heart of the city. Great restaurants, houses and shopping surrond the park so there are many ways you will end up there. Take a jog in the park and see the collection of locals and tourists all interacting.

Vondelpark: delightful. A little steps from the red zone, in the Museum Quarter, Vondelpark is a little piece of peace while travelling in this city. There's nothing special at all, it's a park in a big town. Bicycles are really a plus to cross all Vondelpark. Instead of that, I've had a 'casual' picnic with brownies, beer and kebabs on a cozy gray afternoon.

Playgrounds with cafes: Brilliant!. I love the playground and the "Milk House" cafe adjoined to it. It's a wonderful way to spend time in the park without having to pack snacks or enjoying a nice conversation with a friend while your kids are entertained.

Large and nice park. I was surprised to see how large this park actually was. Its pretty comfortable going away from the city and into the park. You can find sports, restaurants, places to eat ice cream, ponds with ducks and more. Its not your average small park, this one is pretty big. There is also different kind of shows in the park if i remember correct.Another time ive visited the park i used a bicyle and its quite comfortable to go cycling in the park, there is good room and wide enough road. if you havent visited this park yet then you should consider doing it on your next trip

Lovely place to walk and relax. Visited on Boxing Day, bet it's even nicer in the summer! Green grass, gently flowing waterways - very popular for walkers, joggers, cyclists and people with children or dogs. Lots of nice wide, paved paths and many smaller unpaved. Highly recommended for a place to stroll!
Pretty park. We came here in October. A lovely pretty park and worth a visit for a nice walk. It is near the museums.
Take a stroll. Vondelpark remind me a little of Central Park in NYC. Take a bike ride (no scooter allowed), walk around, have a picnic, sunbathe, check out the scenery. Very tranquility place :)

Go to the Albert Heijn, and have a picknick in the Vondelpark. In the summer the Vondelpark is a great place to have a picknick. Go to the Albert Heijn, by some snacks and drinks, cycle (or walk) to the Vondelpark and enjoy a day at the park amongst locals.During the summer months the park can be very crowded so finding a spot might take a while, but once you find the right place you can start relaxing. Tip: watch out when walking in the park, since a lot of people use the park to cycle towards the city center and other places, walking their dogs, running and other ways dutch like to get around (motorized vehicles are not allowed).

Rather cold in winter, cosy in summer ?. We visited the Vondelpark during x-mas period. Not a good time to visit a park though so we gonne visit it again during summer. They say it's very cosy! You got even 2 BBQ area's so let's review this again during summer !
Walk in the park.. Everyday during lunch time i go for a short walk. This park has several trails witch you can explore. Always nice if you want to avoid the city.

Cute Park. My friend and I decided to go to Vondelpark as we had heard good things about it. It was a beautiful park, which on a hot summers day, was a lovely place to just sit by the pond and feed the ducks. It was clean and there was a variety of people and performers. A cute little place!

If only I'd had more time.. I briefly biked through the park during a bike tour and it looked wonderful. Later, I walked through it a little bit. Wish I'd had enough time to just bike the park. I'll definitely do that next trip.
nice. It was winter when I visited here. And It was nice to walk under snowing. hımm I have missed already.
Great escape. Vondelpark is a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. I found the part well maintained and beautiful. It was just nice to walk around.

Great place to spend a day. This is a great place to lay a blanket down and relax and people watch. Everyone is walking, playing, dogs everywhere, there are great areas throughout to stop and relax and enjoy the people with a bottle of wine

Pedal through!. Not much of a sight - main feature is the north-south bicycle thoroughfare, 8 lanes wide. Stately buildings line the eastern border, affluent neighborhood to that side with working-class blocks to the western side of the park.
Great Park. Really enjoyed the Vondelpark - great for a stroll but watch out for the millions of bikes whizzing past! Well kept and interesting gardens, highly recommend a visit

Beatiful. A wonderful Winter stroll through the park is a must.The park is easy to find and its huge , I could only imagine what it must be like to live in one of the apartments surrounding it. If you want to take in some nature then this is the place to be , beautiful old trees and ponds full of ducks really set a relaxing mood.
Vondelpark. Lot's of people here in spring and summer. Nice for hanging out or sports activities. Used to live close to the park.
Nice Park. We took a bike taxi ride through because we had limited time and I was with my 57-year-old mother, whose feet were getting sore. Light up a "reefer" and enjoy the park! :)

Pretty City Park. We spent part of a nice sunny Sunday afternoon wandering through the Vondelpark. It was an interesting spot for people-watching, seeing all the Dutch people out and about, enjoying a nice day... walkers, runners, people with their dogs, cyclists, moms pushing strollers ...It is not too far from the Heineken Brewery, so you can visit the two attractions in a short time.

A Breath of Fresh Air. We had walked quite a distance and when we reached the park, it was a relief. The quiet and peaceful environment was perfectly coupled with the Fall season nature. It was also drizzling a little bit. It's worth the visit.

Great day out.... We took a stroll round Vondelpark on a brisk November morning and i have to say the light was so crisp, it seemed perfect. Great little stroll to get you away from the hustle & bustle of the city centre
Perfect for relaxing. Nice park to escape the hustle and bustle, can get quite busy in the summer but great to find a spot and relax.
A pleasant stroll in the city. It's pleasant, and in the summer there are a lot of people there, either walking, sitting or cycling. It's good to go there to take a break from the city.

take a stroll, rent a bike and then go. Can you really go to Amsterdam and skip the park? It's nothing special like a botanic garden, but it's really nice to rent a bike and cruise around the park half a dozen times. I rented from Mike's Bikes and they were very pleasant to deal with.
Biggest park in town. Very nice place, central located, clean and green, good if you feel like go out of the populated area, although Amsterdam is not a crowdy city.

Comprable to Central Park in NYC. Not quite the same size, but quite similar. Just a spot to relax and move away from the noise and bustle of the city. Great spot to grab a book and catch up on some reading.There aren't street lights though, so be careful when its dark. There are many bikers that use this as a cut through and if there are no lights, you can't see them coming. Just be careful if you are on foot!

One of Amsterdam's highlights. Watching roller-skaters slalom up and down the paths, and strolling past the fountains with an immense peacefulness throughout the park. Such a relaxing place, even in the freezing cold we loved the walk for the scenery and almost eerie lull about the place (in a good way..). I'd say it was a must-visit, we loved it and it was great to break up the city trawling our trip featured so heavily.
An oasis. Big park in the center of Amsterdam full of mini lakes and canals where you can have a walk, a ride with a bike and you can forget that you are really in the center of the city

Even in Winter's Chill I Still Love the Park. I'm from a place where you can't find a park as big as this. It is not a touristy place but being there makes u feel at home in Amsterdam. We stayed just outside the park gate (StayOkay Hostel), in the thawing winter time.We rented bicycles to roam the park, but walking is good too, after all it's a place for exercising. In the winter evening, the park is still full of city dwellers spending time with family, friends and dogs. . and a handful of tourists like us. You can find street musicians playing beautiful music (sometimes sad tunes). The pathways seem endless. There are signs of vandalism which I hope will be improved.Just walk around abd enjoy the park. I enjoyed it in the winter, so other seasons couldn't be worse.There are Amsterdam attractions surrounding the park like the film museum etc.
Perfect place to relax!. Spent a day here relaxing, reading, walking around and biking.Loved it. It was quite similar to spending a day at Central Park in NYC.
Pleasent walk. Had a lovely afternoons walk in the park with a mulled wine in the Blue Teahouse to keep the cold at bay.

Very pretty; even on a cold day. I went here with my boyfriend during our trip to Amsterdam. Our main problem was locating bikes! You must get a bike from just outside the park (we used Max bikes) and cycle in. This costs about 10euros for 3 hours, though we had had enough after 90 minutes.It was really relaxing just cycling around. It was very pretty and there were some nice fountains and ducks to look at. I felt very dutch cycling round the park. We spent most of the morning here and despite the fact that it is just a park, it was a really nice and relaxing visit.

stunning on a sunny autumn day. lovely walks, wide open spaces, lovely fountains and lakes, foliage very pretty and lovely cafe and childrens play area, is close to the Museums and the houses around the Park well worth a wander
picknick. Have a nice lunch together with friends in this park. You might want to run or bring your bike, but be aware that it can be crouwded.

wow!. don't know where to start! i couldn't stop taking pictures of this park..it is just so beautiful! this park is a must for the tourist who just loves a relaxed atmosphere and loves the outdoors. you can cycle your way through it too

A cold November walk through Vondelpark. I went there to have little walk with my friends and I thought it was very nice. It was clean and very well maintained. When I was there I saw very nice display of frozen love hards with one Dollars bills frozen inside :) it was funny to see peoples reactions and made good atmosphere :)

Fantastic City Park. We came here on a short weekend break with the kids, so all the museums I was hoping to check out were off the table. Plus, it was an abnormally sunny and mild weekend, so when in Amsterdam....bikes! We rented some for just an afternoon and biked over to Vondelpark and did some laps. When my wife and I got tired of pedaling we stopped at one of the playgrounds, which also happened to have a biergarten right next to it! Best day at a park we'd had in awhile.
Lovely park. I used the park for a morning run, along with what seemed like about 1,000 others on a Sunday morningnice and flat around the lake, scenic and very relaxing.
Great park!. Lots of bike riders and walkers going from place to place or just strolling. Would be really lovely in the spring and summer for a leisurely walk.

Beautiful park!!. By far my favorite place to visit while in Amsterdam. I went in October so the changing of the leaves on the trees made the whole park look surreal. My wife and I rented bikes during our stay in Amsterdam and loved biking around the park, sitting on a bench and just see all the kids playing and dogs running around. Very peaceful and relaxing place to spend an afternoon.
Chill out. In summer the locals gather here to sit in the sun, soak up some vitamin D and just relax. It is a nice place to unwind for a little bit after walking around Amsterdam for a long time.

The walk of my life. If you are looking for a place to escape the city life for a few hours, then this is it. I loved spending some time here and just looking at children learning to ride a bike or playing football.

Beautiful Park in Amsterdam. Despite the rain our stroll through the park was great - lots of people out walking their dogs, running, strolling, and many small ponds with ducks. Worth a visit if you like city parks.

Beautiful in every season. I've been there during autumn and winter and I loved it. In warm months the park is perfect for a walk, a picnic and for relax in the grass. In winter months be prepared for the cold. In the middle of the park there's a snack bar where you can by some sandwiches and a cup of coffee. In the entrance of the park there's a bigger place where you can buy beer or wine and some food.The park in very quiet and is full of locals, specially in the weekends.
Great early morning run. Nice flat easy paths to run around the safe park. The Asics store near the entrance lists the routes and mileage.

Good fun in any season. Visited in winter and again in summer. In winter it's beautiful for getting lost on romantic walks and in summer - the same! Also, if, like me you are too terrified to ride your rented bike on the streets of Amsterdam, Vondelpark is an excellent and safe environment. And HUGE so you won't get bored cycling round the same paths.

Gorgeous!. We walked every street and side street and path we could find at Vondelpark. It presented some of the most beautiful photo opportunities, and some of the most attractive landscapes we have seen.The park was quiet, and well maintained, including separate areas for ball games, dogs, and picnics, limited to certain periods of each year.
Just WoW!!!. You have to go there! One of the most beautiful parks I've ever seen. So Peaceful, so quiet, so trippy
Beautiful Park. Vondelpark is a gorgeous park at anytime of the year. Great to get away from the noise of the city center.
the never ending park !. Walking late at night has never been so fun. Even when I was lost, ( it is a huge park) I was thrilled to be there. I would recommend this for couples who love to walk.
Great place to bake. When you're fresh out of ideas, go to this park. Great vibes, some say its vibes-a-licious. You can smoke, no-one cares. And there are some seriously fiesty birds (pigeons).

Urban refuge, close in to central Amsterdam.. I biked around Vondelpark. It is a pleasant oasis in an otherwise busy city. There many people riding around on bikes or strolling through the park, even on a brisk Fall day. There are areas for playing outdoor sports and gardens to walk through. Overall, a pleasant place to visit, especially if you're nearby to begin with.
Great for Running. This is a great park for walking, bike riding or running. There are large grassy areas for a picnic and several playgrounds for children. There is also a beautiful rose garden.

It's just a park. sounded like an amazing place before i go there but it seemed like a normal park to me, it big though and they allow public sex at night although heared that even if its allowed policemen wont tolerate it.

Beautiful park. I loved the feeling of this park. We strolled through here on a weeknight one of our first nights in Amsterdam and there were a few people, but it was not crowded. It felt very safe and clean and beautiful. We also rode through the park on a Saturday bike tour, it was fairly crowded with people walking, jogging and biking, but people were considerate and kept out of each other's way. I highly recommend.
Good place to visit. Nice park, with a nice cafe in the middle of it and beatiful scenes. Strongly recommended for a stroll or even more serious run

Beautiful Park!. When walking to Museumplein don't miss the opportunity to pass by this park.It is very beautiful and absolutely worth the time. It's huge (I didn't even do it all), and lovely even just to hang out a bit in a bench and enjoy the view.... Or you can go jogging, have a BBQ, ride a bike ... Just don' miss it, it's wonderful.
Lovely place to walk and relax.. This is a great place to feel like your out of the city yet still close to everything. Rent a bike and take a long ride throughout the park!

On a sunny day. If it's sunny don't miss the vondel park walk or cycle around and watch the Dutch as they're enjoying the sun. It's fun and free of charge. Then sit at one of the cafes and enjoy a cold beer or a cap of coffee. Enjoy life,

The green heart and lungs of Amsterdam. This is a classical city park, in the same way (but smaller) as NY Central Park.It is the place where you can relax, enjoy nature, work-out, BBQ, hang out with your friends, stroll,all seasons. There are beautiful and rare flowers (including orchids), a stork (in season), many very nice people and it is a holiday at home, away from home. A must do experience!
Vondelpark. Lovely open space in the city. Fountains, lovely trees and places to have a coffe and a meal. Hire a bike and enjoy the fresh air.
Dreamy Walk on the Beach. You gonna like it..A nice walk with plenty of sovenir shops and cafes around. The place is not so far from Amsterdam; of course by car.

Mind the crap. City parks are always a breath of fresh air for an otherwise busy city centre life. Vondelpark is no exception so it is definitely worth a stroll - or a ride on the bike through.A word of warning to the innocent: beware of speed cyclists, blade skaters, skateboarders and ... dog-pooh on the shoe!

Great respite.. I ventured here on a day when the feet were really beginning to feel the time spent walking, walking, walking. It was beautiful and I found a few lovely cafe/restaurants to sit in, put my feet up and enjoy wonderful Hot Chocolates. Space was lovely and you could tell there were many locals also enjoying the greenery and space. You can wander for a long way or just enjoy the areas close to the shops.

Stunning even in winter. It's park was such a well kept secret! I'd not heard of it and I'm so glad I visited. It's very well kept and the water features are gorgeous. So many locals there too. I visited on a rainy day waiting for the taxi to the airport after we had checked out and it was still busy. There is a rose garden, ponds, wildlife, a cafe, a stage for performances, plenty of benches and an area in the centre which is not maintained that is for the native wildlife to stay undisturbed. I did a bit of googling the night before to see what there was to do and on doing a bit of Internet digging I read that vondelpark is refurbed every thirty years as it built on basically swamp land so that the ground level is constantly being lowered by nature, so to keep it in use Amsterdam have to dig it all up and start again basically! I thoroughly recommend this area. I can imagine it being stunning in the sun!
Beautiful park. Great place to take a break with your children after strolling the city all day. Its located next to Rijkmuseum, so it shouldn't missed in your itinerary.

Beautiful. A great park which we visited on a lovely sunny autumn Sunday. Saw a magnificent heron and the autumn colours were glorious. Pity that the cafe in the middle has a loud hailer system calling people to collect their food - it really interrupted the tranquility of a lovely spot. I did not want to sit there hearing that number 52's food was ready....recommend finding Trakteren in Jan Pieter straat instead - not far from one of the entrances and some of the best coffee in Amsterdam - truly.

A walk through this beautiful park rounded off an excellent trip.. Bustling at all hours of the day, which may put some people off but this park was very well kept and a pleasant diversion from the chaos of the Amsterdam roads.
Wonderful. It's a beautiful park. We had our hostel next to it and were there for jogging. It was wonderful and quiet and i would live to go there again!
Very beautiful. To disconnect from the life a bit and explore the local Dutch people you can have a walk in the huge park. Really very beautiful and clean and relaxing.
Nature. If you like enjoying nature you should take a walk in the park through the city center which we really enjoyed.
excellent. nature was great, nice playing ground for children. nice cafes and long routes for walking and running.............................

A Utopia. We visited here on a crisp autumn morning, where the parakeets could be heard, there were joggers and people doing other exercises and yoga classes being advertised. With the beautiful trees, landscapes and the variety of birds, it seemed like a utopia. I would have loved to have seen more of it, but did not stay in Amsterdam that long, but it seemed to offer so many things to the community and tourists alike.
Beautiful park!. Gorgeous park in the middle of a fantastic city! Lovely place to walk/bike around and just chill out.

Beautiful Park For a Relaxing Walk. Lots of trees and walker friendly. The park is large and you can stroll in relative peace for quite a distance. It was clean and not too packed with people but you can tell it's definitely a tourist area. I was impressed with how clean it was kept despite the fact it goes on for several miles and so many people walk through. Spread around the city since it's so big so you can take a little walk and be in a new area to explore. One of the nicer parks that I've been to!
Nice park. I didn't see that much of it as I went there to watch the marathon runners go through but it seemed nice

Breakfat at Vondelpark. Any time I fell sad, depressed or just in bad mood I go to Vondelpark. It´s just a perfect place, a piece of Paradise on Earth. Happy families, happy dogs, happy runners, happy bikers. It just feels right. Go to Vertigo or Grote Melkhuis for a cappuccino or feed ducks. They are always hungry :)
Let's go to the park!!!. Since the renovation the Vondel park is now more than ever a wonderful place to walk, to run or to let the dog out. A stroll around the whole park will take you about 1 hour.

Beautiful Park. This treasure is a large park not far from the center of the city. With a lot of green space, paths, water, etc. it is a very nice place to spend some relaxing time after the hub-bub of the city.

The green heart of Amsterdam. This is a true melting pot for Amsterdam, young and old, fit and flab converge to walk, run or cycle their worries away, thankfully not crammed with vendors this park is manageable yet large enough to really feel outside the city. Two important tips: do rent a bike and think toilet before going in there - not much help in that regard. Absolutely enchanting in Autumn.

Relax in Spacious Greenery. Lovely trails, bridges, ponds, and fountains. A good way to relax from sightseeing. Rest your eyes on the greenery, settle in on a park bench and drink in the peace and serenity.

A restful oasis in Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a wonderful city. But if you're there for a longer stay, then the hustle and bustle might get a bit overwhelming after a while. I was there for a week on my last trip and near the end I decided to spend the afternoon at Vondelpark. First I picked up an inexpensive chicken salad lunch at the Dutch supermarket chain Albert Heijn (love that store) and went for a long stroll from one end of Vondelpark to the other. I enjoyed my lunch while people watching. A really great way to lower your blood pressure and enjoy a true Amsterdam experience.

Nice enough park all year round. We pay a visit to this park every time. Good for running around, and for picnics in warmer weather. Can't speak very highly of the cafe in the middle - service is terrible and the prices are rather high. Misses ordered tea and it was taking ages. Turned out the waitress had just put it on the side and didn't bother bringing it to our table - it was nearly stone cold by then. This attracted a disinterested shrug.But the park itself is safe - there are always police patrolling around, and plenty of people passing through. Watch out for the obligatory set of drunks - although they seem harmless enough on the whole.
Wow. Just like Central Park in NYC. Very useable for walks, bikes, running etc. Many people using at all times of the day.
nothing special. It's just an average park, with a lot of people and bicycles. Maybe we get something wrong, but were were not impressed by the Park.
It's just another city park. It's lovely to wander round on a nice day and the cafe's ok, but at the end of the day it's just another big park in a city - you could be anywhere

A walk in the park. If you have had your fill of coffeshops and tourist traps then a walk in one of the two nicest parks in town may be for you. Picturesque and full of life take a couple of hours to walk or cycle around but make sure you stop to sit for a while too. Great place to see the diversity of Amsterdam.
Beautiful place. Must go. Nice park. Had a jogging time on Saturday morning and, afterwards, during the Marathon, ran through the park.
Relax or exercise. Close to Marriott Hotel, Beautiful large greenspace in central city, with easy acess to museums and fashion district, as well as some good eating places nearby.

Nice Natural Escape. Vondelpark is an excellent escape from the high traffic Amsterdam streets for an afternoon. Though the park is not especially large many areas within it make you forget you are in a city. Lots of ducks and geese for wildlife and picturesque views with bridges and beautiful trees. An ideal place to spend with friends or just solo.
Beautiful in the fall. Spectactular place for a picnic, stroll or cycle!! Take some food with you to feed the birds and also a few restaurants for a cup of tea.
Beautiful. The only thing I didn't like about the place is dutch weather! But there's not much to be done about that :)

Nice park and atmosphere. I went with a friend to have lunch in a nice restaurant in the park and then we stayed there for a while reading our amesterdam guides before heading to the museam. This park has a nice atmosphere and is huge!

Sunday Stroll. Located near the Van Baerlestraat its a lovely green area, roller baldes, running, dog walkers, buggies, bikes, and a quiet sunday stroll, the park has a lovely band stand, waterfalls and lovely cafes, we stopped for the famous apple pie and coffee, the trees were autumanal, outside seating, the cafe was a wooden house with a kids play area.
Nice escape. We rented bikes and rode around the city. When we found ourselves in the Vondelpark we went in and felt peaceful. It's a nice escape from all the traffic and people.
Beautif Park. The park was next to our hotel. We used it a few times as a short cut. Very popular and quite nice. It is much larger than it appears from the outside.

beautiful park. Vondel Park is really beautiful. It is huge too. It reaches from the edge of the Leidsplein right down to the Central Park Hotel where I stayed. The weather was rainy when I was there but if the weather is good it is an ideal place for a picnic.

Nice place to sit and people watch. We went to Vondelpark on one of the first warm days of the year. The park was filled with tourists and locals alike. It was great to sit and talk and watch the city buzz around you.

Extensive public park. I saw the Vondelpark in winter, when it was dressed in snow and glistening in the sun. The footpaths were scrupulously free of ice and snow, so walking was safe and easy. The park is beautiful and runs alongside a canal with beautiful buildings. A must see. Not too far from the Homomonument, which you should also visit. It is a chilling and yet appropriate memorial to the many homosexual men exterminated by the Germans during their occupation of the Netherlands in world war two.

Lovely Place for A Bike Ride or a Walk. I rode through this park as part of a bike tour and wish I could have spent some more time just getting lost in here. It was very peaceful and seems to be a great place to relax, have a picnic and read a book for a few hours. On my next visit, I'll be sure to get some food and wind down here. Can't wait!

We loved this quiet little oasis. in the middle of the hustle and bustle of a major city is this quiet, pretty park. We bought cheese, bread and fruit from a local deli and made ourselves a picnic lunch one afternoon.

Beautiful Park right in the city. This park was wonderful to walk around in the evenings. I wish I had more time to explore all the park had to offer. I highly recommend Vondelpark to anyone looking for a nature experience right in the heart of the city. Beautiful ponds and lakes all throughout the park and tons of trails to walk upon.
good park for walking. Lovely strolling/biking park near our hotel--Hotel Fita.Good place for resting and/or reading the newspaper or just taking a break from sight-seeing.
September 2012. Excellent place to relax, visit a coffee shop, buy different cheese and nougat with chips and relax here. It was soothing and pretty amazing!

Beautiful !. This is the second time I visited Vondelpark and it is beautiful! The weather was nice, and it was lovely to just sit around admiring the view! The first time I went, there were a small group of "rasta's" playing their guitars and singing, and we joined in with them! It was magical!

Get lost with your love. One of the most romantic parks we've been to so far. You can easily wander around in here for half a day. If you're in Amsterdam with your spouse, you must get lost in this magical park and fall in love all over again... *sigh*
Great place to catch a run.. Quiet park with luscious greenery and healthy dutch people running or biking everywhere. Easy routes and connections to major attractions.

Nice park. Good to pick a snack and make a pic nick, or to rest a bit from the shops and crowed places.
It's very nice and green, we a coffee in the middle and couple of hot dogs roulottes.
There is a great lake in the center with ducks.

Brilliant park. We stayed on the other end of the park to the city, so we spent quite a bit of time travelling through the park.
We cycled through, and explored the cafes and bars situated in the park.
Definitely worth a visit.
pretty park. Lovely park my only dislike was the high speed cyclist that were zooming past it was more like a road then a path . pretty though

Amazingly beautiful!. I was in Amsterdam for 5 days and went here on 4 of the days. The only day I didn't make it was the day I was too sick to leave my camp site. I loved this park. It seems to never end and you always seem to notice something new. I LOVED the adventure playground! It was like a fort in the trees and gave me many ideas for building a tree house. Just beautiful.
Serene. Come out of the Heineken Experience drunk and go chill at the nearby Vondelpark, wander by the small river crossing through it, and you will enjoy the park a lot :)
Nice cafe and relaxing walks. Cafe is lovely - quite quirky and great coffee. Nice walks and well kept for the most part. Some down and outs do make parts of it a bit less attractive..

one of Amsterdam's nicest attractions. yes it's not the central park, but it's relatively big, well kept and has several nice coffee shops.
you can easily spend there half a day without noticing.
A grat park. A very busy park where you would expect to see dozens of cyclists/joggers and walkers.A nice walk for a couple of hours .
Relaxing. A great place to relax, cycling, walking, whatever, Vondelpark is huge and so beautiful, don´t miss it!!!!

Not a bad park. The usual city-central park which you can find in practically every European capital. What actually separates this from those other parks is, of course, the emphasis on cycling and cyclists - a huge number of cyclists actually passes through the various roads in this park.WARNING: Be alert and do not stay onto the paths of cyclists - because many of them are tourists themselves and won't be experts at dodging other foot-wandering tourists - the locals are quite good at that though! I have seen collisions happen before, though they are rarely (if ever) serious.I cycled through this place and saw large groups of people sitting around simplying enjoying themselves doing nothing - a really good place to relax. According to a local, there is a hippie crowd that gathers regularly, though I did not encounter any during my visit.
Such a Beautiful Place and worth a visit.. This area is just huge and outstanding. The last time we went I got engaged to my girlfriend and what better place to do it than the vondelpark.
Ok. Ok to kill a few hours if your broke, not worth a trip out of your way though. pretty much a park and we've all seen one of them before. Luxor this isn't
Beautiful park. Vondelpark is a lovely space, with lakes, islands and cafes. It's always full of tourists enjoying the scenery, and locals taking some exercise or enjoying a few beers.

A park for every needs you may have. Do you want to get away from the busy streets? Do you miss green fields? Is a big city at bit too much for you? Or do you need to either relacs, "hang out" or exercise while you are in Amsterdam? In Vondelpark you can do all this!Fist of all, it's beautiful - really estetic with small "lakes" and "rivers", a big variation of trees, flowers and bushes. It's very well organiced with roades. You can walk, run or go by bycycles. You meet people in all ages, dogs, and if you get hungry - why not take a brake at one of the restaurants/cafes in the park. The only thing that annoyed me, is that I had to pay to use the toilette in the restaurants I visited. It doesn't matter about the money (50 cents), but it's not nice that the guests have to pay for it!Vondelpark is close to many of the museums (Van Gogh), so you can combine the two events and have a really nice day.

Nice respite from the hectic bustle of Leidseplein. We cut through Vondelpark from Museumplein to our hotel and found it a nice break from the hectic area of the Leidseplein. Still, there were many joggers, cyclists and others taking strolls but the area was fairly serene and lovely. I wouldn't plan a picnic here or anything but some do. It was just a nice place to visit and avoid being run over by bikes.

Beautiful park in midst of busy city. It was a wonderful experience with a mix of trippers, bikers, and sightseers, beware of hustlers coming up and trying to sell you hard drugs, just tell them no and enjoy your experience at the park :)
fab open space. Lots of variety, vibrant, cafe at tiop of park sells delicious food, despite being a popular pigeon hangout!

Nice place to walk round. We visited the park on a sunny afternoon and chose to spend a few hours here, watching skaters go past, etc, while sunbathing. There are a few cafes in the park but we didn't go into any of them.
Beautiful park on the edge of Amsterdam city centre. A lovely clean park close to the centre of Amsterdam. A great place to spend time during a sunny day.

Great place to get lost in. Our hostel was right next to this park, and whilst trying to get to areas to visit in Amsterdam we got lost in Vondelpark many times and when we finally found the place we where looking sometimes we wished we would of stayed here.

Very beautiful park. Walked here from the centre of Amsterdam. It is quite a walk, taking around 45mins to an hour, but was well worth it. It's a large park and all beautifully designed. There are a number of lakes and as you walk around the numerous paths there are different areas that seem secluded from one another. The park was quiet busy on a Saturday afternoon but not so much that you fell over other people and it was easy to find a secluded spot to sit for a while. Well recommended.
Hire a bike and cycle Vondelpark. A nice park to cycle around with other cyclists, joggers, prams and dogs. If you are tired of canals, take or buy lunch and just sit watching everyone else.
Beautiful. If you're in Amsterdam, give this place a visit. Relax by the lakes.Such a lovely spot away from the hustle and bustle of city life.
Peace and tranquility. A lovely start to a Sunday morning - our last day. Lots of joggers. Parrots cawing and flying. Peace and tranquility.

Busy but nice. This huge park is an attraction point for local people. The park is very crowded by picknikers, cyclists, joggers, walkers. You will have a hard time finding a quiet place! Try either early or later in the day.
pack a picnic. We had a great time biking through the park, having a picnic, and just people watching. Made for a very enjoyable day.

A nice park. A fairly large (120 acres), well-maintained park in the Oud-Zuid area (Museum district), with walking paths, water features, children's playgrounds (some spectacular climbing structures), cafes, a film museum, etc.

vondelpark. A lovely park to visit to get away from the busy streets of amsterdam to watch the world go by, loads of cyclists. On next visit, may hire a bike to cycle though the park as park is quite big
NIce park in a central location. Went there at the end of september and it was nice but i think it would be even nicer in the summer, busy with joggers and tourists.

Beautiful - groomed and wild. This large park obviously has a special place in the heart of residents and visitors alike - it is large and has a number zones ranging from groomed gardens and lawns to more wild spaces interspersed with waterways, fountains and public art all linked by a network of wide tree lined paths that accommodate a busy flow of cyclists and walkers.
Ecclectic and eccentric. Didn't have long to spend here, but loved seeing local people enjoying the vast park - singing, playing instruments etc. Definitely worth a look.

lovely park in middle of city. lovely to be able to get away from all the hustle and bustle of amsterdam. Lovely walks but bewarned... look where you step. There are a lot of dogs that enjoy Vondelpark
great bike riding place. This is the best place to ride bikes if you want to stay off the streets of Amsterdam. There are so many nooks and crannies, and so much to see inside the park.
Good place to chill in a frantic city.. Lovely oasis in this crazy town. Nice place to relax and people watch and share a repast. Sunday afternoon, bring your hibatchi and BBQ with the locals
Vondelpark. WOW what a lovely facility to have in Amsterdam, it's a beautifu park to walk through, it has a tea room by a lake. Very picturesque....especially when we visited in the autumn

Green juwel. This green juwel in the city of Amsterdam is great for a walk after a visit in the museums nearby. On Sundays, half of Amsterdams polulation seems to spend the afternoon here. trees, water, winding paths, great for walking or cycling.
A Must See. Take a definite break from the hectic pace of the city bustle to enjoy one of the most beautiful parks. If you can take your bike, but walking is just as great

Beautiful in Summer. On a sunny summer day this park is chock-full of locals sunbathing and hanging out. Lovely wide paths with overhanging trees. In the morning and evening the paths become a bicycle highway for commuters. Vondelpark also houses the Blue Teahouse, a cool place for an evening drink or plate to eat. There are also lots of fountains and ponds.
roaming Vondelpark. Very pleasant and nice to walk around and see people. Interact with people and see people from all over the world. It is large and makes for a nice respite from the crowds.

Amsterdam's Central park. Voldelpark is nature sanctuary far away from the hustle and bustle of the city. less then five minutes from Leidsplein you enter endless lush green fields , lakes , and endless jogging lanes inside the woods, in between the trees lurk amazing Mansions a great place to have a cozy nap , jogging with with native dutch people, drinking coffee or tea in the cute and upsacle cafe's in the park!!! i was there in Dusk and it was so beautiful it's easy to get there via Tram #1 from the Dam and you get of at Stadhouderskade
Bike ride. Hire a bike and ride around the park - brilliant! We took a picnic and hire bikes from the hotel and had a lovely afternoon in the park, which is a very easy ride from the hotel.

Nice park for watching folks. Vondelpark is very beautiful! We went on a Friday evening and had fun watching people. It was a nice evening so the park was packed full of locals and travelers. The are hundreds of bicyclists so be careful crossing roads / paths!

Wow really great and we went in September !!. Can we have something similar in England please. There is even a bar, it is hidden somewhat by the trees as toward the center in the trees, has blue railings and a second floor, my husband called it the tree house. The lower section seemed to close early one day, but the upper floor was open till late afternoon.
Peaceful!. This park was less then a few mins walk from our hotel, very beautiful and peaceful. Full of wildlife. Away from the hustle and bustle of the street life. Great to get away.
beautiful. We enjoyed the peacefulness and restfulness after so much walking. Would recommend that visitors go here as a nice break.
Vondelpark. Very large, beautiful park, lots of space and very very clean! They have many food stands so you wont fall short of hungry. Best way to travel around the parks is to hire out a bike.
Scenic. This is a huge and wonderful park in the middle of the city. We rented bikes and it was a great way to see the park, what a relaxing and fun experience.

A must if you're visiting Amsterdam.. Yes I'm biased because I live near here, but this park gives you the ultimate impression of how it is to be a real Amsterdammer.In the park you'll find joggers, rollerbladers, plenty of buggies including nursery teachers pushing their kids 6-to-a-pram, dogs galore, people having a smoke, people practising circus skills and in the Summer half the population of the city having a beer and a BBQ.Only 4km round, a great park to cycle round or soak up the atmosphere. LOVE.
Great Place for a Picnic. If it's sunny pack yourself a lunch and grab a bottle of wine and head to the park. It's cheap, beautiful and relaxing!
A great break from the city!. A nice park to relax in. This a handy place to exercise in. There are three great cafes within the park. Take a break and enjoy!

Run of the mill, a bit unkempt. I was disappointed: Run of the mill park with lakes and grassed areas and lots of people picnicing or eating at packed cafes. Good operatic busking in the underpass in the middle but not worth going out of your way for.
Great for a walk. Right next to our hotel, and nicely kept. Also very popular for running and walking. Watch iut for bicycles.

Beautiful park - Must visit. Beautiful park just out of the central area. Hire Bikes and enjoy and calm ride round the park. We went on a sunny weekend and the park was vibrant with joggers, families cycling, tourists all mingling. Designated BBQ areas create a community, party atmosphere. If you hire bikes then it's not far on the cycle track to Rembrandt park too
Great palce to rest. Very beautidull place to rest after streets and museums with a lot of people. Green grass, small lakes, nice water birds.
a nice walk and relaxing space,. we love to stroll through the park on our visits to Amsterdam, a nice place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of the city,
Get your Smoke and Rent a Bike. Amazing Park, you can get anything you need with you such as food drinks weed, and enjoy your day at this huge paradise, it’s better to go there during the summer
beautiful. lovely place to walk around or for a bicycle trip. wait for the sunset and prepare for a picnic. spend 2 hours around. lakes, a lot of people around.

Great place to spend Sunday afternoon. We found a good lunch at the Pavilion where the people-watching was outstanding. The paths are smooth walking for people with canes or wheelchairs, and there were some street performers on this sunny afternoon in September.
A nice piece of green. A lovely park for a pleasent stroll amoungst the trees & great for people watching. Some great eateries for some food & drink.
an oasis of Green in a busy area. This park allows joggers dog walkers and cyclists from all walks of life to mix. The water fountains are beautiful and the bridge walk ways unusual.

Great place to spend a summer afternoon.. Take a picnic and bottle of wine and watch the world go by. In summer months there is usually free live entertainment going on somewhere in the park. At weekends crowds can sometimes be a problem.
If the weathers nice, get down there. Lovely place to have a walk and chill out. Anything goes in this park as well so you can do as you please as long as you cause no discomfort to anyone else.

You feel like one of them. This beautiful park is full of holland people... You don't feel like tourist and you can see their habits,,, It is also very careful, not dirty...was good!!! But if you are not from amsterdam...take care with bikes....
Beautiful. Beautiful, but unfortunately I wasn't there in the tulips season The park must be wonderful full of colorful tulips...

Peace and quiet. The restaurant in the middle of the park is worth the trip its self. Great beer GREAT food ...... the Kaas (Cheese) sandwiches are to die for. The park is a real winner I always stop by when ever I am in town. Its a MUST SEE ! ! ! ! !
Run and enjoy the outdoors!. This park is well kept! There are some many free attractions and people selling items. Is a good place to relax and go for a nice run!

Just a park. I found this park a little disappointing. When the weather is good it is absolutely packed with people. This makes it too busy and a little impersonal. I think there are nicer places to be outside in Amsterdam. If you want to spend some time with friends then perhaps this is a good place but bear in mind people often play loud music and it is very busy during warmer days
Cyclist. We visit the Park on a bike tour of the city, so only just touched on the edge of it, but what we saw was lovely, a great space.

Great place to get used to your bike rental. We rented bikes at Mac Bikes near the park. This was a great place to ride around and get used to riding our bikes before tackling the streets of Amsterdam. Cafe Vertigo is a nice place to have lunch and a beer. The houses surrounding the park are beautiful.
nice but just a park. it's a park, like many others in the world... although you need to pass by and take a picture at the gate. it's just a must do for tourists, like the I Amsterdam sign.

Great for a run after flying all that way. Join the bikes and other runners and go 'round the ponds and paths. alk sj dk ffhd sldkf skskdj sl kd slslslsdj ffjjfkd slsldk fjd. Forget it: 50 chars is too much!
If it's a sunny day.... Lovely park to ride a bike or stroll in if the day is nice. This is a large park area with ponds and trails everywhere.

Beautiful Park. Vondelpark is a beautiful area and an ideal place for a walk or a picnic. I spent a whole afternoon here having a picnic and just people watching. The parrots flying about is really something different!
Good ambience. This restaurant is a very European restaurant serving beer, drinks, coffee and some nice dishes. It is not the best restaurant in Amsterdam but it is located in a nice park

Great place to stop and relax!. We needed a little rest after touring all day and Vondel Park was perfect!! Took a little snooze by the pond and listened to some music. Just relaxed and enjoyed the outdoors!

Perfect Park. My first experience of Vondelpark was riding a bike through it on a JoyRide Tour. I instantly knew we would be back. Everything about this park says come, relax and let your mind be at peace. There are some characters in the park but what is people watching without some cheap entertainment?

Beautiful. We hired bikes from Mac Bikes (right around the corner from the main entrance to Vondelpark) and had a great time riding around. The park is gorgeous, great layout and very well maintained. I was stopped by a man who was making huge bubbles and had lots of fun making them. You could give him a donation but he was quite modest and didn't ask for one. There is a playground for kids and a clean toilet you can use for a small fee. I would recommend a trip here when you visit Amsterdam. Great fun on a bike or on foot and lovely gardens and ponds/lakes to enjoy on a nice day.
Great way to get out of the hustle and bustle. Quiet and relaxing. Lots of areas to lay down and have a snooze and people watch. And a few cafes of course
Peaceful. Great park with lots to do for kids, smashing restaurant/cafe to enjoy alfresco eating, spotlessly clean amenities, great for people watching
Lovely park. We spent a few hours wandering through the park, stopping for a coffee or to watch rollerbladers or the open air theatre performance. I wish there had been a place to rent bikes, though.

Awesome hang-out. Great place to hang out. There are always quite a lot of people, but we always found a nice spot in the shade to sit and relax. There is always something going on, soccer, street theater, music, ...Pretty much the only place in the city where you can smoke (except for the coffeeshops of course) without the possibility of getting harassed. Perfect for a lazy, sunny afternoon with a book or frisbee/soccer with some mates.

Beautiful. We hired bikes and headed straight here after being advised, couldn't be happier we did only wish was we could have spent more time here you don't have to spend a penny and can have so much fun. There is so many grass areas with paths weaving in and out perfect for exploring on bikes like we did then pop your bikes down and rest on the grass with ice creams. Everyone seems to have so much fun down there locals and tourists.Couldn't reccomend it enough!

Just beautiful. We were lucky enough to stay at a B&B next to Vondelpark so our stroll into town was through this magnificent place. Many twists and turns lead you to delightful ponds and open spaces. THe park is heavily used so it's busy at all times. In the evening, it's not well lit and it was easy to get lost. However, we never felt uneasy and the extra time wandering the park led to more relaxation.

One of the better city parks. This park is beautiful (almost as good as hyde park in london). Lots of lakes and ponds. Some grassy open areas and some woody secluded areas. we rode bikes eound the park, i would recommend this because you can see the whole park.

Beautiful park with great people watching. Restful.. We visited Vodelpark, walked, rode our bikes, rested. It is very lovely and locals hang out there all the time. Perfect rest spot after the museums.

Freedom and Fun. lots of turns and different stretches of grass to keep ius amused. We played catch the pump, we built a tree house, we people watched especially the myriad cyclists and joggers, we had a lovely family day and unlike the rest of the holiday it didn't cost us any money.

Lovely. Very pretty and a great walk around the park. Would budget plenty of time for this walk though! There's an outdoor performance area a bit further into the park which has shows throughout the summer. Would be wary of cyclists though as they're very fast and don't seem to stop for pedestrians.

Love the park!. Lovely chilled park. On the day we went is was boiling hot, the bbq zones were packed, people kicking a football around, live jazz music and just generally a relaxing place. Me and my girlfriend just sat next to a lake, had a view drinks and watched a heron fish for food.

Great park but could do with more play area for little ones. Nice park, although like most of Amsterdam watch out for the cyclists who seem to show no regard to saftey of pedestrians or any common sense - they will crash into you whilst talking on mobile in one hand and their cigarette in the other hand with a plaster cast on their arm.(presumably from a previous crash?) I kid you not - the worst example of cyclist disregard we encountered.There are it seems 'paths' which are for bikes in the park (like the rest of the city), and unpathed 'tracks' for pedestrians - which when wet are boggy and even dry no use for pushchairs as uneven. Even sticking to the 'tracks' you'll have to cross the 'paths' numerous times. Walking around the park with young children is NOT enjoyable as you are constantly looking out for idiots paying no attention on where they are going on their bike.However, the grassed/fenced areas are superb and a welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of the busy amsterdam streets. The kids play area is great with sand pits, water fountains, stepping stones, but there are no small child swings or slides to much disappointment of our two year old - in fact - there was no slide at all.If visiting with children a welcome spot (once you reach it) to finally relax and not have to stress about them getting run over by a bike. If visiting without kids, still worth a stroll and sit to relax and enjoy a bit of welcome peace and quiet from the rest of the city.

A Green Gem. Go to this park if you can; even though I went in March it was packed with people eating picnics, feeding ducks or snoozing. It is a good people watching location and a nice place to escape Amsterdam's hustle and bustle.

Natural Beauty. the weather was warm and the beautiful trees offered a welcome shade and a sylvan beauty. I saw two bicyclist collide as it got quite hecttic at times. There also appeared to be some homeless people.
Beauty in a thriving city. A lovely large park, filled with musicians, places to eat and drink and some exhibitions. A must see of the city, lovely place to lunch.

Nice for a picnic. If the sun is shining take a picnic down to the park. It is a beautiful place that is very well looked after. Gives you a chance to see some of the blooms that Amsterdam is so famous for..

A great place to relax for a while. We wandered in, wandered around watching people for a while, listened to some music, sat down and watched the world go by, and then wandered out again. A lovely place on a sunny day.
Amazing park in the middle of town. Very large, beautiful and safe even at night to walk or bike through it. Great vegetation, lagoon, bike and walk paths.

Chill out!!. This park is a great place to get away from the madness, on a sunny day you can lie on the grass or sit on one of the mnay benches, I fell asleep for 30 minutes on a bench whilst my husband had a smoke! Be aware of the bikes though when you are walking through. You have to take a walk around this park, its lovely we have also been in winter and it's lovely then too.

Worthy of a Bike Ride. This is a lovely park that is well utilised by the locals. It's worth a visit for it's ponds and the houses that surround the park. we then rode around the streets outside the park. The men's urinals are also worthy of mention - very open to the public.
Very green.. It had a nice oldtime entrance. There were lots of people on Saturday. It's a good place to rest your feet on the many benches & take pictures.

A delightful retreat.. We had a picnic here today- bought some local bread, cheese and wine from small dutch bakery and fromagerie nearby. There was a pleasant atmosphere until late in the evening with locals cycling, tourists picnicing and people enjoying the fresh air. It's amazing that somewhere so central could be so peaceful- you can barely hear the rush of the city but instead have the chatting of various languages, casual musicians and whizz of passing cyclists. It was a relaxing and cosy end to our second evening in Amsterdam. There is a smell of weed in a lot of areas but in this city- that's to be expected.
Peace and quiet. My Partner and I visited on our last day it was very busy yes but there is opportunities for peace and quiet and a picnic lots of runners and off course bikers!

Nice part in the middle of the city. Nice park in the middle of the city. Very well kept and clean. People traveling from South Asia will specially like the serene, lush green and beautiful landscape of the park. good way to take a break from the hussle and bustle of the otherwise busy city.

peace and tranquility. A beautiful park full of wild life, creeks, beautiful trees, pathways and people enjoying the outdoors. So nice to escape the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam's tourist vibe and ride bikes throughout the park. A number of fun play ground areas for kids too!
Nice Walk. It was a tad busy but then again it is a major park. We managed to have a nice walk around and relax for a while on the grass. Very good place to take a picnic.

Chill out like a local. Locals love hanging in Vondelpark and so will you! We got bikes in Leidseplein just outside the front entrance of the park and spent a morning biking around the park and just chilling out! If you have a day to spare... Definelty spend it here. I love Amsterdam!
Natural Beauty. Take a short bike ride through the city and to get lost in this lovely park. Little discoveries and friendly people around every turn.

Beautiful park. I visited this park twice during my weekend stay in Amsterdam. The first time I had a walk, the second time I cycled. Both times it wasa very pleasant experience. The park itself is a jogger/cyclist paradise, and I'm not surprised at all. It's quite big, maintained well, and just simply lovely. Worth a visit for a stroll.
Nice place. Large park, worth a visit to while away the time , def worth hiring bikes and cycling around. Great place on a sunny day

Love, love, love. This is a fantastic park - very similar to Central Park here in NYC. My husband and I spent the day walking through it, a little biking and then just lounged on the grass. A beautiful way to spend the day.
lovely. what a lovely place. We went super early in the morning. Rode our bikes around in the cool air. Very well kept. Staff was cleaning in the morning.

Walking around is just magic. If you want to get away from chaos just come to this park, people playing soccer, music, nice ambience, super clean and people having fun all around make this spot one of my favorites in amsterdam

Be a local. We felt part of Amsterdam despite our obvious HIRE cycle. The park was a lovely oasis with the added advantage of then accessing the rather upmarket Amsterdam on the other side of the park from Overtoom. Not so many tourists and more Amsterdam-Ians.
Nice park to relax. Nice park to relax in and be a little away from the city. Cafes inside if desired. Quite picturesque - lakes, bridges, statues, paths etc.

A park in the middle of Amsterdam. There is always a nice atmosphere in this park .
I should recommand to make a nice walk in the parkor to come with your rented bike.
VONDELPARK. Everything.People,life,amusements,artists,urban tribes,music,streetart,etc,love Amesterdam ANARKY'n'FUN =;-(A)

Vondelpark. Lovely peaceful park with cafes, open air theatre (on certain days) and so much to see - parrots, people - (jogging, walking, cycling, "romance running" and exercising, playing musical instruments, singing, filming promotions etc.) and more varieties of bicycles than you might see anywhere else!

Perfect weather, friendly people. We went to Vondelpark a few times to bike, stroll, and picnic. We had a wonderful time at the restaurant in the park as well, people watching, and meeting fellow travelers. Definitely worth exploring.
Quiet place. Very quiet place. In the weekends, you see a lot of people there making barbecue and getting along. Very nice to visit.

Great park. Great park to chillout during the day. Go with a few friends or alone, take a book or drink and relax in the sunshine. Its close to the city also which was great.I stupidly walked through this park at night as my hotel was literally adjacent to the park. I would not recommend any one walk through place at night, especially females. Its very dark, many hooligans, drunks, homeless and people shouting at others. Otherwise, it was great to chill out looking at the people (the groups that would hug randoms was so cool to watch).

A Runner's Park!. It was a great place to go for a run in the morning (2x around approx. 5+ miles). It was also nice just to go for a stroll, and there was a huge play area that my kids rather enjoyed!
Nice place for a stroll. Good place to take a quiet leisurely stroll. Take in the sights and just relax while walking and enjoying the park

So nice to stroll there!. A very nice walk, great feeling in the heart of the city. My wife and I walked for a long time, enjoyed one of the cafeterias and loved it so much that we returned the next day, now on bikes, to enjoy this garden again
This is not Central park. We rented from Mac Bikes & started our ride in the "central park" of Amsterdam, Well it aint Central park, crowded & very artificial park.Really nothing special at all.
Wow. Excellent inner city park to walk or rid through. Perfect for a break or a picnic while people watching

Park life. We visited Vondelpark on an absolutely sweltering day in August and we found a nice place to sit on the grass by the fountain and chill out for a while. There are plenty of benches available if you'd prefer not to sit on the grass too. There were a couple of restaurants within the park to get a bite to eat or drink. There was an open air stage with some musical performance going on. Overall it was a busy city park much like you would expect, oh and being Amsterdam it had its fair share of cyclists.
Relaxing. Vondel park is nice for jogging, playing tennis, riding bicycles and for a walk too and it´s two minutes walking from the different entrances to every tram Destination: Central station
Great for people watching. The Central Park of Amsterdam. Runners, walkers, painters and more. Right in the heart of the city. I wish that I would have had more time to just sit and be.
Central Park of Amsterdam. Busy and biggest park in Amsterdam, a few restaurants are located in the park, lost of locals who enjoy The park

Gorgeous and relaxing, and a great spot to people watch.. If you're at the Van Gogh museum, take a stroll through Vondelpark. It's relaxing and beautiful, very large and easy to find your own little spot to sit and chill and have a picnic. Watch out for the amazing tropical birds that look completely out of place in the trees. There is a great cafe/restaurant in the centre that looks a bit run down when you are approaching, but head up to the second level for fantastic food and service. Great spot to stop for a beer or a bite to eat, full of locals.We also stumbled across this giant play structure/treehouse (see photos). We spent some time playing around on it, feeling like kids again. Fun! Great spot for people watching. Worth a visit if you're in Amsterdam.
Worth the time. A great park to walk around and unwind. People were friendly and having fun. What a joy to walk and observe people. Stay in the area and double your fun.
Walk in the Park. Wide open spaces in a crowded city make this a must place to visit, after all the hustle and bustle this was a welcome escape.
cute. nice park-very chill--we found a nice restaurant and sat and chilled in the shade a sit was hot and sunny-

Locals mainly hanging out.... It's a park in the city, lot's of locals sitting on the lawn kissing, high school kids smoking drugs, people walking through. If your time is limited, it didn't really seem worth spending time there.

Take a walk around.. Being within walking distance from the Van Gogh museum I decided to check it out. I thought it was great - lots of people everywhere. There was bands playing, people riding their bikes around. The atmosphere here was neat :)
Wow!. Beautiful... except for all the homeless people. A nice place to relax on a summer day but try to stay away from the main area.
Nice area to cycle around and enjoy a picnic lunch. Lovely park to cycle around and enjoy a picnic lunch. There are places to purchase food too. Close to the museums.
Overrated. It was overgrown, full of drunks and the playground not really suitable for younger children. Certainly better places in Amsterdam to spend your time
Beautiful. If you visit Amsterdam this park is a must do. Beautiful and interesting. Refreshing as the bikes stay out of YOUR way for a change!!

Great....... Such a nice parc to do anything. You can lie down and relaxe, have a picnick, have a chat, walk around.........in the weekends there`s also music sometimes, usually in the summertime. Lot`s of green, clean..just a very nice parc.

Nice place to relax. Beautiful park close to the everything. Nice gardens, places to eat, beautiful old houses along the park. Great place to take pictures. It's a good place to go all seasons of the year.

A Great Late Night by the Fountain!. We spent a great late-night taking photos and enjoying snacks at Vondelpark. We rode our bikes there and had a blast.
Even though it was late at night, we felt safe at all times.
Good fun!

Good place to stroll. Very busy with cyclists and joggers, some nice cafes, basic but clean and reasonably priced. Good place to take a picnic, but small children need to be watched because of cyclists speed. A few disreputable beggars about. Try and spot the parakeets. Visited in height of summer and bit surprised not many flower beds or floral displays being Holland, but some nice fountains and trees.

Take your time.... Take your time... breath... sit down on a bench... walk around, go sit next to the lake... Just wonderful, sitting watching the people living in Amsterdam and their way of life, riding their bikes... walking the dog.The whole place is very beautiful... NOT very big for those of you that have been to really big parks around the world. It is very close to the museum square so it can be a nice pause before or after the museum.I recommend going to the supermarket, getting something to snack on when sitting around so you can really feel like you have all the time in the world.

Beautiful park or a walk.. Park was beautiful, clean and relaxing for a nice walk on a beautiful day. If you are looking for a break from the main sightseeing locales and crush, and just want to see how the locals relax, I would highly recommend a stroll through the park.
