well, its a park. not a bad park, its actually a nice park. but unless you are looking for a place to jog a couple of miles / kilometers, there is nothing unusual.i did stumble onto some tennis courts that had a very high level of play going on (NTRP 5.5 +, i think). that made it worth it for me. however, if you are not a tennis fan or into running you won't find pretty flowers or great views here.
Beautiful and pleasant park. I recommend to rent a bike and ride through the park, take time to sit down and just enjoy the moment.
Lovely. Nice place to walk and relax. Watch out in the evenings as many in the park are enjoying a nice herbal smoke.

Awesome park -- and it's free. We just happened upon this park. We couldn't believe what a great place to sunbath, have a picnic, or just hangout with friends. Also great people-watching on a sunny day. If your wallet has been getting pinched on vacation, take half a day and spend some free time, for free. I wish all cities had a park as nice as this one.

Bike ride in Vondelpark. I took a bike tour to get to know Amsterdam better and the bike tour guide took us to the park for a pause. Besides the park being lovely and very restful, the restaurants inside the park are very good and it has good and clean restrooms.

HUGE!. Very natural park, nicely kept, beautiful place to walk or bicycle. It is full of ponds with ducks and goose, and even being very crowded when the wether is sunny, it is a relaxing place to visit. I spring it should be beautiful with flowers.
Picturesque. Nice park only lakes and grass. Lots of bikes but good for picnics and families. Portaloos but clean with running water
So big!. Lovely park with a lot see, restaurants and bars. There is a church in there as well which looks lovely from ouside.

The park is not the beautiful Dutch garden u would expect. And it was very busy with 1000s of bikes passing through, making walkers share the paths with them whizzing by. Probably good for jogging if you like asfalt paths. The playground for children was small and dull although framed by lushous greenery.
Perfect for long runs. We stayed just a block away and ran here every other day. Beautiful park with an amazing number of people running/biking etc.

Beautiful park and its neigbourhood. A vast, beautiful and friendly park. You can sit on numerous lawns and relax. The place can be noisy as it is often crowded but you can always find a silent retreat. Vondelpark is surrounded by beautiful villas - I strongly recommend exploring its surroundings!

Nice place to relax or go for a run. This is a nice place almost in the city centre, where you can have some peace and quiet, although - taking into account the number of joggers, sun-bathers, roller-bladers and all those who came there for that promised peace and quiet, it is not quite that quiet :) But still, it is a very nice place for a walk, a a picnic, or a run. Very green, well-trimmed, with a lot of space for all those who come there. You have one or two cafe's inside, several ponds with ducks and geese. A perfect place to relax!

A walk in the park. This place is really beautiful. We walked there from our hotel and had breakfast in the outdoor cafe. The best hot chocolate and croissants ever. People had their dogs playing and running about harmoniously. The lake was lovely. It's really a lovely place to be.
Huge Green space in a buzzing city. Always worth a visit when in this great city, just chill out or wander in the open space and if you are lucky enjoy some live music

Wow!. Vondel park is an excellent place to be on a sunny day. We rode bikes through the park on a tour with Mike's Bikes. The park is very large and very green. I guess that anything goes is Vondel park but it was family friendly and very peaceful when we were there.

Relaxing and Fun. Loved the wide open paths, the feeling of being on some kind of film set with people running or walking all around you, manicured lawns, wind swept trees - loved it. There's an odd looking cafe there too which attracts hawkers and beggars, but other than that, nice place to stop and listen to the Parakeets.

what a gorgeous park. We strolled through this beautiful park located right in the center of the city.We ate in one of the 2 restaurants,the one that looks like an old 19th century mansion.Just beautiful !
Pretty!. Such a pretty park, rode bikes through and took pictures all around. Loved the "Fish" sculpture by Picasso within the park

Great place on a sunny day!!. Walked through early August. Busy park lots of people but more than plenty of space to sit around in the sun or in the shade. Lots of interesting people floating around and incredibly friendly. Several cafes to eat ad drink at all family friendly.

Pretty much a beach, but a park. Love Vondelpark, top 3 favourite in the world :)
Always free open air concerts in the summer and nice fluffy grass to nap on.

One of Europes Best Parks. I love Vondelpark! On the weekends it's packed with people, especially in the the summer and the fall. The rose garden down at the bottom of the park is worth the walk. This park is excellent for both walkers and bike riders.

Best park ever. Rented some bikes and went for a bike ride after a heavy night out. It was perfect. The park is gorgeous, really big and easy to cycle around. Lots of lovely restaurants and coffee shops around as well, coffee shops as in the type that serve coffee not weed! We took a picnic and ate it by one of the lakes.Also, make sure to explore off the main paths as we stumbled across a lovely rose garden under a little archway! Make sure you visit this park if you are in Amsterdam.
An evening stroll through the park. Pleasant at sunset, nice lanes to walk, beautiful gardens, many places to sit down. Great atmosphere

Wonderfully peaceful park to relax..... This is a wonderful park not far from the heart of the Centrum. It's a beautiful park to walk around, read a book or have a snack in. There is some water in the middle of the park and a bicycle road for cyclists that ride on. The park is not too big and can easily be walked around. Some people compare it to Central Park but it's no where the size of Central Park. I wouldn't use that as a comparison other than it's close to the city.There are several benches to sit on and a beautiful bridge you can cross over on. Definitely it's worth it to spend a bit of time walking around the park.

Beautiful park. great for bike watching and the park is beautiful. We were there in rather rainy weather, so didn't stay long, but we could have sat there for hours just watching the bikers riding through the park on their daily commutes.
Lovely Park for picnic. Really lovely spot to sit on a sunny day and have some food and a few drinks. Nice to meet some locals finally as well!
Great Place to Run. Nice traffic free park to enjoy a run, ASICS shop has run maps on the wall next to the main entrance

A place away from the City. We did not go through the entire park but we did use it to escape the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam. It is very much like Central Park in NYC if you have ever been there. We just strolled through and found a quiet place to sit and watch others as locals came in to soak up the sun and and enjoy a sunny Sunday afternoon. Biking, skating, walking, lunching, and so many other activities to enjoy makes you forget you are in the city...

A Beautiful Oasis. My daughter and I biked through the Vondelpark last week on our trip to Amsterdam. What a beautiful oasis in the city! People were biking, jogging, relaxing in the tranquil greenery. We really enjoyed our trip through the park.
A sanctuary. Visit earlier in the day to fully enjoy the beauty of this park. Free concerts on Saturday summers are recommended
Lovely Relaxing Place. Of course it was raining, but this park gave a much needed break with beautiful gardening to view. Just sit and relax.
Nice park. We took a leisurely stroll through the beautiful park along with very many locals. It was nice to see locals enjoying their city.
Beautifully Serene. Beautiful park full of people chilling out in the sunshine, only took a quick walk through but could have spent the day there relaxing with a picnic in the sunshine

What a lovely park!. During our stay in Amsterdam in July 2012, we spent a relaxing afternoon in Vondelpark. There was plenty of space to spread out and lounge and although it was a wednesday afternoon, there were plenty of opportunities for people-watching. I recommend that anyone staying in Amsterdam for more than 3 days, visit this park.

Beware agressive cyclists. This a lovely park in the middle of Amsterdam and close to lots of museums, the diamond houses, etc. It's quiet and if you are looking for an early morning run or a place to get a bit of peace of mind, it's quite tranquil. Just one caution, which applies to most of Amsterdam: watch out for the cyclists! The bike paths aren't always clearly marked and you must stay out of them. If you hear a bike bell, look around fast! I had a friend hit by a cyclist in the park, and he went home with a broken leg! Of course, it wasn't intentional, but it's clear that bike lanes... are for bikes.
Reminds Me of Central Park. Loved the Vondelpark. We went biking riding, relaxing, and people watching. This park reminds me of Central Park in New York City.
Go with a bike. Beautiful park, with lots of green, but it's better if you go with a bike. Walking can be tiring, specially after some days of walk in a trip.
quiet and piecefull. enjoying a nice and piecefull part of Amsterdam, seeing a lot of bird life, people jogging with or without their dog(s)
VondeIpark. Fantastic outdoor conference and haIIes. In middIe of amsterdam but easiIy accessibIe by bus or tram.This is aIso very cIose to the main A10 ring road.
Love this park. Definitely a must-stop in Amsterdam. Beautifully well kept, with beautiful people and their dogs tromping about.

Don't miss it. A lovely open space where all the world and his wife can be observed - if you're into people watching this is the place on a nice sunny afternoon - an oasis in the mad world of Amsterdam.
Lovely for a walk or picnic. Went to Vondelpark at lunchtime for a nice stroll. Plenty of people about enjoying picnics, a cycle or playing football. Lovely scenic park with various features.

NICE. DO go!!! you'll love it, no matter what season is. Definitly a must go of Amsterdam. As it was by a walking distance of my hotel (Conscious Hotel Vondelpark), it was my daily moment of peace. It's wonderful just to sit there and look times go by....
lovely park. nicely laid out park..great for a good spot of people watching and general splodging.. can bbq there or take a picnic
Relax and sunbathe. We hired bikes and biked around the park, and then sunbathed for the rest of the day. It is so quiet and was a great place to just chill out before hitting a night out.
beautiful park. its a big park set in wonderful greenery and woodland - many many people visit here on a sunny day - nice and relaxing and very close to the city centre - easy walkable

A great place for a daytime walk. Not only a great park but lots of (harmless) interesting characters to be seen. Not sure if I would venture there at night though.
A great place to get away from the hustle and bustle.

Really nice park, right in the city. Liked: Easy to get to, open-air theatre, free concerts, wildlife!
Disliked: Secluded parts frequented by junkies.
Lovely. The Vondelpark is a great place to walk and people watch. Take a little blanket and some wine and cheese and you'll have a great afternoon.

Relax In The Park. When visiting Amsterdam and you have the time visit Vondelpark, stroll the paths, take a long walk go both directions. The park is very pretty. Watch the people, lovers and children. Enjoy the green lawn, flowers visit the cafe, and just relax/rest.
amsterdams' central park. it is a big comfortable user friendly park with cafes and museums. great small lake and beauty everywhere.

I like this place. Large park not far from Leidseplejn. Enjoy the nature, have a picnic, or just sit and rest, or you can take festival and events there. This is place for everyone. You have there quiet areas and also busy places. I like this place.
Mr Alastair Longhurst. The best couple of hours spent in Amsterdam!!!!! The sun was shining and the park was very busy!!!! The blue teahouse is a must visit for a lunch break!!!!!!

Beautiful park in the old quarter. A Beautiful place to sit back and relax with a book, to cycle, pictures, I would suggest you put on your walking shoes as its a huge park and you should try to at least walk around/ cycle around , it should take you around 2 to 3 hours . A must do on a summer evening in Amsterdam

Refreshing. If you want to walk through a lovely park in the middle of a large city, this is it. Designed in an English Garden style, its walks share traffic with bicycles and pedestrians. The bicycles do not intrude and are skilled at avoiding casual strollers!

Best Park in the World. During the summer this park is full of events, festivals or just people of all ages and backgrounds hanging out, doing their thing. Go have a picnic or rent some skates or a bicycle and just ride around, soaking up the beauty. If there was ever a hip place to be, Vondelpark in the summer would be it!
Oasis. A beautiful oasis in the middle of the city. It is very clean and green.
A leisurely wind down. It was really nice being able to stroll through this city centre park after a day's sight seeing. Well worth a stroll through
rainy day. we had a rainy day but still had fun in the park! found a great cafe next to the lake and chilled for a few hours!
Brilliant. Not that close to where we were staying but definately worth the trip to take a walk, somethign to do for a good two hours its beautiful
Lovely on a Nice Day. Lots of people and dog watching here. This is a very large park. We only walked through a small portion of it to get a feel for it. Old film museum has a nice pub in the park.

Great oasis of green in the city. Wonderful for strolling around in a delightful green space as an alternative to the city. As with the rest of Amsterdam, just watch out for the anarchic approach to cycling when merely a pedestrian.

Peaceful space - off the roads!. If you are a pedestrian - beware the bikes! Otherwise it's a lovely peaceful place for a walk, a sunbathe or a sit. There are also some lovely restaurants. I don't rate it above other parks in London but it's still very good.
Amazing Park. Whether you want to cycle, walk or run until you drop this park has it all. Really enjoyed just cycling around.

Great place to have a short break!. Great location for bike riding!
or just to wonder around, nice cafe in the center of the park.

Great Place for Picnic. If you want a floor show Vondelpark is the place. It's not far from the museum district and let's one walk and enjoy the beautiful park with gardens and lush meadows for a picnic with a super window into the Dutch people at the leisure. Grab some fantastic Dutch cheese. and fresh bread...some herring and wine and it's a magnificent experience!
peaceful time out. loved the vibe and chillout factor - got to visit Vondelpark - this is how the Dutch relax !
Lovely. Lovely relaxing park, right in the centre of Amsterdan. Ideal place to have a rest, after hours of walking round Amsterdam.
A relaxing place. If the weather is nice an extremely relaxed and perfect place to spend the day. May be over populated on weekends with nice weather though

Amsterdam's "Central Park". This is the Amsterdam equivalent of central park. This is the favorite place for Amsterdammers to relax with friends on a rare sunny day. There are places to BBQ at the front and back of the park. Great to watch people and to just relax. There are a number of cafes and playgrounds throughout the park.

Family Holiday. The park is a great place to walk and take in the relaxed atmosphere of Amsterdam. When we were there they had some free entertainment on in the open air theatre which was nice. Like the rest of Amsterdam you need to watch out for the cyclists! They don't take prisoners....

Ordinary Park. It's just a park - nice pathways, lots of runners, cyclists and dog walkers, but not a destination point unless you want to exercise or lie on the grass and relax in the sun. There is sometimes live music but we didn't see that while we were there.

Wonderful for biking with kids. We ride our rented bicycles through the park to give my son more confidence biking and he loved it so much he wanted to go again and again. I would recommend this park to practice your biking if you are new to Amsterdam. There are many cafes where one can sit and enjoy a coffee, grab a bite to eat and write postcards.
A Little slice of heaven in Amsterdam. My husband and son spent an afternoon there and tell me it was quite beautiful - they even had a nap.

Rent a bike and do a picnic there!. It's an amazing place, beautiful and alive ! The atmosphere is amazing! Buy some nice food and make a picnic there - in summertime, pls! Rush times are the busiest ones too! The houses around the park are amazing, mansions actually. Woth pay a visit!
A slice of heaven. We went there on a perfect summer day - everyone seemed so happy - a perfect place for a bike ride, picnic or stroll.
Nice park for chill out.. Very nice park for somebody who like walking, biking or just chill out :) Recommend to visit it on bike as we did :)

bit disappointing. We are horticulturists and were excited about this visit as the Netherlands is renowned for its horticultural activities (and rightly so).The park was quite nice, pleasant, but we were expecting more.
very nice. This park is just fantastic, I loved it. The only advise I have for turists is to have a map handy.

Chill out here!. This is THE place to go (weather permitting!) to take a break from culture and site seeing. You can sit here without being bothered by anyone and sunbathe or eat lunch or read a book or just watch the world go by. Plenty of interesting features to this park plus good snack bars and restaurant Vertigo for coffee, cocktails or a meal. Sit on it's terrace and people watch!
Nice park. Some peace and quiet in the city so when im amsterdam i will come back there.
Nice Park.. A pleasant break from the hustle and bustle of this all active city.Giving you time to chill and picnic before your Stroll back down the "Dam" Street.!.
Clear your mind. You still have to watch for bicycles on the paths, but it is a good way to get out of the city buzz, and relax a little.
Sunday rest. There used to be a cinema here, but that has moved now. Nevertheless, go there on a Sunday to relax and you see how active the Dutch are.
nice park. We walked in the Vondelpark for an hour. It was pleasant but nothing special, and the biggest thrill came from dodging the bicyclists when we crossed the roads.

Rent a bike!. We took our kids here to blow off some steam. We took them to the big playground on the grounds of a cafe called Het Gruut Melkhuis. Instead, we should have rented bikes and rode around this park. If we ever return, this will be part of our plan, as our kids really wanted to join in all the Amsterdam biking fun.
Oasis. Take time to relax in this beautiful green park! We enjoyed it.

Fun area lots of locals and tourist. It was fun to hang out in this park and we got to see a soccer match on their huge projector. It was an awesome experience, and best of all it's free. If you have the time, and want to take a stroll, this is a great place to do it at.

Pleasant place for a stroll. Vondelpark may not be on par with some of the great metropolitan parks of the world but it is a nice place to relax and decompress after hitting the museums. It, as well as the rest of Amsterdam, can be more thoroughly done on a rental bike and the bike paths throughout Holland are wonderful.

Go for a Stroll. Go for a Stroll in this wonderful park! We experienced it twice- once in the afternoon and once in the evening. In the afternoon, it was absolutely packed with people walking, jogging, biking, and relaxing. It is a wonderful escape from the city and a great place to relax. We saw two places to eat or have a coffee. We went to the self service one and had our afternoon coffee and a sandwich there. It was very enjoyable to see Amsterdam natives doing their thing. It is also amazing to see all the different types of bicycles and the many things they put on them. We saw some bikes that could carry up to three kids! In the evening, many people were picnicing and BBQing. It was less busy and had more of a party atmosphere than in the morning. There was also a free concert going on. The cafe we saw earlier was now a bar by the theatre. It was a fun place to visit on both occasions.
horsing around. Beautiful stables at the park-and lovely area to walk
Beautiful park. Take the time to wander around Vondelpark while you are in Amsterdam. It's a beautiful park and a great place to people watch!

Beautiful park for relaxing. Vondelpark was a 'must' for us after all of our friends recommended it upon hearing that we were visiting Amsterdam.It is an absolutely gorgeous park that you can walk around, find some empty space, park down and have a picnic. Large bike trails and separate walking trails, but enough space that it doesn't get too crowded. The BBQ areas (at the tips of the park) are packed with people and delicious smelling smoke billowing into the air but if you aren't BBQ-ing, space shouldn't be an issue.Saw park security once but everyone keeps to themselves. We went on a weekday afternoon so it was not as busy but around 5-6pm, the park was filled with people jogging after work, riding through the park on their way home, and groups of people partaking in various activities (yoga, stretching, exercising, running, etc.)Bathrooms are a bit obscure in this park. However, you can go to the restaurants and use their facilities for 50 cents (same as anywhere else in Amsterdam). Must see park if you are in Amsterdam. Hit up some of the markets in the city centre for cheese, bread, and some wine and it'll be a fun afternoon.
beautiful park in central Amsterdam. Lovely oasis in central Amsterdam, great for a run or walk
A nice place to stroll. Right near the Piet Hein hotel this park is peacefully and nice for picnicking. Riding ur bike is also a nice idea here.

Beautiful!. We only saw a bit of it as we rode through toward the end of our bike tour and wish we had time to go back with a picnic! Plan to spend a morning, afternoon or evening - watch for parakeets living in the park!
Beautiful!. A gorgeous place to visit, we were in Amsterdam in lovely sunny weather and this is the place to be.
Lovely oasis. Great Park, central and big enough to walk or cycle round for a few hours.
Beautiful. Fantastic park. If the weather is nice it's a real pleasure to walk around or just to sit and people watch. Plenty of wildlife to see to, a great way to spend a few hours.

Beautiful Park. I found myself wandering and strolling thru this park often over my stay.
It is relaxing and a wonderful place to just linger and meet and talk to the locals away from the hectic bar scene.

Nice park on the edge of the city. We rode though here on a lovely sunny morning and it was very enjoyable, although a little busy. It struck me as a nice spot to have a picnic and watch the world go by.
Mini Central Park. The park really reminded me of Central Park NYC and it was really nice to see gangs of teenagers acting so well behaved and quiet in public.
oasis. A green oasis in a busy city. Been to Amsterdam many times but first visit to the park and it is beautiful.
Leisurely. A cozy, leisurely area of Amsterdam. It's not the kind of place I want to spend too much rime in on a quick visit; but I'd definitely visit often if I lived there.

Great place to relax and meet people. It was huge and you were able to ride your bicycle around it. Vendors were around where you could buy an icecream or drink. You were also able to lie around in the grass and just relax.

Great way to spend an afternoon. What a beautiful park! Walked through it at different times and it always seems to be alive with activity. Great way to kill the afternoon (as most museums close at 5 or 6pm).
Wonderful, eclectic. A wonderful place to visit on a warm summer night. Lots of people out enjoying the evening.

A Wonderful Find. We spend several hours walking around the park and at the small cafe inside the park. It was a pleasant experience walking and the food and drinks at the cafe were reasonably priced and hit the spot for refreshment. The park restaurant would be a beautiful location for a wedding & reception.
Nice park in the sunshine... Had a barbecue with friends last week. Special BBQ spots, best park in Amsterdam if you ask me. People ride their bikes, drink their beers, music here and there. Love it.

an unexpected pleasure. while we had heard about it, we didn't realize how great it was to cycle your way into vondelpark, it was nice sunny day in september and just getting into the park, going to the small restraunt by the water, enjoying fries with beer ( hoogarden - the belgians still beat anyone else when it comes to beer ), and then the cycle back, and this is a big park, spend some time and make sure you relax, excellent for joggers and skaters as well
Relaxing Park. An antedote to the hectic street scene in central amsterdam
Lovely. Cycled through As part of a bike tour -very nice. We're told some of the history which was interesting
A great park to pass the afternoon. Do a walkabout see the people of Amsterdam...mainly in the summer there are open concerts.

Good park!. I went to this park twice today - it's great. Full of active people! Great place for kids (there's a bouncy castle for 2euros for 15 min) including lots of playground ideas. Great place for picnics, walking, cycling and rollerblading. It's got lots of opportunities to eat/drink with several cafes/bars in the park. Definitely worth a visit if you have time in Amsterdam!
Really nice relaxing park. Great area to walk around a parkland environment and take a break from the city. Very much like Central Park in New York. Lots of joggers and people on bicycles.
nice change of pace. the park is centrally located and an oasis from the hustle of the city.
Not like any park I've been in the US. Very neat park. All kinds of people doing all kinds of things.

My favorite place in Amsterdam. Ok, this was my favorite place! I had rented a bike for the week and when I got frazzled with riding in traffic I'd head to Vondelpark and commune with the green parakeets.

Could be nicer....seemed a bit scruffy to me?. Had promised my hubby a picnic in the park for his birthday but the weather wasn't brilliant - quite dull, but warm all the same. Due to this, there weren't a lot of people in the park but a considerable amount of rubbish - including drug paraphernalia. The only good thing I noticed was how quiet it was the moment you walk through the gates; you really are leaving the city behind. Maybe it's better when the sun shines but I wouldn't go there again to be honest.
A great lace to get away from it all. Just a lovely place to relax, very safe even late at night and plenty of paths to choose from.

A great place to wander and enjoy. This is a beautiful park. It is spacious,intersting and well set out so that it can be enjoyed by all who visit it. If you visit Amsterdam it is a great place to go to in order to escape the busy streets. I particularly loved to watch all the young people who cycle there in the evenings to enjoy a picnic dinner together.

Large, open, and quiet. We stayed close to Vondelpark, which means that it was a step out the door and there we were. Always filled with walkers and bikers passing through, it's lively, but never really loud, and is a perfect place to sit down and relax after a day of exploring the city.
Nice park close to the museums. A nice park. A great place to explore when you first rent your bike before venturing out in the very busy bicycle paths.
A cute park.. We felt like we had to go based on reviews, and it was nice, but not much different from nice parks in any other city.

Beautiful Park. This is a very safe and beautiful park with lots of people out riding bikes or jogging. You will see an occasional group of people out smoking some marijuana but everyone seemed very well behaved. It is a beautiful and very large park with plenty of places to eat, sit or just enjoy the scenery.
Vondelpark is V-onderful! :). This is one of my favorite places to go in Amsterdam...a nice retreat from the city streets, a beautiful place to go for a walk or spend a day with friends in the grass!

Beautiful walkway. All I used the park for was to walk through it from my hotel at the west end to my friend's hotel at the east end but it started and ended my day in the most refreshing way. My room on an upper floor looked out on the park, over a small canal, and provided me with a delightful respite from the busy day as many people were walking and biking through the park even after dark. Being in Vondelpark added significant pleasure to my stay in Amsterdam.

Big City Park. This is a serene spot in the middle of the city. Great for biking or strolling. Don't expect the sort of beauty that you see in, for instance, Central Park in New York. This is flat, treed, green, with a bit of water.

Great playgrounds if you have kids with you. Our 10 year old son absolutely loved the wooden playground with the netted walkways and ropes here. We had a great fat noon just walking through the park. Nice way to spend an afternoon taking a break from the shops and business of the city itself.

Nice place to have some downtime. We hit Vondelpark on day 6 of our European tour. By this point, we all were sick of sight seeing, especially the kids (aged 9 and 12). We rented bikes by the Centraal Station and biked the 2 miles to Vondelpark. My husband and I enjoyed the biking very much; my daughter found the biking in Amsterdam terrifying.But, Vondelpark was a breath of fresh air. It was gorgeous, clean, and free of anything informative (as far as the kids were concerned). We found the Melkhaus, parked our bikes, had a beer (the adults) and played in the playground (the kids). Visiting Vondelpark was a nice way to spend the afternoon. We got to see how real Amsterdammers live and we got a break from information overload.

green place. I was already there fwe time while visiting Amsterdam and I have to say it's a nice place to tak a rest during visiting the city. There are a lot of green areas, terraces and a few caffes - so basicly all it's good for a small stop :D.

Favorite spot for walks and relaxing. I love coming to this park when I'm visiting, whether it's for a run, walk or picnic. Everyone seems to love this park just as much as me. I love watching all the bikers with loads of children on their bikes.

Nice place for a bike ride. We rented bikes one day in Amsterdam and especially enjoyed riding in the vondelpark. Reminded us a bit of central park. Stopped for a bite to eat and sat by the pond. So Relaxing!

Beautiful & relaxing. Enjoyed relaxing in the Vondelpark on a lovely sunny afternoon watching all the people and listening to the band playing. The icecream from the seller just outside the gate (mustn't have had a license for the park) was heavenly. A moment of calm....
Beautiful Park. Well worth the short distance to get a taste of the outdoors in Amsterdam. People watching was at a premium. The day we visited there was a nice outdoor concert.
Do not miss. A quiet park right near the museums..ideal for nice walks and to enjoy a momment of quiet away from the busy city

A visit to vondel park. It was very pleasant to visit the park. It is extremely popular with the locals and was very busy when we visited. Access is is easy with a few entrances.Lots of activities from just enjoying the sun to music, cycling etc.It is easy to fins a nice area and spend a few hours watching peaple, animals and the like.

Beautiful city park. Vondelpark is a must-visit area for every trip for me. It's refreshing to get away from the bustle of people congregating in the Centrum, and sit down in one of the park's cafes.The park has all sorts of visitors, and really is a place for everyone to go, there is even a pair of White Cranes nesting there, if you can find them! It is also very well kept and generally clean.

A great place to take a run and escape while in Amsterdam.. Vondelpark is near Museumplein and the Leidestraat antique district. The park offers a great escape from the non-stop tourist buzz of Amsterdam. Early morning runs in the park were great. A good mix of running and typical Amsterdam cyclists move through the park. Finish with a belgian waffle in front of the I AMSTSTERDAM sign and your day is off to a great start.
Lovely. Lovely huge, wide open park.Beautiful huge ponds filled with a range of wildlife, lovely and clean throughout.

Very relaxing park. We arrived in Amsterdam early in the morning and wanted to find a place that was low key for the day. We ended up walking through Vondelpark. It is a large city park and in the middle of the park we found a coffee and sandwich shop with great sandwiches where we could relax and people watch in the park.

great big park. Walked through this park everyday during my stay into town and found it great. There is a very relaxed atmosphere with people out on bikes, people out running and people out for a stroll, great place for what ever you fancy :)

Nice place to bike ride. My wife and I rented bikes from the nearby "Mac Bike" rental stand and spent three enjoyable hours riding through Vondelpark and enjoying some downtime at one of the park's tea houses. Vondelpark is a well maintained urban park, full of activity, mostly folks on bikes enjoying one of the spots in Amsterdam where cars and motorized scooters are excluded. Amsterdam is one of the most bicycle friendly cities on the planet anyway, so it was doubly nice to be able to ride without being concerned about cars and trams.There are plenty of varieties of water fowl to view when hanging around Vondelpark. And like other public areas of Amsterdam, one can get a "contact high" just by breathing. :)
Bike through and enjoy the view. Better on sunnier days. Great people watching. Relaxing and scenic place to picnic, walk, or bike ride!
Great park. Great park to hang out and have lunch. Good people watching in a casual and scenic part of town.
A must...!. Lovely weather when we went. Beautiful park a stone throw away from Leidesplein.
An awesome city park. Lots of space for biking and walking. Great bird watching. Named for the great play write of the country. Very safe too.

A beautiful little park. As you walk along this long park, it changes character and function. It's a beautiful place for a walk and to see the Dutch (and the inevitable tourists, just like you) relaxing and playing.
Time out. If you want time out from the hustle & bustle of Amsterdam go to the Vondelpark for a stroll around lakes with great sculptures, wildlife & cafes.

Lovely park, great atmosphere. Vondelpark was lovely, a 5-10 minute tram ride from city centre, very laid back atmosphere would love to go there on a really hot day and lie on the grass watching the world go by!

Definitely worth a walk-through. Nice English-style park with very mixed vegetation. The residential areas lining the park are also a good idea for a promenade and give a very different feel than the city centre. Also suitable for cyclists.
Get away from it all. Large park in the museum area gives a welcome break from the bustle of Amsterdam. Great to walk around and if you hire a bike good for a gentle trek around.
leisure area. A nice place to relax. Saw people on 2 wheel carts and a lot of runners.
very nice park. big and calm with a nice big lac. very close to the center of the city
Beautiful Park. Lovely park to wander in for an hour or so,lots of people cycling, jogging and just going about there business.
Sunny day? Vondelpark. Popular by youth all over the world to hang around and meet other young people. Or older like me. :P
Great summer's day out.. Great summer's day out. Hire a bike and cycle around or pack a picnic basket and watch the world go by.

Gorgeous park!. We walked through this park to walk off a serious hangover, and boy it did the trick! There's loads of open space, full of people to sit and watch go by and no signs of loud stereos or offensive teenagers! Watch out for the cyclists and skaters though! Deadly!

Lovely green park almost in the middle of the city. Loved strolling around the park, people-watching and sitting in one of the cafes having a cool beer. Place to visit with a picnic - we stopped at a bakery just outside the park and sat on a bench enjoying our lunch.

A pretty park. Lots of water and flat, green spaces to hang out. More natural than the French style of gardens and parks. It would be a fun place to hang out with friends, but I don't think there's much to "see" there.

Great green space in the middle of the city. We visited the Vondelpark twice. The first visit was during a week day and there were a few mothers with young children. The second visit was on a weekend and all of Amsterdam was there. Very festive mood and everyone was enjoying the lawns, trees and warm weather.
Nice park with a little hippie touch. Lovely park with a great feel to it. There were some hippie type folks that were a little on my keep an eye on lisy but over all a nice park.
A green oasis at the center of the city. A green and peaceful retreat from the bustling canals

FUN FUN Park break for 10 year old. My 10 year old son saw this fort like play structure when our bicycle tour rode through this park. We found our way back by bus after the tour and he had the best fun. Very cool bridges and climbing structure. met up with some other kids around his age from Amsterdam and Canada. Defienely recommend you find it and take the kids!

Gorgeous Retreat. We took our bikes to Vondelpark, and we were pleased! We had a perfect day for a huge urban park -- 75 degrees F, not a cloud in the sky. We biked around the park; it has a great bike path that had plenty of space for both bikes and pedestrians. The park was full of city-dwellers enjoying a day in the sun -- thus, it was a great place to people-watch, too. The park was beautifully green with tons of lawns, benches, etc. A great retreat! Plan to spend an afternoon here during a visit to Amsterdam -- bike around the park and then have a picnic.
lovely!. Very pretty, lots of space to walk around in, nice way to spend a sunny afternoon. As with everywhere in Amsterdam beware of cyclists!

A big park. It's nice for running around, or having picnics, but when the weather is warm it becomes crowded... Amazing if you've never seen nature before, but otherwise you're better off riding 15 mins farther from center to an actual polder or windmill.

Great place to chill.... and escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. Gets about 10million visitors per year and Includes barbecue area and several small places to eat or grab a drink. Also provides a safe haven to run/jog with the main avenue providing a circular 2 mile route.

a chill out site in a city. Like Madrid the park is in the city and is well laid out with flowers, statues and plenty of tracks for jogging,cycling and grass areas for picnics and the like.just the spot to chill out for a visitor or break from work.It has a cafe in the prk which delivers good snacks etc.

Vondelpark. busier but still nice. I lived very close to the Vondelpark for almost 25 years. It was great way back then and to some extend still is. However it no longer has this sixties- everything-is-possible atmosphere. But, on Sundays afternoons in the summer there still are free concerts, varying from excellent groups to so so bands. Also on Friday nights and Saturdays there are concerts and/or other performances. Check the agenda.

Cafe in the Park. Went here early one sunny morning and bought a cheese and tomato toastie and a coffee at the cafe they have got there, very nice food and a really peaceful pleasant spot to relax in. Remember to have a table number for when you order so they know where to bring it to you.

A wonderful place to picnic and people watch. This park is beautifully done and cared for. It is quite vast and has some very nice cafes inside where you can grab a cup of fresh mint tea and people watch.
Peace and nature. Very good to visit in a sun shining sunday!! If you rent a bike in Amsterdam, don't miss this park!

Running safely. Our hotel was near this park and I went running in the morning around 7am. Very safe. Lots of other joggers and people on bikes. Very easy to run around, well marked and lovely scenery. If you are a walker there were lots of small cafes within the park itself.
Beautiful Park. This is a large and beautiful park located just outside the main attractions. You can go for a jog or mingle with locals there.
Just about ok. ITs just like a normal park in any other city, nothing special about it
Chilled out !. Spent a day here...lazing around the many ponds, cycling around the cycle tracks and relaxing on the terrace of the bar.

cool. go to a close food store, or a supermarket, get some wine, a grill maybe some food or snacks, a guitar or just a music player, and just go to the vondelpark with friends and chill out just for the fun of it. Awesome place to relax in the city of amsterdam
Very interesting. A great place to sit back and people watch. We brought a picnic lunch and enjoyed the scenery.

Great day in the Sun. Had a great day lounging around the park lots to see and good people watching they were building a large stage for live music that i think is happening every weekend up to end of Summer I expect so Im aiming to go back out and see one of the shows at least.
park. lovely park. packed with people due to lovely weather. nice place to people watch.
Excellent!. Go have a great time at Vondelpark! It's beautiful...
THE BEST PARK IN THE WHOLE WORLD!. If you go to Amsterdam you HAVE to stroll in the park. Preferably on sunny days: walk, cycle, skate, sunbathe, picnic, horseride... Do whatever you want!!!
Glorious park that rivals NYC Central Park.. The largest park I visited. The trees and ponds and trails were the largest of all the parks.
A walk in the park!. This was a very nice place for our morning walk. Stay on the walking paths (when available) and watch out for the people on bikes.
Clean and safe. The perfect weather helped, but having a lovely stroll through this beautifully maintained park was a high point for me. Just watch out for crazy bicyclists.

Little Piece of Heaven. My brother and I spent here 1.5 hours on a lovely Saturday, eating a sandwich near the lake, and then circling the entire park.
Many many people, playing, strolling just in the middle of the city. Perfect!

Lovely park to visit. What a beautiful park and so close to the city. We went for a walk through the park on a lovely sunny day. The park was a buzz with 100's of people having picnics, suntanning,roller blading,dog walking, playing and people watching The park is about 120 acres with 6 play areas and 1 large playground, it is lovely and green and has lovely flowers and trees. If you have the time it is worth going for a walk through the park.
Vondel Park. It's a beautiful place to walk, but be careful of the bikes. They have the right of way, and you can't always distinguish the bike lanes.

Mini Central Park. When visiting Amsterdam you must surely stop by the ondelpark. Especially on a sunny day. During the summer period there is free theatre, music and dance at the Condelpark Openlucht Theater. Visit www.openluchtheater.nl for more information.
Stresssss. I was on sunday and there was a lot of people...so much!! people with strong music and dirty....a lot of cyclesssss very stressss...
Great park!. Great park for an afternoon picnic. We bought food items at a local market and had dinner at the park. Anything goes in this park.
Great Park. Calm and quiet place.Rich nature.Be prepared to walk, because this park is huge.
Queens day. It was brillant to see how the park was transformed for queens Day...lots & lots of Things going on on the Day for all the Families.
Peace in the middle of the city. What a delightful spot.Ideal for walk away from the crowds.Enjoy a coffee and relax

Very busy in summer. The good thing about the park is there is a place to BBQ without getting into trouble. There is also a beautiful rose garden that is hidden but well worth looking for. With sculptures and soon the live music to start, this is for sure, a place to visit this summer.

Most go to if renting bikes. We were going to skip this park but it ended up being one of our favorite things to see. So beautiful and a great place to take a lunch or just relax by the ponds and fountains.

Clean and friendly park to have a wander about in. Park was very easy to navigate with obvious and less obvious paths running through it which made it wasy to follow but also easy to be seclouded but not lost. We found it to be very clean and also, like the whole of Amsterdam, very pleasant to be in.
Green Oasis near the centre. Really busy at the end of a hot day but beautiful greenery and relaxing after a big day of city walking.
vondelpark. beautiful, lovely sunshine and my amazing boyfriend definitely aided the beauty and ambiance of the place!
Lovely park. I really liked this park, really nice place to sit and enjoy the sunshine and the people passing by.

Ideal. Nice large park with something for everyone, bars, cafes, pool for kids, skate hire, street entertainers, privacy, lots to do and going on. Can get very crowded, watch out for the dog mess however on the grass.
Central park in Amsterdam. Park with small lake, many walking paths, flowers, etc in center of busy Amsterdam.

A beautiful respite. This park is conveniently located and has beautiful grounds. There are lots of walkers, joggers and dog walkers. A good number of birds enjpy the park and there are lovely plantings.
Lots of things to do. Loved the tulip displays, watched crane on its nest. Great nature.
Nice picknick-spot. Digg park med masse plass for privacy og chille picknicks.

Great park. Vondelpark is right in the city. It is large & has lake. Events take place here & we attended the annual event that coincided with Queen's Day. Young people come to play instruments or set out a blanket or table to sell their used toys. Great values and great fun. Some of the parents get a little too involved & think they will get their money back. They end up sitting in the sun all day & go back home with all their toys.
one of my favs. I make a point everytime im in amsterdam to bike through or set up a picnic.perfect location for a lazy day
Nice and quaint park. Center of city . Beautiful and some places well maintained . We saw tulip garden and beautiful sculputers . Place to rest and enjoy a stroll.
A haven in the hectic centre. Green, quiet and with the beautiful film museum, and the lovely cafe Vertigo next to it.
Nice place to chill. If you have rented a bike or are right close this is a wonderful park to just go do a bit of relaxing.
Great for small children. A great adventure playground and a good play area for younger children. Pleasant cafes and atmosphere and just space to run about or just relax.
Easy to find and so pretty. Pretty, Big, Open, and a countryside in the middle of a great city.
beautiful. If a sunny day, be sure to visit the park. Take time to walk and rest with the landscapes.
grean heaven. beautiful city park, used by families, couples, joggers, like a mini central park...in NY
Perfect for a picnic. If you've got good weather and fancy a quiet few hours take some snacks and chill out in this popular park. Great for people watching!!
Beautiful, Quiet. Near the Museumplein, this is a quiet and lovely park. Soothing place for a park bench lunch or just taking a break.
Great Park. A very nice park. Grab your shoes and go for a run, or rent a bike. Lots of locals hang out at this park.
Beautiful. Nice place to walk, people watch and get a bite and/or drink.
Gorgeous Park. Cold and overcast the day we were there, but enjoyed this wonderful park right in the middle of Amsterdam.
Must See and Enjoy. As a Central Park addict, I must admit that Vondel, on a quite different scale, of course, is superior in its mood of serenity and pace. Try it for yourself!
Peace, tranquility and dog love. Great, green space. Lots of locals enjoying themselves. The dogs are well behaved and it's a good place for a dog lover to visit. Just sit one bench and enjoy!
Nice Park. This is a welcome relief from the hectic pace of touring a big city. A great stroll where you can experience the local atmosphere and watch people enjoying life.

Nice green space. The park is a good breather from the populated city. Similar to the parks in England, we were lucky to still see some tulips.
Good area for bike riding and walks with dogs. Play area for children.
relaxing. amsterdam at its best! clean and well maintained park
Worth!. We have a good cycling to the park. The park is huge and less busy from city center. Lovely parrots, herons and coots.

Nice urban oasis. The park is a nice break from the bustle of the canal ring area. Well-maintained and well used, it's nice for a short stroll or half an afternoon spent relaxing. It's like many other inner-city parks around the world, so if you're short on time when visiting Amsterdam, you're not missing some unique experience by skipping it, but it's worth some time if you want to get a break from concrete.
a lovely place for a quiet walk. Across the road from our hotel. Like the rest of the city, watch forbicycles!
A stunning park in Amsterdam. It was beautiful and green, all the flowers were in bloom as it was spring time, bikes everywhere, beautiful lakes. So relaxing.
A great Afternoon. A great place to picnic after an afternoon walk to the museums.

Relaxing park in the heart of Amsterdam.. This is a beautiful park in the heart of Amsterdam. It is close to most of the museums, and a great place to bring a blanket and a pick nick basket. Worth a visit.
Huge. Nice place to walk and have a good time with your lover.

An oasis of calm.... Quick to get to from city centre and after ten minutes walking you are deep in amongst the grassland and trees of this lovely park. The local wild population of green parrots were a surprise!
A great walk!. We thoroughly enjoyed our walk through Vondelpark both mornings.

Vondelpark is a must!. Rent a bike, take a stroll around Vondelpark! Especially during a sunny day. On the weekends, you will witness the locals heading to Vondel with their disposable bbq's, beers and picnics ! Some also bring music, to dance around and create a nice atmosphere. Also a great place for joggers !However for food, there is only one cafe that is over priced/low quality food. Don't plan on eating there. Rather to grab some food at an Albert Hejn before to have a picnic, or eat before or after at a restaurant.

Great place to walk or run. I went for a long run in the park. Park was very easy to navigate and easy to run in. The park is simple and clean. It would be a nice walk for couples. Very nice green space.

Nice..if you have a lot of time in the city. I came here on a chilly, semi-drizzly day for a quick walk. It is a nice park in the middle of the city - kind of like Central Park in NYC (but seemingly less crowded). I would say my three star rating is somewhat biased in the sense that I was only here for a short trip and with so many things to see or visit in the city, spending too much time in the park didn't seem like the best use of time. Sure it's a nice park and on a nice day it's probably really nice, but with limited time, I wouldn't make it a top priority. (I spent about half an hour here)

An Amsterdam institution. Not the most beautiful park in the world ever, but longer-term or repeat visitors to Amsterdam should not miss this Amsterdam institution, whose mood and atmosphere changes depending on the type of weather or time of day.
Lovely city park. Nothing spectacular but you can walk through it to get to the Van Gogh museum
Nice green escape. nice place to get away from the crowds and noise - I brought my lunch and a book to relax
Clean park. Very pretty park. Clean...took lots of pictures here..
An unexpected delight. What a marvelous interlude on our pedicab tour. Just nothing you would expect in Amsterdam.
Lovely park in the city.Well worth a stroll or a picnic.. Lovely park in the city.Well worth a stroll or a picnic. Queensday here is a must.

A green and peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle. A green and peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle. Whenever we needed some quiet and peace from all the bicycles and trams, we took a walk in the park and bought a tasty ice cream from the beautiful vintage ice cream van.
Break form the buzzing city. Good park that give a break from the ever buzzing city life. Nothing really special except there are free flying parrots (green) living in the park!

parrots. the park is wunderful a perfect location to flee from the city.
and there are a lot parrots flying free.

the park just dressed in orange on queens birthday!!!! simply woawwww!!!!. beautiful park in this unigue city at this spring and on queens day full of people sitting and drinking all day and night all dressed in orange , thousand of people and tourists have passed to see this event through this huge park!!! a unigue experience while dancing, drinking and celebrating this special holland event!!!! amazing and special spring memory to remember!

Great to watch the world go by.. It's a park, so not much to see and do, but a great place for peace and quiet and great to watch the world go by. On Queen's Day when the whole of Amsterdam becomes a giant flea market the park is only for children to sell thier wares. Very easy to get to and great if you have just hired a bike and are a little wary of the roads.
Beautiful. This was a great park, so beautiful and peaceful. We had a pinic and it was amazing

A lovely stroll. Take a lovely stroll through Vondelpark, you will be surprised how many things are hidden in there! My favorite part was the lost and found "wall", where kind people who find lost items pin them up with clothespins for the owners to claim. Keys, hats, gloves, you name it, it was on the wall. Lovely flowers, fun playgrounds, great people watching....a nice relaxing place to be in Amsterdam.
I don't get the hype. Been there on a regula saturday and on queen day... The first time the place looked fake, the second one just like a huge flee marked...a regular park without any special taste
Good to pass by. It's good to spend some time there it's good and free

The park to visit in Amsterdam. You really feel in a bunch of nature while there.It is a very popular destination for Amsterdamers but it remains very pleasant to go there. It's easy to reach with trams.
Rlaxing Park. Really nice and worht strolling through. My son loved waking and jogging every morning during our visit. also, was perfect for renting a bike.
The best park in Amsterdam. This is an excellent place for park lovers, a beautiful park away from the city.
Disappointment. coming from a city with many parks, I found this one boring. Just people strolling around with nothing to look at
lovely park. cycled from one end to the other ,very peaceful and pleasant
Just down the street from our hotel and very nice.. Good area and worth seeing. We went in spring and there were lots of flowers out.
À beautiful park. A beautiful park in thé middle of thé city. À nice place to go afternoon à day of wallingant around thé city just to rest and look at all the bikes go be.

Lovely park. The Vondelpark is the main open space in Amsterdam and has a mixture of formal, planted areas and grasslands. There's also a canal on one side with lots of wildlife. There are two or maybe even three nice cafes - the Oude Melk Huis which does everything from snacks to full meals and the flying saucer shaped Blue Cafe which has a selection of drinks and snacks.

A Pleasant Walk. I took a pleasant walk through this park on my stay. The park is open with wide walkways. Still, be careful of bicyclists. They are everywhere and seem to have the right of way in most places. One cool feature I found that highlights the friendly pragmatic mindset of this culture is the "Findfence". If you find a lost item in the park, just clip it on the Findfence with the provided clips and the owner will have an easier time finding it.The scenery is classic architecture, a lazy river, trees, and the occasional sculpture. It is a popular park with many people. I highly recommend a stroll.

Its Green. A pleasant green area amidst the traffic and trams of Amsterdam - you still get the bicycles to dodge though. Flat and grassy with some small lakes I would not class it as an exciting park.
Walk or cycle through if you're nearby. Not a destination, but if you are in the area, it is a peaceful and pretty retreat.
Beautiful but... It's a lovely park beautifully set out but I wouldn't feel entirely safe there on my own.
must do in Amsterdam.. beautiful, take a bike ride. you won't regret it! Try the apple pie and cream at the cafe in the centre of the park. great way to waste a few hours.

Nice park. Certainly worth a stroll around, although not up to the standard of Regents Park or the like. Nice to sit and watch the varied cyclist, skaters, skate boarders, runners etc pass by if your there on a weekend. There are cafes so it's possible to sit and have food and drink while you enjoy the peace, not withstanding the (small number) of poor quality buskers. Some reviewers have said that cyclist can be a hazard. Well, if you keep to the paths and DON'T walk on the roads, you are pretty safe. If you do walk on the roads, keep to the left and don't wander around, otherwise....
Get away from the hustle. If you want to escape the tourist hordes and just enjoy some space and greenery then this is a great spot and like everything in Amsterdam close to the centre and museums.
Beautiful place!. It's great place to do sports, to walk with dogs or just to relax! :)
QUIET WALK. Not stunning but a pleasant area to walk in and plenty of room to help avoid the cyclists!

Green space. Not quite the park experience we expected, a green space but without the character of some other captial city parks. It would have been nice to have been able to hire a bike on the edge of the park, maybe we could have had some more fun and covered more than in our walk.

Get away from it all in the middle of Amsterdam!. The Vondelpark is a huge park in the centre of Amsterdam where you can while away many hours people watching or participate in many of the different activities - there are also some good places for a snack or a beer on a hot summers day.

Lovely park - watch out for bikes!. Lovely park, spring time in the sunshine makes it so picturesque.Just watch out for the flamin cyclists who do not give way, have the right to go where they like and do not care much for pedestrians!
Beautiful. This is a beautiful park to cycle or walk around. It is a must see when you are in Amsterdam - it feels like you have left the hussle and bussle of the city.
Stroll through city park. Nice average city park with paths for biking and walking. There are some fountains and bridges.
A lovely place for a walk. Don't bother drinking at the bar in the park over priced and with very poor service. The park is a lovely place to stroll round

Sunny park in March. A lovely open space within the residential area of Amsterdam, well-served by trams; full of locals (but not overcrowded) enjoying a Sunday afternoon in the spring sun, meandering paths and spring flowers. Large open air restaurants, very relaxed atmosphere. We'd hire a bike and explore the further reaches if we went again
Oasis of calm. This is an excellent place to recharge on a Sunday morning, before your flight home, and after you've overdosed on culture and pounding the streets

Quintessential Amsterdam park. Amsterdam has lots of beautiful parks but for some reason everyone goes to this one. At the first sign of sunlight thousands and thousands of locals and tourists stream into the park to walk, roller skate, or just sit down in the grass and enjoy the sun and the relaxed atmosphere. Back in the sixties people used to even sleep here at night but that's no longer advisable.
Lovely stroll in the park. My husband and I enjoyed a stroll around the park during the spring tulip season. unfortunately it was really cold and we couldn't stay as long as we wished.
"Nice if you've got time burn". Nice for a bike ride on a sunny day, quite busy after 6pm weekdays with cyclists and fitness fanatics. Plenty of space to relax and sit with friends.
Easy to lose yourself here. I caught myself lost in my thoughts while wandering the Vondelpark which also meant I got lost a few times. Very tranquil place in the middle of the city.

The perfect place for a joint. This park is excellent, well cured and perfect for a calm and relaxing walk. Find a quite spot, take out your instruments, your Super Lemon Haze from Greenhouse and enjoy this moment. Eating at that bistrot by the lake is a must.Top tip: Don't smoke if there are children around, you may have troubles
Great Park. Great park in the centre of Amsterdam but if you have a bird phobia stay away from certain areas.
love the parakeets. 200o ring neck parakeets living wild in the park, stunning

An asset to the city. We had the benefit of the option to walk from our accommodation through the Vondelpark each day to get to the city. This is an excellent park. Be inspired by the number of runners on the trails too.

Great fun people and dog watching. Gorgeous park with cafes to sit and sip and watch the world go by. Serious Dutch cycling home in swarms at 6 pm in their work clothes, the lycra mob and lots of dogs having fun with their owners

Lovely relaxing environment, even with bikes!. Lovely park, nice to relax and take a stroll there on a good day, has a cafe, looked good but didn't try it this time and play areas for kids, some flower beds too.

Take time to visit the Vondelpark!. This is a beautiful and expansive park in the museum district. Loads of cyclists, joggers and walkers enjoying the pleasant surroundings, lovely ponds and nice birds - we saw, among others, several rose ringed parakeets and grey herons. We only wish the weather had cooperated a bit more so that we could have explored it further.

Nice place to relax, walk or bike. Wish we had more parks like these back home! Vondel park is a great park with a dedicated bike and walk trail. It's a flowing sea of humanity. People walking, biking, kids nplaying, hippies smoking in the grass... Good place to people watch.
Nice for a bicycle ride. Really cool on a nice sunny day.. We went around itby bicycle and it was really nice. The restaurant called Vertigo located inside the park is quite expensive..
Lovely Walk. from our hotel we walked through the park to the city centre it took only twenty minutes lovely park.
Beautiful park!. An oasis in the middle of the city! Watch out for the bikes...

Away from a citys noise.... We hired bikes for visiting Vondelpark, a great idea to see it all, the park is huge! Wonderful place to go away from the busy busy centre, with musicians and parks, it's a really lovely place.
Busy park, beware of dog's poo. A busy park where you are likely to get run over by a bicycle if you don't keep your eyes and ears open. Quite a lot of dog's poo so be careful where you walk

Beautiful Park. I took a stroll through this park, and it was as if I was walking through a painting. Watch out for bikes in general in Amsterdam, but here especially!
Highly recommend!
A Lovely Park. A very popular park with cyclists, walkers and dogwalkers. Well worth a visit if you are in town for more than a weekend.

Bikes are a menace. We didn't enjoy our walk in the Vondelpark because the bikes were coming from all directions and made it impossible to relax! At 10.30am in the morning Vertigo did not look inviting, we went elsewhere for breakfast.
Great on a sunny day. was really nice to see another side of Amsterdam. you cvan get very close to some of the local wildlife too. Herons and parakeets are abundant.
People and stork watching!. Great big park to stroll round, watch all the people, picnic and generally relax. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

Beautiful. We stumbled across this beautiful park whilst taking a last look at the city before we left to go home. Be careful of all the bikes though as they seem to use this park as they do the roads, dangerously! So stick to the grass.
Parrots!. A lovely central green space with parrots, herons, moor hens and coots.
beautiful part of the city. quiet, great cafe, bikes at rush hour worth seeing
love the wildlife. Took a pic of the herons and parakeets and nice for a stroll. Loads of space for children to run about.

A real oasis in the chaos of Amsterdam. This is one of those city parks that make you feel you are no longer in the city with trees, lakes, flowers and wildlife. Can get busy during the sunshine, but there are always areas of the park away from the crowds. Some concession stands and a couple of café/restaurants - all catering for the tourists though rather than the foodie. However, if the sun is shining, go - you will not be disappointed.

Amsterdam's Central Park. Huge park in Amsterdam. Only rode a bike thu it while on a bike tour but it was cool. Would be a good place to exercise, have a picnic, or smoke a doob. Very safe at all hours of the day.
Tranquil and beautiful. A lovely respite from the busy City of Amsterdam. Great wildlife. We stood very close to a Heron. We also saw Parakeets in the trees.
Beautiful. Nature in the city. One of my favorite places in Amsterdam.We rented a bike and cycled throught the Vondelpark-AMAZING experience! Green nature, bikes and dogs - a wonderful combination.
pretty, watch out for militant cyclists. nice city park, cyclists are rampant though.good to take a break from the city

Simply A Park.... We went for a walk in the park and quickly realised that this park is very simple and has nothing special in it. In other major European cities, the main park are usually amazing and offer a lot. This one just doesn't... I would recommend going only if you have spare time and a sunny day.

Nice oasis in the midst of the city.. We wandered thru' this rather large park while visiting the city. It's a very nice place to perhaps sit and have a picnic lunch, to enjoy the sunshine, to listen to music and people watch. The noises of the city seem to disappear once you're a bit inside. It was early spring yet and so not in its full glory, but still a nice retreat.

Our favourite Amsterdam haunt. There is so much to do in Vondelpark. In 10 days, I don't think we saw it all. Highly recommend renting bicycles for a ride through the park. Stop for ice cream, play at the playground ro even just people-watch. An excellent spot for photographs.
Pretty. On a warm day this is a wonderful walk and a good picnic place
Nice and peaceful. Its a park. What more do you want? Clean, tidy, tranquil =)
Amazing. Lovely spacious area, playing football, listening to the Rasta's playing their guitars and singing, and joining in with them!!!
Nice park. This was the paradise of our kids, aged 4 and 5. Great playgrounds in this park!!
Vondel Park. Amsterdam would not be the city it is without Vondel. Miles of paths, nice restaurants, buskers etc...

Great jogging route. If you're trying to figure out how to get a good run in while in Amsterdam without getting run over by a tram or a bicycle, this place is your answer. A beautiful setting surrounded by mansions, this place has nicely groomed trails and is peaceful and free of traffic. Just keep the fence on your right and do as many laps as you need. One outer-loop lap = 3.3km.

Great way to spend an afternoon. We visited the park during summer, and actually spent a lazy afternoon people watching. We also walked through the park on another occasion. It's beautiful with lakes, plenty of lawns, seating, trees and flowers. For us it was a nice way to observe Dutch culture while getting some sunshine and relaxing. Well worth a visit.

Rode through Vondelpark and loved it. I road through Vondelpark during the last part of Mike's Country-Side bike tour and loved it. Wished we could have stopped to take pictures but all in all it was great. I would love to spend a nice summer day there, basically equivalent to New York's Central Park.
beautiful park!. Beautiful park! The weather was beautiful, the daffs were up & it's close to the museum plane.
Nice Park. It's a really nice park and up the road is the Heineken museum - what could be better?>!
pleasing quiet. enjoyable early morning stroll.Our friends who stayed two days longer than us found it less tranquil later in the day that they revisited for an evening stroll

Nice park for a stroll. This is a great park on a sunny day and a nice nature spot on a cloudy and cold day. Always filled with people, it makes Amsterdam seem lively. Good to get exercise in nature without having to go too far out of town.
This is a bit disappointing!. Not much there excpet shrubs and water, The main attraction was a pair of storks nesting.
Good for cycling. Visited on a sunny, calm afternoon and loved the very relaxed atmosphere of the place. This would be a good place to go cycling safely round the cafes.
Beautiful and so much to do. Definitely one of my favorite places in Amsterdam. Go to watch people, rollerblade, bike, picnic, bbq, have a beer...it's all there.
great place for kids. great place to rent bikes and ride in the park lots of playgrounds for kids

Nature in the City. This is the place to enjoy the sun and nature with all the locals.
A relaxing respite.
Pretty, accessible getaway. Nice setting, very clean, easy to access, sit, walk, bike, relax.
Nice. It's nice but nothing special. No gardens or different decoration...just an ordinary park, but a nice place to ride a bike or walk a dog.

Visiting Vondelpark. We stopped at Vondelpark for a small break from the walking. Enjoyed the overall walk even though had to be careful for the bikes that passed by. It was full of people but nice area to take pictures and relax.
most relaxing green space in amsterdam. take a walk or just stay on the grass with a glass of wine. one of my favourites places in amsterdam to relax ina sunny afternoon

Classic "Day at the Park". I spent most of a cool, sunny spring afternoon at the Vondelpark. I was joined by masses of people doing the same thing, yet we all had our own space. This large park has restaurants/outdoor cafes, ponds, open fields surrounded by trees, a concert shell, and plenty of paved trails for bikes (and bikes there are- galore!!). It is a perfect way to spend a lazy afternoon taking in the sun with friends and family or to just relax and enjoy the splendid people watching!

Beautiful .. A must go to!. Nothing bad i can say bout this place... Beautiful, clean, great walk or bike run around on a sunny day.
Cant take a bad picture ... Beautiful is an understatement!
A must visit!! Even if ur not a park lover, you will convert.
Excellent Park. Nice - quiet and great park it's nice place to get refreshed.
Great place to run and bike.. Took a couple runs and bikes through this park in the mornings and evenings. Very beautiful park! Felt very safe.
A breath of fresh air. A wonderful place to stroll to get away from the hustle and bustle of the traffic.
Nice place on a sunny day. We had a picnic lunch here after visiting the Concertgebouw.
Great Park!. We saw the blues til sunrise where the park was all blue. Awesome!!
Good to cycle around and picnic. Gives a much needed brake for cyclists who are not used to the mania of Amsterdam!

Great in august. Okay, the size is not central park, but this works for amsterdam. The hippies used to come here in the sixties, i think. Just like the city, its a free attitude kind of park. In winter not much to look at, but beautiful in summer. Its also verrrry crowded, the spot just at the edge of the park where the museum is situated has 2 restaurants and chillin' out here with friends is delicious!!! Great atmosfere, relaxed and typically amsterdam-ian, dont miss it while being here for a visit. Sundown is beautiful to watch from here. The park does close at certain hours at night, changes from summer to winter etc. Opening times are marked at the gates.

Love this place!. I have been here before but I didn't get great weather. Been here today and the weather was amazing. Were hired bikes and cycled the park a few times. Great scenery! Also if I had my running gear it would be an ideal and pleasant place to train! Will remember that for next time. We also enjoyed lunch in one of the parks restaurants! We ate on the terrace in the sun overlooking the lake. Really nice place for cyclists,runners, walkers and families. Will be returning again! :)

Nice and calm during winter.. A nice, beautiful and calm place inside Amsterdam: small bridges, not so many fast bike riders, a few runners and, the most important: peace all around. Perfect place for slowing down.

nice open space in a tightly packed city. it was a nice break in the otherwise hustle bustle city of amsterdam, a green space that allowed a bit of space for people to lie on the grass or to throw a ball for their dog. Would be nicer in the spring I guess, it was a little cold in march and the trees were only beginning to bud. Otherwise clean and had plenty or seats and rubbishbins

Green Heart of Amsterdam. This is Amsterdam's answer to Central Park - not only a beautiful park with ponds, lakes, paths, trees and flowers, it is the heart of Amsterdam. Take a stroll through Vondelpark on a sunny day, and you are bound to have a heartwarming experience. Dutch people literally blossom on sunny days, and they all seek the happy, laidback, groovy vibe of Vondelpark in the spring and summer months. Smiling people of all ages and backgrounds, relaxing on the grass, eating lunch, having picnics, drinking beer, playing guitar, playing games, singing songs, smoking joints, reading books, jogging, kids and dogs running around, all enjoying the gezelligheid of Amsterdam. Look up in the trees, you'll spot the green parrots, which have taken Vondelpark to be their home. This is the safest, coziest, coolest and most vibrant part of town on a warm, sunny day. Don't miss it!
Central Park. Central park in A-dam, lots of wildlife and many people when sun comes out too, good place for BBQ-ing and ppl spotting
Pleasant place for a relaxed walk or cycle ride.. The cafe was a welcoming place to warm up and did a great hot chocolate, look out for the cat snuggled up on the counter.
Nice big park but watch out for the bikes!. Nice big park in centre of Amsterdam. Lots of areas to relax, walk the dog or just have a nice walk.
ok for a walk, or picnic. Was a very nice park but not much else to this.Great if you are in a group to have a picnic and just chill out.

Very green piece of amsterdam. A very big and green park in the middle of Amsterdam centre. It was a great pleasure to walk around in this park. Quite a few people hire a bike and bike through the park. Nice place for a picnic
very good and loved the canal boats. very good to walk though and canal boats are to good to sight see

Very beautiful. Very pretty park set in the middle of town. We were there in February and the trees were still bare but beginning to blossom because of the warm winter. Still pretty but would probably be gorduous in summer.
Awesome!. rode through the park on a bike. Great scenery! Great photos! and it's all inside the city!!

Nice place to sit or play near Rijksmuseum. We wondered through the park to find a children's play area so our two-year old could run around. We found one which entertained him with a sand pit, climbing frame and giants-causeway-type stones.There's lots of bikes in the park and on a sunny day it would be nice place for a picnic or just to while away the hours reading!

Great historic Park.. The Vondelpark, named after the famous Dutch poet Joost van den Vondel, is one of the most beuatiful parks in Amsterdam. Great for walking, cycling, rollerskating or blading. Walking, or even sleeping on the lawn is allowed. Dog friendly. A must see.
Lovely to walk or ride through. The day I went was a soggy summer day, a bit of a shame. It was a nice city park, and should be experienced.
Vondelpark. Really nice park, big with a few places to eat & drink, a big lake as well as streams. A nice place to cycle, walk or go for a run, does get very crowed on hot summer weekends

Great to sit in the summer. we Passes hours away sitting here in the summer. Take a picnic and if you smoke take some pre=rolled. Just be respectful of others who may not want there kids seeing things like that. Do that and you'll more than likely be left alone. Just dont be a clown and jump about like an idiot.
A nice park to spend your Sunday. When you get tired of the ways of Amsterdam, take a nap on Vondelpark's grass.
Hire a bike. We hired bikes. It cost 8 euros fo 3 hours. Cycling around the park was great fun and much safer than cycling in the streets of Amsterdam!

A lovely park like Central Park. This is a lovely park and a short walk from the Leidseplein, it is filled with grand trees and there's lots happening when it's warmer, there's cafes and people sunbathing all over the place it's very colorful, peacefull and relaxing. A Beautiful Park and Quite large.

Mansion gawking.. In March, with no greenery and bare trees, the highlight of the park were the huge homes and apartment buildings that skirt the park. I can only imagine that in the other three seasons this park will be gorgeous.
Great, but small. On par with many of the world's great parks, aside from the smaller size. It definitely has the locals, the paths, the hidden gems, but you just hope for more. Still worth a loop.

Lovely Spot. Even in gloomy February this place was lovely... just the perfect escape from the hustle & bustle of A/dam. In the summer I would imagine a blanket on the grass beside the lake, a bottle of red, bread & cheese.... Luxury!!
Beautiful. It was lovely to walk through, can imagine that it is fantastic in the summer
A walk in the Park. Just around the corner from our Hotel, a peaceful place to pass an hour or so, enjoying unexpected peace and tranquility.

Nice and green park amidst central places. This park must be a very nice place for picnis in summer days. A nice, big and green park amidst all the restaurants, casino and bars. One can walk through this park to the other part of Amsterdam or hire a bicycle to ride on.

It was just another park to me. I saw nothing diffrent with this park, there were loads of seats and statutes. Only problem is all the bikes and people walking thier dogs off the leads so trying to play dodgems was fun!
Lovely!. Deer feeding, children's play area....great for family time!

Great place for a run. Our apartment was close to Centraal Station which was 1.2 miles from the park. Between 7 AM- 9 AM the side walks and streets are empty enough to run at a brisk pace to park with only occasional stops for trams. A loop of the park using the outer sandy path is approx 2.5 miles.
