Shopping Shopping Shopping. I really enjoyed this area. I walked so much until my legs started to hurt. lol
Lots of Bikes!!. A beautiful stroll in the park fabulous to see all types on their bikes with babies and dogs in the front!

Beautiful Strolls through Vondelpark. Vondelpark is huge and cuts right through the residential neighborhoods. It was close to our b&b (Annette's) so that was the route we chose to walk through to get to the city center. Ponds, bicyclers, restaurants overlooking the park and ponds - it was just beautiful. It reminded us a bit of walking across Brooklyn Bridge amongst walkers and cyclers, but quite a bit calmer.
great for a run early morning..... .....Im an amateur runner and enjoyed few 10k runs in chilly (4o C degrees) mornings.....
GREAT FOR A BIKE RIDE. nice park, went on bikes and had a nice hot chocolate in the cafe, really good thing to do in the morning!
Lovely. Peaceful, relaxing and a great way to spend an afternoon. It's perfect for hiring bikes and going for a picnic.
Nice. liked watching people riding on their bikes and using the bikes to ferry their children and dogs about. One negative dogs dirt on paths.

Beautiful, tranquil and just lovely. We visited on a very snowy Sunday and the park looked gorgeous. We were able to see Dutch families playing ice hockey on the frozen lakes and snuggled up with a hot chocolate in one of the park's cafes.
A must do in Amsterdam

Watch out for dogs!. Sadly, Vondlepark was a bit muddy and dreary in February.This is a shame because there are not many open green spaces in Amsterdam. Lots of dogs and lots of cyclists. In fact, if i went back I would hire a bike and join them!
Bit cold for the park. We could imagine it would be beautiful in the summer, but not worth braving for the winter months

Sunday morning stroll in a cold drizzle. Stretched the legs for a brisk stroll (is there such a thing as a brisk stroll?) round the park. Not as big as expected, but sufficiently interesting features and nice paths. It was cold and slightly drizzly, but good weather for some brisk work-out.
pretty but watch out for the cyclists!. check out the café in the middle, they do lovely sandwiches and draught beer.

A great park. It is a great escape from the city and a very beautiful park. I recommend it if you are looking to have a nice walk and a leisure afternoon. I wouldn't put it though on the must see list of Amsterdam.

Nice Break from the Cobblestones. We took a walk through the park looking for the "famous" Vondelpark cafe we'd read about. It turned out that the cafe was more of a children's party location, but it was still fun to see. Plus, when you walk up through the park you get to see a totally different part of town. Definitely would recommend taking a stroll through the park.

Looks great nice central cafe too. Its a nice and safe park very, very Narrow yet long so you can enjoy a nice walk. The central pond is charming with wonderful trees, recommended on a ( rare) sunny and warm day the colors of the greens truly emerge then
Great park!. Great park, worth the visit close to the square of museums!

great place for running. This is my favorite running spot in Amsterdam.Coming here early in morning when the place is amost empty, you can watch the city waking up: Morning joggers, people on their way to work riding their bicycles and mothers pushing baby trollies.As others said, this is a park. There is nothing really attractive about this place except for the atmosphere and the green lung in the middle of the city.

calm area. It's a calm place in the centre of Amsterdam. It's really a nice place to sit and walk around. The park is located in the south of Amsterdam, and it's easy to reach with public transport( Leidseplein is really close by). It's really busy here on a sunday, so the best time to come is maybe during the week. During my stay the weather was not so good, and the park was a little bit wet and muddy.

great park. This park is amazing..... It's a very big park and it was just across our B&B. We would go everyday but on Sunday was awesome, people Bar-Quing, playing and I would recommend taking your blanket and relax, its amazing.
It is a nice, airy park, perfect for a stroll. The only downside was that you can't escape the bicycles, although there is more space to avoid being crashed into!
Just a park. It is simply a park nothing special.A gulp of fresh air and silence in the city.

Lovely in good or bad weather. So big! Weather your on foot or a bike, Vondel Park is a nice place to rest while your out and about. Great in the sun to sit on grass and watch ducks in the ponds and have a lil picnic =)

This is the most beautiful park I've ever been to. It's like taking a step back into the 60s set against one of the most beautiful park settings I've ever seen. Great for relaxing in the grass and people watching. Make sure to bring a camera!
Nice Park in the City. Huge park that is beautifully landscaped in the heart of the city. Best way to see it all is to ride a bike!

Parrots home. we watched parrots flying with each other, communicating, in grey rainy days with their colored appareance. It is a very nice park, lovely greens, lakes, groups with happy dogs, any kind of birds, summer must be a small paradise there!
If it's sunny, go to Vondelpark. Real Amsterdam! A wonderful spot to people watch. Rent a bike and ride through or just take a stroll, especially if the sun is out, then everyone will be out.

Great for a run. Did an interval session around the park. It is not huge, about 2.5miles around, but the flat, dirt surface is good for short intervals and much better then the rest of the brick sidewalks (footpaths) around the city.
Nice park in the middle of Amsterdam. You should visit this park on a sunday morning. It's not that big. The people of Amsterdam use it for running, relaxing ad playing with their kids.
For grasshoppers. Good to walk with your dog. Or when the weather is good,, just lie douwn in the grass.

A breath of fresh air on the edge of the old town. This is Amsterdam's Central Park without the smelly horse and carriages - good choice Amsterdam.
It is great for a 3k run or an hours stroll and has coffee and play facilities for the wider audience, the only downside is that it gets busy in the summer at weekends.
Take a picnic, a football and friends for a great afternoon.
A must. Very nice place, beautiful people during the best days even in Winter time. I recommend
Relaxing park. I really loved this park, i took nice photos, there are lots of birds in this park, like rose ringed parakeets and much more. I must go again in summer to enjoy lying on the grass

nice. nice park, full of bird life.
nice surrounding area to the east of the park - lots of shops and restaurants
Crowded. The park is covered in locals drinking and throwing their trash everywhere. It wasn't a nice relaxing walk. You were running into people everywhere you went and into their smoke clouds.
Amsterdam central park. You can have your own BBQ here. Bring a botlle of wine and some beers and enjoy all the people biking through Amsterdam
Beautiful. Lovely park, lovely coffee shop/restaurant called 'Die Melkhuis' which serves a very tasty 'Koffie Verkeerd' which is a Latte.

Nice park in the middle of centre amsteram. It is nice to see a spacy green park with nicely built enterances and people walking or cycling through the park. It must be very fine to visit this place when it is sunny and warm. The central place leidseplein is at a stone throw distance from this park and it is full of restaurants and bars. Holland casino is also very near to this place.
wonderfull park. wonderfull park in the middle of Amsterdam centre, with all different tourist and grazy people.

Beautiful park. Amazing on a sunny day in spring or summer. You will find a lot of locals here just hanging out, enjoying what little sun Holland gets. Barbequeing in the park is now limited to certain areas unfortunately, but a picnic in the parc on a beautiful day is definitely recommended.

in the heart of the city. What a pleasant surprise as we walked around the city to discover tree-lined Vondelpark ... lovely even in winter ... and then be right back in the Art District as we came out from our bit of nature walk in the park.

enjoy during the day. sitting on my balcony for coffee and looking out over the park and its flowers. gave space gave peace until the night comes and people are having drinking/sex parties in the park. should be closed during the night to prevent vandalism and drugs/alcohol. the day time is the best and people enjoy the grass the paths.

Countryside in Amsterdam. We took our 1 year old to this park and were amazed at the selection of wild-life within the park. We saw parakeets, stork nesting, woodpeckers. magpies, various species of duck we had never seen before, swans and many other birds. It was wonderful to see this within the City and to make it perfect we had blue skies and complete calm! Apart from the cyclists and joggers of course! There were also plenty fo places to stop for a snack or drink and when our grand-daughter gets older there were many play areas for the children too.
nice park. Beautiful park to walk in it or run there is a nice lake in the park I like to stay near the lake and feed the bird.

Lovely place to relax. A very nice park in summer and winter alike. It is situated in a posh neighbourhood and it was constructed late 19th century.It is nicely laid out and especially in the summer a good place for biking, rollarblading, walking or just sitting around. Unfortunately with the new prim and proper policy of Amsterdam's labour party governance, there is a crack down on drinking beer in the park.Smoking pot and snorting coke apparenlt is tolerated, but sit down with a beer and you can expect to be bothered by cops.Nevertheless a nice place to be, to sit and enjoy and do people watching.If you have time, walk all the way to the end of the park, it is more dense there and less people. I know that some time ago there still was a farm there with cows, but not sure if it still is operational.Visit the following attractions:Vondelparkpavillion dated 1881. Italian renaissance style. It houses the Film museum and café-restaurant Vertigo.De Muziektent (The band stand) dated 1874.Het Openluchttheater (Open air Theatre) dated 1955. Free shows during the summerHet Blauwe theehuis (The Blue Teahouse) dated 1936Het Melkhuis (The Milking House) dated 1874. Once part of the farm that was still in the park, it houses a playground for kidsHet snoephuisje (The Candy House) dated 1927 at the back entrance on Amstelveenseweg, built in Indonesian style

Lovely park. I just love this park.It was cold when i visited and i didn't enjoyed it as much as i could.My boyfriend who is a photografer took great photos and we wish to visit again during spring and stroll around with bicycles.
lovely park and free. a great way to spend a few lazy hours with my boyfriend, went a few times just to wonder round. very nice change from busstle of city life.
Dull. Not much to do or see, but would be good if you want to go for a run.
sunny day in Vondel Park in Heaven On earth. sunny day on a bicycle in the park ,doesn't get better , many cafes and ponds to relax by , art and calm is your to be had :)
Fun for the family. Grat for some exercise , fresh air and fun for all the family

Was expecting much more. i was vey dissapointed with this park, i was expecting something similar to Jardin de Luxemborg but it wasnt pretty much like any other parks...nothing to see, no flowers...maybe i went at the worn gtime

Nice getaway in the middle of the city. Vondelpark is a must visit in Amsterdam, whether you are walking around or on a bike. There are amphitheaters for music concerts, a movie theater for special screenings, nice cafes and eateries for refreshments, lots of pathways for you to choose your own route through the park. Nice place to sit in the sun (when it is out) and read a book if you want to rest a bit during your trip through the city. You will forget that you are in the middle of a city, with the expansive greenery in the park. Definitely one of my favorite weekend haunts.
Very Relaxing. I walked through here early one evening and really enjoyed it. The trees are huge and there are plenty of places to sit and relax. Grab a coffee and just wander through the park.
Open Space. Nice place to go for a walk and feel a bit of open space after being in the city. Very close to tram.

Be Dutch- go to Vondelpark. This is THE park in Amsterdam. As soon as any sun comes out, the Dutch rush there, just to have a picknick and enojoy life out of the busy city life. One can eat there as well as do some sports or watch others do it: it is like a little village within the city.It is a very relaxing place, though can get crowded when the temperatures rise.

Best place for a picnic on a sunny Amsterdam day. Vondelpark is great. There is a lot of space to picnic, play frisbee/soccer (football), bike and rollerblade. It is a great place to spend a day or an afternoon when the suns finally comes out on a beautiful day. Dont forget a blanket!

A nice escape from the crowds. The park is good to escape from the crowds and for a quiet drink. Although the main cafe , is in need of some development but was pleasant just to sit with the locals and wartch the world go by.

Nothing special. Been several times, and always at Queensday. Last time there was lots of mesh screens up. The council also seem to have ruined the park on Queensday with virtually no live music anymore. Do they really think those who don't live on the doorstep are likely to buy any of the junk people offer for sale? Not even a band on the band stand!!
Good the de-stress. Lovely park for unwinding after busy city days doing touris "stuff". Safe surroiundings also.
So beautiful!. Rent a bike and go around this park. So much fun!!!
huge downtown park with social scene & family relaxation. Grass, trees, water features & lots of people hanging out. An awesome city park to lunch, snack, meet friends, relax or ride bikes.

Lovely city park where you can escape. Not large by the standards of some cities but a great little park with plenty of water. My visit was on New Years Day to get over the night before and it did just that. There are cafe restaurants within the park to stop and lunch or have a drink

beautiful even in winter!. My husband and I always visit Vondelpark each visit to picnic and people watch. At Christmas time it was a different experience once again as the ice skating and activities were set up. It was beautiful but extremely busy at that time of year so beware of pick pockets in this area - just like Centraal, lots of tourists.
our short visit to Vondelpark. We didnt see all the park as time was short but what we saw we really enjoyed , a great place to walk and relax away from the crowds .

Stunning park. This wonderful park has parakeets living wild in it. When we went, we seen lots and lots of them. It also has beautiful ponds where all kinds of bird life live. I would highly recommend it for those interested in birds.
The park has many, many scenic places to sit and plenty of open space for children or pets.

Take a break in a really hot summer day at Vondelpark. It is the central park of the Dutchies, and we love our park. It is a reference point, a nice place to have a break, to jog, to chat, to have lunch, to have a BBQ. It is gezellig! However, be very careful with pickpockets and never leave your stuff out of sight. Although is very safe, do not go late at night, there are strange night creatures (junkies) wandering and asking for some coins...

walk through Vondelpark. walking in a park isn't normally something I look to do when in a foreign city. But we happened to walk right passed an entrance one evening so we detoured into it. Glad we did. It was lovely, tranquil, clean and a welcome respite from the manic crowds in Amsterdams central area. It's not high on my recommendation list but certainly someplace to consider visiting for a little break from the city crush and if you've got children with you then it is definitely worth a visit to give them room to run and play.
largest park in Amsterdam, used to be the free place for free people. ... but rarely anyone is sunebathing topless anymore, city has strict rules about noise, but you can still smell the free spirit
Beautiful park. next to a posh neighborhood, very nice park. would love to bike around it. good picture place
Very relaxing and great to see so many interesting people. Amsterdam has it, that is for sure. The park is a great relaxing place with nice benches and restaurants to see the world go by
Lovely and relaxing. It was lovely to walk through this park in the morning and see herons and beautiful birds all around!

Green haven in the city. If you want to get away from the hussle of city life then just take a nice stroll in the park or hire some skates. In the summertime there are free concerts and theatre shows (like cabaret, stand-up comedy etc). People are having their birthday parties there. It's just a very nice place to hang out.
Huge greenspace in the city. Lots of roller bladers, including a posse of costumed superheroes, and cyclists.

A break from the hustle and bustle of the city. Went with five 7 friends in December. Lots of lovely trees and lakes to look at. Stopped at a cafe for some amazing hot chocolate and mulled wine before we followed the trail around the park. A particular hightlight for us, being the child-like people we are, was the wooden bridge structure that we climbed and took photographs from. One should not visit Amsterdam without a visit to the park.
Walk Through the Park. This "in-city" park is pleasant and walker friendly.

Fun in the Sun. During the summer months there is almost always a carnival like atmosphere in the Vondelpark. There always seems to be music playing (there is an open air theatre which has various music events on from June until August), there are several food vendors and places to get coffee or beers and beautiful park land to explore. You are likely to see ring-necked parakeets in the park too. It’s a lovely place to enjoy the sunshine.

A big and beautiful park. We walked and cycled through this park and it was much more fun on a bike but equally as beautiful. It was always full of cyclists, joggers and dog walkers, and it seemed like a very family friendly place to be. I bet in the summer it is a lovely place to relax and have a picnic but in December I don;t think it was quite the right temperature for a picnic but it was great to cycle round all wrapped up.
Lovely change from the city. We found this park easily from the tram stop. Even though we visited in winter it was lovely to walk around and feed the ducks.

In spring or summer this is the place to be!. This is the place to meet the locals.In summer time it seems everyone is at the vondelpark, sunbathing, picnicking, listening to music or sipping wine. And there's a lot of rollerblading, skateboarding and (of course) cycling too!

Great park for a sunny day. The park is a real city park, it is divided into two parts and it is quite big and green. When we were there the we just sat there for a while, a nice relaxing atmosphere... We didn't try the restaurant, we just walked a bit, sat a bit and enjoyed the weather and for that it is perfect (but crowded).
Beautiful Park. We ate at Vertigo's which is an awsome restaurant.
Great place to escape to. Lovely part of the city to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

Whats The Hype About?. We visited Vondel Park in July, being it was very hot we expected a lot of people to be chilling out there, but this wasnt the case. Also there was nothing there really, bit boring and its a fair bit out the way cost us about 15euro to get there in one of those bike cabs. We havent hurried back!
cold and stark. freezing fog so not good to be outside. Film museum not as hoped and cafe very expensive and although told waiter I am vegetarian was given a ham sandwich.Not impressed.

Very Beautiful Park. Whenever I am in Amsterdam, I never miss an opportunity to walk through Voldelpark. This park is very beautiful, even in winter. Well maintained. It is especially pretty in the spring and summer.
Amsterdam's central park. Amazed to see this park despite the city's true lack of space. It is a respite from all the colors that is Amsterdam.
tourist central. tourist central, but the film museum terrace is great for people watching!
Lots going on, great for kids.. Places to eat, play, wander, watch wildlife, locals etc.

Nice Park. It was a little cold and overcast when we went (not exactly park weather) but it was still nice. I'm sure if you go in the summer when all the plants are in bloom it would be really nice. If you typically enjoy being outdoors, you'll like this park. Lots of dogs playing, a big tree house to explore. Good place to be if you're looking to relax and be away from all that's going on in the streets.
Not really a park. A small greenish area in Amsterdam but poorly maintained; no flowers, shrubs of any note.

Great place to while awy an hour or so. This was close to our hotel so we started each day with a walk in the park. We were certainly not alone. Used by everyone for walking,cycling, scateing jogging, running. Couple of great cafe? resturants within the park as well.

Spend a few hours here.... soaking up nature and holland at its best. Great place for bike ride, running or stroll. Also nice for a picnic. The streets adjacent to the park hold fabulous little restaurants and shops. Very nice, one of my favorite parks in the world!!

Great place to watch people. This is a great place to go during a sunny day. A large part of Amsterdam will be laying on the grace, enjoying the sun. If not, it is always a good place to see some interesting characters walk by.Other than that, it is just a nice park!

Stunning Stunning Stunning. This park is huge and full of loads of things to see and do, first time we went it was summer and we lay in the beautiful gardens and soaked up the sun, loads of people around doing like street theatre and stuff which was quite cool and the cafes and things are lovely. Second visit was in jan and it was snowing and freezing cold but was such a stunning place to visit, for there were ice sculptures and the view over the small lake was stunning all covered in ice. Well worth going for a pleasent walk or cycle
Central Park of Amsterdam!. Great! A must visit! just keep walking through it and in it!

The Central Park of Amsterdam. It was a beautiful sunny day in November that felt like spring so it was impossible to stay inside. Vondel park is an oasis in the middle of the city with moms pushing baby carriages,runners,dogs walking their people and of course, bicycles. No motorized vehicles but plenty of benches for people watching.
lovely. Check out the restaurant and the islands and the people...wonderful

Amsterdam's Central Park. We rented bikes and rode through the park on a lovely Fall afternoon. It was pure bliss. Getting to the park, navigating traffic on a bike was nervewracking but exhilirating! As a foreigner, be warned that you are taking your life in your hands. However, other bikers and drivers were so courteous, we survived. No question we would have been killed and definitely cursed at in any American city for our biking behavior and not understanding the traffic signals/signs.
Pleasant. - It's a nice park, clean and a lot of free space.- In the winter, obviously, it's not the best place to be!

The best Sunday morning. With bicycle on morning coffe in Vondelpark...the best way to start with your day. Wonderful for dogs, children and all who like running in nice green park, drink a good coffe or two and just relax on grass. Love it!

Great park. It's a very nice park, with a few restaurants/cafeterias in it. It's good to spend a few hours and relax for a while. It's also good for people watching: you'll see lots of locals riding the bikes, either by themselves or with their kids/family, a friend or even "walking" their dog.
Great Park - beautiful and clean. Take the time to visit this park - really nice and clean and fun to walk around
A piece of paradise in a bustling city. Make sure you take time to stroll through Vondelpark if you have a nice weather day.
Great walk. A great place to wander around. Lots of buskers to enjoy. Went for coffee in the blue house which has great views across the park.
Nice break from the city. Visiyed after going to Van Gogh Museum.We had particularly visited to see the parakeets and were not disappointed, 20 or more flying round and making a noise !

Lovely spot to get away from it all. One of the highlights of my week-long stay in Amsterdam was cycling through Vondelpark at least twice a day. It stays open late so you can jog/walk/cycle through late at night and be in good company. It's a gorgeous area with several ponds, gardens and walking paths. There are also three BBQ areas for picnicking.
Calm. The park is inside the city and surrounded by roads. Nevertheless, it is calm and the air is fresh. It is good to have a walk if someone want to clear the mind.
Beautiful park. Would recommend everyone who takes a trip to Amsterdam to enjoy this wonderful park!!!

Nice on a fall day. Amsterdam is fun to visit in October and early November. It's not too cold to sit outside or walk through the Vondelpark. Near the museums, this park is spacious and a good break from the indoors.

Wonderful park. I took a short walk through the park the day I arrived in Amsterdam. The Park was full of people on bicycle and/or walking. It is a very nice park to walk and enjoy lots of green and fresh air.
relaxing. walk,relax, i went there everyday during stay in amsterdam
Vondel Park experience. This park is large and well maintained with plenty of pathways, ponds cafes and toilet facilities. It is easily accessible by tram.
A relaxing afternoon visit. Autumn colours were stunning. A very peaceful cup of tea in the coffee shop

Autumnal heaven. Excellent foliage colour throughout the park, everyone rides and walks around the park, great kids play areas, really busy and lively, bike riders are not allowed to ring their bells in the park which makes it all the more enjoyable.

You must go. ok, here we have something to share. We went to the park riding a bike and the park was increrible crowded. Talking with a local we understand that in the begining of the park you will find a lot of tourists and the citizens go a little bit inside that's become a peaciful place to stay anda have a picnic or a barbecue
gret place to chill out. was here for about 4 hours, walking, sitting, having coffee, looking at the wildlife, was lovley!

We <3 Mr Vondel.. A beautiful park that stretches on for what seems like forever, like a maze. Highlights were the sunflowers with faces and the adventure tree house! And being away from the insane Amsterdam roads was also a plus. Out of one end there's a great, non-touristy, bargainous bakery which was also a big yay.
Peace. A wonderful area of the city - the Central Park of Amsterdam. All you hear are the bells of the bikes!
A Stroll in the Park. Great for picnics, barbecues or just lounging... especially if it's warm and sunny!!!
Watch out for the bikes!. A great parkland with lots of runners, cyclists and walkers. Absolutely beautiful.

Excellent place to picnic/relax for the day. Beautiful park, lots of people watching, green grass, and lots of entertainment (rollerblading, cycling, etc). When visitng here take a picnic out here for lunch, it's worth it!
Go by bycicle!. Beautiful and huge park, better visited in a byke.

A beautiful and relaxing park in Amsterdam, a must experience.. This is probably my favorite spot in Amsterdam. You'll see people lazing on the grass with their loved ones or reading a book, people bicycling, dogs being walked, birds being fed. It's a large park with a few ponds and a fountain. There is a network of paved and unpaved trails for walking, rollerblading or bicycling and I believe 3 cafes and restaurants. It's overall just a great place to spend time relaxing. If you want to rent a bicycle there is a Mac Bikes rental shop near the park but some friends who rented there advised that the service is bad. If you're near Valkenburgerstraat (where the Jewish Historical Museum is), I recommend renting from Boka Scooters!

A great place for an afternoon lunch. The park was located behind our hotel The Vondel .... when we first arrived it was a sunny day so we grabbed a couple of snacks and headed to the park. We found it be full of interesting people and a very laid back group of kids hanging back smoking of the weed. So we sat down and had our lunch along side of the small pond that was surrounded by young folk on the west end of the park. It was awesome very peaceful and relaxing. The only drawback I saw was that everyone just thru their trash on the ground and left it there.... it was blowing into the water so we picked up around our area and set out to the other end of the park where we found art work and fountains to be enjoyed by all.... so if you want to get off of the busy streets head to vondel park look for the picasso standing there in the weeds .... in my neighborhood if there was a picasso left out like that it would be on sell on e-bay the next day .... such a cool place

Relaxing Afternoon. Sort of the Central Park of Amsterdam, this is a lovely choice if you want to wile away a few hours in the city. Take a picnic or eat at one of the restaurants located in the park. There are several little play areas for children and many spots to choose from for laying in the sun, shade and ponds. Sun bathe, read a book or just people-watch - my friend and I sat and watched a bloke practise his Tom Cruise 'Cocktail' routine - very entertaining!
A lovely place to while away the hours. On a sunny day, this is a real oasis. You can spend the day people watching. Take a picnic and relax the day away. A perfect place to unwind

A nice relaxing place to chill. A nice place to relax, take a walk, or just sit on a bench and people watch. I was having a massive headache so I came here to wait it out and it was exactly what i needed.Very calm and quiet.

A good time with the family. I agree with most of the reviewers. Its a very nice park. Like another reviewer stated earlier its just like amsterdam,,,:relaxed and stylish". They have a walking path and a bike path. theres people walking, running, biking, skating, playing music. Theres areas for the kids to play and some cafes too. Theres also a concert area. I went with my family to the park two times. The park gets pretty packed . I only have one gripe. The park is very bike and stroller friendly but I noticed that most people are not stroller friendly. I had more than a few people give me the why arent you moving out of my way look. Im pushing a double stroller,,,anyone who has done it knows its not the easiest thing to manuver. Eventually I stopped caring and had one of the best picnics with my family. Its a great place for a picnic. anyone looking for a nice stroll should definitely check it out.

Great ride on the bike. we rented the bikes at "Mac bike" not ar rom the entrance, one with a car seat in the back.In the park there are a lot o playgrounds or kids o all ages, several places to seat and have a drink or something to eat. we had a great time (although it was raining a little bit)

Stroll through the greenery. This beautiful park is a haven of green in central Amstersdam for families to stroll, ride, walk or play. Filled with lakes, curving paths and dotted with cafes it’s a great place to relax and get away from the crowds of Leidesplein.

Escape the tourist crowds in this oasis.. Wherever I travel I always take a walk or bike ride in the city park. Vondelpark was a pleasant oasis in Amsterdam. I would recommend renting a bike and ride along the shaded paths past lakes, gazebos and small gardens. There is a cafe in the parks center, plus plenty of little kiosks selling "italian style" ice cream. This is a good place to take a break from the Museum Quarter if you feel overwhelmed with art!

The Central Park of Amsterdam. The Central Park of Amsterdam is the best way to describe the vondelpark. Fab cycling and walking routes, wonderful play areas for the little kids and a lovely oasis of green in the middle of the city.Being in Vondel park does make it difficult to beleive that you are in the middle of a huge city. It epitomises the life of Amsterdam - laid back, relaxed and very cool and trendy.We visited with 5 kids 12, 11, 3, 2 and a 6 month old and there really is something for everyone. My friend (who lives there) says the BBQ's and litter can be overwhelming on a warm weekend day, but we didn't see any of that (though it was sunny) Just the occasionally guitarist playing some fab tunes and people sitting around looking very relaxed........in the way people do in Amsterdam!I would recommend it. Anyone from the States will feel its a home from home and, despite the expensive cost of living (made worst by the Euro/Sterling exchange rate of almost 1:1) its a great place to be!

superb jog...... Great park to visit.. Just walk round, cycle or do what we did and jog. Plenty of space for everyone and as with everywhere in Amsterdam, everyone is so polite no problems with sharing space.

Relaxing place for a picnic. Vondelpark is a vast relaxing park located near Museumplein (where the Van Gogh Museum, the Stedelijk Museum, and the Rijksmuseum are located). Its a good place to rest your feet after walking around the museums. A spot in between the statue of Vondel and the body of water facing the Van Baerle entrance is a good spot for a picnic. You can buy stuff for your picnic at the Albert Heijn grocery located beside the Stedelijk Museum, in front of Concertgebouw, at the Museumplein. Cold cuts, cheese, bread, drinks...yum! However, the park may be crowded at times.

Beautiful & Relaxing Park. We didn't expect the beauty Vondelpark offered. The scenery & vegetation are beautiful, definitely many photo opportunities. This park is very large so bring comfortable sneakers or journey through it on a bike. On the day we visited there were many people simply relaxing, cooking-out, or jogging through the park. A few restaurants are located in this park as well. There is so much to do and enjoy in this park. Definitely how a park should be.

Green Amsterdam... without 2nd intentions!. One of the highlight spots in Amsterdam is, surely, Voldelpark. A huge meeting point where everybody can get a place to enjoy nature, sun or active life. You'll be amazed by the life and diversity that you can find in a 'simple' park and, in our case, regret the fact that you haven't more time to stay and enjoy !

Beauitful, but huge park. Bikes recommended.. We braved the bikes today and after working how to manage the various locks (one big chain lock and another that goes through the rear spokes) we set out through the narrow paved streets of Amsterdam to Vondelpark.Jane was clever and had looked up some of the road signs before we left, so could inform me that the sign was saying no entry except for if you’re on a bike or scooter. This is a city that has lots and lots of cyclists, where cyclists have right of way of pedestrians, yet it can be a bit intimidating. Also, cyclists and people riding scooters that have a low cc rating don’t tend to wear helmets.Vondelpark is a huge park located South West of the centre of Amsterdam and we were very glad we took the bikes otherwise we would not have seen as much of it.

Pretty park. Great green space for a picnic or just laze out on the lawn. Perfect on a sunny day to try and get a tan or just meet with friends. There are ice cream vendors all around selling cheap cones and the occasional musician playing. Only gripe is the amount of litter in some spots. There are plenty of trash cans around I just wish people would use them more often.

Nice enough. When we went it was very very busy. There was quite a bit of litter and if you sit next to the trees, bring a blanket as the flowers from the trees can stain you clothes.Other than that, the park is nice for a stroll, bike ride or nap as we did.
Enjoyable stroll. Great for walking or riding your bike on a nice day!

Lovely oasis for walking, jogging or biking. Before checking out at the Amsterdam Marriott, we decided to go to Vondelpark, less than a minute's walk away. For an overcast November day, the park was busy with people biking and jogging as well as taking their dogs for an early morning walk.

Lovely oasis in the midst of the most beautiful city. We were staying at the Amsterdam Marriott, and the Vondelpark was less than a minute's walk away, so it was very easy to walk over there and have a lovely stroll through the park. It is pretty any time of year, it was gorgeous when we were there in September. It was still warm, and the park was filled with people. It was lovely to sit on the benches and people watch, to stop in one of the many cafes for a cup of tea, and it was amazingly quiet considering that you were in the middle of one of the most beautiful cities in the world, in my opinion. It was warm enough so that the "baby pool" still had small children playing in the water, very sweet to watch for a while. After all the busyness of an intense vacation, just having the Vondelpark nearby to "chill out" in was wonderful.
Lovely Park. Love the park. Love the greenery. Great place to chill and relax !
Green Green Green. Just loved it! Watch people. Bring your snacks to feed the birds!

A Traditional European Park. Vondelpark is the biggest park near Amsterdam's city center, and it is well loved by Amsterdammers. On a warm early June evening about 7 pm (the high latitude means that the sun is still high in the sky at that time), the pathways were packed with bikers, runners, skaters and others. The park was laid out in a typical Europe manner--tightly constructed with every element carefully organized--although at least we could walk on the grass (unlike the Paris parks). I personally do not like these overly manicured parks very much. There's something to be said for raw nature, not nature reinterpreted by people. I also got nervous for my personal safety in some of the less well-traveled parts of the park, especially around stoner hill where everyone was brashly toking up in public.

Relaxing. This is a great park to people watch. We sat on a bench and watched all the bike riders, kids playing and dogs catching sticks. It would have been a great spot for a picnic, had we thought of it.

Loved it! ...but I'm a park-lover :). I had thought, wow, no one has dogs in this city - and then I went to Vondelpark. I wish I had had more time to walk around here - I'm a big walker. And my hotel wasn't close enough to run over.We grabbed breakfast is a grocery store (it seems all pastries in Europe are very dry - but I do love the yoghurt here!) - and ate it on a bench there. People watching galore! There're a couple small restaurants in the park too.Maybe not sightseeing or touristy, but being a fairly outdoorsy person, it was nice to be surrounded by nature (though Amsterdam's tree-lined streets and canals did not make me itching for green. The city is very green with lots of flowers (We came in May).Every Friday there is the Fridaynightskate that starts in front of the Filmmuseum.

Perfect for people watching. If the weather is good the park is a perfect place to spend an afternoon. Take a picnic and sit by one of the lakes and take in the atmosphere. A great place to chill out or cycle round, its a lot safer than the streets of Amsterdam to get to grips with a bike! In autumn the coulours are beautiful, my favourite place in Amsterdam.

Posh? I don't find Gothic Youth posh.... Scary! We had to enter behind the brigde and pass underneath to go to the center of the park... Well, don't go there after dark!! I was not comfortable at all. Half of the park is closed this summer... renovating. No nice views around. The renovation is welcome, becouse the "picturesque and lovely" round tea-house is in a very poor condition... Although the Fresh Minth Tea was delicious!! Besides I had a feeling that all the green was not trimmed (cut) this spring properly. Overgrown trees and bushes. Not well maintened. No nice views around. Not impressed!
Love Vondelpark. Very relaxing. On a sunny day, take a picnic and some wine/beer and just escape from the town. Highly recommended!

Urban Oasis, and a posh one at that. This park is just gorgeous and choc-a-bloc with cyclers, walkers, joggers, dogs, all the good park things. And the neighborhood bordering the park is simply gorgeous. The homes are stately and magnificent. After we had ridden our bikes through the wonderful park, we detoured out into the swish neighborhood, which also houses the big embassies, and toured that as well. You seem a million miles away from the grit of the central station area and all the mishmash of the main tourist centers. At some point or another during your stay in the city, you must end up here.

Fantastic park. What a wonderful park!The first time we went there, on a Sunday afternoon, there were lots of people on picnic, an open air concert... I remember my son riding the bike we had rented along the enchanting paths! I enjoyed it very much, one of my favourite places in A'Dam.

Everything you'd expect. For some people this park will seem like a mini Utopia, for others some aspects will feel uncomfortable; I'm in the former group. Regardless, Vondel reminds me of Holland as a whole: tolerant, carefree, peaceful, did I mention tolerant?You can stroll through this park on the way to several museums as it is located in the very posh Museum Quarter. It's also on the way to Peter Cornelisz (P.C.) Hooftstraat, the high end shopping district. I'm not sure a tourist would get much from visiting for an extended amount of time (depends). This park is meant to be used and you won't find many flowers; just grassland, trees and bushes. Very utilitarian. As you may have heard, Amsterdam has a live and let live attitude and this extends to the parks- in fact, especially to the parks. At Vondel you'll see the following: runners, walkers, people doing drugs, kids at play, picnics, couples making love in the bushes, and gawking tourists (it's a big place). Everyone living their lives side by side without judgement. I'm usually uncomfortable around open drug use but oddly it seems sort of "natural" here.There are several great cafes along the perimeter of the park; be SURE that you ask what the small cake you are buying contains since hallucinogenics are popularly sold in baked goods. All in all, a microcosm of the Dutch lifestyle.

Vondelpark - Wicked!. I have visited "The Dam" quite a few times and can honestly say that Vondelpark is the niceset place to go while you're there. Forget all the hussle and bussle of Dam square, Central station and Red light if you are there with a loved one or even with mates just lie on the grass and chill out. You could be a million miles from anywhere. Fantastic!
